Reviews.Title: “Were it not for check-in, perfect”
Reviews.Author: ljgok
Reviews.Content: Best rooms in LAS, lovely property but the checkin experience was haunted by computer problems that resulted in being checked in, checked out by accident, room keys being deactivated necessitating a trip back to front desk and being treated somewhat indifferently when we complained that they knew when they check us out to correct the previous nights error that our keys would be deactivated and should have taken care of it. Otherwise a lovely seamless experience with super accomodations

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Canadianontheloose
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a few hotels in Vegas. My favourite used to be 'The Hotel' at Mandalay Bay but the Encore blows it out of the water. The Encore has a good mix of everything. It's slightly quieter than the Wynn which is nice, but you still have access to the Wynn and all its amenities (the wynn has more pools). They've got 3 nightclubs on site, loads of restaurants, cafes and shops. Spacious rooms beautiful casino and great service. Right across the street from fashion show mall which houses a neiman marcus, nordstroms, bloomingdales and macys just to name a few.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Reeedy
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the UK from Las Vegas where we stayed at the Encore for 4 nights. We thoroughly enjoyed our first trip to Vegas and the Encore did not disappoint. The rooms were nicely decorated as was the whole hotel. There are many restaurants on site which were all on the expensive side, but to be honest I expected this (don’t stay in a 5 star hotel and expect 3 star prices) The check in was a pain, had to wait 20 mins standing in line waiting. I was a little disappointed as when I booked the hotel I requested a high room with views of the strip. Only to be given a room on the 19th floor. I questioned this only to be told if I wanted a high room I was going to have to pay an extra 30 dollars per night. The check in lady then said “I would pay the extra if I was you as the noise from the nightclub is very loud, and will keep you awake till 4am”. I felt like I had no choice but to pay the extra charge for a higher room as we were only in Vegas for 4 days and I did not want to spend the nights being kept awake by loud music, just left a bitter taste in my mouth. Even on the 54 floor you could still hear the nightclub so god knows how loud it would have been on the lower floors. Rooms are very spacious and furnished very nicely, with a very comfortable bed. Bathroom was nice with his and hers sinks. My only small complaint was the shower pressure was rubbish and the bath was small, but not huge problems. The casino is much smaller and quieter than at casino at the Wynn, I preferred the Wynn casino to be honest just a bit more buzzy. Both hotels are linked via a corridor aligned with designer stores called the esplanade. We had a nice stay and would return to the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinShoes24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Encore in a panoramic suite in early November. We were in town for the SEMA show but loved our accommodations so much that we didn’t get to see as much of the auto show as expected. This hotel is absolutely gorgeous and really leaves nothing out. The rooms, the service, and the décor are first class. If going to Vegas and you want luxury this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent short winter break”
Reviews.Author: Big_Mo_Yasin
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the SPA & GYM facilities at the hotel. The massage there was excellent too! The rooms were spacious although the view wasn't impressive! "The Dream" show at the Wynn is the best show I have seen to-datem and beats all other Cirque-de-soleil shows in Vegas. Highly recommended. The only down side was the fact that the pools were under maintenance and becasue of the waeather all pool activities were halted.

Reviews.Title: “Encore! Encore!”
Reviews.Author: JackD78
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas in itself is an amazing experience and it's easy to lose yourself in the glizt and glamour. If your staying at the Encore then this will be no different. What a hotel, great service, great casino and an amazing club called XS. Any club that has a casino in the middle of the pool is alright by me! Visit it, live it, love it and I'm already planning my trip back later this year

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jokamwisconsin
Reviews.Content: Hotel, staff, entertainment and facilities are just beautiful. The only problem is it is on the far end of the strip. Not a problem if you enjoy walking or taking a taxi. All the food we had in the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wisgal1
Reviews.Content: Took our family to Vegas after a 15 year absence. All 4 of my children are now in their 20's and felt they were ready for the experience. The Encore was the perfect place for our stay. Loved the amenities. The pool area was lovely. Though we would have like to see some areas of shade. No umbrellas were out, (could be that March 12 was too early, not sure). Also, would have liked an area outside where you could sit at small table and read the paper. At any rate, the kids did not seem to mind. The room was very clean, and very modern. Bed very comfortable. There is a walkway connecting the Wynn and the Encore. The casino in the Wynn seemed to have more people in them not sure why. The shops in both hotels are very high end and fun to browse. There is a mall directly across the street with even more shops, a Saks, Neiman Marcus, and a Starbucks!! The restaurants were somewhat disappointing. I had read such great reviews that I expected better. I think they are over rated. For instance at SW Steakhouse, most steak prices are in the $50 plus range. I am from the Midwest and our steaks are very good. I would say that there steaks were of average quality. Also, we were seated outside where a water light show is performed. On the first day we arrived, temps. were slightly cooler so in the evening it was chilly. I expressed concern about sitting outside, the host dismissed my concern by explaining that there are heaters outside. We were put in the middle of that section and that area had overhead heaters that when turned on we felt like we were in an oven. Several of the other diners in the center area complained that it was too hot and they were quickly turned off. I then was very cold. I was embarrassed by the fuss I was causing and wish the host would have taken my initial comment to heart and put us inside. We also ate dinner at Bartolotta's in the Wynn and once again thought it was simply alright. Menu was very difficult to understand because so much was in Italian. Everything was a la carte and it was very difficult to gauge portions on the seafood. We were a party of six. Also very expensive. We went to see Le Reve, the water show in the Wynn and found the show very enjoyable and suitable for the entire family. Concierge service was very busy and plan to stand in lights if you want to use them. All in all, the Encore was a wonderful beautiful hotel and would stay there again but would probably eat at different restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The amenities are what make this property special.”
Reviews.Author: wychwood54
Reviews.Content: Everyone loves the Encore because of the beauty of the property and the fabulous staff but the amenities are what make it shine! You can stay on your healthy lifestyle program even in Vegas - the Fitness Center and staff are second to none and ready to kick your butt! The Encore not only has great equipment - treadmills with TV, bikes, weights etc, but also two studios where fitness classes are conducted several times a day. I tried both the Yoga and strength training classes (they also have spin) and got great work outs. And the cost is very reasonable at $20 per. They also do personal training which I may try next time. There is also a juice bar for a quick and healthy pick me up, freshly made! The entire Spa area is so beautiful you don't want to leave but the pools outside are just as gorgeous and you can enjoy a cool and fresh Asian Salad with a giant iced drink poolside. I just love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chad B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Encore 28 July - 2 Aug 2011. Stayed at the Encore mainly for partying purposes as I was in town for a convention. The staff was very helpful even though my room wasn't ready when I got there, took my bags and told me to come back and the room would be ready. When I concluded my stay they assisted immediately as well which was perfect. The room was exceptional and the bathroom was magnificent, I really wanted to take the shower with me. Taxis were always available so there was no problem traveling around. Clubs at night were always packed and full of people. Room service breakfast for two people was expensive but delicious. I really only stayed here to sleep and have a quick room to get to if I was partying here. Only problem is that is kind of off the main strip but most people came here anyway for the club scene. Loved the stay, will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: KatieMoreno
Reviews.Content: I went to the Encore in November 2011 as I was getting married in Las Vegas. I was so happy that we choose this hotel. The rooms, the food, the service, the friendly staff. Everything was just perfect. I would say that its slightly expensive however it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but loud”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and the staff is very professional. The major flaws with this property are the paper-thin walls. Any noise at all comes right into the room, even ambient noise like cars and sirens from the busy streets below. The real problem with our visit came from a hotel a block away, which was having a very loud outdoor concert on the nights of our stay. The bass from this concert came right through our walls. We complained about this, but the only other rooms are the ones facing the Encore's own nightclub. Essentially our choice was to be on the side that is loud til 1am or the side that is loud til 5am. We did pay for an upgraded room and were on the 59th floor, but the noise still came right in. The hotel is very nice and well decorated, but if you are light sleepers like us look elsewhere. The hotel staff was nothing but friendly and apologetic about our problem, even offering us a refund if we wanted to go elsewhere (busy weekend so that was impossible). In the future we will be staying only in guaranteed quiet places!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've Ever Been to!”
Reviews.Author: Champagnejen
Reviews.Content: Firstly, you have to understand that I have travelled the world to some of the best restaurants and hotels. I have been lucky enough to see the best of the best. And this is it. The suites are so fabulous, you'll never forget them. I could spend all day in the huge low sunk jacuzzi bubble bath. Add a glass of champagne and some of the delicious treats waiting for you in your mini bar and your golden. The bed is quite gigantic, and from it you can basically order anything in your room to do it's job by using the switches next to you. Ultimately lazy! The TV is huge, with a great selection of movies. We had our own in-room massage room. It literally blew my mind. My parent's suite was about triple the size! It had it's own bar! Wow! And thats just the room. The hotel itself is so wonderful. For Vegas standards it is chic, elegant and beautiful in it's decor. The staff are discreet and helpful. I believe they have the best selection of shops out of any of the other hotels in Vegas. When my Dad checked in, they upgraded all of our suites due to him being a black Amex owner. I was a bit nervous about this hotel before we came as you only need read a couple of the pretty bad comments on trip advisor. But I can honestly say. I never couldn't sleep, I could never hear the nightclub, the staff were never rude, and I never saw any disgusting or Lewd behaviour from patrons. We brought my young brother and he had a great time. We were never once worried about what he may be exposed to. However, do remember I went at Christmas, a time when they are quiet. The hotel was hardly full. Perhaps just a week later (New Years) the behaviour seen in the hotel is a bit more disgusting (like the worrying stories I have read on here from past customers)! I could go on but I will end with vowing that given the opportunity I would live in this hotel for ever. Can't fault them even for a second!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mallory L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have visited Las Vegas at least twice a year for the past 7 years and we've stayed at almost every hotel on the strip. And I'm here to say that the Encore is THE BEST hotel we've stayed at, so much so that we've ONLY stayed there for the last 4 trips we've made to Vegas. The hotel looks beautiful, smells wonderful, the shops and restaurants are excellent, the pool area is immaculate, the gaming is fun, and so much more. But what draws me and my husband to this resort much more than the other ones is the fact that there are NO KIDS ANYWHERE. We love kids, don't get me wrong. But many of the resorts are "family friendly" and when my husband and I are on vacation where alcohol and gambling are king, the last thing I want to do is share that experience with a screaming child. The hotel is expensive, but to me and my husband, it is worth every penny. We're Encore-lifers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But It Lacked That Certain Something”
Reviews.Author: sbourne
Reviews.Content: The Encore is the newer of the two Wynn properties in Vegas. Like Mr. Wynn, they are a bit garish - the Encore is done up in red everywhere. The suite was nice. You have to walk a long way to get to restaurants and major entertainment over on the Wynn side. The staff was helpful. I have no major complaints but for a hotel in this price range I expected something spectacular. I didn't find it. But I might have high standards compared to most people because I stay in many different hotels and know what is possible. I wouldn't go out of my way to stay here again but I certainly wouldn't avoid it. If you get in during mid-week when the prices are lower it might be a pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Even at this luxury price point - Encore doesn't deliver 'value'.”
Reviews.Author: mntravelers55129
Reviews.Content: It is really hard for me not give the Encore five stars. The rooms are opulently appointed and there is a panel at your bedside to operate the curtains, lights and even the privacy option on your door. Very cool. The room is a compact suite and very well designed - but it is not large for a suite. The bathtub is a standard size soaking tub for one person. Again, nice but small. My main issue with the room is that despite the opulence, the walls were thin and I could hear my neighbor's t.v. Also, even though I was 21 floors up, I still heard the traffic on the strip late at night. The staff at Encore is the best on the strip. This would also push me to five stars. However, my issues with Encore are these: I sat down at a lobby bar and began playing video poker and was asked for my drink order. Anywhere else I have been in Vegas - including Caesars (at least on my last visit), you are comped while playing video poker at a bar. Not at the Encore. My Absolute on the rocks - although plentiful and strong - was $15.00 w/ tip. Later in my trip, I went to Society Cafe for breakfast and the menu items were $18.00 and above. We're talking breakfast folks. Onto the spa and fitness center. There is about a $15.00 fee to use the fitness center. I believe this price is reasonable and in-line with other Vegas properties if you're not paying a resort fee. However, beware that if you want to use the locker room or showers - that bumps up your visit to $55.00. This facility is very nice - but $55 to take a steam and shower is ridiculous. So, obviously, who goes to the Wynn/Encore and complains about the prices? A valid point. However, regardless of the price you pay for your lodging in Las Vegas - we as customers should expect a decent value. High end properties should deliver high end value and so forth. My issue, is that I thought Wynn/Encore would be above the nickel and diming that takes place all over Vegas. It is not. That is why the property receives three stars, despite the great staff and nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Wynn”
Reviews.Author: ResRules
Reviews.Content: Encore is quite possibly the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Congratulations to all the staff for such a wonderful experience. If your not dropping 10 grand on gambling though dont expect any comps....even a breakfast.... Try win breakfast instead :)

Reviews.Title: “expecting a little more”
Reviews.Author: keepingitreal_10
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was not super impressed with Encore. I arrived at hotel registration and there was a ridiculous line, I found it a little frustrating being that I had just gotten off a long plane trip and did not want to deals with lines. I got to my room only to find it smelled like smoke and I asked for a non smoking room, when I called down to the lobby the person apologized but did not offer another room. I then had to call back and demand to be moved. The rooms were average size and nice the only problem was the noise from the night club could be heard until 3pm in the morning even though we were on the 53rd floor! The hotel is large and nice but nothing really stood out to me as being special or different or over the top making it unique compared to other hotels in Vegas. The one thing I was happy about was the Spa. I had both a facial and a massage and enjoyed both. the amenities of the spa were nice as well and I enjoyed the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous bed”
Reviews.Author: CocktailMom
Reviews.Content: We loved the bed here so much that we went downstairs to the Home Store and bought the same linens - an entire set! Not cheap but luxuriously comfortable and beautiful. Our 18th floor suite was reasonably priced (we had a conference rate) and had a great view. I worked in the room during the day, but the cleaning crew still found a way to come into the suite at night. I was a little embarassed, because in a rush, I'd left with papers and clothes strewn about the room. They did the very best cleaning job I've ever seen - anywhere - neatening my things and cleaning the room. We were there for Restaurant Week - had a couple of meals at the Society Cafe which were delicious and incredibly reasonable in price. If you happen to be there for this event, take advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Bigmoneydog69
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel experience I've had in a while. Couldn't check-in because the computer system was down. The wireless didn't work for the two days I was there. Was woken up by room service by mistake in the middle of the night. Wish I had stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: GavinBridger
Reviews.Content: Wow, we are so glad we stayed here. Fantastic place to stay. The room was great. We paid for an upgrade to a view of the strip and on a higher floor. Tip:Take the highest floor you can get when you are on the south side(looking down to Ceasars Palace) as the noise from the nightclub in the Wynn will keep you awake. Choices of food were very good and chinese is very well priced. (see seperate review). The rooms are kept very clean and our maid was fantastic. If you want luxury then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wynn Does It Again But Better”
Reviews.Author: RuxCooks
Reviews.Content: I just want tostart off stating I did not stay at the hotel, we had our puppy with us. However we did stroll through this hotel for over an hour. We basically hit every hotel on the Las Vegas Strip and this is the most memorable one. It reminded me of Alice in Wonderland when she is in the mushroom patch but with an Asian style. It was over-the-top but not offensive. I just wish I could find the exact words. I can say that I caught myself with my mouth open. They did a spectacular job with this place. I have been coming to Vegas for business and personal for last ten years and the Encore is the one that most stays with me as impressive. Just you know, the Encore does not comp drinks if you are playing at the bar. But our bartender and the ambience there was so great we decided to stay and pay a not so cheap price for a couple of beers but it was well worth it. When we go back again without our pup, we will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: SteveBazakas
Reviews.Content: I'm trying to remember if I've ever stayed in a better room. Sure, there might be rooms with fancier decor, but the combination of bedding, lighting, controls (for lights and drapes), size and size of bathroom, for what you'll pay, is really unmatched. The staff is totally professional, and all parts of the property are immaculate. I love staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: TheBeautifuls4
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Encore in February, 2012 - it was wonderful. This hotel has every amenity and there is no reason to leave the property. The room was comfortable, clean, and our view was just spectacular - looking over the strip! All of the restaurants are top notch - enjoyed the Botero and Wazuzu. This is our second time at the Encore and it has not disappointed us yet - WE WILL BE BACK!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: dwluvsvegas
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Encore March 6-10. Great rooms,great service. We have stayed at the Wynn twice and I think the Encore is even better. It's much quieter and less busy which we prefer on vacation. It is connected to the Wynn so it's only a short stroll to many more slots, table games and restaurants.Note to smokers - only floors 10,30, and I think it was 63, are smoking floors. I LOVE the beds and bedding at WYNN and ENCORE.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mrosco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Encore in November 2010 and had a great time. We had never been to Las Vegas as we don't gamble much and are not into themed hotels/destinations at all. Encore was luxurious and comfortable with great restaurants and facilities. We left only a few times for a helicopter tour and to walk around the strip. We walked through several hotels and could not have been happier with our selection at Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite”
Reviews.Author: guitar0918
Reviews.Content: Paid for an upgrade to a Tower Suite, it was beautiful and everyone was nice. Much better than your typical Vegas hotel suites... Just about everythhing you'll need is in the room, if not, call down for it... they'll hunt it down for you...

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: SixSix
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Beautiful light room. Amazing bed. Plenty of space to lounge in the room. Unbeatable customer service in the resort (don't expect that from the club employees) The reason I book Encore instead of the Wynn; I think the rooms are nicer, more space, more features, the casino is less crowded, the pool is nicer and mood just feels more relaxed. Book the Encore for a grand resort experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mind blowingly beautiful and expensive.”
Reviews.Author: MomofHandH
Reviews.Content: Ran a meeting there. Rooms are huge and like no other. I had an allergic reaction to the rug spray, but what can you do. Botero, Wazuzu and The Cave - amazing. The hotel is extremely $$$. Be prepared!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury fit not for blue collar.”
Reviews.Author: TravelSmartdotCom
Reviews.Content: So this was my 7th or 8th trip to Vegas and this time I chose Encore as the rate was affordable when booked with flight package. Read a lot of reviews first and club noise and value were the two that concerned me. So first the pros. Steve Wynn has surely built one of the most glamorous hotel resorts anywhere. Just high end luxury abounds around every corner. Like most of the new mega hotel/resorts, this place is a sprawling Utopia with lavish decor, basically a mega mall with hotel, swimming, night clubs, fancy restaurants, and casinos. Encore (and Wynn) is basically a high end very upscale resort fit for the well off One percenters if you will. Its a white collar wonderland but if you happen to be blue collar, you better plan ahead because there are better value options. The staff was absolutely gracious, accomodating. I was concerned about the staff based on other reviews but quite honestly, they could not have been better, however when the safe wouldnt open it took 1 hour for security to help and that is just unacceptable. Upon arrival, I requested a high floor away from the strip as sleep is important to me/us. The request resulted in a $20 per night "upgrade" to a 61st floor panoramic view of north and west Vegas which was decent. Unless there is an ocean, the view matters little to me. How long you gonna stand there and look? The rooms are very very nice, huge bathroom. The bed was absolutely without a doubt the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The bathroom was not sufficiently clean when we went in, as I was looking to substantiate reports of mediocre housekeeping. In particular, they sink counter had splash residue from previous guests that a simple wipe down could have taken care of. Not enough for a complaint to the staff though. The bell boy who brought our bags up took time to explain the technology in the room which was quite helpful and garnered him a worthy tip. Housekeeping the remainder of the trip was timely and there were no issues. DO NOT tough the in room bar or snacks, unless your rich. You can get water and snacks downstairs at the shop by the elevators at still high but more affordable prices. This is NOT a place to take your children, and I would suggest this is an adult resort. So the rooms are nice, the staff was great as expected for a five star. The cons: Value. Be it a bottle of beer, water, coffee, a snack or meal, you are going to pay a premium. For a blue collar guy, this will hurt, but it is common on the strip to pay $7.00 for a bottle of beer. Double that for the clubs you pay to get into. Same for food. Its $50 foir the lunch/breakfast buffets, and over $80 for dinner that is basically that same with slight variation. THere are better values on the strip and the food was medicre for a pricey buffet. The SOciety Restaurant we had breakfast and still pricey for the quality. Service is good, but value no so much. Gaming. I am an avid blackjack player. I did not play one hand at Encore or Wynn and I probably never will. I searched for a mid limit table where dealer stands on soft 17s. Found one at $50 and one at $100. The rest were all dealer hits on soft 17s and that is a big house advantage. So I gambled at more player friendly places. Sad how some expensive Casinos are totally taking advantage of the small bettors. Should be the same for all. So Encore to me is all about the luxury resort itself, something to see, but for value and gaming there are better value options. I will never stay again because I refuse to pay high end prices for mediocre food and I refuse to play a game where house edge is double vs other places. THe one other negative which might be positive for some is location. Its far north end of strip so plan on walking or paying a lot of cab fares to see the rest of the strip. If you are wealthy this place was made for you and thats probably what Mr Wynn intended anyways when he spend 4 billion $ to create it so more power to him and those that can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: MachThree
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in March 2012. I've got (mostly) only positive things to say. First, our room was gorgeous. We had a king bed suite on the 33rd floor, with a completely unobstructed view looking north towards Stratosphere, Circus Circus, etc. The room furnishings are terrific, with a large flat screen TV on a swivel so that it can face the bedroom or the living room area. Bathroom large, with shower, separate bath, two sinks and a separate toilet area. The bed was very comfortable for a hotel, large plush pillows and had no trouble sleeping. All the staff was very helpful - everyone from room service, house keeping, the front desk, the concierge and the fitness center. Everyone went out of their way to give personalized service and we were very pleased. The entire property (including the adjoining Wynn), in general, is just gorgeous, including the casino, spa, pool area and all the public spaces. Lots of shops but mostly high end. The only bad things I can mention is that the entire place is very expensive. We received a promotion offer for the room and I believe the cost was fair for the room itself considering its quality. A resort fee of $25/day was added on which included use of the fitness center, wi-fi (normally $14/day) and boarding pass printing for the flight home. There are a wide array of restaurants, both casual and fine dining, in the Encore and the adjoining Wynn, but none of them are cheap. $14 or $16 for a sandwich in most instances. Probably to be expected for a hotel of this caliber in Vegas but Location-wise, its on the northern edge of the happening part of the strip - the only hotels further north are Circus Circus, Stratosphere and Riviera I believe - pretty much no foot traffic to the north. To the south is the sister property Wynn and then the Palazzo and the Venetian heading to the main part of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED!”
Reviews.Author: Brooke G
Reviews.Content: My husband just got back from 3 nights at the Encore, and it was absolutely amazing! We stayed on the 62nd floor in a panoramic view room. The room was super clean, the huge window was perfect for viewing the strip. We had breakfast delivered to our room and it was delicious! We will be staying here again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but beware of loud nightclubs”
Reviews.Author: adshere2003
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and well-appointed. The room we stayed in (two double beds) was very large with a beautiful bathroom. What you need to be aware of is that there are 2 nightclubs in the building that, on good weather nights, open into the courtyard between the two buildings and blast the music until 4 or 5 in the morning. The music, and particularly the base, made our room vibrate and the noise was loud. This is a known problem to the hotel, who offered ear plugs when we complained. We did not think ear plugs were a good substitute for a quiet nights' sleep, especially considering this is a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms in vegas for the price.”
Reviews.Author: alplan
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, with a sitting area & bedroom, spacious bathrooms. If you can get a good deal then it's a fab high end hotel. Located opposite fashion mall so fab for shopping, but Is at one end of the strip. Quieter hotel due to it's location which we found relaxing. Great restaurants in hotel too! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Encore/Wynn properties are the absolute best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelDiva100
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed 4 nights at the Encore for my 30th birthday weekend. During the last 5 years or so, I've been visiting Vegas at least once a year. I have had the opportunity to stay at the best of the best of hotels on the Las Vegas strip and please know that I'm very picky when it comes to hotels. But boy let me tell you...the Encore Hotel took my Vegas experience to whole new level!!! This hotel is off the chain! Everything about the Encore/Wynn looks and even feels absolutely gorgeous. Our check-in host (I believe her name was either Victoria or Veronica) put us in a room that had beautiful views of the golf course, mountains, Wynn, XS Club and part of the Vegas strip. She could not have done a better job with that! Although the Wynn sort of impeded the opportunity of having a full view of the strip, that did not bother us at all because it was still stunning! It appears that the Wynn/Encore does not seem to have any bad views at all. Because of the way they're positioned and designed the views you get feels like they are all panoramic x10. The room is contemporary/elegant style and very spacious. The room itself exceeded our expectations! The pictures/videos we saw on Trip Advisor and YouTube just didn't do it any justice! In-Room Dining- Because we were so exhausted from traveling on the first day, we opted for in-room dining. We both ordered turkey burgers and french fries and it was delicious, fresh and hot! This was somewhat to our surprise because in our previous experiences with in-room dining, the food is usually not that great. Quick and Casual Dining/drinks- Terrace Pointe Cafe, Society Cafe, and Parasol Up, ZoozaCrackers were all phenomenal! Special touches- The Happy Birthday Chocolate tray was so nice and extra special...I will never forget that. Spa- The best! I loved the "Good Luck Ritual" and plunge pool. Overall we were glad to have finally found our new love and home away from home in Las Vegas! The Encore/Wynn are the only resorts on the strip that seem to have that all around IT factor! We will surely be anticipating our next stay! Love and Blessings, PD & CC

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: Undine_in_NY
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for a week at the Encore and loved every minute! The hotel is very big and wide spread but superbly decorated and designed throughout the whole property. The main theme in the whole hotel is red, a deep rich red. Also you will see lots of gorgeous fresh flowers everywhere as well as butterflies for decoration. Our room was on the 28th floor and had a superb view of the nightly Strip. The room (and bathroom) was very spacious, had windows from the ceiling to the floor and was split into two parts, the bedroom and a living room space. The decor was very modern yet comfortable and sophisticated with a lot of texture on the walls etc. To have a lot of texture and a lot of attention to detail was seen throughout the whole hotel though. When this hotel was built obviously only the very best designers were put to work. It is so sophisticated, elegant, rich and clean, such a pleasure to stay there! We did not gamble and can not say anything about the casinos. The hotel is a bit of a walk towards the strip but still very much worth it.

Reviews.Title: “We had a deal that made it worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: albertageologist
Reviews.Content: Our room was great. 36 floor looking north. Very comfy bed and room. Amazing bathroom. The problem is that there is no where to go to escape the smoke. And no where to sit except in casino or restaurants. At least in the Venetian the shopping area is smoke free and they have places to sit. The pool area was closed due to winds or was too cool to use. For some reason the hot tub is only open 9-5 and is away from the entry area. Parking was good

Reviews.Title: “Hard to stay elsewhere in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ahiptragedy
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the tower suites on a couple occasions, I'm having a hard time even considering other hotels for an upcoming stay. The spa is amaaaazzing. All the restaurants are great. We went to the clubs but that isn't really our scene. The pool is lovely if you snag a lounge chair. I wish they allowed us to bring our tiny dog.

Reviews.Title: “Elite & Very Posh”
Reviews.Author: dw165671
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I've stayed at in Las Vegas. It was worth every penny. You get what you pay for... the restaurant Wazuzu served excellent sushi.You should also go to the XS night club, & the pool side was very posh! Our room was breathtaking! We plan to come back again on our future visit to Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: TamaraTammy32
Reviews.Content: When you first walk into the Wynn, you go into a state of aw. Soak in the beauty and the craft of the artwork. I didn't want to leave until we got to the front desk. They were nice, but were determined to put a $1000.00 hold on my card. I had to ask for the manager, at that point, I no longer saw the beauty in the hotel. Finally after speaking with the manager, they accepted a $150.00 hold. And from there, we went to our room which offer breath taking views of the city. The room was well appointed with living room with state of the art furniture. The bathroom offered robes (which were used, but hey; we never got that in another hotel) separate bath tub and shower. I would definitely return to this hotel.....as long as they know they can't put a hold on my card.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen227
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at this hotel. The rooms are very nice and the bathrooms are large and spacious. Great strip and mountain views, the pool and bar area were very relaxing with great drinks. The breakfast food was a little pricey. There's a beach club next door where we attended a great day party which is very noisy during the day but a lot of fun. The hotel is a bit of a distance from other places along the strip.

Reviews.Title: “High Class Hotel Should not Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Kameidotraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with alot of high end amenities. My husband and I had a 10 night stay in Las Vegas. We stayed in 3 different hotels during our stay. First 2 nights we stayed at the MGM Grand (have stayed here over 5 times). Next 3 nights were at the New York New York Hotel (have stayed here over 5 times). Our last 5 nights were at the Encore (have stayed here 3 times). The encore has far nicer rooms than the MGM and New York New York. The Encore is at the complete opposite end of the strip from the first two hotels. We enjoy changing hotels and getting a different vibe from the different hotels. MGM has fairly large rooms but the views are always terrible. The casino is HUGE. The foodcourt is lively and very busy. There is a nice stroll to shopping facilities as well as many restaurants. When we checked out all we had to do was walk across the bridge to get to New York New York. New York has a younger crowd vibe (we are in our early 50's). The rooms are a little smaller than MGM however compared with other hotels in the U.S.A they would be classified as high end. We have always had good views from our stays at New York. Given a choice I would stay at the New York hotel over the MGM hotel. Casino is smaller and during our Friday Saturday night stay very lively. There is a dual ling piano bar that is very popular and fun. There is also a Irish Pub that is a great place to get a Guinness. Food is reasonably priced at the food court and very good. The deli sandwiches, fish and chips and deserts were particular favorites. We planned our trip that we would not walk any farther than halfway down the strip (we used the Flamingo as our stopping point. When we checked out of New York New York we decided to walk to the Encore (we have made this walk many times on previous holidays so we did know how long it was). Our intention originally was to take a cab but we were energized that day and had no problem pulling our 1 suitcase and carrying our 1 back pack. If you do decide to do this there are many places to stop and sit for a minute if your feet get tired. The vibe at the Encore is immediately so different from the first two hotels. Much more staff attends to you and they really do make checking in and checking out a delight. Much more efficient than the first two hotels. The grandeur of the encore immediately takes you aback. Beautiful, beautiful red decor. Rooms have floor to ceiling windows so views are great. We were on the 28th floor and were offered a upgrade to a higher floor for 20.00 more. We declined the offer and we were very satisfied with the view that came with our room. We ate at the Wynn buffet twice during our stay and upgraded the meal to 10.00 each for all you can drink champagne (there are some other drinks available at that price but we chose the champagne). Someone in another review stated that some of the food was not fresh. I would have to disagree with that statement. Everything was great and all was fresh. We intended to try some of the other restaurants at the Encore but it did not work out for us with the shows we were going to see. In this order my favorites are Encore - Classy New York - Fun MGM - Has everything I would stay at any of these properties again. Have fun in Vegas!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Las Vegas since 1984 and this was our first stay at Encore or any Wynn property. From our arrival on Saturday morning to our departure on Tuesday we were truly pampered. Richard was especially helpful at check-in and we got to our room early. Panoramic view was worth the upgrade. Rooms are what the pictures say they are. Society cafe was awesome. Smiles from everyone all the time. And Garth.....what a wonderful evening. It is a true experience when both you and the performer are having fun. We will be coming back to Encore!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: luvtravelAmherst_NY
Reviews.Content: This is the only place we'll stay. Check-in is easy, check out over the phone is easy. The entire staff is professional and courteous. The rooms are always clean, the common areas are always clean. Yes it is $$$$, but it is worth it. Our other favorite thing is that it is small enough to get around quickly; other behemoth hotels on the strip take 15 minutes to get from the room to the pool, common areas, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, very nice room, expensive shopping”
Reviews.Author: agent86SanJose
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Resort King Suite on the 35th floor, view of strip and Wynn golf course. The room has a large bathroom which has a large shower , separate tub and a wall TV. TV is nice but not that remote only has channel up and down. Next is a room containing the king bed which is very comfortable. There's a switch next to bed that allows you to remotely control the drapes and room lighting. A wall unit separates the bedroom and the living/office room. The wall unit contains a 40'ish LCD TV. Channels include local channels, CNN, ESPN etc. There's also several international channels including 5 Chinese channels.Internet service is included as part of the resort fee. The Encore and Wynn shop malls are very high end and expensive. Across the street is The Fashion Show mall which contains shops such as Macy's, Neiman Marcus and others. The walk from Encore to Fashion Show Mall is a hike and will take you about 20 mins walking at a brisk pace. Luckily there's a pedestrian bridge over Las Vegas Blvd so you can easily cross over to the mall. The first shops on the end of the bridge include Neiman Marcus, Macy's and Half-Price Tickets. The Wynn buffet is average and expensive but the Prime Rib and Beef Brisket were very good. Some of the other items did not look freshly cooked. We booked a promo that for $149 per night for 2 nights which included 2 Le Reve show tickets and $92 credit for the buffets. With the promo, I would rate the value very good. The location is below average since you are on the north end of the strip. It would be better to be at mid-strip..

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Jelmy R
Reviews.Content: I know most ppl say that picking a hotel is not a big deal you wont be there as often. Well not until you exprience a high end hotel is that so wrong. I loved the shower, the room, the view, the smell, I had a very good time here. we did get a great price from Southwest and had no problems checking in.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: SarahN79
Reviews.Content: I have been lucky enough to travel quite extensively, I can honestly say this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. I booked a package deal through Virgin holidays and always wanted to stay at the Wynn, despite people saying that it's at the end of the strip. The encore was actually cheaper than the wynn and the newer of the towers. From the moment we checked it we were amazed. We were offered to upgrade our room to a 63rd floor suite with view of the strip for $20 a night. Without hesitation we upgraded and so pleased that we did. It was huge, desk and massive corner sofa area. Huge bathroom with seperate shower and bath, double sinks etc. The adult only 'euro' pool was perfect, with excellent pool side service and extensive cocktail list. You can also sunbathe top-less (should you wish). No photo's can be taken here. It loses the sun at 2.30pm for an hour as it disappears behind the wynn buillding. (guess this depends on the time of year) There is a beach club also there, which we just missed the end of season closing, but it looks amazing. One of the night clubs in the hotel, Surrender opens out on to it. Had an amazing time in there. The night club XS also in the hotel was another good night. Have a look at the resort video on the TV when you get the room as there are some amazing restaurants and bars in the resort that are worth seeing even just for photo opportunities. The dualing piano's in the east bar at the encore is a fun way to start the evening. One more thing, take comfy shoes there's a lot of walking. There's also a mono rail that runs for most of the strip. Nearest stop to encore is in the Flamingo, by Harrahs. (There's a good live music bar outside by Harrahs that is worth a visit). Out and about flip flops and flat shoes are more than acceptable. Heels more for clubs only! We also did a grand canyonn helicopter tour with Papillion. We paid $360 for the sunset tour. well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and view !”
Reviews.Author: mayrealtor
Reviews.Content: We loved our room at the Encore, the sister hotel of the Wynn..There was a separation between the bedroom and living area and the view was to die for. My only complaint was the first night the sheets were scratchy, but they did correct that the second night. Also, with no coffee pot in the room, missed that convenience.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel Service and Room. Yummy Food”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel2345
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Encore for a meeting. We stayed tower suites which offers private access, check-in , concierge and services. The rooms are stunning. We stayed opposite the main strip and had a quiet room with mountain views and views of the older section of the strip. We spent most of our time in Encore or Wynn. OMG the restaurants are delightful with delectable cuisines, attention to detail and excellent service. We have stayed at some top caliber hotels and this was the best, most consistent, and catered service that we have veered had. EVERYone offered their best. Its obvious that it is the focus of the staffs' training. We did tons of room service at ate at many of the restaurants. We were so happy with Encore and Wynn that we didn't want to leave the compound. I would highly recc this hotel for business or pleasure. You can't loose. While there we saw Le Reve and was equally impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations...”
Reviews.Author: lalea
Reviews.Content: A beautiful resort, full of natural light and an tranquil environment that you don't often find in Las Vegas. The rooms are beautifully appointed and offer views of both the strip and mountains beyond. Sinatra was a wonderful dining choice for dinner with all of my old Sinatra favorites providing background music along with video playing behind the bar. The bartender at Sinatra was just great, offering cocktail suggestions along with dinner recommendations. Society Cafe was a great spot for breakfast or lunch offering many unique options---much nicer than your average Vegas cafe! The steak & egg sliders are not to be missed. Also, ate dinner at La Cave in Wynn ( short walk through the shops). Fun spot for wine & small plates. Our group ordered several different things, shared and loved them all! The trio of sausage flat bread was a favorite. There is dueling piano bar and is a nice spot to unwind after dinner. Good music, and great cocktails. The Spa & Salon at Encore is reason enough for me to book my next trip! Spent a delightful afternoon being pampered. The windows in the salon look out over the strip and was mesmerizing while getting a pedicure at dusk.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Goatface
Reviews.Content: This was the 6th time we've been to Vegas and having stayed in diiferent hotels every time, I can absolutely confirm that the Encore is by far the best.We had a room on the 61st floor so maybe that's why we didn't hear any noise from the clubs at all, The service, the room, the food-everything was great. i highly recommenf the Encore and am already planning our next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth7887
Reviews.Content: Before traveling to Vegas, spent weeks comparing 5-star hotels - reading reviews, asking opinions, and prices. Narrowed options down to Encore, The Palazzo and The Cosmopolitan, in the end choosing Encore because I liked the decor and large rooms. Booked a resort king on booking.com for a great rate, upgraded to a panoramic suite upon check in for an additional $30. Panoramic suite was on one of the higher floors with a view of the pool, little bit of the golf course, and a little more of the strip. Great room, although not 700-square feet, as advertised. Really fantastic beds, lovely bathroom, large seating area. $20 resort fee included access to the gym and free wifi in the room, which isn't bad since wifi is usually $15/day. Every restaurant on the Wynn property is pricey, even a bottle of water is $3.50, but great service from everyone on site and very attentive. Even though we were on a high floor could still hear the music from the nightclub - the front desk offered us a different room away from the club, and also a food/beverage credit.

Reviews.Title: “Probably in the top five in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wolandscat
Reviews.Content: I wasn't there for the casinos, and am not even a gambler, but I know a good hotel when I see one. Nothing's cheap in Vegas, but the online deal for our room at the Encore was actually great value. My only problem was that noise from one of the discos penetrated way up to the 37th floor where the room was, until 5 am monday morning.... now I get that Vegas is a party town, and I don't mind staying up as well, but really, a hotel like this should actually have quieter rooms. No complaints for the other nights, nor the facilities, which are pretty amazing. I generally don't care that much about hotel exteriors, but I have to say, the Wynn + Encore is really one of the best pieces of architecture on the whole strip. Friendly staff, decent bars, and impressive decore.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: amilorn
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas several times and stayed at several places including Belagio. Encore was by far the best so far. The only problem was that the light system would go on everynight at around midnight and wake us up. There was no alarm on or anything and we never figured out why. Other than that, the spa was amazing and had the softest sheets I've ever felt. We had to go purchase them for our home. Also, the smoke smell throughout the casinos is always terrible, but not as bad for some reason at Encore as it was in Belagio or some of the others. We went golfing at the Wynn course and had Ray Romano tee off right before us and David Spade was about an hour behind us. We saw Garth Brooks who put on a great show. We also saw Le Reve by Cirque du soleil which was nice. Overall, best Vegas hotel so far!

Reviews.Title: “Bad vibrations on the 19th floor”
Reviews.Author: SussexCpl
Reviews.Content: We booked in at the Encore for a night between flights. Having previously had a good stay at the Wynn, we thought it would be a safe choice. Wrong. The welcome was good, and we were checked in relatively quickly. The room was well appointed, but the decor is far less inspiring than the Wynn. Our room faced the Strip and looked over towards the Fashion Show Mall. We had a good meal just off the casino before seeing the Garth Brooks concert (which was excellent!). The problem materialised when we got back to the room after midnight looking forward to a good sleep. Despite being so high up, the noise from the pool nightclub was very loud. We phoned downstairs and were told that they'd arrange for the music to be turned down. Three hours later we could still feel the beat of the music, and our water glasses were vibrating on the bedside tables!!!! We phoned again, to be told that the club would close soon. We were also told that it was pointless moving rooms because all suffer from nightlub noise! The only positive was that we were refunded 50% of the room rate. This hotel is okay if you're a clubber, but no good if you'd simply like a good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “my honest and unbiased review”
Reviews.Author: r_matt_6
Reviews.Content: The Encore is the only place I stay in Vegas and I come here twice a year from Maryland. I've been fortunate/blessed to travel the world and experience 5 star resorts in Europe, Asia, and the U.S. and I must say this is worthy of all 5 stars. I've stayed here both as a couple's trip and an all-guys trip with success; the resort is fairly versatile. My significant other doesn't even like Vegas but she actually enjoys the Encore. You can easily escape the party-goers and gamblers by going to the spa/gym or do some high-end shopping (window-shopping in my case) in the mall area. The two pools are divided into two sections; you can pick the family-friendly regular pool or the not so family friendly European-pool where clothing is optional. The Euro-pool is very relaxing and setup beautifully with the option to either layback and enjoy the eye-candy or shoot some outdoor craps. The restaurants all serve top-notch food but if I'm in the mood to gorge myself I’ll head to the Wynn buffet. I went there last weekend with my vegan buddy who was pleasantly surprised to find an enormous variety acceptable to his strict gluten-free / vegan diet. Some people seem to think the Venetian is comparable so I'll go ahead and give you my thoughts. I used to think the Venetian was nice. Sure, the replication of Venice indoors is unique but over time it becomes less and less impressive. If you haven't been to Vegas before I suggest you drop by to see it...but that's about it. The decor overall appears rich and detailed, I'll give it that. But stare at it closely and physically knock on something that appears to be stone, it's actually plaster. Tap on something that appears to be wood, it's really laminate. You get my point. Encore/Wynn is the complete opposite...you can tell the place was constructed with uber-deep pockets. The only synthetic material I want to see on vacation is silicone...just kidding. Last I stayed at the Venetian I booked a larger suite which to me still doesn't compare to a standard room at the Encore in terms of fit and finish, Encore is just on another level. COMPLAINTS: Let me start by saying some of the negative reviews I've read here are quite laughable! One review left 3 stars because their room lacked a coffee maker? No offense to the poster but that is no reason to deduct a star or two unless, of course, your last name is Folgers. There are a few things I can nitpick at but I can assure you the positives GREATLY outweigh the negatives. Here goes: 1) Our service at the Wazuzu restaurant was not so good. We found this a bit out-of-place as service EVERYWHERE else in the hotel is top-notch. The waiter was nice BUT very inattentive; my friend specifically asked for no tofu but his dish came with...tofu. He never checked on us a single time to see how we were doing; we had to waive the manager down for assistance, water, etc. The restaurant manager was very pleasant and listened to what we had to say about our service. Not sure what the reasoning was behind the bad service but perhaps the waiter was new? Either way this was unacceptable and a complaint was filed with Encore, however, this did not ruin our day. Hopefully this was just an isolated incident and we are now waiting on response from management to see how they will resolve. 2) Trying to grab a seat at the pool can be tedious especially if you're with a group of friends. I guess it really depends on the time of day you go...but go early and you should be fine. Any decent pool in Vegas will be the same way. 3) Rooms aren't cheap but they’re well worth the price. Probably not the place you want to stay if you're on a budget but then again, who goes to Vegas to save money?! If you really want something low-cost stay at Hooters hotel for $29 but I wouldn't recommend stepping in the shower barefooted. That’s my honest review and as you can tell I’m another satisfied customer on this board. I'm already planning my next trip out here in a few months and will be booking one of the larger suites. You simply cannot go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: missingbangor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made an unlikely trip to Las Vegas; we don't gamble and we are not glitzy people, but we went to see Garth Brooks. It was an excellent show. We really enjoyed staying at Encore. The staff and security people are very friendly and communicate lots of great tips for fun in Vegas. Wonderful restaurants: We were in Botero, Society Cafe, Switch, and otherrestaurants. All at Encore and all great! Never thought I would go to Vegas, but Garth Brooks and Le Reve, drew us and Encore made it safe, wonderful and an excellent environment for us to relax. THank you Mr. Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf All the Way -- And I'm Picky!”
Reviews.Author: QueenoftheSlipstream
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days in Vegas this past weekend for a friends b-day. We picked the Encore property as they had sent us a special offer. Wow -- just amazing in so many ways. From the large to the small, it was nearly perfection. The lobby is gorgeous, the staff -- professional and efficient, and smiling. The food, the bars, the casino, the whimsy -- just delightful. And then the room -- I just loved loved loved the room. We paid a bit extra at check in for a high floor, and it was freaking huge -- clean, well appointed beyond most hotels I've been in, and I've been in thousands. Floor to ceiling windows, automated sheers and drapes, a separate sitting area, a flat screen TV that swivels to either the giant, comfy bed -- with perfectly made linens, and big, fluffy pillows -- or to the sitting area. Ok, so the mini bar is expensive -- who cares? Make $50 or $500 or $5000 on the tables, you can afford an $8 bottle of Fiji Water -- lol. The bed was so comfortable, we are actually thinking about buying one -- they sell everything at the Home Store on property. These Steve Wynn, he's genius. I loved the promotional video that he narrates about the various restaurants and the things that he considered when designing his hotels. I am a forever fan. I even ordered room service coffee every day (expensive, I don't care!) and the coffee was even great -- I mean great, as in Peet's or Italian Roast great...and room service told me how long it would take and that's when it showed up -- how often does THAT happen? We also hung out at the adjoining property (Wynn) pool a couple days, and that was fun too. Good bloody mary's and delightful servers poolside. Geez, I'm ready to go back! But then there's my liver to consider....hahaha. Trust me, you'll love this place. Oh, and go see Vinny Favorito -- this crazy comedian at the Flamingo (now there's a trippy place, don't stay there unless you're broke or desperate) but the comedian was hilarious, and worth $75/ticket! He essentially roasts the crowd! Not for the conservative nor easily offended. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Decor but no coffee”
Reviews.Author: HelenVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wynn Encore for three nights. It is beautifully decorated with the chandeliers and lights being extraordinary. The room was spacious with a spectacular floor to ceiling view of Las Vegas. My one peeve was that there was no coffee maker in the room and to order in would be at least $30.00. You had to get dressed, go downstairs to the cafe and buy a really expensive cup of so so coffee. I asked about this at the front desk and they said that because it was a full service hotel, they didn't need to put a coffee maker in the room. I would suggest that this be an option for guests. I would have paid a reasonable amount to have a coffee maker available in the room for use at my convenience. This is supposed to be a high class hotel but it felt like a money grab to me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Classy!”
Reviews.Author: alstevens
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here with some friends. We usually stay on the other end of the strip closer to the center so we chose the Encore this time, the location was great, right across the street from the Fashion Show mall. They have nice restaurants, loved the Thai Asian restaurant, we ate there a couple of times. You really do not have to leave the resort, everything is right here, lots of shopping too, it connects to the Wynn hotel with more shops and restaurants! The rooms are suites, big and spacious, the view is awesome with floor to ceiling Glass, it's like a small apartment but without a kitchen, the bathroom was awesome, loved the built in tv while getting ready in the mornings. The beds are so comfy with luxurious bedding, I didn't want to go home! We also went to see the show featured at the Encore, Le Reve, which was Spectacular, a Must see!

Reviews.Title: “Such a grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lannie29
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Las Vegas for our 2 yr anniversary. I did a lot of research before deciding on the Encore. Needless to say, it didn't disappoint me. From moment we checked in, it has been nothing but greatness. Once you walk into the hotel, it smells so good. Even with all the smokers, it wasn't that bad. The rooms are spectacular with a beautiful view of the strip. Unlike the other hotel on the strip that you have to wait forever just to get to the entrance or leave in your car, at Encore it was easy and simple. No loud drunks in the casino but classy people enjoying the good service of a 5 star hotel. Would def return in the new future

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great view.”
Reviews.Author: Haynpower04
Reviews.Content: The Encore at Wynn is absolutely beautiful. The suite was extremely spacious. By far the most comfortable nights sleep I've ever had in a hotel. The bed was so soft and comfortable I could have stayed in it all day! The bathroom was also spacious and lovely. They even had a vanity mirror with stool and t.v. in the bathroom. The room was by far the nicest I've ever stayed in with a really good price. The Encore property is gorgeous and stunning. The fitness room was also very nicely set up with more then enough cardio equipment, machines, and free weights available. The restaurants in the hotel were pricey, but the buffet was good with lots of options to choose from. Would stay in the hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - great job Steve Wynn”
Reviews.Author: emamu
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this AMAZING hotel for five nights in November, and honestly can find NOTHING NEGATIVE to say about the whole experience. Check in staff were extremely helpful and sensing that we were exhausted from a transatlatic flight, gave us just the briefest of check in then promised to ring us within half and hour to explain facilities and answer any questions. This was a god send as we just wanted to change & freshen up, and the promised call was recieved in 25mins. We stayed on 34th floor with a fantastic view of the strip. The suite itself, is exactly as you see on the website...which is a pleasant surprise. Large, sumptious and with an extremely comfortable bed & linens. The whole hotel is just so impressive. Totally OTT decor but it works and is tasteful rather than tacky. The casino was small compared to some of the other hotels, but that was perfect for us, and all the common areas from casino to esplanade, even the restrooms were spotlessly clean and a constant but discreet army of cleaning/maintenace personal were always busy keeping it that way. The location was perfect too. Across the road from the Fashion Show Mall and within walking distance of all the other famous strip landmarks, but far enough away not to be too busy or hectic. Ate in the hotel twice, at La Societe for breakfast - pricey but worth it, and Sunday Champagne Brunch at the Wynn Buffet, which was undoubtedly THE BEST MEAL I HAVE EVER EATEN. If ever returning to Vegas, this would be my first (and probably only) choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suites”
Reviews.Author: Marybeth58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore while in Vegas for a conference. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and absolutely lovely. As in all Vegas hotels there is no coffee in the room but the bar at the base of the elevators has coffee service in the morning. The spa and exercise room were stunning. It's all very very expensive!! But a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: DonManolo
Reviews.Content: Empty. Even on week-end and over holiday! Casino staff looked depressed and like they did not want to be there. Rooms are ok. Much nicer in the tower suites. Time to look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Casino and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poodml
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our anniversary in october. Everywhere you walked in the casino smelled so good, not at all heavy with smoke. Our room was beautiful!!! Bed was so comfy, loved the bathroom! Had a terrific view from the bed! Love the remote drapes!!! We could not eat there as the food was so expensive. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Always happy at Encore”
Reviews.Author: MichelleSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have been going to Vegas every year for the past 8 yrs and have stayed at Mandalay Bay, The Hotel, Bellagio, Wynn, and now Encore for the past 3 yrs. Of course it's all subjective depending on individual tastes and budget but we love Encore because it's all suites, the decor is colorful and bright (if you want a NY look, go to The Hotel) and it's small enough to find your way around. I should say that we're not big gamblers so can't comment on their gaming tables. Also we like the fact that they have a "euro" pool, meaning no kids allowed and topless if that's your thing. Plus if you stay at Encore you can also use the Wynn pool but not vice-versa. Wynn also has a euro pool. Go during the week for the best rate!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel is Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Hollysam
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay here and loved every second of it! Having looked around all the other hotels we were very pleased with the choice we made. It is one of the newer hotels and it definitely showed. Great location (next to the Venetian and near Caesers Palace and the Ballagio) and great value for money (all rooms are actually suites and they are HUGE!). When we arrived we were offered a room upgrade for $20 per night - well worth it as the view was to die for - panoramic views of the strip! The suite was fab - as I said, HUGE and very luxurious. We also used the gym and spa facilities while we were there and they are one of the best we have seen. The spa is expensive, but my massage was one of the best i've had and the facilities are wonderful. This hotel is ajoined to the Wynn via a walkway with lots of nice shops and cafes/restaurants. I would recommend Cafe Society for something fairly casual, and Wazuzu (Japanese) for something more special. There is also a great little bar that overlooked a gorgeous waterfall, which has light shows at night, and great cocktails. The casinos in Vegas are pretty unpleasant in all of the hotels, as they are very smokey, however the Wynn/Encore seemed the best out of them all in this respect. This hotel also has a theatre (Le Reve and Garth Brooks were both on when we stayed) which we didn't visit, but from the outside it looked superb and again comparing against other hotels, it looked the most modern. I would recommend going to see some of the many shows out in Vegas - particularly LOVE by Cirque Du Soleil. It is a Beatles inspired show, and truely beathtaking. We are not traditional Vegas people, but having stayed in this hotel we would definitely come back again and stay here. You feel very pampered and looked after and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “dont come back”
Reviews.Author: bennypm
Reviews.Content: i had a bad experience here!!! bad service, the room smell very bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Scott R
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Encore. We booked a two night trip on a special offer that was too good to pass up. I've stayed at alot of vegas hotels and Encore has the best rooms in vegas as far as I'm concerned. Everything here was immaculate from check-in to check-out. The check in agent had me in and up to the room within 5 minutes. We were offered a higher room with a strip view for $50 more a night and declined. We ended up on the nineteenth floor and the view from there was not too bad.We had golf course views and overlooked the pool. After seeing the layout of the hotel I'm not sure that even a room on the highest floor would offer much of a strip view.For the most part the Wynn would block most strip view from any floor just because of the positioning of the two hotels. If I can be critical at all it would be the cost of everything here is very high. We had drinks in a few of the lounges and were surprised at the cost although the drinks were good. We ordered sliders, soup and a diet coke via room service one night and it was close to $50. Both items ordered were marginal at best. For the cost I would expect the food to be exceptional and it was not.No big deal.The high quality of rooms and level of service here is why you pay a bit more for everything else and I'd gladly do it again. I would have loved to have golfed because the golf course from my room looked immaculate but I cannot justify $500 for a round of golf anywhere on the planet.That is probably why I only saw 3 or four people on the golf course over the course of my two day stay.For $500 a round I'd want a professional to hit my shots for me and be able to use the score for my handicap index. You can'g go wrong at Encore though.Great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: Kinna
Reviews.Content: This place is majestic and is impressive even for experienced travelers. We stayed for 4 nights and wished we could have stayed longer. I liked the location of this hotel because it is at the end of the strip and offers a more tranquil environment. We walked a lot everyday but that was a good thing after all the great meals we had. We tried the Society Café which is located in the Encore...WOW!! Expensive but worth every penny. Our room was spacious and had a panoramic view of the mountains. The gym is out of this world and the pool area is quite large with the possibility of using the Wynn's side as well. I would recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Francie U
Reviews.Content: The Panorama Suites are gorgeous, extremely well appointed and very spacious--the bathroom alone is the size of some rooms I've stayed in before on The Strip. Check in, check out and every other interaction with resort staff made me feel like a VIP. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and I am now ruined for all other hotels in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great escape from "typical" Vegas”
Reviews.Author: brooke103
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend a 2-night getaway to Vegas at the Encore to celebrate our anniversary in January. We loved it! Even though you certainly do not escape the buzz of casino completely, it seemed more subdued and not as distracting as in most Vegas hotels. We loved the room, although we were disappointed we ended up with a "downtown view" facing a bunch of construction and some undesirable blocks north of the strip. It didn't really matter though - how much time do you spend in your room admiring the view? The room itself was very plush and trendy, and the bed was extremely comfortable. Very well done. The hotel itself had an enormous number of quality restaurants to choose from, as it is connected to the Wynn and easy to walk back and forth. We ate at the Lakeside restaurant for dinner one night and loved it. Their oyster happy hour was fantastic! We also ate at the Country Club restaurant for brunch - dee-lish! The breakfast buffet was also to die for. We saw Garth Brooks in concert as well - he was AMAZING!! Well worth the money. Overall, my husband and I are not very "Vegas people"....2 nights and I'm ready to get out of there. However, I'd say the Wynn/Encore changed my mind. I could see myself staying for a few more nights, as we didn't get to experience nearly all of it. We also loved that we just enjoyed staying right there and felt we had everything we needed - didn't have to walk all over the strip. This hotel has won me over as our "go-to" Vegas destination! You won't be disappointed - it is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “First class, awesome”
Reviews.Author: oldbeast
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Las Vegas numerous times, and this time tried the Encore at Wynn as we were staying for 4 nights and wanted a bigger room. What a fabulous hotel, everything was excellent. The rooms and view unbelievable, the restaurants awesome, even the pool in February was warm and wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property, beautiful rooms, great buffet, horrible receptionist Vanessa though . . .”
Reviews.Author: onikkio
Reviews.Content: Went to check in and was greeted by the "not so friendly Vanessa . . . ." . She stated our reservations were not at the Wynn, but were over at Encore and we needed to go next door. I explained hat I reserved a room at the Wynn and it should have been booked there. She didn’t want to correct my reservation, and then proceeded again to say that we needed to go over to Encore. That was not acceptable to us since we had wanted to stay at the Wynn and that was where teh room had been booked. I asked her to go check with her supervisor, which she hesitantly proceeded to do. After feeling like we were being scrutinized or lying, he finally said it was ok to change to Wynn, so it was corrected. Her “I can’t” attitude really upset us and we didn't really feel welcome. She did not put out a very good first impression of the Wynn, as I had read in the in-room magazine which stated the front line people represent the hotel. I was hoping that this was not the case. I felt very discouraged at this point. People at teh red card area not too knowedgeable, so make sure you ask for William, who knows what is going on...avoid Danika becasue she gave us bogus info . . . Overall, the rooms were spacious and beautiful, the bar service was great and the casino was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to breathe in”
Reviews.Author: Comeonflywithme
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of things I love about Encore but my favorite is that it doesn't smell like smoke. It's also incredibly clean. I had the time of my life two days in a row at Encore Beach Club and danced the night away at Surrender! If you are going to Vegas, stay at Encore!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: krp87b
Reviews.Content: The room had a clean crisp design. This is one of the newer hotels in Vegas and you can tell. We were in a suite with a nice sitting area and TV that rotated around to either the bed or the sitting area. The bathrooms were big with a dual sinks. The free valet was quick and convenient. I've stayed at a few hotels in Vegas and the Wynn and Encore are my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Grand, Regal & Ornate!”
Reviews.Author: Preethi_Kamath
Reviews.Content: Encore is a property that is Quintessentially Vegas! The only word to describe the experience is "Grand"! It is decadent from the minute you walk in, highly ornate and spectacular decor throughout the hotel, gaming areas and plush rooms that will make one feel like royalty. The service they provide is to die for, the attention to detail is intricate, and all the restaurants that I tried were spot-on. Encore is bustling with the best night clubs (XS was my favorite!) and high-end shopping. Particularly loved the connectivity to Wynn Hotel which has more gaming,dining and night clubs. The location on the strip is also great, accessible and close to the mall for those who need a break from the casinos. Absolutely loved every minute at the Encore and would hope to be back someday soon!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam911
Reviews.Content: Encore at The Wynn (and the Wynn) is a stunning hotel with beautiful and well equipped rooms, very comfotable beds and generally a high standard of decoration throughout. As with any 4 or 5 star hotel in Las Vegas, guests are spoilt for choice as regards dining options, bars etc. There are also two swimming pools to choose from although the pool side food menu could be improved upon, it was quite limited and therefore we chose to not eat by the pool which was not ideal. There is a shopping mall situated almost opposite the hotel. We had one complaint which took longer then we would have liked to be settled and we had to chase them instead of the other way round but in the end it was settled in the "American way", and we were satisfied. Overall a fantastic hotel with a nice clientele and a general feeling of sophistication. TIP: Pay the extra and pre book a Limo from the airport instead of a cab, it's the best way to start your visit.

Reviews.Title: “really covers every attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: dinningforfun
Reviews.Content: Stayed there this past week. Great room at really great price. Room was superb, clean, with excellent service. would definitely go again

Reviews.Title: “All swimming pools closed”
Reviews.Author: Mollyjay0
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a visit to this resort and want the use of a swimming pool I would check with the hotel prior to check in , I have just spent 7 days here and all pools are closed. You can use the pool at the Wynn but in my opinion it is not acceptable to close the pools at the hotel you are staying in without them advising you prior to you checking in?

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Luxury done right!”
Reviews.Author: Trvl_Prncss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 4 nights at the Encore at Wynn. The hotel and staff were amazing!! We stayed on the 56th floor panoramic view suite. The room was spacious, the view breathtaking (how could it not be, you're on the strip) and the room was exactly as pictured on the website. (Speaking of website, they recently updated the website and it truly is a total downgrade from the awesome flash website they had before but don't let the look of the website deter you in booking).
