The hotel is immaculately mantained. Even the casino area, where you usually see the wear and tear of traffic in other hotels, not here, it was spotless. Everything was like brand spanking new. We were never disturbed by music or any noise being on such a high floor. The spa was phenomenal. Lisa was great in working out those knots and kinks. Though the steam room was out of service for renovations while we were there, no biggie because the rest of the amenities at the spa were enough. We will definitely be returning to Encore!

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy asian lacquer red and black decor but cigarette smoke made it a giant elegant ashtray”
Reviews.Author: amb333
Reviews.Content: decor is everything one sees on their web page and more. spa is a dream with motorized massage chairs and simultaneous mani/pedicures with elegant privacy curtains which seem to belong more to a posh exotic palace than a spa. rooms are spacious, elegant, with amazing 50-60 floor height views of the strip, bed console to control motorized sheers and drapes, lights. botero steak house was great but all food salty. greatest drawback to this place is the persistent cigarette smoke. We asked for a non-smoking room and there was no trace of smoke smell there which was a relief, but immediate entrance to the elevator and the rest of the hotel, one can get a headache with the odor of it.

Reviews.Title: “It's what Vegas is all about!”
Reviews.Author: Codici
Reviews.Content: After staying here for 3 nights, I simply didn't want to leave anymore. We got a great deal in november which also included 2 buffet passes. We have visited Las Vegas many times before, but this hotel tops it all. From electronic curtains to their fantastic beds, from the look of the casino to the pools. Everything just makes sense, but is also completely over the top. If you don't like opulent capitalism, please go somewhere else, even better, don't stay in Vegas. Encore is what Vegas hotels are all about, showing off and be noticed, and it does in every way possible! Be absolutely sure to stay in a suite on one of the panoramic levels. The view of the strip and the Wynn Hotel from those levels is just out of this world. By the way both the Encore and the Wynn pool were still open. Most hotels in Las Vegas close their pools around this time of year, so we were happy The Wynn and Encore didn't. As a guest you could use both the pool of the Wynn and the Encore. In the morning they offer some great affordable breakfast items and coffee to go in their cafe downstairs near the elevators. Although it's on the north end of the strip, it's close to TI, The Venetian and The Mirage, so you don't have to walk far to find some other action than the Wynn hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Encore”
Reviews.Author: ScottinKansasCity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a quick 3 day weekend get away to Las Vegas. I reserved a Panoramic Suite King and asked for and was provided a room with a Strip view on the 62nd (of 63) floors at check in. The room was very nice and the view was great. I knew there was a chance we would hear music late into the night on the Strip side (and we did), but it was minor and worth the minor inconvenience for the view. My wife took in the spa service for a 2 hour treatment on Saturday morning and came away raving about the surroundings and the service itself. We ate at SW Steakhouse (fantastic), Botero (also fantastic - try the Kobe short rib), Society (good) and Pizza Place (OK) while on property. We've stayed at Caesar's and Bellagio in the past. Both are great hotels, but we enjoyed Encore more. I would highly recommend Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with service.”
Reviews.Author: Laura L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago and saw Garth's show. I thought it was nice so thought we would go back but was very unhapply when we went to book the room. This time we planned to a 7 night stay and they acted like they were doing me a favor to stay at the Hotel. I guess they don't realize they have other really nice hotels in town that are not on the edge of the strip. That was the thing I hated about the Wynn/Encore - it was far from other places and not central located. I just booked with another hotel and will never even think about going to the Wynn/Encore again.

Reviews.Title: “Wynn Encore was a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: imikm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Christmas holiday season between christmas and new years and although Vegas was very crowded, the Encore didn't feel overly crowded. We liked this a lot because after battling crowds around town, we could come back to the Encore and have some peace and quiet. We had a suite which was very spacious with a beautiful view of the strip. The room was clean and comfortable although my husband thought the decor was kind of like a tacky boudoir. Just not our style. We would stay there again because we like the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJCMN
Reviews.Content: Rooms are amazing. We had one with a great view up on the 58th floor. Check-in staff was amazing. Thank you Winston! My only two complaints which I really hope they fix as they are easy fixes have to do with their food. At Society Cafe, they say they have fresh orange juice for $7 and it is worse than concentrate. I think if they would have fresh juices it would really be a nice fit. Also, we ordered the movie popcorn for room service and it tasted worse than microwave popcorn for $18. Everything else was amazing. Kudos Steve Wynn and your staff.

Reviews.Title: “That's Not Glitter....”
Reviews.Author: a.p.1017
Reviews.Content: I dragged my husband there for his first Vegas trip. He was profoundly anti-Vegas yet after five nights at this place I could not get him to leave. The whole place is just dripping in crystals and silver and gold and silk. Everywhere you look is weird and interesting and fabulous. I thought the red butterflies were flocked with red glitter; upon closer inspection I found they were encrusted with thousands of crystals. Tacky? Nope. Authentically, unapologetically VEGAS? Yep that's it.... maybe some traditionalists or uber-modern types might want to hate it because it's all so gorgeously over-the-top; so if you can't stand whimsical, "I've-never-seen-this-before" opulence then go somewhere else. The Encore is not trying to be ancient Rome, or Venice, or New York, or anything but Las Vegas done right. You see millionaires and billionaires around the casino yet you don't ever feel excluded if you aren't one of them. Although this place is expensive, you get a true resort 5-star experience for less money than most other true 5-star resorts in the world. Food can be expensive but there are a lot of options (Lobby Bar, Cafe Society, Poolside service) that do great food and drinks for milder prices. However, if you are in town to blow a little cash I can think of no place more worthy than Wynn-Encore; we ate like hipster-kings at Bottega, Stratta, and Lakeside Grill. The food was world-class and unique. I remember reading almost every single review on Tripadvisor to plan my stay and it really helped me. I'll reiterate the biggest tips: arrive on a Wednesday or Thursday to avoid check-in / check-out lines. Bring earplugs if you want a lower-floor strip view to avoid the night club noise or face away from the strip. Get to the pool early if you want an umbrella seat. Hit wallgreens or the ABC store across the street in the mall for water purchases. Don't get caught up in the mini-bar (although it's not as outrageous as every other 5-star resort out there). Do buy Day-Passes for those incredible spa pools. You don't have to get a massage (although i did and it was incredible) but you must just check that spa facility out. Go to the gym there (it's great for trying to spot celebrities and Cirque acrobats!) then take a long, leisurely steam / sauna and shower in the spa pools / rooms at least once. CLUBS: OK let me indulge myself a bit and make a comparison between two similar "epic, club-themed" hotels in the US - the Fontainbleu Hotel in Miami and the Enocre: last year I went to the Fontainbleu in Miami which boasts one of the world's best nightclubs called "LIV". I felt like getting into that club at the Fountainbleu was the most miserable, dehumanizing experience and the bouncers treated people like complete garbage. The lines getting into that hole were 200 people deep screaming to get in the door. As an older gentleman pleaded with the LIV bouncer to get him and his wife in as it was her birthday, the bouncer yelled at him that he had to be patient and that both he and his wife weren't really the type of people they would care to let in anyway. All in all a horrible-yet-extremely-expensive experience. Guess who also boasts some of the world's best nightclubs with "XS", "Tryst", and "Surrender"? Yep it's Encore-Wynn. My husband and I were feeling a little bit dressed-up and we walked by Tryst (although I was still gun-shy about ever getting let into any place like that); the CLUB MANAGER asked us if we would like to go in and then escorted us right to a beautiful banquette where we ordered champagne, listened to the house music, and felt like a million bucks. It was so fun!! What a difference! I don't think they could know how much I appreciated their efforts to envelop us into the Encore experience. So at the risk of sounding evangelical, I would highly suggest you check this place out. This Wynn dude really knows how to throw his money around, and we loved being at his party.

Reviews.Title: “Very loud”
Reviews.Author: Kampbda
Reviews.Content: Whilst a beautiful hotel - I booked a high floor to have a quiet time when I was ready to go to bed! Well - we had the room next to us in major partying so I ended up calling the front desk at 4am and they called security to quiten them down. Then the next night we were kept up the entire night with the party going on around the pool – now we were won the 56 th floor so that was loud music! Since staying there I have read a similar review so the hotel are well aware that the party by the pool is very disruptive but still allow it to go on! They sell themselves as a high end sophisticated hotel but there are huge flaws in the Encore experience!

Reviews.Title: “Double down on this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TOYMOVER
Reviews.Content: We have been to this property in 2011 and 2012 and the hotel and staff are second to none. I found that no matter what you want to do they can arrange it. The staff from the Maid to the Casino workers are very friendly and always make you feel special. The hotel is pricey, but you do get what you pay for! I don't think you will go wrong with this property and we will definalty go back in 2013!

Reviews.Title: “What Attention To Detail!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveMyThree3
Reviews.Content: I cannot find one unkind word to say about this hotel. Luxury at it's finest from the casino to the spa. Fantastic restaurants and fun filled nightclubs. I have stayed in many of the Las Vegas hotels but will not stay anywhere but Encore from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out for the Undisclosed Fees!”
Reviews.Author: TrueMinnesotan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wynn Encore while traveling on business the last week of January 2012. The hotel room itself was spacious, very clean, and included add-ons that many hotels don't provide. Having said that, I was taken aback by the charges that the Wynn added to each room when I checked in. When you're already paying around $300 a night for the room, you really shouldn't expect to see an additional $45 a night tacked on for things like resort fees and charges for the view out your window. This is all in addtion to the normal taxes that travelers are accustomed to paying. Airlines are now required to disclose all their charges when you book your flight. Someone really needs to pass a law forcing hotels to do the same thing. The last thing a frequent traveler wants to find out about is one or more additional hotel charges after a taxi ride from the airport and a long wait in the registration line. This brings me to my next comment, focusing on the registration process. The registration desk is located in an incredibly small space for a hotel of this size. I stood in a line similar to the ones we all encounter at the security checkpoint at the airport, winding my way back and forth. I must have been in line for 20 minutes. Again, not what I would have expected from an upscale property like this one. When it came time to check out, the billing was a disaster. Because of a change in plans, I had to add a day on to my trip. Therefore, I ended up with two different registration records. The hotel supposedly couldn't combine them because one had been made by my travel agency and one by myself. i could have lived with this, but then each bill was divided with two separate entries, and therefore four separate charges were made to my credit card. While the charges totaled correctly, I never could get an explanation as to why the bill was split and charged this way. I spent nearly two hoiurs trying to balance the charges in my web-based expense account program (Concur). I do get to Vegas several times a year for both business and pleasure. While this was my first experince with the Wynn, it will also be my last. There are a number of other hotels on or near the strip that may not have electric drapes in the room, or fancy shower heads in the shower, but that also won't charge you undisclosed fees for things you'll never use. All in all, it was a very negative experience. I just hope that what happened to me in Vegas, doesn't stay in Vegas, but gets communicated to those who might be thinking about staying at the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest place on the strip”
Reviews.Author: nrawlins
Reviews.Content: Very open and luxorious. Great restuarants and fitness club/spa. Was winter time so pools weren't active, but they looked nice as well. I've been to the Bellagio, Venetian, Ceasars. Those are all good choices, but this one was nicer. Was there for the Superbowl and the Sports book was a great atmosphere to watch the game. Clubs were good as well. Not really my thing but had to do it while in Vegas. Went to Tryst Fri night and XS Sat night. Don't fall for you have to go to both. While they are a good time, they are both the exact same thing. Same layout, same atmosphere, same wait staff and GOGO dancers. One just overlooks a waterfall and the other a pool. Only downfall about the hotel is that it allows smoking, but I guess that's just Vegas. At least the open casino did as well as possible to air out the smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Service was terrible - Still waiting for Manager's call”
Reviews.Author: Nick K
Reviews.Content: We decided to try Encore at Wynn because my wife really liked what we saw online. We were booking 2 rooms for 3 nights for us and our family. After a drive from Phoenix, upon arrival no bell hop or valet parking greeter to meet us at the hotel entrance so we parked and went in. Like another reviewer we had booked through Booking.com a few weeks in advance. We had altered the reservation three days before arrival to receive a lower non refundable rate ($50/night less). The Booking.com agent called the hotel directly (with me on the line) to confirm that the reservation was changed. The agent at the hotel confirmed that the reservation was in fact changed & that since the hotel had already charged a $400 deposit on my credit card, that would just be deducted from my final bill. I was sent a new email confirmation with the new rate and particulars. Upon arrival the hotel check in agent could not find any record of the revised rate. I showed her the confirmation that I had received but she said they could not honor it unless the reservation dept put it in the system. They had not done so. She went to speak with her manager twice but still insisted it could not be honored. Finally I asked that she bring her manager to speak with me. The front desk manager Katrenia Dupree was not only less than helpful she was rude. She said she could not honor the rate because reservations had no record of it in the system. When I showed her the confirmation of the booking with lower rate she said there was nothing she could do. She said it would take at least an hour to get the issue sorted out with the reservations dept. I asked them to call Booking.com and sort it out with them right now and she said she could not do that either. The agent who checked us in then also mentioned that the pool was closed at the hotel. Not just one pool, all of them. She said they have been closed for quite a while and were not sure when they would be opening. I said that it would have been nice to notify guests of that when making reservations. She said "that is not our policy". (Of course not) I later found out after talking with one of the cleaners that the beach club pool was actually filled and functional they just had it closed. Nice cost cutting. After 45 minutes of checking in we finally received our keys. When I went back to get luggage out of the car I was met by the valet attendant who said "is this your car, I was about to have it towed". When I said to him "perhaps if you were here when we got here and perhaps if your check in staff did their jobs properly it would not have been here for 45 mins". He just took off. Finally a bell hop came to take our bags after we had unloaded them ourselves and asked a hotel cleaner for some help. When we got into the room we had a so called "strip view". The strip view consists of a view of the Wynn hotel and the corner of Treasure Island. Inside the room the large mirrors were badly streaked. This was not even cleaned the following day when housekeeping came. It took until the second housekeeping visit (the following day) for them to clean them. I also received an unfriendly voicemail from Katrenia saying that she would not honor the new rate for the room and that I would have to take it up with Booking.com. She then called me directly an hour later saying that they had been able to contact Booking.com and they could now honor the rate. I explained to her the encounter with the valet and she said "that should never have happened". I said "this is what you call exceptional service?" Katrenia said she would have the hotel manager contact me directly. So far no call from the hotel manager. Of course not. Needless to say my gambling/dining is all going to other hotels. Steve Wynn needs to tell his staff the economy is very different from 10 years ago. The idea of keeping your guests at your hotel for as much of their stay as possible is more important than ever. There are at least 10 other great hotel options in Vegas who actually do care about service & actually serve their customers well (not just talk about it). Steve may want to go "undercover boss" to see what is actually going on in his hotels. Otherwise keep it up Steve. Soon your hotels will just be just another average Vegas hotel amongst many other better options. By the way, take a lot of extra time to walk your young kids through both Encore and Wynn casinos to get to the half opened Wynn pool.

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt the best hotel on the strip!!”
Reviews.Author: LordSilverbridge
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Wynn on our way into Las Vegas...and were totally blown away! However, when we stayed at the Encore on our way out and WOW! As much as the Wynn had raised the bar to a whole new level the Encore took it even higher! The rooms were even nicer! Larger and more amenities. It is the place to stay when visiting Las Vegas. ...without a doubt the nicest hotel on the strip! Do yourself a favor and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nina H
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and 8 others stayed for a week in the encore and I cannot find one fault with them. Two of the couples had standard rooms and the rest of us had suites and the upgraded the other two as soon as they realised we were all together without us even asking. I would not stay anywhere else in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Encore is a Wynn...”
Reviews.Author: brian m
Reviews.Content: We went out to Vegas for three nights (which is more than enough for anyone) and we stayed at Encore. It is a very nice place - great restaurants and nightclubs - clean rooms and a friendly staff. Now the place is huge and the casino's always get me turned around, but after you get the lay of the land it is easy enough to find your way. We have stayed at most every hotel on the strip and the Encore is an older, more sedate crowd...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Make sure you visit the spa.”
Reviews.Author: rbach
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The spa is really special. Rooms are huge. Makes you really feel like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: phillytraveler71
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at a Wynn property. We stayed in a suite by booking an online special, and the room and the amenities were spectacular throughout. But the fees at the edges will just make you groan -- a $25/day resort fee to use the phones, wifi and the gym, $40/pp breakfast buffet, and a trip to the gift shop for snacks running you up to $50. It's probably no headline that a Strip resort will take its nickels and dimes whenever it can, but buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “High End Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyaway2day2011
Reviews.Content: Third stay at the Encore- by far the most upscale patrons in Las Vegas. A few problems with some of the restaurants in the hotel but it's still one of the best

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Spot”
Reviews.Author: Diane844
Reviews.Content: Gal's get-away weekend! Encore was very nice. Concierge staff very helpful. We had beautiful and large adjoining rooms so it was PERFECT for 6 of us. Nice L shaped sofa in each room & bathrooms very well appointed. BEAUTIFUL view of golf course and "the strip".One bummer--no coffee maker in rooms or anywhere in lobby, etc. Had to go out & bring it back (found some for sale in the small cafe in the workout room)...got room service once but it was very expensive. Loved eating at La Cave and also at Wazuzu. Work out room OK. Spa looked beautiful but we didn't utilize. IF you reserve a car, make sure you find out if it will be at Encore or Wynn. I reserved a car at (what I thought) was Encore, waited in a long line only to find out that my car was at Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel, period.”
Reviews.Author: bridget1007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel frequently to Las Vegas. We almost always stay at the Wynn or Encore. The service here is impeccable. The hotel is beautiful. It is one of the only casinos in LV that does not get unbearably smoky. The waitress visits in the casino are frequent. We upgraded to a panoramic room last time. It was nice to have a view of the strip. Yes, the club music does get loud, but we are night people so it did not bother us. The room was beautiful. It is one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in. Yes, everything here is expensive. You get what you pay for. What you pay for here is excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellover13
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room - King suite. Offered us an upgrade to panoramic view for $20 extra a night but we declined since we wouldn't be in the room much. Excellent service at the front desk and valet. When my husband made a joke to the front desk whe we were checking in about bed bugs -she told us they were they had the only dog in the US that can sniff them!? Dont' know if this is true but it made him feel better. Ate breakfast at Society all three days and only one "iffy" server. Expensive but convenient. Had a massage and it was fantastic. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: tickledpink88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last August for three nights and had two rooms connecting. Very luxurious and super clean, two very important features on my list. The property is beautiful and quite small which we loved. Botero Restaurant is fantastic although as with most restaurants, the meals were humungous! The Society Cafe was also very good and we had breakfast, lunch etc there during our stay. The only thing lacking is a place to get a latte in the morning without having to go down to Wynn side or order up room service. The pools were quiet and comfortable and the girls working were sweet and attentive. The service was excellent all around from check in to check out. We had an early flight and because there were four of us with four big bags, we asked the bell desk to arrange an early cab, large enough to accommodate us (this way we didn't have to stand in line with all the drunk kids just going home from the night clubs). When we got down in the morning, no one knew anything about the request but instead of reordering one etc, they brought in their own Encore car and driver to drive us to the airport. Nice surprise and excellent service. The driver used to be Robert Goulet's private driver or something and was quite fun to listen to his stories. Long story, The Encore is fantastic, the best place to stay in Vegas. Would I return....you bet and will be there in five short days!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms but service lacking”
Reviews.Author: AZFrequent_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Our room had a great view from one of the top floors. Not as big as I expected for Vegas, about the size of Hampton Inn suite. But beautiful. However room service was horrible, spent 20 minutes on phone with them, $14 orange juice came out of a can and errors on bill took 15 minutes to sort out at check out with nobody in authority in sight !

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: ChloeEdwards
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Encore with my husband for 5 nights. I booked our trip online and got a great deal. Encore is an all suite hotel, our suite was amazing it had a fantastic view over the Las Vegas strip with a floor to ceiling window. The room was beautifully decorated in a modern and stylish way, the bed was one of the most comfortable i have ever experienced at a hotel. The bathroom was gorgeous with his and hers basins, a huge walk in shower and separate bath. Encore is linked to the Wynn hotel, and you can also use the facilities there to such as the swimming pool and casino. The casino at Encore and the Wynn are the most stunningly decorated out of all the hotels on the strip...they pure luxury. The casino has a great atmosphere and has everything you would expect from a five star hotel. I would 100% recommend booking tickets to see the show called 'La Reve' at the Wynn hotel, it was amazing and i enjoyed it more than the many cirque de soleil shows in Vegas....although these shows are great too. I would definitely stay at Encore again if we return to Vegas and would recommend it to everyone, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Edmondattorney
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several nice hotels in Vegas. The Wynn is my favorite and Encore is a close second. My only criticism, and it's not the hotel's fault, but the view from the North is construction and parking lots. We paid $20 a night extra for a view and that's what we see during daylight. When we complained the hotel took off the charges and moved us from the 51 floor to the 22nd floor, which was okay with us. Be aware that there is a $25 "club fee" a night, which some other hotels do not have.

Reviews.Title: “wow...”
Reviews.Author: dave j
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel, very very expensive tried ripping us off for a room upgrade

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter805
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend getaway and were very impressed. We thought we were going to check out the other hotels/casinos on the strip, but we had such a good time at the Wynn/Encore we only went next door to the Palazzo to see Phantom of the Opera. The casino at both is very spacious with friendly staff. Make sure you sign up for the Red Card players club; we earned 4 buffet trips in just a short period of time without gambling very much. The venue/show for Le Reve and Garth Brooks were comfortable with great sight lines to the stage/center. Other restaurants in the Wynn/Encore were excellent, if not a a little pricey. We visited their fitness area and it was clean with helpful staff and a juice bar available. Wished we had more time to try the spa! We would definitely stay again. Ask the front desk for a south/west facing room for the best views of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZMR
Reviews.Content: Great suites. Tastefully furnished. Loved it. Location is at one end of the of the strip so be prepared to walk a bit. Overall, a great resort to stay in when visiting Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, and justifiably expensive”
Reviews.Author: glewbel
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at either of the Wynn properties. Our room during CES in January was priced at almost twice what most other Vegas hotels during the same time period would have cost, but after this stay, I realized that I'll book the Wynn for CES next year. It was well worth the cost. Our room was comfortably furnished, full of "designer" accoutrements, and best of all, clean and quiet. A lot of hotels in Las Vegas have really unpleasant high noise and smoke levels in their casinos, but not the Encore. The hotel exudes "high end" and maybe their ventilation system is super-powerful. This hotel is a good choice, therefore, for people who are not comfortable with smoke or allergic to it. This is the first hotel I've found in Vegas that didn't make my hair and clothing stink. A high level of cleanliness seemed to be the rule. We were often out and about early in the morning, and Wynn staff seemed to be everywhere, vacuuming and shampooing rugs, polishing railings, etc. Our room was pretty much spotless. The restaurants in the hotel served decent large meals, though they were certainly not cheap, and the buffet was wonderful. The only negative was the rather high cost of internet access. Charges are levied per computer/device, not per room, if you don't pay the "resort fee" up front. Check on that before you decline that resort fee. It seems to be optional for some room rates. Oh, yeah, be sure to check the rather punitive prices for the minibar and snacks to avoid a really unpleasant surprise when you check out. If you need munchies, consider walking a couple of blocks to one of the nearby 24-hour markets on Las Vegas Blvd. You'll walk off some of the calories you ingest, and you'll save at least $5 on a bag of nuts.

Reviews.Title: “flawless”
Reviews.Author: buddyPhila
Reviews.Content: recently stayed at the encore on a business trip the hotel is absolutely georgeous it is smaller than Wynn but I thought it was mor elegant the rooms are all suites withl floor to ceiling windows our room was camel black and a touch of red it was perfect cant say enough good things about the property all the restaurants we tried were very good although everything in the hotel is pricey the pool was lovely Steve Wynn definitely runs a first class hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon at Encore”
Reviews.Author: Darra_83
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our late 20's early 30's who stayed at Encore in September 2011 for a week for our honeymoon in a standard Resort Suite. We requested a strip view room on check-in and got a room on the 30th floor (I think). Due to the curve of the building our room was the closest to the strip in the Resort side of the floor and we had a fantastic view down the strip including Treasure Island, Mirage and Caesars. We could watch the Mirage volcano from our room. The room was large with a comfortable couch and lovely bed. The bathroom was enormous. The pool was pretty quiet but had excellent service with waitresses constantly coming around with complimentary fruit bowls and taking drinks orders. Service was excellent and all members of staff that we dealt with, from receptionists to dealers to cleaners were all very friendly. We got turn-down service one night even though we didnt request it and then someone else tried to do it on the same night!! The room was cleaned everyday and all common areas of the hotel were very clean at all times. The casino is fairly small and quiet compared to some other resorts but the dealers were excellent. The casino is also pretty light which is a nice change from some of the dark ones elsewhere on the strip. The hotel is located to the north of the strip next door to Wynn across from Fashion Show Mall and close to Venetian/Palazzo, Treasure Island and Mirage. We had no issues with the location and could comfortably walk anywhere that we wanted to go on the strip. Although we could hear the bass from the Beach Club it didnt prevent us from sleeping at all. This hotel is easily the best hotel that I have ever stayed in and would gladly recommend it to anyone visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fivestar2
Reviews.Content: Location at lower end of strip with great views if u have panoramic suite for today's standards rooms are up to date closets are small bit you do have drawers in the room for clothes the night club xs very nice pool closed while I was there not as large as others in that aspect. Overall experience was great I'd recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great Couples Weekend At Encore”
Reviews.Author: AustinKim_10
Reviews.Content: Wow.....First time at Encore and will go back, again and again! Been to many of the Las Vegas Hotels......most of them in fact, over the past 20 years, but Encore proved to be fabulous and a great decision. Fun weekend away with 2 other couples to celebrate an Anniversary and Birthday. Coming through the front doors of Encore to a beautiful, sunlit lobby looking out to the gardens and pools was breathtaking! Decor and ambience was delightful. Front desk staff so friendly and accommodating upon a very fast check in, how refreshing! The rooms, which are all suites, are spacious and very tastefully decorated. Comfy King beds, and especially loved the button on the nightstand that opened and shut the drapes!! Awesome marble bathrooms that included robes, separate tub and shower, TV, and amenities. So many great Restaurants and bars at Encore and Wynn you never really need to leave the property! All six of us agreed..........A great place to stay while in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Service, Quite Casino”
Reviews.Author: Carguy46703
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 11:30 in the morning on my check in day and my room was ready! I wasn't sure if I would have to check my luggage at the Bell Stand and wait. I was on the 61st floor facing north on the strip. I actually like a little quiter Hotel I have stayed at the 4 Seasons at Mandalay Bay and this Hotel is just as nice. The staff in the casino was very accomedating to our group. The spa services were incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: Amanda D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Vegas marathon in early December. It is big & beautiful, like most of the Vegas flagship hotels. The customer service & food were excellent, although expensive- like everything in LV. I did appreciate that the elevators were near the entrance and not on the far side of the casino so that you had to walk through it every time you went to/from your room. Dislikes Far end of the strip & further to walk to get to everything else Room decor- a little cheesy, not my style

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel! This exemplifies a five star resort.”
Reviews.Author: JnL_McD
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! This exemplifies a five star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is perfect”
Reviews.Author: ClientServiceExpert
Reviews.Content: Great room, service, food. Can't complain about anything

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel stay in 2011”
Reviews.Author: Joseph777
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a higher end hotel in Las Vegas then try Encore. There are many high end hotels in Las Vegas but none have the Outstanding service my wife and I enjoyed at Encore. Front the front desk, to the exceptional bellman who brought us our bags to the room, to the wait staff - they we all way above par. Minus the hostess crew at La Cave but our waiter there made up for her. Enjoyed dinner at La Cave. Fun and different, small plates of food and wine flights. Good dinner but expensive at Lakeside. Faced the "Lake". Most awesome jaw dropping and exciting stage show I have ever seen at La Reve at the Wynn. Well worth the money. The buffet at the Wynn was really good if you are a buffet person, had lunch there. Upgraded my room to a tower suite on a high floor and had a killer view of the Wynn and the strip. Safe travels!

Reviews.Title: “Best 5 star hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cookieabroad
Reviews.Content: After four nights at the Four Seasons we checked into the Encore. Before we did so we checked out all the hotels on the Strip and concluded the Encore was the best. We were pleased with our selection. The Four Seasons Las Vegas is highly rated on TA so here is our comparision of the two; Landscaping Four Seasons 85% Encore 100% Arrival experience Four Seasons 60% Encore 90% Rooms Four Seasons 60% Encore 100% Restaurants Four Seasons 60% Encore 100% Ambience Four Seasons 60% Encore 100% Staff / Service Four Seasons 70% Encore 90% Overall Four Seasons 65% Encore 95%. We are happy to recommend Encore as the best five star resort in Las Vegas and definitely a better hotel for the same money as Four Seasons. Encore has squared away the details for a five star Las Vegas experience. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: TKUCH
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the amazing reviews before me, but there is a few things I would like to add. I appreciate the Printing out my boarding passes, early check in & late check out. Every time I turned around someone was there to help without being overbearing:) I have found my new place to stay when in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay Every Time”
Reviews.Author: bostonvianj
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the Encore. I have stayed at the hotel twice, most recently in October 2011, and loved each stay. The rooms themselves are beautiful, spacious and very luxurious. The service is top notch and I truly felt taken care of while at the hotel. I love Vegas for the pools, and the Encore does not disappoint. The pool scene is lovely with just the right hint of Vegas. We rented a cabana one day and loved the service. I absolutely recommend renting a cabana while you're there! I would 100% recommend the Encore to anyone traveling to Vegas. It's a great hotel with an incredible atmosphere and top notch service!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but Too Snooty”
Reviews.Author: JustMe123170
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon last July. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous as are the rooms. However, it just felt too stuffy and snooty. I would have rather saved the money and stayed somewhere a little more relaxed. Also, don't pay the extra money to stay on the higher floors. I think its like $20 a night more to stay about the 40th floor. But what they don't tell you is that there is no floors between 30 and 40.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Vegas Trip”
Reviews.Author: Foodie223
Reviews.Content: Thank you, Encore, for making my bachelorette and time with my family and friends the most amazing it could have been. Rooms were beautiful and appointed with all modern day necessities. Staff was accommodating. Pool staff was AMAZING and helped us have a wonderful time. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing elegance”
Reviews.Author: Mmichan
Reviews.Content: Everything is perfect, what you should expect from Vegas. A little expensive compared to other hotels, but it is worth it. Amazing views, ambiance is a little high end, high rollers and no young crowd, since tables are more expensive. But this place is and has the best of the best. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm at fault for being in someone elses room?”
Reviews.Author: yehfang
Reviews.Content: This is a long over due review for one incident at Encore. This occured in Spring 2010. I was there for a conference and was placed in a room facing the pool/club. I can't remember which floor I was on but I was able to hear the music outside. Not a big deal to me, it is Vegas after all. I'm the lame one that's sleeping at 11pm. At 1am someone started sliding their key card to open the door. It woke me up but I just ignored it. Drunk people... again, IT IS VEGAS. The shaking of the door and numerous attempts with the key turned into banging on the door. I just waited. At some point these guys should realize it's NOT THEIR ROOM!! The banging went on for 15 minutes with pauses in between making me believe they've left. Finally they got really loud and I got really pissed out. I looked through the peep hole and it was 4 Asian adults, sober, not drunk I oped the door (I know stupid move but I was so pissed) They looked shocked to see me and said "you're in our room" I was baffled by THAT response and said, "no, I"m in here, you're out there, this is MY room" They showed me their key card and they were right! The receptionist downstairs had written my room number on their card. Still, I don't bang at a door for 15 minutes when my key doesn't work. I go down and ask for a new one! I told them the lobby made a mistake, you'll have to ask them for a different room. They couldn't understand, so I stood there explaining how an error has been made and just go downstairs. I proceeded to close the door then the guy tried to push it open. That freaked me out, I quickly slammed it and called the lobby. What the hell did that guy think he was going to accopmlish by entering an occupied room at 1am? Now, this is the part that pissed me off. I call the lobby telling them that a stranger banged on my door for 15 minutes because they gave them the wrong room number and that put me in danger. The response was this, "oh, did you get their name?" That further confused my 1AM brain. "no I didn't" Encore "ok" Click. WTF!! this is the service at Encore?

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: marcs1Nyc_Ny
Reviews.Content: Checked in on 10:00AM (MST) on Thursday, January 18 and the room was ready. We "settled" for a room on the twenty-fifth floor which had a view of both the Strip, the pool area and the golf course through the floor to ceiling windows. The room itself was terrific. We entered into a foyer with the spacious bathroom on our right and further on was a closet. Past the closet was the a dresser on the left and the king bed with four pillows was on the right. The room is divided by a low wall on which rested a large Hi-Def TV that swiveled. Past the TV is the rest of the room which had a couch, table and chairs. Next to the bed is a remote control to handle the two sets of window treatments and the lights. The bedding is wonderful. Only have praise for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Palatial Experience”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelRod
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Wynn twice and at Encore twice in the past 2 years, so this review is from that perspective. The advantage of Encore is its simply a wonderful room experience. Encore is a true suite experience with awesome views of the strip. The room furnishings are wonderful-yet very tasteful. The bathrooms and electric blinds will likely be favorite parts of the room for you. The common areas are fantastic and never crowded, its just a wonderful resort. Only downside is that its a way to most of the things you will want to do which end up being more often in the Wynn or at the Venetian/Palazzo. If you can get a great rate, stay at Encore and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best.”
Reviews.Author: JonnyJ1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights after our trip too California before returning to NY. It was the perfect ending to our vacation Or start!  I've stayed at nearly a dozen different hotels in Vegas  and this one is at the top of the list. Perfect room...bed,decor, bathroom, tv, floors, mirrors, lighting etc were all amazing. This is one of the best places To stay. I've always been a fan of wynns hotels and this one didn't let us down. Bartolotta  for dinner is a must if you  make arrangements for gazebo seating. I'll never forget that dinner! Expensive, but worth every penny in my eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Encore At Wynn is a beautiful and special place.”
Reviews.Author: Haggerty25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Encore At Wynn for a romantic weekend. We love going to Las Vegas, and this was the best stay yet! I just can't say how special our stay here was. There was only one small problem, we could hear the music from the pool (Beach Club) all the way up in our room. (see picture) When we go back to Las Vegas, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the New Year”
Reviews.Author: TravlinSpeecher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wynn with five high school friends in 2010 and we loved the accommodations, amenities, and location on the Strip. For this first of the year get away, a friend and I chose the Encore part of the property and loved it for the same previous reasons. Although both properties are easily connected, there is more of a clandestine feel at the Encore than at the Wynn, along with a party hard, adults only atmosphere. There were a couple of items for management attention and Matthew D. handled them marvelously. We had quite a loaded itinerary on and off the Strip during our stay and the Encore suited our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, as usual!!”
Reviews.Author: uaboater216
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th time staying here, and again it was perfect. I caught the early flight in but was still allowed to check in at 10:00 am. I booked a suite on the 62nd floor, and everything was perfect as usual!! After 7 years of staying everywhere in Vegas, I've found the last place I'll ever stay!

Reviews.Title: “Encoretastic!”
Reviews.Author: Zabza29
Reviews.Content: Having visited Vegas on number of occasions we were keen to try out the Encore and spent 7 nights in this luxurious hotel. From the moment we checked in everything was just as we expected - all good! Whilst we requested a a high room facing down the strip towards the Venetian we were given a room facing the Riveria. Still we didnt let this bother us as we did not spent on planning too much of our days in the room! The hotel and restuarants were lovely and we really enjoyed the bar overlooking the water at night with the light show and singing frog! It was nice to be able to spend time at the different pools although at times it was tricky to get some rays due to the shading of the hotels themselves. One downside was being unable to get a late checkout despite being will to pay for this. We were told we could get a shower in the spa area before leaving but when we got there they wanted to charge us $40+ each to take a shower....eh no! BTW Steve Wynn was right about the Pizza in the Wynn..it was spot on, shame it took us till the last day to get round to trying this! Looking forward to another Vegas trip already.....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome- best in town. best bet if going to a convention”
Reviews.Author: jpm
Reviews.Content: AMAZING huge rooms and a beautiful hotel- large but feels smaller than some other hotels. If you are going to a convention at LVCC this is the best place to stay- really close walk- never had to wait for a cab or shuttle bc the walk is quite reasonable. Definitely recommend Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and luxurious with everything needed at your fingertips!”
Reviews.Author: cagney37
Reviews.Content: I truly loved Encore in Vegas. Spacious, super conmfortable and bathroom as large as my own Master bath! Wonderful foyer with mirrors/closetsmon each side. Huge bathroom with separate shower and nice tub, double vanity and make up stool as well as private nessary room. Super comfortable bed with buttons to open/close sheers and/or curtains, set privacy and all lighting. Step down into large gathering area with sectional sofa and desk area complete with fax/printer. The entire wall is a window! The large TV can be viewed from the sleeping area as well as the gathering area. There's even a TV in the bathroom! It was a wonderful room to come back to while on a business trip but I will definitely return for pleasure or as a couple!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: territraveler
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of the Encore. Let me start by saying that the casino is the best on the strip! The dealers at the craps table are by far the nicest and most helpful. Not near as stuffy as the dealers at the Wynn! Now on to why I'm writing a second review. The rooms have started to go down hill. This is the second time that we had to change rooms at check in because of the very sour odor. When you get off the elevator to the rooms you are hit with the smell of old carpet. The rooms smell like sour rags! The towels are so very hard you really need to be careful that you don't rub your skin to hard and cause a rash. My husband and I took my brother there (for the first time) for his birthday and his big complaint was the smell of the towels. I think the Encore is a great property and we always have a great time, but the rooms really need to be renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Party like a crackhead”
Reviews.Author: AsISeeIt37
Reviews.Content: Planned a nice mother-daughter trip to Vegas. Usually stay at the Wynn but the prices for the Encore were much better and I like that the casino is much quieter there. Going to bed the first night at 1 AM I could hear people partying in the next room loudly, eventually they quieted or went out for the night. The sound seemed to come through the windows room to room on the 60-something floor and it was nothing I had experienced at any other Vegas hotel. At 7 AM the room that backed up to my bed (a different room) was blasting electronic dance music that I thought I was at a rave. The people were screaming and dancing and jumping on the beds. I called hotel security who quieted them briefly before they started up again. I called to complain again and was told my the operator that this is Vegas and I should expect noise. Yeah, maybe in the hallway baby, not a crackhead rave party in my room, especially not at that hour! Later that day I went to the front desk and my room was moved. First of all, the Encore is a nice, high-end hotel (for Vegas). I expect both higher-end guests and higher-end treatment. Secondly, I don't understand why I had to be inconvenienced and move when the guests on both sides of my room where clearly inappropriate. For this inconvenience the hotel gave me a $75 credit, they should've comped the room for the night or at the very least given a major upgrade when I moved. The reason I am giving the hotel 4 instead of 3 stars is that all the restaurants serve Vegan food which is delicious and a treat when you can get it without complaint in high-end restaurants. Also, the hotel and the hotel rooms are very nice. However, the management staff has a lot to learn about treating clients.

Reviews.Title: “Encore is a jackpot”
Reviews.Author: jfkdeuce
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Encore over New Year's , and had a fabulous time. The room was spacious and from the 61st floor we had a great view of the fireworks along the strip. Because of the room and all the great restaurants, shopping, night life, etc. at the Wynn /Encore, we plan to stay there every time we visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun”
Reviews.Author: Berylruth
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel in Las Vegas that is luxurious and not as large as some of the other luxury hotels then the Encore is perfect. Just across the road from the Shopping Mall. The swimming pool is great and fabulous for people watching. Need to get down early for a good position. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Las Vegas Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: smeyler
Reviews.Content: This is a great property with everything you need to enjoy a stay in Las Vegas. Rooms are extremely comfortable, with plenty of room to relax. Highlights: gym is good, pool is great, Encore Beach Club is fun but not family oriented. Dealers are much more pleasant than most other casinos and the location at the end of the strip means it can be a little quieter during very busy weekends. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Touch of Class in the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: amcsocal
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of friends having a birthday celebration in Las Vegas this past weekend. They decided to stay at one of the newest hotels in Las Vegas, the Cosmopolitan. We received a promotion at the Encore, which included an upgrade to the Resort king suite, so we opted to take advantage of it. The promo also included 2 tickets to La Reve(brilliant by the way) and complimentary buffet at the Wynn for 2(we've eaten at many buffets in Vegas, this is the best one so far. We had the lunch buffet and the champagne brunch). The reviews on here are all correct regarding the size and comfort of the rooms and beds. So, let me talk about the atmosphere of the hotel itself. We've stayed at many Las Vegas hotels during the years including Bellagio, Venetian, Mirage, TI, etc. Staying at Wynn/Encore, you definitely get a different type of atmosphere(although Bellagio has the same atmosphere as well). If you've ever been to Monte Carlo Grand Casino(in Monaco, not the Monte Carlo hotel in LV), you get the same feeling here at the Encore/Wynn . There's definitely more class with Encore than many of the hotels on the strip, without it being snobbish. The staff also treats all their guests with excellent service, from the valet, bell service, housekeeping, front desk, restaurant staff, etc, without it being too over the top. Back to my friends who did stay at the Cosmopolitan. It's a beautiful hotel, yes.. But you get a different type of people staying there compared to the Wynn/Encore. There's a couple of times, I would hear college kids running in the hallway getting drunk at the Cosmopolitan, when visiting our friends there. Wynn/Encore is definitely more refined, and I'll have to say, staying at Encore was one of the most relaxing stays we've had staying in Vegas. I'm also beginning to like the new image of Las Vegas getting more into boutique hotels, focusing on the guest, services, and uniqueness, instead of theme hotels. One negative especially for this class and type of hotel-are the abundance groups of women at night hanging out trying to get business inside the hotel, although this happens inside all of the hotels on the strip it seems(it's not like they vocally solicit business, but with the next to nothing they're wearing, it's a little obvious). But again, this is Vegas! I'm sure many others wouldn't mind it.

Reviews.Title: “one of vegas' best”
Reviews.Author: s3jwang
Reviews.Content: For someone who has been going to vegas since I was 16, it means something to say that this is my favorite hotel/casino in vegas. It's luxurious without appearing "cheesy". The size is perfect, not overwhelmingly large like many of the other vegas hotels. The crowd is generally a bit less ghetto and the the there has been some obvious care when they selected the waitresses. The suites are nicely appointed, but a bit smaller than those at Venetian. They're not great with the comps, but I guess they don't have to be since I'm sure they generally have a high occupancy rate. Encore Beach Club is fantastic, I'd definitely recommend going there, but try to reserve a space if you do.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Travelgal483
Reviews.Content: When it comes to Vegas, Steve Wynn knows how to do it right! His namesake hotels, the Wynn, and the Encore at Wynn, are a cut above the rest. My husband and I spent one of the most relaxing and luxurious weekends we've ever had in Las Vegas at the Encore. It's difficult to find reprieve in a town like Vegas, which is constantly stimulating, but the Encore manages to transport you into a different kind of Vegas. The room we stayed in was absolutely gorgeous with a view of the southern strip. Beds in Vegas are usually hard with sheets like paper, but the Encore bed was something truly to look forward to after a long day of walking and a night on the town. The staff was extremely professional and attentive and offered us a glass of champagne upon check-in...bonus! The rates are super affordable if you go during an off season, and even if you don't, the comfort, beauty and amenities make it all worth it. The Encore is the perfect combination of class and Vegas fun.

Reviews.Title: “Again! Again!”
Reviews.Author: GottaRun
Reviews.Content: Hats off to Steve Wynn for creating another masterpiece! We had visited Encore before when we saw Le Reve, gambling a little and we were urged to signup for a "Red Card,” their casino loyalty card. I wasn't too excited about the butterfly theme, which reminded me of cute 6-year-olds. However, we decided to give Encore a try, and I am so glad we did. It's everything a 5-star property should be. Superb attention to detail and a staff that seems to take pride in their job. By the end of the trip, I learned to love butterflies. Because we had a "Red Card" we were able to secure a gambler's rate for our room. By the end of our trip, the casino host surprisingly comped our room. Sweet! It pays to play and ask. I highly recommend dinner at Botero and splurging for a spa treatment. The spa itself is nice, but the walkway to the spa treatment rooms is not to be missed. I highly recommend making reservations before you get on the plane

Reviews.Title: “Best Suite in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: daniel f
Reviews.Content: Fabulous accommodations, gorgeous rooms and wonderful personnel. Thank you very much for an absolutely fantastic vacation. By far the best rooms on the strip I've had the pleasure to reserve. This is the ultimate in pampered luxury. Great Spa, excellant fitness center and the pool is heated comfortably. We love Wynn properties, our new 'go to' resort in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “How to do Las Vegas right: Stay at the Encore”
Reviews.Author: Neil S
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed at the Encore at the end of October. I'd been in the casino before while staying at a cheap hotel and wanted to get the full Las Vegas experience. I stayed in a standard suite, while my friends stayed up on a higher floor as a $20/night upgrade. What an amazing difference it made in how much I enjoyed my trip! The staff was friendly and accommodating, especially Joanne at the front desk. The housekeeping staff folded my discarded clothes and placed them all together. My friends, celebrating an anniversary, received a giant fruit basket and chocolates in their room. The rooms are spacious, and some have a nice southerly view of the Strip, depending on where in the hotel they are located (ask the front desk or book appropriately), with floor-to-ceiling windows. The bedroom area is separated from the living room area by a dividing wall with a rotating TV in the middle. The restaurants and especially the spa are downright opulent. Even if you are not interested in the spa services, it's worth just asking the spa staff if you can take a quick peek around the facilities to take it all in. The food is on the expensive side, but is delicious without exception. If you are on a bit of a budget, skip lunch, visit the Wynn buffet (the Wynn is connected to the Encore) at the end of lunch hours to get the lunch rate, and stay until they put out the fresh dinner entrees. Seriously, the buffet is not to be missed. I ate enough creme brulee alone to make the price of admission worth it. When my friend mentioned her food allergies to the buffet staff, one of the actual chefs came out and spent literally 15 minutes walking her through each of the dishes and telling her which ones were safe for her to eat! The Encore casino does a good job of keeping the air smelling fresh, rather than smoky. Part of the reason behind that is that it is quite a bit less crowded than other casinos - the Wynn is noticeably smokier/more crowded but still does a pretty good job. The dealers and pit staff were all friendly, and one of the supervisors recognized me instantly even though it had been over a month since my first visit. The table minimums tend to be higher than average, especially during peak hours, but $10 blackjack with decent rules (3:2 payout, surrender) is doable most of the time. The loyalty program (Red Card) is pretty weak for table game players. Unless you play slots or bet $150+/hand, don't expect much in the way of freebies. The night life is quite active at the Wynn/Encore. XS and Surrender, the two major night clubs there, attract the hottest and richest around - so be prepared to dress nice and fork out some dough if you're interested (I wasn't). On the hotel's lower floors, you'll get some bass from the clubs in your room in the wee hours - especially in the Strip view rooms. Prepare/book accordingly. There's a nice little sundries shop by the guest room elevators that sells stuff at a somewhat reasonable markup. There's also a Walgreens across the street to the north, along with a Peppermill restaurant that's not too bad if the Wynn/Encore joints give you sticker shock, plus the Fashion Show Mall with a nice food court across the pedestrian walkway over Las Vegas Blvd just outside the hotel. The location is not too bad, on the northern edge of the Strip. There are some massive empty lots to the north, where new casino construction has been halted because of the economy. There's also the Riviera, and, further north, Circus Circus (stay away) and the Stratosphere. So, basically no reason to go north - everything cool is to the south. If you're catching a show at the MGM Grand or thereabouts, you'll have a LOOOOONG walk. Take a taxi instead. In conclusion: if you've got the dollars and want to stay somewhere tasteful, this is THE place to go.

Reviews.Title: “The Encore is the best in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Lecia M
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel/casino and the staff is wonderful. Our favorite place to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: catherine f
Reviews.Content: The encore was even prettier then I imagined I had just a basic room and it was Gorgous outstanding view from a floor too roof wall too wall window. The curtains t.v and lights was all ran from the same remote the room was big with a large sitting area Gorgous bathroom. The restaurants are all 5 star I got breakfast at one place I don't remember what it was called it was inside by the pool it was delicious. I got my professional wedding pictures taking there and they were fabulous the lady don't such a good job. It had loads of gorgous designer shops to walk throu a salon that done my hair and make up.I loved this hotel and would love too go back it was so classy and feminine. First class all the way!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LopezAV7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great amenities. Stayed here fore three nights and enjoyed every one. The hotel is beautiful and staff was great. The room was spacious and had a great view of the strip. The hotel and casino were nice however I preferred gambling at the Wynn. Wife went to their spa and enjoyed her visit. Fantastic buffet at the Wynn...best on the strip. Wish this was located more centrally on the strip however would definitely love stay again.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS !!”
Reviews.Author: Cherie A
Reviews.Content: Everything was fabulous. We so appreciate the attention to each and EVERY detail. The staff, the air quality and aestetics ~ Every detail was superb.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Vegas - LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Larissa G
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas and I am so glad we stayed at Encore. Everything was super nice, clean and the staff was very professional, friendly and helpful. Their casino is one of the nicest ones on the strip. Sign up for a red card - we always get deals emailed to us now that are really good.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a RockSTAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: EMILYRODNY
Reviews.Content: Simply put, the Encore at the Wynn is amazing! Clear superior rooms with amazing bedding, flat screen TV and a bathroom straight out of the movies including a television. Spring for the extra money to stay in the amazing hotel. The pool is beautiful and the casino is a bit quieter on the Encore side. The clubs are awesome ( buy tickets in advance from concierge). All resturaunts were great - Switch is something you can skip on!! A +++ PLUS PLUS PLUS rating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly beautiful, pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: Susiepoosy1003
Reviews.Content: We travelled here for our 10th wedding Anniversary in late October 2011. The Encore is at the far end of the strip and in my opinion quiet for Las Vegas!! Saying this we were on the 60th floor, with an amazing room with a floor to ceiling window with a view of the strip, a beautiful golf course and the airport!! This hotel has top class shops a great casino and nightclubs that are out of this world. Warning to not stay in a high floor if you have vertigo as it is VERY high!! The room has a fair sized wardrobe, big bathroom, office/sitting room area and a beautiful bed. There is no getting away from the TV as there is a fair sized one in the main room and one in the bathroom!! This was our first visit to Las Vegas and we would go back in a heartbeat...not seen other rooms at other hotels but would definately stay here again. It was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Agligs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful. The attention to detail is what I love in every aspect of the hotel. No detail is left out, service was wonderful and the staff is so friendly. There is a lot of amazing places to eat. Shopping area is a little excessive, but so is Vegas. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy_needs_RandR
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Las Vegas, and both times I stayed at the Encore for a conference. At first I was overwhelmed by all the red decor in the common areas, but I got to where I really loved the bold colors. The casino has to be one of the nicest on the Strip, with its high ceilings, space between tables, not smoky, etc. The dealers and bartenders were all helpful, friendly, and fun. The rooms are very large and nice, with comfortable bed and linens. The best part was the enormous bathroom, which made me want to remodel my bathroom at home! My only complaint is it was a long haul to walk to the classes in the conference area. Each day when we would return to the lobby area after the conference and see the signature red carpet with butterflies I said "Ahh, home sweet home!" Everything in both the Encore and Wynn is so beautifully decorated and fun to look at. We ate at a restaurant in the Wynn that had a chandelier in each bathroom stall!!! I think I'm spoiled now and won't want to stay anyplace else on the Strip except Encore. The location isn't very central, but I didn't care since I had everything I wanted right there. Oh, and the spa is to die for - expensive but so worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great spa”
Reviews.Author: tizbiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite on a high floor, windows ceiling floor, large room. Great bathroom with shower, tv screen, bath. The beach club looks so beautiful, too bad itwas closed for the season.. The spa also is amazing, we got a couple massage and stayed just for a short time to the facilities which is bad becaus eit is worthed to stay a coupke of hours to enjoy the spotless sauna steam room jacuzzi and relax. Room service is good, for a quick bite in the hotel you have a couple of options, there is more at the Wynn, especially for breakfast. Otherwise the fancy restaurants are really good! Casino is quieter, also more expensive than other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccm21
Reviews.Content: Higher quality then some, but the higher price tag comes with it. nice decor throughout, very clean rooms and modern decor. Close to Fashion Show mall but on the Northern end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “granduer in america”
Reviews.Author: SAIMOHAN
Reviews.Content: if there is a hotel that i would go back to in vegas it is the wynn . wow what an awesome hotel ... modern , fresh , luxurious awesome in one word !!!! a new level of excellence .

Reviews.Title: “Special Memories!”
Reviews.Author: Tunaslam
Reviews.Content: My wife of 42 years. Sheryl and I had the most wonderful time this weekend at the Encore. The elegance was beyond expectations, the experience a memory forever. The room and view was spectacular. The show, Reve, the Dream a special treat, with spectacular performances by well trained gymnastic athletes and swimmers, with a little magic thrown in, and lots of special effects. We enjoyed immensely both the breakfast and dinner buffet. You could add champange or all you can drink Bloody Mary's with an added $10 each cost for breakfast. Plenty of choices, with our favorite Lox and Bagel, choose your own omelettes, a plethora of seafood, with the most popular being snow crab. All the regular meats of bacon and sausage, plus meat balls, prime rib, turkey, ham, etc. Dinner had added seasfood selections, with Oysters Rockefellar, Lobster Bisque soup, clams, mussels, Mako shark, salmon mousse, etc. We especially enjoyed the Rack of Lamb chops, brasied beef ribs, and veal ribs, and many more items. The Prime Rib was tender and tasty as it gets. The desert selection was all you could ask for including hot crepes filled with your favorite fruits. Also they served a great Caesars Salad. We felt like privileged guests, and hope we get to share another wonderful experience at this resort, perhaps in the late sping, summer or fall with warmer weather, because the pools looked so inviting! Landscaping and Decor were unreal! Can't thank the marketing staff enough for the incredible offer made to us, and our good fortune to be able to accept the opportunity. Cory Visser

Reviews.Title: “Amazing sheets!”
Reviews.Author: timskim
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, just stayed one night to see Garth Brooks. Bathroom was huge..bigger than my kitchen..lol check in clerk was wonderful and tipped us off that if we chose a room overlooking the strip it could be noisy (35 floors up?) due to the clubs below..we took the mountain view..very pretty. Staff is great, we asked one guy where we could buy some bottled water and he walked us right to the Sundries store..ok here's the stuff I didn't care for..just two..they give you soap and lotion but no shampoo..I love that stuff! Lol and the shower heads need to be updated..I'd stay there again, no sweat!!

Reviews.Title: “Passed through Encore”
Reviews.Author: Venus L
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay at this hotel but I passed through here to check it out. I met up with some friends here and a VERY RUDE employee of Encore just blatantly yelled at us, "MOVE IT! YOU CAN'T STAND HERE" WOW seriously!? This experience represented your property terribly. Why would you hire such rude employees in the hotel business?! What ever happened to "customers first" in the hospitality industry?! There's a much more appropriate way to tell people that they can't stand somewhere, Encore and that is "Excuse me miss, sorry but people aren't allowed to stand here because ____." I was seriously so shocked I didn't know how to react to that employee. A bit of advice Encore, work on customer service if you want to be top in the hospitality industry. Highly doubt I would ever want to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: stephrn01
Reviews.Content: I've been to vegas twice, the 1st time I stayed in a celebrity suite at MGM, the 2nd time encore. NO comparison! Encore is pure luxury from the moment that you walk in. Everything and everyone was wonderful from room service to housekeeping. I will be back and there is no other option but encore for me!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but still disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Martin G
Reviews.Content: First let me tell you that the hotel isnt bad as such. The rooms are nice, the SPA is very nice and everything is still looking quite new. But when we decided to book the most expensive hotel on the strip which only offered "Suites", we were thinking of something else. The rooms are by no means "Suites" as they call them. I have stayed at the Palms and the Venetian before and both have bigger regular rooms than the "Suites" at the Encore. Also there is an air condition in the mirror on the side of the room which cannot be turned off. The main AC can be turned off but this one not. And I even heard voices through this one, and no, I am not mental. lol Also the windows dont seem to be very well isolated. You can hear traffic outside, although we were in the 25th floor. What was especially bad was, that while checking in we had to pay another extra $20 per day (the room was prepaid already) for services such as internet and free long distance calls. I think such amenities should be included in the most expensive resort on the strip. As for the SPA, as I already said it is very nice with several pools, showers, steam bath and sauna. But for $40 extra per day it better be. I have stayed in many 5 Stars resorts around the globe and most of them had one thing in common. They were special. In a good way. Encore is not special. Its not better than any of the other resorts I have been in Vegas. So I dont think the higher price is justified and therefore cannot recommend it. I would not stay here again for the price they are asking. Its just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A bit over the top--but that's why you visit Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: Here on a business trip and was blessed with the luck of getting a last minute room booked at this location. Everything was perfect! The staff was very helpful, the rooms immaculate, and the location near the strip perfect. The amenities were a bit "over the top"--more than I would have ever needed, but sometimes that can be a nice change-correct? I will stay here again when I get back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: edfern00
Reviews.Content: Everything perfect. Service, cleanliness, room, restaurants, parking, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very prestegious hotel”
Reviews.Author: dhm444
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very large, very clean, well decorated and comfortable. This hotel had it's own Ferrari dealership right on the main floor. In its shopping complex it had a Rolex watch store, Hugo Boss, as well as many other well known designer stores. The restaurants were top notch with 12 very well known chefs on hand. On the property it also had its own golf course. I would definetly return....

Reviews.Title: “encore”
Reviews.Author: winslip33118
Reviews.Content: Stay here when we come to Vegas. Love this hotel. Service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous.”
Reviews.Author: Dasha D
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights on our honeymoon. The room was huge, good view over the strip. I think it was the comfiest bed I have ever slept in! Almost everything about the hotel was great - the casino and all the shared spaces are light and bright, and have interesting design features. At first it all feels a bit gaudy but it actually works well and feels a lot more sophisticated than other hotels on the strip. Pool is lovely too. Minor downsides - restaurants were expensive, and I don't think there was free wifi, which is usually a priority for me. But we were on our honeymoon so weren't bothered with checking emails etc. Some people might think the location (away from the centre of the strip) is a downside, but the style and service of the hotel more than make up for it. If I returned to Las Vegas, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: SarahHelen63
Reviews.Content: We have just returned form a holiday in California and we stayed in Las Vegas for 3 nights at the Encore. We were travelling with our two children - 14 & 17yrs. We chose the Encore after lots of feedback from friends and people who have stayed in LV and we were not disappointed. The Hotel is beautifully decorated throughout and the grounds/pools were immaculate. It has a slightly quieter, relaxed atmostphere than some of the mid strip hotels, but that suited us. When we checked in we were offered an upgrade for small cost, to a Panoramic room but as it was on the 60th floor (daughter not keen on lifts), we declined. We had a Queen room on the 22nd floor which was some 700+ sq ft and gorgeous. Beds were amazingly comfortable. Bathroom had good size bath, large shower with a double vanity area with all manner of extras! The complimentary silk bathrobes were so lovely to wear I was tempted to buy one! We ate at the Society Cafe which does amazing burgers and at the Wazuzu restaurant (Asian) which was also lovely. A couple of mornings we had breakfast at the buffet in the Wynn which although it was around $86 (£55) for the 4 of us - with the vast selection, high quality and 'eat as much as you like' it was still really good value! The only 'hiccup' we experienced was the noise factor from the XS nightclub (which other reviewers have commented on). The reason for this in that the DJ set is open plan to the European pool area so rooms on the lower floors over looking the pools get affected and it is loud - not only could we hear the base but every song in detail and consequently our first night was not a good one. The next morning we phoned reception and were immedaitely moved to a higher floor with out any fuss and very slick service from the bellboy. We were also given a compimentary upgrade to the Tower Suites which is located at the opposite end of the building to the European Pool area. After this we heard nothing more from the nightclub. This hasn't put us off the Encore and would definitely stay there again but we would ask for a high floor that is towards the Tower Suites end of the buiding and would advise anyone else contemplating a visit to do the same, Rooms on the opposite side of the building are not affected by the nightclub, but they do not have the views of the strip. All in all we loved the Encore. If luxury, first class service with a slightly quieter/relaxed atmosphere is your 'bag' then the Encore is defintely to be recommened!

Reviews.Title: “Encore - Upper Class!”
Reviews.Author: Dejaye
Reviews.Content: There is no doubting this is a terrific hotel with first class amenities, the standard room is fantastic with great space, decor and facilites. The service we recieved was first class, from the moment we checked in, inlcuding all the restaurants, concierge service and casino (you can use all the amenities in the Wynn as well) The pools are fantastic for lazing around, and the location is towards the end of the strip so it feels a little more peaceful than some of the others, but here lays your decision depending on what you want from your trip. If we were to return, having looked about the Strip and other hotels if you are going to Vegas and you want to be in the thick of it all I'd choose another hotel next time like the Aria, Cosmopolitan or Venetian, they seem to be more lively, more fun and a little more relaxed.
