There are loads of great places to eat, two that I'd recommend would be the The Sugar Factory if you want a bite during the day, and The Eiffel Tower restaurant overlooking the Ballagio Fountains for something a little more special. I wouldn't worry about bookng airport transfers unless you want to travel in a Limo as airport taxis are plentiful & reasonably priced. The resort fee felt unneccesary considering the price we paid for the holiday and some hotels are now waiving this additional expense. One word of warning - your room key is also a charge card for the Hotel Casino! Clever but dangerous, especially when checking out! :o) To conclude, if you choose The Encore you won't be disappointed if you want that 'Upper Class' Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: maya d
Reviews.Content: This resort is part of the Wynn Las vegas. Amazing room/suite with wonderful view overlooking the Las Vegas Boulevard. Very clean and modern. Good restaurants. we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Amp_98
Reviews.Content: This is a great 5 star hotel. We stayed over Christmas and was not disappointed. I have stayed at many of the hotels in Vegas over the years and the Encore is by far the best. I do not think I have been in a cleaner and more quiet hotel. Some of this may be do to the Holidays, but we walked the strip and it was still very crowded. The great thing about the Encore is that you can still get the Vegas feel without the Vegas crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Steve Wynn doesn't give a poop”
Reviews.Author: johnnyboy02
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Encore over the last few years and sadly our last. What was once a clean, sleek room overlooking the strip is now tired and with major signs of neglect. Our bathroom had some kind of fecal material on the wall. When we brought this to the attention of the conceirge they assured us someone would be up to clean the room properly. Sadly in our 3 day stay this problem ( everytime you used the bathroom it was there stairing you in the face) was never addressed. So I guess Steve Wynn really doesn't give a poop. Ps the food by the pool is really terrible.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: stuartwa
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days in Las Vegas, staying at Encore at Wynn. Deciding to stay at this resort was the best decision! I have had the good fortune of staying in some pretty amazing hotels around the world (Hotel de Paris in Monaco, The Ritz Carlton NYC etc...) and I can honestly say the Encore is the best yet! The two resorts (Wynn and Encore) are joined by shopping strips, and both are immaculate! The staff are fantastic; so friendly and helpful without being over the top. The restaurants and bars are plentiful with loads of variety; Terrace Point cafe had the perfect selection of breakfast choices (try the buttermilk pancakes!!), the Loby Bar at Encore is nice, and makes a bloody great martini (also, try the calamari here!!), Zoozacrackers make awesome deli sandwiches, and there is a pretty impressive looking buffet (if thats your thing). The two casinos are nice as well; my preference was the Encore casino, as it felt more calm and a little bit more high-end!! The room... WOW! We upgraded at check in to a Panoramic King Suite on the 59th floor for only $30 extra. The view was to die for, looking down over the strip. The bed is quite possibly the best feature of the room, and the bathroom was enormous! What surprised me the most about the room was how quiet it was! I was worried about noise from the clubs (having read other reviews) but we heard NOTHING. Not sure what rooms further down can hear, but for $30 extra a night it was nice to have that oasis of calm to come back to at the end of a busy day in LV! Having walked around and visited nearly all the main hotels in LV, I am 110% sure we made the best decision by staying at Encore. A lot of the other hotels and casinos were a bit rough around the edges, full of people (and screaming kids!), smoke (yuck!!) and noise. It might be a bit more a night to spend, but if you want a nice, relaxing, safe, friendly and clean place to lay your head after a hectic day in LV, you can go wrong with Encore! Also, try and see Le Reve - jaw dropping stuff!! One of the best shows I have ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “Second time around was a let down”
Reviews.Author: kiki7
Reviews.Content: This is my second time visiting Vegas and since I had such a great experience at the Encore at Wynn the first time I thought why should I stay anywhere else!? As per my previous review there are somethings that cannot be messed up regardless of how much they try...the room size, location, views, pools etc are just as amazing as they were the last time we stayed here. Unfortunately, there were issue this time around! When checking in they had us down for the wrong room type, which they seemed to be able to fix. The problems occurred with the room itself! When checking in I let the hotel know that the mini bar was half empty, they reassured me that although the mini bars are not always restocked, they are billed so I would not be charged upon check out. I even spoke to the manager about this issue at one point due to a phone issue we also had with the room. When check out time came I had over $100.00 dollars billed to me for mini-bar charges that were not mine. When I pointed this out the clerk at check out was rude and non-responsive but did remove the charges. An apology or some recognition of their error would have been appreciated NOT attitude! Though I was there on a family vacation I did have to take a business call....the first day I tried to take this call the phone did NOT work! I was able to call into the conference call but they were not able to hear me! When I let the front desk know they assured us they would fix it in time for my rescheduled call. Once again the phone did not work! When I explained the the front desk and manager about our problems they did give us a credit for buffet but honestly for the inconvenience and rudeness i experienced later on at check out it was not worth it! Despite all this I have to point out that the concierge was amazingly helpful. The hotel is new and rooms are amazing and the casinos are light and bright and amazingly well ventilated! But I do fear that all the personalized service and attention to detail are falling to the side in the midst of what are guaranteed customers! Would I stay there again? Yes, but to be honest if things happened the same way this time I would change hotels mid stay!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisitely beautiful, well appointed hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Antera_309
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 2 nights in a "Resort Suite King" room on the 52nd floor of this absolutely gorgeous hotel as part of a 7 day break. The room was spacious, clean and very well appointed. It felt so light and airy, with a massive one-piece floor-to ceiling window and had distinct bedroom and living room/office areas. Patrons at the Encore can use Hotel facilities at the adjoining Wynn. Facilities in both buildings are beautifully appointed and everything is gorgeous to look at and obviously very expensive. No plastic plants here! The beautiful spa at the Encore and EAMAYL buffet restaurant at the Wynn, with a dazzling choice of international food for $24pp, are both must-visits. Also, check out the artificial lake & waterfall (a great place for photos!), onsite Ferarri dealership, lavish pool area and incredibly luxurious convention center. All the bars and a-la-carte restaurants are crazy expensive, as you would expect in a high-end Las Vegas hotel. Worth it for the environment though. A $20 per day per room resort fee covers use of the gym and high speed wi-fi Internet access. We were offered an upgrade from our north-facing (mountain view) suite to a south-facing (overlooking the strip) suite for another $30 per day. We didn't take them up on the offer as we planned to spend so little time in the room (and we didn't) but be aware that the north side overlooks a large building site, two new resort hotels that have apparently been abanadoned mid-construction due to the economic downturn. As we went at a very quiet time of year, we did not experience any problems with noise. Couldn't fault the service either. Location was at the far north end of the strip. Venetian, Palazzo, Treasure Island, Mirage and the Fashion Show Mall were all walkable. Paris, CP, Bellagio & Flamingo were a 5 minute taxi ride... City Center, MGM Grand, Mandalay bay, Excalibur, Luxor are a 10-15 minute cab ride away.. Overall I can highly recommend the Encore. Beautiful rooms and a beautiful hotel, with all the facilities you would expect and more. Encore really had that luxurious "5 star" feel. I would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY IF YOU WANT TO SPLURGE AND NOT BE IN THE MIDDLE OF HECTIC L.V. STRIP”
Reviews.Author: tvlbuddy
Reviews.Content: The Encore and companion Wynn is an elegant hotel/casino, but not as crowded as some of the strip hotels. The restaurants are excellent at the high end, but lacking at the "grab a bite" range. You can "dine", but no place to "eat." Service is excellent at all levels, and the rooms are extra large (we had a resort king suite), and it is possible for one person to read in the sitting area while the other sleeps.The spa is just as elegant with the latest exercise equipment. Right across the street from the big strip mall. Don't expect to "win" at the Wynn casino, and the poker room sucks--unless all you like is no limit games. Orleans still has the best live poker. The $20.00 "resort fee" includes internet and admission to the exercise facility- but NOT the spa ($40.00 extra, so get a 160. massage and its "included").

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend part of your life at...”
Reviews.Author: Herb P
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed Encore very much. We celebrated our 30th anniversary. Food was great. Service was great. Our guests had a wonderful time. There is nothing better then spending part of your life at Encore Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: travelpro2007
Reviews.Content: The Encore and the Wynn complex is the best place to stay in all of Vegas. (Palazzo comes close). After trying practically all the upscale hotels the Encore provides the best friendly service, ease, restaurants, entertainment. The Lakeside Restaurant is very very good. The entertainment on the lake every 30 minutes is original and very enjoyable. La Reve is not to be missed. All the restaurants are excellent. Rooms are large, well appointed and clean. My only complaint is the casino area allows smoking. That may be desirable for some, but as a non smoker I stayed away from that casino.

Reviews.Title: “More nicely appointed version of Wynn”
Reviews.Author: AmanJunkieBoston
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a bit smaller than I was envisioning, but the view of the strip is to die for (not obstructed like at the Wynn). The rooms are very nicely appointed, and newer than the Wynn. Yet, you have access to all the wonderful shops and restaurants at the Wynn. The service in the Tower Suites was good, and everything was simply very comfortable. Easy to get in/out, unlike some of the other casinos, as well. Recommend among Vegas hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A True Las Vegas Resort”
Reviews.Author: toyee
Reviews.Content: I am a Vegas veteran and have stayed at pretty much every hotel on the strip - from the Bellagio to the Flamingo. Indeed, this was a return trip to the Wynn/Encore. Encore offered a great weekend deal that happened to fall on my birthday, so how could I resist? FIrst off, the front desk made the extra effort to place me and my friend in rooms across from each other. We spent nearly the entire weekend at the resort - from the La Reve show, Botero, the pool, the buffet, the nightclub and of course, the casino. So if you are looking for a true "resort," then this is your place. I also recommend staying at Encore over Wynn only because it is less crowded. With regards to the rooms, you will not find a better room anywhere. And I mean anywhere. I've stayed in hotels across the world and Encore's room was the most impressive hands down. The "basic" room is about 700 square feet. No that is not a typo. That's the size of a decently sized one bedroom apartment! All rooms are "suites." Everything in the room exudes absolute luxury - from the designer L couch that provides a nice and comfortable alternative seating area/living room to the marble encased bathroom. I have one warning. Make sure you stay in a high floor room. This is a must. It's not the road noise that will wake you up. It's the bass from the nightclub. We were on floor 8 because we wanted two rooms next to each other. That was not high enough to avoid the beat of the club.

Reviews.Title: “Vegan dining is a dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: MrsGee316
Reviews.Content: We love the Encore and can't wait to return. Every single staff person we had contact with was exceptionally friendly. The property is beautiful. The dining is all excellent. I eat a vegan diet so the Wynn and Encore restaurants with the numerous gourmet vegan dishes are like a dream come true.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel - best one on the strip”
Reviews.Author: croyox
Reviews.Content: We cannot fault this hotel. We went there for our honeymoon and were upgraded to a lovely suite overlooking the strip on 54th floor. The staff are extremely helpful - unlike the Bellagio which is strange given that they are owned by the same person. The casinos are extremely clean and you cannot smell any smoke. Definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Encore surpassed expectations”
Reviews.Author: AitchHW
Reviews.Content: The Encore at Wynn was excellent in every way. Rooms extremely luxurious with no trouble from noise (unlike that indicated in previous reviews). All hotel staff were very helpful and pleasant and responded quickly to every request. The Encore is a quiet haven from the frantic pace of the Strip. I cannot imagine staying anywhere else in Vegas on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3seasonedtravelers
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our trip to Las Vegas. We loved the Encore!!! The hotel was so clean, the service was very personable. It wasn't crowded and smoky in the casino like the other hotels. The dining at both Encore and Wynn was exceptional. It may be a bit more pricey than the other hotels, but it was definitely worth it. If you want a clean upscale hotel then look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this World!”
Reviews.Author: SummerGirl55_9
Reviews.Content: The Encore at Wynn is one of the most amazing hotels i have ever stayed in! The whole hotel is basically out of this world, the rooms are amazing fully equipped with remote controlled curtains, TV in the bathroom, power shower, bath tub, seperate living and bedroom and not to mention the most amazing views of Las Vegas. If you do stay at this hotel though be ready for high prices for everything and get ready to lose lots of money in the casinos!!

Reviews.Title: “Encore WOW !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: debRenton
Reviews.Content: All I can say is from the time we stepped out of the taxi to check in we were treated so well, and felt so special because of this. Everyone was so helpful and knowlegable.The room we had was beyond fantastic. The birthday we were there to celebrate was made so much more special because of the Encore experience we had.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Monkey56
Reviews.Content: WOW! What can I say, what a fantastic hotel. Room: beautiful hotel room with a well appointed bathroom. Plenty of space. Loved the automatic windows. We also had a great view of the golf course and the Wynn Hotel. Restaurants: we ate at Café Society several times for breakfast and lunch and had wonderful service and great menu selections. There were plenty of dining & bar options to choose from also. Pool: my only compliant about the pool area was that it took forever to get a drink, there really needs to be more people serving. During our visit to Las Vegas we spent 4 nights at Caesars Palace and 3 nights at the Wynn Encore, since we wanted to break up our 7 night stay. Both hotels were very different, Caesar’s the bigger theme style Vegas hotel compared to the Wynn Encore also big but still managing to provide a more intimate feel with a very elegant style and a relaxing place to stay. The Wynn Encore compared to Caesars was a little bit out from the main part of the strip but that does provide its benefits. Overall I would have no hesitation recommending the Wynn Encore – loved it!

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE Room”
Reviews.Author: PucksterColorado
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many of the Vegas hotels (Cosmopolitan, Mirage), but this is by far my favorite. It's big (of course) but still manageable. When you check in you're just across a hall from a pool, which you can see through big windows. The elevators to the rooms are just around one bar area... not the full-walk-though-our-casino-first hike that many hotels have. And the room: Oh My Gosh. We opted for a panoramic view and it was unbelievable. It was also huge, with a big couch/sitting area, lovely large bath area, desk and probably the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. If you're a shopper, the great mall is just across the street, as a bonus. I now have a favorite Vegas hotel: Encore. The Wynn is good, too, but more massive so I'd still opt for the Encore over it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sticklegs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this fabulous hotel for 7 glorious nights. When we checked in we did the $20 trick by putting $20 in each of our passports. I then asked if there were any upgrades. The receptionist gave us the money back and said she would see. If she could find something suitable for us we could give her back the money. She gave us a beautiful King suite on the 55th floor overlooking downtown. We gave her the $40 and thanked her./ It did not matter that we didn't have a strip view as we have been several times to the Bellagio and have always had a view of the fountains and strip. The room was beautiful. Bathroom had twin sinks, lovely deep tub and a terrific separate shower. The toilet was also separate. There was a t.v. in the bathroom which was great and worked perfectly. The bed and pillows were the best we have ever slept in. Shame we couldn't bring a pillow home in our suitcase!! Housekeeping was very thorough always leaving plenty of toiletries and extra towels. I put $5 each morning on the bedside table marked "for housekeeping". The Lobby Bar and Cafe near the elevators was great for a quick breakfast, although twice we had the Wynn buffet. The best buffet in Vegas by our reckoning. Forgot to mention that when we checked in we were given a $100 resort credit which was a bonus. We enjoyed walking from the Encore through to the Wynn and then crossing the road to the Venetian. The Fashion Show Mall was also across the road from the hotel, about a 10 minute walk. Great shopping, plenty of shops and stores. The hotel itself has a sense of calm about it and was great to come back to after spending the day out. We have been to Vegas many times and have stayed in a lot of different hotels. This hotel surpasses all of them and we would only come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clearly the best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HugoSmith8
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Las Vegas and having explored all the other hotels in the vicinity whilst there, I can confirm that this is in fact the best hotel in the area. My husband and I had a few teething problems upon arrival ranging from slow check-in service, (we arrived on a Saturday which is considered to be a popular day to arrive hence the delays), to concierge blunders; they sent my son to the Business Centre to buy tickets for a show when there is a dedicated area for this type of activity next to the hotel Theatre! Obviously, the young man at the Concierge desk had no idea of it within his own hotel! Having complained, we were offered a most generous upgrade to the Tower Suites, which we gratefully accepted. We often travel abroad to 5 star hotels but this was an experience to remember. The standard of accommodation was superior to any of the finest hotels in the UK and the service offered is equally superb. Food is expensive but this is to be expected in a hotel such as this. The cleanliness is of the highest standard and the spa is unique. You pay extra for the latter as you do for the gym but the fee is not outrageous. All the above contributed to an excellent break and we hope to visit again soon. This is the place to come if you want to spend your time in a sophisticated environment where the casino is discreet, the shops welcoming and the staff very keen to oblige. They need to train their desk staff a little better but the spirit of the management team is very refreshing. They are courteous and generous to a fault. Many thanks, chaps. You are doing a sterling job!

Reviews.Title: “Best on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Joni15
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Vegas many times; this is the first time we've stayed at the Encore, and not the last. Location is perfect for us - across from Fashion Mall, not far from Palazzo and Caesar's. All the restaurants and shops we like are nearby. When we checked in we receieved a complimentary room upgrade to a King Panaramic suite - absolutely gorgeous room. Looks exactly like the pics on the website - what you see is what you get. Too top off our stay, we even received a $100 resort credit at either the Wynn or Encore. $100 does not get you far; but did pay for a couple of drinks! Housekeeping is top-notch. The Encore totally exceeded our expectations. We will only stay at Wynn properties on our future trips to Vegas. Amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “great great hotel, average service but is Vegas don't expect great service there.”
Reviews.Author: cx123
Reviews.Content: great great hotel, average service but is Vegas don't expect great service there. the spa is amaizing, also Vegas size great restaurants and club, Wynn siter hotel awesome too enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: NiuSi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to do something fun for our fifth wedding anniversary, and by pure coincidence Wynn/Encore resort sent us promotional letter with great room rates just in time for us to act on it. Upon arrival we had a chance to upgrade and got a spacious, contemporary, super clean suite on top floor with huge floor-to-ceiling windows and breathtaking view of the strip; definitely worth paying a bit extra. The entire Wynn/Encore resort is beautiful and refreshing with sunning details throughout. We enjoyed the casino, swimming pools, elegant restaurants and the scrumptious buffet. We loved it all!! We also received free tickets for Le Reve which was mesmerizing- a must see show. We highly recommend this upscale hotel for anyone who wants/needs some luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: bobcarter55
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Encore via airport shuttle for a three night stay commencing December 9th. Arrival time was about 1 pm with the reception desk being staffed with 4 very welcoming employees. There was one couple ahead of us and nobody behind us so check in was very check. Our luggage was already taken from the arrival area by the bell captain's team. Room would be available for occupancy at 3pm (normal as per Encore website). That staff would call me on my cellular phone to let me know when we could pick up the keys. The also made sure you understood the policy on the resort fee, room refrigerator and room snacks. (Check the Encore website for FAQ's). Off to the casino. Plenty of multi-denomination slot machines with various max plays. Table minimums of $10 (but that could go up based up time of day and level of crowd. The casino is smaller that the Wynn's but it is also less hectic and noisy. We learned Pai Gow poker and the dealers were all friendly, conversant, and professional. Their bosses always came by to thank us for coming to the Encore. What a fantastic experience. Time to go to the room. We were there during the National Finals Rodeo so our request for an upgrade was out of the question, but be sure to ask. I did request a room away from the club. Our room was on the 16th floor on the side of downtown (same side as entry way). The room was located near the end of the hallway, but the walk didn't take long at all. Not a very long trek. The ice machine was located nearby. Elevators to the guest rooms are near the check in desk, but in a small hallway that the hotel makes you show your Encore room key to take an elevator during evening hours. It's nice the elevators don't open up to the casino and you don't have to walk through the casino. Very nice. Descriptions of the rooms have been posted before so I'll just describe some small things. The hallway and bathroom have marble floors. Bring something to wear on your feet if you don't want them to get too cold when in the room. Night lights available in the bathroom (nice and unobtrusive). The towels are big and nicely appointed, but not too fluffy. The bathrobes are big, comfortable and very absorbent. We brought a single cup heater for coffee and tea (see Encore FAQ's regarding coffee makers) and we brought our own snacks purchased offsite so room service prices were not a concern. (See Encore FAQ's for menus, etc, regarding your room). We had neighbors but we never heard door closings, conversations, or traffic to the ice machine. The room was spotless and in good working order. No calls to fix/replace or clean anything were ever needed. The room was service about 2 to 3 pm but we were out of the room so it wasn't a concern. The closed was big enough to stow everything and included a small set of drawers, iron and ironing board, safe, pillow and extra blanket. The wall safe is very easy to program, but it is wall mounted so it has about 1 foot of height and only about 5 inches of depth. All in all the trip was fantastic. No gripes, hidden surprises or anything else. We did our homework before we arrived and enjoyed our stay. Now, if the casino sends us another special like this year we will definitely be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: erdincbektas
Reviews.Content: ı stayed 5 days between 24 th - 28th of November 2011. Hospitalty is in their nature. Rooms were super clean, comfortable and well furnished. I like every details of the hotel. Best Club XS is in the hotel and also the best restaurants, and also ı had great time in open buffet breakfast with a wide variety of selections. But the enterence of clubs should have been free of charge for the hotel guests. Normally ı never go twice to a same hotel, but ı will go for next year to encore again for seeing the pool parties. Stuff is so friendly, and experienced .

Reviews.Title: “It really is the best in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: I can't say anything more than has already been said. After staying here, staying anywhere else in Las Vegas would feel second rate.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong at the Encore!”
Reviews.Author: schayward
Reviews.Content: The Encore Las Vegas is a gorgeous hotel the embodies everything "vegas" without being gaudy. The rooms are large and beautifully decorated with floor to ceiling windows and a view of the strip or downtown. The beds are comfy with bedside controls for lights, curtains, and a privacy setting for the door. The bathrooms are spacious with a large shower and nice soaking bathtub with all the amenities you need. Some might complain that the Encore is too far at the end of the strip but it's a perfect location for shopping at Fashion Show mall right across the street. The staff is very helpful and the spa is a gorgeous destination when you want to get away from the casino seen. Wouldn't hesitate to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Dont think twice, this is THE hotel if in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SophsterBath_England
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at The Wynn last time we were in town and they were building the Encore then so we always said we'd try it next time. We found a good selection of restuarants for meals at all times of the day. The beds are fantastic, the best I've ever slept in. The rooms are bigger than the rooms in the Wynn and are sectioned so the Bedroom and lounge are seperated. As always, the bathrooms are spectacular. The only minus is that if you are coming to the hotel on foot (typically via The Venetion footbridge or The Fashion Show Mall) then it will take you a good 10 minutes from walking through the door of the hotel to reaching your room. Bearing in mind I was 14 weeks pregant at the time, if I can do it, then anyone can (ok maybe not the elderly or infirm). We were rarely in a rush so I actually enjoyed browsing in and out of shops as we meandered back to our room. I think it is this reason that the casino floor in the Encore is quieter than the one in the Wynn - something I dont have a problem with! We didnt do the nightclubs or the shows in the hotels but we enjoyed the pool and I had my haircut in the salon which was a good cut. We did not experience any problems with noise. After leaving the Encore, we stayed 2 nights at The Trump. There we stared forlornly at the Encore wishing we were still there. Nothing against The Trump, but we felt 'loved' at the Encore. Even walking through the other hotels on the Strip, we always felt that the Encore offered more and we always felt 'at home' there. I dont think we'll stay anywhere else if we come back.

Reviews.Title: “QUALITY HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: kvt01
Reviews.Content: What a treat of a hotel to stay in, the rooms were top quality and we managed to get a strip facing room. We were in Vegas for 10 days and stayed here for 5 days and in the Palazzo for the remaining five days, I have to say I was very sad to leave the Encore as it was head and shoulders above the Palazzo. The rooms were very modern and very spacious and very comfortableand would be my first choice of Hotel when I go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property & Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: breanna501
Reviews.Content: We spent the final day of a 5-day trip at Encore on an offer; our flight home was leaving at 10 p.m. so decided to book Encore for the day rather than be "homeless" for the day after checking out of Caesars and also to give us a chance to see if the Encore might go on our list for future trips. We are frequent Vegas travellers. Check-in was fast, efficient and very friendly.....we were offered an upgrade to the top floor for $20, but since we were only staying the day, declined. We were able to check in and get into the room at noon. The suite was gorgeous, elegantly and comfortably furnished. Everything was very clean, including the light coloured carpet. An afternoon nap for hubby proved the bed was also very comfy. There is one flatscreen television that can be turned so it can be viewed from the living area or bedroom. I spent a fun day in the Casino, great selection of slots though I can't say I had much luck. Casino staff are also very friendly and helpful and the drink service was quite good. We went for the buffet at the Wynn late afternoon and dinner selections were being added. This ranks among the best buffets in Vegas in our opinion and the dinner selections included Alaskan King Crab legs. We now look forward to a longer stay at Encore. Kudos Mr. Wynn and the staff of this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View even from the 6th floor”
Reviews.Author: AngieD2
Reviews.Content: This is my third trip to Vegas this year. My last stays were at New York New York and Paris. This time I was here for a medical conference. The room at the Tower Suite is by far the best I've ever been in. I especially liked the bedside console that controlled everything from the lights to the drapes with a touch of a button. I also liked the privacy button which I used quite often. The room itself was roomy and it's not just all the walled mirrors making it appear that way. The bathroom was spacious and nicely proportioned. The hotel is meticulously clean. I also like the fact that someone stands by the elevators and checks to make sure you're staying there before riding. It just made me feel secure. Location was also a plus for us. It was relatively close to a lot of shopping venues including the Grand Canal Shops and the Fashion Show Mall. Now for the cons. For an expensive hotel you would think they'd have softer towels. I mistook the bath towel as the one you placed on the floor the first night I was there only to realize that all the towels felt that hard. I was there for a conference and apparently that meant I didn't have to pay a resort fee. Thus anything extra cost money including the fitness center and internet access. Okay, I get that. The room was discounted for the conference but when I tried to call and pay for the resort fee so that everything won't be ala carte, they wouldn't let me. That meant there was a charge every 24 hours for my laptop but if I wanted to use my kindle and download a book that was another separate charge even on the same 24 hour period of time. I thought that was just ridiculous. Forget about working out. The food at the conference was mediocre. I've had better with more variety at other hotels. We ate at "Society" for lunch. Again somewhat mediocre. The fried calamari wasn't fresh and the serving portions were small but pricey. The vegetable pizza was dripping olive oil. The mac cheese bites were okay. Now, I had my 11 year old daughter with me and believe me, she's an expert on macaroni. The lobby bar overlooking the casino also served food and I did have a good Egg mozzarella and chorizo wrap there but I have a hard time paying 9 bucks for a breakfast sandwich but I hear that's typical in vegas. In conclusion, I would stay here again because I really loved the room just not the towels. If I stay for a conference, I'd ask about the resort fee before arrival. I would probably eat elsewhere though, maybe try Michael Mina's at the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Why we love the encore... and what we don't like”
Reviews.Author: therealmike
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas several times each year for business. I've stayed at a number of the hotels around the area and stayed on and off the strip. Here's why we like the Encore. Nicer than the Wynn. Seriously, the rooms are a little bigger, more contemporary and more comfortable. Wynn is nice too, but a little more old fashioned. Never a wait. Unlike most of the other Las Vegas casinos the Encore has enough staff to run the desk, valet, concierge, bell desk, etc. So you never wait long for anything. Enough elevators so you never have to wait for that either. Clean. Everything is spotless in and out of your room. They clean constantly. Quiet. Never heard a sound in my room, but I always stay on a high floor. Classy casino. Good looking crowd, everything is expensive which kind of keeps the bargain hunters away. There are cheaper buffets than the Wynn which drives away the all you can eat crowd. Tends to be very quiet on weeknights, fills up on weekends, but never too loud or nasty. Good ventilation. Good food. Not cheap but we've never had a bad meal anywhere in Wynn or Encore. What we don't like.... Temperature. All public areas are kept in the upper 70s (I'm guessing 76-78) which is way too hot for Las Vegas, but just perfect for Tokyo. I'm guessing that a good amount of business here comes from asia and that the hotel keeps things on the warm side to accommodate those travelers, who are definitely accustomed to things being a little warmer indoors. Anyway, prices are reasonable for what you get, and we like it. If you are budget minded this is not the place for you, but if you don't mind paying for quality, you'll think this place is worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Strip Views”
Reviews.Author: delfing
Reviews.Content: We asked for a room with a view on the strip and we got it, the view was great. The room was spacious and comfortable and good value for the special rate we got. Parking is no problem as the hotel offers valet and self parking, conveniently located in the same building. The check in procedure was quick and efficient, however the check-out was a nightmare with a huge queue of people shared for departures and arrivals. It took us almost 40 minutes to get to the counter! The hotel is nice with a couple of swimming pools, some restaurant, big shopping area and the casino some of which are shared with Wynn hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas great weekend.”
Reviews.Author: ossytabletennisteam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 17th - 20th Nov. 2011 Check in was quick and easy (we arrived on a Thursday), the check in looked a lot busier on the Saturday ! Upgraded to a room on the 60th floor overlooking the strip, cost was $60 for 3 nights in total. Well worth it, the views were great and the room was very quiet. No complaints about the hotel, it was off the strip but only a quick 10 - 15min walk to the strip however we always got a cab and this was only $10. Had breakfast at the Wynn buffet which was $20 which has a fantastic range that sets you up for the day. Booked a few shows before we got there which was well worth doing as the prices in Vegas were a lot more. Did not try any of the restaurants in the hotel but the bars and casino are great. If you are playing the slots or the tables drinks are free however you must tip or the waitress never appears again !! To sum up, if you want the best in Vegas you cant go far wrong with this !

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: KnoxTrouter
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Encore and it is going downhill. We arrived the day of the Las Vegas marathon. The strip was closed to all traffic and we were trying to get to the Encore from the west. After trying several avenues, we called the hotel which gave us a route which was also closed. Finally, we asked a police officer manning one of the side street roadblocks who advised us to park in the mall and walk to the hotel (1/4 to 1/2 mile including the interior of the casino) as it would be another 6 hours before we could get across Las Vegas Boulevard. This was after trying for about an hour to drive 1/4 mile. Why doesn't a hotel that purports to be as classy as the Encore notify arriving guests to expect this problem and suggest ways around it or at least warn you? The first night of our stay I woke up at 5:30 am to the smell of something burning. I turned on the lights and looked all around and couldn't see smoke or pinpoint the source. I tried to go back to sleep but the smell got worse so I turned on the lights and looked again. I still couldn't pinpoint the source and my wife and I could no longer sleep so I called the front desk, explained I smelled something burning and was told someone would be right up. No one ever showed up. In retrospect I think the smell was caused by dust in the air ducts burning in a room that had not had the heat turned on in a while, especially since it didn't happen again but for the hotel to ignore a guest who smells something burning is inexplicable. I tried to get ice a couple of times over an hour and a half from the ice machine and it was either not working or empty so I called the front desk. A bucket of ice was promptly delivered which was in line with what I have experienced in the past from this hotel and it's sister the Wynn where I have also stayed. But for the remainder of our stay, there was no ice available and I didn't bother to call any more. On another day I was away from the room most of one day and returned about 4 pm. Our room had not been cleaned but someone had left a spray bottle of a cleaning liquid on an end table and thrown a couple of clean sheets over the bed. Puzzled, I walked out into the hallway, found a member of the hotel staff who promptly arranged to have the room made up. I asked them to wait a half hour so I could shower but the door bell rang twice, once before I could even get in the shower and again while I was in the shower. On one trip to the lobby our elevator acted erratically. We got in and pushed the lobby/casino button and nothing happened. I tried it several times and with no movement, I pushed the "open door" button and we got out. I waited a while and pushed the "call" button again and the same car opened. Reluctantly we entered and pushed the lobby/casino button. A maintenance man had joined us so we felt a little more comfortable. He asked us how our stay was and we said fine. He got off 2 floors lower and then the elevator went back up to our original floor where we got off and waited quite a while before pushing the elevator call button again. On subsequent trips I realized that one of the "lobby/casino" buttons was inoperative, resulting in nothing happening unless you pushed the other button. Except for ignoring our report of the smell of something burning, these are not huge issues but cumulatively I would expect more from a hotel that likes to make itself out as one of the best on the Las Vegas strip. Clearly these maintenance and other issues are not consistent with that status.

Reviews.Title: “Not Conducive for a Good Nights Rest! Oxymoron for Vegas?”
Reviews.Author: dxrobe2
Reviews.Content: RESTAURANTS. Society Cafe is the best lunch spot. Loved it and of course the service was great. The hostesses and wait staff are great. The managers actually help out too instead of just dropping by your table to ask how things were. Wonderful experience and the menu are great and have something for everyone. The sliders of any flavor are recommended. ROOM SERVICE. Very good. Food was set up for us and presented, served and most of all warm and delicious. SPA. Simply the best compared to any around. Trust me on this one. GAMING. Tight slots. Gambled 1k on Double Diamond $1 and $5 dollar slots and Wheel of Fortune $1 and $5. The largest pay out was $20 on one spin. I am not looking to win every time but a pay out of at least $100 or $50 would have made us feel better at least once. It would have been spent back anyway. I would recommend doing your gambling elsewhere. If you are looking a good night’s rest, yes sometimes people do want to sleep in Vegas, DO NOT STAY HERE! Or request a room on the North side of the Encore. The music from the XS nightclub is ridiculous. I mean disgusting. We were on the 39th floor and could hear the thumping all night until 4am each night. The 39th floor! Called to express concern in the morning and spoke with Kirsten, as others have mentioned in their reviews and received the same lip service as they did. She is an expert at answering this complaint as she receives it often I assume. We asked to be moved to another room on the same floor but the opposite side. They couldn't accommodate our request but could have moved us to another floor on the opposite side. We had already unpacked so we asked for ear plugs instead (which were brought up) and a late checkout of 4pm the next day which they granted immediately. Sober this evening and with ear plugs, we were woken up again multiple times to the music. Shame on us we should have moved rooms even though it doesn’t make it right. I get it. It’s Vegas. Sleep at home or consume so much that you pass out or just ask for a room on the North side. However, every individual should be entitled to a good night’s rest if that is your thing or even not for that matter. I am quite disappointed with my stay because of this reason and will not be staying here again. I have received the same experiences at other hotels in Vegas (Caesars, MGM Grand, and Flamingo) and never had to listen to music until 4am each night. I am not a chronic complainer with a holier than though attitude. I am 41 year old, middle class, white collar business professional that travels for business 50 nights a year. However, I will not tolerate a poor nights rest at other hotels across the world due to hotel negligence, I shouldn’t have to accept it from a "5 Star" hotel in Vegas. Vegas shouldn’t be an excuse and tolerance for loud music interrupting your sleep. If that were case, escorts roaming in the hotel hallways should be tolerated as well, which it is not. It's Vegas right? Thanks but no thanks! Stay home, stay elsewhere or go the XS club. At least you chose to listen to the music then.

Reviews.Title: “Encore continues to surpass my expectations. Return guest, very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalSiren
Reviews.Content: The Encore staff is very responsive to guests' concerns. I arrived Nov 27, 2011 for four days and I was thrilled to be back. The first night, I had difficulty sleeping due to the noise from the elevator, and realized my king suite was too close to the elevator foyer. I called and the attendant apologized, and within a few minutes, she returned to the line to say that another suite down the hall on the 30th floor was ready for me, and had activated my room key so that I could easily relocate to a quieter suite without me having to go down to the front desk. Hassle-free. She offered up a bellman, and was very accommodating, and understanding. Encore is clean, gorgeous, and love the property, the fabulous selection of outstanding restaurants. They had their Christmas trees, poinsettias, and holiday decor set up, and is breathtakingly beautiful. A friend joined me at Encore's lounge next to the lobby and we chose to dine at Sinatra, one of the best restaurants I have experienced. The food, wine, and surroundings were sublime. Outstanding filet, and exceptional dining experience. Society was exceptional, as always, and ordered in-suite dining at 3am, after a late night downstairs. The food was fantastic, and delicious. Encore is always consistent about following up with email guest surveys to ensure that if there was anything that was not up to standard, you can advise them, and appreciate their follow-up. I had a wonderful time in Winter Wonderland Encore and I highly recommend this lavish resort. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jose S
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fantastic. breakfast was great. 2nd time this year to stay at the Encore. Location is one of the best except for taking the tram. Spa and massage great, please try. Love it, I will be back. My only problem where the concierges at the Tower suites, they where not very reliable with dinner reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary 5 star luxury at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Corinne2095
Reviews.Content: A great experience all round. I hadn't been to Vegas yet and was hesitating between the Bellagio and Wynn, ended up settling for the Wynn due to Tripadvisor reviews and the fact that good friends just had their wedding there and couldn't fault it. Neither did we... we upgraded for a very reasonable $25 to the executive suite, a top floor 1BR suite boasting the most amazing views over the Strip. Decor was sleek and contemporary; one of the reasons in fact we chose the Wynn over the Bellagio, the B's plush decor didn't really speak to me - but that's just personal taste... all the gadgets and amenities one would expect from a five star resort were there. Most importantly, it didn't feel tired like some Vegas hotels we subsequently strolled through seemed to be. Choice of restaurants and pools was great too - only regret is that we couldn't stay longer... will definitely be back next time. thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Vegas?! It is possible!”
Reviews.Author: ritchiesgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an amazing first stay at the Wynn Encore. I received a letter in the mail from the company offering a pretty amazing deal. We were upgraded to a King Suite, we got 2 Free buffets, and 2 Free tickets to Le Reve. I could write a book on each aspect of this phenominal location and the experience, but I will save everyone time. The Room: Amazing. Large, clean, beautiful floor-to-ceiling windows with a huge view. We stayed on the 32nd Floor. The bathroom has numerous ammenities, clean, very roomy. Loved the TV in there and the vanity! The Bed, oh man, the bed! That is where the relaxing came in. It is a heavly cloud of a bed with luxurious sheets and pillows. The living area was nice to have for use of the table, the couch and lounging. The hotel(s) were amazing. The Wynn is top-noch! It is clean, beautiful, and easy to get around. The two hotels, Wynn and Encore are connected by a lovely walkway that makes for an easy transition. Dinner: Boltero. Honestly the greatest steak I have ever had. Wonderful dinning experience. Nice layout, formal, beautiful lighting and then the food!!! We shared the 40oz. Porterhouse that was honestly to die for! And we have the truffle mac and cheese. Perfection! It was Thanksgiving weekend when we stayed. We arrived in mid afternoon on Thanksgiving day. Staff was very friendly, helpful and prompt. I could only dream of getting a deal like this again from the company. It was the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at in Vegas. The Room, Dinner and the show were top of the line. It was a much needed, relaxing trip to Vegas. So much fun.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views from Our suite...”
Reviews.Author: LakesMomNJ
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Las Vegas with my husband on business and stayed here for 3 days. We booked a suite and it was situated so that we could see the town laid out in front of us, but the Wynn Property blocked our view of the strip....not a bad thing actually. The hotel was very 'swanky', bathed in oriental themed lamps, flowers, rugs, furniture, chandeliers, etc, etc. If you like the color red, this is the place for you! It was all tall ceilings, opulent drapes, tassels, artwork, prints,and furniture seatings throughout. Many restaurants to choose from inside...we liked Society Cafe for breakfast. I did like that they position a staff member by the elevators to check everyone for key cards, so only guests can go upstairs. Our suite was so awesome. The bathroom was very large with two vanities, a large sit in tub and a shower with built in shelf/seat. The toilet itself had it's own little room. The closets were spacious...the bed was sumptuous and so were the linens! The suite had a terrific living area to sit down and take in the view. It was so great! Two little nit picky things...The first is, the room did not come with a coffee pot. That would be a nice touch, although I realize the casinos want you to depend upon them for your every need. This should be in all rooms! The second is the tacky note attached to the snack bar that says if you lift an item to inspect and do not put back in a 60 second time interval, you will be charged. That was a minus! (I am grateful our children were not there with us to test out this flaw....cannot imagine the bill they would have racked up!) Otherwise, I highly recommend this property. It was also nice to be away from the rest of the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: waterskirunner
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at the Ecnore Las Vegas is the last two years. I enjoyed my first stay a lot, it is definitely one of the most impressive hotels on Las Vegas Blvd. The real quality of a hotel only shows in times of complains (if justified or not) and how they deal with it. And in this regard the Encore it definitely one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in and it seems as if the General Management is in absolutely no contact with its department heads and does not control its actions afterwards in any way. What has happened? I stayed at the Encore in August 2011 for 4 nights. On the morning of the second day I placed my dirty laundry (estimated value $ 300 – one pair of jeans, one sweater and some socks) in the hotel’s laundry bag and placed that bag on my suitcase next to the trash can and to the room’s desk. After returning to our room in the afternoon, I recognized the disappearance of my laundry bag. Following my first intention I called the room service and asked them if they have taken my laundry for cleaning. But they denied and put me trough to the security department. After a while, two security ladies knocked at my door and recorded a file. I told them what has happened and they handed me out a telephone number were I should call after 7 days. I didn’t call after 7 days. 2 days later at the day of my departure I gave them a call and they told me that they were not successful in finding my laundry till now and I should call again next week. What else can you do in such a situation than to check out, continue your trip and hope for the best. But it came worse. I called the next week and after being placed on hold for a very long time they informed me that my file has been closed as my laundry was not found neither in the laundry nor anywhere else. So I asked if they have checked the video surveillance. They answer was that they can not give me any information on such details. So I asked them if there is any proof that someone has broken in my room. Again they denied to give me any information on that. So I asked to talk to the head of the security department. The head was out of office but after 2 hours I got a call back. The answer remained the same: it is not possible to get access to the video footage, they could find it and it is not their fault that my laundry disappeared.. From the perspective of the hotel guest a very unsatisfying situation. I don’t want to blame anyone but the only way it could have happened is that the housekeeping lady thought my dirty laundry to be trash and threw it away. Or, but definitely less likely, someone broke in my room and the only thing he did steal was my dirty laundry. I shared both theories with the conversational partner of the security department of the Encore – without success. However, in such a situation as a paying hotel guest you expect by far more information and cooperation by a hotel than to tell you to call them and be then left alone with the fact that the file has been closed. What I expect from a good hotel management in such a situation would at first be to go for an apology. Not the Encore. During the phone call they always emphasized that it was not their fault. Not a word of apology, not a bit of an attempt to work on a solution. The next step taken by a good management, independent of who’s right or not, would be to find a solution for the customer to compensate him for his loss. Not so the Encore. I had to ask for a compensation for my lost/stolen/disappeared clothing. They denied and said they do not compensate in cases of loss of guests property. So if things disappear from your room at the Encore, be aware of that you do not get a compensation! So I at least asked if they could offer me a discount on my next stay or what else they do suggest to offer me as compensation for my clothing. A good management would offer you a good deal and hope to keep you as a customer. A stupid management would deny any compensation. But if you really want to provoke a guest and make him write an article about his stay on tripadvisor, you gonna tell him that you can not offer him any compensation BUT would ‘try to get him a fruit basket to his room at his next stay. But you can not promise’. End of citation. Dear Management of Encore. I know that a General Manager can not be everywhere all the time. But he has to ensure a certain quality standard and coach and instruct his employees to follow certain guidelines and some kind of a company culture. If you promise best service and quality at your hotel, you also have to follow these rules regarding your complaint policy. As I still don’t know what has happened to the property that did disappear from my room and have experienced absolutely no cooperation neither regarding research nor compensation, I can not recommend to stay at the Encore Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Carli C
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed in The Encore Nov 2011 as a couple. I have stayed in 5 other hotels in Vegas but this beats them all hands down no contest. We had a fantastic strip view room on 29th floor & it was amazing! If I had to pick one tiny gripe was you could hear the noise from the Beach Club night Club but to be honest I was so tired as soon as my head hit the pillow I was out. It wasn't that bad more of a dull background beat. The staff were fantastic friendly & helpful. I have stayed in hotels where bell boy staff and taxi rank staff have been very rude about expecting the tip some even telling me the amount they expected ,I always tip but I hate when people are rude in their acceptance of a tip. But you never got that at this hotel it was a different class & when you gave tips it felt like a gratuity not a thing that was expected. The whole place was luxury an absolutely gorgeous hotel that I will be recommending to everyone! Beautiful Thank You :~)

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd visit and we loved every minute of this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: alfandrepe A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love the Encore Hotel. The rooms are top shelf. Pay the extra $ for the upgrade, you won't be sorry. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. Omg, the linens, bed and body lotion are all fab. The beautiful colors are very calming. Again, we love, love, love the Encore Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Blood on the pillow”
Reviews.Author: RodandTracey
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this trip and hotel for my 40th birthday. Upon returning from our first 'day' out on The Strip we found the dirty glasses from the night before still on the bar, no fresh glasses provided, no bottle opener for wine and BLOOD on one of our pillows!! After having to complete security forms and speak to the Assistant Manager of the hotel, we were passed off to 'Guest Claims'. We weren't claiming anything rather simply looking for an explanation and for the hotel to make things right. We received a phone call tonight after returning home from the trip. Barbara Turner from 'Guest Claims' informed us that after their 'investigation' our claim was denied. She stated that the hotel does checks and re-checks of rooms once housekeeping completes the servicing of the room to ensure quality, so the BLOOD on the pillow must of come from us....... Really? Is that how The Encore treats its patrons? Neither my wife nor I had any scratch or lesion anywhere on our bodies to transfer blood on the bedding, let alone on the end of the actual pillow (not the pillow case). If the hotel's QC is so stringent post room servicing, why were the dirty glasses still in the room; why were no clean glasses provided; why was there no corkscrew; and how did they miss the BLOOD on the pillow if the room is checked an re-checked post cleaning??? Needless to say we are pursuing legal action. Not because we want anything, simply because of how this entire ordeal was handled. In two words: Very Poorly!

Reviews.Title: “Encore an exceptional hotel - fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: TX_MC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of hotels on the strip for business over the years. I can honestly say the Wynn properties are exceptional. The physical amenities are wonderful, but the staff are truly exceptional. Well groomed, well mannered, upbeat, knowledgeable and helpful at every turn. My wife and I celebrated our 10 year wedding anniversary and it was a wonderful and amazing experience. Thanks for the memories!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Encore deserves an encore!!!”
Reviews.Author: Monique F
Reviews.Content: I really appreciate the attention paid to every detail at the Encore!! The hotel and grounds are beautiful and service is second to none!! Thanks for another wonderful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel. Best I've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Bartje83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the week before Thanksgiving in a panoramic suite on the 59th floor with Strip view. Loved everything about this place. Check-in was smooth, hardly any queues and just a short walk from the self-park. Desk attendant was friendly and arranged to give us two rooms next to each other (with a connecting door) so the place turned into one great mega-suite. The first steps in the room were amazing, the suite is very large for a hotel room and the view down the strip is absolutely amazing. Everything in the room is clean and well cared for. Everything (not just in the room but throughout the hotel and casino) seems to have some kind of texture on it, giving the room an amazingly luxury feel. Bathrooms are large and clean and come with loads of amenities. Housekeeping is great -never disturbed us and even folded dirty clothes neatly. Casino is great as well. Most table games are pretty expensive, but that was to be expected in a place like this. Drink service was very good, even at the slot machines. Tried both the Encore and Wynn pool, both are perfectly beautiful. Nice touch that the pools are accessible from the hotel room through the spa, so you don't have to walk through the casino in swimwear. Only negative: From now on, every other hotel is going to look a lot less impressive.

Reviews.Title: “STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE”
Reviews.Author: oldkansasfolks
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel!! $12 small margaritas, $18 for a pot of coffee delivered to your room, $39 Buffet, poor food, small selection, poor location for a hotel, not close to anything, valet service is great, only '1' access to valet on LVBLVD. $25 for munchies in your room if you pick it up be ready to pay. Stocked fridge with high priced beer. $20 per day resort fees that you dont find out about til you get there. Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pam P
Reviews.Content: In a city where there are many choices to indulge your senses the Encore does it with elegance and service. This is one of the few hotels with a casino where the smoking didn't bother me!! And that's saying a lot. Beauty is everywhere. Rooms are luxurious and very comfortable, breathtaking views of the mountains and city from higher floors. Located at the end of the boulevard made this resort quieter than most which I liked, and it was very easy to maneuver around in. The connection under ground to The Wynn through the shopping mall is awesome! The cleaning service, concierge, front desk,, wait staff were all very courteous and prompt. Room service was the only slow service we encountered. Our room overlooked the pool toward the strip and the only con was that we could heard the nightclub music and people yelling even from the 23rd floor. If this would keep you awake get a room facing the mountains on opposite side of hotel. We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Like the Bellagio better”
Reviews.Author: jdvmd
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is nice but considering all the rave reviews, I was rather disappointed. We paid top dollar for everything and nothing else was included like at Bellagio (we had a penthouse and they included limo transportation to and from the airport). My husband was attending a conference at the Wynn and thought we would stay at Encore. We had a Panoramic Suite on the 62nd floor. The room was fine but we never received turn down. If you move anything from the mini bar or from the tray on top of the cabinet, you will be charged if it is not replaced within 60 seconds. It seemed that no matter where we ventured out to, we walked and walked and walked. I will say the gardens were very well manicured and beautiful. Prices are high. Would rather stay at the Bellagio again.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: Lori_Ling
Reviews.Content: Ok, I stayed here awhile back, a few weeks after it first opened. I could smell it was brand new. I never posted a review, so here goes. Beautiful hotel, great service. Loved it, luxury and class. You get cleaning during the day and again at night a turn down service. Restaurants are pricey as in any high end hotel, but there is a big mall located across the street with plenty of cheap eats at the food court, and shopping if you're into it. The location is at the north end of the strip, not midstrip.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Deneen123
Reviews.Content: Repeat visit, having also stayed at NY NY and the Monte Carlo, as well as Mirage and The Nugget. Encore is hand's down the most elegant and luxurious place to stay in Vegas. When I walk in the door and indulge myself in the aroma and visual beauty, I am "home"! The service is amazing, the rooms are exquisite. Wonderful food and amazing pools. Splurge...you'll be so glad that you did!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel except for one thing!”
Reviews.Author: marylynn1966
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Encore the first week of November. I was impressed from the minute we walked through the door. Our room was STUNNING! The view on the 22nd floor overloking the strip was Amazing. The bathroomhad a flat screen TV, huge vanity area, large tub. Our beds were super comfortable, very nice sheets!! Had a L sharpe sofa too! The only negative thing I can say is we had to listen to the Disco until like 4:00am! I even asked to be as far from the Disco as possible. If I ever stayed there again I would bring earplugs! The Lobby was stunning. We had coffee and a cheese danish from the little cafe area near the lobby. It was pricy but very good! Hotel is in a Great location. Very impressed with the entire staff! My sister is VERY well traveled ( works in the travel buisness) and was very impressed!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility, but food prices were high”
Reviews.Author: michaeledwards7
Reviews.Content: The hotel and room were beautiful. The grounds, pool, restaurants were gorgeous. We really enjoyed our stay. We had a wonderful view of the golf course and the Vegas strip. However, the restaurants were ridiculously pricey. We paid $90 for breakfast. Our meal was basically a Denny's Grand Slam. It is also at one end of the Strip, so we spent a lot of time walking to the more central attractions and casinos. Overall, the hotel was modern and cool, but I wouldn't stay again due to the ridiculous cost of the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: Roolaw
Reviews.Content: In town for business, but it felt like pleasure staying at the Encore. The service was incredible from the bell hop, to the maid, to servers at the restaurants. The room was beautiful and the bathroom was very spacious. The bell hop showed me around my room and discovered that the curtains weren't working properly. He called in the service request and a technician was to my room within 5 minutes. The turn-down service was wonderful and greatly appreciated each night. The resort has everything you need, but could use a better sports bar. I had many meals at the restaurants in the resort and all were wonderful. The Country Club was a great lunch option and the Hawaiian Tuna "Salad" was fantastic. A sushi dinner at Okada was fantastic and our server did an excellent job of keeping the sushi and shashimi coming our way. The last dinner was at SW Steakhouse and it was a great last meal, besides a mixup on our sides. I had the filet and it was cooked to perfection and added the shrimp scampi (but would not do so next time). The sommelier was excellent and recommended a wonderful cabernet. I will definitely be returning to the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Weekend”
Reviews.Author: tripsters5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a kingsize suite overlooking the strip on the 50th floor, the room was pretty much perfect in every way - very spacious, beautiful furnishings, large bathroom, comfortable bed, amazing view, silent at night. The only thing I would have liked is a coffee machine, but I guess they want you to get out of the room as much as possible! The staff were very eager to please, hotel was very clean and well maintained. Although it was too cold to go in the pool, the pool areas were gorgeous, shopping was a delight (make sure you bring plenty of money, or have a big win!), restaurants were great especially Swtich. XS was a fun, lively nightclub, avoid the lines by getting a table - worth the cost if you are a large group. Can't wait to go back . . .

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe and luxury”
Reviews.Author: QuiQui12
Reviews.Content: Encore offered a very good deal for us with reduced room rate plus 2 complimentary tickets of "Le Reve" so we spent our Thanksgiving weekend there. The hotel is very classy. People around you including the staffs and the customers are very decent and good looking. You will not see a lot of kids running around. That's really make a different in a vacation. Our room is at the tower suite with deluxe bathroom, comphy bed, separate living room with open view. The "Le Reve" show is bonus for our trip. The ticket itself cost $149 but we got it for free. I deducted 1 star for rating because we never got to their buffet. We went there 3 times and always had a long long line. You can pay additional $12/person to get in quicker but we don't think it is worth to do so as there are many other choices in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Vegas drawer”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherPim
Reviews.Content: Bearing in mind that Las Vegas has it's own rules and 5 Star does not necessarily include every service you may expect in other parts of the world, this is as good as it gets in Vegas. The staff are welcoming and kind and nothing seems to be too much trouble for them; from booking wedding chapels, theatres etc to preparing food for special diets and all done with genuine warmth. Items in the room that did not work (bedside telephone and lamp) remained unfixed over a five day stay; however these trivialities did not detract in the slightest from the overall experience. The exceptional quality of the restaurants and the service therein crowns a very smooth act. I would not hesitate to return. The only absolute negative, and this applies to every casino in Vegas is the appalling quantity and stench of smoke (perhaps there is a correlation between smoking and gambling;) ..but the Encore Towers is different to most hotels in that you may actually get to your room without being walked through the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MaxwellGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend of November 18th, Tower Suites, 53rd floor. The suite had a separate sitting area, concierge service, fitness facilities access. We read other reviews and were concerned about the disco beats keeping us up, but heard nothing. We had massages at the spa and it was the best massage I have ever had. The decor in the spa was breathtaking. it reminded me of the Gluckstein designed spa at Four Seasons Palm Beach, which is stunning. I forgot my brush and the concierge promptly had one delivered to our door. The beds were exceptionally comfortable. I will return. One downfall: the housekeepers did not remove our used glassware for after they cleaned, a strange miss and we weren't happy to see it there when we had returned to our room.

Reviews.Title: “An Encore, please.”
Reviews.Author: better3rd
Reviews.Content: Cheesy title for my review. But having stayed in Encore at Wynn is truly a royal experience. Opulent. Excessive. It's Vegas. Would they do it any other way? The Encore's lobby is decorated with $150k hand-blown glass chandeliers from Murano, Italy. And they're beautiful. My husband and I stayed here for two nights courtesy of a promotional offer that included two show tickets to Le Reve and a free upgrade to a king suite. The king suite is beautiful--floor to ceiling windows that open to a view of the Wynn, the golf course, the strip, and overlooks the hotel pools below. We had a spacious bathroom with a separate shower and tub and a tv built into the side wall. Because you have to watch TV when you brush your teeth, right? Our living area had a comfortable sofa with a chaise. The master remote on my nightstand controlled the lights in the room and the shades. So if you're too lazy or hungover, no need to get up. There's no coffee pot to make your own coffee in the room and there's a 24-hour little market downstairs for late-night or early morning munchies. The hotel has two nightclubs (XS and Surrender--supposedly very nice clubs) and according to the concierge, the line usually begins around 9 p.m. and there's a 2-3 hour wait! Entrance fees for guys at the time of this review was $45/55 and for women $25/35 and can go up from there as the night wears on. We didn't go to either club but did witness the super long lines in the hotel casino. The casino is fairly-sized and plenty of slots to choose from also. We ate at Botero on our last night and it was really good. Standard prices for a steakhouse. If you go, it'd be criminal if you didn't order the truffle mac n cheese. Just my opinion. Checking in took awhile. Other than that, service is wonderful. Le Reve is an amazing show of acrobatic feats in water. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you can ask for”
Reviews.Author: quickjaunt1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on Nov 2011. Got a room on the 33rd floor above the swimming pool and facing the strip and golf course. Everything about the hotel is first class. Even the seats to play the slot machines were more comfortable than other casinos. Everything is clean and still feels new. The rooms have floor to ceiling windows, A separate seating area with a work table and couch. The TV sits in between the bed room and sitting area and it swings around so you can see it in either room. Small TV in a huge bathroom. Soaking tub and separate shower. Probably the best room I have been in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the best concert ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ustravelgirl13
Reviews.Content: I have been to hundreds of concerts and this one is at the top. I had missed Garth touring in the 90's and was so excited when I found out he was playing in Las Vegas. We had third row center tickets. Any closer and i could have reached out and touched him. He dressed very casual and it was just he and his guitar. A voice that doesnt need anything else, like most of today's artist. The exta surprise was when Trisha Yearwood came out for a couple of songs. My husband hates country music and only went to the concert for me. He love it! Which says alot!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, gorgeous decor, look out for hidden costs!”
Reviews.Author: MCCL0510
Reviews.Content: We decided to celebrate our 40th in Vegas in late September. Got upgraded to a suite (2 Queens as opposed to 2 doubles) when we called the manager on duty to explain we were a party of 3 celebrating birthdays. The room was beautiful, high up and overlooking the pool and the Wynn. Loved the decadent decor in the lobby, pool area was great. But the smoke at lobby level was really heavy and made my sinuses act up as soon as we got out of the elevator. As well, there was no internet (unless you paid $16 a day), no gym (another $20 a day)....I thought these were "givens" for 4-star plus hotels these days! But apparently not in Vegas. The last day we were there, we were flying out at night so we decided we would "splurge" for the gym, shower and then leave....but we were told we couldn't shower unless we paid another $20 (on top of the gym fee), b/c the shower was in the spa area, not the gym area!! We weren't happy about that - seemed really cheap and cheesy considering we had stayed there 3 nights and spent a ton of money on food and drinks. Anyway, overall a good experience but we'll likely do more research and find another place next time round.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: LittleTLondon
Reviews.Content: First time to Vegas and we absolutely loved this hotel and would definitely return. The room was spacious, bright and contemporary with wonderful views. Lovely large bathroom. We were on the 61st floor. We had booked a panoramic suite and at check-in requested a room so we wouldn't hear the nightclubs and we didn't hear a thing. The decor of the hotel is amazing, so much attention to detail. The casino is light and airy. We ate in some of the Encore/Wynn restaurants and had fabulous meals in all. The pool areas looked lovely although we didn't use these as we were there in November. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. Overall a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “I picked up my own room it felt so much like home”
Reviews.Author: reed c
Reviews.Content: Just an incredible experience. Everything was perfect. Hated to leave my room. This is beyond a fabuous hotel. They even figured out which side I slept on and left shoes next to my bed. The staff is so friendly and helpful . Will go back again and again. What a value. What an experience. Beyond 5 stars.....

Reviews.Title: “Third Stay in 18 months....5 Star!! LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: Shep99
Reviews.Content: I was lucky, free room, free food and drinks for my recent stay (due to my gambling amounts!) but even if I did have to pay, its a great hotel! Rooms - very nice, large and great views. Resturants - great steak houses but you are looking at $250 for 2 people but great food! Night Clubs are great and are filled with stunning people! This is the hotel for any stay in Vegas. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “This place Rocks”
Reviews.Author: JamesHurt
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to vegas for 25 years and have I seen changes. Encore is by far the best resort on the strip, doesnt matter if you are a whale or a guppy they will make you feel like a million dollars. This makes my 5th stay since they opened and i will not stay anywhere else, the rooms are impeccable, the food is divine, the staff is attnetive and the location is middle of the strip. The only other thign you could ask for is hitting the Jackpot.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: TonopahAz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore 3 nights. Booked a non-cancelable room for a good rate. Mixed emotions on our stay. Upon check in (we were 2 hours early), we were told there were no rooms available yet for the booking we had, but for $20 extra per night there were high floor rooms available with a mountain view. We took the upgraded room. The Good * The woman at check in was very nice and the check in process was pleasant. * The room was very nice and the view was awesome! Not So Good * No coffee maker in room - I really need a cup of coffee first thing. * Housekeeping was spotty - no service after our first night. Had to ask them to make up our room as we were going to dinner/show. Upon returning our bed had been made up, but the wastebaskets were still full and our glasses had not been exchanged. Next day things were done properly. * Bartender at the first bar we stopped by was very snooty. So much so, we took our drinks and went to a lounge to sit. * Everything is very expensive at the Wynn and the Encore for what you get. Overall, this is a place that seems to cater to the European / Asian crowd and those who need to been "seen". While the room was really very nice, we just didn't feel like hanging out at this resort - wasn't our type of place. So we spent our time at other casinos / resorts and enjoyed our time in Las Vegas. Again, the room was really nice, but don't think we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: abiMexico
Reviews.Content: the bes beds i have ever sleep inn and grat swiming pools and restaurants a little expensive but its worth it
