Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing”
Reviews.Author: Traveler-vr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at most of the top hotels in Las Vegas, and the Encore stands out as my personal favorite. The rooms (especially the Tower Suites) are large, comfortable, quiet and very well appointed. I'm a bit of a perfectionist, and I can honestly say that the Encore met my high standards in every way. The facility is modern and stunningly beautiful. Of special note is the quality of the staff, who are uniformly friendly and helpful in a way that really makes you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “perry the bartender”
Reviews.Author: Raymond W
Reviews.Content: have stayed in many hotels on the strip and the Wynn and Encore are, by far, my favorites. The room at the Encore was awesome. We had such a blast eating at the Country Club bar and enjoying the friendly conversation with Perry the bartender.....he made the dining/drinking experience so much fun. The staff and facilities at both locations is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: cleo13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Best part is you have a private lobby with check-in and private driveway so you don't have to right the Vegas crowds. It is connected to the Wynn but access to the Encore is restricted to guests. You can walk downstairs to both the Encore and Wynn casinos, restaurants, shops, spas etc so you are still in the middle of lots of action.. The spa at the Encore was one of the nicest spas I have ever been in. The beds, sheets, pillows were great. The bathroom was huge and beautiful. Service was very good, too. This is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: ross7979
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in Vegas, small by Vegas standards, nice decor, goog gaming floor, smaller more boutique less diney world like venetian or MGM. Good rooms, double rooms are great, cheap for standard. Good restaurants, pool parties are great, good Cubanas. Good for singles and couples, no kids! Happy days.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above the rest”
Reviews.Author: G_Nagha
Reviews.Content: Went for a 3 night stay, as a an 'overseer' for my rowdy nephew's Stag Party ! Spoke nicely to the receptionist at check in, and got upgraded free to a higher floor and slightly larger room. You need to be higher, as otherwise you might hear noise from the 2 on-site nightclubs. I had a "Resort Suite King" room, 700 -745 square feet, with a fabulous view looking down the strip on one side and distant McCarran Airport on the other. Room was beautiful with separated lounge area and huge bathroom. Everything was impeccable and clean. Hotel is not as crowded or hectic as any of the big Vegas Strip hotels, including sister hotel Wynn... so definitely a plus point ! Buffet is great,costs about $30.... but good quality and huge choice. As I said, if you like nightclubs there are 2 of the best in Vegas, onsite... Tryst and XS. There are the usual high-end luxury shops inbetween both hotels, and even a Ferrari dealership, if you want to have a lustful walk around ! As with ALL Vegas hotels it seems, there are 'ladies of the night' working the lobbies and the bars, but it is definitely alot more discreet and upmarket here... but just beware if you are sittingt alone at the bar. I got propositioned 3 times in 30 minutes.. .but I think I charmed and disarmed them with my english accent, and actually had a good laugh with a couple of them. Be respectful and gracious, as they definitely are. Across the road is the Fashion Mall, but further back down the strip there are alot more malls to choose from. Beware though, this hotel is a deceptively long walk from the main part of the strip as it is at the north end. In summary: When I return to Vegas, this will definitely be my preferred choice of stay. ALL the staff are polite and courteous. I am not going to rate everything as 5 star, as there is always room for improvement with anything !

Reviews.Title: “In a Word....Wow!”
Reviews.Author: JP-NYCDFW
Reviews.Content: With so many trips to Vegas, I am clueless why I have not stayed here before. It is spectacular. Very similiar to my first impression with the Bellagio way back when. Stayed for six nights. Large bathroom, large room, everything "felt" new. Art in all of the rooms, just a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “First Class!”
Reviews.Author: daymeeyan
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Wynn before a few times, so this time we decided to try the Encore. We had high expectations and all were met. It was just unfortunate that we were visiting at a time when the weather was cold. That meant no lounging by the pool for us. The room was nicely decorated. Lots of room with a large desk and couch. The TV swivels so you can watch it from the bed or the couch, but not both at the same time. The bathroom was large with a separate shower and tub, plus an additional TV in there. We enjoyed the use of the robes and slippers as well as the nightly turn down service. The french toast at Society Cafe was amazing. The Encore and The Wynn will always be our favorite places to stay while in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and with my special, I got a suite for only $149/night. The room was huge and nicely decorated. The show La Reve is a must see! It is better than many of the Cirque du soleil shows. The club surrender might be a little overrated and it's definitely not worth $40 per person. The spa was outstanding and it's a must do. The location is good and bad. It's at one end of the strip but it's close to the Fashion show mall and the Venetian shops. It's quite a distance from the center of the strip though. I will stay here again if I get the same special :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Luxury Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: LDA_59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights to attend a wedding at the Wynn. The rooms were large with a sitting area and separate sleeping area. Everything in the room was fantastic. Large bathroom area with shower and tub. There was a King size bed and large Television. The view of the strip was good. We spent a night in the casino, and found it very clean with good service. The hotel is located at the northern end of the strip. The only downsides were that the rooms stayed warm at night, and the restaurants were very expensive. Overall had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best of everything - but you pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: MyAnnieD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on the recommendation of friends. Everything was just about perfect from the early and uncomplicated check in to the check out using the TV. The decor was lovely, the bed big and squishy, the bathroom enormous, the north view great, the closet huge and well equipped. The casino, bars and restaurants were the least smoky ones we were in up and down the strip. I'm not sure if that was because this place is relatively new or if it is the state of the art air filtration system. Service was very good and the staff members we spoke with almost all appeared to really care about our comfort. La Reve was a great show and well worth the money to see it. The only downsides apart from the price were: 1. the silly/petty bar fridge and snack set up in the room that charges you crazy amounts for cookies or water and wont allow you to place your own items into it. 2. the air conditioning did not go below 16C - when combined with the lovely pillow top bed and the very warm duvet, this made for some rather warm nights. 3. the inability to buy even a newspaper or anything else to read in any of the hotel shops.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Barbara W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a deal of $149 a night and that included $50 credit we used towards the fabulous restaurants. The room was a huge suite and I loved the bathroom area with comfy robes, a tv, shower and tub, phone. We also had a wonderful view and I'd definately return. Able to spend some time at pool where grapes were served and the buffet was the best I'd ever eaten!

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: AlexOstad
Reviews.Content: I confronted a bartender for degrading a patron after he acknowledged the bartender didn't pour any alcohol in his drink, but still charged him $11. Surprise, surprise! The patron was upset and as soon as he said something, he was verbally abused by Miguel the bartender after the acknowledgment. So I stepped in and confronted the bartender, and notified his superiors, unfortunately the hotel staff couldn't have been any less helpful. I guess confronting a bartender by the name of Miguel, who is extremely unprofessional, and for lack of a better word, ghetto!!! Is not allowed or acknowledged by the encore management staff. They were extremely uncooperative with the investigation, and I'm sure they kept the unbelievable rude Miguel, and his extremely rude manager Anthony on staff, which exposes future customers to this unfriendly and unprofessional environment. I will most definitely take my business to the Venetian/Palazzo or any where for that matter, as they know how to treat people, in a kind and professional matter. Keep in mind I was not originally a victim of encores horrible customer service, what triggered my abuse was sticking up for someone who didn't have the courage to stick up for himself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: ConchyJoe1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for a week. Like some have said, the music from XS will potentially bother you, so ask for a room on the opposite side or high up if you are not a party animal. After the first night, I never noticed it again. Big shout out to Mary Noel at the Blackjack tables. She was fun, witty, and actually taught me some new was to look at playing Blackjack. The room is well laid out and large like a typical Vegas room. It had a larger than normal tub in the marble bathroom, and a separate water closet. The bed was comfortable and plush, and the living room had a nice couch with my favorite, a chaise lounge on one end. As is typical anywhere in Vegas, everything is expensive, but the service is impeccable. I ordered room service one night, and I think the nice lady that delivered it was going to feed it tome too! She set up everything very nicely, and it was hot, tasty, and perfectly prepared, even if it was just an Angus cheeseburger. Really good fries too. We also had an event at Encore Beach Club, and they served a great prime rib, turkey, and pasta stations. This place is certainly much more upscale than that other place that is on TV. The Cabanas were very nice, and the staff that took care of us there were incredibly attractive young ladies that actually had a personality, and nice to talk to. I was not able to find any flaw in this hotel from an overall basis. Both Encore and Wynn are two of the nicest hotels you can stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: julesinsf
Reviews.Content: WOW. I walked in and was stunned. The clean lines, elegant decor, and posh interior made me feel like I was a VIP. This is going to be my go-to hotel for Vegas from now on. Two sinks - what a luxury! The swiveling TV is so simple, but genius! I took baths, showers, naps, and pictures - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip was flawless”
Reviews.Author: TheGreek36
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Encore for our 10th anniversary trip. The room and amenities were perfect. Loved the Encore pool but actually preferred the Wynn pool. Had a nice lunch overlooking the Wynn pool one day as well at the signature cafe. My wife booked a massage at the Encore and said it was the most opulent spa she had ever seen. At check-in I asked for a higher floor room with a room facing south, and we were given a room on the 36th floor with a fabulous view. Steve Wynn spent a lot of money on these hotels and you can tell. Every detail from the doors, to the light fixtures are just beautiful, you will feel pampered. The only downside to staying at the Encore is that it is a little far down the strip, you can certainly still walk everywhere but we found it easier, especially with wife in heels, to take a cab to the other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Encore / Wynn Experience”
Reviews.Author: Papu47
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Encore/Wynn. We spent a great deal of time in both the Wynn and Encore and were very pleased with the appearance and overall attention to detail. We enjoyed our stay very much and hope to return soon. The Garth Brooks show was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Once you try Encore, nothing else will do.”
Reviews.Author: motmay
Reviews.Content: We were so amazed and pleased with our stay at Encore. We will never want to stay anywhere else. We've tried many other places around Las Vegas and the world and this is by far the nicest place we've stayed.Every detail in design, decor, comfort and convenience was impecable. We were so comfortable and pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Encore is still the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Andy_0nT0ur
Reviews.Content: After a stay at Aria earlier in the year, I returned to Encore for the 3rd time. And just like I remembered the place is still the best hotel on e strip. Coupled with Wynn it has everything you need from the best dining (Wazuzu, Society, The Country Club, Red 8) to a choice of buzzy casino (Wynn) to a more relaxed vibe at Encore. The rooms are spacious 2 rooms in one with lounge separated from the bedroom and very spacious bathrooms. The Spa is still the best place to relax and unwind with an array of treatments that, while pricey, will leave any stress at bay. Staff are always friendly and the whole experience is one of ease where it seems no request is too big or small to be fulfilled from ordering off menu to booking shows. Whilst its location at the South end of the strip might make visiting other casinos a bit of a walk, it is located opposite the Fashion Show Mall that satisfies all your shopping needs. If you get a chance to stay at Encore, and your budget allows, do so it is an experience worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - this hotel is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: shortcakecrowther
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few nights and I absolutely loved it! We had a room on the 63rd floor, facing the strip and when we walked in we could hardly believe our eyes. The gorgeous room and the amazing view were worth every penny. The room was massive, with a lounge area and a bedroom area, a hall (a hall!) and a lovely marble bathroom with adjoining room for a toilet! The bath was huge and a separate shower with lush soaps and shampoos etc. I would definitely go back here if we go back to Vegas. We also stayed in four seasons but the encore was every bit as luxurious. Fab, clean casino and an amazing nightclub too! We thought it might be noisy but it was so quiet and the bed was so comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gloяia H
Reviews.Content: The best view ever! I went to Las Vegas last year on December with my sister and my dad. We stayed on the 59 floor! As soon as we opened the door, we were shocked! We could see all the hotels in Las Vegas!! Of course the view at night was even better. All the lights and music invited people to get out. The problem was that I was 17! To get out of the bedroom and walk in the hotel I needed to be with someone older than 18! I was not able to be near the play area. What I didn’t like about the hotel was that there were a lot of people drinking! Smoking! And there was also some women wearing inappropriate clothes! I truly recommend not going with kids! This is a great really great hotel! But it is to go with friends and have a GREAT time!

Reviews.Title: “Never have to leave the Encore to enjoy Vegas”
Reviews.Author: liza_loves_travel
Reviews.Content: The spa: Amazing! Go first thing in the morning to enjoy the water therapies before it becomes messy. Everything is great except for the sauna. The sauna is never hot so don't bother if you like a hot sauna. The suite: Nice and spacious The food: Terrace point cafe at the Wynn has the best pancakes. The best! The club: If you are a guest at the Encore you don't need to pay cover at XS. Overall I find the Encore isn't as congested and smoky as some of the other properties on the strip which means that you can enjoy some peace and quiet even though you're in Vegas. Extra bonus: Right across the street from Fashion Show Mall!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: ACE06
Reviews.Content: I've tried many properties in LV none come close even to the ENCORE. It was my 1st stay but this is by far the best one! Rooms are spotless, nice amenities: FANTASTIC!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the food, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: VParry
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property, with stunning pools and very good restaurants. But heed the many reviewers who caution you, as I do, that this must be the loudest place on the strip at night. No matter where you are sleeping (apparently from the reviews), the three nightclubs boom as if there were an all night party next door. Also, this hotel practices the great evil of our times: the resort fee. They charge $20--plus tax!--per day for things one expects to be part of the room rate: access to the gym, wi-fi, local phone calls. Next there will be a fee for pillows or toilet paper. A place that boasts about how classy it is can't even match the free amenities of a Marriott. Note: we complained to the manager and refused to pay this inhospitable fee, and threatened to eat and gamble off the property. They reduced our rate by the same cost of the fee. Botero, Bartolotta, and Wing Lei are all wonderful restaurants. And if your taste goes to Asian brothel, you'll love the red satin decor in the casino. But stay at the Bellagio for a classier experience.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising!”
Reviews.Author: gcarr
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at a handful of hotels in Vegas, and this is by far our favorite. I was attending a business conference and was impressed at what a great job they did for our meetings. This was the best food I'd ever had at a conference - wow! Our room was beautiful - clean and comfortable. The hotel's restaurants - including those at Wynn across the walkway - were all wonderful. This is our new place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Encore!”
Reviews.Author: harsha3852
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Vegas and stayed at Encore, and it was just beautiful. people were very friendly, staff was accommodating. we are vegetarian and could find Vegan menu in all the restaurant at Encore and Wynn. Room had all the conveniences and really comfortable bed pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay at the Encore on a Wed, Fri, or Sat.”
Reviews.Author: JaneIowa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 nights stay at the Encore, and would not go back. The room and the casino were both very beautiful. The staff was exceptionally accommodating. The problems: There is a club called Surrender that booms music until 4 in the morning. We were on a high floor and could still her the thump, thump, thump of the music. I did complain to the front desk and they offered ear plugs, or to move us to a different room, but it was midnight and we didn't want to move. Also this hotel has a very snobby vibe. The restaurants and bars are overpriced. Next time we will stay at the Monte Carlo, Caesar Palace, or the suites at the Palazzo Resort and Casino. If you are very young, very rich and looking for a high priced trendy casino....then this is the choice for you. If not, pass on this....you will be disappointed and would be happier somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful to the Encore!!”
Reviews.Author: PenDoc
Reviews.Content: This was our second vacation to the Encore hotel in Las Vegas, NV. We have been to Vegas numerous times and stayed at the Venetian, Mirage, and Treasure Island in the past. However, last year we stayed at Encore and we will never stay anywhere else now! The Encore was built by Steve Wynn. It costs about $2.3 billion to construct along with $2.7 billion for the adjacent Wynn hotel. The Encore exemplifies glamour and luxury among any hotel we've stayed. The staff is courteous and gracious. The clubs are packed and energetic. The restaurants have amazing cuisine. The casinos are clean and mildly smoky compared to other Vegas casinos. The pools are the hidden gems of the Encore though. They are not busy, have adequate staff, and great music. I used the exercise room this year and had a good workout using both the free weights and stationary equipment. It was not busy on any days that I attended. When we arrived, our room faced the North strip and the construction - it was not a pleasant view. We voiced our complaint and it was handled appropriately. Our room was moved to the opposite side facing South and the pools. It was the same view we had last year. Rooms lower in the building may be distracted by the nightclubs at night as they are open until 4am. We were on on the 60th floor and could barely hear the music. Overall, this is THE finest hotel on the strip. It is conveniently located across from the Fashion Mall on the North end of the strip. It is a five star and then some!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Baby!”
Reviews.Author: Mandy E
Reviews.Content: First timers to Vegas, wonderful hotel, decor inside is very modern and very red but really funky! We stayed in a Panoramic King Suite which was on the 61st floor - fabulous views out to old Las Vegas. Room had all the conveniences you could wish for and a really comfortable bed with pillows to die for - we did learn you could buy the matress and take it home for only 2000 USD! Bargain. Lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Got to stay at the Encore and the Palazzo this Ocotober”
Reviews.Author: motmemo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore and the Palazzo this past October. If I had to choose I would select the Palazzo over the Encore. This is due to personal taste rather than anything that did or didn't happen at either place. I was able to immediately walk up and check in, I was welcomed warmly and information was provided about the room and facilities. I don't care for the decor of the casino at either the Wynn or the Encore so I was a little surprised when I arrived at the room that it was more modernly decorated. The room is smaller than a bella suite at the Palazzo,. Not sure if I am a fan of the TV that is in a cutout of the wall and can face either the bed or the sitting area. At the very least would have preferred the bed area to be near the windows and the seating area near the door. The bathroom was lovely and the deep bath and shower had hot water immediately as well as good pressure. The bed is to die for, was able to sleep very well there.Only ate at the buffet at the Wynn which was good but the best in Las Vegas,not sure about that. The staff at Red card( which is the players card for the Wynn and Encore) were exceptional at the very least. Seeking me out on the casino floor to advise me of free play available to me. All in all the stay was very nice but the decor of the casino is a little too much like a bordello to me and I prefer the airy openess of the Palazzo

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: Finiky390
Reviews.Content: I am usually a Four Seasons patron but had friends staying at the Encore so we decided to stay there too. It is a beautifully plush hotel. Small casino but we liked that, besides you can walk to the Wynn casino in 5 minutes and get the loud and bright Vegas version. First of all, take advantage of the deals on the internet. My favorite for Vegas is Southwest Vacation Deals. I tried to go directly to the hotel for booking. Their basic room rate was $425. a night. On Southwest Vacation Deals, 3 nights plus airfare (my location is not that far away) $840. total for 2 people! My room was approximately $100./per night. Once we got there we were able to upgrade to a 1-bedroom suite (1500 sq ft) for less than their basic room rate. All the amenities I like: great bathroom products, down comforters, high thread count sheets, huge living room with a view looking down on the strip, separate little room with a massage table for in-room message service. The spa at the Encore is beautiful and I am a big spa connoisseur. See some of my reviews of Spas. I got my upgrade comped due to our gambling habits that trip but still was well worth it at the upgraded price. Service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Janybabe
Reviews.Content: The ambience in this hotel is the best Las Vegas has to offer. It is not tacky, the staff are really friendly and the food is good (if expensive) but then again, you don't come to Las Vegas without knowing it is going to cost you. Each restaurant has the prices and menu's displayed so you can decide if you want to eat there. You don't have to eat in the hotel, there are more reasonably priced places outside, but you get what you pay for. We found the drink prices are about the same in each hotel (we had a drink in nearly every hotel)so there should not be any shock there. At least with the Encore, we were told if we touched the mini bar the sensors would pick it up. We were not told this in other hotels we stayed in on our three week trip across America.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking, but falls short”
Reviews.Author: gsto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the week of October 24th for a combination business conference and personal vacation. I'm definitely conflicted on the hotel but for those who want to just cut to the chase, the bottom line is next time I'm in Las Vegas I'd stay somewhere else. The Pro's: Very well kept property. It's Vegas, but it's not over-the-top cheesy. It's got a classier look to it. Everything is very clean, all the staff are very polite. For the money (assuming you're not paying full price), it's a very good looking hotel. The rooms are big, modern and nicely decorated and the views are fantastic. The Con's: First, nickle and diming and silly policies. $15 a day per PERSON in your room to use the fitness center. $13 a day for internet in your room. Want to just pay the $20 a day resort fee instead? "I'm sorry sir, your rate doesn't include the resort fee." So I want to pay you money and you won't take it? End result, we went for a run instead and skipped the gym and used internet on our phones. Encore loses $20 a day...for what? Inconveniencing your "valued guest"s? Second, I don't understand this but the rooms pick up the music from the clubs FAR below. I was on the "50th" floor (really around the 40th due to their floor numbering system). Beginning at midnight and lasting until 4 AM we were treated to the thumping music of the nightclubs. The beachclub was closed for the season, so this was NOT due to that. I could sleep through it, but it drove my wife crazy. The clubs at the Wynn/Encore are all at ground level, so I'm at a loss to explain how the music travels that far but bottom line is you can hear it pretty clearly. Third, the service is good on the surface. The staff is polite. They say the right things, but then there's no follow-through. Examples: On our last day I visited the casino host to see what type of comps I had qualified for. I was a net winner (which they knew) but I figured asking wouldn't hurt and anything was better than nothing. They offered me a modest credit off my bill due to the time I spent at the tables and the amount we had spent at the resort restaurants. Fair enough. "Don't worry, Mr. Stocki, I'll take care of everything". Guess what? No credit on the bill. Another: They didn't have the King bedroom I requested on my reservation. Kindly upgraded my room to a panoramic view suite (with 2 queens) and said I could switch after my first night - they'd put in the request and contact me the next day when it was ready. Didn't contact me. Never put in the request. Front desk person I spoke with the next day "said" all the right things but there was an underlying attitude that was very annoying to interact with. It's hard to describe other than I felt like I was being spoken to like a child... I could relate several other instances of similar situations that occurred over the 5 days we were there but the bottom line is they say the right things but there's no follow through or not enough attention to detail. Very disappointing stay given all the positive reviews I'd read beforehand. We'll definitely stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Las Vegas...period”
Reviews.Author: Jerry J
Reviews.Content: I think the Encore is the best hotel in Las Vegas. I stay here every year as a traditional Vegas trip. This is my 3rd time staying at the Encore. I like it because the ambience is not over the top, very tastefully decorated, the beds are extremely comfortable, everyone is nice, and the whole environment is so classy. Restaurants are awesome, Stratta is my all time favorite and so is Sinatra's (try the Lasagne). I took my girlfriend for the first time and she never left the hotel! The pool is amazing and so is the spa! What a great way to enjoy Vegas! Steve Wynn knows what Vegas lovers look for and delivers all the way.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels --but bring your cash”
Reviews.Author: Kim C
Reviews.Content: Encore was first class all the way. Steve Wynn is a master at what he does. The staff was incredibly professional and kind. The rooms are beautiful and the beds are one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on. Apparently to pay for all the high end furnishings in this hotel, they have to overcharge for all of the food items. I understand that Vegas has become a foodie town and prices have gone to the higher end. However, some of the prices at the Encore/Wynn are insulting. A few examples: Bloody Mary $13.50(well vodka), Tea at Wazuzu $8.00 (yes tea), Fountain sodas $4.00, least expensive glass of white wine $11.00, Teriyiki Chicken Bowl $15.00 (and the chicken was dry). To me, I felt as if this property thinks that the customers who stay there don't care about their money or what they are charged for things. I do not mind spending money for good food (we spend $110 per person at SW Steakhouse it was worth every penny) but the other outlets were nothing special and just way overpriced. Besides SW, there was very little value to price relationship. And unless you want a good walk (to the next casino) you are stuck there paying too much for food.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: alfonso v
Reviews.Content: Third time in Vegas, best choice so far. The rooms are huge, pool choices are available depending on your mood, casino floor is elegant and not crowded like other hotels. The location is not the best but you do have the Fashion mall a few steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Margaret S
Reviews.Content: Only to say that any staff member I encountered always went above and beyond what I needed or expected. You are to be commended for the training you have given your staff. My experience was so positive, I would return - even though past visits to Las Vegas have been based more upon economizing than the luxurious comfort I found at Encore. Many thanks for what was a very special 80th birthday celebration!

Reviews.Title: “Garth Brooks package at Encore/ Wynn Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ken B
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with your friendly staff and the all around cleanlyness of your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED to the max! Plus... stinky!”
Reviews.Author: HappilyMarriedTravel
Reviews.Content: Major price rip-off for EVERYTHING! Firstly... we stayed in a Panaromic View King Suite & there are not tea & coffee facilities and in fact NO accessible fridge facilities at all included in the room cost. Plus... we were in an adjoining-style room & could hear everything in the room next door. No privacy! In the room... the fridge has weights on everything & if you remove for more than 60 seconds you are automatically charged. There is no additional space in the fridge for anything else... So... there is a sign saying "if you would like a fridge, call Housekeeping" ... which we did... only to be told it would be an additional $25/day... what the??? Next, the Society restaurant... don't bother making a special request for anything... it won't happen. e.g. for breakfast we asked for our toast to be buttered... it wasn't & they served the toast with solid cold butter that was unspreadable. At lunch we asked for a burger cooked medium-to-well... they got it right one day & it was raw another. Oh... and don't even get me started with the disgusting cigarette & revolting cigar smell throughout the entire place. If you want luxury... Encore is NOT it.... I would describe Encore as a cesspit!

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are not on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: mrs_mackay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore for 5 nights Ocotber 2011 and we had a really good time. We had room 5011 - this is not on the 50th floor as they dont have floors 40-49 so technically we were on the 40th floor. Upon check in we were told our room was on the 31st floor and that it is most likely that we will hear the music from the nightclub. The receptionist (Shelley) asked us if we would prefer a higher floor, obviously we said yes, this is how we ended up in room 5011. Luckily I checked our bill on the 3rd day and I noticed we were charged $50 per day for an upgrade. We were very shocked as we do not remember being informed this. I immediately went to the front desk and spoke to a Duty Manager and explained the situation. I know its only $50 BUT it would have been nice to have been informed. The matter was rectified we were given the room upgrade for free. The pool at the Encore is fabulous. The "European" pool is adult only and you could sunbathe topless. The service was really good and the poolside snacks/meals are reasonably priced and of good portion. This is actually my favorite part of the hotel. Cocktail service at the casino was good. Not very good but good enough. If you fancy nice lunch I recommend the Society Cafe. The Kobe burger was delish, my husband had the wagyu beef which he enjoyed a lot. If you like dimsum Red 8 at the Wynn was extremely good (try mongolian beef too), so was the pizza place. The buffet was average value - there are loads of choices but only a few dishes that stood out. I would recommend this hotel ONLY if you are not on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Encore in LV...first rate experience!”
Reviews.Author: Panther5150
Reviews.Content: I found the experience to be quite refreshing. I travel once or twice a year to Las Vegas and have stayed in a variety of places. I can quite canidly say that this was hands down the best experiecnce that I have had. Everyone made an effort to make us feel welcome. I never felt rushed, or intruded upon and in fact was quite comfortable and relaxed. La Reve was the most amazing show that I have seen and the most important part was that my wife was thrilled with the experience of the food, show, and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - nightclub noise ruined stay”
Reviews.Author: SarahandPaolo
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely, huge suite on the 58th floor with fantastic views but our stay was ruined by music blasting out from the nightclub into the early hours, which we didn't expect to hear in one of the rooms at the top of the hotel. The valet and bell desk staff were excellent - very friendly and helpful - but the check-in staff clearly need more training. When checking in the lady got my husband's name wrong despite having his credit card and ID in front of her, and when we checked out we weren't even asked if we enjoyed our stay - something that the gentleman at the bell desk asked when we left our luggage. We expected better from a luxury hotel and won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Premier accommodations”
Reviews.Author: J3Pilot
Reviews.Content: Encore resort suites level are the most comfortable accommodations we ever had. Everything was new and immaculate. We stayed there twice over three days and had great views on both sides of the hotel. A wonderful refuge for tired travelers. The General Manager - Brian - ensures a welcome environment by staying on the move and being available to all guests - not just the high rollers.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, terrific property!”
Reviews.Author: dancepig
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore at Wynn in mid-October. Love this property. The location is fabulous, right across the street from the Fashion Show mall, next door to the Wynn, adjacent to the Palazzo/Venetian property. It's an easy walk to Treasure Island and Mirage to see the evening outdoor entertainment. Our room was a suite in the tower, one thing to note - all of the suites come with a king bed. There are no suites at the Encore that have two beds. Unfortunately, because I was staying with my sister, we had to get a roll-away bed. The suites are huge, we had the smaller one and it was about 700 square feet. The bed is very comfortable, and the amenities are excellent. The housekeeping staff does a wonderful job, which is good because there are no ice machines, meaning they need to deliver ice. Fortunately, they bring it around when the come by to turn down the beds. The fitness center offers classes, which is excellent. I took the Pilates class which uses the reformer. The teacher was very professional and really knew what she was doing. I took a class on Tuesday and Thursday at the cost of $20 per class plus tip, and it was worth every penny. There are Zumba classes, spinning classes, yoga and pilates. The classes are held in well equipped studios. Book early for the classes, they are limited in size. My Pilates classes were not full, most likely because they were at 8:30 a.m. The pros of this property are the location, comfortable beds, great staff and wonderful amenities, the cons of this property are no ice machines, no coffee makers, and only one bed. All of the upscale casino/hotels have a lot of fabulous restaurants, beautiful pools and great fitness centers, what sets them apart in my opinion is the location, beds and customer service. The Encore has all three.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are Bond Cool...Yes...James Bond...”
Reviews.Author: PrincessWildhair
Reviews.Content: O.k...I will tell you I HATE Vegas. I am never happy to be there. I am someone who hates crowds, doesn't gamble or smoke and prefer to drink with close friends discussing something crazy. BUT...if you have to go...why not go to the Encore. Property is easy to get it, well staffed...easy to get to your rooms. Rooms are fantastic. You really can't go wrong. Most rooms have great views of various views of the city. Beds are top of the line with fantastic linens. The bathroom is giant - HUGE tub...Huge shower...(fun to go to this place with a special friend...) o.k. I don't like phones next to the toilet but some of us have better manners than others and know better than to phone a friend while indisposed.(fun to go with a special friend) in fact most rooms at the Encore are most likely larger than most NY apartments! The feel of the room is really Bond..in my opinion. Very cool, richly appointed, relaxing...very quiet...not inexpensive but who knows...maybe your blackjack hand will pay off!

Reviews.Title: “It's good”
Reviews.Author: TabHK
Reviews.Content: It's a good hotel. Massive rooms with a enormous bathroom. Casino Style hotels are not my cup of tea. Breakfast in the morning you had to line up. Check in and check out you have to line up. However, I think this would be a normal thing to do in Vegas. It has a good weekend pool party. Overall, it's a pretty flashy room and you can't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Encore is High Definition”
Reviews.Author: Mainstream_Traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with two other couples, just stayed a long weekend at Encore in Las Vegas. With more than 2 dozen Las Vegas Lifetime trips, this was one of our favorite stays. Comments: • This property feels “High Definition”. It is so vibrant that it makes many other Vegas properties dull, and that’s not easy to do. • It lacks a grand entry, like its big brother Wynn, but that does not matter. The sense of arrival happens as soon as you hit the check in area. • The walk from check-in to room elevator takes less than a minute. Imagine that. No map needed. • The rooms are big, beautiful, super comfortable, and full of gadgets. Their size is enhanced with a wall of mirrors. • Thru-out this property there are fantastic details that are super cool. Its almost unfair for other “normal hotels”, who don’t benefit from gambling revenue. How much does it cost to imbed butterfly mosaics into marble floors? Or install curved escalators? • We took in Le Reve, which is simply an amazing show. • We dined at many of the hotel’s options: Botero, Wynn Buffet, Lobby Café, Spa Café (wheat germ shot anyone?)and Café Society. Each experience was great. Though not the priciest meal we had, Café Society was our favorite. The grilled artichokes are amazing. • We checked out Surrender, the indoor / outdoor pool-themed night club. What an electric club experience that is – even if just to see the lighting show. • We did use the “spa”, which is another architecturally amazing space – and its one where the treatments are given with the greatest of expertise. • Directly across from the Fashion Mall is handy. • The only negative: many of the bartenders in the various casino bars are “gruff”. I am not sure why, but their collective lack of personality / service stood out in a hotel full of professional staff. • The room rate went from $250 for the person who booked early to $500 for the person who booked 2 weeks out. Book early. • F&B, Spa services, etc are all very expensive, but you get more “experience” for those dollars. • There is not a true sports book in Encore, so if that is important for you, you might want to consider Wynn. This is a fantastic hotel that pleases you in so many ways. I probably would not recommend this property for someone on a budget or focused on value, but instead for someone looking for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “A smelly room is an no go item!”
Reviews.Author: Gmacmac
Reviews.Content: For such a well run hotel it is unfortunate that I could not adequately convince the management that a room with a foul aroma was unacceptable! The first room I was offered had a mysterious foul aroma. The bell person agreed and they sent up some destinking team. The treatment was ineffective and I was moved to a room with a new foul aroma. I recognized this aroma, stale beer and cigarettes. I was told one mover per customer, all are rooms smell like this, (not true and I hope not) and I was stuck with this room. The destinking team did try again to fix the smell. forget destinking it doesn't help! On the second day I was once again moved to a third room. No smell finally and I didn't really think all their rooms smelled like that. The first move cost me my first appointment in Las Vegas. It wasn't like the Four Seasons where they just move you and you don't even have to be there. The second move another appointment. trashed. The hotel had so adversely affected my stay that I left early. I should have left as soon as they could not find me a satisfactory room. It wasn't my first stay at the Wynn/Encore but it was my last. On my next visit to Las Vegas I tried the Mandarin Oriental NOW THAT WAS A 5 STAR hotel. Even better than the Four Seasons (my usual favorite).

Reviews.Title: “Found my new home in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Minnie121971
Reviews.Content: I wanted to sincerely Thank the management and staff at Encore for making our stay extra special! From the moment we arrived to check out, we felt welcomed and at home. Complimentary of the Encore, my boyfriend and I were upgraded from a Resort Suite to a Tower Suite at the same rate... WOW! Thank you! I didn't want to leave our suite, but there were so many beautiful and stunning venues and sites to visit at the Encore/Wynn! From the beautiful decor, amazing ambiance, friendly staff, fabulous bars, social atmosphere, to the superb SW Steakhouse, our visit was fabulous! I most definitely recommend! We have found our new home in Vegas! Thank you again for pampering us and making our stay extra special! :) We love the Wynn/Encore!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ndbrit06
Reviews.Content: Perfect! Stay here for sure! Big, gorgeous, clean rooms! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “amazing but expensive”
Reviews.Author: djenglandessex_UK
Reviews.Content: On entering the Encore you will be amazed it's huge. Check in was abit of a let down as we had requested from Expedia a very high floor with strip view, it appears that rooms are allocated on arrival, we were offered 8th floor which we declined, we eventualy got 30th floor with strip views, 2 queen beds, the room was fantastic, bang up to date, his and hers sinks, with tv in the bathroom, flatscreen tv, lounge area, very clean and no smell as I'd booked a smoking room. Can't fault the hotel, staff all very attentive and polite. On the down side, it is very expensive, coffee was $6.00 for a frothy white coffee, we had to pay $20.00 per day resort fee, I don't actualy know what this if for but alot of Vegas hotels are charging this, £150.00 deposit this again is if you dare touch the mini-bar or the goodies on top of the cabinet. The buffett was very good $80.00 for a couple, the location, well it's at one end of the strip, but when you go to Vegas expect to do plenty of walking. On the whole a fabulous hotel, try to stay in Vegas during the week, it's not as busy, and it's cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Wynner
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights comped and paid for 2. Unbelievable hotel. The room is so nice I am redoing my bedroom just like it! Everything about the Encore was great. I will only stay here when in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Encore for sure!!”
Reviews.Author: Noodle362
Reviews.Content: The Encore is a gorgeous hotel. Although on the boundaries towards no "mans land" and the deserted end of the strip its still in a good position and close to the other hotels and fashion show mall. We had a strip view on the 51st floor and views were pretty awesome! The suites are large, airy and tastefully decorated, the bed far too comfy and the bathroom had huge shower room, bath, 2 sinks and still big enough to hold a small party in! The 2 pools that we found were beautiful and got a lot of sun throughout the day. Free pool towel rental and comfy beds awaited. The pool also opened at 9am so you didnt get greedy sunbathers saving the "good beds" before sunrise! Also drink service was frequent plus free pots of grapes not necessary but such a lovely touch. The hotel itself was grande and beautiful inside it had a large open casino floor with assortment of games and croupiers very friendly. The restuarants we visited were all very wonderful in their own right and sadly due to so much choice we did not get time to eat in all those we wanted. Shops were very high end fashion Prada, Gucci, Oscar de la renta, Tiffany etc but nice to have there if you win have a big win! I love Vegas, have been many times before and I would put Encore up there with my favorite of hotels to stay in. Encore is a good name. Steve Wynn has done well

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel in Vegas - only thing that would make it better would be winning.”
Reviews.Author: cr8it
Reviews.Content: This is just a spectacularly perfect hotel. They do everything right. The staff is wonderful and the rooms are gorgeous. This was a return trip, and we will go back again. We had a panoramic view of the strip from the 60 th floor. If you can hit the Spa - it must be one of the best in the world. We also ate at Red 8 - very tasty and not too fancy. SW Steakhouse - shared the spicy Rib Eye that was over the top wonderful, and the sommelier provided us with a recommendation for a great Spanish wine that was quite a treat (and relatively reasonable --- especially considering that they featured a wine for $14,000). You did not need to go to a show when we were there, as it was Halloween, which made people watching in the Casino better than any show Vegas has to offer. Would like it if it were non-smoking - but that just doesn't seem to happen in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: LivingtheCaliDream
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family & husband over the period of 3 nights. Fabulous hotel - probably my favorite in Vegas. Great location, walking distance to most places and/or short cab ride. We ate at several of the restaurants (Buffet - very good), and Switch (very cool and my in-laws enjoyed it). Gambled a bit too. All in all, the service is amazing and the place is just very luxe. I like how once you get in your room, you can't hear anything - it's pure quiet. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: north12345john
Reviews.Content: Attention to detail was fantastic throughout this hotel everything from the rooms to corridors to the lobby and casino would not stay anywere else in las vegas no we have stayed at the wynn, the class isupper class to all the other hotels, one problem was check in took a while thats mh only issue.

Reviews.Title: “5 star”
Reviews.Author: Westwood627
Reviews.Content: What can I say that has not been already said. Yes this Hotel is immaculate, yes the service is first class, yes the room was amazing, yes the beds are unbelievably soft, yes the music from the night club is a problem if you stay on the South side, no we did not have to pay the resort charge. After staying at the Encore it has spoilt me for future Hotel stays as I know they will not be as good.

Reviews.Title: “A special experience- A Resort on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Ted8360
Reviews.Content: Our mini-suite was beautifully decorated in a high end contemporary style, fabulous bed. It seems like they didn't skimp in decorating the whole hotel complex, elegant yet modern. The hotel is almost at the north end of the strip and away from a lot of the foot traffic and what looks as thousands of people checking out every lobby and casino in sight. Don't get me wrong, there were many people but it was less crowded than the main part of the strip. (We liked it better, we are in our 60's.) The room was clean & bright, the bathroom spacious and our view overlooked the pool area. We did make it to the pool every day that we were there and it was delightful. All the help we spoke to were curteous and friendly. It seemed to us that the hotel had mostly younger (20's-30's) people than a lot of the other hotels. They were better dressed, especially at night and well mannered. We stayed here because Garth Brooks was performing last weekend and we weren't dissappointed. We enjoyed looking in the shops, & shopping and ate several meals in the hotels. All excellent: Society, Lakeside Grill & Wing Lei. We also enjoyed the dueling piano bar.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: franklyspeaking22
Reviews.Content: We started at a another hotel to try to save some money, thinking we wouldn't be in hotel room very much so who cares...well after 10 minutes in other hotel we knew it was time to move on....looked on line and for $100 more we could stay at Encore so figured we'd give it a try. WOW. Great hotel, unbelievable spa, really cool pool, great restaurants -- casino is fine but not unlike every other top rate casino only minor downside is it's at end of strip so getting anywhere else for shows or dinner can be a hassle. But spa was so great it's worth it - do the Couples Retreat!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: sb007_10
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel and incredible attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: eatonsneck
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Encore Hotel in a year. What can I say? This hotel along with the Wynn is absolutely amazing. The first thing that hits you when you enter the lobby is the glorious scent of flowers and Asian Rain the Wynn's signature fragrance oil. Smells great! The hotel is very, very clean and everyone working here is very polite and helpful. Since we were only staying three nights we decided to make our dinner reservations at the hotels restaurants. There really is no need to get into a taxi and spend a lot of money when the best food is right there. We tried the SW steakhouse and it was spectacular along with beautiful views of the lake. Pretty much every restaurant in Wynn/Encore you can't go wrong. The rooms are all suites with floor to ceiling windows and super clean and again that amazing smell. I could go on, and on but I will end with the SPA at the Encore. It is the most beautiful place I have ever seen. The smell, cleanliness and staff were off the charts. Not pushy, trying to sell you a million different products, just did their job and did it well. I decided one day to go to Canyon Ranch Spa at the Venetian just to compare....no comparison it was like a meat market in there and the clients were cattle. My first turnoff was when I was handed my bathrobe from the assigned locker and it was filthy, covered in woman's face makeup. YUCK! Don't hesitate to book at the En ore/Wynn. Beautiful hotels

Reviews.Title: “A trip of a lifetime!!!”
Reviews.Author: hueyx5
Reviews.Content: I have traveled for business for the past 27 years. This is the nicest place I have ever stayed and I have stayed at teh best. The resort has everything and anything you could ask for. Of course it comes with a price tag, there is a dive 4 blocks away for 89 per night, that I am sure comes with soem things as well.........If you want to be treated like royalty and stay at a total CLASS Act resort this is the one. I will NEVER stay anywhere else while in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Bring Your Wallet”
Reviews.Author: NPHiker
Reviews.Content: Valet, check-in, and bell service were excellent. Our suite was nicely decorated throughout with floor-to-ceiling windows across the whole living room. Food choices galore without ever leaving the building. After seeing a couple of other hotels while attending shows, the Encore is very high-end in both decor and clientele. We also noted that the Encore is much less crowded and noisy than the Wynn, so choose according to your preference, since the facilities are connected by a short walk through a high fashion shopping area. The only downside is the prices on food and sundries - $40 per person plus drinks for the buffet dinner, $12 beers, $20 for fruit, a bagel, and juice for breakfast, and a $9 toothbush. There is also a mandatory resort fee of $20 per day, ostensibly to cover wireless, phone, and gym access. Be sure to re-check rates on the room - our rate was lowered by $90 per night when I checked a couple of days before our arrival and I had no issue with re-booking.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flighty31
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a number of high end Vegas hotels. Such as the Venetian/Palazzo I thought I had seen the best of what Vegas has to offer but I think the Wynn Encore might just be my new favourite. Check in was a breeze and the staff could not be more courteous or helpful. We had a suite on the 52nd floor which had a view of downtown Vegas and a golf course. I personally would not pay extra for a strip view as I don't feel it is worth the money. The suite was incredible, very spacious and well set out. Even though the bedroom is not separated from the living area with a door it does feel like you are in a separate room. The bedside controls for the lights and curtains is a good touch as are the floor to ceiling windows and mirrors. I think the only way the room could be improved is to have a jacuzzi in the bathroom. I also liked that the mini bar was on a timed weighted system so you could actually have a look at the products for up to 60 seconds and if you decided not to buy it you could replace it and not be charged. The hotel itself is reasonably compact (on a Vegas scale) , the casino in the Encore seemed smaller and quieter that many of the others, which I personally liked, however it is directly connected to the Wynn which has a considerably larger gaming floor if you wanted that atmosphere. I would not hesitate to stay at the Wynn Encore given the opportunity in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Encore is the greatest”
Reviews.Author: marq7654
Reviews.Content: Steve Wynn didn't cut any corners on this hotel. The rooms a re the best I've seen on the strip so far. The amenities include a nice TV in the nice spacious bathroom, large lounging area & bedroom that includes electronic shutting of the drapes & light. The hotel's decor is a red and butterfly with almost smokeless casinos. I can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: TomC97
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 4 night stay at the Encore. The hotel & casino service cannot be faulted although I wish I'd won a bit more. Had a panoramic strip view room on the 63rd floor and did not hear any clud noise. The buffet, whilst costly, has a wide range of choices to meet all food preferences. TomC

Reviews.Title: “Mr. Wynn, not so fabulous as you say!”
Reviews.Author: bizwarrior
Reviews.Content: To all those who love the property, sorry. I thought it was quite below the expectations described by others. My check in with Alisa was not too smooth. I was promised a 30 minute early check in. She wSn't able to find a room until I pushed hard due to a meeting commitment and a plea for a shower! Alisa has lots of facts confused. Each "ameniity" required that I fight back with what I was told. Amenities as promised were not delivered either. It feels like a bait and switch. Typical LV. The front desk isn't knowledgable about the property or those around it. I found simple requests impossible to fulfill. Highlights: great suite and in-room dining. From the call through the service to the food were all done superbly. The Encore Tower is strict on entering and I was aggressively demanded proof of staying at the suites. Mini bar is charged by weight. If it moves for more 60 seconds, you bought it. It was hard to get concierge help. They always seemed stretched. Often, calls were not returned as promised. Spa was also not great. The waiting area was standing room only. For a $200 service, standing for nearly 15 minutes isn't okay. I was surprised. Finally, I asked to speak to a manager a few times. No one ever reached out, called. Nothing. The property is physically pretty and ornate. For all the Encore hype, it was a big let down.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique feel with amenities and customer service”
Reviews.Author: pman383838
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers convenience and customer service better than other hotels in Las Vegas. The pool, spa, and morning coffee are very convenient to the elevator, this is not true at many Las Vegas hotels, where the pool is a 1/4 mile walk from the elevator. The customer service was 99% outstanding, quick drink service, prompt room service, treated very well despite gambling small amounts of money. Nice mix of conventioneers, gamblers, younger and older. The south facing rooms have a better view of the strip, but can have nightclub noise, the north facing rooms view some construction and mountains, and are very quiet. Spa and fitness center are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: meandtheoldman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Las Vegas on a few occasions, but this far surpassed everywhere else we have stayed. Location - Great, connected to the Wynn and across the road from the fashion show mall, perfect! Room - OMG totally amazing and soooooooooooo comfortable, you will find it hard to leave even to enjoy the many sights/experiences Vegas has to offer - especially if your jet lagged! We never experienced any problems with noise or loss of sleep quality, everything was spotlessly cleaned everyday. You have your room key which acts like a credit card while you are within the complex - so convenient, though maybe a little dangerous after a couple of cocktails! The staff were all very helpful, polite & nothing was too much trouble. I really couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David E
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Encore in Vegas. 1st impressions at arrival were v good friendly & quick check in. Excellent standard of room amazing bed huge & comfortable. Tried room service, food was good but slightly expensive. Pool area was good only issue was the shade caused by the Wynne hotel for approx 30min at 1pm. Went to the Botero restaurant for a meal. Great atmosphere, great food seared tuna was fab. Only downside was wine prices couldn't get a bottle under £100. Would recommend this hotel stayed at the Ballagio last year would rate this hotel slightly better. Only thing to warn against are prices but if you want to stay at a top notch hotel you must pay top notch prices. All in all stunning hotel well worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Roystontraveller
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, friendly helpful staff, I couldn't fault this hotel in anyway. Not the cheapest but you get what you pay for!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Chic”
Reviews.Author: Freja3
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, luxurious and large rooms with super comfy beds, excellent choices of entertainment and dining. No need to leave property. Impeccable service. Prepare to pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: rbgilder
Reviews.Content: Was at Encore for a conference in mid-October. Everything was perfect. Was on the 25th floor facing the strip. Standard room is very large with a big couch. Everything was extremely clean including the bathroom. The bed was firm and perfect. Had room service one night. Full menu available 24/7. Huge portions but excellent food. $49 for a lunch type meal though. Some people noted the noise from the club outside. That club is Surrender and was on the ground floor directly below my room. Directly below as in 25 floors directly below. I never heard any music at night. But one friend staying on the 26th floor said he heard and was annoyed by it. Said it really kicked in about midnight. Overall great stay. I have also stayed at the Wynn. Basically the same thing although the lobby of the Wynn seems more happening with more of a scene. Encore seems small by comparison. Not sure how that is possible since they both are massive towers. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Chrissylou62
Reviews.Content: Loved the Entire experience at Encore. Stunning suite with opulent but tasteful fit-out. Service delivery was faultess & the restaurants, bars & casino area are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, well kept property, service could be better”
Reviews.Author: chrizNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Las Vegas for 2 days only, stayed in Encore for both nights. I'll start with the positives. The location of the hotel was great. It's at the northern end of the strip, within walking distance to Treasure Island, Venetian and Mirage. I'm talking about 30 mins or less walking. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. The restaurants in Wynn and Encore were all very good. Lots of selection at the buffet and the dessert were so delicious. Swimming pool was big and water was very warm and comfortable. Not sure if the pool was heated but the water temperature was just about right. Now let's talk about the negatives. I checked in at 3pm, and was told my room was not ready. Tthere were 50+ people ahead of me waiting for rooms and it could take few hours before getting one. I was offered to upgrade to a suite for $30 more per night. Wait a minute, I had to pay more to stay at a suite which I didn't really need or wait for few hours? No way. I decided to wait for one hour for the room. When I returned to lobby at 4pm, they still didn't have a room and asked for upgrade again. I was very upset and let the lady know that I wasn't going to upgrade unless the hotel absorbs the fee. Well, miraculously, one room became available and I was given a key immediately. I'm still upset to this date. If the hotel over booked their rooms, they should offer free upgrade, and that's how they retain customers.

Reviews.Title: “A true Vegas luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jgirl007
Reviews.Content: AMAZING room and views from the King Panarama suite. Try to book on the south side to get a view of the Vegas Strip. We had the view of the mountains and Old Vegas on the north side which was ok, but not as great as the other. Also, booking a King room only guarantees you will be in the top 10 floors if you are a smoker, only the top 15 if you insist on a non smoking room. Beware the very expensive, greasy breakfast sandwiches at the cafe near check in and try room service instead. Poolside service was stellar, concierge was excellent, but Le Rev was underwhelming. Go see Cirque 'O' instead if you want a really great water show. Competitive with the Belagio for sure. I kept scanning the interior for where they might have cheaper out in decore but they haven't cut corners anywhere. It isn't Dubai, but one if the nicest hotels Vegas has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Opulence”
Reviews.Author: blandab
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on honeymoon in June 2011 and, despite United Airlines doing their best to ruin our stay by cancelling our flight and costing us a day and a night in Vegas (never again), the pure opulence and wonderful staff made our stay an amazing experience. We stayed in a tower suite (got it on tripadvisor - rates for about $325/night AUD) and it was beautiful, complete with strip and pool view and electronic everything. From the tv to the blinds it is all remote controlled, you almost don't want to leave the room! We did however and found the shopping (although a little pricy, but hey it is a top line Vegas Casino after all), the grounds/pools and the restaurants were all unbelievable. The only slight downside I will say is that the casino is mainly for big players it seems (high table minimums) and lacks a little atmosphere, but I must say we are not big gamblers and were happy to stay on the slots, where we were always looked after with a constant supply of drinks (much better service than other casinos in Vegas I have experienced). The major bonus of staying in the hotel we found however was VIP entry into all of the Wynns night and day spots, the Sunday pool party is a must and the highlight of our stay. Overall I would have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone, but I would caution it is not for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but gamblers beware”
Reviews.Author: Chad M
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights for a bachelor party and rooms are oversized, very plush, and great room service. However, if you are looking to gamble, stay elsewhere. I found out afterwards that many pros play at this casino and their rules are extremely tight. After rolling for 30 minutes and winning a nice amount on the craps table, Murray, the pit boss, kicked me off for not hitting the back wall enough. I go to Vegas often and have never seen this. The table was irrate when he pulled the dice from me. Apparently, this is how the Encore controls winning, which is most peoples goal when going to Vegas. If you want to gamble, stay somewhere else...I will.

Reviews.Title: “price gougers”
Reviews.Author: diverUsa
Reviews.Content: I will admit it- the property was gorgeous. However, the degree of price gouging was shameless- $20 per day to use the gym, and no coffee maker in the room???!!!! I have traveled extensively, and never seen this. I do consider it inhumane to have to leave the room to forage for caffeine. The beds were not that great- nice and soft, however whenever you rolled over the other person felt it.

Reviews.Title: “Wynn Encore - Oct 13- 16”
Reviews.Author: trvlynwilburys
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Vegas and I had a tough time deciding which hotel to book. I couldn't decide between the Veneitian, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan, Aria or Wynn. Finally I thought the rooms at the Wynn Encore appealed to me the most -- the room was a suite and not just a room. Throughout our time in Vegas, I walked through every lobby and casino of the hotels that I was considering and was thrilled I made the right choice.The furnishings looked modern and reasonably new. I had no regrets whatsoever after finally booking the Encore; especially after finding we did spend alot of time in our suite after partying long and hard the night before. The hotel was beautiful, classy, elegant and more importantly the casino did not smell strongly of smoke. The chandeliers, carpeting and even the casino girls looked great - no trashy go-go dancers on tables. Also, the hotel guests did not look like Vegas riffraff - definetely a higher standard here of guests and services. I utilized the concierge services on 3 or 4 occasions and service was impeccable. I'll definetely book this hotel again. The food in 3 of the restaurants we tried was excellent (Wynn brunch buffet, Cafe next to pool, Country club). We went to the XS club and had a blast! The shopping was excellent. My husband enjoyed his time in the Ferrari/Maserati dealership.

Reviews.Title: “The Encore is Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Joanne W
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a wonderful 11 night stay. We love the hotel, dine at all the restaurants at both the Wynn and Encore, enjoy the atmosphere and appreciate that a lot of the staff recognize us and go out of there way to give us first class service. We love the Encore!!

Reviews.Title: “Roll on our next visit!”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: To celebrate our 25th anniversary, my wife and I deceided to do something completely different to what we had ever done before. 1st time to Vegas, indeed, 1st time to USA. We had booked through a tour operator and had booked a deluxe king. At check-in we were offered an upgrade to Tower Suite for only $30 per night, an offer which we eagerly accepted. WOW! A view right down the strip,(we were offerd the choice of strip or desert) large, comfortable bed, huge bathroom and large sitting area. At check-in, we were asked by the clerk, Erika, if we were there for a special occassion and told her why we were there. Imagine our delight on returning to our room, on Monday afternoon, to find a half bottle of champagne, chocolate dipped strawberries and a card, all courtesy of Erika, a very splendid gesture which was much appreciated. We found the hotel to be very well maintained, clean and immaculately kept. All the staff, from restroom attendants to senior members of management were always polite and courteous. Nothing seemed too much trouble for anyone, and no-one minded being asked for various information, no matter how trivial. Would we return? You bet your bottom dollar. Plans are already underway. We were both totally blown away by our first experience of the USA, Vegas and particularly of the Encore, that we feel compelled to return to make sure it was as good as it was. It can't come quick enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and lovely property-shame about the nightclubs”
Reviews.Author: benbee1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Encore for 2 weeks in June/July. The good: Loved the suite, almost prefect. Everything about the room was very good. Check in staff, security all good. Food outlets, very good. The bad: The Encore has big nightclubs inside, and the attached Wynn has more clubs. Now I like partying but the problem is all the drunks which it brings to the property. I did see people throwing up in the casino, shouting and overall the late atmosphere in both Wynn and Encore was not good. They will lose are losing many good Asian gamblers by this.There is also some noise from the XS which can be heard in the rooms, which is more like a thumping bass sound. It was not loud and did not bother me (22 floor) Overall if you can get a deal, its a top place. But get mum or grandma out of the casino by 1am !

Reviews.Title: “great place to enjoy Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MjsAjs
Reviews.Content: This trip was planned as a get-together for my sister & I who live on opposite sides of the country. Our husbands joined us for a wonderful weekend. I've never spent 3 days at a property and not run into some staff member(s) who were unpleasant, but at the Encore, the staff actually was a major contributor to our enjoyment of our few days together. They are uniformly polite, friendly, knowledgeable and conversant. Every staff member we encountered was terrific. I kept waiting for someone to be less than gracious, but it never happened. From check-in to departure, we were pleased with the service we received. The property itself is outstanding -we went on a special offer and got a terrific deal - clean, beautiful and comfortable, with plenty to do at all hours of the day or night. A perfect place for a mini family reunion.

Reviews.Title: “Really? 5-Star?”
Reviews.Author: Wardimus
Reviews.Content: Never been to a 5-Star hotel and had a certificate I wanted to use. Enlightening experience. High expectations dashed. Main room and bathroom, while large, were nothing special. Beds (I'll admit) were very nice. Service was decent, but nothing out of the ordinary. Location is at the far end of the strip so be prepared to walk or cab or bus. VERY loud nightclub around one of the pools until late, so be sure to choose a room as high up and facing away from the pools as possible. Gaming rewards points only valid at Wynn and Encore while other properties span several hotels and locations. While hyped for the LGBT "Pride Concierge" at the Encore, none existed and the regular concierge had no information (they did have some information at the Wynn next door). Concierge was not empowered to make things right. If you choose to stay here, also be sure to get the resort package which includes wireless access to smart phone data plans and the gym area (you will have weak - if any - wireless data otherwise). Be prepared to pay top dollar a-la-carte for everything at this 5-star (only a 4-Star in other cities from my experience). Very elitist environment - which I suppose is the point. Example: nicer pool chairs are "reserved" by the pool staff for higher-end guests and they sit empty most if not all day. A "regular joe" who pays only $300-$500 per night for their room will be relegated to the back the rows of pool chairs.... Ahhhhh - only in Vegas - and in America - baby!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch! Love This Place!”
Reviews.Author: jmsdean28
Reviews.Content: Where to start? The hotel is beautiful, I have no complaints whatsoever! The rooms are well kept, very modern and if you get a room facing the strip, you won't be let down. Our room looked out over the pool and the Wynn, which reflects the most gorgeous sunrise and sunsets. Extra charge for the roll away (a night) was a bit much, BUT for the money you spend here, you get the best service in return. The casino plays the best eclectic music, it's not loud or smokey. Very inviting and even worth getting up early to take a morning walk through the casino and esplanade. See the cirque show - the best I've ever experienced. We dined at Stratta, the Buffet (Wynn) and Wazuzu. Stratta has some great dinners, the Buffet had EVERYTHING under the sun and the quality was fresh, and Wazuzu had the best sushi. Again, no complaints here - parking was easy, check it was a snap, room was clean, staff is super friendly and you just can't go wrong over all. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A welcome respite!”
Reviews.Author: LilJalapeno
Reviews.Content: We just had a great time. The friendliness and the service from the staff really stood out, and the hotel didn't have that "stuffy" attitude all to common at high end hotels. The whole hotel just had a nice mellow vibe. Great fitness center and nice spa facilities, you can't go wrong here. Oh, and the food was excellent too! Thanks to everyone for a job well done...we will be back. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer service!”
Reviews.Author: giantkrash
Reviews.Content: Erika in registration was great. Professional and so very helpful. Room is amazing. Bell service, Paul,was great. So far so good!

Reviews.Title: “Encore is beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Peg630
Reviews.Content: I was so surprised when I walked into Encore that it didn't smell like smoke like every hotel on the strip! I have asthma so it was great not having to choke every time I go through the door. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. It's not a themed hotel but the decorations are exquisite, love the red & butterflies! Our room is extremely comfortable, very spacious and spotlessly clean. Great tolietry items as well. Pools were good, we can always find suntanning beds and the pools are not too crowded. They provide iced water nearby. We had a massage at the spa and it was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. You've got to splurge because it's the best massage I've ever had. We ended up being at the spa all afternoon because we couldn't bear to leave. Only a couple of downsides: Location is far from everything else as it's at the end of the strip. Also service is not very personal. I was there with a few friends to celebrate us turning 30 this year, I had emailed Encore in advance to see if they would make our special trip more special (usually hotels offer upgrades etc) but they never responded nor did they do anything special. My friends who stayed at Mandarin Oriental at the same trip was treated with birthday cake, fruits and personal cards. Not huge problem though as we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Highly recommend it if you don't mind a longer walk.

Reviews.Title: “Garth Brooks Package”
Reviews.Author: aledo99
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic experience! The hotel staff working at the Tower Suites in the Encore are doing a wonderful job!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !!”
Reviews.Author: BobB53
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in Las Vegas. We got an amazing deal through lowcostUSA.com and cannot believe how little we paid for our three days here. Having walked around all the other hotels on the Strip this was definitely the best. It has class written all over it. Our room was amazing. The casino is so much better than all the others (I'm not a great gambler). Very good pool areas. A variety of good restaurants. Fantasticly helpful and friendly staff on the front desk and concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Say No More!”
Reviews.Author: donsieAdelaide
Reviews.Content: The Encore was fabulous from start to finish! We have just returned from a 7 night stay in a luxurious suite on the 62nd Floor. The room was large,spacious and clean, with a separate living area. The television was inbetween the living area and bedroom and could spin around to face either! Beautiful Big Bathroom with double vanity area, and separate toilet! Met some people staying on the lower floors and they could here the nightclub music into the night. The hotel facilites are fabulous with a choice of many restaurants, nightclubs and shops, and if you are into Gambling of course a Casino. You also have access to all the facilites within the Wynn Hotel and Casino. There are two pools an Adults only and a family pool, which seemed more popular as this pool was in the sun for a longer period, and you can access the pool at the Wynn also.
