Pool service was great, with complimentary iced water available and complimentary grapes were offered throughout the day. The Poolside Menu has a great choice of snacks, smoothies and drinks. All the staff at the encore are polite, friendly and at your service so please remember to tip them. We were here for a work conference and the facilities for this were wonderful. Yes you are charged the resort fees and you do have to pay for internet. The location of this complex is great just far enough from the mayhem at the centre of the strip, and just close enough to take part if you wish. Located directly across from the Fashion Show Mall for great shopping, and more restaurants, I recommend Maggiano's and Segundo's. And a close taxi ride to the northern Premium Outlets for really good shopping and a visit to Downtown Vegas a must at night to see the Freemont Street Lights! We had to opportunity to see "Le Reve" I highly recommend this show, amazing! Overall we really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend to anyone, remember to venture out and explore the many restaurants, bars and entertainment that Las Vegas has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love”
Reviews.Author: Janet Q
Reviews.Content: Encore is one of the best places to stay in Las Vegas. My husband and I have stayed here many times and will continue to come back. Service at the Wynn & Encore are superior to any other hotel in Las Vegas! There is not much more to say restraunts, spa, pool, clubs and shops are all rated 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “A Gold Standard”
Reviews.Author: fls114
Reviews.Content: The Encore at Wynn exceeded all expectation for a hotel. I stayed three nights for a conference, and was awed as soon as I stepped into my room. The suite was large and smartly designed. The 40+ inch flat screen tv swiveled so that it could be watched in bed or in the living area. The bathroom had every detail you could ever want from a divine shower with bench to the separate soaking tub. With the flick of a button you could control the room lights and curtains. The rest of the hotel wasn't too shabby either. It'd be nice to see shops that people could actually afford to go to (I'm not sure I ever noticed anyone in any of them). Lunch at the Society Cafe was tops. I was there on business but if I were making a return trip for pleasure I'd certainly try and stay at the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Encore”
Reviews.Author: playinthesand
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 2nd stay at the Encore and it was as great as the first time 1 1/2 years ago. My husband and I stayed in a standard king room. I requested non-smoking and a quiet room and we were given a room on the 39 floor with a view of the most northern strip and mountains. A great view in my opinion and we never had a noise issue. The bed and linens are wonderful. Very comfortable. The casino is beautiful and surprisingly very smoke free compared to many on the strip. We did not eat at any of the on-site restaurants because I don't believe in spending that much money on a meal. The pool area is very nice but at this time of year, the limited sunny deck areas were fustrating for many people. The Wynn next door blocks most of the sun by 2 pm at the regular pool and the European pool was shaded most of the day. It was nice that the staff come by several times a day with fruit snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Tower Suites... Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia B
Reviews.Content: Daniella was our front desk person that helped us. She did a fabulous job and went out of her way to ask us each day about our stay and offer suggestions for activities and meals. She found out it was my husbands birthday and sent him chocolates to the room. Our stay was made extra special due to her extra personal attention which we really appreciated. Thank you so much and you should definitely make sure you keep her representing the Encore Tower Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: FrauBell60
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the encore. My daughter was married at the primrose court in the Wynn on 4 th October. The experience was amazing. Our rooms at the encore were better than we could ever have expected. Massive and very comfortable with luxurious fittings! If I had to complain about anything it would be the lack of tea/ coffee making facilities, the hotel is so large it takes ages to get to a restaurant/ bar for a quick coffee! The mini bar has everything but beware as soon as you take anything from the large selection it gets charged at an inflated rate to your room....ok if you have an unlimited budget. The breakfast at the buffet in the Wynn was fantastic value at 23 dollars per person, there was everything you could possibly want and more! We had paid for a wedding package including some photos, some flowers etc but the sky's the limit. We went to view the pictures two days later the extra package for DVD, photo disc and more photos etc was 9700 dollars but if we bought them on the day it was going to be a bargain price of 5700 dollars............we never bought the extra package!! I would certainly return to the encore as we had the time of our life. Be sure to tip the waitress when you are gambling....even slot machines and they will bring you drinks all night, a bonus as you can pay a fortune for spirits etc. Tips for staff were a big part of our expenditure so beware...everyone expects tips.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Outsource
Reviews.Content: The overall comment has to be great in defining my experiences at the Encore. Room was big, well appointed, luxurious, well... great. The service was fast, attentive, great. The collection of restaurants give you a great variety and some fantastic food, great. The shows, great. Gambling, great. Well, I am getting kind of monotonous. Have visited LV for over forty, from being a kid to now, my fifty's. This place stole my heart, goodbye Bellagio, Caesars... Great for all ages. Now I haven't personally experienced, but I am told the club scene at the Encore is the best on the strip and seeing the massive lines, beautiful people and the pure sounds of some great partying, makes me wish I was a few decades younger. Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: hudson2680
Reviews.Content: The Wynne encore is a stunning hotel, with large roooms, with some great views of the strip ( depending on which room you get as some views look like they could be restricted)bathroooms are and have a tv in there, check in was very quick and efficient and staff friendly. Pool area very clean and enjoyable. Would recommend the Wynn buffett its to die for!! There is a good selecton of restuaruants in the wynn and encore but as expected in a 5* hotel in Vegas there are on the pricy side. Would recomend this hotel, especially if you are wanting to make your holiday special.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Experience”
Reviews.Author: Darrell T
Reviews.Content: We can not say enough about the friendliness we felt from the entire staff. Our room was magnificent with so many surprising amenities. Often one "stays away" from the higher end hotels; not anymore. Our experience was first class.

Reviews.Title: “birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: Nola T
Reviews.Content: It is hard for me to say better than expected because the caliber of the property is such that you expect it to be what it is. Walking into Encore is a pleasure. The feeling of luxury is everywhere, the fresh flowers, the welcoming staff, and the total ambience. The rooms are extremely comfortable. Everything you could want. Bought the entire bedlinen set. Cannot say enough wonderful things about this property. Everywhere I went I was wished Happy Birthday.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience on all fronts”
Reviews.Author: Marty K
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed at the Four Seasons I was to be in Vegas for three days with my wife who had never been there before. The Encore/Wynn experience was first class. Every employee was well trained and we never encountered any problems. At check-in we upgraded to the 58th floor for $20 more per night and heard none of the disco noise mentioned elsewhere. Dinner at Sinatra was excellent in both service and cuisine. One negative was finding a blackjack table below $25 at night but I think that's the norm unless you want to play during the daytime. I would not hesitate to recommend either the Wynn or the Encore and will definitely stay there again in the future....

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: gwbca
Reviews.Content: I wanted to thank Robin for her excellent service and going out of her way to making my birthday celebration special. Robin works in both the Encore Lobby Bar and the Eastside Lounge. Robin's customer service performance really stands out above most and I really appreciate her professionalism and service at the Eastside Lounge when my wife and I were there celebrating my Birthday. Thank You. It's because of you and people like you I keep coming back to the Encore. I look forward to my next visit. Thank You again, Gary

Reviews.Title: “Men - Bring your shoes!”
Reviews.Author: LouiseNYC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wynn Hotel in Las Vegas September 13-16. We reserved for dinner ((by calling their dining reservation number) at Sinatra's. We were told that the dress code was "business casual." I had no problem with that. Then I said we also wanted to dine, the following evening, at Switch. Both restaurants are in the Encore. Arriving at Switch we were greeted, a "dining check" or whatever it is was printed out and we were asked to step to one side. I assumed it was to wait for the hostess to seat us. Then we were informed that, due to the dress code, we would not be seated. My husband was wearing slacks and a button down shirt. The problem was that he was wearing leather sandals (with socks.) Men are not allowed in with sandals. My husband pointed out that I was wearing sandals. That was OK, as I was a woman. They then told us to wait while they phoned the manager. When he came, my husband was given the once-over and we were not to be seated. Then the hostess sweetly said that they would hold the table if my husband wanted to return to our room and change into shoes! All this for a restaurant that did not even have tablecloths. At that point we told them to forget it and we walked away. We wound up having a lovely dinner in Botero's - also in the Encore - with tablecloths. Afterwards, I told the hostess about our experience. She said the decision is usually made on a case to case basis. How discriminating!

Reviews.Title: “The Encore stands heads and shoulders above the competion.”
Reviews.Author: AimeSki
Reviews.Content: If you chose to stay here you just have to accept that Mr Wynn knows how to part you from your money, but he does provide you with one of the best hotels in Vegas from which to do so. Check In : A long queue on arrival on Sunday, but we were able to go to our room early. We also got a 1pm checkout. Room: Amazing and a reasonable price. Floor to ceiling windows, a large corner sofa, TV's in room and bathroom. But no tea/coffee maker and DO NOT EVEN MOVE ANYTHING FROM THE MINI BAR OR THE SNACKS ON TOP, you incur an immediate charge. If you leave the hotel by the Encore exit and turn left there is a strip with a small liquor store (and a Denny's). Noise: We had a 20th floor strip view. The XS Club did not affect me, but the Beach Club required earplugs, however I knew this was a trade off for a strip view. Big plus, you do not have to trudge through a casino to reach the elevators. We had great sunset views as well. Casino: I am a real cheapskate gambler. But the drinks were provided even for the likes of me on the 50c Blackjack machines with good grace. The casino decor is really gorgeous, both in the Encore and the Wynn. I did not visit the Aria to compare, but no other hotel that I visited was as visually stunning. Dining: I ate at the Lakeside restaurant. We had a great table on the terrace to view the Lake of Dreams - You have to see it for yourself to decide if you like it, I loved it in a weird way. You can also see this show from the parasol bar. Distance: You are at the end of the strip, but right across from the fashion mall. To view all of the strip we took a $7 all day pass on the Deuce bus. We walked as far as the Eiffel Tower, no problem. Pools: Nice but not stunning. but I did not go to Vegas to sunbathe. I would return to the Encore in a heartbeat. I

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Joshua G
Reviews.Content: Our stay far exceeded our expectations on EVERY level. The room was phenominal (considering quality of design, view of the city, and comfort). The staff was so attentive and friendly, making us feel like we were a part of the Wynn family. I cannot say enough great things about our visit and will definitely be staying @ Encore when we return.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AT ENCORE AT WYNN LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: Mario J
Reviews.Content: What an experience!! I have been going to the Wynn since it opened and the experience is as good at the Encore as it was at the Wynn. Wynn and Encore are at the top of it's game in all facets. From the staff to the appearance there is no match in Vegas. Thank you for always making my visits smooth and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “caring”
Reviews.Author: barbara s
Reviews.Content: my husband is disabled and the care he recieved was remarkable. the staff was so helpful.and polite

Reviews.Title: “Modern Luxury Amongst Chaos”
Reviews.Author: KiwiGirl69
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference. Gorgeous property. Very modern, clean and HUGE on every level. The rooms were large, lovely, quiet and beautifully decorated. The food in the hotel was some of the best I've had both as part of the conference and when we dined socially in the hotel (Botero was particulary good) The XS nightclub is truly spectacular - what an incredible venue The pool area was ok. Stayed at the Bellagio earlier this year on a personal trip and the pools there were amazing in comparison. The Encore is at the north end of the strip so it is quite a walk to where the action is - this isnt a bad thing but something to be aware of Overall great hotel - service was good given the huge crowds they have to attend to

Reviews.Title: “Setting the bar higher.”
Reviews.Author: cubmanruss
Reviews.Content: Steve Wynn's Encore hotel is an incredible property. The rooms are exceptional. The lobby/casino is tastefully decorated while remaining visually interesting. We had a cabana at the Encore's European pool. The service was friendly and efficient. The pool itself is nothing spectacular but the overall vibe was classy but sexy. Every member of the Encore staff that we interacted with was excellent. This is now my favorite Vegas property.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: Rachel_and_Simon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore in September 2010 for our honeymoon. We had a lovely time. The hotel is very modern and clean and they gave us a quiet room away from the elevators as we requested. They also brought us up some homemade chocolates as a little celebratory gift on our arrival. We love Las Vegas - we highly recommend the champagne buffet at the Wynn hotel which is connected to the Encore hotel. it is a bit pricey but definately worth it. We were on a smoking floor which was dissapointing as we are non smokers but you honestly couldn't smell it when you were in the room which was a good thing. Our last day was a friday and they had a pool party with a dj playing, this is good if you are into that sort of thing. would definately stay here again and we thought the slots had a higher pay out rate than any other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, top notch!”
Reviews.Author: agbrock
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with great views. A conference took me here with a reasonable rate. 2 pools and a Ferrari dealership. My room was very spacious, clean and included works of art. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Resort!”
Reviews.Author: AnnG901
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end our visit to the Encore was first class. Service was professional and attentive from the valet who greeted us to the front desk associate to the housekeeper. Our suite... loved the floor to ceiling windows, the king bed was fit for an emperor and the soaking tub... heaven on earth. Society Cafe was excellent for any meal! We especially loved the succulent Cowboy Steak!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice strip hotel, but can't call Encore a resort”
Reviews.Author: BogeyMike
Reviews.Content: Encore is a great hotel in terms of decorations and amenities but I don’t think it is a top rated resort. There is no personal attention here because of the sheer number of people passing through. You are been herd just like the rest of the strip hotels, like a bunch of cows. Case in point: 1. Checking in: I booked two rooms. My first priority is to have connecting rooms, second is to have quieter room in higher floor. I am not even interest in the view, just want quietness. I asked for higher floor (using AMX Platinum Card Fine Hotel Program) but the agent seems to just trying to get thru the booking and get me going. Sure enough, as I walked into the 35th floor, I can hear the music and the windows vibrating from the Beach Club. Called the supervisor, took him 10 minutes, moved me to 54th floor on the opposite side - quiet. His attitude is exactly what I expected, very apologetic, he did all the work, I just sit there and wait for the result. He even comp us with a small in-room fridge, and it showed up the same time I get to the room – fast. So they do have a great recovery procedure, but why can’t the front desk agent do the same thing? maybe because he wants to be fast and move me along? 2. Checking out: As I was standing in line waiting to check out and the line was getting longer. A supervisor came out, stand in front of me (literately up against me), and ask me to walk around the line and chained off in front of me – no apology or even a “please”. I looked at him in disbelieve, shake my head and walked away, Not worth the argument. A simple “I am so sorry for the trouble but can you please help me by moving to the other side?” would do. But to him, I am just another tourist in a long line, nothing personal. 3. There is a line to get to buffet, there is a line to a sit down breakfast, there is a long line to get coffee, there are lines everywhere. You are in a tourist hotel, not resort. By the way, I asked for non-smoking rooms, yet one of the room smell like someone just smoked in there. In fact, I can see cigarette butts at the trash can in front of elevators, and occasionally smell smoking in the hallway, proving some people ignore the non-smoking rule. I guess it’s not the hotel’s fault, you are in Vegas. And no coffee or tea maker in the room? I had never been in a resort without a coffee maker. That was a shocker for my wife as she likes to make coffee the minute she wakes up and don’t want to dress, do hair, makeup and go down stair for a cup of coffee. The pressurized toilet flusher is LOUD and scary, you can wake up your spouse, and the neighbors by simply flushing the toilet. The good part? Once you pay the $40 daily fee for Spa, then you are in a totally different world. In the Spa, staffs are now focusing on YOU and YOU only. They know your last name, they smile every time they see you, they ask to help you, very nice. You are now in a fine resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MontevalloTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Encore in a Panorama Suite. The Room(#5348) was good with a great View of the Mountains and downtown old Las Vegas. King Bed was a little bit smaller than our King at home but comfortable with an array of Pillows. The Bath was large and very modern. We had trouble with the Air Conditioning the first night but maintenance cleared things up the next day. They did not have a turn down service at night. We were always short of a few Towels. We ate at Switch, in the Hotel, a Great experience with the Interior changing every 30 minutes and probably our best dinner in Vegas. The Staff were very pleasant and helpful. I wish they had a Coffee Pot in the room. I wasted a lot of time going down stairs each morning and standing in line for a Cup!! What I did not like was the Pool. My wife and I enjoy a Pool but these were a little over the Top for us!! The music was too loud at the two big Pools. The third pool I believe was a European Pool. Did not care to visit there. I could not read my book for the pounding beat. I would have prefered an Adult only Tranquil atmosphere Pool for folks like us. I did like the Hertz Rental Car at the Hotel. We rented a Car and visited Red Rock Canyon about 15 miles West of Vegas. You should do that one day and take a Picnic basket. Beautiful!! In closing, Smoke is everywhere, even in the Lobby. Someone should catch on and build a Non Smoking resort in Las Vegas. Overall a good stay at a good Hotel. One more thing, the details of the RED CARD CLUB was not explained so we lost several dinners because we did not understand how the Points could be used before we departed.

Reviews.Title: “Happy stay at another 5 stars hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bigboy61455
Reviews.Content: First of all, I like spacious self parking garage dedicated for Encore. No difficulty finding a spot near the entrance and so do not use the common parking garage for Wynn and Encore. Rooms in encore are spacious and starts with at least tower suite I believe. Try to look for special rate from Wynn's website for advanced reservation, special offers and reservation through credit card program etc. When I checked online for reservation, rate for a regular room at Wynn and tower suite at Encore are the same and so I chose suite. Since it's a suite, there is an extra living room with great view to Wynn, green golf course and strip. It's definitely bigger than rooms from Wynn since Encore is built later. It's well decorated for 5 stars standard but I think suite from Palazzo is a bit larger. Still no complaint from me because I paid same amount of money for non-suite room at Bellagio or even smaller room at Wynn which could be the smallest room for 5 stars in Vegas. Positives: - Beautiful suite room as described above. Instead of wasting 2 flat screen TVs in my suite, Encore installed a rotating TV so that you can either watch from bedroom or from living room. - Dedicated staff who are willing to help all the time. I lost my telephone on Casino floor but very honest cleaning staff sent it to lost and found department and when I inquired about my lost phone at security department next morning, it's there. I really could not believe it. - Availability of prime time show, La Reve is a big, big plus in this place. Only other 5 stars place in town (i.e. Bellagio) can host unique cirque du soleil shows in water. - Self parking behind the elevator, wow, I like it. Don't even think about using valet. - Good size swimming pool (more than 25 meters but smaller than gigantic Roman pool from Bellagio) is good enough unless you are swimming for London Olympics. Adult only pool is a plus too. Neutral: - Waiting time at elevators is quite long and I've seen much faster, "right-away" elevators at all MGM hotels, Palazzo and Planet Hollywood in Vegas. There are many people waiting at lobby level and more than one elevators need to be sent down at a time. - Encore/Wynn might try to limit window shopping visitors which really is not a bad idea but less visitors mean less revenues to shops and restaurants. Nightly light show at waterfall is nothing compared to free things at Bellagio fountain, Caesars' Palace etc. Negatives: - Resort fees of up to 22$/day a day is included in total bill and Encore still try to charge extra 14$ for internet (yes, 14$ per computer per day, not per room). That's why "Total Rewards" group hotels including Caesars' Palace, Paris are claiming they are good guys because they don't charge those ridiculous fees. - Food overall is very expensive inside Encore or Wynn. Even Bellagio has several places for reasonable pastries, coffee. So please try to take time and doing research for better deal if you are too tired to go outside Encore. Since I did not do my home work, I missed some good deal at Wazuzu, which is fine dining per Wynn's classification. I tried semi-fine dining food at Society Cafe and Red 8 and I'm sad to see the direction Vegas eatery industry is going. If they keep increasing the price for indifferent food, I'll just go to Wynn buffet for good food.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Henry C
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at all the top hotels in Vegas and the Encore is by far my favorite (I prefer it to the older Wynn). The Encore exudes luxury and Wynn does a great job of keeping the Encore clean and updated. The quality of the interior design and materials are bar none. It doesn't feel like this hotel has aged one bit since it was opened several years ago. The standard rooms are larger than most in Vegas as they all feature a big seating area with a L-shaped couch. The beds are amazing and feature very high thread count sheets and an abundance of nice pillows. Encore features many amenities, including 3 pools, spa, golf course, shops, 2 clubs (XS and Surrender) and a bunch of shops. I find that when I come here with friends, we rarely leave the property because everything you need is right here. The only thing Encore doesn't have is a poker room and sports book, but you can walk to the nearby Wynn which does. All in all I highly recommend staying at the Encore and as I said before, there's no other place in Veags I like more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but..........”
Reviews.Author: pkw1956
Reviews.Content: I was there for a trade show .the suites are very Exceptional.The bathroom was huge with a tub and shower.there was a double sinks and a tv ! The towels were very luxurious ,and the quality of the toiletries was high. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets and duvet were made from very high quality cottons.there was a control box for lighting and drapes beside the bed . The television could be rotated 180 degrees so you could watch it in the bedroom or in the Sitting area. The room also has a safe in the closet. The only peeves was that the check in was slow(took over 30 min unacceptable for a 5 star) ,and they charged $14 per day for WiFi !!!! Was a

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: ktyjenkins
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Vegas and i would say i like my luxury when i travel and enjoy going all out when on holiday and if your the same the Encore is the perfect Hotel. Check in was quick and they where very friendly and helpful. Offering us maps and restaurant advise. Our room was amazing!! On the 28 floor we had a great view of the 2 pools, golf course, Wynn and the strip. Im a clean freak and even to my standards the room was spot on. They work very hard through out the whole hotel to keep it tidy, you wont see rubbish anywhere! They give you plenty of towels and shampoo and al the little extra even down to polish and a shoe buff. The pools are lovely. Im an early bird so always got a good chair. I would say if going to the pool over the weekend try and get down early as i noticed the pool was busier on sat and sun. The food and drinks served at the pool are not too expensive either i thought they were a good price compared to the mini bar prices wich are a killer! Also i have to mention that there is ice cold water machines pool side so you dont need to bring any down and its free and also the bring round fresh grapes each day and cold bottled water all free as well. Just nice little touchse. The shops in the Encore and Wynn are beautiful! Im a big shopper so having 2 Chanels in 1 hotel was perfect! The are special stores not really the everyday shop but great to look at and always made to feel welcome. I ate in the buffet for breakfast and dinner both where fantastic!! The choice was endless and its all so fresh. Breakfast have ceras, fry up, rolls, toast, pizza, cakes, nachos, noodles, omelettes made to order, fruit, porridge and even toffe apples!! And dinner was turkey, ribs, lamb, salad bar, soup, cheese and breads, veg, potatoes, chinese section, pizza, pasta.......it really does go on and on. I even heard a chef say to a lady he would make he something she asked for that some how they didnt have out. I also ate at the steak restaurant Botero in the Encore AMAZING!!! This restaurant was a high standard and the price does reflects that but i have never had the nicest most juciest steak, it was perfect. They come as plain or fancy as you like and its situated next to the pool so in the evening its lovely to look out over while eating dinner. Some people may think its too pricey but i beg you just to try it once! Overall i loved the Encore and im hoping to return next year for 2 weeks. I hope they keep up the 5 star standard because its excellet right now.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great time”
Reviews.Author: 10coastal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore for four nights from Sept 21 - 25 for my birthday. We booked the room through American Express Platinum and recieved upgraded room (58 floor), $30 per day per person for breakfast and 100 dollar spa credit. We checked in at around 4pm and everything was as promised and was very prompt. Room was great, overlooked pools and strip and was directly across from Wynn. We went to see Carrottop that night at Luxor and were not dissapointed. It was one of the funniest shows i had ever seen and recommend it. We were meeting two other couples who got in the following day. The next day the ladies went to the ice bar at Mandalay bay and enjoyed it, if you go there you can negoiate price. Dinner being a group of 6 we could not fit in one cab, we rented limo by the hour at 75 dollars and worked out well . You can find them at hotel, ask concierge or valets they can direct you. Went to dinner at Texas de Brazil, it was by far one of the best restaurants i have eaten at. No menus salad bar, and all types of meats, 50 per person. Other restaurants we ate at was Maggianos right across the street, food was great and very reasonable. Hotel food and drink is of course pricey, but you get what you pay for. All in all a great trip in great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Encore Worth a Stay!”
Reviews.Author: msenske
Reviews.Content: I just had the opportunity to stay at the Encore while attending an industry trade show and my experience was exceptional. The room was very well appointed and the quality of materials was extremely high. The bedroom was extremely nice with controls for lighting and drapes on an end table next to the bed. The bed was very comfortable, with a great mattress and linens. The bathroom was large and had double sinks, soaking tub, shower, and private water closet. The sitting area was large and contained a couch with a chaise at one end that was great for putting your feet up. I especially liked the fact that the flatscreen television swiveled 180 degrees so that you could view it from the bed or from the sitting room that was opposite the bedroom. There was a nice size desk that accommodated a laptop very nicely. Although there was a pop-up housing that contained two electrical outlets on the desk, it would have been nice to have a couple more outlets in the desk for the myriad electronic devices that we all now travel with. The Encore and Wynn are home to several very nice restaurants, some of them very casual and others more formal. I especially enjoyed Wazuzu, which featured a wide variety of Asian cuisine. Switch was also a very nice dining experience in terms of menu and service. The staff was very nice and attentive, especially the people at the front desk and the bell desk.

Reviews.Title: “Its Vegas baby”
Reviews.Author: cfozy
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Encore. I stayed there in May over the holiday (I had no idea I booked over a holiday weekend). I really like the rooms at Encore (love the door bell-its the little things :) If you remember your in Vegas and everything is over priced you will be fine. Before going to the property we got help from Magen with our limo, show tickets. She was AWESOME. I felt like I was bugging her so much but she was always so helpful. POOL - The free party pool seats are gone fast and early so get down there fast. The slower pool is still fine but the "beautiful" people aren't over on that side as much which is probably good for us normal folk LOL The "Beach Club" was $100 to get into the holiday weekend so we avoided it at all cost. SERVICE - It was fine. Not to much interaction with staff but if we did have some it was helpful. Cleanliness - very clean. I am not a smoking, in fact it makes me sick but it doesn't me to much here at the Encore. Rooms - The room size is wonderful. The decor, great. View, love it. THE BEDS ARE SO COMFY WHO WOULD WANT TO LEAVE THE ROOM????? You really don't hear noise in these rooms either which is nice. The only negative was an encounter was with Mr Wynn himself. He was walking through the hotel and is security (not him. Just want to make that clear) literally put their arms out and pushed us out the way. I found that VERY RUDE and no one ever has the right to put their hands on you especially in that situation. We did not attempt to approach him so there was no need for that. One person I was with didn't even know it was him. Will I stay here again? Probably. Its at the end of the nice hotels so its great exercise but being right across from the mall is perfect. Plus I love the doorbell.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Wynner in Vegas, Encore!”
Reviews.Author: R0yC
Reviews.Content: The sheer scale of hotels in Las Vegas is extraordinary. Distances seem modest against the physical presence of these buildings, and the Encore is no exception. This was our first time in Vegas and we were struck by the magnificence of the exterior only matched by the opulence of the interior. Check in was swift, and last minute changes to our itinerary were effortlessly and cheerfully accommodated. We had a great king room on the 32nd floor, spotless, with an ever changing panoramic view down the strip. Wonderful. We bought the 2 day package which included a buffet breakfast, really good value. The food was plentiful, huge range of cooking, and limitless, as evidenced by the appetites of the many customers. Pool area was a bit crowded, but still accessible, and the casino is well lit, there is even daylight, unlike many others on the strip. In short what was there to complain about - well absolutely nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Encore Tower Suites”
Reviews.Author: Lance11
Reviews.Content: Graciously upgraded us to a Parlor Suite. Excellent service from front-desk, concierge, bell, room service, doorman. Has a dedicated massage room which I took full advantage. Discovered the adults only pool. Tops optional. Fantastic in-pool lounges $$ and cocktail service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: k p
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was amazing! My boyfriend and I stayed there for an entire week in the mid july. The room had a great view and the design was very modern. The room had a flat screen tv. The hotel had many different restaurants. The staff there is also very friendly. We were always greeted in the hallway by a staff member. The only down side was that it was a little loud---they host outdoor parties.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cheerngolf
Reviews.Content: I don't think you can find a better resort in Las Vegas. This hotel is stunning! My boyfriend and I make an annual trip to Las Vegas. This year we booked our room at the Wynn, but upon check-in, were upgraded to a suite in the Encore. As Steve Wynn describes on the website, the hotel is filled with little surprises. The decor is brilliant, with exciting things to look at from floor to ceiling, and the arrangement of the rooms, pools, restaurants, lounges, etc. seem to be very carefully thought out. They have a handful of different pools, we spent our time at the main Encore pool and the main Wynn pool. The Wynn pool is by far my favorite pool that I have ever been to. The design (a long lane connecting two large circular pools) is very unique and intimate. Lots of great places to sit in and around the pool. All lounge chairs are very comfortable, pool staff is very attentive. We had lunch at Botero one day - the veggie wraps were delicious. The Parasol up/down cafe is fun and whismical - we sat outside one night on their patio overlooking the lake of dreams, and enjoyed the light show that takes place every half hour. We also dined at the SW Steakhouse for dinner - delicious (the 6oz. fillet is not on the menu but you can get it if you ask), great staff, but pricey. Dined at Society Cafe for breakfast - loved the oatmeal pancakes! We only tried out the buffet for breakfast one morning, but it was the best breakfast buffet I have eaten at in Vegas! Would love to go back another time and check out the dessert room! Beds were very comfortable. The service was excellent everywhere. My only complaint is that food, beverages are expensive ($5 per diet coke at the pool) but something I was expecting at a five-star hotel. I loved staying at the Encore/Wynn and will be returning again!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vegas - Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: Vicki52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely brilliant. This was my first trip to Vegas and I wasn't sure what to expect but when landing we could already see the hotel from the plane which was a lovely feeling. Upon arrival myself and my group were overwhelmed. Check in was quick, we were politely and pleasantly greeted and we were told that we had rooms together (as requested). We were offered the choice to upgrade rooms ($20pppn) then we'd be able to go to one of the higher floors, we decided to upgrade and we weren't disappointed. The views from the 50th floor were all across the strip and well worth upgrading for - especially at night. I must stress to you that the hotel is stunning. No attention to detail is missed and the butterfly theme follows you everywhere. The hotel is beautiful everywhere you go; outside too - and no area is plain or run-down, its the ultimate luxury. We walked all over the hotel and were pleasantly surprised at every corner all different kind of arty things around the hotel. I walked around to many of the big, well known hotels: The Mirage, Bellagio, Paris Las Vegas, New York New York, The Cosmopolitan, Venetian, Stratosphere and I can honestly say that the Encore/Wynn trumped them all in terms of design where some others looked slightly run down in places. The rooms are incredible - and the design was amazing, lots of space and it lacked that 'hotel vibe' that most rooms come with - you feel like the room is yours and not just one of many. I can't even describe how lovely the design of the room is! The room comes furnished and its all well kept. The bed is so comfortable and the bathroom is lovely. I never had any water problems heat and pressure adjustable. Lots of mirror space and good lighting - the window is floor to ceiling and you have an incredible view. One of my friends who travelled with us had already stayed in Vegas at the MGM Grand and he said the rooms didn't compare - that the Encore was much better. I must stress that ALL staff at the hotel, are incredibly helpful, friendly, courteous and polite. We encountered lots of different staff and you were always made to feel that your request was no problem and they genuinely wanted to help you. I've stayed at alot of hotels and its rare to come across such fantastic customer service. Staff are a credit to the hotel and part of the fantastic service when you stay here. The conceriege helped us checking in online, enquiring with information with other hotels and various bookings. Breakfast here is incredible! I had already been told before I came here that I must eat at the Wynn (the hotels are merged so you have access to both facilities) and I wasn't disappointed there is a wide and varied choice of possibly everything you could want. There are chefs waiting by preparing fresh food and there to see your specifications. To give you a rough idea there is fruit, yoghurts, freshly cooked meats, egg, eggs Benedict and there is even a choice of Japanese, Thai food and a few others. There is lots of space and I would advise you get down earlyish on weekends as locals and people from other hotels come here. Club XS - again we were told about this club before we came - one of the most expensive club refurbishments in the world. The club itself is big and spacious and there was always a queue to get in. TIP: the dress code is strictly smart; women must wear heels (it makes the point of saying no sandals) and men must be wearing smart clothing. This is pretty much the same throughout Vegas so I would recommend you pack some dressy things for evenings! SW Steakhouse my sister got married in Vegas and she decided to come here for her wedding breakfast. This restaurant does not disappoint myself any some members of our party agreed we'd had the best steak we'd ever had here. We ate so much we couldn't manage dessert or any of the sides we'd ordered! It was the most incredible meal and I thoroughly recommend it. Tips: For cheap gambling the stratosphere (the only downside to the Wynn is that gambling is expensive). Clubbing wise the best clubs are: Ghost Bar - Palms Hotel (nice view point and fairly busy for a Sunday) XS - Wynn (absolute must - this is one of the nicest clubs) Tryst - Wynn Pure - Caesar's Palace Marquee - Cosmopolitan Tao - Venetian Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone and its one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. For everything in Vegas - come here!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Colleen M
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Encore and we loved it! Everything from the food, to the room, to the service was amazing. We loved the dealers, the pit bosses and the waiters and our room was incredible. We won't be staying anywhere else. We were at the pool on Saturday morning, and my husband dropped a huge chip (white) and a sweeper/janitor picked it up and brought it to his attention and gave it back! What service!

Reviews.Title: “Very good but never great, but that's Las Vegas for you!”
Reviews.Author: luxurytravelguru
Reviews.Content: I have stayed nearly everywhere 3 stars and up on the strip over the years and other than the Mandarin Oriental, this is the only place I will stay. I called from the plane in LAX and requested a limo pick-up 45 minutes later and it happened, although I have yet to get an American Express fine hotel and resort upgrade (but thats likely a busy weekend phenomenon). Its the little customer service snags that linger, like two ladies beside us at the pool who went to the rest room and on returning found their drinks gone (we were supposed to mind them but somehow the attendants got to them) and then they had to try and convince management of the fact. It was just embarassing for them asking to have the drinks replaced and in fact they gave up in a place where there is nearly more booze than water. Anyway, Encore remains consistent, unlikely to improve but as long as it does not slip I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Max T
Reviews.Content: LOVE LOVE LOVE! Encore is a beautiful hotel that has trendy decor and really amazing rooms. Our suite was big, really clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The little things like the shampoo and conditioner were really high quality and the fact that you could watch tv while in the shower/tub was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: smedley26
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Encore, I had read lots of reviews before we went so therefore had some had some idea of the pros and cons. The hotels are situated at the end of the strip opposite the Fashion Mall and next door to the Venetian. its along way to the other end of the strip so either a long walk or a cab ride away. I prefer this as I found the middle of the strip near the Bellagio to be manic and very busy a bit like Blackpool. The check in was quick and efficent I requested a room that did not face the strip above the busy nighclubs which are very noisy at the weekends. The room was clean and very well appointed the bathrobes were lovely. We ordered a number of times from the in room dining and the service and quality were faultless, they always arranged a time to collect the dishes once we had finished. The pool area was lovely with free water and fruit bought around regularly, always plently of waitresses to take your drink orders. It would have been nice if there were some shaded ideas near the pool where you could sit for drinks and lunch. The pool menu was very limited considering the amount of diferent restuarants there are in the hotel. The hotel caters for the younger end of the market and there are lots of people off to the clubs and the beach club in the afternoon at weekends. The Beach club is a good idea for the young hip crowd very Ibiza, but should be situated a bit farther from the main hotel it is a 5 star hotel and the most pleasant experience to be accosted by alot of drunk half naked people trying to get into the hotel. I think Mr Wynn needs to make his mind up about what age/type he wants to market the Encore too. If he wants the young hip crowd only then target that market and let people know. I had no problen and was it was a nice touch that when sitting round the pool during the day the staff would put you on the guest lists for the clubs. Lovely hotel enjoyed our stay and would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Unable to sleep at the Wynn Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bivin101251
Reviews.Content: It is 1:30 am, Monday, and we haven't been able to sleep yet in our room at the Wynn. We are on the 38th floor facing the golf course, & the loud music & the pounding bass from the GROUND floor is vibrating the plate glass window, the walls, & every cell in my body. When we called down to the desk to complain, we were told it was their nightclub, & Will I Am was performing. The show will be over at 4 am. Evidently that explanation was supposed to make everything alright. When we weren't impressed & asked for another room, she said there weren't any vacant rooms, but they would give us a $150 credit on our tab. Also she promised to ask the club to turn down the volume. They didn't. After reading the other numerous complaints dating back to 2008, I think the staff is toying with me. This is nothing new to them. We are booked for two more nights, but we are checking out tomorrow. $150 just isn't enough compensation for 3 sleepless nights.

Reviews.Title: “nicely appointed”
Reviews.Author: widad11
Reviews.Content: Wynn Encore: nicely appointed rooms, with attention to detail. Beware the mini-bar sensors. You pick it up, you get charged.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, but the smoke in the casino kept this from being a 5-star”
Reviews.Author: Evanston_Jeff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Encore Tower Suites at the end of a long trip to Asia. The rooms were fantastic, with great flat-screen TV and very modern style. Internet service was a bit slower than I am accustomed and the faintest whiff of smoke in the downstairs casino was disappointing. Overall the hotel was very nice, with great rooms, wonderful bathroom and nearby (but expensive) restaurants. If it weren't for the smoke in the casino I would absolutely come back (although i don't think that there is too much that can be done with the smoke in Vegas)

Reviews.Title: “Epic trip”
Reviews.Author: asianprincessx
Reviews.Content: The suite was gorgeous and so was the view! Modern room decorated beautifully. All the hotel staff was courteous and helpful. Saw John Mayer and will I am in the lobby! Will definitely come back! Club xs was not accomadating with regards to helping us celebrate a friends birthday. Wazuzu had amazing drunked noodles!

Reviews.Title: “Curate's egg”
Reviews.Author: Netty13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights and overall we enjoyed the Encore. The pool area is beautiful and staff bring round free bottles of water and bowls of fresh fruit to keep you hydrated. There are plenty of sun beds and all are free of charge ( unlike Mandalay Bay). There are plenty of bars and restaurants, and we enjoyed some lovely meals. Also, whilst gambling, waitresses keep up a steady supply of drinks and even playing slot machines you can quickly accumulate enough credit for free buffets etc. if you join the Red Card program. On the down side, some of the restaurants are extremely pricey - even for a luxury resort. Switch Steak is a prime example. Great food - but way overpriced. We split a salad as an appetiser and each had a steak and shared three sides and a bottle of wine. This cost the same amount as the five course parallel tasting menu WITH wine pairings at Aureole in Mandalay Bay. Also, the rooms are described as suites: they are not. The rooms are similar to the Wynn, where the bed is positioned to face the floor-to-ceiling windows, but in the Encore there is a stud wall between the bed and the window which has an aperture for the TV which swivels so it can be viewed from the bed or the " living room". This does not constitute a suite and in fact just spoils the view. That said, the rooms are big, clean, comfy and the views are great. The biggest issue we found, and the one which would make us think twice before booking here again, is the noise. Encore caters for a quite young crowd. There are several well-attended clubs in the hotel and they can be heard from the guest rooms - even on the 37th floor. Loud music and very enthusiastic DJs can be clearly heard until dawn. We had a strip view room, and perhaps a room on the other side of the hall would have been quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: p3eps
Reviews.Content: As the third and final instalment of our honeymoon we decided to spend a week in Vegas.  We've been before, staying in the Paris hotel - but as it was a special occasion, Encore was the hotel of choice.  We flew in from Hawaii and got to the hotel at about 1am Vegas time. There were 3 staff on the reception desk, and no queue. The girl was very nice, and when she read 'honeymoon' on the paperwork, she upgraded us to a suite on the 58th floor.  The room was stunning, and the view down the strip at night was amazing from so high up. It wasn't until the morning I could see a huge empty golf course on the left, and numerous swimming pools! It was a huge room, beautifully decorated and even had remote control curtains!  The TV in the bathroom didn't work, but as we didn't spend much time in the room we didn't care.  Once we'd unpacked, we decided to have a brief 'explore' as we were hungry. We found a small shop in the hotel that sold sandwiches and drinks - so bought some stuff. A sandwich, 2 bags of crisps, 2 bottles of juice, a bottle of water and an ice cream mars bar - $38! At that point we decided to avoid the hotel shop and get 'supplies' elsewhere! We went to the pool on a couple of occasions. It was really nice and had plenty of loungers available. They gave you towels, and often handed out bottles of water. There were also water dispensers around the pool too.  With the 115degreesF temperature at the time, I guess they wanted to keep everyone hydrated.  We ate in Switch restaurant in the hotel which was one of the best meals I've ever had. The food was divine and the setting is amazing. It was probably the most expensive meal we ate in Vegas, but it was worth every penny. (approx $240 for 2 mains, 2 deserts and a few drinks).  We also ate at the pizza cafe in the hotel which was lovely and pretty cheap.  The duelling pianos bar was really cool, but you HAD TO purchase at least a drink each before they'd let you in! $30+ for a beer and a cosmo!  We discovered the best way to drink in the hotel was to play slot machines - as you don't have to pay (just a tip to the waitress). That way, the $30+ rounds cost $5 each! Our plane had a huge delay on it, and we ended up staying an extra night (which BA paid for - thanks!). The staff were really helpful when sorting it out, and even gave us our better room at the standard rate.  As we'd originally booked a package we didn't know about the 'resort fee' - but on our extra night we had to pay it. The benefit of paying the 'resort fee' is that you get free wifi.  Although the hotel is on the strip, it's maybe a bit far away from most things. It's a fair walk to some of the other hotels since it's located quite far up the strip. It's good for the Fashion Show Mall - which is a 5 min walk. If I return to Vegas I'd probably try and stay somewhere nearer the middle of the strip so that I have easy access to all the hotels / casinos.   On certain days they have a Beach Club - which is essentially a night club during the day. We never attended - but it was a nightmare trying to get a taxi at 6pm as there were hundreds of drunk youngsters trying to get home. We stood in line for about 25mins - which made us late for our restaurant reservation. We also went to get a taxi at 4am to go home... just as the Surrender nightclub had come out. Thankfully the doormen had the sense to let us skip the queue since we had 4 suitcases! Although we were on the 58th floor, we could hear the music from Surrender when in bed. In summary, Encore is an stunning hotel. It's beautiful both inside and out, and the staff are brilliant. It does come at a price though! Would I go back - probably not. I'd rather try somewhere else a bit more central... However I would recommend it for a one off.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: ausmike_1968
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned to Australia from a 6 week trip around the world. In terms of hotels, the highlight was Encore. The rooms were superb and the grounds and hotel itself were immaculate. I didn't even realise smoking was allowed as the air was so clean. Much better than many other hotels on the strip. I hadn't expected it to be better than the Bellagio, but in comparison, the Bellagio looks a little tired. While the service wasn't at the standard of say Four Seasons, the rooms and ambiance made up for it. Encore is quieter than the Wynn, which I appreciated, and it's only a short walk to the Wynn if you want more people! Wazuzu was a great restaurant for reasonably priced Asian food, and The Buffet at Wynn was excellent for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: doctorsunnyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore in August for our 25th anniversary and loved it. We booked our room thru whatahotel.com. They offered some extra perks with a good rate. We were to receive an upgrade at check in if available, $50 credit at the spa and breakfast daily. Check-in: We arrived early afternoon on a Saturday. There was practically no line at check in which was a pleasant surprise compared to other hotels. The front desk told us about the spa and breakfast credit. Whatahotel had told us room service was included in the breakfast choices. The front desk told us it was not but gave us a long list of restaurants where we could use the credit. Not sure who is right as we did not push the issue. We had to remind the front desk of the upgrade and it was available. From the standard suite, the upgrade is to a panoramic suite. All that means is the room is on a higher floor. Room: Our room faced downtown. It was a nice view. The room looked just like the pictures on the website. Loved the couch next to the windows. Only once did we hear bass from the club. Bed and shower were wonderful. Loved the swivel TV. The room was always clean when we returned late afternoon. Housekeeping did a good job. Breakfast: We ate at Society Cafe one day which was good. Then we found Tableau! The food and especially the service were outstanding. Loved being able to eat outside. We ate here for breakfast the rest of our trip. Pool: Part of the reason we stayed here was the European pool. We spent most of our days here. Just loved not having any kids around...very relaxing. The service as everywhere at the hotel was great. Casino: The casino is on the small side and quiet compared to other hotels. The cocktail service is the best. My new favorite drink is an espresso martini. Spa: We never made it to the spa. Maybe next time! I would definitely book with whatahotel.com again. The extra perks were very nice. The Encore has won us over. It is a luxurious, service orient hotel that we would go back to if the right offer came our way.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service but not the Wynn”
Reviews.Author: TracymIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at Encore. Had previosuly stayed at the tower suites in the Wynn and booked into the tower suites at Encore as the Wynn was sold out. Service at the hotel is comparable to the Wynn. However, poor planning and poor management policies made our stay not all that it could be. Because the hotel recetnly built the Encore Beach Club that has a DJ in afternoons as well as at night until the early morning hours, even numbered rooms in the tower suites which are on the pool side of the building get to hear the heavy bass of the music at all hours. Forget napping or getting any sleep at night unless you are heavy sleepier or a llittle inebriated or both. Ask for an odd number room on the ciry side of the bulding. We requested to be moved which the hotel did without any questions. It was apparant from talkign to the front desk and bellmen, moving rooms because of the noise is a common occurence. Poor planning by the hotel designer. The casino is smaller than at the Wynn and does not include a sports book area. You can make your sports bets at a teller but you have limited access to all lines and prop bets. Other than that the casino seemed to have all the same action as the Wynn. There is no tower suites pool at the Encore like at the Wynn. The two pools are too small for the crowds and more bothersome is the policy to close out your check after every drink if you are charging to your room. This clearly slows down service and is a pain. Several guests that we were around complained about this and reflected their displeasure in their tips. Keep in mind that teh Encore is at the far end of the strip away from the airport. Unless you are willing to walk a lot, you will take cabs everywhere. Overall a good stay after we changed rooms but the hotel is clearly a notch below the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic week in a fabulous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireAdventurer1
Reviews.Content: I thought that no other hotel could better the Bellagio after staying there last year.I wanted to try Wynn's hotel this year but could not be accommodated for the week I wanted and booked the Encore.I am so glad that I did.I found the hotel to be quieter and less frenetic than the Bellagio with its crowds of visitors walking through gawping at everything! The decor at Encore is fantastic with tremendous attention to detail and colour and luxury is standard.I cannot fault the place for a relaxing stay and all its comforts as mentioned in the many other reviews .I feel that the Bellagio has the better buffet and restaurants and a better position on the strip as we had to summon taxis quite regularly but if I return to Las Vegas I will book the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Best So Far on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: travels5Usa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several of the popular hotels on the strip and this was by far the best. The live flower arrangements are gorgeous. The decor of the rooms is a bit modern and drab for my personal taste but it was still luxurious and a nice change from home. What makes this hotel is the pools and the clubs. There were people of all ages at club XS. The piano bar is a fun nighttime distraction. They could use another casual eatery.

Reviews.Title: “One week in the Encore”
Reviews.Author: Shanghai_sam
Reviews.Content: Have just recently returned from one week in the Encore. This was our 2nd stay in the Encore in 3 years and we really love the place, however not everything is perfect. The pool is great, all the food we had in the Lobby Bar, Society Cafe, La Cave (Wynn), The Cafe(Wynn) and Zoozacrackers was wonderful with great service. All the staff were polite and helpful, housekeeping and pool CW's excellent. The downside: Did not appreciate paying the $20 resort fee as we had no intentions of using the internet or gym whilst we are on holiday, secondly paying $20 upgrade fee to get high up and avoid the noise. We were on the 62nd floor facing north and could still hear the bass from the beach club, just turn it down a little................not off. However will be back still love this hotel and its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tuneman61
Reviews.Content: The Encore is an outstanding place to stay, we were upgraded to a king suite and it was fantastic! A great view of the strip, the room was very comfortable to say the least. The room had all of the usual things with a remote control at the bed for all of the lights and drapes. Floor to ceiling windows. The only negative was the buffet at the Wynn, at $40 per person it is highly overpriced, don't get me wrong the food was good...good not outstanding, in my opinion it was worth $20 maybe $25 per person. We received excellent customer service wherever we went on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable get-away”
Reviews.Author: preason
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Encore was very relaxing. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. The food is good and priced for any budget. We loved our view from the room and the decor. Loved our bed, so comfortable. Won at the slot machines. We loved the pool and the use of Wynn's pool. We liked the seamlessness of the both the Encore and Wynn hotels. Everything was very clean and cared for. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Bland conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: lyndaessex
Reviews.Content: This hotel had no redeeming features unlike others on the strip. You had to queue for everything. Breakfast was a nightmare, 20 minutes to pay before you were allowed in to the restaurant, very poor service and dirty tables everywhere? Pool and gym were not free. Room was lovely and great view.

Reviews.Title: “An Encore at the Encore”
Reviews.Author: TheGreatOne313
Reviews.Content: After enjoying the Encore in Las Vegas last year, i decided to go back this year. I was not disappointed. I booked the vacation through Orbitz, and there was no problem checking in.The room and hotel service were excellent. I love the atmosphere that the Encore brings. It is a great hotel for couples. It can get expensive, so don't order room service if you don't have to. My girlfriend's only complaint was that there was no coffee maker inside the room. If you want to impress your significant other and spend a lot of time in the hotel, the Encore is for you. If you just want a place to sleep and you"re going to be out enjoying vegas all day and night, then the Encore may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: KarBill_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantatic week in Las Vegas - our first time. We stayed at Encore at Wynn and have to say it's the best hotel we have ever stayed in. The rooms were huge and so luxurious - even a t.v. in the bathroom! All the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. During our week In Las Vegas we went into most of the other hotels and none of them came near to the fabulous Wynn Encore. We saw the Le Reve show at the Wynn and it was the most wonderful show we have ever seen, even surpassing Love, Cirque de Soleil at The Mirage, which was excellent but in our opinion not so good. Not being experienced gamblers we found that the croupiers in both casino's of the Wynn and Encore were extremely helpful in explaining the rules of the various games to us, because being in Vegas you have to have a flutter on something, even if it's on one of the millions of slot machines available! We had a brilliant time and will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Encore, another great stay.”
Reviews.Author: ritter01
Reviews.Content: Encore is a very nice hotel. The regular rooms are like a small suite. Very nice having the extra space. Rooms were clean, cleaned daily by a very nice housekeeping staff. Beds were very comfortable, linens were nice. Towels large and plenty of them. Love the seperate tub and shower. Televisions in the bathrooms were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property with Cheap Hidden Costs”
Reviews.Author: mlaessig2
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positive. The Encore at the Wynn is truly a great property committed to providing the best of every aspect of your experience. Incredible service and staff, very nice rooms, great restaurants and popular nightclubs define this experience. The only negative I have to say about the property are the cheap hidden costs. This is a top end property, no doubt, and I don't mind paying for that experience. What I do mind are charges that are not communicated upfront. I make my reservations with an agreed upon price, but on top of that price is another charge - the resort fee - that you only find out about when you actually arrive for the reservation. It is $25 a day to be able to use the pool and their facilities, and this is a non-optional charge (based on our itinerary for Vegas we were not going to use those facilities, but we had to pay anyway). It is not that $25 a day is so egregious...we were already paying several hundred dollars a night for the room which I was fine with and had agreed upon...it was the nature of "slipping it in" after you had already agreed upon the price, and making it non-optional, that bothers me. This is an uncharacteristically cheap and unfriendly tactic the Wynn uses when everything else is so committed to an amazing experience for the guest. Similarly there were cheap charges for room service. A breakfast order for 1 person (eggs, toast, bacon, coffee) was $30, to which they added on a $5 'service charge' as well as a mandatory 18% gratuity. If there is a 18% gratuity, what is the $5 service charge about? It was over $40 for a simple breakfast for one. It is not the amount of these charges that bothers me...our party literally spent thousands of dollars at the Wynn for the rooms, restaurants and at the nightclubs, but those were all charges we agreed upon. Cheap little charges like the mandatory resort fee that they don't tell you about upfront and the nickel-and-dime charges for room service are decidedly out of character with the rest of the experience, and why I only give this great hotel and staff 4 stars instead of a resounding 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Top Drawer”
Reviews.Author: ThePinkCar
Reviews.Content: Open letter to Steve Wynn- You nailed it baby! Your employees are so caring, helpful and polite. Service means everything and it's very evident that you invest a lot of money and effort in truing your fine team.

Reviews.Title: “The resort that has everything. Well, almost.”
Reviews.Author: Simon H
Reviews.Content: The resort has everything you could expect in Las Vegas. Huge casino, pools, shops, buffet, shows and what seems like endless numbers of restaurants. The rooms are large, clean and have everything you could possibly need. No complaints there at all. However. For all this and for all the money that has been spent on it, it sadly lacks one thing. Real class. Class is not something you can buy, it's something that oozes from the walls. And it's certainly not evident here. Pre-programmed desk staff, waiters removing your plate the second the last mouthful has passed your lips even though your colleagues are still eating. Efficient, yes. Classy, no. Yes, these are small points, yes you are not paying very much to stay there and yes I would return. My point being that the Encore sells itself as something it most definitely isn't. If it has been awarded its' AAA five-star diamond award for fixtures and fittings, it is thoroughly deserved. For the total experience, this is dubious. As one of my colleagues remarked "It's champagne lifestyle at beer prices" Welcome to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Ericsson81
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in !! Impeccable rooms, service And value for money ! Added bonus that the encore pool party is on sight and the best in Vegas as is the nightclub XS !

Reviews.Title: “Nothing better in vegas”
Reviews.Author: Chris10573
Reviews.Content: lets just say encore is the top of the line in vegas, you can tell by just walking into to the Wynn and encore that they are a step above all the other hotels. the encore was clean modern and amazing. stay at no other hotel, just walking around the hotel you can tell how they take care of the property. they were changing carpeting that looked brand new. the only downfall is that it is at the end of the strip and walking to other hotels could be time consuming , but well worth it. the room was very modern with automatic shades and one touch shuts everything down for sleeping. Modern, spotless, attention to detail and the price was right, Steve wynn knows how to build hotels. If you get the chance , stay at Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Encore Suite with View of The Strip”
Reviews.Author: SlotQueen655
Reviews.Content: First time staying at The Encore. We had a suite which I knew would be a big room but it was actually astonishing when we saw it. A huge room with a great view of The Strip. We've stayed at The Bellagio, The Wynn, and The Venetian, and this accommodation was right up there with them. The casino floor is smaller than the other resorts, so I'd like to see them up the gaming a little by adding more $1 slots. Overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Choose the tower suites for extra service and attention.”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrvlr37
Reviews.Content: After dozens of trips to Vegas and after staying at pretty much every high end hotel there, I can honestly say that the Wynn and the Encore hotels remain my favorite places to stay by a wide margin. Not only do these hotels have excellent service, but their feel is modern, open and airy. Unlike the new hotels in the city center (Aria, Mandarin Oriental, etc..), The Encore is modern and warm (not stark) and has tons of natural light that make it look open and inviting unlike any other casino you have ever been to. Pros: - Excellent food in all their restaurants. Some of the best bread and desserts you have ever had, and, did I mention that their Pinapple/blackberry infused Vodka is to die for? These hotels have definitely some of the best restaurants in town! No need to leave the resort for a great dinner. - Speaking of dinners, my wife is vegetarian and she loved the Vegan/Vegetarian menus available in every single restaurant. - Tryst and Xcess are some of the best clubs in Vegas. Beautiful people and very exclusive, just bring your wallet! lol The Encore Beach club is great for hanging out during the day too! - Excellent shopping - Great gym/workout area - $10.00 cab ride from pretty much anywhere worth going to in Vegas. Tips: - Choose the Encore Tower Suites for extra privacy. They have a special entrance with far less people than the regular hotel and special elevators too. No waiting here. - Your Suite key also affords you VIP access to the buffet line, free gym access and other perks like a private concierge, etc... - Choose a room in the higher floors for fantastic views of the strip and less noise from the pool below. - Do use the concierge services to make reservations for all your shows and dinners the moment you arrive. - Do tell the hotel if you are celebrating a special event. The offered us complementary champagne and chocolate strawberries for my birthday and a free dessert in every restaurant we dined in. - For things to do, we recommend: Ka & "O" (CIrque Du Solei), Some of the adult shows and A helicopter trip with lunch to the grand Canyon (this was an activity that I did not originally wanted to do, but turned out to be one of the best funnest things I have ever done. Tip Seat at the front of the way over). Cons: - If you are facing the pool/clubs and are in one of the lower levels, they music may be a bit annoying on Fridays and Saturdays. Choose a room in a higer floor to prevent this. - Some of the rooms are beggining to show a bit of wear and tear. Not bad at this time though.

Reviews.Title: “The Wynn is A MUST!”
Reviews.Author: kiki7
Reviews.Content: My first time in Vegas (May 2010) and my first visit to this hotel proved to have me hooked! The hotel is fabulous, the people friendly, the location ideal and the rooms FANTASTIC! The Wynn is a newer hotel and therefore the rooms are clean, modern, well maintained and spacious. I was there for a bachelorette party but loved every minute we spent in our rooms. The beds were beyond comfortable, the bathrooms large enough to share, and the furnishing modern and practical. The hotel provided a variety of eating options and we all enjoyed every minute. The only issue we did have which was minor, was that our room did not have a view of anything memorable other than an adjoining rooftop. You must also realize that hotels of this size and popularity are not the place you will get personalized service. This does not mean it is lacking but it is a LARGE HOTEL that tries to expedite its services so as to get to everyone....

Reviews.Title: “Hands Down, finest Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJayBird
Reviews.Content: I was so looking forward to my stay at Encore. Almost to the point where they would probably end up disappointing me in some regard. THEY DIDNT. This place is absolutely amazing. Everything is available and if you ever feel like you ned more people, just walk over to the Wynn. You never need to leave this complex. My most favorite part of this hotel/casino is the air quality and elbow room. At no point on the casino floor do you ever feel cramped or stuffy. There is so much room between the tables. You will love this place as we did and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: seattle_cat_2011
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed at the Encore. The hotel and room were beautiful and every staff member we encountered was friendly and professsional. The room elevators are conveniently located near the registration desk, casino and pool. It's less crowded and more low key than many of the other casinos. The only negatives were: - The bed was too firm, so I didn't sleep very well. - The main pool is right next to the european style/beach club pool that played very loud and annoying dance music. Several people around us complained, but nothing was done about it. Not the right atmosphere for us middle aged folks. - No casual dining options We also stayed at the Wynn for a couple of nights on this trip, which didn't have the negatives listed above (but had a few others). I will probably stay at the Wynn from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, i will come back next summer! One of my Favorite hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: Philip Bruun E
Reviews.Content: The hotel is Astonishing, and the Rooms are soooo big and the price is not that high at all. i think i had a normal room which is 65 m2. the beds is good as well. You feel a bit proud that you saying at encore, after i saw the room, i had the feeling that it is some of the nicest rooms in Las vegas for the price. It was a bit of a mess to get breakfast, you have to walk to win, and there was a huge line, so we found something else. It is a bit of a shame that you have to pay to get to the Hotels club´s when you stay in the hotel, there should at least be a discount or something. The parties in Encore is fantastic. The club XS is one of the Best Coolest parties i have ever been to. the pool out side is amazing.... go early so you can skip the 100 meter line. Surrender (Beach club during the day) is Really cool and some of the hottest girls on the planet in bating suits. Watch out for the minibar, if you open it they will charge you. and if you even lift anything to just look at it, they will charge you. (a lot) Staff in the reception is really nice but, the doormen are stupid as always do not ask them anything, or you will be disappointed. Go to both of the clubs and you will not be disappointed :) Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience EVER.”
Reviews.Author: RobinQuiversFan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are not the biggest travelers, but when we travel, we want to stay in nice hotels and "splurge" on accommodations. We selected the Encore after reading quite a few reviews of LV hotels. We've never been to LV before, and the Encore just blew us away. I have stayed at many wonderful hotels, but the Encore by Wynn was just wonderful on every level! I loved the "suite" feature of all of the Encore rooms and the bathroom was HUGE. Beautiful linens, room spotlessly clean, excellent amenities. I liked the fact that we were on the North end of the strip, and could get away from the noise and the crowds. We like to walk and had no problem navigating the rest of the strip. After visiting almost every hotel on the strip, we definitely made the right choice. Wonderful staff as well - the concierge was great securing reservations and even just making recommendations. We ate at several of the restaurants and thoroughly enjoyed every meal. Pricey, like all of Vegas, but excellent with top notch service. Love the shopping within the Wynn complex as well! Especially the Manolo Blahnik store! Hands down, the best place we've ever stayed and we will be back. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, in every aspect of the word”
Reviews.Author: Suryonhan
Reviews.Content: has held numerous Forbes Five Star awards and the property is beautiful. I can't say one bad thing about the hotel. I was the most impressed by the service. This place has the red carpet rolling out from the moment you walk in to the time you leave. Name engraved room key cards to the fresh flowers on the room service table, the little details made a big impact. The spa is gorgeous. It has both Asian and classic Italian influences and it blends nicely to create a fantasy world. The four hydro pools are immaculate and temperature controlled to give you a variety. The rain showers are a nice touch as well as the steam room and the sauna. Overall, one of the best hotels I have been to. Bravos!

Reviews.Title: “Best US Hotel Resort”
Reviews.Author: Adm7
Reviews.Content: There may be a better resort somewhere in the US but I have yet to find it. I have stayed at just about every Ritz Carlton in Florida plus a few others including the Ritz Carlton / Four Seasons in Chicago, none had the quality of construction, materials, and furnishings to match the Encore. There are some areas that the Encore were not up to the level of a Ritz, for example there was no turndown service in the evening during our stay, so don’t expect fresh towels in the evening if you desire replacements, for the price the Encore is an outstanding value.
