The Encore seemed to attract a wider spectrum of clientele than the typical hotel of this caliber, a younger less inhibited mix; let’s just say some people behaved inappropriately at the Euro Pool, as if auditioning for girls (and boys) gone wild. Generally speaking the property was very well maintained, I keep coming back to design, construction, quality of materials; Steve Wynn gets my vote as the Steve Jobs and Walt Disney of hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a price”
Reviews.Author: TexCol56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore for three days starting Sept. 8. Originally we were booked at the Wynn but our reservation said we would be upgraded to a king suite if available and it was. The rooms are the best in Las Vegas. Great views, comfortable beds, fantastic bath, everything you could want in a room. The room would make me book it again however the prices might not. Eight dollars for a beer is too much. Poolside food was also high however the pools are great and the staff attentive. I have a problem with the location because it is the last hotel on that end of the strip so you're walking a lot but there are restauranrs close including Maggianos and the Stripburger as well as the Fashion Mall. Overall it delivers on comfort and pricing. I had a package deal so that bought the price down. La Reve was ok. It was comped thankfully because I wouldn't pay 130/ticket to see it. I'll stay again if the price is right otherwise I might move to the other end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and attractions”
Reviews.Author: anderl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, grandeur deco, plenty of restaurants and attractions. The pool was excellent, the gaming rooms clean and serviced, and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Hotels are now a science....”
Reviews.Author: Sad2BHomeDenver
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas for business quite frequently and have stayed in most of the newer hotels, Bellagio, Venetian, Mandalay, Aria, The Hotel, etc. The Encore at the Wynn would rank at the top of those hotels, I would give it a 4.5. Initially, walking into the hotel and through the lobby, it reminded me of the Bellagio with a red theme. It is light and airy rather than dark and smoky as some of the Vegas hotels can be. Check in was quick, however, they put the wrong room number on my card when I checked in. Naturally, I couldn't get in but housekeeping was next door and immediately called security and they corrected the mistake very quickly. Mistakes happen but everyone rushed to correct. The rooms are on par wth The Hotel/Mandalay and the Venetian with the "suite" concept of a separate sitting area and grand bathroom with soaking tub, large shower, and two sinks. (Seems like these Vegas Hotels have a template and they customize only the style and color) The beds, what can I say about the beds. They were the ultimate in comfort. They sell the bedding in one of the stores in the shopping pavilion and I was actually tempted to go buy them. The Esplanade shopping area boasts some of the finest brands I've seen, even in Vegas. We ate at Switch, which was a bit kitchy (the walls and lighting changes every 30 minutes or so) but true to Las Vegas was great food and great service. I didn't have the opportunity to use the pool area but did walk through and it was beautiful as were all of the grounds...simply immaculately kept. I passed Steve Wynn during the stay and he was greeting people and asking everyone if they were satisfied with their stay. Nice touch. Check out was a breeze and unlike some of the other hotels had a much more efficient cab service. (You can wait forever to grab a cab at some of the hotels) The Venetian is next door and has a much better selection of restaurants, however, for the grounds, service and hotel itself, I would say the Encore has the edge and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nicely appointed. The best thing: Le Reve”
Reviews.Author: SKI_Road_Warrior
Reviews.Content: The Good: Rooms - suite was nicely appointed. We didn't have an issue with check in or finding a good room. We didn't experience the severe noise issue that so many others complained about -- but there is a fair amount of "white" noise which can be distracting. Simply put, riding in a Mercedes is a quieter experience. On the plus, you do not have to drag yourself through a "casino maze" to get to the elevator bank from the check in desk. Security @ the Encore was good -- and we appreciated this. We've stayed at other places in Vegas (i.e - Venetian) where the elevators become a mob scene and staying there becomes a total and complete nightmare. For this reason, we appreciated the Encore's security efforts. Le Reve - amazing. Highly recommend seeing this production. This was the highlight of our stay at Encore. I can not say enough good things about this show and the cast. It is certainly a lot less frenetic to stay at the same property where you see a show (and not have to cab and run around like a bunch of headless chickens trying to get there on time). Pet Peeves - If one pays a premium price, I would hope that the "royal" treatment be thought through in the details -- so here's the short list: Food options - limited. For this reason, we hopped in a cab to get to the great food -- it added another $30 to each and every one of our meals. Bathroom products: the bathroom is well stocked with a fair number of products, but...as a frequent traveler, I am kind of picky about the "stock" bathroom products in better hotels - and these ones were "ok" but not great. They certainly did not compel me to want to purchase them in the store downstairs to take home. The stock conditioner left my hair in a tangled mess, so I was less than happy... Mini-Bar: the mini bar has a 60 second timer (not unusual), so you really don't want to take anything off the sensor unless you plan to pay for it -- including the $8 Fiji water (which is $2.50 everywhere else). My personal gripe about the hotel is that there is no complimentary "downscale" drinking water - which is offered at a fair amount of other hotels. Valet Parking - is located on a lower floor. You have to haul all of your stuff and go down one floor to get to the valet, which sort of defeats the purpose of "valet" by definition. In short, competition is tough in Vegas -- esp. with all of the City Center properties which have opened up. Overall, a nice stay - however, with a lot of competition around which has raised the bar considerably, I would think twice before returning for the following reasons: (1) this place is SO remote for *great* food options (2) there are better first class hotels that I like better, and (3) the fact that the Encore is not pet friendly. We stay in Vegas several times a year, so we don't often bother to submit Trip Advisor reviews for Vegas hotels where we stay -- unless they are unusual (good or bad); I think after all of the rave reviews that our friends' had mentioned about Wynn/Encore - I would want to know the details so that I could make an informed decision on where to spend my money. For me, I prefer south strip location for the "Vegas experience" -- Four Seasons, or even somewhere in City Center which seems to suit my "convenience factor" (i.e., food, location, amenities, etc.), preferences better.

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jeff K
Reviews.Content: We chose the Encore/Wynn property to spend our 7-day vacation and we were very pleased and impressed with the entire experience. The Encore is connected to Steve Wynn's signature namesake hotel via an Esplanade walkway which houses many of the top brands in fashion. The property and grounds are kept immaculate; there is ample staff to assist you with any needs you may have, and as a guest I was made to feel welcomed. As someone who has been to Las Vegas over the last 20 years, it's a rare testament that when you depart the Encore/Wynn properties you wish you were able to spend another week exploring all the great restaurants and amenitieis you didn't take advantage of during your stay. I've read many reviews on Trip Advisor and other sites indicating that the fees at Encore/Wynn for food, drink and resort usage are excessive. As a highly seasoned business traveler (approx. 30 weeks per year for 15 years) I do not agree with this assessment. The reality is that pricing logic for food and lodging no longer exists; if you feel value has been imparted based on your personal experience then it merits the cost. In short, I believe the statement "there's no free lunch" best sums it up. As anyone who has been to Las Vegas knows, the selection of hotels and amenities are almost limitless. Encore/Wynn are at the top end of the hotels in town. If you prefer to lodge in a first class resort property replete with all the amenities it has to offer, I highly recommend you add this to your potential list of stays.

Reviews.Title: “top notch!!!”
Reviews.Author: mardeuce
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Wynn in 2010 so i decided why not try out on Encore even though i was satisfied with Wynn. Everything from the check in to the check out was great. The room was very clean and not a single problem throughout our entire trip, the staff was always friendly and definately going to come back and stay again

Reviews.Title: “Encore was Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Almar1
Reviews.Content: I have been lucky enough to stay at 50% of all the hotels in Vegas and the Encore was the best hotel I've been lucky enough to visit. The rooms were beautiful and very clean, the staff was excellent and very friendly and the food was tremendous. Great hotel for a couples get-away!

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: tgtoronto
Reviews.Content: All the kudos here are well deserved. I didn't even mind the location at all. Total class and luxury in all respects. Outstanding service, wonderful employees. The food in all the restaurants was outstanding. The value is remarkable. In Europe, a suite like this would be well over $1000. Now I understand why Americans are so often disappointed when they travel abroad! There are excellent deals midweek, especially if you join their website. You can't do better. I thought Vegas was going to be a one time thing but I can now see going for a holiday, just for the hotel, cuisine and pool! Beats the resort factories in the Caribbean any day.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly overrated.”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: Maybe my expectations were too high. Maybe outside factors influenced my opinion of the hotel. Maybe Steve Wynn's voice just really grates on my nerves. Whatever the reason, after spending almost a week in Encore to celebrate Labor Day with a small group of friends, I think it could be most accurately compared to a Rolex or Armani: a good product that costs about 5 times as much as it's worth, and should only be bought if you're sold on the name and have money to burn. The staff are friendly and polite, but they don't really go out of their way to help you. For example, I was unlucky enough to get a room next to the elevator, which would wake me up every time it arrived on our floor. When I called the front desk about this, they apologized for the noise but refused to let me switch rooms, saying that since I had paid in advance they were unable to make any changes to my reservation. Even if that was true, which I have a hard time believing, they could have at least offered me a set of earplugs or something. Even without the noise, the rooms themselves didn't really wow me. They were spacious and comfortable, but very uninspired. Even though I was in a top-floor room, the view wasn't the best - I was at an odd angle that mostly just allowed me to watch the construction site below. Some of my friends got stuck with a connecting door and very loud guests in the next room, and although the front desk promised to do something about the noise, nothing happened. The resort has a decent selection of restaurants, but once again demanded high prices for average (by Vegas standards) food. The casino is also nice, but has higher table limits, tighter slots, and the dealers don't seem as friendly or helpful as other places on the Strip. This seems to be a consistent problem with Encore: it's not that it's bad, it's just there's so many other places that do it better for the same price. Venetian/Palazzo offer larger rooms, Mandarin Oriental offers better service, Aria has a larger casino, Bellagio is in a more convenient location, and so on. Unless you have a reason to stay in this particular hotel, there's better deals to be found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and view.”
Reviews.Author: Jobias
Reviews.Content: Speedy check-in on arrival - courteous and friendly staff. Rooms were huge and well-appointed. Comfy bed and great view over the strip and downtown. Everything worked well during our stay. The TV in the bathroom was a nice touch. Bit of a walk to any attractions or restaurants outside of the hotel/s but access to the fashion show mall shouldn't take more than a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmiller73
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that this is a great hotel. Because of my love for The Cosmopolitan, I was being a bit critical of Encore. The service and overall atmosphere is perfect. It is very light and airy feeling. The rooms are nice, but because of the partition between the bedroom and living area, I felt a bit closed off. It is hard to look out the widow from the bed. The TV swivels so you can watch it from the bedroom or living area. However, if you're sitting on the couch, you have to look 90 degrees to your left to watch TV. Granted, you're not in Vegas to watch TV, but nonetheless...The 21+up pool had a good vibe and is free. The pool DJs were awesome and there was enough seating, provided you got there before 11:15. The food at the pool was mediocre. Everything was served cold, even tortilla chips (the drinks were yummy though). There are a ton of high-end restaurants, but very few easy/quick bit-kind of places. Encore/Wynn has plenty of bars and clubs on its property. Despite it being in a less-than-average location on the strip, you don't feel the need to go anywhere else. Def would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tgraddon
Reviews.Content: Had my 50th here with friend, stayed for a week and had the time of our lives, Steve Wynn and his team really know how to do it

Reviews.Title: “Only one word can describe this hotel...magnificent.”
Reviews.Author: ABTravelDine
Reviews.Content: There is only one word that truly describes my experience at the Encore Las Vegas… magnificent. It was the first impression of walking through the doors that truly affected me the most. The Encore Las Vegas is a 5 star hotel by Steve Wynn and appeared to go above and beyond in terms of customer satisfaction and amenities. When I first arrived at the hotel, I was greeted by immense, solid mahogany doors, which in a sense, seemed like a symbol of greatness. As I stepped through the door, I was greeted by large floor to ceiling windows that gave out a subtle dosage of sunlight, which helped emphasize and bring about the warm red and gold ambiance throughout the room. It literally felt as though I entered a new majestic world because I've never experienced anything as amazing as this, in terms of architecture. As I continued to walk forward, I noticed the plush and soft red carpet that essentially massaged my every step. When I looked left and right, I couldn't help but notice the great amounts of detail of the walls and ceilings from the elegant art work and chandeliers that complimented the soft yet vibrant colors, all the way to the extensive use of decorative crown molding and trim. It was a room that made me feel extremely comfortable since it was exceptionally spacious and quiet for a casino hotel, all complimented by a beautiful fragrance that virtually eliminated all hints of cigarette smoke. I don’t know why, but entering the hotel was amazing. The overall property of the Encore feels very comfortable and intimate. It didn’t feel like I was being suffocated by a low ceiling and slot machines at every corner. I remember once going to the Treasure Island and I just felt that I was rubbing elbows with every person in the casino and lobby. However, my experience at the Encore was more pleasant since the overall property felt roomy. Another thing I truly appreciated about the Encore was the service. Everyone at the concierge desk or check in desk greeted me with a smile and appeared to be very patient when I asked questions about shows and dining. A great touch to the trip was when the kind woman at the check in desk comped our roll-in bed during our 5 night stay. The one thing that really stood out at the Encore was the guests. The guest seemed to dress fairly nice and their appearance seemed a little high class. What I mean is that you rarely saw someone walking around the hotel with a tank top or raggedy attire. In terms of dining and shopping, it seemed like the Encore had the best of the best. The shopping esplanade was very high class- a little out of my price range! I didn’t eat at any of the restaurants but I feel that they are probably good anyway. I honestly found myself walking over to the Wynn Buffet and eating most of my meals there. My only complaint about the Encore is the location. Although it’s quite secluded from the heart of the strip which is where all the action is, it’s still a far hike to get to the popular hotels and attractions located near like the Bellagio or MGM Grand. But other than that, I absolutely had no complaints. Overall, I had a great time at the Encore and I will definitely make sure to book my stays there whenever I return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome facility but RUDE reception!”
Reviews.Author: kahanac
Reviews.Content: Enjoy being greeted by friendly staff upon arrival? We do, it sets the tone for the start of a getaway! After the hassles at the airport the last thing you want at your hotel is an unfriendly, rude front desk receptionist. That was "Vanessa" at the Encore! She was extremely unfriendly, didn't even look at me, and actually "sneered" at me. Be careful at Encore's nail salon; they'll "rob" you! You expect to pay more at a salon, but being charged $20 to removed "no-chip" polish is outrageous in addition to the $45 manicure and $85 pedicure! They don't tell you in advance about the extra charge. The cleaning lady was a gem, but watch out for Vanessa, with the "attitude" at the front desk if she's still around. Vanessa is a "force to be reckoned with!" Couldn't pay me to stay there again...for a new hotel they have lots to learn about customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: ziggydssp
Reviews.Content: FIrst Impressions - gaudy but grew to like the decor Check In - we checked in at about 4:30 pm and had no wait Room - very nice, spotless, lots of storage for clothes, shoes etc. Beds - very soft mattress that you sink down into so if your used to harder bed, you may not be comfortable. The sheets were hot and there is no air vent in the sleeping area. We had to crank down the air to 64 to get it as cool as we like in the sleeping area. View - only a mountain view was available when we checkin in. I would select a room that faces at angle furthest away from the unfinished construction across the street. It's not pretty. That's what we did and we enjoyed the view. Noise - room noise was minimal, the doors are very heavy and they block out almost all the noise the hallways. Never heard any noise from the rooms next door. We checkin in Tuesday and checked out on Saturday. The Beach Club only runs Friday to Monday so we only had one night to be concerned about regarding club noise. Being on the mountain side we never heard any club noise while in our room. Pool Scene - very clean, plenty of chairs, attentive service. What turned me off was the scene in the afternoon felt like a Hollywood pool movie scene with lots of foul mouthed drunk people that gave it a trashy feel. We found the best time to go was in the morning, it was very relazing and had a nice cool breeze blowing through the pool area. Restaurants - Decor is absolutely stunning, no other casino can match the quality fo the decor. Society Cafe was okay, the in room video tour of the hotel raved on the fish and chips but for $22.00 the fish and chips were very bland. And the "Chips" were Pomme Frits, not traditional Chips. The Buffet was decent but other than the Asian selections there is not much different than I would find on a Casino Buffet at a four star hotel/casino. SW was good as well but not great, we had the Porterhouse for Two and it was a bit fatty and hard to cut. For $108 for one steak, I was expecting better quality. The bread with dinner could of been more inventive, very bland. The atmosphere was very enjoyable, we sat outside. Service was cordial and attentive. Overall vibe at night - a bit too trashy for my likes, lots of women dressed in impossibly short dresses in high heels, many looked like hookers. Lots of drunk people using foul language, lots of people dressed in appropriately, gym shorts, t-shirts etc. This place could be absolutely amazing if the clientele matched the quality of the hotel. I visited the Four Seasons and found it to be a totally different vibe very classy and very nice decor, it had too much of a corporate feel for me but I would consider staying there next time, the pool ther was quite small but seemed very relaxing. Location - being at the end of the strip was not an issue. We were able to walk to almost all the nicer casino's (Ceasar's, Bellagio, Paris, Venetian) without getting too tired or sweaty. We took the RTS bus to Mandalay Bay. If you can catch an Express Bus, it's an easy ride. If you have to take the Duwce bus (makes lots of stops) it's a pain the rear and quite frustrating. We found Express buses very hard to find, they were never on tie and the drivers were quite surley. If you can afford it, take a taxi. The mall across the street (Fashion Mall) is awesome. We enjoyed our stay at Encore and would possibly return. We visited almost every hotel in Vegas in this class and found Enore to have the most beautiful restaurants. If you don't end up staying at Encore I would at least visit for a drink or dinner. It's worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay”
Reviews.Author: MickyDionisio
Reviews.Content: By far the most superbly decorated suite we've stayed at in Vegas. The suite is very spacious and every single detail was designed for a reason. Mirrors open up the room even more. The bathroom is huge and comes with a flat panel TV. There's also not shortage of clubs between Encore and Wynn. Aria takes the cake by a small margin for the simple reason that Encore is located towards the end of the good part of the strip which Aria is at the center.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful High Tech Room!”
Reviews.Author: memse
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying 3 nights at the Encore Hotel in Las Vegas on a business trip to exhibit at WMworld. I have to say that Encore is a great property. My room was on the 28th floor and had a super view looking south at the strip. I was impressed as soon as I walked in with the spaciousness, decor, appointments and high tech lighting. I had a king bed which was nicely separated from a sitting area & desk with floor to ceiling windows. The desk had a printer/fax machine, a wired high speed internet connection ($13.95/day) and a pop-up power center. While extremely impressed with the power drapes & screen the latter would open but not close properly (although the maid got this to work every day). The only negative things I can say about the room is I was intimidated by the optional snack & beverage options because you get automatically billed if you remove an item for over 60 seconds and how slow the TV was to power up. It would take about 15-20 seconds for it to come alive after pressing the power button. The hotel lobby is small but you can check in at the Wynn which is what I did when walking over from the Sands Expo center. I arrived early and went to the bigger pool at the Wynn (as a guest you can use any of the facilities at Encore or Wynn) until they sent me a text saying my room was ready. I also discovered that you can walk from the Sands to the Encore with only having to exit air conditioning to briefly cross a sky bridge. I enjoyed the walk which gave me the opportunity to see people in the casinos and browse the expensive shops lining the corridors. All & all I'd highly recommend staying at the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieFromToronto
Reviews.Content: We went to the Encore with 12 friends all turning 40 this year and we had such a great time. We stayed in the Tower Suites, which we have to say we were disappointed with, because they really weren't any bigger than a regular room, so not really worth the extra money. But the European Pool area was so much fun! It made our stay really enjoyable. Word of warning - don't bother with the cabanas - they charge you $600 and you are set so far away from the fun at the pool - you do get a lilly pad on the edge of the pool, but if there's more than 3 of you, you won't fit. Save your money for the drinks and gambling and hang out by the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for exploring beyond the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: SafariPooh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a long weekend together at Encore. We received a special offer that included lodging for 3 nights, 2 tickets to Le Reve, and 20% off all meals at every Wynn restaurant. We paid $419 for the package. We took advantage of the dining discount by eating at Society Cafe twice and The Country Club Sunday Jazz Brunch. We were aware of the $20 resort fee ahead of time, and we also were familiar with the menus at every on-site restaurant, so we were very well informed ahead of time regarding costs we would incur during our stay. Our enthusiasm for the hotel was in part due to the value we received for our dollar. We came to have a great time, and Encore exceeded every expectation. We loved this all-suites hotel. The quality of every item in the room was outstanding. Linens, furnishings, and interior design was elegant. The soundproofing was wonderful. The unique floor plan made us feel we had a much bigger room because not an inch of space was wasted. The closet was spacious and well-planned to accommodate lots and lots of clothes and suitcases. Loved the swivel TV/drawer chest because it divided the area into two distinct rooms. After a long hike, my husband napped in the bedroom while I channel surfed, then read a book in the utter calm and quiet of the living room. We easily adjusted lights and sound accordingly in each space. (Sometimes a "suite" doesn't provide truly separate living/sleeping rooms.) We experienced no hiccups in the level of customer service. Every contact with the staff was appropriate and friendly. It was what I expected from a luxury hotel. (On a side note, the wait staff at each restaurant was impeccable.) One of the biggest benefits was the close proximity of the self-parking lot to the lobby entrance. We spent most days away from Vegas and came "home" each evening for a nice dinner and a show. After hiking all day in 115 degree heat, we did not need another hike from the parking lot to our room. Both of us looked forward to coming back to the Encore to get ready for an elegant evening. We cannot say this is the case for other hotels on the Strip. Do what we did. Leave the kids with the grandparents, and stay at Encore for a civilized vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like Alice, through the Looking Glass... Fun, upscale and whimsical hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JetSettingWoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore for nine days during a business trip in August 2011. The hotel is very upscale and fun. It draws a largely European & more sophisticated crowd; lots of couples and children. The restaurants are top notch, but we had some of the worst service ever at Social. Very disappointing... hopefully, it was an off night. The rooms are small suites (Venetian & Palazzo's are bigger and more spacious) but very well appointed. The beds are quite comfortable and the bathroom was great for pampering after a long day. The Lobby Bar was great for apres-work or late night cocktails but the menu was a little heavy for us. Did love that the Sundries store carried fresh salads, sandwiches and Vegan protein bars. (All of Steve Wynn's hotels have vegan options throughout) Location was great for my business purposes to LVCC... just a quick 3-4 minute cab ride in the morning. Getting to the Strip was OK... we walked a lot but do not recommend it for small children or older adults. You'll wind up taking a lot of cabs if you want to do anything mid-strip. I went to the pool on my last morning and it was early enough so it was quiet and extremely relaxing. I think they have a day club where there is more action, though. Loved the entrance through their Spa... next time I go, I am definitely booking a treatment there. It is the most beautiful and serene place in Vegas that I've been to yet! Overall, great hotel to call home for nine days in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “"THE BEST OF THE BEST"”
Reviews.Author: Ochie10
Reviews.Content: Steve Wynn definetly has the best hotels in Las Vegas. Wynn's impeccable taste is displayed in every single detail of the Encore and no expense has been spared in the decor which is outstanding. The suites are extremely well thought out and the beds are the most comfortable that I have slept on. The service is also top notch at the Encore. There is a super Spa and Gym. The Beach Club which opens 4 days a week is something to see and experience and the main pool is very well appointed. There are also many exquisite restaurants. What I also like about this particular hotel is that it is away from the maddening crowd and that it has easy access to the Wynn, The Fashion Show Mall, The Palazzo & The Venetian. It is one classy hotel and after staying at many of the other hotels in Vegas will cobntinue to choose the Encore. It really is a cut above the rest

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Wynn or stay home”
Reviews.Author: Pips_14
Reviews.Content: Yet another wonderful experience at this marvelous resort.  Although I didn't have a salon suite like I had prior (I tipped my desk clerk way more than $20 bucks, that trick didn't work for me loolol) but the panoramic tower room was phenomenal!! We stayed on the 60th floor with an awesome view of the strip.   Something I realized this trip is that there are no casinos or hotels in Vegas that even compare to the Wynn.   It was so nice to see such a clean resort with fresh flowers placed throughout it daily.  No one else does the little things like that.  Not even the newer Aria has anything to compare.  Now, even as a big fan of the Wynn, here's  a couple of things I disliked... We arrived on Thursday to a partially empty casino, it was awesome!! Not a lot of smoke, not a lot of people and we were actually winning money!! Everyone was happy... This was short lived because as soon as Friday arrived EVERYTHING changed. Like a switch was switched..  I guess the pro's arrived and took over.  The place became super packed, the smokers arrived in herds and I lost all the money I had won, plus some.  I know, I know - it's a casino, duh...but I think the next time I go I'll try to go during the week with the other amateurs.   Oh and another helpful tip,  park on the top floor, level 4 if you get a car rental..  It's a lot cooler with plenty of parking.  Unlike the other crap casinos, the Wynn makes parking and entering the resort a breeze.   Love the koi ponds they have at the entrances to their uber elite villas.  I always love to go there and just hang out for a few minutes, so very refreshing.  Thanks Wynn, <3 you for being the best!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: LesAZRIA
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooms, amazing casino, amazing poker room, amazing shops, amazing pools, amazing service, amazing food (the chicken salad @poolside was delicious), amazing views...everything in this hotel is beautiful and perfect... The only thing that was not incredible was the "Le Reve" show... Beautiful stage but nothing else... Boring.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best rooms but poor casino floor service”
Reviews.Author: Eric_S_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: From the moment you drive up, you are treated like you're important. The service from the bell desk to the room service was incredible. The rooms are out of this world. We stayed in a Panoramic Suite in the Encore tower and had a fabulous view of the strip. The higher the floor, the better. The floor to ceiling windows and shutters that open all the way really give you a scence of how crazy Las Vegas is. Being from Phoenix, the wife and I go probably 2-3 times a year with friends and this was by far the best room we've ever been in. Sadly, the rooms were not nearly as soundproof as I would have liked and you could definetly hear the rooms next to you. Not a deal breaker though because all Vegas rooms are noisy. We only tried to game there one night and were so dissapointed, we left after about 45 minutes and never tried again. We sat at the video roulette for at least 25 minutes waiting for a drink hostess to come by without any luck. I finally saw one and asked her if she could take our order. She said she wasn't working that area but would have someone come over. 15 minutes later, no one had arrived so we decided to go elsewhere. Poor cocktail service is a sign of a poorly run floor so whoever is in charge of the floor should be looked at very carefully if anyone at Encore reads this. It's to bad because we lost a lot of money at another casino down the road. It could have been you Encore. I would definetly stay here again but I will not be visiting the casino. Le Reve was awesome btw. So was watching the drunk people leave the clubs at 3am.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at it's best”
Reviews.Author: dotboy3088
Reviews.Content: You cannot say enough about this five star resort with all of the little touches. 110 degrees at the pool made easier by free ice cold water bottles and orange slices being handed out. Suites that offer plenty of room and floor to cieling windows looking out over the lights of the strip. remote contrl of all lights and window shades from bedside. Highly recomend breakfast on teh Pizza shop patio overlooking the lake and waterfalls ..

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Matthanach
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the last 4 days of our honeymoon in Vegas and stayed at the Encore off the back of many recommendations from friends and were not disappointed. I wasn't really sure what to expect in terms of service bearing in mind its such a massive resort but the guy that checked us in was awesome, really friendly and gave us a better room as we were on honeymoon and that night arrnaged for complimentary Champagne and chocolate strawberries to be sent to our room. Speaking of the room, it was awesome...everything you could need and awesome views from the 62nd floor (one off top)! In terms of the resort, its pretty much got everything you can think of...millions of pools (Recommend European Pool), Beach club, loads of clubs on-site, designer shops, upteen restuarants and generally very friendly croupiers on the casino floor. We spent a decent amout of time exploring Vegas and visiting other casino's and other resorts and can safely say that I think its very unlikely I would stay anywhere else. The Bellagio and MGM are ok but are very dated compared to the Wynn / Encore If you're looking for a awesome hotel where you can combine wicked partying, good restuarants and great gambling then can highly recommend the Encore (or the Wynn for that matter). On a more general note..HIGHLY recommend Cirque Du Soleil's 'O' @ Bellagio (one of best shows I've ever seen) and restuarant wise 'Craftsteak' @ the MGM (Best steak I've ever had) and Tao :o)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: sunshineexpress
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!! Room was clean; however, my aunt noticed an odour coming from the washroom. almost like a hospital smell... Aside from that, location was fantastic as it was close to the mall, excellent service, and the rooms were clean. Just for those to keep in mind when checking in. the front desk lady wanted to upsell a room because there might be disturbance due to the nightclub noise. it was an extra $25 a night, which isn't too bad, but did not like how she was kind of pushy to sell the higher floor (55th). we declined and took the 31st floor. we heard a bit of music but it was very faint and it was not an issue. overall, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wynn = 1st class...period.”
Reviews.Author: Fortunes_Formula
Reviews.Content: can't even begin to describe the level this place operates on. The staff is 110% focused on providing a five star experience. Met an ex-employee upon arrival and she took the time to show me around the place as if I was paying for a tour. The restaurants are great, the casino floor is great, the pool, etc.........all great. Steve Wynn put his name on these resorts for a reason..........and I don't blame hiim............Wynn and Encore are the creme de la creme of Vegas. Treat yourself to a stay at Steve Wynn's resorts.....you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act”
Reviews.Author: deadwing
Reviews.Content: The Encore is a very stylish hotel, top spec design throughout with great attention to detail. The location at the end of the Strip made it part of the town yet one step removed, which i felt was a plus. The twin towers of the Encore and the Wynn had a strong presence on the skyline without shouting, unlike some of the neighbors. I was new to Vegas and was there for two nights with my wife who was working at a convention, so had time on my hands during the day. I explored pretty much all the hotels/casinos/malls on the Strip and felt that only The Bellagio and The Cosmopolitan came close to the level of the Encore in sophistication. I'm not a gambling man but the casino appeared less gloomy than the rest, more inviting. The shops were the likes of Alexander McQueen and Dior, which added to the hotel's five star appeal, although I suspect they were largely empty because of the extortionate prices. The one thing you could question was the lack of wow factor as you enter the reception, when it's competitors have that area covered. We had a king suite for about $200 which I felt was fantastic value, although the taxi drivers informed me that prices can vary depending on whether the town was busy or not. It might be worth shopping around and haggling for the best deals. It seems the hotels factor in the extra money you will spend on extras such as live events, food and drink and gambling, which subsidizes the rooms. The one think I felt let them down was the price of breakfast. $9 for a small orange juice, for example, was just plain greedy. What made it easier to swallow was the sensational view when you eat it in the room. We were on the 38th out of 60 floors and facing the Strip. Panoramic doesn't do it justice. I also loved the detail of having the light-tight curtains open via a remote control by the bed - very James Bond. We opted to eat elsewhere for other meals and found the Encore isn't alone in bumping up food and drink prices.

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Lotus111
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas three times. And twice now we have stayed in the Tower Suites in the Encore. The service is exceptional. From the Doorman to the Front Desk there is always a warm friendly greeting. Mr Wynn you have excelled yourself. The rooms are of a good size with ample comfort and luxuries. Great view of the strip,being an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room”
Reviews.Author: whitewolf678
Reviews.Content: Loved this room (King tower suite). Floor to ceiling windows with buttons for lights, drapes, even if you wanted or didn't want your room cleaned. Clean and very spacious room. Excellent amenities in the room. Negative check in was slow even in VIP checkin Parking here is excellent and at the end of the strip heading towards downtown so not congested. Liked the gamingand the pool in the Wynn part better. Would be nice to have a connection between the Wynn and Encore pools without walking all the way through the shops and part of the casino. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Girls' Holiday, we will be booking hotel again for 'Hen' Do next year...”
Reviews.Author: T0nyandSuzy
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Vegas with a group of girl friends and a friend over in Vegas had Press connections and put us up in a room in the Encore Wynn. We had stayed in other hotels in Vegas in the past (with friends and as a couple) and the experience at the Encore was by far the best. We stayed in an Encore Suite King and it was fabulously kitted out and serviced. Beds were the most comfortable we have had in Vegas to date! For the time of year (and being British) the entertainment for us mainly centred around drinking and clubbing and the Wynn Hotels had our favourite starting boutique bar/club and favourite final club (before Dre's ;), this was Club XS and well worth a visit. It was the perfect location within walking distance of all main attractions and it is easy to get a quick limo ride up the strip to where you need to be at night-just use the English accent! The front desk management at the Encore got us ticket to 'La Reve' at the Wynn. It is by far the most entertaining show we have seen over the years in vegas. We sat at the top and had the screens to watch the underwater dives on which is definitely recommended, I feel the show would not have been as good without these seats (and we got chocolate strawberries and champers from the waitress service in these seats-bonus!) All in all the Encore offered 5* accomodation with a great location and service. The staff were unbelievable and a credit to the company, they helped us with everything anf threw in a couple of extras that totally made the holiday. We are going back and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Steve Wynn got it right. You must stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NYCBAY
Reviews.Content: So I've stayed at the Wynn and Encore a few times (for those who are new, Encore is the new tower at the Wynn but they are really pretty much the same concept). Encore is everything I could dream a hotel to be. Uber-luxurious, fantastic service, amazing food, great drinks, awesome pool scene, fabulous nightclub, gorgeous spa, etc, etc. I just can't recommend a nicer hotel. I usually stay at the Tower Suites at Encore which I only do to avoid the check-in line. The one downside is usually dealing with a line at check-in but if you pony up an extra 50-75 bucks for a Tower Suite, you'll have a private entrance and no line at check-in. The rooms are nearly identical but you just feel a little bit like a VIP. Every room at Encore is gorgeous... no need to ask for a special room. I ate at Lakeside and SW during my most recent trip with my wife. Five stars for both, although I liked SW a bit more. Go and enjoy. These insanely low rates (we paid $239/night for a Tower Suite) are too good to be true. If you can stay out of the casino and just enjoy you room, the restaurants, shows, shopping, etc, you'll be happy. 5 stars! Thank you Steve Wynn for making me feel all the comforts of home and giving me a fantastic sensory experience at every turn.

Reviews.Title: “This Is absloute Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Grandomon
Reviews.Content: We stayed her to see Garth Brooks and the place was stellar...The country club and Switch was encredible and far beyond what one would expect. Thier bartenders were so nice and fun...Highly recomend this place...

Reviews.Title: “It's in the details... great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: justpumpitlouder
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner for about 8 nights. As a person who has stayed in numerous "5 star" hotels, I can honestly say that this 5 star hotel's attention to detail is far superior than any other hotel I have ever stayed at. It's truly in the little things, such as: 1. Knowledgable, kind, friendly concierge personnel who will go above & beyond, trust me even I was amazed at the sheer hospitality of the place 2. Housekeeping that will clean your room within 10 minutes from your request (if you had the do-not-distub sign illuminated); they're "green," so if you want your sheets changed, be sure to ask them when calling (otherwise they won't to conserve water, etc.) 3. Doorbells in each room, electronic window shades & sheers that work at a touch of a button, honest housekeeping (never had an issue leaving Boise noise-canceling headphones, iPod, iPhone, Apple computer unattended in room), and a wonderful iHome system to dock your phone into in case you want to turn up some music and invite some people over 4. All of the lights in the room are computerized, meaning one touch turns on or off all of the lamps, really convenient and kind of neat... there's a little "control panel" thing next to the bed 5. Not one blemish on the furniture, walls, ceilings, fixtures, etc. Attention to interior decor detail is amazing compared to other bland, run-of-the-mill Vegas hotels. Although the rooms aren't as large as at the Palazzo or some other hotels, the attention to detail really makes you not sweat the smaller square footage 6. The pool area is amazingly lush (although, if you have kids... see my comment below) 7. Free wifi internet upon payment of daily "resort fee" 8. They engrave your name onto your room key, and your room key can be used to not only buy anything anywhere inside of the casino, but you can use it as a players card when gambling... very convenient 9. EVERYONE, and I mean EVERYONE, I have encountered (okay, with one exception... see below) was beyond kind, beyond hospitable, and beyond anything I've ever experienced in a very, very good way. It's like everyone at this hotel is on happy pills... for example, my ironing board was stuck and wouldn't close... I call downstairs... less than 5 minutes, sha-bam... there's a man delivering me a new ironing board with a big smile and asking if I need anything else. Can life always be like this? 10. Although I know this might not appeal to everyone, but as a gay couple, I found the staff and environment very open and accepting... not all vegas hotels are that way with the gay crowd, so props to Encore for realizing a paying customer is a paying customer, regardless of lifestyle... The only problems I experienced during my stay was a rude employee at the Pizza Place restaurant (but after complaining to the manager, she refunded my money and even called the next morning to check up on everything.... like I said, it's in the details!). Also, the European Pool is DEFINITELY NOT a place to take your kids, and it's kind of in the eyesight of the regular pool. Okay, we all know European pool = topless women, but what you don't realize is that it's simply a party pool-- thumping music, craps tables... muscle guys drooling over the women with probably 5 too-many cocktails in their system... abandoned alcohol cups galore scattered among the place... oh and sexually explicit things such as motor-boating, dry humping, and a bunch of fondling among guests with no shame in sight (viva las vegas). I thought it was hilarious and a great time, I would tell you this just as a warning for those of you with kids.... make sure your kids don't wonder over to the other pool, otherwise you might have some explaining to do. If you want the best Vegas has to offer, book a room in their Tower Suites, but even if you don't... you will really enjoy your stay at this place, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: soccerbandit10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and very quiet compared to the other hotels. We wanted a quiet hotel still in a good location and this hotel was exactly that. The room was so nice and the bed was so comfortable. We didn't hear the club at all but we had a room facing the other side and it was very high. Eating at the hotel is very expensive but with the $100 credit you can try a place out. The pool area is also very nice because there is a family pool and an adult pool. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and helpful. The hotel was very new and clean as well. The best thing about the hotel was that it was located on the strip but it was a nice quiet place to come back to at night. I would definitly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always Amazing”
Reviews.Author: StaceyGaGa
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels in Las Vegas. The staff is very friendly and helpful, you are treated like royalty. We stayed in the Resort Suite King, and the room was huge. The lounge area was separate from the bedroom, so it was a great place to relax before going out. The flat screen TV swiveled from the bedroom to the lounge area. You could control the entire room with a remote control by the bed - lights, drapes, music! The hotel smells absolutely amazing. There are fresh flower arrangements everywhere. It is connected to the Wynn, so you get 2 hotels in 1. The dealers at the tables are very friendly and helpful. The restaurants are very unique and the food is absolutely delicious. It is a little to the expensive side, but it is Vegas! Society Cafe is a great place for lunch. Switch Steak was great also, the room switches scenery and music every half hour. The fitness center has some of the best machines. The spa is absolutely beautiful inside and the masseuses know what they are doing. We saw Le Reve, and the show is stunning. There is something exciting going on every second. It is so beautifully choreographed. The pool is an excellent place to hang out all day. The DJ is playing great music, and everyone is having a great time. The drinks are a little expensive ($9 a beer). There are craps tables in the shade. The pool turns into a club at night - XS. The DJ's are absolutely amazing, everyone is dancing and having a great time, and the atmosphere is so exotic. I honestly did not want to leave the hotel to go anywhere else in Vegas. But if it is your first time in Vegas, you definitely need to walk the strip and explore other hotels as well. I've just stayed in so many other ones before, I didn't want to leave the Encore this time. The only thing is, be careful how much you spend because it adds up quickly. I would suggest checking your balance every morning, not at the end of your trip! :)

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rochrossi
Reviews.Content: Encore Wynn was a beautiful hotel. The staff was exceptional, beautiful hotel suite. We ate at Sinatra's ,very good food. The club XS was wild but for the young crowd. beautiful grounds, pools, nice casino. I recommend this hotel if you plan on going to Vegas. It is at the end of the strip but you can walk to a lot of places.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 4th Of July Weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: annjensen5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore at Wynn for 4th of July weekend. It was PHENOMENAL. This was my second stay at the Encore (the first was this year for New Years Eve). The hotel is beautiful, as expected, and the rooms are above and beyond fabulous. The bed is so comfortable, the rooms are spacious.. and don't even get me started on the bathroom. Our shower turned into a steam room! All of the finishing touches are great in the decor. The room service was also notably great and not surprisingly so were all of the restaurants in the hotel!! We ate at the hotel every night except for one fantastic meal at our favorite, Simon's, at the Palm. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Vegas- the Wynn has it all!

Reviews.Title: “Note that impresses”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvlots
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal via email that included a suite upgrade and show tickets to Le Reve... Absolutely fantastic show and definitely recommend! The suite was nice BUT the flat screen TV that divides the room bocks the view when you are in bed… furnished in modern Asian décor but the sofa was a little hard. Service was great & friendly… if you plan on eating at the restaurants, bring $$$

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: 2onvacaton
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to the Encore. We viewed the suites on-line but were not prepared for the "thought of everything" feeling we got after checking in. The rooms are comfortable with an understated luxury. Floor to ceiling windows. With one button we could turn of/off all lights, open/close drapes. Spacious bathroom with large tub and separate shower. The 46" TV swivels 180 to face the bedroom or The casino is welcoming, bright with lively, beautiful décor. Lots of options for dining. Pools are expansive and beautifully landscaped. Staff was welcoming and friendly. We enjoyed our stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TGordon987
Reviews.Content: Upon receiving the brochure from the travel agent I was very excited. I have been to Vegas a couple of times before this trip, however I was looking forward to staying in the hotel. The hotel was everything I imagined it would be from the brochures, however we paid for every penny of it. Let me start by saying I do not have a problem paying for great service, however I couldn't understand how certain things were not included in the price. The room did not have a microwave, refrigerator, coffee, etc. Everything and I do mean everything was " a la carte", which was disappointing when we still had to pay an extra $25 a day for all of the other extras I never used in the hotel. I would rather that fee be placed within the original price of the stay instead of added on later. The restaurants were very expensive, however we did get to have brunch at the Wynn on Sunday morning. The hotel was running a "special" on their jazz brunch for $59 it was definitely well worth it. Although it was pricey it is a must do. There were several problems at the Encore. First, was the above mentioned a la carte amenities. Second, the club under the rooms were loud! My friend who is a light sleeper could not get any sleep. The music from the club was so annoying that I am not sure I would stay again. There are to many great hotels in Vegas to waste money and not be comfortable. Overall I am not sure if this is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: Itravellondon
Reviews.Content: The only thing that spoiled our stay was the fact that the hotel's policy seem to force us to spend money none stop during our stay. Be it for a basic cup of coffee for breakfast or an evening meal, one is forced to pay 3 times the average price for everything. You will need $1000 pocket money to get by for a week, (Gambling at the casino NOT included of course)

Reviews.Title: “Best room service in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ayao001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Encore for three nights and it was amazing. Encore, like Wynn, is an all suite hotel. We booked the encore resort suite room and got upgraded to the panoramic suite for a small fee. Lobby: The lobby was a little bit disappointing. The design seemed a little bit confused and messy. It didn't really have the WOW factor i expected from Encore. Room: Modern decor, spacious and very clean. Everything was electronic and the room had the cutest mini bar area with jelly beans and cookie jars. The view from the room was absolutely breathtaking. Service: The service was good but not wonderful. Compared to Bellagio, Encore still has many area that needs improving, especially with staff consistency. Some of them were very friendly and professional, others seemed disengaged and bored. Room service: The room service was amazing, possibly one of the best food in Vegas. The food came very quickly, and having that amazing view was an extra bonus. If you stay here, you must try the onion soup! It was heavenly! And the chinese barbecue pork, different from the ones I usually have, but in a good way. Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel is reasonably priced compared to places like Cosmo and Aria. I'd rather stay at the cheapest room at Encore rather than the more expensive suites at Aria (we have stayed at both hotels). Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alghamdi_f
Reviews.Content: Very positive about all details except the reception service was not good. The Asian girl was not welcoming and she was in a rush to get rid of me!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel to stay in vegas”
Reviews.Author: yousefalmansoori
Reviews.Content: i was having my honeymoon in US & i visited las vegas i've choose this hotel as reviews its really deserves to stay in

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: PSJ0
Reviews.Content: It was the first time to Vegas and as newlyweds we stayed at the Encore during our duration for 7 nights. After checking out from the Encore it was easy to know that we made the right choice to stay here. The place is smart and elegant. I went to most casinos hotels in the strip and nothing compares to the Encore-except the Wynn itself! The hotel casino was amazing, much sleeker and presentable that most casinos. The music they play on the sound system is decent and not ur cheesy old school anthems playing. There are loads of restaurants and bars within encore/wynn..Try La Cave...missed out on Wazuzu :( Saw the Le Reve show was was amazing..make sure u check it out...we got $20 off as we were staying at the Encore. The buffet was great! Dinner starts at 3pm and we went before and there was no queue at all at that time..We took our time in there. They have everything, seafood, steaks, worldwide foods and the desserts-too many to choose! My wife went for crepes which they made fresh and can see them making it. Encore is truly amazing and for someone who went Vegas for the first time and went through all the hotels, Encore is easily the best.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: MafaldaMafalda
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and overall environment. however make sure you will have at least an extra $1000 to get by (not including the gambling of course) for your very basic meals, drinks, and other everyday needs etc...! two of us stayed for a week and that is roughly the amount we spent on dining (in room and in two of the restaurants at Encore), the only option for breakfast is the daily 'pop up' coffee shop that serves coffee and muffins etc...at 3 times the normal price outside the hotel. same applies for anything else you might need during your stay. We also paid $100 for a very average bottle of wine. although the hotel is located at the heart of the Vegas famous strip, still is far from anywhere that one could buy drinks/ food from, leaving you no option but to pay the super high prices within the hotel.... also stay well away from the phone, a short local call was priced at $38.00! Other basic services such as Wi-fi or the use of the fitness center were not included and again were priced way higher than what you would expect t pay. All together a great place and a very good service, however all the points above made me feel ripped off and would make me reluctant to go back.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Julesinbrno
Reviews.Content: My husband and I meet another couple in Vegas every couple of years. In 2009 we wandered through the Wynn/Encore and decided we would definitely stay there on our next trip. In August 2011 we stayed at Encore for a weekend. It wasn't as perfect as I thought it would be, but we will definitely stay there again next time. Positives: Encore/Wynn just seems more grown up some how. I'm certain that it just seem more calm because it really is the end of the north end of the strip, so not as many people visit, as compared to the beautiful but way too crowded Bellagio, where we stayed last time. We loved the rooms at Encore, but seemed to spend our eating and casino time mostly in the Wynn; they are close enough so it wasn't a problem. Negatives: We've stayed at many wonderful (expensive) hotels all over the world, so I had an expectation of what service would be, based on what I'd heard about the Encore. Most of the wait staff was very average, while a few were downright surly. The restaurants were OK. We attempted to go to the buffet at the Wynn one night, but gave up when we had moved about 15 feet in the line in 45 minutes. Maybe that is typical for a buffet, I'm not sure, but that was disappointing and frustrating. We also ate at La Cave, which advertised they were open until 2 or 3 am. We saw a show one night and went to dinner here around 1pm. The staff wasn't terribly pleasant, and seemed like they weren't really prepared for guests this time of night. We ordered a selection of appetizers that was very good. We enjoyed one dish so much we ordered a second dish and it was nothing like the first. My biggest complaint about Encore is the Beach Club. While I realize that the beach club was not designed for our group (all in our 30's and 40's), but the Encore to me seems like a more adult hotel. One afternoon when we walked backed to our hotel, we went in the Encore entrance right off the street. To get to this entrance you have to walk by the entrance of the Beach Club, where twenty somethings were being told they have to put their clothes on before going into the casino, and literally throwing up in the bushes. I've stayed at Planet Hollywood before, and I didn't like it, so it's disappointing that Mr. Wynn would create an atmosphere to lure the kids. I get it, it's all about making money, but it was disappointing. Negatives aside, I will stay at Encore again. I just expected my stay to be the best hotel experience I've ever had, and it wasn't. But it was still very good, and Encore is a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Beach Club Ruins the Former Best Hotel on The Strip!”
Reviews.Author: Mattsaab
Reviews.Content: I was the biggest fan of Steve Wynn's Encore hotel -- until now. Encore is a fantastic hotel, with a stellar collection of restaurants and great staff. But with the addition of their strip-facing Beach Club nightclub, they have almost ruined the hotel for guests. Our room was on the 20th floor in the middle of the hotel, not next to the Beach Club, and when it was time to go to sleep, we realized our room was ruined: we would hear and feel the thumping music of the nightclub in our room. I could even tell you what song was playing! It seems no one thought that the sound might make its way into the guest rooms, or maybe no one cared. It ruined the room. I one thoughtless change, it went from being the best room in Vegas to being unsleepable. (The music went past am!). The club also ruins Switch restaurant, which is victim to the loud thumping and cheap looking led lighting effects. We were not the only people talking about the gross miscalculation -- a honeymoon couple was angry and a taxi driver on the way home volunteered that his pickups from the Encore had all been complaining. As far as a brand goes, the club also brings in kids, young adults and crowds not dining, gambling or staying over. I hope Encore is making enough money from the table service at the Beach Club to cover the exodus from their loyal guests. Palazzo is looking better all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a renovation”
Reviews.Author: territraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband took me here for my 50th birthday and we had a blast! We have stayed at the Wynn/Encore for years. This review will serve as a summary of our experiences. We stopped staying at the Wynn when the Encore opened. The rooms are a lot nicer and have more of a suite feel. It's probably time for them to begin renovation of the rooms. This last time we stayed the carpet was stained, the sofa in the suite is black and you can see every mark. The mirror behind the sofa looked liked someone had blown their nose directly onto the mirror. This is one of the most beautiful hotels on the strip and has some of the most fabulous restaurants. My husband and I have flown to Vegas many times just to eat at WaZuZu, ZUZU Crackers and the pizza place all outstanding. The overall problem I have with the Encore/WYnn is they are very inconsistent. The experience varies each time we go. This last time the front desk was very rude at check in and housekeeping did not do a very good job. We had to change rooms twice. The first time they put us in a handicap room the second time the room was just not clean. Other times we have gone the experience was seamless. We are red card members and we get offers to visit at great prices on a regular basis, so we will continue to visit this property because we love the Las Vegas experience and overall we like Wynn properties.

Reviews.Title: “Extravagant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mags072
Reviews.Content: I love the ambiance of this hotel. The rooms are amazing and spacious and it's a good location for checking out some of the other nice hotels on the strip. I have stayed at MGM and Mirage and this hotel beats them out of the water. It's also great because as guests of Encore we could go to the Encore or Wynn pool. We didn't really venture much outside of this hotel because great restaurants and clubs were all right there. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer.”
Reviews.Author: Nosnom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our anniversary from August 10-12, 2011. We had a wonderful time and would absolutely stay there again. Pro's: The room was spacious, immaculate, well laid out, and beautifully furnished. The grounds were expansive and the pools beautiful. The food was good to very good. The customer service was top notch, from the front desk to housekeeping. We found the valet service to be especially courteous and prompt. The fitness center was tremendous. Con's: It can be expensive, but this is a five star hotel and one should expect it to be expensive. We were offered an exceptional deal, but the costs still add up. Tips: *The temperature in the restaurants and casinos is almost cold. You need clothes for outside and the hot weather, but also a cover up for indoors. *Go see La Reve. It was ASTOUNDING. *XS is the hottest club in Vegas. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms nice, location at end of strip”
Reviews.Author: justme2Georgia
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice at the Encore. When you are working with anyone who works at the Encore they are extremely friendly. Room service food quality was excellent and so was the service. Unfortunately long waits for anything on the phone. When at the pool watch out for the feet of the lifeguard stands, people were tripping over them all day. Note that there is a $20 a day resort fee which covers internet access, use of the gym etc. Quite a walk from the main part of the strip. Convenient if you want to shop at fashion show mall.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and comfort and indulgence collide with great results”
Reviews.Author: DonDiego4
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most of the luxury addresses in Las Vegas and Mr. Wynn knows how to do luxury. Rooms are all suites and all comfort. Ideal bathroom with best layout and features. All little details done well like nightlight, separate bath and shower, built-in TV, dual sinks, nice bath products, scale, and good lighting. Oh yeah, lots of marble. Bedroom and parlor share giant screen TV. Bed is big and comfortable. All lights and curtains controlled from bed. Nice seating and desk. Drawers are self-closing. Closet has safe and all necessaries. Lavishly stocked fridge and munchies (but $8 for chips?). Casino and restaurants have all you could want with easy access to Wynn next door. Decor is over the top and the spa is the most lavish in the hemisphere.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is opulence overload.”
Reviews.Author: mattchuk212
Reviews.Content: This hotel is opulence overload. It is very well done, from amenities to keeping the “Vegas riff raff” out. The on call staff off Rolls Royce is enough said. However, I wasn’t completely happy with the guest staying there. It’s a bit “AARP” and “Boca Raton”. Old, rich and very boring! The casino was always dead. The stores are packed with women stuffing themselves into thing made for the young and beautiful. The food was great but expect to pay the premium. Clubs and bars were great too. Be prepared to get table service or expect to wait in line forever. Granted they even like your “look”. The Encore Beach Party was simply amazing. One of the best parties I ever! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating for a family trip.”
Reviews.Author: chowster
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at Encore and Wynn when we visit Las Vegas, however this was the first time we brought our babies along with us - 19 months and 3 months. Upon making the reservation, we requested a crib for our room. The operator immediately asked if we required a fridgerator for milk as well! Perfect! The crib and fridge arrived. The crib was fully equipped with thin bumper, blanket and gift bag filled with baby necessities. Baby shampoo, lotion, powder and a RUBBER DUCKIE! We had a room on the 38th floor strip view facing the pools. Only problem with this side of the building are the two night clubs. During the day - the bass from the Beach Club is energetic and acceptable, however, at 3am with both clubs.... not so good. WE switched rooms the next day - and had a downtown strip view instead. Much quieter. We're surprised Encore and Wynn don't have automated doors since getting through with luggage can be difficult, especially in such congested areas, but during this trip the doormen were proactive and on the ball in terms of opening doors for our double stroller. WE dined at the Terrace Cafe and the Buffet. Both excellent value and family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: maimonidesflorida
Reviews.Content: Very Nice and spacious Rooms. Very elegant lobby. Very animated casino. All the fun of LV without the inmense crowds. If in Vegas Choose thi hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Staff is Rude and Condescending”
Reviews.Author: M B
Reviews.Content: Although this is a beautiful property, the staff is horrible - everyone from servers, front desk, concierge are very rude and offensive. They act like you are annoying them with every request. And yes, this is a "club" atmosphere - there were prostitutes everywhere in outrageous outfits. The "clientele" also were dressed like hookers in bikinis and high heels. NOT a place to relax. Horrible. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Encore is a Wynner”
Reviews.Author: luxie07c
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Encore because it is smaller then some of the Mega resorts. Talk about clean well it's Steve Wynn. All restaraunts are great some are pricey. Favorite time was hanging around the piano bar with a few friends. Since casino is small you are never but a few steps away. If you enjoy the big busy places not for you. Pools at both the Wynn and Encore are open to Encore guest .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: ice11567
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and very clean hotel. Service was excellent. Buffet was delicious. We definitely will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Our Absolute Fave, But a Very Close Second”
Reviews.Author: KatKnapTrvl
Reviews.Content: We always enjoyed playing at both Encore and Wynn, so when we received a great rate offer, we booked it for my 49+1 Birthday Trip. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like royalty. The valet was so courteous and welcoming, you'd have thought we were driving a Rolls, rather than a rental. Registration was just inside, so no hike through the casino to check in. The line was long, but moved fairly steadily---gave my husband time to check his voicemail, so got that out of the way while we waited. The guy who checked us in was so nice, welcomed us to the Encore, and made small talk about where we were from while he searched for our room. He told us we were upgraded to a Panorama Suite, high floor, and Strip View, and it was ready, so we went on up to the room to call for our bags, which arrived in mere minutes. BTW--they do charge a daily resort fee. The room was fantastic! Amazing view---floor-to-ceiling windows, partial south Strip view, and the Wynn golf course/country club. Remote control window coverings were pretty cool, and you could raise/lower/open/close from the sitting room area or the bedroom. The living room area had a desk, a desk chair and guest chair, a sectional sofa/chaise and big round ottoman in place of a cocktail table. The wall separating the living area and bedroom held a large flat-panel HDTV that could be viewed in the living area, or turned around to be viewed in the bedroom. One wall in the living area (and bedroom) is completely mirrored, making the spaces seem larger. The desk area had plenty of electrical outlets for charging phones, GPS, laptop, etc. Wireless internet connection was complimentary (although that may have been covered by the resort fee, or maybe part of our room offer--not sure, so ask before you assume so you won't get a surprise daily charge for i-net usage.) The bedroom had a King bed, with twin bedside chests on either side. The wall separating the living room and bedroom, besides holding the HDTV, had 4 drawers, like a built-in dresser. There was also a console holding the refreshment center and over-priced snacks/drinks, ice bucket and stemware. The bed was very comfortable, firm but not too firm. I liked the pillows, too, some sort of goose-down alternative I imagine. The hallway into the room had large mirrors, and a closet. The closet had space for hanging clothes, three drawers, a shelf, ironing board/iron, and room safe with digital lock. Staying a week, there are never enough hangers in any hotel rooms for everything I need to hang---I probably pack way too much. The bathroom had a separate glass shower and deep bathtub. The tub was not jetted, unfortunately, but was deep enough to enjoy a nice soak. The lights were on dimmers,. There was a double vanity, with an ottoman to sit on to apply makeup, and a makeup mirror. The toilet was in it's separate closet. Other features, a bathroom scale (on vacation, that's torture.) And two of the most wonderful robes--not the usual terry-cloth most hotels have. Love those robes! Amenities were the usual shampoo/conditioner, mouthwash, bath soap, face soap, shower cap, lotion, and shower gel. The smell was fine--not too sweet or overpowering. There were glasses in the bathroom, in addition to the ones in the refreshment console in the bedroom area. The hotel was very quiet. We never heard another person in either room next to us, or in the hallways. Or even housekeeping in the mornings, so I guess it's pretty well insulated for noise. Or maybe the guests here are more courteous than some of the other hotels where we've stayed. Housekeeping kept the room spotless, plenty of towels, etc. We would definitely stay here again, and would certainly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At Encore”
Reviews.Author: louismfried
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 30-August 3 for my birthday. Met a friend who came down a few days later. Had an excellent room on 55th floor with nice view of the strip.Faced the pool but no noise from the nightclub at night. Check in was smooth and managed to get a room by 11am. Spent a lot of time at European (adult)pool because weather was 103-105deg. Would arrive at pool at 9 and never had a problem getting a lounger in a good spot. Service at the pool was excellent and pleasantly surprised they had my favourite beer-Stella Artois. Ate at the buffet and the SocietyCafe and both were excellent. Went to XS nightclub on sat. and sun. nights and had a great time. The club is beautiful and part of it overlooks the adult pool. XS is part indoors and part outdoors which makes it unique. One little thing that bothered me is that they don't change the sheets on the bed every day. Before you put a card on the bed and they would change them. Now there is no card and you have to telephone housekeeping and request a change of linens. That is absurd! Nevertheless I had a fantastic time at Encore. Staff was very pleasant and professional. Since it was my second time there in three months they gave me a complimentary upgrade to a panoramic suite and sent. A complimentary tray of chocolates to my room. That was an excellent gesture which was appreciated. All in all had a great time and loved every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, perfect Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: cartyco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Encore at Wynn Las Vegas. We stayed in the Encore Tower, Parlor Suite, which was amazing. It had a separate living room and dining area, a powder bathroom for guests, bar, a huge bedroom with sitting area, and a massage room (all areas including the big suite bathroom had flat screen tvs. Beautiful floor to ceiling windows in living and bedroom, over 1,400 square feet! The service was unparalleled. I believe they cleaned our room 3 times a day! Air controlled in bedroom and living area. Steve Wynn spared no expense on the property. Also, with a Tower Suite room in the Encore, you have a different check-in area and concierge than the other guests and there is no line and it is beautiful and easy/fast. We saw the line for check in to the Encore/Wynn that was not in the Tower, yikes! It looked really terrible, so tower well worth it to us. We reserved a lily pad every day at the all adult, European pool which was right in the water, pool side with food and beverage service that was awesome. Do not miss dinner at Bartalotta, amazing. The waiter brings the whole cooked fish to your table and filets it while you watch, freshest most amazing meal ever. We also loved Wing Lei, Asian upscale in the Wynn, perfect. We ate breakfast almost every morning at Cafe Society which was really good and easy and has wonderful blood orange mimosas. The Country Club was also especially good. It was too hot this trip, but if you dine at The Country Club in the fall, sit outside where you can look at the gorgeous waterfall and golf course. Then there is the shopping, wow! Dior, Manolo Blahnik, Channel, etc. I visited the salon and had my hair and makeup done one night, what a treat! They did a great job and I felt beautiful. We have stayed at several other resorts in Vegas and will never stay anywhere else again! Plus we WON! Gotta love Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Sophisticated, Great Dining, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: diamondgirl22
Reviews.Content: The Encore at the Wynn Las Vegas, is a jewel to be discovered. The rooms, which are suites are spacious and have a great view no matter which side you stay on. The Spa is the most beautiful we have ever visited. It has a Morrocan theme which is luxurious as well as relaxing. The massages, facials etc. are wonderful. There is a gym, many restaurants, two pools, nightclubs, and of course the casino area. Because of its proximity to the Wynn you also can use any of those amenities. My husband and I have stayed at both hotels. We find everything we need here, and most times never leave the hotel area! There is a great sports book as well.
