Stay at either property and have the time of your life!

Reviews.Title: “Definately a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juliengu
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas many times before, and often stayed at Planet Hollywood or Venetian, but this trip, my boyfriend wanted to surprise me with a nice stay. It is a very classy hotel. The chinese restaurant is highly reccomended. The pool was great, and service was great. The rooms were beautiful. I highly recommend it. The only downside is it's at the end of the strip, so we never really made it to the Planet Hollywood side where everthing was more central. It was a bit too quiet for us because all the crowds were on the other side. The casinos didnt have a good vibe for us. We like to go where it's busy and not as expensive. Definately encore is for the rich people. We found ourselves at teh Venetian more because of their casino and cheaper food. But if you have money Encore is the way to go. Would defiantely stay again. We stayed on the 26th floor, and were out most of the time so not sure how noise levels were from the club, but I remember the concierge telling us if oyu get a higher room, you'll stay away from loud music from the clubs.... make sure to make reservations in advance for their restaurant with the waterfall...we never got a chance to see it but from the looks of it, it looks very romantic

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: beescivic
Reviews.Content: I liked that they had someone by the elevator checking for room keys so that made me feel secure. The front desk asked if I had any recommendations for my room choice ( view vs quiet) and I chose the quiet side on the 37th floor, second door all the way at the end of the hall. It was worth the extra walk because I didn't hear anyone coming or going which was nice after a long cross country road trip. Hotel decor is beautful. The beds and room were super clean and comfortable. Bathroom was large with 2 sinks, shower stall, and tub which was great. I usually don't prefer to sit in a hotel bath tub in hotels because I'm a clean freak when it comes to that but it was spotless. Great size room. Overall great stay and would return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, great room layout but a couple of disappointments”
Reviews.Author: WasatchGal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Encore for 3 nights after receiving a promotional letter. Our rate included tickets to Le Reve which made our stay a decent value for the money. The room layout is fabulous; we enjoyed being able to sit on the sectional couch and look out over the Strip. Unfortunately we had to lay towels down on the couch first because there were several stains on the couch. It was quite obvious what the couch had been used for prior to our arrival. Note to Encore: If you are going to put a black couch in a Vegas hotel room PLEASE make sure the stains are appropriately removed after each guest has "used" the room. Gross. Between that and random hairs all over the room we were not impressed with the cleanliness. The bed & pillows are extremely comfy. The noise from the night club didn't keep us up at night (we were on the 38th floor facing south). We did happy hour at Society; the food was good and the drinks were wonderful. For 2 drinks and 2 apps with tip it was $45. Food is definitely pricey at Encore, but the atmosphere is wonderful. The pool is very low-key and mellow. The pool boys bringing around water and fruit cups was nice (and free). Overall we enjoyed our stay but would probably not return unless we got another screamin' deal.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel...VERY CHIC”
Reviews.Author: shirinf
Reviews.Content: PROS: This was my first time in Vegas and I went with my boyfriend this weekend for a weekend trip. I had heard positive things about the Encore so we chose to stay here in a panoramic suite king room. Upon arrival to the hotel, I absolutely loved the interior. VERY upscale and well maintained. The customer service was wonderful and very helpful. The room we stayed in, room 5545 had a view of the mountains, which was nice, although it would have been nice to see the strip as well. The hotel was in immaculate condition as far as cleanliness goes. I am quite picky about where I stay when I travel, and I was very pleased. After having jumped around from casino to casino throughout the city, I liked the casinos in the Encore and Wynn the best, by far. The beautiful red hues and butterfly mosaics were beautiful. I HIGHLY recommend you choose this hotel as your destination, especially if on a couples trip. We will return! CONS: Our room was a bit warm throughout the stay. We turned the air as low as it could possibly go, 60 degrees, and we still woke up a few times throughout the night because it was a bit too warm for our liking.

Reviews.Title: “Really Really Red”
Reviews.Author: wheresdaapplebzdaddy
Reviews.Content: We are not high rollers by any means but we still received two comped nights at the Wynn with an upgrade to the King Resort Suite at the Encore and paid for a third night. The normal rates for the Wynn or Encore are out of our Las Vegas traveling budget so we were thrilled with the offer. Would I stay again, free or not, probably not? I suppose the pros and cons will intermingle here. The casino décor is really, really red and somewhat gaudy. It is very different from the Wynn or the Bellagio that Steve Wynn built. The room is nice with plenty of space for personal belongings but not as big as it appears on the website. The beds and pillows were comfortable. Although there are outlets by the bed they are taken by the rooms “gadgets” so I just unplugged the lamps. Speaking of gadgets, the control for the curtains is on the bedside table, is not illuminated, so when I wanted to open the curtains in the morning for a just bit of light I had to stumble around with the control and subsequently woke my husband. The honor bar had a variety of choices that I personally found to be exorbitant e.g. 5$ for a 12 oz can of soda and 8$ for a tin of Reese's Pieces. The wifi is included in the 20$ a night resort fee and there was a printer/fax machine in the suite; the fax has a cost to it but I do not know about the printer itself. The bathroom is spacious and the amenities very nice such as shoe polish, cotton balls, q-tips. The shampoo, shower gel etc. was much larger than the standard hotel and is lemon grass fragranced. The towels were very thick and plentiful and there are robes too. There is a ledge that allows plenty of room for personal items without cluttering the counter top. On the down side the bathroom does not have much room to hang anything including a hand towel and the bathtub is short! My husband, who is 6’1 and can stretch out comfortably in our normal size home tub, had to scrunch his knees up in the Encore room tub. I also found it weird that the water controls are on the back not to the side or front of tub. The line at check in wasn’t long and there was plenty of staff but still took longer than it should have in my experience. The staff we encountered were all very courteous and would actually hold/start a conversation. Housekeeping during our stay was excellent everything was put back in order just as the moment we arrived; although with being in a hotel of this caliber right after we checked in I was shocked to find a hairball behind the bathroom door (which was cleaned up the next day). We did use one of the pools at the Encore and had a good time; it was not the one with the bar or the beach club. This pool was easy to access from the elevators just off the casino floor and was a mix of people. We brought in our own drinks in a non-breakable cup they also had ice water readily available throughout the pool area. There were limited shaded areas. Ok after all this rambling why would I not stay there again. I suppose it is all location and incidental costs for me. I felt very disconnected from the rest of the strip; it is an easy walk to the Venetian but not much else. I like to be more centralized where I have more options for gambling and food choices. Perhaps for many who may stay at this property this is not a huge issue but there was nowhere that I found to “grab a quick (inexpensive) bite” or table games less than a 25$ minimum. I have stayed on the strip in a room just as nice , with a great pool, coffee maker, refrigerator and a nicer view for a lot less money.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise, the only place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: PSUNurse7
Reviews.Content: In the past 3 years, I've stayed at the MGM, Mandalay Bay, Bellagio, Mirage, Palazzo and finally the Encore. Every hotel in Vegas has it's perks, but I will never stay anywhere other than the Wynn properties from now on. As soon as you enter the Encore, you feel like a celebrity. Staff treat everyone with respect and are always smiling (unlike the Bellagio staff who can be condescending). Everything you need for a fabulous Vegas vacation is on the Wynn Property. The Casino is clean, bright and airy. The restaurants are phenomenal- must try the buffet, worth every penny. The clubs/lounges are some of the most popular ones on the strip, we went to Tryst and Blush. We did not get table service, but were still served in a timely fashion with minimal waiting for drinks. Rooms are incredible, a basic King suite in the Encore has all of the conveniences you could imagine and more-- there's even a button next to the bed that puts a "do not disturb" sign on the door. Its the only hotel room I've stayed in that has a doorbell. We got room service one night because the view was so incredible and the room was so nice that we didn't want to leave it. Even the hallways are upscale and nicely finished. Incredible attention to detail. I ran out of memory on my camera taking pictures all over the resort, there was so much beauty! Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “the very best you won't be let down”
Reviews.Author: calalb
Reviews.Content: Encore is a great hotel in the Wynn tradition which just can't be beat. Very different from the Bellagio. We had a suite which was very nice. All the amenities with friendly and caring staff who want your stay to be the most comfortable ever. I usually get comp'd at Harrah's properties and would strongly reconsider this my next stay again. Walked to the golf course for a look and should have golfed. On the way passed through the conference facilities and they looked great. One thing missing which was odd, was no post card included in the desk to send out. Yes there was a fax machine. Don't pick up anything off the bureau (drinks or food for sale) as they are touch sensitive and will be billed to your room way faster than the 60 seconds as noted.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: DaniUSVI
Reviews.Content: I booked a special rate thru TP housing in connection to ASD So many disapointement from a Name i expected a lot. This is the crapiest hight-end Hotel in Las Vegas. Dont bother stayong there and dont b impress by the XS/encore beach... Staying at the hotel wont give u any priority or free access.. 1-i booked a smoking room and received a non smoking 2-ibooked 2 bed and got 1 and right away the answer was we r out of 2 beds... 3_the receptionist gave me a small card saying free internet and local calls ... But when i came to check out thats happened to cost $20 a day 4 during the last 2 days they had construction or smth (i stayed on 30 floor after they move me from yhe 9 floor) and noise day & night 5-room service didnt care much on the last day. Kjnd of i know u will b gone tomorow. Never never again Save ur money and go to another hotel and u wontvregret it Fyi the smallest room at vemetian is almost twice the size of a reg room at encore. Is it really a Steve Wynn resort??? Maybe it should change to original name Desert Inn cause if the service stay the same it will b deserted... Dani Stayed 07/28/11 to 08/15/11 Room 3017

Reviews.Title: “Glitz but no glamour”
Reviews.Author: PGMAT
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore in July / August while attending the ASD trade show. As I was traveling with my wife I booked a room on the 59 floor to take in the great views down the strip and the room didn't disappoint. The rooms cannot be faulted and are appointred to a very high standard. The downside.....as others can attest the loud music from the Beach Club is outrageously loud and could be heard clearly on the 59 floor. Furthermore the Beach Club attracts a young crowd who like a drink (read to excess) and this element can be seen wandering around the hotel shirtless, shoeless and leg less!. I wouldnt stay at Encore again simply because the price paid is not in line with the expectation. There are plenty of other good hotels on the strip that are better value and offer a better night sleep with less noise!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blackieboswell
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Encore in July and had a fabulous time. We were really pleased with our King Resort Suite. It was so relaxing to return to our room after a day of being amongst the fray. We found this hotel and casino to be less crowded and loud than some of its neighbors and for us, this was a positive thing. Although we didn't intend to, we gambled every night at the slots in the Encore and they have a great reward program, so that when you get to 150 points, you get 2 free buffets. This is very generous compared to some of the other reward programs at the other casinos. We also took advantage of both the Encore and Wynn pools and really enjoyed them. THe staff were helpful and friendly and the housekeeping staff were receptive to requests as well. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Resort with load of amenities”
Reviews.Author: CrystalDuncan
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking Resort with loads of amenities. The Asian Bistro restaurant Wazuzu is phenomenal! The 27ft crystal dragon is absolutely gorgeous. The sashimi platter was my favorite! The switch is another restaurant at this property, that everyone should experience. It is French-influenced, and features walls, ceiling and lights that rise, fall and change color every 20 to 30 minutes. The nightclub XS surrounds the pool, and also features a beautiful ten-foot rotating chandelier. You can relax indoor or outdoor in a poolside cabana. Overall I rated this property 5 star, and would recommend to all of my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoldenGopher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Encore Tower suites with a friend for a birthday celebration the last weekend in July, the second time I've stayed at the Encore. Again, the Encore delivered a wonderful experience. I loved the private valet, registration, concierge and elevator, no 30-person waits at the registration queue. The room was impeccably clean, refined, and quiet. While you'd expect the service to be excellent at the better Las Vegas hotels, I really can't say enough about the Encore's commitment to it; the staff do a fantastic job and get a hearty thank you from me. The main pools are very nice, and the clubs are still great, especially Tryst on Thursdays. For a truly mind-bending party experience for the under-30, the new Beach Club is not to be missed on the weekends; you won't see more beautiful people in one place on the Strip. All in all, this hotel very much deserves its five-star rating and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay in the Encore Tower Suites”
Reviews.Author: musicmansimpson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled with friends to Encore, and we had a room at the Encore Tower Suites. Whenever I can, I try to stay in the Tower Suites -- both at Wynn and Encore -- because the experience is wonderful. I know a lot of people say "why would I pay $75 more a night (or whatever it is) just to have a separate check-in?". Here are all of the benfits, as I see it: -- separate check-in. Not only are the staff all over you as soon as your limo pulls up, they give you refreshing water, cold towels, and get you up to your room in very quick order. While in the resort side you pay a premium for high floors, in the Tower Suites there is no supplemental fee. We stayed on the 61st floor, looking south over the strip. -- The Encore Tower Suites are closest to Las Vegas Blvd, which means that the view is not blocked by Wynn. If stayin gin the Resort side, depending on where your room is, your view is heavily obstructed by the Wynn Tower -- No Resort Fee in the Tower Suites (that will save you $20 a night) -- Complimentary Coffee in the morning at the lobby bar -- Complimentary pressing of your garments (2/day) -- free line passes for the buffett -- never have to wait for a cab at the valet -- exceptional service. For example, every time I walked by the front desk, I received a bottle of water. The conceirge got us the best tables at all of the restaurants, etc. -- There are only 5 rooms per floor, which means you have a very short walk to your room once you get off on your floor. -- The elevators are fast, and because there are so few rooms in this part of the hotel, they very rarely ever stop between where you get on and the lobby. -- Access to the Tower Suites poll at Wynn -- a far walk but a nice change of scenery --Upgraded (or at least slightly different) room decor --More amenities (shaving kit, toothbrush kit, etc) The Tower Suites give you all of the excitement and thrill of being in Las Vegas, but the service and luxury of a small, boutique hotel. I'd highly recommend it! My only complaint was that we missed turndown service twice. If you're in the room when they come, they're not always the best at remembering to come back once you've left. But that was the only problem the entire stay. Big deal. Also, I think you get less club noise being in the Tower Suites section of the hotel because it's a little further from XS, although I suppose you get more Surrender Noise. Who knows. The service is amazing. Just do it!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular, except the resort fee”
Reviews.Author: Cueball123
Reviews.Content: If principle is not an issue for you, then just pay the $20 per day/ per room fee and enjoy this gorgeous property. Decorated in lush red with amazing art and design everywhere you look, i cant think of another place i'd rather stay in vegas. I've been to vegas over 50 times but wont look any further than Encore for a long while. Only minor downsides are that you have to walk over to the Wynn (5-8 minutes) to get to the Buffet, Poker room, steakhouses, etc.... Phenomenal place...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, amazing Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kimpet
Reviews.Content: Wow !! what can i say..... The Encore is pure luxury. Beautiful huge Hotel that is at one end of the strip so not quite so noisy as the middle of the strip. The beds are to die for, i have never slept in such comfortable beds in my life. We had a superior room with electric drapes and floor to ceiling windows. Many restaurants to choose from, a great casino, but it is expensive, but you pay for exclusivity. Lovely if a bit small pool area for size of the hotel. Checking in was disorganised, but when you get to your room, you forget all of that.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with a grown up feel”
Reviews.Author: looboo500
Reviews.Content: The encore is my favourite place to stay in las Vegas. The location is perfect for shopping at the malls and also for downtown las Vegas but still able to walk straight through to Wynn and then on to the venetian. The check in is always welcoming and when we have asked fir certain requirement they have been very obliging. Steve Wynn takes great pride in his properties and his OCD for cleanliness is fed through to the staff. This is my 5th stay and will shortly be returning in a few weeks. The king size beds and huge bathrooms make staying in the rooms a delight. The smaller casino in encore is nice for a more chilled out evening but still classy and sassy dress is a must. The drinks service in the casino is second to none... You name it you can have it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Georgous hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is stunning to look at. Check in was very quick. We arrived after 9pm on a Friday and were offered either the 17th floor strip side or the 37 floor on the quiet side. We chose quiet, the view was high enough that you could avoid looking at the partial construction site and look at the mountains or Wynn golf course. At night we had a view of the city lights, Stratosphere, Circus Circus. Our room looked very much like the website pictures, except that I believe our room was an accessable room. There was not a private toilet room, so having this big giant bathroom was pointless for those of us who like a little privacy. The towels were a bit grungy (looked like someone had mopped up mud with them and it didn't all come out in the wash), hair in the tub, dust on the crooked lamps in the bathroom, hearing neighboring room's noise - is not a five star hotel in my opinion. Details like a second box of kleenex outside of the bathroom, a second set of hooks to hang things in the bathroom (as ours were maybe 3 feet from the floor, and our closet had low shelves, so there was no place to hang anything longer than a shirt) were also missed. The bed was pure comfort. Each morning we went to the adult pool and pressed the button as we left for housekeeping. Our room was always ready when we returned. We ate at several of the casual restaurants for breakfast and lunch. For small meals, the pizza place on the Wynn side was great to grab a slice from (lovely to eat outside by the waterfalls) or the lobby bar at Encore. We tried Stratta before LeReve. The meal was fantastic, but too much food. I must have mentioned when I purchased tickets for LeReve that is was for my husband's birthday; because our server at Stratta brought out a georgeous little dessert cake and candle at the end of our meal. We are not gamblers. We visit Vegas for relaxing, shows, restaurants and shopping. We'd spend a little at the quarter slots before heading to our room each night. The drink service was quick. I enjoyed the wine they served in the casino more than the glass I had at Stratta. We enjoyed our stay at Encore, the casino, pool, restaurants and shops are luxury. I was a bit disappointed with our room; perhaps my expectations were too high, but there were details that they missed. On our next trip it will be a hard decision whether to stay at the Encore or return to the Palazzo (loved the bathroom at Palazzo with the seperate vanity table).

Reviews.Title: “Best on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: DublinRugbyFan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a few other hotels in Las Vegas - The Bellagio, The Veneitan, Flamingo - but none are as nice as the Encore. From the moment you sink into the plush carpet, you know it's going to be a luxury trip. Check in lines were pretty short, and the attendant who checked us in was really friendly, talking to both of us, making some suggestions for where to eat and what to do. The room was great - it was just a standard room, but was really spacious, and the space was very well used - it almost felt like a suite. The bathrooms are massive, double sink, huge shower. There's also lots of wardrobe space. We ate in Switch one of the nights, which was a real treat - I would recommend it to anyone staying in the hotel. Great steak, great service, great atmosphere. We also went to the duelling pianos one night. There's a two drink minimum, which I was pretty unhappy with as they took a break five minutes after we sat down, so ended up getting more than two rounds. The pianists also didn't have a great range of songs. They seemed to know a lot of American artists, but not too many European ones. They also seemed really annoyed by people requesting Piano Man. We hung out at the pool for a day - if you get the opportunity to do this, you should do it! It's really relaxing, there are two pools and a pool bar. It's a really great place to just lie back and relax. We didn't gamble at all in Encore, and it didn't seem to matter. The casino is less intrusive than it is in several other hotels. The volume on the gaming machines is turned way down so it's not as annoying. it feels more like a spa hotel (which it is) than a traditional Vegas gambling spot. The Encore is in a good location on the strip, with a shopping mall across the road, and the golf course out the back. It's a bit far from some of the other hotels, if you're travelling with others staying in different locations. It seems to appeal to a wide range of people, from business men attending conferences to the young and the beautiful who are just there for the night life. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place !!”
Reviews.Author: travelreviewer09
Reviews.Content: The Wynn and Encore are my favorite places to stay when in Vegas. The Casinos are kept very clean and comfortable. The room we were in at the Encore needed a deep clean, especially the bathroom . The toilet smelled terrible and dust bunnies in the corners. The air never cooled below 73. I will still stay at the Wynn or Encore again as it was probably just our room. If management is reading this, please have your maids do a better job cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: ALISTER54
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many of the strip hotels I think the Wynn and the Encore are up with the very best. On this trip we booked a suite through www.lowcostusa.co.uk as we just could not believe how cheap it was. On arrival we were given $100 voucher towards any food and drink in the hotel ( we were not expecting this). We had 2 rooms suites both on the 57th floor. Great views of the strip and the Wynn golf course in one and a view of downtown Vegas in the other. Whilst I preferred the strip view there was noise from the daily pool party in the afternoon, but the downtown view suite was quite. Your choice strip view with slight afternoon noise or a quieter suite with downtown views. Both suites were superb.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay and we would stay again”
Reviews.Author: mrc1965
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful and we had a great view of part of the strip. The beds were very comfortable and lux. It a nice property to be away from the main part of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!!”
Reviews.Author: sibby777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights following a three-night stay in NYC. What an amazing hotel! It really is out of this world. From the moment you walk in the doors the staff cannot do enough for you. We were here for our first wedding anniversary and the lovely girl on reception sent us complimentary champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries to our room - what a nice touch. All the rooms are suites with amazing panoramic views, we were lucky to have one of the Strip. We didn't eat in the Encore but tried the lunch buffet at the Wynn which was superb. While this hotel is pricey compared to others on the Strip I would highly recommend it and hope to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “If you want an amazing holiday - Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne-Cantle
Reviews.Content: On our fourth trip to Vegas we thought we would try Encore. We had previously stayed at the Wynn Resort and loved it. Staying at Encore gives you the best of both worlds. As Encore is smaller - Encore guests are allowed to use Wynn facilites but Wynn guests are not able to use the pool at Encore. Encore has a lovely butterfly theme. As it is further up the strip the hotel it is also much quieter and therefore a more relaxing experience. We stayed in a deluxe room on a higher floor - we paid a little extra for this room and were not disappointed. The rooms are similar to that of the Wynn (see my review of the Wynn), roomy modern and with a good deal of storage. My husband organised a few treats for me and the service he received was exceptional. The only little complaint I would have is the pool area at Encore is quite small and really quiet. There were lily pads and loungers in the pool which were reserved all day everyday. We were there for two weeks and didnt see one guest on these. Whilst I appreciate these would be reserved for VIP guests I think the hotel needs to be more flexible. I was told off when I sat on a chair in the pool (which in actual fact wasnt reserved). If you want a little more atmosphere I would recommend using the pool facilities at the Wynn. I would recommend any of the restaurant in Encore and there are some great choices for lunch, but if you want a special treat eat at SW in Wynn - probably one of the nicest dining experiences that I have ever had. We will return to Vegas every year and probably wouldnt consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Panoramic Views of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JaguarVideo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore Hotel in Las Vegas in January. It snowed on one night. the rooms are beautiful and spacious. Our suite had a living room and bedroom separated by a divider with a 42" LCD TV which swiveled to be viewed from either room. The hotel itself is very nice and very clean. Join the slot club and earn free rooms, like everywhere in Vegas. The suites drapes can be controlled remotely from the bed.

Reviews.Title: “You're a winner every time at either the Encore or the Wynn”
Reviews.Author: minimi46
Reviews.Content: Last May my wife and I decided treat ourselves to yet another Las Vegas holiday. We've been visiting "Vegas" nearly every year since the early 80's and stayed at most of the hotels along "The Strip", you name it and we've been there, done that..yet the allure of the millions of lights, grandeur of the super sized structures attract us as moths to a flame. Adding the draw are the Vegas shows the scale and spectacle of which only possible in this incomparable oasis in the Nevada dessert. The icing on the cake are the magnificent rooms of the Encore and for that matter her sister the Wynn. First impression on entering our room is... Wow!! Sooo much space and it’s not just the size of the rooms but also the first class interiors, amenities, furniture, bed, pillows, carpet, enormous bathrooms...every detail reflective of Steve Wynn's quest to make his second flagship property like no other and setting yet again the bar of how to build a super resort hotel so high that it would require anyone to wear oxygen masks to reach such a high plateau of excellence and pockets deeper that the Marianas Trench. It's mind boggling that anyone could afford the privilege of staying at this masterpiece yet, the Encore IS affordable. The Encore like the Wynn is in my view in the best location of all the hotels along the Strip and just across the street from the Fashion Mall where good variety abounds. Two of Steve's earlier achievements...Treasure Island and Mirage are likewise only a few steps away as is the Palazzo which is connected by an elevated walk way bridge near the countlesslly photographed Wynn waterfall. Don't wait! Book now! Expedia or Vegas.com can quote you excellent rates or you can book direct on the Encore Hotel website. Enjoy! We sure did!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Encore!!!”
Reviews.Author: pecagal13
Reviews.Content: My niece and I stayed at the Encore from July 25-29th. Check in lines were long, but we checked in near checkout time so that is probably why the lines were long. I requested a room away from the club, as I have read on here it is noisy from the clubs on lower floors. I had booked 2 queen beds and all those rooms are facing the club. So I opted for a panoramic view with a king bed and they gave me a roll away bed that was sooooooooooo comfortable!!! We were on the 59th floor facing the mountains and the golf course. Was very quiet and I had no problem with noise the whole time we were there. The room was very nice, the air worked well, the water pressure in the shower was good. I was very happy with our room. We did have a $100 credit and used it at the pizza place in the Wynn, ate breakfast in Society Cafe. The frosted flake caramelized banana french toast was sooo good!!!! Also had 2 drinks at the adult pool and it tasted like there was not a drop of alcohol in it. My one issue I had was the waitress at the pool. I think she was profiling people, there was a couple next to us on the right and a couple next to us on the left. She asked the couple to the right if they would like something and I was sitting right there looking at her and she went right to the couple to the left. The lady to the left said oh they wanted a drink and the waitress was like oh..... Sorry we are an aunt and niece on vacation. Or if we looked like we had no money or something. I dont know what it was, but it was very rude!!!! Anyway I gave her a good tip and then she was being nice and coming around. Dont judge a book by its cover, you never know who has money and who does not. The most beautiful person in the world can not have a dime in there pocket and be treated better than someone who has money and is a regular 40 something year old mom. That was my only complaint about our whole stay at the Encore. I would stay at Encore again. It was a nice quiet hotel at the end of the strip which was what I wanted and is exactly what I got.

Reviews.Title: “oasis in the dessert”
Reviews.Author: balz
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property with terrific suites. and great views. Be aware of extra charges on price quotes oas there are extra resort fees, from room to charges made in bars and restaurants. It adds up.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Bed ever”
Reviews.Author: samrossuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers everything but the reason it's getting a review is that the bed was the most comfortable I've ever stayed in. Despite the allure of the casinos, the two pools (offering either a family-style and more hip-style atmosphere), the fantastic restaurants and the incredible nightclubs (XS and Surrender), the bed was the best part of the stay! Stay here and you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful 5 star suite”
Reviews.Author: mnjjjmom
Reviews.Content: we stayed from sunday to wednesday.. check in was very efficient and pleasant..apparently we qualified for $100 resort credit which we used for a breakfast buffet one day and a lunch buffet the next day.. (both were excellent!!)..the first day we went to the encore pool (the adult area) and found it to be rather crowded and noisy with lots of loud music not really my taste, and a younger crowd having a great time..that was good for them, but i was really looking for something a little more sedate and relaxing...the next day we found that at the wynn adult pool.. lots of open chairs and much less of a party atmosphere with better (in my opinion ) music..it was a good walk but well worth it..nearby is the fashion mall that has a fairly good selection of fast food for when you dont feel like spending a fortune to eat. the room was really nice and we had a great view at night.. the daytime view was marred a bit by the fact that it squarely overlooked the unfinished casino that was 1/4 built..the shampoos and soaps were really nice and the robes for us was a nice touch too..we brought our own coffee pot as that is not in the room and i didnt feel like going downstairs for a $5 cup of coffee first thing in the morning..really it would be so nice to add a coffee pot in the rooms.. or at least have an option.. i did enjoy the no smoking policy.. all in all a good experience with good service..

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: slkjay
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and luxurious rooms. A step above the pre-reno'ed Wynn rooms. Pool area is very nice. No buffet, you have to walk to the very crowded Wynn buffet. We have stayed here twice and never eaten in any Encore restaurant. Self-parking is very convenient at both Wynn and Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Awesomeness!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mandinkadell
Reviews.Content: Encore is our Vegas hotel of choice!!! We started staying here in December 2009 and have not stayed anywhere since...well until we cheated on the Encore in June 2011 by staying at newly opened The Cosmopolitan. While The Cosmopolitan is a great hotel, they have NOTHING on the Encore (except for the better location)!!! I was reminded of why I LOVE the Encore. EVERY staff member is awesome and friendly. I have never had to complain about anything at the Encore. The Encore room is PERFECT!!! Plus, The Cosmo does not have a "smell" like the Encore. Now back to the Encore: First of all...the smell...delicious!!! I love the smell so much that I bought their smell at their home store (Asian Rain). Simply scrumptious!!! Now for the rest....the place is beautiful and the rooms are HUGE, always clean, and very comfortable...love the tv in the bathroom!!! The staff is very helpful and nice. We have been to Vegas and stayed at the Encore before and NEVER left the Encore!!! There is that much to do there!!! There are all sorts of restaurants between the Encore and Wynn....all sorts of bars...gambling...2 of the best clubs in Vegas...shopping.... spa, etc!!! We have converted many of our friends who frequent Vegas to the Encore...they, too, are now fans!!! I am so sorry Encore, my love!!! I will NEVER stray again!!! Please forgive me!!! We will ONLY stay at the Encore going forward!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_B_travels
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our anniversary at Encore. Check-in was painless since we went during the week. We stayed in a suite and it was beautiful and luxorious. I love the big screen TV that can swivel to face the living room and the bedroom. Our room faced the back instead of the Wynn Tower so there was a nice view of the city through the ceiling to floor windows. The bed was comfortable and I enjoyed getting ready in the nice big bathroom. The pools were nice. We enjoyed the show "Le Reve". My absolute favorite of the trip was the buffet at Wynn. It was exceptional! The hotel is right across the mall. It is a little far away from the other hotels. We walked all the way to Aria and it took us about an hour each way. I would definitely stay there again! I am actually missing it now as I'm writing the review.

Reviews.Title: “Pool Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: marcii
Reviews.Content: We chose Encore for our Las Vegas 32nd Anniversary adventure and it did not disappoint. On top of the luxurious setting, fabulous room and amenities, and five-star service - the pool was quite the happening place! The adult-only pool and surroundings made it even more fun for us fifty-year olds - even though surrounded by mostly younger, but some older folks too. It was like a scene from a movie - sun shining brightly, beautiful (and normal) people, frosty drinks at the island swim up bar, blackjack on the shaded bar tables, cute and friendly waitresses, fabulous poolside food, even vodka snow cones! The music was bumpin' and it was easy to get lost in the fantasy of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent, beautiful, amazing on every level.”
Reviews.Author: SoCalSiren
Reviews.Content: I love Las Vegas, and is a fun destination so we try to get there 3-4 times a year. I only stay at Steve Wynn's Encore/ Wynn compound unless I am going to a show off-property because everything I need is at Encore. Even the standard suites are well-appointed, and beautiful. The past two trips, we upgraded to the penthouse suite (Salon Suite) and it is astonishingly beautiful~ so large, the suite should have its own ZIP code:) The Tower Suites at Encore offer a very private, secure VIP only entrance, and valet, with private pool area. Well worth the extra money~ no long lines at check in, or valet.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Encoretels”
Reviews.Author: TomHall
Reviews.Content: The Encore met all of my expectations of a 5 star resort. I will judge all other Vegas hotels by how they compare to the Encore. The rooms were large,feature an amazing view and made me feel like I was a Hollywood insider. Since I'm a teacher in the Bronx this is difficult to do. Although the entire resort is breathtaking, the spa and sandlewood massage were my favorite parts of my experience. By far the best massage I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed staying @ Encore, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: eph2004
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very enjoyable, we loved that we could go swiming at the different pools and yes kid friendly too...We were there for the UNLV graduation my son's girlfriend graduating; so we had easy access to and from any where. Highly recommend you sign up for their rewards program; got to do nice fun activities & even gamble some. I always enjoying going to vegas and finding a great place to rest is important to me. Encore offered all the neat details I look for in a hotel or resort.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: Jo D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore in November 2010 whilst on our honeymoon, my wife and I had both been to Vegas previously, so we decided we'd stay at what is revered to be one of the best hotels in Vegas. I have to say the Encore does feel like a top class hotel, and is lavishly appointed. We were disappointed as we found our room to be quite small, but the clever use of mirrors does give you a spacious feeling. Having been to Vegas previously and stayed at the Bellagio and Venetian both my wife and I felt the Encore was no better than either of those properties. In fact we both felt the rooms at the Bellagio and Venetian were far larger and felt significantly more spacious. As we were on our honeymoon we assumed we’d be treated a little more special, than the “run of the mill” patron, but we were wrong to make that assumption, whilst our booking highlighted that we were on honeymoon, at no point were we made to feel special. The food in the hotel is excellent, plenty of good quality restaurants, but we want to make particular note to the 4am room service breakfast, OK, it was $100+, but it was exceptional! The food in Lakeside if truly fantastic and I personally had the best steak I’ve ever had, well done!!! We were disappointed to find the staff weren’t too friendly either, we didn’t expect a hotel which purports to operate at such high levels of service to feel this unwelcoming. In short, this is not a hotel we will be visiting again, whilst you are surrounded with amazing shops such as Ferrari, Rolex and Manolo Blahnik, none of this makes up for pretty poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: mkstj1
Reviews.Content: We traveled with another couple. Have been to Vegas many times and have stayed at various hotels from mid level to high end and Id have to say that the Encore was fantastic albeit a bit pricey. Check in and check out were without a hitch. We had a $100 credit thru the package we booked and they pleasantly explained how that worked. The casino area is a bit smaller than ive experienced in a larger hotel in vegas but i like the way they have things set up. Never seemed overly crowded. Seems to be the quieter side of the Wynn/Encore complex. Service is outstanding. The thing that struck me about the place was how absolutely spotless the place was, the floors, public bathrooms, casino areas etc. I was really impressed with that and the overall attention to detail throughout the property. Just a very comfortable and pleasing place to stay. Its is pricey however, esp the food. And the lesser priced options are somewhat limited. If im anywhere on vacation for a week i really dont want to have a sit down fancy type meal for every meal of the day. Even the places they tout as casual are really not that casual. For comparisons sake since its right next door and weve stayed there in the past, at the Venetian/Pallazo if you want to grab a quick relatively inexpensive bite to eat, you have several options. You really dont here. But i will say this, every place we did try at the Wynn/Encore was really good. Pizza place, La Cave, Society Cafe, Lakeside Grill, Country Club. We satisfied with them all. Really liked La Cave. Great place for wine and a bite to eat. Bartenders were fantastic. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. Probably the nicest hotel room ive experienced. Dealers were very friendly and professional. Not a big gambler so its not a big deal to me but when i was at a table the dealers were all great. Limits were more reasonable that i had expected so that was a nice surprise. They were quick to drop limits if things were going a bit slow. The shops are basically all high high end. My wife is a big shopper but it is a waste of time to look in some of those stores because its just out of our league. The fashion show mall is right across the street and more our speed. The fitness ctr and spa were very nice. The wives loved the spa. The are spa pros and said this was one of the best. I hit the fitness ctr every morning and really enjoyed it. Staff was great. The size of the fitness ctr is fine. Treadmills seemed to get full quickly but crowd was never a problem. We didnt hit the pools. It was still a bit on the cool side when we were there so i cant comment on that. Overall great stay. If travelling to Vegas again in the future it would be hard not to pick the Encore again.

Reviews.Title: “Always the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: GISGoddess
Reviews.Content: The Encore was fabulous. The service here is outstanding. The regular size suite is large and has a separate sitting area with floor to ceiling windows. The bathroom is huge - double sinks, soaking tub, stand up seperate shower, and a flat screen televison. Society is a very good place to eat without having to choose from overpriced items with no taste. The quality of the food and service is excellent. Mr Wynn has another winner with the Encore Las Vegas! Blush is a fabulous night spot for those who like to dance and/or sit in a relaxing setting. Blush also has an outdoor sitting area.

Reviews.Title: “Pure self indulgence, the best in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: lj1111gush
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel, by far the best on the strip! From start to finish the Encore hotel exceeded our expectations. A stunning panoramic suite overlooking the Vegas strip provided 10 nights of luxury for us. The highlights: pool, Chinese restaurant, casino & our favourite, society cafe. The best place for breakfast between the Wynn & Encore hotels, the cafe staff were so polite & welcoming every morning! If you enjoy a relaxing start to your day without moving a muscle except to rave about the interior design like I did, then this is the place to dine! The menu offered full cooked breakfast choices but even more healthier options which we loved, bagels, fruit, cereal etc! Not cheap but worth every dollar! There is too much to tell about the Wynn & encore hotels, all good! The only bad points were the lack of sun loungers & noisy Beach Club nightclub which the whole hotel can hear! Anyway, minor issues & I would go back tomorrow!!

Reviews.Title: “Live the Life”
Reviews.Author: jsmm
Reviews.Content: You haven't done Vegas until you stay at The Encore or the Wynn. I went for a bachelor party with my friends for a weekend and had an awesome time. We've stayed at other resorts before on prevous trips, but this was all about the experience. You don't need to worry about finding the hot spot, because its at either the Wynn or Encore every night. We stayed at The Encore, but it is connected to the Wynn, and from what I could tell the amenities are the same. It is 5 star service all the way. You feel like a celebrity or royalty when you are there. And you will probably see a few while you are there. I highly recommend spending some extra bucks if you are attending the night clubs or pool party and get table service, or a cabana. It is much more enjoyable this way... and hey your in Vegas. For dining, there are many options and all of the restarants are fabulous. My favorite place, and if you are in the mood for a steak, get a reservation at Botero. Get a few side's to share around the table, as these are not your normal side dishes. Get the Mac n Cheese, and trust me this is no box stuff. The staff at the hotel was beyond expectations. The rooms are large, and immaculate. Beds are very comfortable, and when you go home, you are going to want to redo your bathroom to mimic your stay at Encore. I've never spent so much time in the bathroom. If you are doing some gambling don't be shy with your players card. You can talk to the concierge and get some extras with all of your play. This is the best hotel in Vegas, no question. My only regret is I didn't get a spa appointment. I guess I'll have something new to try next time!

Reviews.Title: “Just Book it! You won't regret it.”
Reviews.Author: jojoearth
Reviews.Content: All I can say id just book it. This is by far one of the best hotels in America. Everything is upscale. The bathroom is BEAUTIFUL and the room was superb. Bring your bubble bath because the tub is spotless and welcoming. I took away one star because there were a few stains on the counter below the mirror in the bathroom. We stayed at Encore from Monday to Friday in room 5441 with a view of the mountains. Opened the drapes every morning with the push of a button from the bed. Called the front desk or housekeeping and they refer to you by name. I called for more shampoo, they were there in less than five minutes. The concierge desk- patient, nice, and most helpful. I also enjoyed the Euro pool- topless of course. I have never gone topless in a public pool but I was in Vegas and they designed the pool for people to go topless. Don't worry, if you are not as bold they also have a family pool. One thing, get ready to pay for the luxury. A small bottle of vodka in the fridge in the room is $29. My husband went to the liquor store (3 minute walk) and got the same thing $12. The restaurants are also pricey but we were on vacation so we ate at each at least once. The yogurt with granola and fresh berries was my favorite ($11) at Society and the steak and eggs were good. My husband enjoyed the frittata and the frosted flake french toast I can honestly say that I enjoyed my stay at Encore and look forward to going back

Reviews.Title: “The service was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Danspeanut
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at Encore for 3 nights over a weekend. The service was fantastic. The concierge desk saved us twice--once when we lost cell charger and once when we needed to send a fax after hours. When we called down for service everyone greeted us by name and were incredibly helpful. Dinner at Botero was delicious, Garth Brooks was absolutely unreal. Pool was lovely and the room itself was beautiful--not as large as Palazzo or Venitian but I thought more tastefully decorated and everything was controlled from panel on the bed. We liked that. If I had one complaint it would be the club vibe on the weekend. Seemed everyone was 25 from LA in a tight tight skirt. I was so not beautiful enough to sit by the "european pool" or hit the clubs (being a 40 year old mom). That said, we requested mountain view so as to not be bothered by noise from clubs and we didn't have a problem. I did think the table limits were too high like some of the other posters said. We will definitely stay at Encore again.

Reviews.Title: “I WANT TO GO BACK NOW!! I LOVE THIS PLACE!!”
Reviews.Author: Heather5586
Reviews.Content: I went out to Vegas July 13th-16th and got married in the Valley of Fire. I decided to stay at the Encore after reading hundreds of reviews and checking out all the different hotels. I don’t even know where to start with the Encore – this place is truly 5 star ultra luxury. I get goose bumps just thinking about this place! Check in – Check in was a breeze. I didn’t have to wait longer than 2 minutes. They guy helping us was super friendly. I mentioned I was getting married the following day and the Encore surprised us with chocolate candies and a nice card in our room the next day (super nice touch). I was also told during check in that I had a $100 resort credit. I was a little hesitant because when I booked the trip through Orbitz I thought I could either get 20% off my stay or the $100 resort credit – I didn’t know I got both (another big plus)!!! The resort does charge $20 per day as a daily fee. I knew before arriving that I would be paying this fee and it didn’t bother me at all, especially after seeing this resort- it is so beautiful. Our Room/View– I think I paid about $30 more per night through Orbitz for a “panoramic” room – let me tell you – it was worth $100!! We were placed on the 56th floor and the view was amazing!! I was a little bummed that our room wasn’t facing the busy strip side but then when night came around and I saw Vegas all lit up and the mountains in the background- it was just breathtaking. I read reviews about people complaining about club noise at night but I didn’t hear a thing being up so high (another reason I recommend the panoramic room). Our Room – The room itself was gorgeous and beautifully decorated. The Encore didn’t skip an inch when decorating this entire resort and I’m not exaggerating! The room had a bedroom area along with a sitting area and desk. The room does have food and drinks for sale but if you pick up the item longer than 60 seconds than you’re charged- so don’t let kids play with anything in the refrigerator.. lol The Bed – The bed and sheets were so comfortable. I thought for sure my back or neck work hurt after traveling but this bed was pure luxury. I think my husband looked up all the prices for the mattress, sheets, etc. because the Encore claimed you could buy it all and the prices were outrageous. I wasn’t surprised by the prices after sleeping in the bed. There is also a switchboard next to the bed that controls the lights and the drapes that cover the windows (another 5 star luxury perk). Once the sunset then I would press a button and the drapes would open and the view was spectacular. The Bathroom – Again, pure luxury. There were 2 sinks, a nice tub and a very nice all glass shower (and lets not forget the private toilet area). I was spoiled after leaving this place. I want a new shower now back at home!! There is marble everywhere…. Casino – Let me just say that this was my first trip to Vegas and my whole point was to get married. I didn’t use the Casino so I can’t really comment. All I can say is the Casino is beautifully decorated. I walked through a couple of other hotel casinos (Venetian, Luxor and Caesars Palace) and the other hotel casinos were dark and looked out-gated. The Encore on the other hand was vibrant and new. Food – The Encore does claim its 5 star and I totally agree so you’re not going to find a McDonalds or Burger King inside this place. There are a ton of places to eat at the Wynn (right next door) but the Encore offers places to eat as well. I ate at Wazuzu (sushi) 2 or 3 times and it was delicious. It was a little pricey but not out of this world. I think I spent about $70 bucks each time but I got a lot of sushi. I also used my $100 resort credit to eat – that was a nice perk. Location – The Encore and Wynn are located right past the heart of the strip. I consider Caesars Palace and Bellagio to be right dab in the center of the Vegas Strip. Where as the MGM and Mandalay Bay are near the entrance of the strip (by the Las Vegas welcome sign). The Encore is on the other end. I loved the location because I didn’t want to be where all the chaos was. Don’t get me wrong- there are people everywhere but the Encore wasn’t as busy as some of the other hotels that are in the center of the strip. Valet Parking – It was free if you were staying at the Encore – I loved the service – it was great and fast! (We did rent a car but only used it a few times.) Overall – I LOVE THIS PLACE AND CAN’T WAIT TO GO BACK!! I thought before arriving that next time to Vegas I would try a different resort but after staying at the Encore – I wont stay anywhere else. I love the location, service, the rooms, the bed and Wazuzu!!!! Some people may complain that this place is expensive but after walking through other hotels- nothing else compares and I can’t complain about a $20 resort fee because the Encore is truly a 5 star resort. Every wall, floor tile, elevator, room, restaurant, bathroom, etc is decorated perfectly. I don’t even want to know how much this place cost to build…. If you’re thinking about going to Vegas then give the Encore or the Wynn and try and book the panoramic room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Honeymoon in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingB0B
Reviews.Content: As a businessman, I've stayed at many excellent hotels, including many on The Strip, but the room at the Wynn Encore surpassed any room that I've ever experienced. It was pure luxury. Curtains, lights, etc. are all controlled from your bed, which is really nice when you're on your honeymoon! The hotel is relatively new and very clean, and every hotel employee made us feel that they had only one purpose in life - to make our stay at the Encore perfect. There is a walkway from the Wynn Encore to the Wynn, and this quickly became familiar territory during our stay. In fact, since the Wynn Encore is at the north end of the strip, you need to do a LOT of walking or take quite a few taxis to get anywhere. The line for a taxi can get a little long at times, so figure that into your plans if you're on a time schedule. There is a lot more I could write about our stay at the Encore, but it really has to be experienced to be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, can't beat it !”
Reviews.Author: simigag
Reviews.Content: Wow again. This hotel beats everything you have ever seen in Vegas. Bellagio, ok, great. Been there last year but the Wynn and the Encore are even a Level better. Make sure to take Dinner in the Encore and watch. Every 20minutes, everything changes. Great Show !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, though a bit sedate for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyerFred
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell: Steer clear of the gambling but enjoy the hotel and its facilities for all the luxury! A three night stay at the Encore in July was a terrific, relaxing visit at a reasonable summer price. We stayed in a king suite and it was absolutely a suite by any definition. Very large living area, full size desk, plenty of room in the bedroom area. The bathroom was also quite large, with a separate tub and shower, dual sinks and an enclosed water closet (toilet). Overall it felt luxurious with only two major flaws: 1) The music noise from the outdoor nightclub drones on well past 2 or 3am and it could easily be heard in our 29th floor room. If you want to avoid the noise, request "mountain views". The "strip view" rooms face the club, and thus get the noise. 2) the bathroom ventilation picks up cigarette smoke from somewhere else on the property. It was not constant, but frequently the bathroom had a very strong cigarette smell. It was contained to the bathroom, but quite unpleasant in an otherwise generally low-smoke hotel (for Las Vegas). I would stay here again for the luxury. The nightlife is fairly low-key, with two less popular clubs and a sleepy casino. The table minimum bets are kept high despite the low casino traffic. $25 was the lowest minimum for blackjack on a slow Sunday night! And there were tables of dealers twiddling their thumbs for lack of players! Those high minimum bets keep the "lower class" gamblers away, but at the same time makes it unappealing for all but the big bettors. The energy in the casino was non-existent.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! A great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Ugataylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed all week at the Encore and had the best time. My wife and I have stayed in over 10 different hotels in Vegas over the last 10 years or so and the Encore was by far the best. It's pricey but if you want top notch service and a less crowded environment then this is the best on the strip. We both hit the spa which was exceptional...and the restaurants are all excellent. SW Steak was our best meal...just a fabulous restaurant...the best service you can get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 2nd stay. we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: mk_oc
Reviews.Content: We go to Las Vegas often for weekend getaways. We have stayed at Bellagio, Venetian, Monte Carlo, Mandalay Bay, Palm Place and several others. Encore is one of our favorites. Beautiful colors, very clean, good service and a better crowd. Our only issue with Encore is that they don't have a separate line for check outs. So if you pick a busy weekend, you end up waiting in the same check-in/check-out line for hours to be able to check out. Seems like a serious oversight for a hotel of such caliber. Otherwise, we love everything else about it. Great restaurants too.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive total resort experience”
Reviews.Author: FlemBrimstone
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Vegas at 8 am and fully expected the usual Vegas thing with early flights where you are told your room will be ready at noon then it never is, but by about 2 or 3 you finally get your room. The Encore TOTALLY surprised me as (no line at check IN, everybody was checking out) the desk clerk said “I think we have something for you right away”. Having prepared my agenda for the wait and already stashed my bag with the bellman, I advised the clerk it was more important that I get a nice room with a really good view than to get in quickly. “No need to wait sir, we can accommodate you on that right away.” Wow! The Encore allowed me to pay my deposit by cash ($150 per night). I never charge to my rooms anyway so minus the (arg!) resort fee it was just money in the bank for my pocket on the way home and no annoying credit card hassles. The bell boy had my bag up promptly and took the time to show me the room. After he got the $20 tip he would have gone for ice, tuned the TV to my favorite channel, re-arranged the pillows and drawn me a bath! I think there must be a lot of people being cheap on tips, as everywhere here from the front door to the waitress, once they knew I was good for a tip to reward their effort I never had to open a door for myself or wait too long for a drink ever again. Bed, Wow! Room quality superior. The wi-fi and honor-bar may not have been available to cash deposit clients maybe but the honor bar is always a gyp anyway and if you are hunched over technology needing internet in THIS resort? You are not taking advantage of the Encore Experience. Just let go and let Encore/Wynn drive! Being disconnected grows on you here. The tub, the pools, the spa beat the F outa facebook and within an hour I was glad the wi-fi didn’t work! The push-button controls for the lights and curtains are the technology you need. Nice, and unlike the Vdara the Encore puts this on your nightstand so you don’t have get up to light (or black out!) your room perfectly. Some popular things had a long line/wait like the very best clubs and restaurants. No drawers in the bathroom a big ledge instead, use that! (My sundries look good on display I found out & always at hand.) Again, letting go and letting this superior design/concept/resort GIVE its experience TO ME always worked here once I learned I could trust not to be disappointed in the end. Men’s Spas very good, Wynn & Encore both. Would have liked to buy all my days of spa access at once, be prepared to pause every day at the spa check in desk. The noise from the pool club will bother the light sleeper, I was on floor 61 and could hear it but I did not find it an issue. One of the best Starbucks in the country is across the street at the Fashion Show Mall (best shopping in Vegas). The daily trek across the street was actually nice & got me movin’ and gave me a feel for the casino for the day. Would I stay again? Yeah, sure.

Reviews.Title: “It's Great”
Reviews.Author: WilliamTheSilent
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Encore twice in the past year -- both were for business purposes. I'm not sure if I would stay here if I had to pay out of my own pocket as it is very expensive. The rooms are beautiful and the bed comfortable. Just like everything else in Vegas, expect to get nickled and dimed for 'hidden' fees.

Reviews.Title: “First time at the Encore -- will likely be back.”
Reviews.Author: d&mlovevegas
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at Encore after several years of repeated trips to Bellagio, and, except for some very minor items, we were delighted with the choice. Stayed Monday through Thursday in an Encore Resort Suite on the 22nd floor. We faced the north end of the strip with a partial view of the golf course. Except for the desolation of the defunct Echelon Place, the view was quite lovely, especially at night. We liked the layout of the room. The sitting area was comfortable and had plenty of space for a the room service cart which opened into a small table for in-room dining. The bed was comfortable the room was very quiet. For dinner, we took advantage of the fact that several of the Wynn/Encore restaurants offered "Taste of Wynn" menu options where, for a set price, you could enjoy a three course meal. We did this at Lakeside for $59/pp, and at Bartolotta for $69/pp. Both meals were delicious although each had a few misses. The surprise of our dining experience at Wynn/Encore was La Cave. We really enjoy dining the small plate style of dining, and since one tends to overeat while on vacation anyway, it was the perfect spot for us. Our meal consisted of diver sea scallops, a lovely gorgonzola salad, a beet salad, diver sea scallops, and a ham, egg and cheese flatbread. Add a bottle of wine, dessert, tax and tip, we left feeling that we got a great meal for $155. Perhaps the best part of our stay was the Encore adult only pool. A nice pool is a major factor in where we decide to stay. The Encore adult only pool, was just perfect. There were plenty of chairs to choose from, and the atmosphere seemed surprisingly laid-back. Background music was served up from a diverse playlist and the volume was appropriate. Poolside drink service was attentive, and there is a nice bar that provides an opportunity to get out of the sun to enjoy a drink or a sandwich. I would have liked the water to be a bit cooler as it was well in the 100s while we were there. The regular pool at the Encore had chairs jammed together, although it was never really that crowded either. The most disappointing aspect of Wynn/Encore is their policy of not comping drinks at the video poker bars. We knew this going in, so we had already adjusted our mindset to this reality. however it may be the one aspect of staying there that may keep us from returning. And it's not just the comped drinks, but, because of the bars are now mainly for grabbing a drink, most of them were not open until evening. So off to the casino floor we ventured where the drink service was excellent. We never had to wait long for a cocktail waitress and could still get just about anything we wanted. We probably split our time between the casino at Encore and the one at Wynn. It was good to have easy access to both since they have dramatically different "vibes", but are both very comfortable. At the end of our stay we checked at the Red Card desk only to find that, since we were there on a special offer (2 free nights, 1 night at $129, and $150 in free play) there were no additional complimentaries that they could offer us. Grade B+ Customer service throughout both hotels was excellent. We were greeted warmly by every employee we encountered. Housekeeping was adequate although I was a bit surprised that there was no evening turn-down service. We were able to check-in early (around 1:00 p.m.) the day of arrival but there was no separate line for check-out at the front desk on the day of departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jslondon85
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at Encore last week, had a fantastic time, great room on the 11th floor facing the north strip, no club noise problems at all. Mini suite layout was lovely and the bathrooms in particular are great. Pool area was excellent, good waitress service, nice laid back atmosphere and really appreciated the adults only pool so you could properly relax with no kids running around! Hotel is beautiful, very bright and airy, I liked that encore was smaller than the Wynn side, it felt much more intimate and laid back. The location is right at the north end of the strip (assuming you dont go up to circus circus - not sure why you would really) but thats not a problem if you dont mind a bit of walking. We also ate at Okada in the Wynn which was fantastic, while I didnt particularly enjoy the Society cafe in the Encore, there wasnt anything wrong as such, just a little slow and a bit dull, not the best breakfast we had in vegas- Peppermill wins on that one! The concierge was fantastic and helped us to check in online for the flights etc, on the whole a fantastic stay, I would definitely reccommend Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average”
Reviews.Author: tommygordon
Reviews.Content: Some really good points to this hotel (rooms, Japanese restaurant Wazuzu, pool) but also some not so good (service, value for money, casino tables). We will stay somewhere else next time. Be careful about all the hidden fees - $25 to use a fridge in the room, $15 to use the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, hospitable, and posh”
Reviews.Author: apjohnsonsd
Reviews.Content: Encore is one of the nicest hotels in Vegas. It's warmer than the new Aria, City Center, etc. The other places felt cold and ultra-modern which is great if you're single and like that. Encore was more hospitable and welcoming. Beware rooms facing the pool. XS nightclub down there is open till 4/5am and is LOUD. The front desk warned us in advance so we got a room on the other side of the hotel. It was not the best view but we slept well. We had an excellent breakfast at Society (not far from the elevators). Dinner at Sinatra was OK. Nothing to write home about. We had a great time at the Encore spa. Make sure to bring swimming attire. Nice and relaxing pool/Jacuzzi, and showers. Nice lounge, locker room, amenities. It felt like country club living. The fusion massage was good but not great. The facilities were amazing. We'd definitely go again. I'd recommend it to couples and high rollers. The hotel has the best club on the strip with XS but the hotel itself seems to be for a more mature clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: amungarro
Reviews.Content: This July my wife and I decided to try another Hotel in Vegas. We settled on the Palazzo with a view of the Pirate Show right across the street. As soon as we walked in we noticed some pretty obvious problems. #1, the window looking out from all the rooms were much smaller than we are used to at the Encore where the whole wall is glass making no matter what your looking at very cool and giving the room a more open feel to it. The other thing we noticed was the finger print smudges all over the dresser and chairs. Gross! The nail in the coffin was the hair in the toilet and sink. Maybe it was from housekeeping but we didn't bother to stick around and find out. We checked out as soon as we checked in and went next door to the Encore where we are always satisfied and enjoyed the rest of our trip. The thing about the Encore that I really love is its not a zoo. The valet is next to the front desk which is next to the elevators to my room so checking in is fast and getting to my room is easy. The Palazzo like the other places we visited were jammed packed and the walk to the front desk and eventual elevators to our room from the valet was a hike through a casino which isn't easy if your lugging your own luggage. I know they offer to bring it up but when your packing light enough to carry yourself, we prefer to do it ourself. We noticed the small pools at the Palazzo. I don't think they had an adult pool which is nice when you don't want kids around you. Anyway the adult pool at the Encore is awesome. It's big, there are no kids and it has a full bar with food. Again, it's never packed unless your there on a Sunday when they open the club XS and create a pool party all night. Awesome! Anyway. I have no need to seek a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Encore does not care about their guests”
Reviews.Author: cstrom
Reviews.Content: The room they gave us was near a machine room. So all day and night we heard these weird noises from there. I had to put a pillow over my head so I could sleep. I complained to the front desk about it and they blew me off. All of the workers there seems stuck up and would not even say "Hi" to you when they pass you in the hallway. I will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints...”
Reviews.Author: rjrdomer
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay at Encore over the past year. I have another one planned in a month or so. No, I am not a compulsive gambler. My job brings me to Vegas every so often and I sprinkle in a personal trip here and there for a weekend. I am your average person. I gamble a little bit. I am not a club-goer, and I sit by the pool for a little while. I enjoy nice restaurants. For someone like me, Encore is a perfect fit. It is obvious that Steve Wynn and his crew have paid attention to every detail. Nothing goes unnoticed. I notice new things and pick up on some operational efficiencies each time I go. The staff and management have it all down to a science. It's a classy joint overall. Check-in: Smooth as silk. I am always welcomed back with a friendly smile when they pull up my profile. Spa: Haven't used it, but my spouse said it is incredible. Staff: With the rare exception, every employee I have encountered at the Wynn/Encore has been friendly and accommodating. Many do their jobs well and aren't even noticed. Restaurants: All are very good. I have been to a selection of the many restaurants at both Wynn and Encore. Wynn has more to choose from, Encore being the smaller of the two has fewer options. Yes, better bargains can be had on the strip, but each meal I have had at all restaurants has been above average. I enjoy Society Cafe for any meal. Service is top-notch. Casino: Clean, beautiful and actually bright. Not as crowded as the Wynn casino but the minimums tend to be slightly higher. Standard games. Wynn gears things toward the Asian gambler so there are a lot of Pai Gow games and things like that. A lot of Asian dealers as well. But everyone is generally friendly and helpful. Red Card: Same program as the Wynn. It's not entirely transparent. I've gotten a few basic things comped...food and drink mainly, nothing too elaborate. I'm not a high roller, but I gamble my fair share when I am there. Pool: Nice pool area. Smaller than the Wynn. Free water. Cocktail service is good. Slightly slower when busy, but not bad at all. There is a Beach Club separate from the main pool area for the Rehab types. Wynn was smart to separate the two so you can choose which atmosphere you want. Stores: All high-end. I've never seen anyone purchase anything in them, but if they can make money, more power to them. Worth a look if passing through. Overall ambience is great. I find the Wynn/Encore to be peaceful compared to other strip properties. I venture off property quite often when I am in town and always say "I can't wait to get back to my hotel so I can get away from this madness." The bad: Yes, it's expensive. But you are paying for the entire experience. Everything is just a step above. Sometimes it is difficult to find a lower-minimum table especially on weekend evenings where they will start at $25. It's not uncommon to see a crowd at the $50 or $100 blackjack table, but there are plenty of low-rollers as well. More diverse food options would be great. There are a lot of restaurants so I think most of the bases are covered. However a lot of Asian restaurants that seem to all serve the same food at different price points. I look forward to my trip each time I go. When I go to Vegas, I price out multiple properties and always land at Encore paying more in the process but getting slightly more.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with a couple of missteps”
Reviews.Author: totallye
Reviews.Content: The Encore is exactly as expected, a "lifestyle" hotel. Some casino in LV invoke Rome, Paris, Monte Carlo or the tropics... the Encore is more or less is the Vegas embodiment of the pages of SkyMall, Forbes or Vogue come to life. Hey, it's not how most of us actually live, but this town is made for big dreamers so why not indulge? The rooms are quite large at more than 700 square feet and nicely appointed with floor to ceiling windows complete with remote control window covering at your fingertips. NIce furnishing and particularly high quality bedding. It was the nicest I have found on the Strip and this includes the Palazzo, and tHE hOTEL at Mandalay Bay. The bathroom itself was large, bright, and very clean. The towels plentiful and the robes were great. My complaint would be that the there is a odd musky scent emanating from the water closet room and the bath products seemed inferior to those at comparably priced properties along the strip. Check in was quick for our arrival albeit very noisy in the lobby. The hotel itself seems to have issues with noise as our first night was spent on the 29th floor which was no where near as quiet as the nights spent on the 51st floor subsequently. The noise we encountered was mostly due to guests volume and thin walls. Our biggest complaints on our three nights at the Encore was the fact that we were told to request a late check out if needed upon check in, it was denied to us however which was a disappointment as it was offered earlier. Secondly, following our first night we left our room by 10:00 am only to return at 5:45 pm to find it had not been attended to by housekeeping. After a call to the front desk we were offered another room immediately but no assistance to move our luggage or ensure that the room key-cards would open the new room. So one of us had to high-tail up two separate elevators to check that our card key would open the new room while the other stayed back, packing furiously, waiting for the okay that the switch could happen. The back down and up another elevator to pick up the luggage. It was unnecessary and an inconvenience to us and is the main reason it rated a four with us. One pays more to stay here, and that includes everything throughout the property so with that extra expense, I for one, expected a higher level of service when requested. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't handled to my satisfaction. BTW, La Cave at the Wynn was very good, we dined there twice.And the cocktail servers on the casino floor were among the nicest and most attentive in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, could have done without the attitudes”
Reviews.Author: phxdaddio
Reviews.Content: This was my 10th visit to Las Vegas for pleasure and my first stay at the Encore. It is immediately apparent that Steve Wynn's team has an impeccable eye for detail....nothing was out of place. The prices are outrageous (a pitcher of rum runners at the pool was $52), and there is a charge for everything but you know that going in. The real surprise for me was the attitude of some of the staff. For the most part, everyone was cordial, helpful and had a smile, but there were 3 seperate incidents where we received some serious attitude and in 1 case a staffer being down right rude. Coupled with the prices at the restaurants and bars, I think I will return to the Palazzo, Cosmopolitan or Bellagio before going back to Wynn Encore.
