Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: dbaumy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived early in the morning on Thurs, July 14th, for a three night stay. Bell Hop and front desk were very friendly and helpful. We opted to upgrade our room for an additional $25 a night and were very glad we did. We received a very nice room on the 61st floor with fantastic views of the strip and mountains. The room was very nice - just what I expected. I could hear the bass/thumping from the night club on the 61st floor! If you are not used to noise when you are trying to sleep then this may not be the place for you. The bed was very comfortable. I wished the room had a coffee maker as well as a small fridge (it did say you could call to get one delivered). The snacks to purchase were dusty and the mini bar had expired beer - founds that out after I took a drank and thought it didn't taste very good. This place is very upscale and everything is very expensive. Bloody Mary's for fifteen bucks +tip, cup of coffee for six bucks +tip, bottle of beer for about eight +tip. Be prepared to spend a lot. We had breakfast the day we arrived at the Terrace restaurant. The omelet was great but my five dollar muffin crumbled as soon as i cut into it. The pool was very fun. There is more action and more fun on the adults only European side. On weekdays I would recommend being down by 10am to get a good spot and be there at 9am on Saturdays. Pool service was very good, wait until after 11am to order food so you can order off a different menu. The food we had at the pool was fantastic. Dinner at Strata was very good - served at a slow relaxing pace. At night, the casino and common areas are overrun by club goers. Thousands of very young clubbers waiting in very long lines to get in. The place goes from very classy/upscale to trashy. We headed over to the Cosmopolitan for one of our evenings to get away from the demographic shift that occurs at the Encore at night.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas at its finest!”
Reviews.Author: GaRoo2010
Reviews.Content: Fabulous...what can I say... we’ve previously stayed at the Wynn and this time tried the Encore. We got a great deal, the staff and service were great, the room immaculate and lazy time at the pool just what we needed at the end of our vacation. Try Wazuzu Restuarant for fabulous Asian / Sushi and if you’re looking to take a helicopter tour to the Grand Canyon we highly recommend Maverick Tours. The only teeny tiny criticism is that there's no free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay!”
Reviews.Author: london2135
Reviews.Content: Firstly the initial check in. Upon arriving the staff were helpful, offering to take our bags and open doors. At the front desk there was no queue so check in was quick. Again did offer upgrades however we declined. Got a room on the 26th floor and heard no nightclub noise at all during our stay. As others have said we were facing the Circus not the strip. The room was lovely, comfortable bed, massive bathroom and nice seating area. The Internet is free but you do have to accept the charges that are refunded at checkout. The pools were spacious but did get busy and you need to get down there before 11am to get a lounger. The overall vibe of the hotel is relaxed. Compared to other resorts we visited it was quieter and cleaner. We enjoyed this as it gave us a break from the hustle of the strip. Location itself was excellent. Across the road from the mall and about 10 minutes to the centre of the strip. Negatives Although it's common place the 20 dollar resort fee does seem excessive especially as you get very little for it. Also despite staying at the encore/Wynn you don't get any queue jumps or preferential treatment at the hotel as in at the buffet or nightclub. This does seem a little odd from my point of view surely as a hotel guest you should receive this. Only bad experience whilst attempting to enter a small cafe in the bar was told I could not enter wearing a vest. Again minor but considering it's 44 degree I am unlikely to be wearing a shirt. These points are minor but I think any review should comment on both good and bad. Overall we had an excellent time and will definitely stay at the Encore again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: GuinJ
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel was beautiful,and the first. Few people we came into contact with were very nice, but it went downhill from there. The buffet is excellent, however the people who workt there were surly. The wazuzu had the most singularly UNinspired sushi ive had the misfortune to eat, priced exorbitantly, and "served" by one of the most inept waitresses I've had in Vegas (and I'm including sleazy joints too ) Although our room was 23 floors up, the club on the first floor was loud and throbbing until 4am. You'd think soundproofed rooms would be part of the package. The beds are hard and uncomfortable. I was hoping for "heavenly" beds

Reviews.Title: “Very upscale and elegant.”
Reviews.Author: CaAudrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a tower suite at the Wynn Encore in Las Vegas. Everything was better than exected. The suite was large and roomy with all the latest amenities. It even had controls to open and close the drapes that were located bedside. The hotel had facilities to serve all needs- restaurants, entertainment, shopping and recreation.

Reviews.Title: “The other 900+ Excellent reviews got it right”
Reviews.Author: itsnotafad
Reviews.Content: There's not much I need to say about this place. With almost a thousand excellent reviews they can't all be wrong haha. This place is great, stay here. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Wynn Nightmare...do not value customers or staff...”
Reviews.Author: Pd3421
Reviews.Content: Not a "five star experience." made reservations several weeks ahead and called to twice to be sure they knew we would arrive after midnight. They "made note"of the late arrival time and stated "no problem.". After 14 hours en route we arrive at 12:45 am and are told they do not have a room for us and they are sorry but they "overbooked.". The young lady (Michele)at the registration desk was pleasant and apolegetic and said she would call us on our cell phone when something was available. To me this is unacceptable of a "five star" resort. It tells me they are greedy and do not value their customers and trying to get every dime they can anyway that they can. To have a reservation and be told at 1:00 am you don't have a room is not acceptable. Get more housekeepers ! Sixteen dollars for a carafe of coffee is greedy! Ten dollars for a toothbrush is ridiculous! After a two hour wait we are "downgraded" to a handicapped room and told we have to move the next morning. We don't even have the king bed that we booked! We tell the front desk we will be at the convention center all day the following day and not returning until 6:00 pm. They say "no problem." They call us at 2:00 pm and state the room is ready and we need to return to the hotel as soon as possible. We leave early and miss two events but it is still close to five when we can get back to move. Later that night we are riding in an elevator with a very nice handicapped gentleman who relates his check in story. His room was not ready and he had to wait 4 hours to check in. We are horrified and feel terrible; yes the room they booked us into! They knew he had a reservation, and they knew we could not be on call all day to move when they finally said another room was ready! Where is the customer service and the "Wynn Experience.?". Shame on Steve Wynn for his greediness!"

Reviews.Title: “one of the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JayBristol77
Reviews.Content: I had pre-booked on line for a suite. When we arrived, checkin was smooth, efficient and professional. I was asked for an extra $20 per night i could upgrade my room from a normal suite to a panoramic suite. Which i am glad i did. We were on the 64th floor with a view over looking the strip, what a view. The room was how you would expect a luxury room to be, clean, nothing out of place, just brimming with luxury!! The toiletries were not the skimpy little bottles found in most hotels and the towels and dressing gowns were pure quality. The bed was one of the most comfortable i have ever slept on and to add to it all you didnt even have to gt out of bed to turn lights on or off, close the curtains or nets. You could even set the door with a do not disturb all from the comfort of the bed. The restaurant while not very cheap (even by american standards) but well worth it, the food was sublime. The shops, whilst expensive, are worth looking at. The casino wasn't as seedy as other hotels along the strip and had an air of elegance about it all. This has to be on everyone's "bucket list" from the moment you checkin with your personalised key cards to the moment you check out, it was pure pleasure and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: alibullock
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 5 star hotels all over the world and this was by far the worst I have ever stayed at and most certainly not worth the price. I know this is Vegas and no hotel will be as good as Europe or Asia, but the place was loud, busy and the service was not up to what i would expect as a Wynn property. When we arrived our room was not made up and when we companied no-one helped us to move to a new room (where the new key did not in fact work.) Again, more complaints and no support. I actually refused to pay the bill (of course charged anyway.) But overall I would not stay here again. No way is this hotel worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with outstanding rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jaykay33
Reviews.Content: The rooms alone are worth the money when you stay in this fabulous hotel. The ultra modern rooms and bathrooms are immaculate and no expense spared. The only problem we had were noisy neighbours and could hear everything. More sound proofing would have been the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate luxury”
Reviews.Author: terinay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Vegas, for the 8th time. Each time we stayed at a different hotel and this 8th trip we stayed at the Encore which by far was our best Vegas luxury hotel experience to date, hands down. Encore is expensive, yes, but for a good reason. Also, there's a popular school of thought for hotel choices: why pay more for a hotel if you're going to be spending most of your time outside the hotel anyway? While there is alot of basis for this school of thought, it might not necessarily hold true in Vegas. In Vegas, all the attractions are the hotels itself which means that you will be spending alot of your time in hotels: pool, meals, casino, shows, and other attractions. Guests at the Encore and Wynn have access to amenities on either side. It seems like for every great thing that was first built at the Wynn, they made it better at the Encore. If you are looking for excellent customer service, modern and gorgeous and high tech rooms, and wonderful amenities, then this place is for you. Vegas has a ton of hotel competition but Encore knows how to stand out. When we requested for more toiletries, they called us up within the next 15 mins to check if they had been delivered to our room. Some other standouts at the Encore: 1. They have a European-style pool (i.e. topless optional). Best time/least crowded time to go is on late mornings early in the week. 2. Beautiful pool area without the spring breakers crowd. If you don't want drinks and food service, they have multiple complimentary ice drinking water stations to keep you hydrated during those hot summer days. 2. Fighting over which tv channel to watch in the room? No worries. There's a tv in the room and another tv in the bathroom. 3. Automated control for lights, drapes, and room privacy from your bedside. 4. Touchscreen room phone. 5. Personal customer service: Whenever we called up housekeeping or the service desk, they picked up the phone and straightaway addressed us by name without us informing which room we're in. The last time we got this type of personal experience was when we stayed at the Four Seasons in Singapore. Great award-winning restaurants and shopping at the esplanade. The location is also fantastic being really close to the Palazzo, Venetian, and Fashion Show Mall. Need something from Walgreens? Take the overpass from the Wynn esplanade and cross over to the Palazzo. Hotel guests are allowed to purchase prepaid tickets for XS Nightclub and also enter through a special line. We bypassed everyone else and hardly needed to wait. Nice perk as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel dodgy checkout!”
Reviews.Author: Stevebirch
Reviews.Content: Spend 10 days here with my grown up family fab hotel great restaurants superb pools with great vibe couldnt fault at all until CHECKOUT checked out using there express checkout via room tv no problems there but to my surprise once home in the uk I find to my surprise that they where charging my room on a daily basis after numerous calls from travel agent and myself to the hotel to get this refunded there response was it will take 5 working days so in effect I paid my room bill twice until those kind people at the Wynn decided to release the pending amounts back into my account. I feel when we first checked in we should of been warned of the way they charge you can be quite a shock once back home. Other than this the hotel and staff where as you expect first class. Big thanks to melissa concierge desk for all her help

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: ctron1
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I have read the reviews and several people have complained about check in. I can only tell you how wonderful our experience was. We were horrendously delayed in getting to the hotel. I had read some horror stories on trip advisor as to what happened when you arrived late, so we braced ourselves for the worst. Nothing could be further from the reviews on here! We arrived at 3am, tired and upset at the plane delays. We were met with sympathetic and very understanding staff. We were told there were no rooms in the class we had booked and that they would sort something out. The check in staff phoned someone and two minutes later she told us we had a free upgrade to the 59th floor with full strip view. Not only that but they brought up extra towels and gave us additional toiletries (toothbrush, toothpaste etc), I can only assume to save us unpacking at the late hour. Truly wonderful! The rooms are out of this world! Comfortable beds, plush pillows, great tvs, tv in bathroom, which is huge by the way! I cannot complain about one thing. The pool area was wonderful as well, never overcrowded, we always got a poolside lounged whenever we went down. The Internet is very good, and very fast. It is included in the resort fee, I know lots of people complain on here about the resort fee, but it is fairly standard, not just in Vegas. All the staff were great and friendly and very helpful. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in most ways but lost a star for check-in”
Reviews.Author: marcgr
Reviews.Content: A five-star hotel is about perfection in all aspects at all times. A 5-star review for a 5-star hotel means everything went perfectly throughout. I have given 5-star reviews to other 5-star hotels (for example, in Vegas, to the Four Seasons and to the Wynn itself). The Encore fell short upon check-in on a recent stay so, sorry Encore, you lose a star for that and this is a 4-star review for a 5-star hotel. We arrived at 3:30PM (30 minutes after check-in officially opened) in a VERY quiet week in Vegas (no large conventions, casinos mostly empty, never had to wait for a taxi or game or restaurant table). In our past stay at the Wynn we did find the main pool area a bit crowded so we asked the desk clerk about upgrading to a tower room that has use of a special pool just for tower rooms. We found out the special pool is over at the Wynn (about 7-10 minutes walk away) and it was an extra $75 per night to upgrade to the tower room so we didn't bother with the upgrade, and the clerk tried to upsell us to 3 or 4 different kinds of upgrade rooms (which is fine in my opinion). Then the desk clerk tells us that, sorry, there are no rooms ready in the room class we had booked. While I will tolerate this in a 3* or maybe even a 4* hotel, I have little tolerance for this in a 5* hotel - I see it as a management failure, either an accidental underestimation of the number of guests in the hotel (unlikely with computerized reservation systems) or an intentional understaffing of the housekeeping department to try to save cost. I see this as the hotel telling me, "We don't value your custom enough to err on the side of caution when staffing our housekeeping department with people earning $8/hr." Here is the correct way a 5-star hotel should handle this: "I'm sorry sir, we don't have any rooms left in the room class that you booked, so I am going to upgrade you to (whatever room class is clean and ready at that moment) at no extra charge." In the very rare instance that there are no rooms at all open (maybe there really was a rash of people who checked out 2 hours late) then a barely-acceptable 5-star answer is: "I'm sorry sir, there are no rooms at all available at this moment because of (whatever). I will call a bellman over for you to store your bags and they'll be waiting in your room when you get there; meanwhile, here are a couple of drink coupons, please have a drink in the bar with our compliments and I will bring you your room keys as soon as your room is ready, and it will be ready in (an accurate estimate)." Here's what actually happened: Like I said, we were shown all the upgrade rooms but then told that our room was unavailable. It was pretty matter-of-fact, if it was an apology I don't remember it being apologetic, more like "I don't know when your room will be ready, please give me your cellphone number and someone will call you when it's ready and you can come back to the desk and wait in another line to pick up your keys. You can take your own bags down to the bell stand if you want the bellman to store them for you, and then when you get your room number you can call the bell stand from your room (and wait) to have your bags delivered." That would be acceptable in a 3-star place and barely acceptable in a 4-star, but the lack of service there is not at all acceptable in a 5-star hotel. Anyway, we did store 3 of our bags but still opted to lug one bag with all our valuables in it around the casino. We did get the phone call eventually after about 30 minutes, not a big deal but again not knowing how long it was going to be meant we couldn't really plan an activity to fill the time (didn't want to sit down and gamble if I was going to have to leave after 15 minutes) so we were just kind-of wandering around waiting for the call. Yeah I could have pitched a hissy fit and probably gotten some or all of the 5-star response I was expecting, but the fact is, I shouldn't have to. The only other thing that irked me was a big sign outside the elevators saying, "No food or drink from outside the premises allowed in rooms". I don't think I've seen one of those in any hotel in a long time... what does that say about what you think of your guests or your restaurants? If you offer quality food at a price your guests are willing to pay then people will rarely bring in food items. But I'll tell you what, if I have that Big Mac attack at 3AM I don't want any sign telling me I can't bring it back to my room. So - enough of that - other than that the Encore was pretty good. Hotel in general: Nicely decorated, very contemporary (which we like), everything in excellent condition with a lot of attention to detail. Room - Excellent as expected. Bed comfortable, layout very functional, nice sitting area for entertaining if desired. We were able to hear the Surrender nightclub from our room (low floor but near the elevators and relatively far from the club area) but it wasn't too bad. Restaurants - Wazuzu was very good (try the soup if you are hung over) and the Buffet (in the Wynn) was good for breakfast. Excellent coffee and pastries from the Cafe over in the Wynn. Casino - Small, quiet, nice ambience, relatively non-smoky. Note there are no Blackjack tables under $25 in the evenings even mid-week (my Wife is just learning and $25 is a bit high for a beginner). My Wife's game is Craps and we had a craps table all to to ourselves for about an hour one afternoon where I learned craps from the staff who were all helpful and friendly. The Wynn casino is a bit more lively. Bars: Most of the bars around the casino were shut. The advertised "Dueling pianos" show in the Eastside bar was more like "Agreeable pianos" and not the fun-times dueling piano shows that I am used to. Pool: Very nicely decorated, good service, but all the "good" spots to sit (padded lounges etc) are reserved for the Cabana rentals. Regular deckchairs for everyone else. Overall: Very nice hotel and we had returned to the Encore because of our previous good experience at the Wynn. But there are other great 5* hotels out there (4 Seasons) and perhaps it's time to try something new for next time.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: CBE&LME
Reviews.Content: Check in was efficient and gracious. Our room was supplied with fine amenities..........plenty of very large towels........quality soap, shampoo, conditioner, etc.... We loved the bathroom and shower. Very quiet. We never got disturbed even once. We enjoyed the "privacy" light and the automatic drapes. Very fine furnishings and linens & lots of mirrors. Spacious and clean. Our stay at the Encore was memorable.

Reviews.Title: “out of this world”
Reviews.Author: lou777
Reviews.Content: Encore and Wynn is the most amazing hotel stunning finishes everywhere. The rooms or should I say suites are huge just a standard resort king is amazing, separate living area and you can see down the strip from your bed no need to upgrade!!. Dont let the reviews about the noise put you off encore the strip view is great and although the music can be loud fri and sat its really not a problem. You can also get earplugs at reception if you are a light sleeper. Staff are all excellent at this hotel and will help you with everything. You totally feel that you belong to the hotel and do not get lost in visiting guests, stylish classy and great fun for everyone. We did not leave the hotel resort for 3 days and only ate out once as the restaurants and food are superb. 2 pools at encore and 2 at wynn which one of them is more chilled out with lovely cabbanas and one up top with gaming and more atmosphere when you fancy it. Encore beach club saturday from 11-7 we had a table and bed by the pool for $1200 for 4 well worth it for the day. Will return to the encore anytime I am in vegas. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!! Excelent room!!! (Honeymooners: do not expect any special treatment)”
Reviews.Author: DarkChocolateandWine
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great rooms, amazing view (ask for stip view: we stayed at the 60th floor which had a wonderful view but be careful when booking because some rooms views are covered by the Wynn building). Great in-room breakfast. If you are going on your honeymoon, don´t expect to get special treatment or any kind or “honeymoon treats”, you are only one more guest. If you are in party mood, be sure to visit the XS night club at the Wynn, it’s one of the best night clubs in Vegas. Be sure to bring all you medicines with you, I forgot my eyedrops, but I had my doctors recipe with me… anyways since the recipe was from an other country you have to get an American recipe, which costed us around $175 dlls just for the Doctor at Wallgreens to re-write it.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: shannenavila
Reviews.Content: We stay in Vegas 4-5 times a year at different hotels each time. The Encore would have to be one of the nicest (if not the nicest) hotels we've stayed at so far. The rooms are luxurious, well worth the money. Stay during the weekday for the best rates. The Wynn resorts have the most comfortable beds in Vegas. The things I did not like about the hotel: They do not comp drinks when you play at the bar, the minimum bets are outrageous for most tables. I would stay here, but not gamble here. It takes a lot of money to earn points on your players club card. I am sure the next part was a fluke: Our room was had items on the floor (earring backings, paper clips, long thick black strands of hair). Not sure what that was about because the rest of rooms was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock_Wallace
Reviews.Content: First time at the Encore. I like the rooms better than the Wynn. The semi-suite layout is nice and the overall decor is tastefully elegant. Steve does hotels right. It is pricey for everything in this place, there are better values in Las Vegas. Also you are at the far end of the strip, not in the thick of it. My TV never worked, but didn't call to have it fixed. I did call and ask for a ziploc bag as my liquids bag had ripped. Two sturdy bags showed up within a few minutes. Would only stay again if I get another nice offer in the mail. But if I do, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - first holiday where i did not miss my own bed or pillow”
Reviews.Author: La_Tempete
Reviews.Content: Right on the strip handy for the regular and the express buses. Good pool though the european pool was a little noisy. The room 2647 was lovely massive flat screen TV that flips round to watch from either bed or the chaise long. floor to ceiling windows with electric curtains and nets. There is a fully stocked minibar in the room but a fridge may be supplied if you need it for medicines or if you are there for a long stay they will let you have one. Despite the indoor smoking the casino was not as smelly as some in the area. The gym was fitted with all new equipment and water, fruit, headsets and handtowels all supplied. Never got to see the inside of the spa at around $40 a day did not bother. Staff in the hotel all very pleasant service at the pool a bit hit and miss when they seemed short of staff and menus. Do not use the nail bar near the minimarket over priced and not that great a manicure. Do not bother with the open top tourbus just buy a 24 hour $7 ticket and ride the double decker. Avvoid the outlet centre near Downtown head to the one at the opposite end of the bus route as this is all indoor and much cooler.

Reviews.Title: “Every beauty has it's Flaws”
Reviews.Author: RoxieCris
Reviews.Content: Overall yes I like Encore. When we first got there it was quick check in and the front desk girl was lovely. We get to the room absolutely wonderful!!! I was so glad we chose the panoramic suite bc the view was great!!! I love the remote thing for the lights and drapes. I really felt special at that moment. The hotel and casino was a great sight to see and I enjoyed the Wynn restaurants better than Encore. Once we got there we went to Encore Beach Club which really isn't part of the hotel so you still have to pay... BUMMER bc the price you pay to stay there it really should be included if you want the option or at least cheaper! But back to the Encore if I felt like balling or if I was on a nice romantic trip or something yes I would stay there again but just girls getaway no bc we never really used all the amenities but it was a good experience. Oh and trying to charge me $5 for a fork bc they forgot to give me one almost pissed me off but I politely walked downstairs and got it myself lol

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: realreviews_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous!!! The rooms are spectacular. The hotel is new, clean and so well maintained. Casino is great (did't win though). Location is on the strip, fantastic! Staff is so friendly and helpful. Food is delicious. The pools are wonderful. I really can not say a bad thing about this place. I booked it at a great price on book-it.com. Would definitely go back there any day of the week!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: Shark303
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, nothing for kids to do. Everything is adult oriented so you have to go someplace else. In addition, most of the restaurants and entertainment is on the Wynn side so a 10 minute walk with kids each way every time. Food is outrageously expensive. Service is very uneven and it is clear there are no clear hotel guidelines. In most hotels all employees have the same attitude, either good or bad. In this hotel you take a chance with every employee you deal with. Rooms are nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem With Minor Flaws: Swank Resort With Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ajferguson13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Wynn for our 15-year anniversary. Our stay did not start off well as there was little organization at the front desk, and we got stuck behind a rude party that wanted to haggle over a last-minute booking. However, once we were finally checked in the service was 5 star at every turn. The resort itself is beautiful and you could spend hours just crushing around marveling at all the high-quality materials that went into a design that is nearly flawless in its execution. Our room was huge considering the price we paid. We were on the 52nd floor with an amazing view of the city, complete with a massive bathroom and sitting room. A note for light sleepers: at the 52nd floor I could still hear the bass from the club and the DJ yelling over tracks. If you are a party animal then you wont mind a bit, but I think some of the more conservative travelers might want the room to be a complete sanctuary. It is not. People are screaming in the halls, and well, it’s Vegas. I was not really bothered because I’m there to party too, but I can see why someone else might be put out. Everyone on the staff is very friendly and professional. Aside from the front desk, I really have no negative comments about any of the service I received at this resort. The food on-site is pricey (of course) and most of it is presented in an ‘overdone’ fancy fashion when such treatment is completely unnecessary. It seems like many of the chefs are working under the assumption the even American comfort food must be drizzled in truffle oil and jammed into a soufflé cup. I can understand what they are going for, but many times over-the-top becomes yet another camp cliché. More about the food: room service is really remarkable in being able to deliver a well cooked meal to your door hot and well prepared. When you order a cup of coffee, expect the person to try to ‘upsell’ you at every turn. Again, I get it, but the pressure gets old. That said, on my last night I enjoyed a perfectly grilled ribeye while looking over the strip and planning that night’s foray into the casino. – One last kudos on the food: the buffet is really remarkable and pretty good deal at 23 a head. Of course the casino beautiful and expensive. Personally, I prefer to stay somewhere nice and gamble on the strip. But if you don’t mind high minimums, Both the Encore and the Wynn casinos will meet or exceed your expectations for a good time. For a larger selection of games and a more lively crowd, I would say your best bet is the Wynn Casino as it has more action. The Encore Casino is much more intimate, but I was not feeling it there. I do not do Vegas but once every five years, and I am not sure when I will go back; but if the price is right when I do, the Encore is at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “They thought of everything you'd appreciate, then added a bit.”
Reviews.Author: LauraJHodson
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, having previously stayed twice at Wynn. Staff are really fantastic. Service and food quality excellent- loved Society cafe, very reasonable and the breadsticks wow! Staff are knowledgeable, courteous and genuinely take pride in ensuring the highest standards throughout the property. Public areas are immaculately maintained. 5 minutes to check in- acknowledged as previous guests. It's hard to review something that I have nothing to really take issue with- I guess the rooms aren't a massive wow factor if you're used to that kind of thing and the sofa is not amazingly comfortable (unlike the beds which are just stunningly comfy). Get the red card- very easy to rack up points, I think it was 250 for a buffet for two people which was easily redeemed; just ask at the desk. So we enjoyed two free trips to the buffet during our stay- my are the deserts heavenly! We enjoy walking over to the the Fashion Show Mall across the road, very easy to get to from Wynn. Here there is a Starbucks where you can pick up a tall brewed for $1.50. Bus stop outside if you fancy a jaunt downtown or maybe take a stroll to the Bellagio Conservatory (30 mins) if you are botanically inclined. Just enjoy the calm, tranquillity and light (and a drink or 5 from the regular cocktail service- recommend a white Russian!) Encore truly is so relaxing, you feel energised and chilled at the same time. Nothing is too much trouble. I guess everything is relative and it is easy to take for granted the subtle touches that make it such a special place.

Reviews.Title: “I want to live here”
Reviews.Author: niall1000
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about the Wynn. Decore, service was fantastic. Not in the busiest part of the strip but that suited us fine as we love to walk around the strip. highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely best hotel on the strip! Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: sian421
Reviews.Content: The Wynn and Encore at Wynn are gorgeous hotels. This is my 5th stay in Las Vegas, and this by far is the nicest hotel I have stayed in. I was in a king suite, with a great view of the mountains ( I prefer that to the strip). Beatituful foyer, bathroom with stand up shower and sunken tub, great bedroom-comfy bed- and great living room area with couch. The only complaint is that the bathroom shelf had rings on it from cups or whatever, so it hadn't been cleaned properly. The hotel food is very pricey, but that's just how it is in Vegas hotels. You can easily walk across the street to the fashion show mall which has great shops and cheaper eating options. Overall, great stay and I will never stay anywhere else in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Everything & More..Service..Clubs..Restaurants... wrapped with an exquisite bow!”
Reviews.Author: ylbrazeau
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at Encore & can't really say anything we didn't like. The rooms were great, modern, clean & comfortable. Staff at all shoppes, restaurants & clubs exceptional, for a higher end hotel I didn't get any attitude. When our cabana boy( Sunday#204) at Encore Beach Club folded all our cloths for us & lined up all the shoes, bags & suncreen I was impressed! We attended the Garth show at the sister property Wynn & again were blown away with the performance. Would definitely recommend to others, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “It´s Ok”
Reviews.Author: jimena_mv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just stayed at the Encore in Las Vegas for my birthday. We got there on Sunday June 19 and departed on Thursday 23. In general the hotel and it’s service its ok, in fact I think we could consider staying there in the future. Never the less there are many things they can improve. Here´s our point of view. The line at the front desk to be able to check in is tooooo long, the same for the day we checked out. It takes you about an hour to get to the front desk. Our first disappointment the room, we had booked for a panoramic suite with view to the strip, well we had a panoramic view but certainly we didn´t had a view to the strip. Our room had a view to Vegas down town. But we were so tired form the flight and the one hour line to check in that we decided not to call the front desk, just in case we had to wait one more hour to finally get our room. (That if they changed our room). The decoration of the room is very beautiful, the bed is heavenly confortable, and the bathroom is perfect. The only downsides of the room were the view, the light inside the closet was out and the scale in the bathroom didn´t worked. The casino is really quiet. And honestly I liked it to be that way during day hours, but at night. I like casinos to be a little more loud with a little more of life. On my birthday we were playing at a blackjack table up to 3 am and by the time we were done of playing black jack we were the last one´s playing in the casino. (Maybe it is because the drink ladies don’t come too often to your table.) And the only complain we had during our stay was that we booked with more than one week in advance to celebrate my birthday dinning at the Bartollota (that is the Italian fine dine restaurant at the Wynn). We wanted to be a special night so we booked a private cabana in the outside lake of the restaurant. Ones you call to make your reservation they send you a contract for you to sign it and agree that in order to have a private cabana you have to consume more than $130.00 per person (that was fine with us). But they never let you know that in some weather conditions the cabanas services are not available. What was our surprise? When we arrived that night the hostess informed us that due to the weather was so hot that day, they decided not to give service at the cabanas. What!!!!!!! The make you to sign that you agree to pay for special dinner but no one has the courtesy to inform you that this things can happen?? Honestly I was very disappointed. The food of the restaurant is ok (nothing to die for) and the waiters are really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality - I don't think so!”
Reviews.Author: Fish7765
Reviews.Content: 80% of the restaurants and bars are closed. The pool wait staff sucks - I was never asked if I wanted a drink or a snack for more than 3 days. The lobby bar staff is lazy and stupid - I did not get a cup of coffer for three days becuase I did not want to wait in line for 30 minutes. This hotel is only about making money, upcharging for what one would expect as part the the general offerings and is not concerned with a customer experience. I must say that none of this was unique to Encore - a $35 dollar cab ride from the airport. I know the economy is bad but please tell me why I should come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel meeting accomadations leave a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: jloBethelPark
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great. wonderful view from 55th floor. Very clean service great. Staff very helpful. The meetings and meeting areas were very poorly planed. Our group was told that the hotel had double booked conferences and did nothing to right their wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great but no personal attention”
Reviews.Author: SpaniardinIowa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore for our annyversary on our first trip to Las Vegas. We loved our stay, the moment you open the door into the lobby a pgreat smell comes to you of European perfums. The casino was impecable and not smokey. The pools were great but with VERY limited hours and VERY LITTLE shade areas. The room was amazing as we were up on the 63rd floor and with great views of the strip. Very quiet and wonderful. One day I did have to call service two times as they had not cleaned our room and it was already 4:30 in the evening! Hotel is in great shape and nice because it is in the strip but far away from the noise. The staff however was non-attentive and did not aknowledge you or check on you at the pools. Very modern decor and disco ambiance music throughout the hotel property. It was a great hotel and very recommended, I would say on the top 5 in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER”
Reviews.Author: loki_knows
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely good. This was my second visit to WYNN, i got a promotional email from Wynn. I got reduced price for three nights. In addition they charge $ 20/night which included free internet. They also gave $ 50 room credit which we used for Lunch. Very neat, clean, large rooms. One negative, there was no refrigerator for the guests' use, considering we were staying for three days with kids and aged who need to keep milk and madicines for personal use.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: sammowhammo
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at Encore - we normally stay at the Wynn Tower Suites. But they sent me an invite so I did a solo trip I arrived very early & was happily surprised to get checked in without any fuss. The staff is gracious without being patronizing, helpful without being imposing, and friendly without being familiar. TIP - Get a "north facing room" if you think you will be bothered by any club noise. I had a room on the 5th floor & couldn't hear a peep - or a thump. The room is very plush, as are all the amenities in the room. Granted the view in a north room isn't great but that's the fault of the economy not Mr. Wynn - the view is of the skeletal remains of the abandoned Echelon and Fountain Bleu projects. I imagine a higher up room would be a better view but I wasn't there to stare out the window. I felt very secure there - something very important to a solo traveler. I have stayed in a few hotels in Vegas and all around the country and I have to say that Wynn-Encore is the one where it feels the most like you are on a luxurious vacation and not just at a hotel that happens to be in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service. Fantastic Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: McAuley2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 full weeks at the Encore so we definitely feel merited in completing this review! The Encore hotel was excellent from start to finish. Reception, pool, casino, waiting and restaurant staff were all extremely polite, genuine and welcoming. High quality and luxury were paramount across the Encore on all levels. I have just two complaints .... noise from Encore Beach Club/outside clubs and lack of sunbeds at the pool area. We were on the 63rd floor (the highest floor of the hotel) and still had to buy earplugs and sleeping tablets for the noise. My suggestion is that if you aren't fussed on a strip view and value your sleep more, get a room on the non strip view side of the hotel. In terms of sunbeds, hit the pool early, especially Thursday through to Sunday. This aside, our stay at the Encore was thoroughly enjoyable and we thought it was much more fitting for us as a young couple than our stay at the Wynn a few years ago. Couple of tips for those staying at the hotel in the near future - Check out the Peppermill Diner which is literally a 5 minute walk from the entrance of the hotel to the right. You get a huge and awesome breakfast which sets you up for the day. Walgreens is again a few feet away from the entrance, just a 5 minute walk and you'll get water for the room, suncream etc rather than pay big prices at the Encore shop. RA Sushi at Fashion Show Mall is excellent and they do a Happy Hour at the wekends which means big discount prices on drink and selected food. Again this is literally across the street from the Wynn which you can gain access direct from the Encore. We didn't get to see La Reve as the show was dark but after speaking to a few people at the hotel who had managed to catch it before we arrived, the feedback was excellent. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Encore again but I will be requesting the "quiet" side of the hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star all the way!!”
Reviews.Author: PinkBonBon
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed at!!! We have stayed at the Encore twice now and from beginning to end everything has been top notch. Very large rooms with modern decor. The bathrooms had every imaginable amenity. And best of all this hotel is CLEAN!! I've been to Vegas at least 15 times in the past twenty years and have noticed changes in the city every time I visit. We noticed that most of the casinos now are not kept up. Very dirty and VERY SMOKY. Not so with the Encore. It is spotless and no smoke smell ever. They must have some type of special filters because there is always a pleasant smell in the casino. The cocktail waitresses come by quickly and the drinks are fantastic. They have some of the best mojitos I've ever had. I also visited the spa during my last trip. Gorgeous decor and great masseuse. Every amenity you could want at the spa. I believe this spa has won some type of award. You won't want to leave it's so beautiful. Next time you're in Vegas stay at the Encore. You won't be disappointed. Edit Remove

Reviews.Title: “Everything and more than we could have imagined.”
Reviews.Author: jeffl2503
Reviews.Content: A stunning hotel on the Las Vegas strip. Fantastic bars, nightclubs, Show Theatres, Restaurants, Coffee Shops , Spar and Swimming Pools gambling etc, The Hotel has an excellent Breakfast and Evening Buffet but note the price increases considerably Saturday and Sunday. Nothing is a problem to the vast amount of staff of this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you are sensitive to cigarette smoke, stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: erinontheroad
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Encore. Despite having requested a non-smoking room and getting a room on the 63rd floor which is designated as non-smoking, there were ashtrays in the room and people were walking the hallways with cigarettes in hand. Getting into bed at night meant pulling a duvet that smelled vaguely of tobacco over myself- YUCK! Down below in the hotel, people walk around puffing away in the casino, at the coffee shop, at the pool and stroll past the restaurants. I lost my appetite, got nauseous and had a perpetual headache. It is not pleasant at all.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, first class stay at five star resort”
Reviews.Author: bptmark
Reviews.Content: We spent days patrolling the Internet for the best place to stay. We were looking for a upscale hotel that had a great pool, cool atmosphere and great rooms/restaurants. The Encore met all those expectations and was a terric experience. Our room was spectacular, the pool was classy and not overpacked and the service was professional and friendly. We took advantage of the $40 spa passes which was a good deal. The Encore and Wynn are best suited for people looking for an upscale, low key experience that is focused more on high end service.

Reviews.Title: “Poor for a five-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: itrunsdeeper
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled. Encore at Wynn does NOT offer a five star service. I stayed there for two nights with 3 girlfriends in June and we were thoroughly disappointed with the hotel: - no housekeeping service. We came back from a day out to find our damp towels unchanged, beds unmade etc. When we called Housekeeping they seemed surprised that we had expected someone to turn over the room during the day. It took 3 further calls to get clean towels, have the old towels taken away and arrange to have the room tidied and beds turned down. I'm not usually a fussy person with hotels, but when you've paid a five star price....? - no information in the room on anything at Wynn or in Vegas. No club/restaurant info, no details on how to get tickets or when the services closed. We went down to the concierge to buy club tickets before dinner but it was closed - this information would have been useful in the room! - no replacement of toiletries in the shower, dirty glasses were not removed or cleaned. - it was my friend's birthday and we asked what upgrades/extras we could get to make her weekend extra special. The front desk suggested 'a show' but nothing more - we weren't trying to get free stuff, we wanted suggestions!! They didn't even try to sell us an upgraded room or champagne. Useless. I have stayed in two star hotels who have treated their guests better. On the plus side, the casino is plush and the Club XS pool party was wicked fun, but next time I hit Vegas I will be staying somewhere with a real five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel room features at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ladodgerone
Reviews.Content: Room was a real upgrade over the normal Las Vegas room: comfy, updated, nice features. Casino itself is okay; sometimes one has to head to the Wynn for the Sports Book, for example, or for one of the better restaurants. But all in all a nice partitioned suite; I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding once again”
Reviews.Author: D.B.1976
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our trip to Encore last June we did it again with friends this time around. It is our favorite hotel in Vegas - by far. It's not perfect but it also depends on preference. Rooms are great, the atmosphere is class and upscale. Some of the things are over the top expensive but we were there for a few days, not a week. I can handle $14 mai tais for a long weekend in return for a terrific pool scene - especially at the Euro pool. It's important to point out the best view is to the south side (the main strip) but the club music from Surrender/Encore Beach Club is audible in the rooms throughout the night on the weekend at some level. It didn't bother us one bit but it might some. Encore caters their social scene to a younger crowd but they need a restaurant or two like Lavo (at Palazzo) to match. All the restaurants just seem a little to mature (although very nice) and just a tad overpriced. In back to back years my wife and I went next door to Venetian/Palazzo for Lavo, Delmonico and Carnevino. If the rooms are reasonable, this is my default choice for a weekend with my wife and other couples. I might stay elsewhere for a guy's weekend. The location in not ideal if you want to explore a lot of the strip by foot but we managed. Palazzo/Venetian is next door, Mirage is adjacent, Caesars is not that far down.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly Exceeded expectations...”
Reviews.Author: gp7787
Reviews.Content: Came down from Reno with my girlfriend for our anniversay, her birthday, and my graduation. Wanted a upscale place that would take care of us and the Encore staff did just that. Decided that I wanted a little more exclusivity and went with the Encore Tower Suites. **If you have the money to spare there is absolutely no reason not to go with the Tower Suites. They are worth every single penny!!** Separate entrance, private check-in, private elevators, and only 6 rooms to a floor. Room: The room lay-out is great. I stayed in the Encore just because I liked the room layout better than Wynn. The mirrors make the room seem bigger and the decorations are chic. The floor-to-ceiling windows are fantastic. We were placed on the 38th floor and had a Strip view room. Having a strip view room means that this side deals with the noise at Surrender Nightclub and Encore Beach Club. At check-in our attendant made sure we were aware of the possible noise. It really isn't anything to freak out about if you are high up enough. Pool(s): The best pools in Vegas. If you are a Tower Suites guest then you have access to two private pools. There are two problems with these two private pools. There is no Tower Suites pool at Encore, only at Wynn so be prepared for a little trek. Two-Being that the Tower Suites pools are at Wynn simply means SHADE. Once the sun starts to set in the West the pools are covered by the shadow the Wynn casts. We ended up using the European pool. Best choice ever! Good music, great atmosphere, and good drinks.. Clubs: Only checked out XS and Marquee at Cosmopolitan. In my opinion XS out did Marquee. The crowd at XS felt much more sophisticated. Both are mega-clubs where much fun can be had. For a great host at XS use Ryan Perrings. Restaurants: Ate at SW Steakhouse, The Buffet @ Wynn, and Stratta. The best meal we had was at Stratta. SW seemed to be way to busy and more of business meeting spot. The buffet @ Wynn is well....A BUFFET. I was not overly impressed, although they had a wide variety of food. BOTTOM LINE: Encore Tower Suites are the place to be in my opinion. A hotel within a hotel. Stay here if you are looking for great service, selection, shopping, and things to do. And one cannot forget about the beautiful pools.

Reviews.Title: “Encore delivered on all its promises”
Reviews.Author: sjc0009
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night stay the Encore , Las Vegas. I prevously stayed at Wynn and was very pleased. I decided to try the Encore this time around for the larger suite accomodations. The suite was elegant, very comfortable and extremely clean. I havent experienced such a high level of cleanliness in a hotel such as this. Everything was extremely clean.The bathroom was very large with dual sinks and a seperate shower/bathtub.The suite had a very large TV that swivelled to allow viewing from the bed or lounge area. The hotel operators were excellent and always followed up to ensure any request had been fulfilled. the entire hotel staff were every friendly,professional and accomodating. I tried the new LakeSide restaurant and it was very good from the food and service. SW was another winner for us. Casino area is very comfortable, great dealers, good drink service too, Try the Spa, you will be amazed. I had a massage followed by steam room etc. The Esplanade has very high end retailers that filled our needs, Hermes, Wynn Jewellers etc. We will be back in September for another 5 night stay

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury”
Reviews.Author: kerwei
Reviews.Content: Encore was amazing, absolute luxury. Take my word for it, I should know because I went casino to casino from South to North of the Strip. Great atmosphere, beautiful people, not as many kids running around. Sorry no offence but we were on our honeymoon. What could be better? The view from our room was great but I doubt you will be able to get a complete view of the Strip. We got a corner-ish room on one of the top floors. It is true that everything costs money. The snack and mini bars are weight sensored but they tell you this when you check in. No free room wifi and if you plan to use the internet, it will cost you a bomb. All that said and done, you are in Vegas and nothing in Vegas comes cheap. On the plus side, great pool and the concierge is fantastic. We got tickets to XS (you don't have to stand in the long queues) and they told us how we could get on the guest list for Tao. Handy, very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Costs Galore...”
Reviews.Author: ggoldsmith
Reviews.Content: Great room package value...until the hidden costs. Arrived for a well earned three-day with my bride getaway (from the kids). We booked 9 months in advance...after we purchase Celine Dion tickets. We planned and saved and talked about our upcoming romantic adventure. We researched all the hotels because we wanted a great 'total experience package.' Bottom Line: We slept in a top hotel and the experience was cheap, unless we were to reach into our wallet. Everything at The Encore seemed to be after my hard-earned dollars. Even a drink of non-tasting water has to come from a bottle which set me back 400% over retail. I know this because my wife and I went across the street to fill her prescription and found the same exact same Fiji water. I felt like I burned my money for the hotel’s greed. Like I said, even a dime costs a quarter when you step foot inside the hotel. Even a normal cup of coffee costs $4. Cleverly, there is no coffee available in the room unless you go to the lobby or have it delivered. It is kind of like Disney, when you set foot in the park they got you...I did not want my experience to feel that way. It really is awful, but I understand it and it is in fact capitalism at its finest. That is why we learned to buy a couple bottles of water from across the street and bring them into the room. However, the hotel thought about that as well and keenly prevents the renter from using the hotel’s mini-fridge to keep the water cold. Now, I could have called housekeeping and coordinated somehow to have one delivered, and I am not sure but there probably would have been a charge for that as well. While the room was a value, everything else is just the opposite making the value non-existent, at best. My wife and I started our trip from Louisiana. We long-needed a romantic get away. We planned the trip after buying Celine tickets in August of last year...In other words, we have been looking forward to this trip for several months. Additionally, we bought Le Reve tickets upon our arrival in your lobby...When we checked in, we were convinced to purchase a room up-grade for a panoramic view of the strip from a higher floor. As we wanted our experience to be memorable, we were excited to see the night scene...only to get to our room and look out at the Circus Circus. I called down to the front desk and complain that our second-to-none view was of the back-side of the strip and that was not explained to us. It was explained that it was ‘of the strip’ and if we wanted the ‘other’ side it would cost additional. I said okay, we’ll pay the additional...”sorry sir, those rooms are full until tomorrow. Would you like a room there tomorrow?” I made the room reservations several months in advance only to get this kind of service and commitment to excellence? I wonder how many would have said lets un-pack, re-pack, un-pack, and then re-pack for a two night stay? Not worth the hassle. Very poor explanations of the room’s views. We were also told from the desk personnel that the bass from the club would have shook the windows until 4am. This was not true, we talked with clients across the hall on the same floor in the elevator. Did you know that there is a pass you can get to by-pass a buffet line? We had no idea so we waited an hour. The facilities were beautiful, and great to explore however, the price of staying was only the tip of the iceberg. Our next visit will be somewhere else where I won’t feel cheated. Because, you don’t know what you don’t know...

Reviews.Title: “classy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stephen g
Reviews.Content: stayed here for four nights in total in between exploring Utah. first stay we were upgraded to tower suites, a few extras in the room like water every day, but otherwise exactly the same as the standard suite you get. the rooms are very modern light colours and the most amazing bed you will ever sleep in. huge bathroom with twin sinks, shower and bath. great toiletries. bedroom area and sitting area separated by partial wall so quite open too. desk and sofa in sitting area. the most amazing views if you are on ahigh floor from the floor to ceiling windows. loved the electronic curtain and light unit by the bed so you could open the curtains whilst lying in bed on the morning. the hotel itself is very stylish and refined for vegas. the casino doesn't feel like the main thing, the bars and restaurants are as much a part of the hotel. best selection of malt whisky i have ever experienced in the usa. if you want a classy place to stay in vegas stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, upscale. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Coqui2011
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend a the Wynn's Encore hotel and we loved it. It is not too big and very upscale. The rooms ( we stayed at the King suite) are outstanding and the beds are one of the most comfortable we slept in. The hotel is connected to the Wynn's hotel and this is great since we also used the pool at the Wynn's since it is larger and nicer. We also ate at both the Encore and Wynn's restaurants. The Wynn's have more affordabe selections. We loved all the food at the hotel except for dinner at the Wazuzu restaurant at the Encore. The quality was good but the food preparation was mediocre. The brown rice was almost raw. All and all, great value. Next time I personally may try staying at the Wynn's since we spent more time at the Wynn's hotel ammenities than at the Encore. However, they are connected so this is not a big issue.

Reviews.Title: “Little Nice Suite”
Reviews.Author: Ruskam
Reviews.Content: Simply good hotel with good service of the helpful staff. Modern but with an American touch. I like the beautiful garden, so colorful event during winter. A big hotel with two separated building that located across a big mall. A perfect stay for family or group traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poi_159
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 days 2 nights for my cousins wedding. The trip was paid for so I am not sure what the price of the hotel room was. I stayed in a nice suite with 2 queen size beds. It was nice and cozy and very roomy. The service was great, i cant complain much there. The casino was great as well, very busy and lots of staff to help me out when I was lost. The enviroment was great, all though I cannot stand the smoking rules in the building, it was not in my control anyways. The hotel was clean and very new, also it was very large and I had a nice view of the desert facing north west. Beautiful view in the morning when the sun came up. Its a short walk towards the strip and other hotels as well. Found it easy to get around. It was a bit noisy when I was trying to sleep over night but thats because its Las Vegas, it never sleeps at night, but I still had a good night sleep because of the comfy bed. Over all my stay was alright, I wish I could have stayed longer in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for younger set.”
Reviews.Author: graveljack
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a first class establishment. That said not everything was in the first class category. Check in was slow and tedious and took about 30 minutes. Once we upgraded and were assigned our first room we noted immediately that it wouldn't work. We were on the 49th floor above the pool and apparently the Beach Club and the thumping bass from the music could be heard loudly and clearly even when we tried to drown it out with the TV. I called the desk and they immediately changed our room to the outside side and 3 floors higher. WARNING! do not locate over the pool if you want sleep, it won't happen. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and the choice of restaurants is ample. In the morning muffins and coffee are available for a stiff fee. In fact if you are looking for a bargain you won't find them here. Prices are stiff and you pay for the surroundings. Our room consisted of a sitting room and a separate bedroom area. In short it was very comfortable and nicely appointed. Wi Fi was available and worked well and is included in your $20 hotel fee. After one day it was obvious this hotel is primarily occupied by the club crowd and is the place to be seen. Around 7 PM the hotel became infested with clubbers dressed to the nines and looking to score. Around 9 PM the casino was empty and a machine or table was readily available. In summing up our experience at the Encore I can honestly say it was a very nice hotel with a wonderful staff. Be advised you are going to pay for this experience, example: a bone-in ribeye for $42, not from my wallet and believe me I'm not cheap, always tip 20%. We found that a short walk across the street to the fashion mall produced several very nice restaurants. It's refreshing to get a decent meal for a fair price. All in all a trip to the Encore is an extravagance you won't forget. It's beautiful and the staff is great. Just remember to bring a fat wallet.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieinOntario
Reviews.Content: I am a picky traveler and I just LOVED this hotel. Funky, sexy decor, all rooms are nice large suites and the bathrooms are incredible. Nice large soaker tub, shower, and private toilet area. TV, lots of room. HUGE closet for your clothes and a fun black sectional to lounge on in front of floor to ceiling windows. The last time I was in Vegas, I stayed at the Bellagio Penthouse Suite. But I LOVED this place as well. Being a Fitness Trainer, I had to check out the gym and I totally fell in love with it. LUSH, full of great equipment and beautiful. Juice bar, lounge area, spin room. I taught my husband a Spin class while there. We never did check out the pool area, as it was too cool while there. The bars are fun, went to a few with my girlfriend, every restaurant we dined at there was amazing......the casino? nah. Not in your favour if you read the odds, but it was very pretty. I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!! Excellent service and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Vivieyra
Reviews.Content: We loved the Encore it felt like we were back on honeymoon for my husband and me. The rooms are really nice, specially the sheets at the bed are amazing. Can't wait to go back. The restaurants are wonderful, the service is very very good at them. Nice and service oriented staff. The only improvement I would suggest would be the time to check in as there were only 3 lines but seemed to take longer than usual.

Reviews.Title: “Warning.... only stay here if you want to be severly pampered.....”
Reviews.Author: grayhog
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Towers at the Encore recently for a Girls Weekend Away, the weekend being to go and see Garth Brooks. The Encore is a fabulous hotel and we purchased a special "Unforgettable Garth" package that included two meals, the tickets and spa credits. The restaurants in the hotel are excellent but they are fairly pricey; same with alcoholic beverages in the bars - pricey. But this is a resort hotel and it must be expected, I suppose. The spa is luxurious and the pool areas are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “They made me a deal I couldn't refuse!”
Reviews.Author: geniph
Reviews.Content: I took advantage of one of the Wynn/Encore's special vacation offers for a 3-night stay, comps for La Reve and buffet, and $50 free slot play. Service on the telephone reservation line was excellent: they forwarded me to the concierge to make reservations for the show, dinner, etc. Service at the front desk when we arrived was oddly incongenial, but perfectly efficient (it almost seems as if they train the front desk staff to seem indifferent and unfriendly). We enjoyed the room itself immensely - the bellman was particularly helpful when he brought up our bags, pointing out where we could go nearby to pick up sundries, water, etc., and suggesting a couple of breakfast spots, and showing us landmarks from our windows. I opted for the upgrade to a panoramic room (top ten floors), and I consider that money well spent, as it's far quieter on the higher floors (the nightclubs can be quite loud, but I heard not a thump or a peep up on the 61st floor). I chose a north view, which at this time is largely of half-finished construction projects, but on the high floors, you get a decent view of downtown and the mountains. The south view, the Strip view, is much more dramatic, but I'm told those rooms do hear more nightclub noise, and since I was there over a Friday-Saturday, that was a consideration. The rooms are well-laid out, with many comforts and conveniences such as the power drape controls by the bed, a decent iPod player, easy connection to wi-fi, which makes the minor irritants just all that much more irritating. I really dislike the lack of a refrigerator and coffeemaker in the room. There IS a refrigerator, but if you touch anything in it (the honor bar items are motion-sensitive), you will generate a charge to your bill, and the cost for the items is extremely high. You cannot add your own items to the refrigerator without generating charges, due to the motion sensor. And NO coffee. Good luck getting coffee in any of the Wynn/Encore restaurants in the morning without waiting in a half-hour line. I wasn't willing to wait that long, so we went elsewhere for our coffee and breakfasts. Definitely buy some of the bath products in the Wynn home store while you're there if you like them (I loved them); they're very hard to get hold of via the Internet. The robes are lovely: I actually considered buying one, but they're over $100. The resort fee of $20/night entitles you to "free" wi-fi and use of the exercise room. It's annoying, but it's also pretty standard for most of the Vegas resorts anymore. Buy your own water - they only provide a single, small bottle for the first night, and after that, the bottled water is an absurd fee. There's a Walgreens pretty much across the street to the north, and a liquor/beverage store, so there's no reason to pay the room bar prices. The lines to pick up the show tickets never seemed to get any shorter, so I finally just bit the bullet and went and got in the line. Service was very efficient, and La Reve was worth every penny of the stay. Getting that as a comp makes it a stellar deal; it's an astonishing show, not a bad seat in the house. If you haven't seen it, definitely consider it. It's stunning. The buffet was enjoyable: I've heard people complain about a lack of variety, but I frankly don't see where they're coming from on that. I found seafood of every type, from crab legs to whole fish, to sushi. My husband enjoyed the prime rib and ham. We both experimented with the extensive Asian food and pasta selections. The one place we were a little disappointed was with the desserts: they were extensive and elaborate, but we found them TOO elaborate for our tastes. We probably should have stuck with the house-made ice cream. I used both the Encore and Wynn pools while I was there. The pool at Encore is very small and gets extremely crowded. The adult pool is better, but most of the seating is reserved for the cabana renters. It takes quite a long time to get a drink from a server if you're seated around the pool, but for the adult pool, just go up to the central bar island. Neither pool at Encore is really suitable for a serious swim; they're much too small. You can, however, use the Wynn pools, and you can make a decent swim out of it by swimming from one pool to the other via their connecting "canal" pool. Wynn had far more seating available near the pools, but that might have been because it was cooler the day I went down there. I did not use the spa or exercise equipment. Checkout was utterly painless - I reviewed my bill on the television in the room, verified the charges, and selected the express checkout, which is basically dropping an envelope in a box on your way to the taxi stand. The charges were accurate, and I would certainly consider the Encore again, with a special offer such as I took advantage of. Be aware, though, that many of the core Strip attractions are a LONG walk away. Everything is walking distance, IF you brought really comfortable walking shoes. Don't try to take the regular bus; it takes quite literally 45 minutes to get to the MGM Grand from the Encore. Take a taxi, walk over to the light rail stations, or walk; the bus is awful. Just don't try to do it in your stiletto heels. You'll be unable to walk by the second day. I do prefer the rooms at the MGM Grand Signature, where I stayed last fall. Those rooms provide a full kitchenette, more separation between sleeping and sitting areas, and have an even more sybaritic bath. However, it's an even longer walk from the Signature to the Strip than it is from the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but just average for meetings”
Reviews.Author: travelerkl
Reviews.Content: Overall hotel and room product is great. The rooms are nice and spacious with floor to ceiling windows. Bathroom amenities are high end and plentiful, they even provided hair spray. Beds are soft and linens are wonderful. Room service was very good and prompt. No issues with check-in/out, both were very quick and no lines. We went to two restaurants at the hotel, LakeSide and Stratta, both were good and had views to people watch. The downside of this hotel is having a meeting there. They charge for things that most hotels provide for free. The AV and internet vendors they use are very expensive and not easily accessible on-site. Banquet service and food is good but not great. I recommend going to this hotel for a vacation but not for a meeting.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: d_r_kranz
Reviews.Content: very good hotel at the north side of the strip. Good for relaxing and gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: chefeMark
Reviews.Content: One of the best views in town! The best in a hotel room!! What a place! Beautiful hotel with not many small kids! We left our kids at home so it was nice to be around adults!! Beautiful casino and a great choice on pools, bars, and restaurants. And the room was out of this world!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, quiet refuge in a crazy town”
Reviews.Author: 212jeff
Reviews.Content: Superb facilities, decor, the most comfortable bed ever. Service was excellent. Truly worth the price

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: JLands
Reviews.Content: They do not miss a beat at this hotel. They really get it. Stayed in the tower suites. The room was great and the service just as great. I would not stay anywhere else in las vegas.

Reviews.Title: “COOL”
Reviews.Author: bicocchinaonesta
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed Encore experience. Beautiful rooms, another "big monster" in Vegas but one of the best and newest. As you know... you can't go to Vegas to found the ospitality that you could find in a small luxury hotel where you feel at home.... about 2000 or somet 3000 rooms... but I think that the Encore is a good compromise between luxury and Vegas crowd. The pool is too small for all the guests... no other negative side.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mula1
Reviews.Content: A truly fantastic hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful in every way. This was our second stay at Encore and it just gets better.

Reviews.Title: “best there is in vegas”
Reviews.Author: vegasman99
Reviews.Content: service,room,amenities,everything was outstanding, would stay there again in a heartbeat.central location, and pleasant people. have to have a little money but it's a vacation. food was outstanding and reasonable.room service charges were out of site so do not order unless you win

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant option for Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: do1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore for the second time and found it just as good as the first. I really like the expanded guest rooms (suites), I think around 700Sq.' compared to a normal room of around 350sq'. The bath is large with separate shower and tub, water closet and TV. We like Wynn and Encore because they are not as huge as most of the casino hotels and can get around much easier. The commercial area is also spacious and they do not crowd all of the areas so you have plenty of walk space. There are numerous great restaurants and pools and a very nice spa. They have nice shopping but are also located across the street from one of the nicest malls. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seetheworldmontana
Reviews.Content: This was a gorgeous hotel. The staff was very helpful and nice. The only drawback was that where the cooling unit was on the wall there was a gap so that whenever someone spoke in the room next door we could hear every word and at 3 in the morning it wasn't pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Encore: Unforgettably forgettable”
Reviews.Author: TalkingTravel
Reviews.Content: The Encore at Wynn Las Vegas is certainly an architectural marvel. Everything from the driveway, to the building and the ornate waterfall, are meticulously designed to emit an atmosphere of class and luxury. The opulent rooms are each adorned with the finest of details and amenities, and include everything from a marvellous (albeit expensive) minibar, to complimentary dressing gowns for the duration of stay. The bedding and linen are of the finest, luxurious quality, and the entire property, in terms of cleanliness, is simply impeccable. Behind this seemingly faultless façade, however, lies many inconspicuous, underlying issues; all of which had a detrimental influence regarding the quality of my own stay. I had originally made a reservation at another hotel casino, but had decided to make the most of my first stay in Las Vegas by cancelling, and rebooking at Encore due its status amongst Las Vegas hotels. Upon making my reservation, as I do with every other, I requested a higher floor, in a quiet room with a view of The Strip. Such note was attached to my reservation, and I was informed of such. My stay in Las Vegas was the one of which I was looking forward to most of all, consequential to the reputation preceding the hotel. Such excitement was short lived; at the very least, for the time being. The line at check-in was shorter than I had anticipated, and it moved along at a steady pace. Upon approach to the check-in desk, the Guest Service Agent greeted me, somewhat impersonally. It wasn’t until I had observed the other staff members that I had noticed that this was commonplace. The member of staff assisting my check-in acknowledged my requests, but informed me that there were no rooms accommodating all of my requests. Each available room only accommodated one of these requests, and not the others, at best. I simply requested that he place me in the room he thought best, and I was allocated room E1910; the nineteenth floor. Entering the hotel room is most certainly an experience. The rooms themselves are phenomenally designed and presented upon first glance. It isn’t until very close examination that many faults, however small they may be, present themselves; particularly in the case of room E1910. The room features an adjoining door, through which the neighbour’s door is clearly audible with each and every movement. There are times when conversation can clearly be heard, even should that conversation involve no shouting, screaming or yelling. Further, the shower screen of the bathroom made a loud ‘clicking’ noise with each movement. Flaws in addition to these included, but was not limited to; a missing aesthetic display pillow; a missing breakfast room service card; an item on the minibar appearing to have been opened and resealed; an inoperable bathroom scale; a television featuring a chip in the screen, leading to an obtrusive black line spread across the entire width of the panel; and most disappointingly, I was hoping for a higher floor. These flaws may appear petty, however when involving such significant room rates, these things are made all the more disappointing. Such to my disappointment, I contacted the front desk, and the following day the front office manager, Andrew, happily had me relocate to room 6220; on the sixty-second floor (although not physically the sixty second floor, this is of the highest floors of the property, as the hotel does not feature floors 13, 40-49). This made for a considerably comfortable stay; up until the very last night. As I had what could be considered an early flight the following morning, I called to make wake up call arrangements for 6am. As it was an earlier flight, I had planned to go to sleep at approximately 11:30pm. Before I could get there, I could hear droning, reverberating sounds of the nightclub music constantly exploding up at me from approximately fifty floors below! As I had read about the noise prior to my stay, I thought I would give it time. It wasn't until 1:30am that I called the front desk and asked when the music would stop, only to be informed (following five minutes on hold. Presumably due to an influx of noise complaints) that it would be at 4:30am!! I was presented with two options. The first; have some earplugs delivered to my room.
