I decided against this, as (a) I already had my own, and (b) I had a wake up call I needed to be able to hear in order to receive it. For this reason, I declined. The second option was a room change, however this would be quite the inconvenience, considering it was almost 2am, and a room change at that hour (and for a second time - a third room - during a 5 night stay) would be almost unheard of! I declined this also, and decided that I would try to sleep through it. It may be worth noting that it was at this time that I could hear what sounded as though my neighbour was relocating, however this I am unable to confirm. It wasn't until almost 4am that I could no longer stand not being able to sleep. I will clarify: I had had absolutely no sleep during the entire night up until that point! I decided to put some earplugs in, and fell asleep at approximately 4am. As I had feared, I had missed my wake up call due to the earplugs. Luckily, a second wake up call woke me up at approximately 6:05am. This was extremely lucky!! I could have very easily had missed my flight that morning. In summation, I had what was no more than 2 hours of sleep. 2 hours sleep in a "luxurious", "classy" five star establishment! 2 hours! This is not acceptable for a five star establishment. What I did not expect was to be able to hear the music from the sixty-second floor, some fifty-odd floors above the action! This made for a very uncomfortable and dissatisfying final experience of this upscale hotel. I would also like to add that I believe the resort fee, although I was well aware of it prior to my stay, is an unnecessary, classless add-on that should be incorporated into rates, and not used as a tool to extract more funds from the guest upon check out. Check-out itself also left much to be desired. The Guest Service Agent at check-out, the only one on duty at that time, was quite impersonal, and did not bother asking about my stay. It appeared as though she simply did not wish to be there. When I asked for a hotel manager’s contact, she brought to me a business card featuring an email address. I later tried this email twice to no avail; the email address was seemingly invalid. I then attempted to call to obtain the relevant contact, and was accidentally hung up on when placed on hold. It is for the reasons that I have outlined above that I will choose not to stay at Encore in future. Not only does a guest pay for service when selecting a hotel, they are paying for the privilege to sleep. This privilege is therefore earned, and then an exclusive right. Having paid significantly more to stay in a premium hotel, this is what was expected. It is quite a shame that, what should have been a memorable and pleasant stay, was overshadowed by these flaws, however minor they may appear.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: igolfCA
Reviews.Content: Have been to Vegas many times and have stayed at most of the nice hotels. We received a special offer from Encore/Wynn, and since we had never been there, wanted to give it a try. We were not disappointed. Check-in was fast and efficient, and the room was beautiful. The fact that it was a suite gave us room to really be comfortable. There was a desk for the computer, coffee table, large sofa and flat panel swivel TV in the sitting room. The TV could be turned around to face the bed in the other room which also had the mini-bar. Internet service, fitness center, and local and long distance phone calls are included in the resort fee of $20.00. Parking is free. Bathroom is huge with all super nice amenities. We had a great view, and there was not a noise problem (as some people have complained about) when we were there. Restaurants are expensive but very good. We did eat at the buffet one night, and it was the best buffet on the Strip that I have tried. We also went to see La Reve, an excellent production. Casinos are par for the course. Very pleased overall and would go back again, especially if we get another special offer.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ahk45
Reviews.Content: This is the best room I have ever stayed in. It is larger than most New York apartments and very well laid out. If you want to stay in the lap of luxury you should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: wretchedhotelstay
Reviews.Content: My significant other and I are very busy physicians and we plan our vacations long in advance to make sure everything is just right when we finally manage to get time off together. I had booked my stay at the encore king suite with panoramic views several weeks in advance and requested an early check in. They said it shouldn't be a problem. When we got there, we wond up waiting over 4 hours for our room. It wasn't even ready at 3, which is there check in time. We spoke to the manager and he was actually rude. I've never been treated like that before or had such a hard time checking into a hotel before. I travelled 12hrs to spend 18hrs in vegas. I spent 4 of those hours in the Encore lobby waiting dor my room. Even worse, they charged my card for $450/ni, along with an incidental fee of $150, immediately upon my arival...before i could even get a room key.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible 5 Days @ Steve Wynn's Encore Hotel for Memorial Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: BillRaye
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were very happy to get away for the holiday and decided to try Vegas and wanted to stay at an elegant 5 star hotel so we decided to try Steve Wynn's Encore Hotel and what a mistake we made. We get out of the cab and a rude front person yells at as to stay on the curb as we are walking into the hotel...we walk into the crowded lobby which looks like the extras from A Jersey Shore episode...There was an Ambulance pulling up and a kid with a blood soaked face and police officer screaming what other drugs have you taken...I was mortified. Then we get to the check in and are told we should pick the inferior room as the rooms with the views are way to loud due to the techno/club scene located at the hotel.!!! I was so upset... I was going to pick the Four Seasons but decided to try Steve Wynn's hotel what a mistake I made!!! We immediately left the hotel as we were so upset and walked to the Fashion mall across the street to talk about what just happend and have some lunch...We both shared our deep disappointment about the hotel property...our hotel concierge voiced to us how awful the crowd was at the hotel...coming back to the hotel from lunch we then passed a patron throwing up in hallway on our way back to our room...We were horrified.. We went to Beatles LOVE which was amazing then came back to a hotel filled of YOUNG LOUD SWEARING 20 something's flooding all over the lobby areas and they were so rude to all. The doorman were charging Men $100+ to get into clubs on property which was so obnoxious and trashy. We went to bed and I woke up and Emailed the Hotel Managers/Concierge telling them how upset I was and that I wanted a refund..NO one returned my Email...I was SO SO upset and the 2nd day was totally ruined...again same loud crowd/smoking/swearing/drunk in hallways...Not a 5 star holiday weekend...A staff member said to us well it is Memorial Day weekend as this should be acceptable behavior at a 5 star hotel...We were sick and said to ourselves hat an awful response. On day 3 I spoke with one front desk manager (who I had to call 3x) as no other manager retunred my calls or emails...who apologized and sent up 1 $10 dollar of wine and 3 small wedges of cheese as an apology...Our trip was ruined and she thought this would make it better. Again NO ONE asked us what could tehy do to make our trip better.. Our actual hotel room was nice (a little small) but since LOUD club thumping noise we had to be in a room with an inferior view overlooking at one side a construction site where a building sat abandoned due to Las Vegas poor economy. We still heard the loud noise and smoke seemed to creep into our room even though it was a NON SMOKING room. $20.00 for Internet Service per day $16.00 for Coffee for room service $100.00 to get into a hotel nightclub PER MALE PERSON!!! $500.00 to rent a pool cabana PER DAY... Most of the nice/good seating areas at pools sat empty with a reserved sign on them for most of our visit. Music was too loud at Euro pool at times and same songs kept rotating. Prepackaged lunch menus at Euro Pool hardly 5 star (nothing made to order) and a very limited lunch menu. ***At Euro Pool bar it took an hour for a server to wait on us as=after a waitress gave us a menu...I had to call front desk manager to get the pool manager to get some service..again hardly 5 star. (The pool was half empty) ****At Eastside Bar off the Casino my partner and I sat down to order a drink the bartender left the bar didn't acknowledge us and never came back..we finally left after 10 minutes Encore Lobby's reeked of smoke VERY Rude doorman screaming at people in front of hotel at guests ***Sinatra Restaurant , Society Cafe and Le Reve***** were the bright spots Encore hotel has running that was excellent....visit the hotel for these three attractions all other areas were awful.( In all fairness we didn't try other restaurants so they could be good) We did the Wynn VIP Dinner Buffet which was nice but a little expensive @ $128.00 for 2. The Hotel management Never responded to my Email.. No level of personal service We were just another Credit Card to these people. No Sense of personal service at all. We went to Wynn's Encore to be WOWED and left VERY disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Our absolute FAVORITE hotel in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: kimschule
Reviews.Content: Encore is our favorite hotel to stay at when we go to Vegas. Once you stay there, they keep you on a mailing list, and they send some great deals for future stays. Check-in just depends on the time you get in, but we never have had any issues. They immediately match your credit card to their "red card" which is very convenient and eliminates the need to carry a room key and credit card. It is such a BEAUTIFUL and classy hotel. We usually venture out of the hotel to do the standard Vegas activities, but it's a very nice hotel to retreat to once we want to get out of the druken and belligerent crowds. The restaurants at Encore are FANTASTIC! The best part is that the Wynn is literally a hallway away, which provides for even more culinary treats. The two are so close that I often forget which hotel I am in. The rooms are so wonderful. Always so clean, and the maid service to awesome. On one trip where I brought my daughter, they took her doll and blanket and tucked it in like it was taking a nap. So cute!! They offer so many great quality toiletries (q-tips, sewing kits, Aveda products, ect.). The television can turn and face the living room area or the bedroom area, which allows you to watch tv, comfortably, no matter where you are (but who watches tv when in Vegas???). They also program your name on the television, so that you see "Hello, Mrs. Thompson" every time you turn on on the tv. In addition, they offer television check-outs, which is AWESOME and so convenient. The beds are SO comfortable and the curtains can be controlled from your bed! The closet is a girl's dream (for hotel standards) and the bathroom has a tv in it. Views are usually really good and the windows are floor to ceiling. If you are looking to party at one of the clubs, DO NOT expect to get preferred treatment just because you are a hotel guest. That is one complaint that I do have. The rooms are not the most affordable, and you would think that they would accomodate hotel guests a little better. Regardless, The Encore Beach Club/Surrender is a must-see if you are looking to party and pay a lot to do it. The pools are nothing special, but there is an "adult only" side which is nice. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel. The only reason that I would not recommend staying here is because it might spoil you for all other hotels! It definitely has done that to us!

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy!”
Reviews.Author: jvd79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing but class. I really enjoyed my stay and defiantly recommend it. One of the things I loved was how they turned down the volume of the noise & rings on the slots machines and play music through out the casino. As a result it felt more like a cool lounge instead of a carnival; which gave it a much better vibe!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - more training of service personnel is needed.”
Reviews.Author: ricardominer
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for a non-smoking room with two beds. Got one with a King. Asked again - got a very strong tobacco room. Complained again - got a handicapped king. Complained again and finally got what we wanted. If we hadn't been laughing so much we would have shot the receptionist. However, we have stayed many times before and had everything done right. Going back in june with our fingers crossed.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: pcalhoun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time at the Encore hotel. It has displaced THEHotel as my new favorite. The service is fantastic, the conditions of the hotel are great. We really enjoyed the dualing piano bar in the casino. Great place to finish the evening. Their fitness center was awesome. The pool.... not so much. Very cramped and extremely noisy. Only a couple of downsides: - Away from the core of the strip (although the strip is expanding yet again) - The Wynn seem to want to control the whole experience, including who you get coffee from. If you want Starbucks, or rather get a coffee for less than $7, you'll need to walk to the Fashion Mall across the street (not too far) - We were there during the long weekend, as were all of the college students in the US (apparently). I had to call security twice to stop a party in the neighboring room at 7AM. I'm sure they were busy, but it was a pain. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “What Can I say it was Great”
Reviews.Author: catfishncwc
Reviews.Content: 1st time staying at a Wynn Property. I have gambled and eaten at Encore/Wynn many times but finally got a comped offer and had to take advantage of it. 1st off everyone at the hotel is polite and happy to help. From the Bell Hop to Valet to the girl who check me in, they were all great. The room was great perhaps the best room I have stayed at in Vegas including Bellagio. My wife loved the bathroom. Bed was very comfortable. Dealers at the tables were all friendly and even the Pit Bosses were very social. We ate at the Wynn Buffet the 1st night which is the best buffet on the strip hands down. Botero was great and Stratta was very good also. Also got a slice of pizza at pizza place not bad but not worth $5 a slice. We have another comp offer that we can not wait to take advantage of this summer. I think we found our new Favorite Hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a good rate give it a try!”
Reviews.Author: jbmWyoming
Reviews.Content: PROS -- Beautiful large room (we just had the standard Resort Suite King) with all the amenities you would want - comfortable beds with nice linens, remote bedside controls for lights, curtains, etc. Huge bathrooms with tv, large tub, stall shower and separate private toilets Extremely clean Casino beautifully decorated with fun decor and colors (more exciting than Bellagio but still tasteful) -- your senses won't be on overload Great restaurant choices and food quality Easy to reserve restaurants in advance through 800 phone line Location to other hotels and Fashion Show Mall For a fee concierge will give you line pass for Tryst & XS CONS Very few employees we came into contact with anywhere (restaurants, front desk, valet) were friendly, bordered on snotty Expensive restaurants Clubs were wall to wall can't move crowded Overall this is a very comfortable upscale hotel; easy to get around, great but expensive restaurant choices, and very nice casino. Since there are no many nice hotels in Vegas I wouldn't pay rack rate or really above $300 but if available at a good rate would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The Best In Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: WhiteGatesNewYork
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic experience the Encore is. Lavish design, every last detail perfectly thought out. Highlights include: - The best Vegas hotel room I've ever had. Flawlessly designed and furnished. I simply can't find a fault. - The resort itself is terrific with interesting restaurants and bars throughout. -The many pools and hot tubs provide the perfect party atmosphere without being too crazy or crowded. -The nightclub XS is terrific - we saw Deadmau5 perform there on our stay. It was a little too crowded but still a good night. -The staff are very well trained and both check in and check out were fast. My new favorite Vegas resort! The only negative is that it's often expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Cgy89
Reviews.Content: Lots of places to eat and in a great location. Major downside is that you can hear the bass from the nightclub, even on the 59th floor! Wonderful views, service and pools.

Reviews.Title: “Another amazing stay at Encore”
Reviews.Author: cassley
Reviews.Content: This is probably at least the 10th time we have stayed at Encore, but my first review. We have stayed at Wynn before but prefer Encore as it is a bit quieter. We checked in on a Wed. afternoon around 5pm with no wait. We were asked if we wanted a panoramic view room for an additional $20 but declined. We were assigned room 3309 which was a North facing room, away from the nightclub noise. We have asked for and received a North facing room on each stay and have never once had a noise issue. The rooms to the right of the elevators have a much shorter hallway and you get much less foot traffic so we always request that side. Comfy beds and linens as usual. Had a few nice breakfasts at Society Cafe and a nice dinner at Red 8. I have read some other reviews talking about paying for wi-fi. This is included in the $20 resort fee as is access to the gym. Someone also mentioned that they didn't receive the service of a five star resort. Only the Tower suites is rated five star, not the resort side of the hotel. As far as value, I feel like there aren't a lot of cities you can get a room for under $200 that provides what Encore does. We'll be back next month...

Reviews.Title: “Better than we could have imagined!”
Reviews.Author: MattCSenior
Reviews.Content: We spent the most enjoyable 4 days at the Encore and it truly made our holiday to the States. Upon arrival we were given an upgrade to the 59th floor with a view of the strip and just about everything else in Vegas. Being just on the end of the major hotels on the strip, gave you the impression of a bit of a space but still being in touching distance of the action. The room was first class, along with the customer service and the food. Dinner at Sinatra's was a particular highlight, best to book in advance as it gets very busy, the food was outstanding. Wazuzu was also excellent and very popular but didn't take bookings. The pools were busy but they were well maintained as you were not allowed to reserve the loungers whilst you left the pool area, such was the demand. The only downside being the music round the pool could be rather loud, if you wanted to read or listen to your own music. The same could be said of the nightclub music, which went well into the night even though we were on the 59th floor! A top class hotel, excellent facilities and full of Vegas Style!

Reviews.Title: “Tries but Fails to be 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: WhyWasteTimeWorking
Reviews.Content: Encore definitely makes me think Wynn should have closed the show with the first performance. The staff definitely tries to make it a first class experience. They definitely cater to an upper class of business traveler, but it just doesn't make the grade. There were multiple faux pas while we were there. From rude security guards to improper charges for minibar items we didn't take, to being shuffled from one room to another in the early morning after our room becoming 'unusable'. Our first room on the 38th floor was nice and quiet, but after we were stuck on the 23rd floor, we heard the booming beat of the nightclub until the wee hours. Our 2nd room's lock was broken, there was no amenity kit (shampoo, soap.etc) and there were missing rugs. If we were in a best western, we would have been happy, but for Steve Wynn, we were sadly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, overpriced, loud.”
Reviews.Author: Rskogl2
Reviews.Content: We come to Vegas about once a month and usually stay at the Bellagio, Aria, or Trump. This time we decided to try some place new....big mistake. The check in lady was rude, the valets were rude, if you're used to 5 star service I suggest you stay at the Trump or Aria. We had a room on the 38th floor facing the strip, nice view, decent room, but the noise from the XS club was unbearable. So, at around 3 am we decided to call the front desk to ask what was going on and when it would end. So, she says it ends at 4 30 am!?!? I am like ok...well how am I supposed to sleep with this going on all night? She says, "Would you like some earplugs?". I just about lost it, earplugs, you are gonna give me earplugs when I'm paying over $300 a night?? So, long story short they transferred our room to the one across the hall and now we face the ugly side of the strip. Also, if you think the Encore would appeal to a more mature group such as the Bellagio crowd, you are sorely mistaken. The best way to describe the people staying here would be "Jersey Shore". Anyways, with all of the awesome hotels that have recently opened in Vegas I will never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great experience-luxious”
Reviews.Author: nina2727
Reviews.Content: Encore is not a mega huge vegas hotel which is great in my opinion. Really beautiful rooms and very comfy bed. We had the panoramic room which wasn't huge but very nice. The pool is great too. No complaints at this hotel, only praises.

Reviews.Title: “The Encore is completely overrated”
Reviews.Author: Kameron101
Reviews.Content: I was expecting 1st Class accomodations, service and food! I was looking forward to the experience of the Encore. I was completely wrong. From the minute we checked in, there was a line to check in, the customer service representative was rude and not helpful. When we got to our room our view was the parking lot - not the American Express Platinum Card upgrade we were promised. Next we went to the cafe for breakfast. We were seated at a table, our order taken and then waited and waited for our food to arrive. When the food did arrive it was ice cold. I sent the food back and 15 minutes later my food came. The bill for two entrees, two coffees and one orange juice was $70. No value in my opinion. We then attended our conference for the day and returned to the hotel for dinner. We were told Bartolotta's was amazing and booked a reservation there. When we arrived the hostess said it would be a little bit, but to take a seat at the bar. A half an hour later, we asked her what was going on. We were then seated at a table located next to a busing station. We said we would wait for a better table. The general manager came out and seated us at a table in the main dining room. To make a long story short, the food was terrible, no flavor and extremely overpriced. We then went to their nightclub and were disappointed with the $17 cosmo and smelly carpet. All in all - we were terribly disappointed with our trip to Vegas. This city has turned into medicore service, food and accomodations and yet charging a premium. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous experience, but needs a little tweaking”
Reviews.Author: norm5Seattle
Reviews.Content: Liked this hotel a lot. Steve Wynn spent millions of dollars on decorating this place and it really shows. The restaurants at the hotel that we have tried were all extremely good. Particularly enjoyed the food and ambience at the Sinatra Restaurant. Check in went fairly smoothly and our initial request for a rollaway was met immediately. Also loved the pools and the services at the pools. With all of this good stuff going on at the Encore there is still room for improvement. First and foremost there was no turndown service at night and no goodies left on the beds such as guests would normally see at a five star place. Thus, there was always a need for more towels. This was important if you are using the pool and/or are out in the Las Vegas heat. Also there was no opportunity for a late checkout - even for one hour. Don't even get close to the minibar or you will be charged for something. As for the overall facility, it is quite beautiful but the casino like all others in Vegas contains a lot of smoke. Don't know if the Encore can do anything about this, but some of the other high end hotels have their shopping malls on a higher floor or in a completely separate area so that there isn't too much smoke. Another pet peeve is the resort fee. A high end hotel should not be charging this unless the guest gets something substantial in return such as a free gym. Not the case here. In addition, the spa is overpriced. So, in summary, a marvelous experience that could be improved upon. We probably will return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: disneydad331
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great place to stay in Las Vegas, this is it. While lots of people are looking for that $59 a night room, this is not it. The rate was about $169 / night, but you get what you pay for. The rooms are contemporary, very clean, and super comfortable beds. There is a large flat screen TV that swivels between the bedroom area and the living room area of the suite. The view (if on the vegas strip side) is one of the best in town. The restaurants are good, a little pricey, but there are some less expensive options such as the buffet in the neighboring Wynn Resort. The casino is very clean and nice, as are all the receptionists, bartenders, and servers. One down side? I'm not a fan of the $50 resort fee. It does get you into the gym and other such things, but as a business traveler, that's all I get out of it. Overall a great spot that I will continue to return to!

Reviews.Title: “Was this the Boom Boom Room, or what!”
Reviews.Author: LITraveler811
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for this hotel, and was very disappointed. My husband had a conference at the hotel, so knowing it's reputation, I was looking forward to it. We spent a week at the hotel, which I know is a long time for Vegas, but between the few days we tacked on at the end, and his board meeting, we needed the time. The worst part was the extremely loud music, and the disco sound that lasted until the middle of the night. We were in the Tower Suites, on the 39th floor, which is only 1 floor below the 50th. There are no floors numbered 40-49 because apparently this is bad luck in Chinese. That section of rooms is above both the disco that they have at the Beach Club, and Surrender, one of their other discos. The suite itself is nice enough, but who designed this place didn't seem to know what they were doing. The "suite" is a very large room with 2 sections, with a rotating flat screen TV on the divider. The biggest problem is that the airconditioning is not sufficient to cool the bedroom area. If one person want to wake up earlier, or stay up later, than the other, there is no way to not hear the TV while in the bed. Also, their is neither an air conditioning vent or an exhaust in the bathroom. Thankfully it was not a very hot week, but still . . . . The Encore and Wynn are connected by an esplanade, so that allows convenient access to restaurants at both. Although one of the bars at the Encore serves coffee in the morning, other than a major sit-down breakfast, you have to go to the Wynn for a "starbucks" type of place. Other hotels have a variety of counter/cafe type locations for either breakfast or a snack during the day. That is lacking here. There noise level from the music is everywhere. It seems that what the Encore is looking to attract is the 20 somethings who frequent their discos. There is also a disco/nightclub called Xs that provides quite a show for those who are not used to seeing the type of people who go to these kind of things. My kids are this age, and now I know why my son loved spring break in Vegas last year. I had also hear raves about the spa. One day I decided to take a look at it to see whether it was worth the exorbitant cost of services. I found it very uninviting, and decided against it. On the plus side, the Encore is right across the street from the Fashion Mall, which has great shopping. I am a New Yorker, but don't have the time to shop, so this was a great.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but can't deal with anything complicated”
Reviews.Author: LAMitchell
Reviews.Content: we got married in Las Vegas in April and stayed at the Encore. The hotel is beautiful and the facilities are amazing, but they cannot deal with anything complicated. I tried to book a meal for our wedding day and went through the process of being told to email, then being told they couldn't deal with the request and to call a specific department; called them to be told wrong department and to call back during the week; called again and was told again wrong department and was transferred but no-one on the other end, etc etc until I got extremely irate at the girl at the other end and told her if she didn't deal with it then I was cancelling my reservation at the hotel and telling my guests to do the same. When I wrote and complained the general manager was very good and got someone to sort it all out, but in a 5* hotel this just should not happen. Everything else went well until we checked out and I said I wanted to charge my room charges to a different credit card (not an unreasonable request I thought), to be told that they had already charged my card and couldn't do anything as it was the weekend (again ridiculous). I ended up having a 10 minute argument with the manager, who ended up doing exactly what I asked for - so why the problem in the first place?! Location is great just opposite the Fashion Show Mall, the rooms are very clean and the maids do not disturb you at all if you put on the do not disturb sign. You have to pay a resort fee of c $20 p/n. I thought it was a bit of a rip off considering the price of the hotel rooms to start with. I would definitely recommend this hotel, however, they definitely lack the proper service you get in most 5* hotels in Europe of a similar cost when it comes to anything reomotely out of the ordinary. One major tip, is don't let them fool you into getting a different room. All the room types are exactly the same - a panoramic suite only has a mirror on one wall to make it look bigger. You also pay for a higher up room with a better view, worth it if you want to pay for a view, but all rooms have a good view.

Reviews.Title: “59th Floor but Bass noise till 4.00am”
Reviews.Author: blondesallbabe
Reviews.Content: We originally booked on expedia then emailed the hotel to request the cost of a different room and how to book a cabana. Two days to respond then told we had to call them to get a price and no answer to the cabana question. When we checked in the area was busy but only a ten minute wait. Having seen a few reports on club noise we requested a quiet room. They upgraded us to a panoramic room which I think is a room on a higher floor, in our case the 59th south side facing the strip and pools. It's a pity some of the hotels drop the resort fee on you, the Encore was$20/night plus a couple $ tax. This does include internet so we were able to connect a laptop plus three iphones in the room. The couple checking in before us were annoyed that they had to pay the resort fee but didn't have a laptop and so would still have to pay the business centre fee on top of the resort fee. The hidden resort fee is sneaky enough but then to have to pay more to use resort facilities is taking the p-ss. The suite (2 queen resort) was beautiful and finished to a very high standard, with some nice touches,e.g auto close/open drapes, soft on/off lights with a control console by the bed. Beds were very comfortable, good pillows ( and I am picky when it comes to pillows) the air con was very quiet, I was able to leave it on all night and have never been able to do this before. Everything was almost perfect until the encore beach club music started up, even on the 59th floor on the east side of the hotel is was still very disturbing thankfully they did stop at dusk. Then at 11pm the XS club started up and for the next 5 hours , OMG WAY too loud which completely spoiled the stay, we had to get drunk so we could drop off to sleep. I've stayed at a bunch of the cheaper hotels on the strip but never had this problem before. Pool area is pleasant but not enough beds for the size of the hotel and they are butt next door to each other and tied up so you cannot move them, not 5 star. Overall great property ruined by the noise.

Reviews.Title: “The King Suites Are Awesome"”
Reviews.Author: sceneisle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wynn Encore on a "Wynn Getaway Package" that was offered via mailed invite. The package included 3 nights; complimentary upgrade to a Deluxe Resort King Suite, 2 complimentary in house show tickets to "Le Reve" and one complimentary meal for two at "The Buffet" for each day of our stay (6 meals). We accepted an additional upgrade to a suite on the top (63rd) floor for an additional $20.00 per night. The hotel also charged an additional, mandatory resort fee of $20.00 which covered fitness center admission, wireless internet connection and all local and U.S. long distance calls. The spacious (700+ s.f.) suite was awesome. It included a large sitting area, a separate sleeping area and a large bathroom with separate glass enclosed shower, large bathtub, dual sinks and in-wall television. A 42" flat screen television sits on a shelf in an opening of the wall that separates the sitting and sleeping areas. The television swivels so it can be viewed from either area. The suite is equipped with one-touch climate control and the ceiling to floor windows allowed for excellent views. The buffet was over-rated. The crab legs were good but the prime rib was barely average. Lots of food to choose from with many cooking stations but in my opinion, not worth the regular dinner price of $38.00. We were so disappointed with dinner, we used our remaining comp'ed buffets at breakfast. Despite the negative buffet experience, the terrific accomadations coupled with the price of the package ($500.00 including resort fee) left no doubt that we would accept another invitation if offered.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 on the freeway is quieter”
Reviews.Author: 1BlueSkyTraveler1
Reviews.Content: What a joke! It is 12:30 a.m. midweek - windy and cold in Las Vegas and the outside nightclub is thumping "techo-music" non-stop (ever pull up next to a thumping car...it is as loud!)...called and asked for the hotel manager. "Kristin" said she could do "nothing, other than reach out to the nightclub...." She said it would continue until 4:00 a.m. -- she can...but has totally failed the customer... Steve Wynn -- you have a fancy infomercial when the TV in the room is turned on...your room looks nice...but it would be quieter to be sleeping under the freeway in L.A....and I am on the 20th floor of your "outstanding hotel"! What a joke!!! You talk on the TV about your "relationship" with the Dalai Lama - try having one with your paying customers...very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sherna123
Reviews.Content: I have to say when we walked in the hotel, it took a while to take it all in. The hotel is absolutely beautiful! The rooms are large and really comfortable, we had a very good experience with all staff, they were all very nice and helpful. While visiting we went in the other hotels, and none of them compared to Encore. From the hotel guests (young crowd), to the decor, and how sophisticated it was! I would never stay at another hotel in Vegas, i also preferred the Encore to the Wynn, i just felt a better vibe on the Encore side of the hotel. Really close to the Fashion Mall, and we walked the whole strip and took us about 1 hour. Overall i loved every minute at the Encore!

Reviews.Title: “Not ready for Prime Time”
Reviews.Author: twoweeled
Reviews.Content: We show up at about 5:30 pm and told the reserved room is not ready. Maybe about an hour. I'm tired, it's well after check in time. I raise a stink. After the normal script of "I apologize" and my conveying my disatisfaction, they find a room available!! Starbucks Coffee? Not in this Hotel. All they have is Wynn Coffee (about $4.00 for normal coffee 14-16 oz). The signage that leads you around the hotel, is sometimes right, and sometimes not. We found ourselves going around in circles, following the signs. Take a compass!! Expecting the usuall express checkout on the TV, we check our bill. There are charges that are not ours. we call the front desk and are told we have to fill out a form at the front desk. The charges were made at 1:00 on our check in day. We didn't even check in till 5:30. We didn't even have a room yet (to charge to the room). Back to the script again (I apologize sir). Maam, it's common sense that the charges are not ours, can't you just fix it without us. I'm sorry sir, but you'll have to come and wait in line and fill out the form. Yes, there are lines to check in and out. I see signs of too many cutbacks. Room is very nice, show was very good. For around $200 a night, this hotel is not worth the money. The bugs not worked out yet. Even calling the front desk is cordial at best! For this money, I'd take Ceaser's or the Venetion. Not ready from prime time. Oh yeah, the black jack games at the bar do not comp drinks, Period! Doesn't matter how much you play. gym? yes, but if you want to shower, that's extra! not kidding. funky mattress?? Your sorta of at the end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Think of resprt not a 5* Hotel and you wont be disappointedh”
Reviews.Author: tarky1968
Reviews.Content: I actually booked our rooms online followed by a call to ensure we would get our simple requests months earlier however upon arriving at the extremely crowded check in/reception area of the Encore I was disappointed to find out that none of what I requested was provided (king bed, strip view, non adjoining room) add to this an unsympathetic and somewhat arrogant receptionist that will give you an idea of my first impression of the Encore. The actuall Wynn/Encore facility is vast, well maintained, mid to lower high end and impressive however not without its flaws which include but not limited to - exceptional waiting times for service inc. breakfast that takes 45 minutes (not surprising I guess in a facility with that many rooms). You need to add time to everything you would be accustomed to from a 5* star hotel from check in to check out and everything in between - the restaurants are generally booked in advanced with no real 'fast track' for hotel guests - both pools are totally insufficient for the number of guests, there were more guests looking for seats at 11am than there were guests seated in the pool area - if you are an early morning gym'er like I am the gym at the encore is small and hardly built to match the potential number of guests Dont get me wrong the Wynn/Encore facility is great but you would be better off expecting that mid to high end 'first come/first serve' resort experience rather than the 5* hotel experience. If the latter is what you looking for look at the Cosmopolitan and/or Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing amazing amazing”
Reviews.Author: SJ118
Reviews.Content: We stayed at both the Wynn and Encore on this trip. Both hotels were suoerlative but the Encore adds just a little more refinement to the Wynn experience ( eg rather than waiting under a canopy for the car to be returned by the valet in the Wynn, you wait under cover in the Encore). The Encore is a vision of elegance in red. Without fail , the staff were friendly,professional and helpful. The room was spotless and the bed was fantastic. We loved the lobby bar cocktails ( the best mojito I have EVER tasted). The casino was not at all smoky and the Society cafe meal we had was excellent. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Would have been a 5 if not for the pool area”
Reviews.Author: ohiorona
Reviews.Content: First trip to the Encore and everything was fabulous, but the pool areas of both the Wynn and Encore were disappointing. We went over Easter weekend, and the chairs at both locations actually touch each other they are so packed in. You aren't allowed to even try to reposition the chairs or tables or you will be scolded by the employees immediately. We along with other guests felt this was a little oer the top. I guess you can say they run a tight ship, unfortunately, that's how I felt, like I was sitting on a crowded cruise ship. I have never had guests spoken to in such a way, and I mean the guy next to us found a chair table near him not in use to use and was told that they would tell management if he didn't move it back!! For the money everyone was dropping for $5 cokes and $15 a pop drinks, this is not good customer relations. The place is so crowded because they offer the loungy seating areas at $500 a pop, and the cabanas for $350 of course there is plenty of room in those areas. Only in Vegas........

Reviews.Title: “Encore really gets it-- the most polite, upbeat & helpful staff hands down”
Reviews.Author: MAKitty
Reviews.Content: Encore really gets it-- the most polite, upbeat & helpful staff hands down. Off hour requests, mundane needs, even in frenetic beautiful people-land the Encore staff always rocks.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Vegasmike77
Reviews.Content: We met some friends at the Encore. This was our first stay here. Have been at Bellagio, Venetian & Mandarin Oriental. Encore has so much to offer. Top of the line restaurants, clubs, pools, casino, spa and golf. You never have to leave if you don't want too. Would need to get a cab to go out. The service that was provided by the staff was outstanding. They treat you very well. The Tower Suites are fantastic. We had a great view from the 57th floor. Only wish we had more than 4 days to enjoy everything. We will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Encore is Amazing , don't miss the SPA”
Reviews.Author: kevinfor
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the new Encore hotel.. having stayed at the Wynn on previous trips.. after an unpleasant experience at the Venetian property several years ago. We stayed for three nights.. first let's just get this off the table... YES The Hotel is Expensive.. unlike other properties in Vegas I could nott find any discount or special deals. at this property... so we stayed in a standard Room was amazing. Checkin was fast, *ALL* The hotel /casino staff .. I came across (even non customer service people) like IT Staff, security etc. were polite and eager to help out... The rooms are amazing.. Beds very comfortable... this hotel is miles above in service compared to many of the other resorts like MGM, Casear's etc. You Must see the SPA.. The SPA at Encore is vasty superior in both customer service, features etc to that at the Wynn hotel.. but the treatments are expensive around $220 for 60min service etc. The only downside I can see with the property is that it's located at the other end of the strip.. (next to Fashion mall shops) away from MGM, Ceasar's palace etc. and it's quite a walk (advise getting a monorail 3day pass) This might be good for some people to get away from the "average joe" class in vegas ...also I was shocked Unlike most other cities.. TAXI cabs don't take credit cards by default... ask first.. Would I stay at this property again? I like to explore differn't hotels... but EVERY future trip.. to Las Vegas.. I will include at least one night at this property

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but the itchy beds!! :-s”
Reviews.Author: Kar230781
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week from end of april to beginning of may with my partner, The guy who checked us in was great, gave us an upgrade as i have mentioned to him that i wanted a room on higher floor due to reviews on the club noise. Room: standard panaromic view room. everything was good, except the itchy bed. made me and my partner with very itchy skin each time we slept. defo was the bed because we was ok when we wasnt in it. it was so bad that i end up sleeping on the sofa they had. the bathroom was very nice, i loved the layout of everything, the only problem was the bed. Location: oh my, it is at the end of the strip, far walk to main the part. the walk is very tiring, best advice was taken from a british lad who also posted on tripadvisor to use the bus that takes you up and down the strip. there are two buses you can take, DEUCE which is a doule decker one that stops at every hotel and then the RTC i think, the joined single deck one also goes on the strip but fewer stops.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: mlgtexas
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Las Vegas many times, mostly for business, but a few for leisure. I have stayed at most of the high end hotels, Wynn, Bellagio, Aria, etc., but I have to say Encore is our new favorite. My favorite thing is the smaller casino, which gives it a more intimate feel, if that is even possible in Vegas:-) and the casino has a lot of natural light.. no closed in feeling at all....I love the atmosphere!! If you want to larger casino experience, just walk down the hall to the Wynn. Also, the hotel itself is just beautiful. The casino with its red chandeliers and the spa is one of the prettiest, most relaxing I have ever seen. We did not use the spa this time, but the fitness center is right off the spa waiting area and we loved to just sit and relax after our workouts. Our entire trip was just so relaxed and fun at the same time!! Rooms, staff, service, fitness facility, food....all very, very good. We will be back!!! Only complaint...being able to hear the music from the pool/club on the 55th floor, but if you turn on the fan on the AC system, it pretty much drowns it out...not sure about lower floors.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Strip! Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: missiv
Reviews.Content: Loved loved loved the Encore. We stayed at the Wynn 18 months before and loved it so stayed at the Encore this time and loved ot even more! Great pool, great restaraunts, beautiful spacious rooms, amazing bathroom. I cant say anything but fabulous things about the Encore. Wish I was there now!

Reviews.Title: “Incomparable”
Reviews.Author: bert48331
Reviews.Content: My wife has been reluctant to visit Las Vegas because she is not a gambler and was concerned that the city's anything goes reputation would be a turn off. The Encore has converted her to a Vegas afficionado. The property is fabulous. Hats off to Mr. Wynn for having the vision and guts to create this triumph. The staff was appropriate and helpful, without exception, and the facilities; simply spectacular. Be warned: beyond the reasonable room rates (a bit higher than the other 5 star options, but worth it), room service, restaurants, and spa were on the high side of the price spectrum, but the Encore offers accomodations and service which are a cut above the competion.

Reviews.Title: “Not an Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior0411
Reviews.Content: The Encore was supposed to be an 'Upgrade' over a room at the Wynn. While the room was very nicely decorated and clean, the towels were flimsy. Not what you would expect from a high end hotel. They do not have in-room coffee, fridge, DVD, or self-serve luggage cart. Smoke was not only in the casinos, but drifts into the restaurants, and into our 24th floor room ventilation system. Even 24 floors about the poolbar the music was loud until 3:00 or 4:00am.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but a little cheap for the cost”
Reviews.Author: lost_traveller2008
Reviews.Content: As previous guest have mentioned the rooms were very up to date and spacious. We had an issue with our first room, we were over the club and could here the bass coming through the floor. Needless to say we asked if we could move, the front desk said no problem but it couldn't be done until 3:00 - 6:00pm. No problem as we were going shopping, came back at 2:00 and they said we could move, we were placed on the 63rd floor. Our view had changed from overlooking the pool to now looking downtown. Oh well...when we went down to play the slots we found that for the three days we were there not once were we offered a drink, could find any hostesses also when you go and play the poker machines at the lounges they charge you for your drinks, unlike at the Palazzo where they " comp" you for as long as you play. So if you would like to drink on the house when you gamble, this place would not be for you. I would stay here again but I would gamble at either the Palazzo or Venetian where they don't seem to be so cheap with there drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Encore, certainly is !!!!”
Reviews.Author: GFOSTFOS
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband and 2 friends stayed at the Encore in March 2011 for a 5 night stay. My husband and I have been to Vegas numerous times before and have stayed in many of the 5* properties all of which were fantastic, however not a patch on the fabulous Encore. Our suite was out of this world, lovely big bathroom with walk in shower, bathtub, his and her vanity sinks and a TV. The bedroom was tastefully decorated with shades of cream, gold and black and the furniture all tied in with the colour scheme. There was also a living room area with a corner suite and the TV that was in the archway between the bedroom and living area spun round so you could either watch in bed or from the sofa. All of the lights, curtains etc were controlled by remote from the bedside, however our curtains did not draw from the console and we had to do manually (no real hardship there) Be very careful of the mini bar and the goodies in the tray on top of the dresser, they are all controlled by weight and as soon as you remove an item, bang your changed whether you have opened it or not... We did manage to use one of the pools whilst we were there, and there was plenty of comfortable sunbeds and lovely bright, fluffy yellow towels for our use. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, it has a great variety of restaurants with something for everyone to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, loved it”
Reviews.Author: girllovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, rooms are very spacious and modern almost made me feel like a high roller. I liked the pool at the Wynn next door better than the Encore but both are beautiful, guests can use Wynn and Encore pools

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, personal attention and made you feel truly special”
Reviews.Author: Shwa_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Staff treated everyone equally. High rollers or not, you were made to feel special. Both the Wynn and Encore offered everything you could ask for in entertainment, restaurants, shopping, gambling and RELAXING. The adult pool at encore was an oasis. A place to relax and be pampered until you were ready for excitement. We stayed at the Encore and, as baby boomers, noticed a calmer atmosphere compared to the original Wynn. Don't get me wrong, the Encore wouldn't have as much to offer withhout the Wynn. It is definitely a one-stop destination. The fashion mall is directly across the street and can be easily accessed by way of an overhead walkway. Cudos to all the staff. They consistently greeted you whether you were coming or going.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but definate luxury!”
Reviews.Author: bunchtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and had a king suite on special offer. suite was spacious, immaculately furnished, clean and very well laid out. Bathroom is huge, dual sinks etc. Service is good, brilliant selection of shops on casino floor. Nice asian fusion restaurant on casino floor which is really reasonably priced, good portions and pretty good food. didnt eat at any of the other restaurants as you cannot wear trainers and my husband didnt bring shoes! spa - went for manicure and pedicure - was good service and not too overpriced. only think was that felt a little rushed in there. pool was always busy but lots of staff who help you locate a chair and provide towels etc. to be honest it was so hot, you could only stay out for a short period of time! overall would go again - especially if could find good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Staying Here is No Gamble”
Reviews.Author: DelicateEssie
Reviews.Content: My firm was hosting an event at this hotel and I wasn't sure what to expect. I can tell you to expect the best. The rooms are enormous. I was especially pleased to see a separate tub and shower. The design of the room is such that the television swivels to the bedroom or living room (and as a person who loves TV, I love this feature in addition to the TV in the bathroom). The hotel offers 24-hour room service, which makes life on the road a lot easier. Would definitely stay at this hotel again, even on my own dime.

Reviews.Title: “Wow an incredible four days !”
Reviews.Author: npc2010
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at Encore in Las Vegas and all I can say is it was a wonderful trip. Weather was perfect 81 degrees. Check in was not bad since we arrive at 1:00 p.m.. got our room within a few minutes, but had to settle for a view of the downtown area. Not bad but would have preffered a strip view. We went on the Wynn Ultimate Package, expensive, but worth every dime. Needed the room because we booked massages for two at 2:30 P.M. and wanted to unpack before we left if we waited we could have had a strip view. Dinner was at Bartollota, Botera and Sinatra all were great! Saw La Reve (this was our third time) but it was great. Spent a day in a cabana at the pool and golfed their amazing golf course. My Wife and I had a wonderful time and are looking forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and they know it!”
Reviews.Author: ontothenext
Reviews.Content: The Encore is a beautiful property. However, as we toured the Wynn, we preferred its decor and overall atmosphere. The rooms were gorgeous - we upgraded to a north facing room on the 58th floor and didn't hear any sound from the XS nightclub. The hotel is at the north end of the strip but we managed to walk the strip comfortably to and from the area around the Paris Hotel. After the first two days, we took taxis to further destinations on the strip to save our feet. We have come to expect certain standards in Canadian hotels - in-room coffee machines, refrigerators, and computer rooms to check email and check-in for flights home. There were no coffee machines, only a refrigerator stocked with items to buy, and only a few internet kiosks in shopping areas that charged $ 20/hour for use. As for customer service, we found the concierge staff rather condescending. They provided the information we requested on local travel and attractions but were not very friendly at all. On the other hand, the cleaning staff greeted us warmly each time we saw them in the hallways. Staff at the front desk were courteous and asked about a room upgrade; however, we are still not clear about the resort fee and the amenities it was supposed to provide like in-room internet. While there are taxi queues at every hotel, visitors need to beware of the best ways to get to their destinations from the Encore. Both to and from the Encore, the taxi drivers did not use the most direct routes - one took the highway, and another claimed to have missed the exit to terminal 2, costing us $ 20 - 25 for each trip - more than internet guides suggest. The Encore is a hot spot for young people. Its nightclub is listed # 1 on some top 10 lists. And the beach club is dedicated to the young party-goers. The pool area for families and mature travellers is beautifully situated and the private cabanas look great for those who enjoy full days poolside.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience at Encore”
Reviews.Author: avnv
Reviews.Content: Large Suite with excellent views,comfortable bed,large bathroom with tub and shower. Service was uniformly excellent. Spa/exercise room with plenty of equipment and wellstocked with water,apples. Buffet was extensive with excellent produce. Restaurants were uniformly excellent. Le Reve show was superb. 5 Star all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Encore”
Reviews.Author: louismfried
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Encore over the Easter weekend. We stayed In a resort king suite which was beautiful. Our room faced the north side which means there was absolutely no noise from XS nightclub. The room itself was very modern, comfortable and well maintained. We really enjoyed going to the pool everyday and we heartily recommend the European pool if you want a tranquil experience. This is truly a five star resort. Last time I stayed at Palazzo but Encore is much better. I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Missed The Mark”
Reviews.Author: OregonVisitor50
Reviews.Content: We were here on a business/leisure trip. At check in, we upgraded our room the the largest suite for an additional $300 per night on top of the initial room rate. The room was very spacious and clean, but they really miss on the amenities. They represented that this room usually rented for $1,250.00 per night. It is in the Tower Suites. I noticed there was a hospitality suite with coffee, etc. I called to ask if we could use this and was told we could. Upon entering, we were told we could not, it was only for "invited guests" with a star on their room key. I am not sure who, if not people renting the largest room this hospitality is for. There is no in-room coffee, and you must get downstairs by 8:30am in order to use the benefit of your ONE cup of coffee. No extras, no refills. I inquired if we could have a coffee maker brought up and was told "no". I later saw a coffee maker on the maid cart for another room. We were supposed to get two daily papers, the first day I had to go downstairs and request the paper, after that we did get one. Their employees seem to not be very well informed regarding what their hotel does or does not provide. They are not very service oriented. We were supposed to get "priority seating" for restaurants, buffets, etc., but again, you needed the star on your key, which ours did not have. There are NO real additional amenities worth noticing, unless you drove your own car and I think you get special parking privileges. I am not sure what event was going on Wednesday night, but as others have mentioned the nightclub noise goes until 4am. I asked about relocating rooms to the other side of the hotel but was told none were available. I had trouble believing this as it was Easter week and many employees were commenting that occupancy was down. Perhaps the room we upgraded to was for repeat guests or those who have a membership of sorts. I felt like we were treated like the stepchild. We stayed at the Trump Waikiki in March, and it FAR exceeded our experience at the Encore/Wynn. I think next trip to Las Vegas, we will visit the Trump. Staff here is not friendly. At Trump, it was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have stayed at in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CJFromNYC
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at the Venetian, the Bellagio and the Palazzo, which was my previous favorite. The Encore blows all three away. The attention to detail, cleanliness and rooms are unmatched. First off, check-in and check-out were totally painless and quick. Our room was on a low floor and had probably one of the less desirable views (North to the riviera and hilton) and was still amazing. The rooms with a single king bed I liked much more than the two-beds rooms. the king room had a nice divider that created two rooms and just a more homey feel to them. Bathrooms are standard luxury vegas, although the shower was much nicer than the Venetian/Palazzo's with a seat and hand-held shower head. There is also no shortage of mirrors in the room, with one whole wall of the room entirely mirrors, and three full-length paneled mirrors across from bathroom. All very good when you are trying to get ready to go out. As for the hotel itself, we had coffee from the lobby bar directly at the entrance to the elevators (very convenient) each morning. They have also have good tapas type food for the middle of the day. Used the pool each day, the European pool which is nicer and has BJ tables, a nice bar with TVs and topless women( I counted 3). We got a cabana there which was beautiful, but definitely not necessary. It also gets shade much sooner than the main pool. The main pool had more kids, but for tanning is definitely the better spot. Lastly, for meals, ate only at Society Cafe (also hit up Lakeside Grill at the Wynn, which was excellent), which we did each morning. Food is very good, service was hit or miss each day, our one waitress thought it was amusing when she forgot to bring us things, but its a good place to start the day. The casino is small, never crowded and fairly smoke free. It also has huge floor to ceiling windows which look out at the pool. A nice touch I havent seen anywhere else. The comps process was relatively painless and the pit bosses were tremendously friendly and excited to see us each day. Drink service was standard, but I never found myself looking for a waitress, which to me is excellent service. I will say that the one gripe is the location of the hotel. Its at one end of the strip, and it is a hike to get to the main part of the strip. Having been to Vegas many times, that didnt bother me and when I was at the Bellagio one night I realized just how choked with people the main strip places are, but by the end of the trip I was so over the walk between the Encore and Wynn...You pretty much have to walk through the Wynn to get anywhere. The European pool turns into XS at night, which if you can handle it, is an amazing club. We got a table which worked out well, but I think you can probably get in decently fast by staying at the hotel, and even if you are not into nightclubs, its worth a visit. Its so vast, that you can hang away from crowds, hit the dance floor or even gamble, with relative ease. Also got a cabana at Encore Beach, which if you are into pool parties is a MUST. So much better than any other I have been to, and while packed, the pool never gets gross (see Rehab/Tao Beach). If you have a big group(it holds 12, although the girls next to us had 18), the cabana is amazing and even looks out on the strip and the service was perfection. I will be returning to the Encore in a few months for a wedding. Cannot wait...

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly beautiful but pricey”
Reviews.Author: cctravelgirl
Reviews.Content: Decor-- This hotel and the Wynn are a feast for the eyes. Everything is impeccable from artwork to landscaping to decor. No expense has been spared. Room--The room at the Encore was extremely comfortable, spacious and inviting. The beds are unbelievably comfortable and the views from the floor to ceiling, wall to wall windows are unbeatable. Bathrooms are extremely spacious and well appointed. Pools--Pools at both the Wynn and Encore are beautiful. Gardens are gorgeous. Pool staff are extremely accommodating. Bar service is a little on the slow side but still a nice amenity to have. Restaurants--Meal at Switch was very good but expensive. Novel setting. Breakfast Buffet at Wynn was good. Pizza place was alright--nice patio by waterfall. Overall food is good but overpriced. For example, $5 for a cup of takeout tea. Check-in staff--Not the most helpful. They claim you can't request a non-smoking room and that it's just whatever they have available so we had to take a smoking room the first night and move the next day to a non-smoking. You would think a hotel of this magnitude would be able to designate a certain number of floors for people with allergies to smoke. I felt we were being lied to on a few occasions by front desk staff. Convenience--close to Fashion Show Mall Value--not sure how much our room was as it was part of a package with airfare and transfers but I suspect the room itself was good value especially for the calibre. However ... I think they get you on the food, drinks and absolutely everything else in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Hotel without the loud casino and smoke”
Reviews.Author: pawji
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Encore several times over the past few years and it does not disappoint. The pool is nice and clean with good service, the casino is fun but never super loud like some other casino's on the strip and the spa is a-m-a-z-i-n-g! The Encore is connected to the Wynn so it's an easy walk to eat at the Wynn's restaurants (Japanese one with view is ridiculously good) or see La Reve. If you like to shop in Vegas, you are 10 minute walking distance to the mall from your hotel room. Overall, it's a great hotel, that if you want to have a more laid back Vegas experience it affords it. It also has one of the best clubs, XS, so if you want to get crazy, that should be no problem too.

Reviews.Title: “set the standard for me”
Reviews.Author: tgaynor1117
Reviews.Content: This was my fist trip to Vegas and I am now spoiled! The Encore is the only place I want to stay! It was so nice and comfy! Of course the price was a bit much and I didnt like that the internet and workout room werent free but in the end I guess you get what you pay for? Gorgeous hotel, friendly & fast staff, all around good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Six star service, rooms, location - second to none!”
Reviews.Author: Kelwood
Reviews.Content: If I could rate the Encore a six I would! Every single aspect of the hotel was terrific. We spent 3 amazing nights in a tower suite and could find no faults. Check-in was friendly and efficient (tower suite worth the little extra just for this). All staff we encountered, from check-in, concierge, room service, housekeeping, spa and restaurants were incredibly friendly, professional and made you feel special. Our room was enormous, spotlessly clean and had a view of the strip which I can't imagine could be beat anywhere else. The selections in the mini-bar were extensive and the bedside controls for the blinds and the privacy light were a treat. The bed was extremely comfortable aiding in perfect sleep. The huge bathroom came with a TV, lovely amenities and lightly coloured fluffy towels (a welcomed change from the hospital white normally found in hotels). We had room service a couple of times, visited the spa, and used the concierge services and all staff we came across were very polite and professional. We did not come across one staff member that was having a bad day. Even staff we bumped into in the lift offered advice on what to do and see in Vegas. We were especially impressed by the room service menu which had many vegetarian selections and would accommodate special requests. Having spent 7 weeks in the US, we stayed at some lovely places but this was by far the standout in all areas and we could not believe the value. Mr Wynn please open up a hotel in Australia as I wish the Encore wasn't quite so far away!

Reviews.Title: “Bad costumer service”
Reviews.Author: brunospba
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable, as you should expect, with great views to the strip. The spa is beautiful ! But, the costumer service is really terrible! If you need anything from them, even something as simple as a copy of your invoice sent to your email, they will ignore you. It takes them days to answer a single request by email. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too Hard to Decide Between Wynn & Encore”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I usually stay at Wynn, but decided to try Encore this time. He had stayed there before and thought it was just slightly trendier but at the end of the day, they're both awesome hotels and I would take either. The room itself was great, spacious with a separate couch and desk area broken up by a low wall in the middle of the room with the Tv, then the bed area. Great that the bed faces the Strip. Huge bathroom with double sinks, soaking tub, massive shower, very nicely done. We ate at SW (horrible service, but pretty good food), we also had a casual dinner at Society Cafe. My husband's burger was good, but my salmon with Red & White Quinoa Pilaf, Shaved Fennel & Citrus Salad sounded so good but was not. The salmon was good enough (very salty) but the quinoa (which I usually love) was terrible. I was also excited for the mac and cheese bites and the donuts but both were disappointing as well. Overall not worth the money. We did have excellent room service for breakfast in the room, great service, set up and food. We went to the spa, which was a great experience. My husband loved his massage and my facial was good too, but I would never pay those prices again. Because the weather was unseasonably cool, it was really the only option for during the day. Service was excellent and the public spa spaces were really great. Went to XS, which even when we came in Nov seemed to be much more popular. Overall, I would definitely stay at Encore again, although I think we'd probably choose Wynn just because it's got a slightly better location. Have been disappointed by the food though so might venture out of the hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “A smelly start!”
Reviews.Author: DMC71
Reviews.Content: We generally stay at The Wynn but decieded to try out Encore on this trip. We checked in on Friday night as were given a room that absoluley stunk of really bad feet, did the housekeeper have no sense of smell, we were moved to another room and told " this is the last room left in the hotel" well guess what, the same housekeeper must have cleaned this room also!, it smelled just as bad. I went to the front desk informed them again of the issue. " your issues have been noted in your file" They found us another room, it was as it should be clean and odor free. The hotel itself is nice, more compact than The Wynn. Getting to the elevators from the reg desk is akward, they are placed behind the lobby bar and cafe. The pool area is good, the spa is one of the best in the city and probably the country. The hotel has rebounded in my eyes from the rough start, but the Wynn will always be my home from home when in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Licenciada
Reviews.Content: Very posh hotel and Hollywood service! One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. No complaints. Get VIP entrance to nightclubs... Worth skipping the lines. The spa was great.. Take a bathing suit even if just going for a massage.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: xpider
Reviews.Content: Check-in Asked for a room with strip view on the higher floor, but was told no room was available. However, one of my colleagues arrived few hours later than me but he got a room on the high floor facing the strip. I am Asian but my colleague is white. It makes think the hotel registration staff is racist. Concierge No help at all. The service booklet in the hotel room states that if you want to go to XS nightclub, you could call concierge for help so that you don’t have to wait in long line. So, I called the concierge but didn’t get any help. The staff told me I have to wait in line and pay the $30 coverage. Resort fee It is mandatory to pay the $20 daily resort fee now. You actual daily rate would be your room rate plus the daily resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Very NICE !!”
Reviews.Author: minnyman
Reviews.Content: 3 nights @ planet Hollywood 2 nights @ ENCORE. HUGE difference. Everything GREAT. No coffee in room though. I would say BEST IN VEGAS. (Been to Venetian,RIO,Tahitti,Club DeSole', Flamingo,4 Queens,Golden Gate,Golden nugget,Orlean's and Tahitti Village.)

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Treatment!”
Reviews.Author: Sammyjb19
Reviews.Content: We were given an upgrade to the 60th floor when we arrived. We were on the even side facing the strip. Great views! I will post pictures shortly. The concierge was amazing, everything they told us was right on. The staff treated us like we were celebrities. Ordered a cappuccino while playing the slots and even that was 5 star!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly. I was so upset to leave...”
Reviews.Author: gettinoutthere
Reviews.Content: We stayed from April 5-9th, and had no issues with check-in. The woman I dealt with was pleasant and made good small talk while she did her thing. i bought into the $20 upgrade to a higher floor - but they only had mountain-view rooms available. She promised to contact me the next day when a higher-floor strip view opened up, which would be no additional cost (just the $20 they were already charging me for the upgrade). We also had the dreaded $20 resort fee explained to us, which essentially covers access to the gym, Wifi, and printing of your boarding pass. Sure enough, we had a message waiting for us the next day and we were changed to a room on the 55th floor, strip view. No fuss, no muss. I was really happy with how effortless it was. It was mid-week so it was a bit quieter, but there were still quite a few people strolling around. The only good pool day we had was the first day, as Wednesday and Thursday were cold (and windy). However, there were lots of chairs out on a Tuesday and service was prompt. If you're looking for less crowding, mid-week is definitely a good way to go. We ate dinner at other hotels, which I have covered in my other reviews (Jaleo, Sushi Samba, Mesa Grill, Lavo). Nothing against the restaurants at the Wynn/Encore, but we used those dinners as reasons for getting out and seeing other hotels. We did pick up croissants and coffee one morning at the Lobby Bar at the bottom of the elevators - very good. We also had breakfast one morning at the Terrace Cafe at the Wynn, which was also great. Portions were huge and the 2 of us easily shared an omelette and yogurt/granola. We played a bit - blackjack tables, I played some slots. We didn't really lose very much, but it also didn't seem like there was a lot of 'winning' going on around us. It wasn't too busy, but I guess I expected more ringing from the machines. Regardless, I got a few hours of amusement out of it. My big celebrity sighting - Kelsey Grammer and his new wife! I saw them a couple of times, and played next to them for a bit. It's really close to the mall, where we stocked up on munchies for the room (ABC Stores). The shopping through the Esplanades was jaw-dropping, but it was nice to look at what I'll never be able to afford.... We booked through Expedia, and I had a call from one of their local concierges the week before we left. She mentioned that she could get me access to the clubs, which I took her up on. It would have cost us $50 to get into the Surrender Nightclub on Wednesday, but we got in for free, and through a VIP line - no waiting! Score one for Expedia. If you go through them - make sure you ask about these people as they are local, included in what you already paid, and may be able to provide similar benefits. Surrender was pretty good. No real room to dance (and the area where you could was WAY too packed). So there was just a lot of standing around and gawking outside by the pools. Music was great, it's always fun to people-watch at those places. When we got back upstairs, the club was still going around 3am. I had read about the noise complaints but it was non-existent on the 55th floor. I might have heard faint thumping if I was up against the window but there was nothing that kept me from sleeping (except maybe the snoring on the other side of the bed). Beds were really comfy, room was well-appointed. Housekeeping was thorough. I have never liked in-room coffee makers so the fact that there wasn't one was not an issue. We had a massage one chilly morning, which I HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Think of it as using the money you would have lost through gambling. The spa facilities are amazing and really helped us to unwind. The heated lounge chairs, steam room, rainshowers and saunas... opulence. I've tried to keep this brief but I can't go on enough about what a great time I had and how much I loved the hotel. I will definitely stay here again, it has everything you need in one giant complex (and everything else is a short walk or cab ride away). We picked it because of the luxury and amenities and were not disappointed. The location didn't matter to us, we've seen the strip before and didn't need to check everything out (just the select restaurants I mentioned). We had stayed one night at the Wynn before and expected the same experience with the Encore. So glad we did. This is something you need to experience. Please feel free to contact me with questions.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: wannafiji
Reviews.Content: Unlike the previous reviewer, I found my stay at Encore to be peaceful and restful. Our small suite was located on the 38th floor, with fabulous downtown and mountain views through floor to ceiling windows. I love the elegant glam decor of the entire hotel, from the public areas to our room. Service was excellent, and the quieter atmosphere is a nice change from some of the less elegant, more crowded hotels farther down the strip. I'd stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy noisy noisy... it's 4am, and all we can hear is the nightclub”
Reviews.Author: memojen
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review at 4am, from our room on the 29th floor. We have been kept awake two nights in a row by the loud thumping coming from the nightclub. I can't even imagine what people on lower floors must be hearing! We called the front desk about three hours ago who informed us that the nightclub closes at 4:30, so we're just waiting for it to end. They said all their rooms are booked, and there was no other room they could move us to. They offered a $200 credit for food as compensation, but the girl was very vague about it and just told me to go ahead and charge it all to my room, and then she'll see about having it taken off when we check out. Uhhhh, very reassuring, right? Trouble is, my husband is here for a conference and now hasn't been able to sleep in two nights. We were supposed to stay one more night, but we just used our sleepless night to change our flight home to a day earlier so we don't have to deal with this again. As long as I'm awake anyway, I might as well review the rest of the hotel... The rooms are nice, but don't feel quite as nice as the room that we stayed at in the Wynn previously. They're bigger in the encore, but somehow feel more cramped. Our room was clean & tidy, so no complaints with housekeeping. Aside from my noise complaint about the nightclub, the soundproofing between rooms also leaves something to be desired. We can hear our neighbors doors open and close, and when I was taking a bath earlier, I could hear our neighbor in their bathroom doing their, uhh, business on the toilet, if you get my drift. Pretty disgusting. We ordered room service while we were here. I told the girl that I have a dairy allergy and just asked her for a mixed green salad with no cheese or dairy, no croutons, no meat... just mixed greens.
