They sent up a salad alright.. with chicken, cheese, a bunch of bread, etc. Especially disappointing since the Wynn claims to be sensitive to allergens. I had them remove the food, and asked them not to charge me, but I am guessing we'll see it on our final bill. Maybe I can use that suspicious sounding $200 credit to pay for it, ha! The casino is nothing special. I do like that the air filtration is good, so the smoke isn't as obnoxious. But I played their slot machines for some time, and got zilch.. nuthin! Just dumped my money in and that was it. So I'd say to head elsewhere for fun slots. Oh look, it's almost 4:30am... going to wrap up this review in hopes that we can get some sleep soon. Seriously folks, don't stay here. We will likely check out the Mandarin next time we're here. I also don't remember the Wynn rooms being noisy at all, so that could be an option as well. But avoid the encore at ALL costs!

Reviews.Title: “21st Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: miss_sss1
Reviews.Content: Nice location, clean hotel, nice staff, food is overpriced however, overall great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: someplacelse
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in this fabulous hotel. Our room had a wonderful view of the strip from the 24th floor. Our only concern on checking in was that we were given the keys to someone else's room. A HUGE security breach as we could have cleaned these guys out. Other than that, this is a classy hotel and one night is just not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Tower Suites is a jewel!”
Reviews.Author: tifferst
Reviews.Content: Between the private check in with hot towels and cold water, gorgeous rooms, intimate casino and superb restaurants the Encore Tower Suites cannot be beat. Other then always losing my shirt at the tables my only other qualm is that unlike the Wynn Tower coffee is not served at the bottom of the elevator but instead complimentary at the Terrace Cafe. If needing to look presentable to pick up my coffee is the biggest of my problems I think there is little else to ask for in a hotel. This was my third trip of 2011 so far and already i have another 2 planned, both at the Wynn/Encore!

Reviews.Title: “Wynn Encore is a winner”
Reviews.Author: winner13
Reviews.Content: First class hotel ,service, food and the Spa is second to none !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: SmileyCorona
Reviews.Content: We received a package deal for Encore so our value was fantastic, but it would be hard to stay anywhere else in Vegasafter staying at the Wynn/Encore. The suite was beautiful, as was the entire resort. Every employee was friendly and helpful. Pools were both hip and comfortable depending on your mood for the day. Lakeside Grill, Society, and the buffet served wonderful food. Tryst Club was great for the 21-39 crowd, as well as Blush. At the resort we saw Ryan Seacrest, and as we were lounging by the pool we were invited to the VIP list for Blush where we met Miss America contestants, and 2007 Playmate of the Year. Le Reve was good, but don't go if you are paying full price for the ticket, not worth the $141 as the ticket price showed (ours were comped). We are just regular people in our mid 30's but we felt like celebrities all weekend!!! Prices can be high for drinks, but if you are splurging it is completely worth it. Not for families. No strollers allowed in hotel, and everything is geared toward adults.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cinster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week last month. I would've preferred warmer weather, but overall we had a nice trip. The Encore is a very nice hotel. I love the bathroom! Nice big shower, separate tub, his and her sinks, toilet behind a door so my husband could do his business while I got ready! It even has a tv! The bed is comfortable, but we could hear the music from the bars, and we were on the 23rd floor. There's a nice sitting area next to the floor to ceiling windows. The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is I didn't like the fact that there was no coffee maker in the room, and if you want a fridge you have to pay for it. But no problem with maids, service or anything. The concierge are helpful when booking shows and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great looking hotel, but too far from variety and watch the extras”
Reviews.Author: Goopy007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Encore in a Resort Suite King room during late July 2010 for 3 nights.  Our room had stunning views from 53rd floor down the strip and was suite was exquisitely decorated.  The bathroom was large, modern and had everything you could want.  The room was a suite, with a semi-separate bedroom and living room divided by a half wall with a swivel TV. The Encore complex is huge and has 2 large pool areas... One for the kids and another for "European bathing" (topless).  If you want to avoid kids, go here.there was also a bar with a pool, but this was not part of the hotel and was expensive to get into.  Speaking of the pool party, we could hear the loud music from this place till 3am on a Thursday night and we were on the 53rd floor.  Beware if you plan on sleeping. The hotel was extraordinarily cheap for such a luxury hotel, but beware....everything else is extra and expensive.  The location of this hotel is a little too far from the main action to be able to grab a quick bite from somewhere other than in the hotel complex.  Its great if you’re happy to just stay in the hotel as its so much less trashy than most of the older casino hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NuclearAli
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice hotel and I certainly did not regret staying there. Pros: -nice that it's a relatively "smaller" hotel, so it's a bit more intimate than many other strip hotels in terms of the size of the casino -fabulous drinks at the pool -lovely decor in public areas -all the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful Cons: -pool area was almost completely full on a weekday at the end of March. Would hate to see it on a weekend- you wouldn't get a chair! I was also surprised with how small the pool/deck area was considering the size of the hotel. -Long walk to the center strip area (not the hotel's fault, of course!) -Had to wait for our room to be ready (arrived about 4:30 PM, room was ready in an hour). Kinda annoying after a long flight- if we're there after check-in time, I think our room should be ready! Since the Wynn has renovated their rooms, I would suggest staying there for the larger pool area and closer walk to the main part of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “100%”
Reviews.Author: winequaffer
Reviews.Content: I can't even say 1 complaint about this hotel.. from the moment we checked in. 15 years we have visited LV... we always heard the Bellagio was 'the' destination... see my review of Bellagio this year... I say Wynn and Encore is THE place. The rooms are amazing... the casino fun... the restaurants delicious... our bathroom even great! I am struggling for a complaint to seem honest... but honesty on the table... it was a perfect place... OK... one issue ... I had a net gambling loss there... but that happens most places in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice....prefer the Wynn facilities with the Encore Suite.”
Reviews.Author: ufrc75
Reviews.Content: Let me just preface this by saying that I have stayed at the Wynn and decided to try out the Encore this time around. The room is larger than the Wynn. The design with the semi-seperate sitting area with the swivel TV is a nice touch. It made the room feel very large and very comfortable for 2 people. The room at the Wynn is nice, but this room feels more spacious. I would say the bathrooms appear to be about the same size. The common areas of the hotel are nice as well. The casino is much smaller than the Wynn and you don't get the crowds that the wynn gets so it is a bit quieter. We enjoyed going over to the wynn to gamble then retreating to the quiet of the Encore. We might have lucked out with our neighbors, but I commented to my friend that I could barely hear a sound in our room. There are 2 different sides to the hotels, one facing the XS nightclub. If you are a light sleeper request the one that is not on the XS side facing the strip. You want the moutain view. Just let the front desk know. We used the spa, which is one of the nicest I have visited and the most expensive. I would highly recommend. The gym is included with your $20 a day resort fee.....Great place to stock up on free bottled water....FYI. We visited both Encore pools, the european one with the casino in the center island is a bit more fun. Just keep walking past the first pool, you will see it on the right side. We actually preferred the Wynn pools and returned to that side for one pool day. Overall, I liked the Encore room, but I think I prefer the Wynn facilities and restaurants. I love being able to go back and forth between the Wynn and Encore. You get the best of both worlds. As you should know, the Wynn/Encore is located on the very far north of the strip. It is tough to walk to a ton of places, but I think the hotel makes up for it. Once you leave and see the other hotel options, you will understand. The staff at both hotels are great.

Reviews.Title: “Room design flaw ruined a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ECgg
Reviews.Content: Encore is a beautiful property, there is no question. But to me the first thing a hotel should offer is a good nights sleep, and the design of the adjoining room/door/wall allowed the noise from my neighbors travel to my room, barely muffled. It didn't help that they appeared to be cast members of Jersey Shore. Let me start out by saying I live in a condo in DC; I'm hardly over-sensitive to noise. But I was at the Encore to work 12+ hour days at a conference for work. Each of my four nights I was woken up at 2-2:30 am by shouting and music, that I could hear OVER my fairly good earplugs. On the VERY last night of my stay, after complaining each night, the front desk suggested moving my neighbors...why couldn't this have been suggested the FIRST night? Lack of sleep over my 5 days at the Encore ruined my stay. If that is taken out of the equation, the food was pretty good, the meeting facilities were nice, and the meeting room staff was very good. The furniture in the room was well designed and comfortable, and our room had a wonderful view, though the mirrors were excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and my favourite casino”
Reviews.Author: retep68
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with partner and 8 other friends, March 17 - 21. I had made the booking and paid deposits on my credit card. Simple, quck and easy and no problem to cancel the deposits off my card when we checked in. We upgraded to high floors on checkin ($20 per night extra) - 59th floor with views of golf course and downtown - which was fine (didn't want strip views in case of club noise). Service was consistently excellent. Check-in was efficient and friendly. Staff at the table games were helpful, patient (with beginners) and fun (exception being one miserable women at a roulette table at Wynn). 'Free' cocktail service when gambling was 98% quick and regular (again, one miserable exception). Food at Society cafe and Terrace point was great (breakfasts and one lunch). Breakfast at ZooZaCrackers was also good and very cheap in comparison to most other places in Wynn/Encore. Rooms were great. Big enough (just) for us all to gather before going out. Housekeeping also good ($5 tipped daily). Great bathrooms - large and well stocked with soaps, gels etc... water pressure not so good. Huge comfortable beds. Loved the Encore casino. Favourite by far of all we visited. Easy to navigate. Not very smokey. Bright and airy in the day (love having windows, so you can actually see outside!). Weather was good enough for one day at the pool. Very good drinks service. European pool was excellent with good music, but lost the sun pretty early in the afternoon. Bit of a trek to get anywhere else on the strip (on foot). Ended up getting cabs to most other places. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: greycoast
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to visit Las Vegas for the first time as a couple. We wanted to stay in a clean, "higher end" hotel and this place delivered. The entire property is beautiful. The rooms are very nice and recently updated (even though the place is still very very new). The pool area is very nice and overall, the service is very solid. We stayed in the regular suites (not the tower suite) portion of the hotel. I liked the fact that all the rooms are the same size and layout. The rooms are good size with floor to ceiling windows which offer nice views. The rooms have a modern design. They have very high ceilings and well placed mirrors to give the feel of more space. The bathrooms are beautiful with a large glass shower and separate, large tub. Lots of marble tile. Bed and linens were of very high quality and the electronic lighting control is slick. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Every staff member I made eye contact with greeted me warmly except for what was noted below. We wanted to see "O" at the Bellagio. I called the concierge desk a couple of weeks before my arrival and Brendon scored us some excellent seats at the base price which was very cool. During our stay, he got us some great reservations at Le Cirque on a very busy night. Every time I called, he remembered me and got things lined out for us very quickly. I am sure the other concierge staff is as good but you cant go wrong asking him for assistance. There was a huge convention (140k people) while we were there and we were very appreciative that we could get such great service. Ok.. so why just 4 stars rather than 5? For me, a hotel or resturant will need to hit a home run for me to give them a 5. Encore did well but they did stumble a couple of times. Upon arrival, our check in experience was cold. Fast, efficient, but cold. We knew about the resort fee prior to our arrival (it wasn't included in our package). We were told coldly it was mandatory, however it was either removed from our account later or was never added. We had a conflict with the staff when we wanted to go work out one morning which was uncomfortable. Who wants to argue with a gym attendant at 8 am over a $15 user fee? When it was corrected, it was added back and forward on our account for a mystery amount that needed to be corrected at check out. We also rented a fridge and had it removed the next day. We were charged for 4 nights use. Again, it was corrected upon check out but I felt like I had to explain all the corrections and it literally took 20 mins to get us out of the hotel. Finally, I know this is vegas and I stay in a lot of urban hotels for business so I am a little more used to all the little fees hotels charge you but this property takes it to the extreme. These fees, to me, is more of an annoyance than anything. I am not an expert on hotel pricing but I would rather pay a little more and not have to deal with silly charges. We were charged the following during our stay: Room at a higher floor - $20 per night. When that room had a funny smell, I took it as an opprotunity to change to a room facing the other direction (toward the strip). That upgrade fee kept me at a high floor but added $5 per night to the fee for a total of $25 per night. Really? In room Fridge - $25 per day In room internet - $18 per day (unless you get the resort fee). The internet did not work at the pool or gaming areas. Receiving a package while at the hotel - $15. Yes, just to receive a package plus we had to ask to have it delivered to the room and tipped accordingly (not knowing about the fee). Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and enjoyed the property. It met our needs. Yes it is more expensive than many but depending on your definition of value, this could meet your needs. It did ours.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back asap!”
Reviews.Author: W.O.F.
Reviews.Content: Our first time at Encore/Wynn and we were very impressed. Got a great deal for 3 nights for $400, including Le Reve tickets. The bedroom was wonderful and spacious, as well as the bathroom. The Encore seemed much more relaxed and calm compared to the Wynn. Found some cheap blackjack tables and the drink service while gambling was excellent. Only ate breakfast (Society Cafe), and the pool was closed during our stay ): The fitness room was big and offered most machines-not crowded at all! I have never gotten such close parking to a hotel-a definite plus also. If they keep offering such great prices, we will definitely be back as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: wckdtrix
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Encore at the Wynn. From check in to check out, everything was great. We arrived on a Friday night, and were worried check in may take a while. When we got into the Encore, we found no line at all and were checked in immediately, so that was great. We made our way to our room...we were a little worried that there was going to be some loud partying on our floor as the smell of reefer smoke was almost overpowering when we stepped off the elevator and in the entire hallway...fortunately, we never heard a peep from whoever was "partying" our entire stay.... The room was very nice, and quiet. The room has an awesome bed, awesome couch, etc...everything was great. The casino was very nice....great selection of games, and once again...all of the employees we encountered were more than friendly and great. Anyways, great experience...would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Delivered as Expected”
Reviews.Author: spiels
Reviews.Content: The Encore was great! We stayed for 4 nights in mid-March. We paid the extra $25 a night for the "panoramic" room and ended up on the 56th floor, facing the strip. (Note that there are no floors 40-49 as far as I can tell. Elevators go up to floor 63 but there are not 63 floors when you count from outside and no buttons in elevators for floors 40-49. I think it is simply a marketing trick to make you think your room is higher up?) Outstanding view, comfy bed, beautiful resort. Previous reviewers were correct about not taking or moving the snacks or mini-bar items but they have signs in the room that explain the process and charges. It would be nice if they had a fridge in the room you could use: you can't put you stuff in mini-bar and they charge you $25 a night if you want them to bring you a different fridge. We passed and instead just filled the sink with ice (although the ice machine was clear down at the end of the hallway). Casino and pool areas were very nice and clean. Restaurants all kind of spendy (as you would expect) but the fashion mall is right across the street and has some fast food options and a Starbucks for quick meals. The 1/2 price tickets place is also right across the road. There is also a small strip mall just north of the Encore that has a liquor store where we picked up some premixed margaritas, etc. One suggestions: signup for their Red Card program right away. Your room key is your reward's red card which is convenient. However, we didn't officially signup for the card until the day before we were leaving. It was then we found out that we each got 2 free buffets and a "free spin" on their wheel after reaching 500 points. It would have been nice to know that at the start of our visit.

Reviews.Title: “I thought The Wynn was great and Encore bests it”
Reviews.Author: Goober818
Reviews.Content: I love The Wynn. Love it. I thought The Encore wouldn't be much different and probably couldn't best the Wynn experience but I was wrong. The rooms feel slightly more sophisticated and I love the open feeling of the casino (lots of glass overlooking the pool area). The Wynn and The Encore both are amazing properties and my pick for Strip hotels. You can't go wrong at either.

Reviews.Title: “A Top-Notch Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: rhanderson
Reviews.Content: Had a terrific time in Vegas over the last weekend (March 11-16) at the Encore. My wife and I spent the same weekend last year at the Wynn, so at the end I will make some comparisons in this review. Upon arrival, check-in went very smoothly and quickly and received a room on the 38th floor facing the Strip to the southwest. The view was spectacular and was better than the same from the Wynn. The room at Encore was large and the bed was extremely comfortable, unlike the Wynn the room is divided into a bedroom area and a sitting area with a flat screen TV that swivels so it can be seen from either side. However the TV blocked the view from the bed to the floor-to ceiling window of the room. Personally I preferred the Wynn floor plan that gave me an unobstructed view. The bathroom was large with separate tub and shower, but once again I preferred the Wynn bathroom that had the toilet in a separate room off the main bathroom. The Encore bathroom did have a couple of problems, such as a loose shower head and the remote for the TV in the bathroom was missing, but these problems were very quickly remedied with a call to the front desk. The casino was nicely lit during the day by natural sunlight and was enjoyable to gamble in (although slightly smokey, but all the casinos are.) The spa was spectacular according to my wife that had the desert stone massage there. Really the only drawback to both Wynn and Encore are they are located on the north end of the strip and its a long trip if you have any activities planned on the mid or south end of the Strip. The staff for the most part were very attentive and helpful, but there were some waitresses at various restaurants and lounges that should have been more attentive, but with as much service personnel that are attached to these mega resorts you will get the mediocre mixed in with the superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: alexsndiego
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel room at the Encore! Everything was so clean and comfortable. We got a really good package for $480 which included: 1) Three Nights 2) Three Buffets for two people 3) Two tickets to Le Reve. The economy must be rough in Las Vegas to offer us such a great deal. We paid the extra $20 per night to be upgraded to the Panorama Suite. Awesome view! The Panorama Suites are on the top 10 floors of the Encore. We had a view to the north which is not as nice as the view to the south which included the strip. Being the on the north side avoids have to hear the noise from the club. I asked the check in agent and they confirmed that if you are on the lower floors and face the strip, you will hear and feel the club. If quiet is important to you, you should politely ask the check in agent to place you facing north especially if you are on the lower floors and desire some quiet at 2 am in the morning. The rooms were really comfortable and clean. The bathroom was amazing. Having a nice bathroom really makes your stay enjoyable. Dual sinks, separate tub and shower, water closet. TV next to the sink. Water pressure in the shower was good. Toiletries were just okay. Felt "watered" down. Another victim of the economy? The $20 per day resort fee includes internet service and access to the gym. The gym had really nice NEW equipment with state of the art options to plug in your iPod. Plenty of towels and water. The buffet was just okay. We went for breakfast/lunch and then dinner. The economy has really taken its toll on Las Vegas. This was once the premier buffet on the strip. Not so much anymore. We ended up not using our 3rd buffet meal because the food was boring. We decided it was better to pay for breakfast somewhere rather than subject ourselves to the bland food. We dont gamble so we cannot comment much on the casino and other gaming action. Le Reve was horribly boring. I would NOT pay $150 for that show. Our tickets were included in our package. Go see "O" at the Bellagio. I love shows etc but I felt the music was inspirational and the show forgettable. Which brings to the point about the Wynn/Encore vs Bellagio. Steve Wynn was the original mastermind of the Bellagio. Unfortunately, Wynn/Encore does fails to measure up to the Bellagio. The Bellagio Buffet was so much better. "O" is much better. The fountain show at the Bellagio is so much better. In summary, the rooms at Encore are AMAZING. Buffet was boring. Le Reve was also boring. We stay again strictly for the quality of the hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away”
Reviews.Author: New4dventures
Reviews.Content: In short this Hotel far, far exceeded my/our expectations. We were offered the usual upgrade and took it. The view from the 62nd floor is unbelievable. Watching the sun set and the Vegas lights come on is amazing. The hotel is plush and very well designed. Unlike others it is fairly easy to navigate and links well with the original Wynn. The gaming area is lacking in atmosphere but we found that with a lot of places because of the size and choice available. The food is unbelievable and we would thoroughly recommend the breakfast and evening buffet. Small trays ensure the freshest, finest prepared food not found at any other buffet I've been to. And the food matches the price with prime cuts of meet and culinary genres to suit most tastes. The clubs are fantastic, just make sure you get concierge to put you on the guest lists. XS was pretty awesome, definitely check it out on a Monday which is industry night. The pools are chilled out with a great atmosphere. We looked enviably into the beach party pool and wish we had enough $ to have gone there too. Service is subtle but everywhere and very helpful and friendly. Fresh flower displays are also pretty amazing but easily missed in all the glitz and glamour. The only negative is it is quite north on the strip and a good 20 minute / half hour walk to MGM (the centre). That said buses and cabs are everywhere so it's no issue. I am almost certain no hotel will ever match the experiece I had here, it is truly mind blowing. the only other hotels I would stay at in Vegas (having visited them all) would be the Wynn, Bellagio, Venetian, Palazzo or maybe Cesars.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Comfortable and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: TwoShermans
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Encore before and again this year found it to be one of the best hotel experiences we've had. Our room ( mini suite) was lovely to see, had great space, a wonderful bathroom, ultra comfortable bed and pillows, and was SO quiet and clean. The service at the Wynn and Encore is the best. The location is across from the Fashion Show Mall and this is a hike to the other end of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: JMaddix
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Vegas and after much research on trip advisor we decided to go for the Encore as it got the best reviews. The encore cost a little bit more than most but we thought this is one trip that can't be done on a budget! We were greeted by friendly valet staff and an even friendlier check-in lady who offered us a nice little upgrade which worked out about the same as the resort fee ($25 per night) and in return she'd cancel the resort fee and boy was it worth it! The room was amazing, we stayed on the 57th floor and had wonderful views of the strip it was truly breathtaking! The room was immaculate and very big, the bed was super comfy and I loved being able to control the curtains and lights from my bedside table! The t.v in the bathroom was a nice touch and housekeeping did a fantastic job keeping the room nice and tidy during our stay ( don't forget to leave a tip out for housekeeping when you leave) If you want to see just how good these rooms are go onto youtube and search for encore room tour there's plenty of vids on there) The hotel casino was very swish with friendly dealers and valet girls who served you drinks very quickly. The ventilation system was the best, lots of people smoking but you couldn't smell any smoke at all. The cleanliness was top notch, such attention to detail I didn't see one piece of litter, one empty glass or one piece of dirt. To give an example of the lengths they go to we were up early one day and they had a team of people cleaning the leaves of the plants in the lobby!! I had a few concerns after reading another review about people looking down their noses at you as it's a posh hotel with people wandering around in suits and cocktail dresses. Yes there were people dressed smart but I didn't feel out of place in shorts and a baseball cap, not once did I feel looked down upon everyone was just so friendly and accommodating! We didn't eat at the Wynn or Encore as it was a bit pricey for us but the restaurants looked very posh and nice. The shops were the crème de le crème with Luis vuitton, Chanel, Cartier, Dior, Rolex and even a ferrari/maserati dealership next door in the Wynn! Talking of the Wynn, both hotels are linked via a shopping esplanade and the Wynn is a mirror image of the Encore with a bigger casino and a sports book. We loved the hotel and Vegas so much we plan to return later on this year but will stay at the Wynn this time as it's a little closer to getting out onto the strip. All in all it was the best holiday of our lives and the best hotel we've ever stayed in. If you can afford it BOOK IT! You will not be disappointed and if you can't quite afford it then save a bit longer it's worth every penny! The only bad thing about the Encore is that we've ruined it for ourselves as now we can no longer stay anywhere else as it just won't compare and we went in every single hotel on the strip and downtown. Sure, some of the new resorts are very nice (in particular the Aria, Venetian, Cosmopolitan and palazzo) but they just haven't got that final piece of excellence and attention to detail you find and the Encore and Wynn Tips for Vegas... 1 - Take plenty of moisturiser and more importantly lip balm, yes you heard right, I'm a guy and I used tons of this stuff, the air con in each hotel and then the warn air outside dries you out big time! 2 - Drink plenty of water even if you're not thirsty 3 - Don't use taxis to get about, there are so many sets of traffic lights on the strip the traffic moves very slow. A taxi ride from the airport should be $15-$20 + tip (10%-20%) A taxi from the stratosphere to treasure island will be around $12. To get around take the express bus or the deuce. Walk through the shopping esplanade into the Wynn and then out of the Wynn and down onto the strip. Turn left and 100yds up is the bus stop for heading down town. If you want to go south up the strip which you'll want to most days then cross over the road and the stop is in front of the fashion show mall near starbucks. The Deuce double decker bus stops at every hotel on the strip where as the express only stops 2 or 3 times on the strip. The express is a lot better and quicker it is a single decker 'bendy bus'. Both buses use the same tickets, its $5 for one trip, $7 for a 24hr pass or there's a 7 day pass which I think is $20 you buy your tickets at the bus stops from a machine. If you get on the deuce you must enter through the front door and swipe your ticket. If you use the express you can get on at any door and only have to show your ticket if an inspector is on the bus or if one gets on at one of the stops which they almost always do! 4 - If the food at the Encore is too pricey then there is a food court on the top floor of the fashion show mall across the road with the usual suspects, macdonalds, subway etc You can also find food courts at a lot of the hotels like montecarlo and flamingos. A good cheap buffet can be found at monte carlo, it's $20 per person for dinner, lunch and breakfast are only $15 bargain! 5 - Shopping, if you love to shop then there are 3 good places you need to go....Las Vegas shopping outlet centre, just get on an express or deuce heading south up the strip it is the penultimate stop on the bus before it turns round and comes back down the strip. Tons of cheap shops there including a levis factory shop and nike factory shop. Next is the town centre square it think it was called, again lots of shops it's the stop before the Las Vegas shopping outlet centre, get off after Mandalay bay. The last place is the premium shopping outlet, lots more discount stores here, it can be found heading northbound and is the last stop on the bus just after freemont street. The last tip is duty free, buy it at the airport when you leave! I paid $50+tax for 200 Marlboro on the strip only to find they are $36+tax at the airport! Think that's about it, if you haven't been to Vegas you'll soon become addicted like we have there is so much to see and do it's a non stop party town! Once you've checked into the Encore and had a look at the other hotels you'll soon realise you've picked the best hotel on the strip it really is THAT good!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms but we had issues you won't expect at a luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 17th floor was spacious and clean. The bed and bedding were comfortable. The bathroom had a deep tub with a separate glass shower. It also had double sinks and a toliet room. I also appreciated the docking station for my IPhone. The fitness room had sufficient cardio equiptment- treadmills, bikes, and elipticals as well as weights and machines. However, we had some issues that I didn't expect. For instance, the first two nights someone ran up and down the hall screaming. My husband slept through it but I wasn't able to. The location is somewhat inconvenient. It's at one end of the strip and is quite a distance from other casinos and the closest monorail station. Also the control near the bed for the drapes and the scale did not function and even though I brought this to the hotel's attention, it was not fixed. I called concierge for information. The person wasn't able to provide the information and said she would call back with it bit never did. The lack of follow through and the nighttime noise was quite a surprise and disappointment. This was a splurge and I probably would not stay there again unless I was able to get the room at a significant discount. However, I don't go to Vegas much and do not know how the value of this hotel compares with other hotels on the strip. We usually go to Hawaii and have stayed at comparable hotels with much better service and no nighttime noise for much less. I would recommend the hotel but it would be with caveats.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with excellent dining.”
Reviews.Author: UFAlum88
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The rooms are fantastic. Beautifully appointed like the Wynn, but larger. There are even electronic drapes controlled by a remote next to the bed, that also controls all the lights, etc. I was able to set up my laptop, charging station and there was still room to spare. The only negative was the maid service. Sometimes I would be gone all day, only to come back at 5pm, and the room was still not made up. This is even with the "make up room" light illuminated. But over all, it was a great stay and I would recomend it to anyone. Please note, it is not a bargain, but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “one beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: mazeandblue
Reviews.Content: I checked in on Sunday March 6, 2011. The check in line zig- zagged around ropes. The line moved very quickly. The room was on the 59th floor. The room was amazing. The view was the best I have ever had. My view from the left looked at the wynn golf course and the airport. The center view was the Wynn hotel and the entire strip. The right side view was mountains and Summerlin area. An amazing view. The room had two beds and a couch in it. The staff was so friendly. I didn't meet anyone who wasn't extremely helpful to me. I've stayed at the Wynn many times but this was the first time at the Encore. I like the Wynn casino more, but I like the Encore rooms better. The hallway from the elevator to the end of the hallway where the rooms are, are shorter making for a better walk to get ice. The hallway from the elevator to rooms at the Wynn seem endless. The prices are high on everything at the Wynn/ Encore. Be prepared, but you'll be pampered as well. I highly recommend either the Wynn or the Encore they're the best in town.........

Reviews.Title: “Bright and airy as opposed to dark and dingy”
Reviews.Author: FairWinds1
Reviews.Content: Caesar's appears unable to put more than two 60 watt bulbs in a room. The Encore, OTOH, breaks the typical casino mold by being bright and airy. Even the Mirage, which used to be glitzy, now looks "yesterday" in comparison. King room (tower suite) was spectacular and compared very favorably with any five star we have stayed. The initial thought that it was too stark but after five minutes of examining all of the amenities in the room, one grew to appreciate the design and decor. Casino floor small and the days of lounge shows are long gone. Food and drinks overpriced, but the service was outstanding. Quality of either does not match the price. "Le Reve" requires some explanation and none is available. Convenient to other venues, of course, Wynn, but also Mirage, Venician, Palazzo, et al.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Great Rooms but Staff Tired”
Reviews.Author: globaltravelkid
Reviews.Content: Day 3 of our honeymoon and still not ONE word of mention from anyone at Wynn Encore. Victoria checked us in with such robotic-like efficiency I'll say we'll NEVER be back based on her tired, non-welcoming attitude alone. Whenever I would ask her opinion on a question she posed, she said "I can't decide for you, so which do you want?" Some lights burned out in room like in closet and over the minibar. No coffee service or tea kettle inroom but the $10 coffee downstairs was great. Pool experience was horrid as sardines and "Pool Boy" desk (cute name) never had a pool boy or anyone other than blondes walking around and selling drinks in plastic...no water, fruit, spritzers, or other pool amenities these days so often seen were apparent. A huge disappointment to be just a number on a honeymoon trial of this hotel which guarantees we'll not return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: uaboater216
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect Las Vegas hotel. Stayed on the 53rd floor and was very happy with my room and view. Bathrooms and beds are wonderful. Only complaint is with turndown service. You have to callnand request it, and even then they only show up to do turndown about 50% of the time. Still, Encore or Wynn are now the only hotels I will stay atbin Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “5* resort without the pretentious attitude!”
Reviews.Author: Neil791
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a 3 night stay at the Encore and I have nothing but good things to say. The surprisingly smaller gaming floor in comparison to other resorts was lovely as it gives a more intimate feel instead of the overly commercialized party atmosphere in other properties. Needless to say you will not see plastic yard cups and silly beads anywhere in Encore...thank goodness! The staff were very helpful and friendly and the room we stayed in (Resort Room) was very clean and tastefully decorated. Slots aren't worth spending too much on unless you've got money to burn but the dealers were all (for the most part) very friendly and willing to help novice players which was a very welcome change from other properties. We received two comped buffet passes based on our play (which wasn't very much) and it was a welcome end to a lovely trip as we used our buffet passes on our last day for lunch...make sure you bring your appetite! Well done Encore, we will definitly be back for another relaxing trip to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Athens_Greece_Val
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were impressed by the service, the bell desk took cake of our luggage until we checked in - which was done in 3-4 minutes. Even though the hotel's policy is to check in after 15.00 we were given our room in 13.00. The room was more than great, very spacious, with modern design, there is even a flat screen TV in the bathroom. We had a resort suite in the 21 floor which offered us a great view on the Strip from the large windows. What I appreciated the most, since I don't smoke is that the hotel has a very clear and fresh atmosphere. The casino is full of light, with big windows all around, unlike the other hotels' casinos. The concierge was very helpful and even helped us check in to our flight and printed our boarding pass. We didn't try any restaurant or nightclub at the Encore but we visited its sister hotel Wynn, had lunch at the Buffet and a drink at the Blush nightclub, it was also great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Truly a Special Place in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mike257
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for 6 days and had 3 at the Encore. We had a Panorama Suite on the 60th floor in the hotel and the room was truly stunning. Perfectly clean, crisp linens, a perfect view. The bathroom is a sight unto itself, with his and her sinks, a massive room, beautiful materials and everything is spotless. I enjoyed having controls of the lights and curtains from bed as I went to sleep. Laying in bed and opening the floor to ceiling curtains to show the strip lights at night from the 60th floor was something special to see. Our room was about 700 sq ft, the basic size at Encore and was truly beautifully decorated. As others have mentioned, don't touch the mini bar items on the top for more than 60 seconds, or they will be charged. If you have an issue just stop by the front desk it will be reversed. There is a resort fee of $20 per day, which is steep yes, but expected in Las Vegas nowadays. Internet, Faxing, Calls (international calls included) at least come with it. My girlfriend had a massage at Encore and I used the spa there as well. These are fantastic facilities! The best spa that ive ever seen. The showers, jacuzzis, rainfall showers, and amenities are all top notch. She mentioned that the massage was the best she's ever had. We ate at the Wynn buffet as well, truly fantastic. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: phadrn
Reviews.Content: Our room was a king suite and had every amenity you could wish for. The linens are phenominal, rotating TV for viewing in bedroom or sitting room, electronic drapes-you name it. We have stayed many places in Vegas and this is the best. Service in every restaurant was perfect, all common areas and casino are spotless. Checkout was a breeze on the TV and our bill was immediately emailed to us. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wynn made me an offer that I couldn't refuse.....”
Reviews.Author: valady12
Reviews.Content: Wynn made me an offer that I couldn't refuse.....a room for 2 at either Wynn or Encore for $119 with breakfast or lunch at the Wynn buffet each day for 3 night or longer stay. I suppose the winter months aren't the busiest for Las Vegas but the weather even though cool - 50s and 60s - it is snow and ice free. All of this for having one of their player cards and playing a slot machine for a couple of hours 2 years ago. And by the way I am just about as far from being a high roller as possible. My stay at Encore was wonderful - especially the service and the friendliness of the staff. Even after reading some very negative reviews - especially with references to terrible service - I was a little nervous but willing to give Encore a chance especially for the price. The positive experience started when I drove up to the entrance and the staff checked my luggage and said to call when I got to my room. The good things continued when I arrived at the front desk and found no line - at about 4 PM on a Tuesday. I asked about using the minibar for some medication and was offered a separate frig for no extra cost. The bellman who delivered my bags - within about 5 minutes of my call - gave me instructions on how everything in the room worked - drapes, lights, etc. Which was a good thing since there weren't any written instructions in the room. The room was comfortable and nicely furnished. I liked having a separate sitting area. I was offered a room with a panoramic view for $20 more - glad I didn't take them up on that offer. I had a nice view of the strip, the pool, and golf course from my south facing room on the 15th floor. Bottom line I had a great stay at a great price. I do think the $20 daily resort fee was excessive but it did include wifi in the room and some other not very useful services. Oh well, so I was paying $139 for the room not $119. WARNING Don't touch anything on the lovely display of goodies on top of the minibar - you will be charged!!! I had been warned by other reviews but there wasn't a sign that said the goodies weren't complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: tdogg5184
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and each time they seem to get better. I really cant reccomend any other property aside from Wynn on the strip and I have stayed at most of the better ones. The Good: When we arrived the bell attendent quickly got our bags, when we got to the check in desk we waited for a few minutes but once we got up there the girl was very nice and got us in to the room we requested quickly. Once we were in our room we got our bags pretty quickly. The rooms are gorgeous, hard to believe how detailed oriented their "basic" rooms are. The bathroom is huge and the view from the 18ft wall of windows is stunning, and the bed is probably the most comfy bed I have ever slept on. The reasturants and clubs are awesome but the lines at both can be pretty long, especially the buffet and XS. The Bad: If you like to go to sleep early you are likely going to be annoyed by the constant nightclub noise. You can hear it in the rooms up to 4am. However if you get a north view room there shouldnt be any noise but you lose the view of the strip. Everything is expensive on the property, as long as you know this going in you should be OK. Overall the property is gorgeous, take time to look around at all the detail that is put into everything. I really cant reccomend it enough although Wynn is a close second to Encore!

Reviews.Title: “Five stars hotel but no five stars service”
Reviews.Author: ila785
Reviews.Content: I had a 7 nights stay at Encore Tower suites. I will try to describe pros and cons of this resort. pros: beautiful decor, nice and calm atmosphere in the casino that was never too crowded and great concierge ( but I'm talking about Tower suites) Cons: room was nice but not so big as they say on their website, bath amenities are ridiculous for a such hotel, housekeeping service was one of the worst I have ever experienced in a five star hotel ( I had to ask everyday to vacuum the floor and change bed linen) and the service was very unpersonal with all the staff that seems to be interested only to tips. I also have two treatments at the spa: it is beautiful for its decor but you will find only few amenities and treatments have been nothing of special. Regarding restaurant I ate at Wynn several times: Tableau: it is the best secret of the resort, everything was exceptional. Wing lei: the best experience you can do at Wynn. Daniel boulud: food was only normal and service very slow. Sw steakhouse: tha same as DB Alex: one of the best culinary experience in my life but I know it is now closed. So, if you are looking for a five star resort without service you can choose Encore, but if you are like me and you are searching for real luxury and five star service try Mandarin oriental.

Reviews.Title: “"Nickle & Dimed" to Death -- Don't Go There”
Reviews.Author: chiaraGaithersburg
Reviews.Content: Come on, Steve Wynn can't provide even a bottle of complimentary water?? NO ROOM AMENITIES!!! $14.95/ day for wi-fi; $5/bottle water; $1.25 local calls; move anything at the mini-snack/bar for more than 60 seconds and you're charged $25; put anything in the refrig and you're charged $25!!! No coffee in the room; not even mouthwash! The room was lovely (however, no down pillows); the view was lovely, but that's it!! Dog barking in room next door kept us awake. Dogs in the rooms???? Breakfast? How about $60+ for 2 coffees; 2 juices; 1 muffin; 2 eggs/bacon/bagel. WOW No wonder old Steve is doing so well!!! Won't get more of our money.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: udontsavethose
Reviews.Content: Booked with Expedia to stay at this fabulous hotel and was not let down - the location of this hotel is ideal - not in the hustle and bustle of the centre strip but with a view from the 57th floor we felt every part of the Vegas experience. The decor of this hotel is sublime. There were only a few points that let this place down: 1. No coffee or tea facilities, 2. the mini bar (60 seconds or you would be charged for the item you moved plus a $25 restock fee). Was gutted when awakening on the first morning having arrived in darkness the night before - room had a perfect view of what only could be described as a perfectly manicured golf course - being a pauper I cold not aford the $500 green fee!! Would I stay here again - definately - would i like to have had more money at my disposal - definately! If you have money to burn this is the place to stay in Vegas - Book and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “luxury boutique hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: mcbain80
Reviews.Content: We loved the Encore for it's slight seclusion from the crazyness of the strip and its intimate lobby and amenities. The Encore/Wynn have by far the best restaurants and nightclubs on the strip and having them in our hotel was an excellent Luxury - think dinner beside a Koi pond (Bartolotta) and then dancing poolside to a world famous dj ( XS). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Encore and will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: NikosRunner
Reviews.Content: The room was 60 square meters and just perfect with view over the Strip avenue. The hotel had great restaurants and bars. I cannot think of something bad.

Reviews.Title: “Far From the Maddening Crowd”
Reviews.Author: MarylandDani
Reviews.Content: This is the best location if you want to be in Las Vegas but not exactly IN Las Vegas. It is close to everything, and walking distance to most other hotels. Of course walking in Las Vegas in the summer might not be the best thing for your health, which is why they have very expensive taxis to shuttle you around. The rooms are suites, very large, very new and clean, huge windows and if you get there early enough you might score one with a view of the strip. We got one that overlooked a massive abandoned construction site; this was the "mountain" view and you could see a mountain in the distance. The bathrooms are also big, new, clean, although it was hard to keep the temperature down. The beds are very comfortable, the sitting room and desk perfect. Housekeeping was a bit careless since they did not remove last guest's half filled water bottle and some Asian pears, but the pears were good too. And they did come pretty quick to take it all away. Service was excellent and the show Le Reve was awesome. The casino is not as noisy and crowded as others we saw, but it sure looked like you could lose your money just as quick. In general the decor is in better taste throughout. Not much to complain about, though I like to have a coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “So Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Scout216
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place for a relaxing, romantic get away! Yes it's Vegas with lots of people, lights and action, but when you are just about anywhere in the Wynn Encore it is elegant & beautiful! Step into the elevator and up to your room in the over 60 floor high rise, it is spacious, clean, quiet and luxurious. The views are fantastic from the rooms, with comfortable beds and a fabulous bathroom. I highly recommend the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Comparable to Bellagio”
Reviews.Author: Graftarian
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a number of hotels in las Vegas and this is as nice as any of them. The cleanliness and quality of service was similar to Bellagio, but I preferred the atmosphere at The Wynn Encore. I travelled with a group of friends and without exception we loved the place. Staff were very friendly and rooms are absolutely beautiful. The only downside The Wynn is that it's quite a way away from the centre of the strip. Next time around I'll be trying Planet Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: beachguybry
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel that lived up to its high quality and standard. The dinner buffet was pricey $39 but worth every penny. Everything we tried was great. The gambling room was nice and didn't stink like smoke like most of the other hotels did. We are non smokers and it bothers us so it was nice at encore to try the slots and not be choking. It was a little busier at Wynn and a little smokier than where we were at Encore. Our room was on the 28th floor very quiet facing the north and nice views of the mountains and the old Las Vegas and downtown. Coffee and tea came to $10 bucks in the cafe restaurant bar at the foot of the elevators was nice for convenience as we need our fuel in the morning being from Canada it is a staple for us. We noticed a Dennys located just north of the hotel and a short walk if you wanted a cheap quick breakfast. We rented a car right in the hotel for $90 total for a day and did some sight seeing. You could get one at the airport and return it there if that worked for you better. The shows in Vegas are worth seeing. We saw Ka the circe de solei. It was amazing and worth every penny. I was skeptical as they said it was martial arts but anyone would enjoy it and appreciate the skills in the show. It was a little slow to get going but once it did you are in awe. You can get cheap tickets across the road in front of the fashion mall at TIX4 LESS and save on any shows that are not sold out from it's venue. We saw them set up as booths along the strip as well. Just look for that name. We would definitely go back and stay at Encore at Wynn again. Service was exceptional. Room was very clean daily and fresh clean towels etc. No shortage of call girls any where in vegas and they are not hard to spot even in the hotels. They are pre- arranged or booked from the the thousands of street vendors pushing their cards which you will see littered on the ground early in the mornings. We also visited the Premium Outlet Mall which had good prices on many brand name stores about half hour strip bus ride north. It is the last stop on the line. You can pay $7 and ride all day up and down the strip and many designated stops along the way in either a double decker or double length bus. The double length one is the only one that goes as far as the outlet stores though.

Reviews.Title: “Pure decadence”
Reviews.Author: eclecticritic
Reviews.Content: This place is not cheap, but if you've got some money burning a hole in your pocket, or you can get a reasonable convention rate, this hotel will not disappoint. They've thought of everything, or at least the most important things, and it shows. I was sad to have to leave.

Reviews.Title: “The supreme jewel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: I had the outrageous good fortune and being offered a comp to stay at the Encore based,I presume, on an afternoon's play at Wynn's some months ago. What a treat! The room I received was phenomenally beautiful with a view of the northern part of the strip and the mountains beyond from the ceiling to floor windows. One feels one is flying.The bed was absolutely one of the most comfortable sleep experiences I have had in years. Every detail and amenity in the room and bathroom was exquisite. The bathrobes hanging invitingly in the bathroom, the two shower source stall,the deep luxurious towelling, the Bambu gels and shampoos...etc. The staff were obviously not hired. They were cast to act out the best in service and pampering and amiable response to any request. The casino, though not large by Vegas standards, has a good array of playable machines that actually give you play for your money. I spent a couple of hours playing one video poker machine based on an initial $60.00 investment and left with more than I began with. The atmosphere is luxurious and relaxed yet not pretentious or intimidating. I ate at both Stratta and Sinatra's which was delicious and expensive and very worth it. There you get what you pay for in every department. I can only hope to get invited back (I played as long as I could and ended up only a little in the red, so my hopes are up!) but if I don't I might even break down and pay to stay there so good was the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Customer Experience”
Reviews.Author: casamoir
Reviews.Content: If you go to Vegas... you need to stay here. The experience from checkin to departure was amazing. They go out of there way with every little detail to ensure that you are having a memorable stay. The staff are the best at any hotel I've stayed at - they really care about their guests and it's sincere. They love their jobs. Everywhere you look, the decor, lighting, furniture, colors, carpets etc. are just spectacular. The people watching is the best in Vegas and the restaurants are one better than the next. We ate at SW Steakhouse (while watching the spectacular water music show outside) and Bartolotta which was excellent too. Pricey but worth a splurge for a special occasion. Oh and the fitness center was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale large hotel with small boutique feel”
Reviews.Author: meheartsthevacays
Reviews.Content: What I liked most about this hotel is that the casino is relatively small and there's only one elevator bank. Because we did this trip with extended family, it was nice and easy to find each other in the casino. Also, there's one main bar right at the base of the elevator banks, making it an easy meeting spot. Despite being in a hotel with a more boutique feel, you're attached to the Wynn. So you can walk over (although it's sort of a long walk) and enjoy the shopping (all in a corridor which attaches the Encore to the Wynn) and "big" casino at the Wynn. The rooms were gorgeous -- very spacious. They were all suites with separate bedroom and seating areas. Large bathrooms. The pricing was reasonable, although certainly not cheap compared to the myriad of less expensive options in Vegas. This was my second stay at this hotel and I anticipate there will be many more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful all the way around.”
Reviews.Author: Justin1674
Reviews.Content: Rooms are beautiful, staff is excellent. Very much a 5 star hotel, very tasteful decor.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed every minute of it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Luscious1xox
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Staff has superb Customer Service Skills. I did encounter a problem when I checked in (they wanted to charge me over a thousand dollars for incentives, or Resort "Fee" for my entire stay, March 26-April 2nd 2010). And after speaking with management, I was informed that they would gladly refund my money and I can make reservations elsewhere. But after CAREFUL consideration, management relented, and I was given a key to my lovely room. The room and bathroom was exactly as I expected; Clean and comfy. The flat screen in the room has your name on it as well as the telephone. Those little details made me feel a little special. I ordered room service; a slice of chocolate cake, coconut crunch ice cream (2 scoops) and a little 5 oz. soda came to $35.00. But it's a Five Star Hotel and we were on vacation so why not. Overall, I would definitely stay at the Encore/Wynn Hotel again. For dining out, I recommend the PH Westgates Resort all you can buffet, or In and Out Burger, lol!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Second Time did not disappoint, but...”
Reviews.Author: Ditto032791
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at this hotel. It is definitely in a class by itself. The rooms are fabulous and clean and the hotel and the casino give you the feeling of being in a luxury boutique hotel. We ate at Sinatra's and it was great. Service and food was spectacular. My only minor complaint is that if you use the Spa, they now charge $40 per person per day and have removed some of the perks such as unlimited juices and coffee. I know this is a small issue, but it appeared to me that they are nickel and dimming. The staff and everything else the hotel has to offer is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel at the end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: TanoshiiTravel
Reviews.Content: The Encore At Wynn is a gorgeous hotel with everything you would expect from a Las Vegas hotel. Service at this hotel is top-notch. I experienced quite a bit of personal drama during my trip and I deferred to some of the staff for some help. They went above and beyond the call of duty. Very friendly people work here. Some of my highlights from my stay at the hotel including my manicure service at the spa. Attentive and well-trained staff helped put my mind at ease while I relaxed during the treatment. Food at the hotel is very tasty. There are many different restaurants to choose from so you don't have to go to the same place everyday. Typically I would go down to the restaurant near the elevators for breakfast. Sorry, I don't recall what the name is. The shopping is luxurious- retail therapy at its finest. If you are a shoe lover like I am, be sure to check out the Manolo Blahnik boutique in the Wynn. I think I might have bought too many pairs of shoes! The hotel doesn't have that stinky casino (re: smoky) smell. The carpets are regularly cleaned so no need to worry about having a hard time breathing in the casino. If you like the nightlife, XS is one of the hottest clubs right now. It's located right in the Encore so be sure to check it out if that is your scene. For any of your event needs go to the concierge desk. I got 2nd row, center tickets to see Blue Man Group. The woman at the desk was extremely accommodating and helped me decide what to do with my night. My room was very comfy. The design reminded me of a posh loft with a bedroom and sitting room area. The bathroom was well-kept and there are no complaints in that area. Now for the negative: the Encore is at the end of the Strip. You can obviously take a cab wherever you want to go but if you are hoping to walk everywhere, expect to walk at least 15 minutes to get to the most populated parts of the Strip. For me this wasn't a big deal but I could see why this is a drawback for some. Note: there is no coffeemaker in the room and the mini-fridge is stocked with mini-bar items and no room for your own goods. Don't pick up with and inspect the mini-bar stuff- you will be charged for anything that is lifted off the sensor for more than maybe 30 seconds. The Encore is a good option if you want to be on the Strip and have the action close by, but not right in your face. I will definitely be returning to Vegas and the Encore is a hotel I would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “High end hotel, quiet and filled with old people”
Reviews.Author: Jetsettergal_11
Reviews.Content: The Encore is a beautiful hotel! The rooms are stunning and very clean. The casino is very small, but it connects to The Wynn casino, which is very big. There are not a lot of places to eat in the hotel and everything to eat is very expensive. The location of this hotel stinks. It is near the end of the strip and a far walk away from many places. My boyfriend and I stayed here and we were probably the youngest one's there. We are both 29 and found it to be quite boring there. If you are looking for rest, relaxation and silence, this is the place. If you are looking for a good time with friends and to meet others, you are better off staying at The Venetian or Caesar's Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: randapex
Reviews.Content: We received a promo for this hotel. We went mid-week which I think is better if you're not into crowds and higher table limits. The room was very nice. 27th floor with an almost 180 degree view of the mountains. Kinda spooky when you look down. As mentioned, they have a small refrigerator but it's stocked with pay beverages no room for you own stuff. And NO COFFEE MAKER!!! Come on...reallly? There is a nice bar at the elevators that has lattes and pastries so, all is not lost, you just have to leave the room for it. I'd read that the table limits at this hotel were high but the craps table was $10 day and night so, for those who're used to the $5 ones downtown, at least you can play with a little betting adjustment. Same for BJ. $10 tables were available. Not a lot of people gambling here but again, mid-week in February. Blue man group was awesome. We picked up discounted tickets at the Mall across the street to the TItantic exhibit at the Luxor. Very cool to see all the items they've recovered. The buffet wasn't the best but it had lots of food. We went to the shopping Mall across the street for lunch several times. They have a food court on the top level. Had a great Italian meal at the Stratta in the Wynn casino. Very friendly and accomodating staff. So, the Hotel is a little out of the way, I was surprised to find the cabs charge by time now, not miles so it's great fun to watch the meter ticking up as you wait at the stop lights... It is a nice place and I'd recommend it if you're looking for a place to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The best customer service I've ever received”
Reviews.Author: EastEnglandTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore in January. We had a fantastic stay. Whilst there I bought some souvenirs in the gift shop to bring home. Once home I realised they hadn't put a mouse pad in the shopping bag that I had paid for. My husband completed their after stay questionaire and stated a small comment regarding this on the bottom of the form. We received an email 2 days later asking for our address. I received my mouse pad yesterday with a very kind note inside apologising. This really pleased me. I don't think I have ever received such good customer service anywhere. They had sent it via UPS to the UK. The hotel is fantastic, very grown up. The buffet is the best in Vegas. Rooms beautiful, just as we expect now when staying in Vegas. We have stayed at a few of the 5 star hotels along the strip, the Encore is at the top of our list. Try it, you will love it. Some good deals via Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Could be amazing -if only the service was improved...”
Reviews.Author: HillsonHols
Reviews.Content: After a very long (but good BA) flight the last thing you want is to run into difficulties at check in but unfortunately that is exactly what happened to us. The outcome was not favourable after 1 hour of complaining and saw us having to move rooms the following day to obtain the interconnection that was soo important to us (and indeed the reason we chose this hotel). Just one of a number of little niggles which should be avoided in this type of high end hotel. Gorgeous rooms - the MOST comfortable bed ever...we did not crave returning to our own beds which is so often the case after holidays. In fact we crave returning to this bed if the truth be known lol!!! This hotel is not near the hub of the strip and in future would probably stay closer to the action because an hours walking and you still seem to be just along from this hotel - but I guess thats Vegas for you... Tried the Japanese in the hotel which was very nice but felt overpriced for what it was - but again I guess thats Vegas for you.... Saw Holly Maddison in the Peep Show - very good and close to the action with our VIP seats!! Gambling expensive here with typical min blackjack bets of $25. In summary - gorgeous hotel to look at, service for us needed attention and bit too far from the hub of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “when you open the door to the room...the view was AMAZING. I wanted to move in.”
Reviews.Author: SanDSI
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Vegas for over 20 years. I've stayed at every hotel on the strip at least once. I remember when the Bellagio was new, you could sit for hours in your room watching the fountains. It's romantic and special. Steve Wynn knows how to make a hotel WORK. The ENCORE is no exception. You're made to feel special the minute you walk in. This hotel is not 'brand new' though there isn't that awful cigarette smoke smell anywhere. I don't know why, but I want the same ventilation system in my home. The attention to detail is noted the second you drive in the parking garage. It's big, clean, bright, and easy to navigate. I like Wynn properties because they get you checked in FAST and into a room that you reserved. I'm not a big gambler and not on any VIP list with them. They just seem to genuinely want you to have a great trip. It's working. The room was perfect, the bed that you sink into, and the view...I was so exhausted when I arrived, I almost cried that I got to spend 3 days here. Dramatic, I know...Wished I wasn't working. Yes, everything is expensive, but if you're going to spend $ on a hotel in Vegas and want something nice, do yourself a favor and spend a little extra and stay here. It's worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: betchason
Reviews.Content: Three years ago my wife and I stayed at the Palazzo and love it but decided to try someplace different just for the experience so we chose the Encore for our long weekend of shows and fine dining. If you want a recommendation on the Encore for gambling I cannot help you we don't gamble other than dinning at unknown restaurants. The Encore is beautiful especially if you like the color red and the rooms have floor to ceiling windows for spectacular views of the strip if your room is high enough, unfortunatley they said they only had our preferred 2 Queen room available on the 7th floor which gave a wonderful panoramic view of the roof of the casino. I suppose our biggest disappointment was with the fact that most the restaurants open to the casino which greatly diminished the enjoyment of our dining experiences. We did have a lovely meal at Sinatra but other than the unique ambience there was nothing really remarkable about the meal itself. Another annoyance was the fact that the Encore did not open their pool decks for lounging like the other hotels we visited when we received the gift of glorious 75 degree weather, very disappointing. My highest praise goes to "Dance with Me" the Encore's tribute to Frank Sinatra. If you like Frank and appreciate really amazing dancers, this is the show for you. All in all a nice trip but a little disappointing, I doubt there will be an encore visit for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: KyTracy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Wynn before but would be hard pressed to stay there over Encore next time. Our room was on the 62nd floor and gave us an amazing view of the Strip, the airport, and the golf course. Everything about our stay was nice. The room was very comfortable and relaxing. We have stayed at other resorts on the Las Vegas Strip. I doubt we'll stay anywhere but a Wynn property for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happy2travelnow
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel. Staff was very helpful, accommodating, and the room, with separate living area, was luxurious and beautiful. Stay was a package deal, with some free buffet meals and tickets to the Encore's signature show, La Reve. The show is an aquatic, acrobatic eye-opener, beautifully executed. Meals and buffets were excellent. The Encore is linked to the Wynn, where the La Reve theater is located..

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: rangerfanDallasTx
Reviews.Content: One of our favorite places to stay. Great room, very comfortable, wonderful view of the mountains. Enjoyed the dueling pianos and Dance With Me Show was great. Will be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: brownsf
Reviews.Content: We had a spacious and comfortable suite with nice views of the mountains. Very important to me--our room was quiet. Even though we were near the elevators, we didn't hear a sound. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Had breakfast, lunch and dinner at the buffet (on different days) and it was excellent. I'm not a big Las Vegas fan, but the Encore was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: kbranman
Reviews.Content: beautifully and ecologically re-decorated. the suites are spacious and very well-appointed. mattress is ok - better than most. (i'm a mattress manufacturer so this is the first thing i check!). great towels, huge bathroom, swivel TV serves both sitting area AND bedroom. big negative was pressure sensitive fridge which prevents guests from adding any of their own food or removing any of the resort food without being charged. want a supplemental fridge? it will cost you $25. FABULOUS buffet (not super cheap but an EXCELLENT value - don't judge by the limited listings outside). free internet and free valet parking add value. one of the nicest places i've stayed in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Encore...It's Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: GeeMoneyCA
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell: Loved our room, floor to ceiling windows, living area, tv in bathroom & electronic blinds. Great shops & restaurants too--tried several. Missed the club & pool so can't comment on those areas. Spa was really nice & we booked appts & used the exercise room also. Be sure to get a smoothie! Only complaint: needs a real coffee shop/stand like Starbucks or something. The little restaurant off the lobby served coffee in the morning & it was good but there was a pretty long wait time.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: ribbangga
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Wynn before when it opened so I knew what to expect. Encore surpassed my expectations my a mile. I love it. I love the color red so that helps. I had the standard room (3444). High ceilings plush bddding, and nice entertainment with the tv and iPod docking stereo. My biggest problems were with the panel that controls the drapery. It was broken when I got there so a guy came to fix it. It worked then broke again. Except it was too late and Sunday morning the sun poured in. Not good when you wanted to catch up on sleep. My cordless phone had a dead battery they changed it too. I have tmobile and the Service in the room was bad. So I needed the phone in the rooms. The last day of my trip my safe didn't open, and my iPad was in it, so a security guy opened it for me. Nothing terrible in my opinion, but that's the kind of person I am. I ate at Sinatra and was very happy with the prices food and service. No major complaints, even the resort fee of $20 came in useful with the phone and wireless. Checking in on a Saturday took all of 10 mins. I got casino rates so the prices were not bad, but I might think twice if I had to pay the full shot. Being at the north end of the strip keeps me out of walking distance to cosmo bellagio and Caesars that I like to go to. So taxis got annoying, but again, part of the package. I'll stay again and as often as I can.

Reviews.Title: “High-end, very luxurious hotel. Not central on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: kwickly
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Encore and were very impressed with the property, the decor and the general ambience. As others have mentioned. the restaurants are pricey and I was annoyed at having to pay $40/day to use the steam room and sauna (located in the spa). The casino was nice and well-venitalated. Staff were all helpful and friendly, although I will agree that there was always a wait to speak to someone at the check-in desk. One thing to be aware of is that this hotel is not central on the strip. It is at the far end of the strip and it would take you close to an hour to walk to the end where MGM and New York New York are. The Deuce bus is your best bet for $7/day...the monorail is a complete joke. It is nice to be in close proximity to the Fashion SHow mall (there are cheap eats there) and also to the Palazzo and Venetian which are also very nice hotels to spend time walking though or gambling in. I do feel like we've been spoiled though in terms of the luxurious stay we had at the Encore. Any other Vegas hotel will feel second rate after this.

Reviews.Title: “asked for a quiet room and got 3222 next to the elevator !!!”
Reviews.Author: Exploration-2day
Reviews.Content: This is an OK place to stay, but make sure you dont get a sadist checking you in. Did not sleep the whole night, although I specific requested a QUIET room! From the moment of arrival this hotel was a disaster in customer service: Valet is only available if you enter a specific line (1 from 6 I guess). Other hotels in vegas you just pull up and somebody takes care of your car. The guy checking me in could not find my reservation in his "system" and did not care to see my confirmation !!! Later I talked to the manager on duty who wasnt at much help either. Unfortunately I had to talk to the manager above the manager (???) to get just a little understanding. Never the less I got checked in to a room, where I was fortunate enough to be kept awake the whole night listening to the elevator-noise. I am writing this reviwew at 3:48 in the morning. Almost 4 hours after getting back from dinner... :-( Yes - now I could call the reception and ask for another room, but my partner is sleeping. The good thing about this resort is, that half of the staff working in the casino's and restaurant's actually care for their customers. So 50% of your stay is something close to perfect. I like that :-) So - getting a quiet room and a good nights sleep would bring this property a 4 star review. From me 2 stars because of the 50% wonderful staff working "on the floor". Better luck next time in vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but formal, dated, questionable location, and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mikeatlarge
Reviews.Content: First the good news. The rooms at the Encore are very nice. There are lots of extra touches even most nice hotels don't have--like a flatscreen TV and scale in the huge bathroom (this was a "Deluxe Suite"). They're also relatively quiet beyond people making noise in the hallway. The bed is great, the linens and toiletries are great, and housekeeping does a good job. My one gripe about the room is the safe is about 3" deep and impossible to put even a small laptop in. Le Reve, in the Wynn theater, is an above average show. It's probably most similar to the Cirque show "O" and is well done. The fitness center is fairly well equipped for a hotel, very clean and wasn't crowded. More good news is this hotel doesn't really have some cheesy theme like many. It's not trying to be something else. So that's nice. There are butterflies everywhere, however. Then there's the bad news. Check in took over a half hour--the longest by far I've ever spent at a strip hotel. There were lots of empty positions at the reception counter but apparently no employees to staff them. The hotel is also designed for profit rather than ease of getting around. For example, you pretty much have to walk through or by the casino to get much of anywhere.
