And, inexplicably, they bury the room elevators *behind* a cafe and force you to walk all the way around 3 sides of the cafe just to get to your room. It's stupid and annoying. There's more bad news depending on your tastes, how you want to spend your time in Vegas, your budget, and perhaps your age. For being a relatively new hotel, the Encore and Wynn are seriously old school in some ways. They have the same ugly gold oval signs everywhere that you see in hotels that are 20+ years old. The Encore uses the same old-school layout of putting most of the restaurants around the main casino instead of off by themselves. It would appear Steve Wynn is rather set in some of his ways. If you like his older properties, you'll feel right at home here. And speaking of Steve Wynn he's everywhere. You call for reservations and listen to him on hold. You turn on the TV and he starts talking to you. His name is plastered all over the hotel, all over billboards, and on ads throughout Vegas. I've never met the man but apparently he likes to indulge his ego and he never stops selling. If you don't plan on leaving the hotel much, it's not an issue, but the Encore/Wynn is located towards the north end of the strip. There's very little anyone staying at the Encore would want to visit north of the hotel--a huge piece of land under construction, some small seedy strip malls, and further north, the tired Circus Circus and Stratosphere. Most of the action is south of the Encore/Wynn. So, whether you're walking, driving, or taking a cab, it can take a long time to get to say City Center (home of the new Aria hotel). Traffic on the strip is horrible much of the day and night and it can be a 30+ minute cab ride from say the Luxor to the Encore. So if you plan to check out other things on the strip you might want to be more centrally located. Almost everything in the Encore/Wynn is seriously overpriced. Just a very basic light breakfast with coffee will easily set you back $25 or $30 per person with tax and tip. A beer can be $8. Unlike many strip hotels, there are very few reasonably priced places here. So, depending on your budget, you may find yourself wanting to leave just not to get ripped off eating your meals. Beware they also charge a daily "Resort Fee" on top of your room/package rate. But at least it includes free internet and access to the fitness center (gym). Finally, there's a certain "attitude" among many of the guests and even some of the staff towards catering to the wealthy. This place is a good fit for those who wear $1000+ outfits. The more casual might feel a bit out of place at times.

Reviews.Title: “Best Premier Hotel In All Of Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: stormchaser4ever
Reviews.Content: This is one classy hotel! It truly is a stunningly beautiful hotel. The grounds are perfectly manicured, every inch of the hotel is immaculately cleaned. The hotel staff is the more attentive that I have ever had the pleasure of dealing with; from the front desk to the concierge to the bartenders & waiters and the casino staff. Simply incredible and impeccable service, all the way through! My boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights in a Panoramic View suite. It was gorgeous. We enjoyed the most incredible views of the surrounding mountains as sunrise illuminated them in warm hues of pinkish-yellow light. Restaurants and bars at both Encore and Wynn are both spectacular though pricey. We enjoyed a marvelous steak dinner at SWITCH Restaurant. As far as buffets go, the Bellagio supposedly has best that there is...NOT SO! We ate at the Bellagio buffet once. It was tasty but in our opinion, the buffet at EncoreiWynn wins, hands down. The buffet offers something to delight every palette. The vibe is far less frenzied than at the Bellagio. Having checked out many of the hotels up and down the strip (Bellagio, Ceasars Palace, Mirage, Venetian and several others), the Encore exudes the classiest vibe in EVERY aspect. We found the other hotels to be somewhat overcrowded, frenzied, gaudy and loud. Even the casino areas at Encore and Wynn are uncrowded and less noisy. As stated earlier, Encore IS pricey ($300 per night or more). Now, if those rates are too high for you, check out RUMOR BOUTIQUE HOTEL (directly across from the Hard Rock Hotel). Rumor is beautiful and on par, comfort wise, to Encore. It's king-sized beds are plushy and delicious to sleep in. We stayed there for 1 night and LOVED it! It's ultra sleek and modern (no casino on premise) but 24hr outside pool (beautiful) and jacuzzi, on premise restaurant, bar and in-house parties. We had a gorgeous suite with king bed, jacuzzi tub, balcony overlooking the pool courtyard and living room, for $140 per night. They also provide free adult channel TV. We would DEFINITELY stay again at either of (or both) of these hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: WannaBNomad
Reviews.Content: The Encore Hotel, part of the Wynn is a GREAT place to stay. Our original room was 2 queen beds, strip view, on the 19th floor (1924). The front desk agent had warned us that the nightclub might keep us awake if we were light sleepers. We didn't think it would be a problem and took the room anyway. Room 1924, the room we were given, is the room closest to the elevator. Even though it was a non-smoking floor the room smelled funny. My friend and I couldn't decide if it was a smoke smell or a burnt toast smell, but either way, not good. The room size for 2Q layout is the same as the 1K layout with the exception of the dividing wall. So essentially, all the furniture in the 2Q room is pushed up against one wall. There is a huge open space on the TV side of the room. I feel like the Queen room is a definite step down from the King room. It's almost like they knew they needed it, but didn't want to spend one second thinking about it. Go for the King room if at all possible. The view from the 19th floor wasn't that great. All I remember was the lights of the McDonald's sign. Because of the smell and everything else, we decided to wait for the bellman and move to the 15th floor. Our room, #1547 was at the end of the hallway, just down from the requisite ice machine. We never heard or saw anyone use the ice machine, so our proximity wasn't an issue. Our new view was the "mountain view." Just a few more hotels and a big church. Not too bad though. I didn't feel like we missed out on the view at all. Our room didn't smell which was more important to us. Other people have mentioned the sensor-based accounting system for the fridge. You can pick an item up to look at it, but after 60 seconds you'll be charged for it. No big deal if you know about it. Our check-in guy was really good and told us about it. Our room, although on the other side of the building, did have some noise. We heard the people from the floor above or below us through the ventilation system. It wasn't really loud, just tinny sounding. Next to the right side of the bed is the controller for the lights and drapes. There are small icons on each side of the button, so while you can just push the button, you may not get the desired outcome. For instance, if you're going to open the blinds, look for the button that looks like the open elevator door button. This is REALLY important for the lights. One wrong push of the button and your partner will be rudely awakened. The All Off button is really nice, when you go to bed, but pushing this button and then walking to the door can be hazardous to your health! If you're looking for plugs to recharge your phone, plug in the computer, etc. There aren't many. On at least one lamp there is a plug on the base of the bed-side lamps. The only other easily accessible plug is near the desk. We had to move the sofa to get to the plug behind it. Strangely, there is a fax machine in the room. The bathrooms are great, just like other luxury hotels in Vegas. The lighting is great! Some other hotels are too dark, this one was just right! It even had a night light! Housekeeping was varied. On one hand, they were great. We called down for a lint roller and they were packaged so nicely when they were delivered we had to call and see if we were charged for them! When they were delivered, we were out, so they left them on the bar. Afterwards, they called to make sure they were satisfactory. On the other hand, we used the iron and left it on the floor near the windows. They never put it away, which leads me to believe they never went to that side of the room. It sat there for 3 days, until we put it away. Now for the public areas: Overall the Encore is more modern than the Wynn. The primarily red color scheme is bright and cheery. The colorful butterflies are Asian inspired and not child-like at all. In short, inviting while still being elegant. The casino is nice, of course. It's not smoky, like other hotels. Minimums are higher than some places - what else would you expect? Thursday night we got in late and ate at Stratta (see my review for that). We ate at the buffet Sunday morning (I'll do a fully review at some point), but it was just good, not great. It had an amazing array of desserts. The sundries store is great and has most of what you need. I specifically needed things to keep me from continually stepping out of my shoes. They have those! I needed hair mousse - they had that too, but only in a gigantic bottle - they did have hair gel in a small bottle though. My only issue was that none of the sodas had a price on them. If you're staying in the hotel you get VIP access to the nightclubs - and the lines get really really long. I can't imagine any club that is that important to get into! Checkout lines get a bit long. Either grab yourself a champagne at the lobby bar, like I did, or do the express checkout!

Reviews.Title: “My review will not do it justice, stunning hotel/resort.”
Reviews.Author: Pay74
Reviews.Content: Ok where do I begin on this one? Firstly after reading the reviews on the Encore on here with most being favourable we booked up for 11 nights back in March to arrive in November, we were slightly dubious over a fair amount of reviews that mentioned at checkout they have cards swiped for large depositis and also were offered room upgrades for about $20. We never got any of that which was good as it was a 3rd party type booking in fact this we agreed was best check in we have ever had, the girl on reception was very helpful. On check in we were given our room key-cards which double up us your bonus cards for casino play (more on this later) we were also delighted to be given $75 resort credit which basically meant we got a nice meal one night. Room is top class, ours faced to north strip but is still a great view, bed, bathroom and TV all excellent the room is perhaps best I have stayed in. One thing is the mini bar which is weighted so if you pick up an item you have 60secs to put it back or you will be charged, the room should come with its own fridge and tea/coffee making facilities, that is only dissapointing room aspect. We played the 1c machines not spending a lot but we earned 2 free buffets, a meal in the society café and $10 with a water bottle. Once you have checked in and go out for first time to to Red card desk and ask about the benefits of the card (room key). You will not be let down by this stunning hotel, when we go back to Vegas we probably will try another Hotel maybe one at City Centre but that is purely to stay in another nice hotel. I would stay at Encore again in a heartbeat. As usual drinks are free at the machines and are served very quickly with superb service, in the bars you will pay about $14 for a cocktail and $6 or $7 for a bottle of beer, all the bars are nice and offer a different atmosphere in each. I will say maybe to snack in the Hotel it’s a bit expensive but across the road is the Fashion show mall which has a food court with all the major players inside, the location of the Encore is heading to the North of the strip it’s as far North as we would stay, I would say 10-15 min walk to Mirage area but that’s from room, bare in mind 5 mins will be walking through the Wynn itself. Depending on how busy the streets are its about 30mins to City centre area. Well I hope this review helps your decision and enjoy Vegas. Please feel free to contact me if you need any help or information Holidays are noy cheap you want to make sure you enjoy it, at The Encore you will.

Reviews.Title: “AAA+ Experience”
Reviews.Author: KatieK144
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Encore for two nights in the middle of summer - it was so hot that we couldn't stay outside on the strip for long! The hotel is located at the South end of the strip, but isn't far away from everything else - a 15 minute walk got us to the Bellagio and other casinos, and there is the Fashion Mall right across the road with great shops. From our arrival we knew we had picked a great hotel - the decor was fun and upbeat, with giant butterflies and other motifs decorating the walls and floor. The casino is right near the check in area, and all done up in red - looks amazing. We had a Panoramic Suite King room which was beautiful. Marble floors; ceiling to floor windows; large bathroom with bath, shower and his&her sinks; king size bed; tv's; separate sitting area with lounge and writing desk; and a mini fridge. Decor was stylish - the only complaint I have about the room was that the windows were streaky. Room was a very big size too. The pool area of the hotel is AMAZING. There are two pools at Encore, and guests can also go to the Wynn pool areas. One of the pools at Encore is a topless pool (optional of course) and surrounds a huge bar. Waitresses come and take your drink order and music plays at all times. Cabanas can be hired, but there are plenty of lounges and towels all provided. Restaurants at the hotel were also amazing, and had several different ones to choose from. The shops were stunning, with Chanel, Prada etc being the main line up. The Spa was expensive, but well worth it. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel--would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: hturner21
Reviews.Content: It is beautiful! Definitely smaller and more intimate than the Wynn, and less crowded (which I loved)! But, there were less tables, restaurants, and bars so we walked to the Wynn a lot for that. The rooms were beautiful, service great, and we loved it! The decorating details all over are amazing and really set it apart as a classy hotel. We got an email deal as a past Wynn guest and saved some money on the room. We didn't use the pool or spa though.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel but too big to expect stellar, personalized service”
Reviews.Author: ho_ho_holidays
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Right opposite Fashion Show Mall, located at one end of the strip (so you're not really in the middle of everything else). But not to worry, there is more than enough things going on within Wynn/Encore to keep you occupied! You're a short walk to the other nearer casinos like Treasure Island and Venetian. You CAN walk further to Bellagio, MGM etc. but it'll take a while (half an hour?) and the scorching hot Vegas sun isn't really conducive to walking much. Oh, there's a Hertz (or Avis?) car rental right in the hotel building itself, so that's very convenient if you're renting a car! ROOMS: The rooms are really spacious and plushly decorated. Big bathroom. In the room we were in, the lounge/living area was separated from the bedroom area by a counter where the TV sat. The TV was on a swivel so you could watch it in bed or turn it around if you were in the living room. It's a very very comfortable room to just relax in. But be sure to get a room on the higher floors as the nightclub is REALLY REALLY LOUD and goes on til the wee hours of the morning. No problem if you're a heavy sleeper like me, but my husband is not and couldn't fall asleep at all. A couple other gripes: 1) There were potato chip crumbs in one of the drawers!!! The cleaners overlooked that! Not acceptable for a 5 diamond hotel. 2) No bedroom slippers?? I know hotels are cutting costs, but like I said, this is a 5 diamond hotel! Bedroom slippers are a basic amenity. 3) No complimentary water and ice cubes. We've stayed in many many 5 star resorts around the world and there is ALWAYS complimentary water and ice cubes. The only places that don't have them are hotels less than a 4 star. These are not big problems at all... but when you're talking about 5 star/diamond hotels, it is precisely these small things that make the difference. SERVICE: Staff are nice and friendly, service is good but nothing terribly memorable. Compared to the Mandarin Oriental (on the other side of the Strip), it kinda falls short. You can read my review on the Mandarin's exceptional, personalized service (to the point where the doorman remembers your name and remembers you if you've stayed at there before!) FOOD: Lots of options within the hotel - reasonable and high end too. Didn't try too many restaurants but the Chinese restaurant was really good! Nice bars and cafes around the place where you can lounge and have an afternoon drink. AMBIANCE: I LOVE THE AMBIANCE!!!!! It is almost fantastical in a very elegant sort of way with its butterfly decor, colorful indoor garden at the Wynn lobby, cafes decorated with colorful parasols hanging from the ceiling!!! It is also very bright as there's a lot of natural lighting coming in from the windows and skylights - gives the place a cheery mood. This is unlike other casinos which are always dim and completely walled up.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Suzymdg
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Encore and we were as pleased this time as when we stayed there in May of 2010. We booked a resort king suite both times. We paid more this time as had an incredible offer of $100/night on our first visit with free LeReve tickets and no resort fee. This time we paid $129/night and had to pay a $20/night resort fee (which includes in-room internet). Even with the additional cost, we were still more than happy with our visit there. We find the hotel to be very conveniently located with the Fashion Show Mall right across the street from the Wynn (Wynn and Encore are connected) and we were able to walk everywhere except for once we took The Deuce because we were going further down the Strip than we wanted to walk. It is a pretty pricey hotel overall. The restaurants are especially expensive, but the food, service and ambience can go a long way towards making up for the extra cost. The Wynn Hotels are definitely way above most of the other hotels in Vegas and we've been in most of them and stayed in quite a few of them. The Encore casino is bright, light and fresh - so much different than many of the other dark, smokey and dated casinos in Vegas. I can't really think of nearly anything negative to say about this hotel except I wish it were cheaper! We paid the $129/night with an offer that my husband got through an email. All the other online hotel booking sites were charging much more for this room. $129 plus the $20 resort fee and taxes is about our high-end price point for a per night stay. It's a great hotel. I doubt anyone who stayed here could find too much to complain about. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The best Vegas stay.....EVER.”
Reviews.Author: LadyGTX06
Reviews.Content: For our 9 year anniversary, we chose to stay at the Encore. We were told that once you stay there, you walk away spoiled....and they were right. Everything was top notch. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel if everything goes well”
Reviews.Author: flamo1
Reviews.Content: The breakfast buffet was awful. The bagels seemed a week old. No cheese. No muffins in the buffet. The food looked nice but tasted blah!...and cold! The female uniforms are atrociously ugly. Employees were nice but seemed to fear managers. We were offered a package which included tickets for La Reve ($129 each X 2). The show was cancelled due to technical problems. They would not offer tickets for Sinatra ($89 each) which was also running at the hotel. They gave us the option of tickets for La Reve on the next time we come to Vegas (I would not go back to the Encore or the Wynn) or a credit of $50 for each of us. Wiskey on the rocks has a $2.50 surcharge....with taxes and tip comes to $16 a shot!

Reviews.Title: “No Cookie Cutter Strip Hotel Here”
Reviews.Author: Five_Seasons
Reviews.Content: First off, Encore is an excellent hotel. I cannot say it is the best hotel on the strip as I have not stayed in all the hotels on the strip. However, I can say Encore surpasses hotels like Bellagio. The hotel rooms at Encore are spacious with its suites and a very good deal (depending on what offer you get) for a strip hotel. It is one of the newer hotels so you get the feel of cleaniness. Unlike Bellagio, the rooms are far from cookie cutter. The rooms have a modern touch with windows from floor to ceiling for a great view of the strip or downtown. Mirrors are all over the walls to give the room a bigger feel visually. Encore does get a very good rating and not an excellent rating though. As far as excellent, the standard bearer are Four Season Hotels in Hawaii. Unfortunately, Encore cannot compare to the service level of the Four Seasons Hotels in Hawaii. It is definitely on par with the Four Seasons Hotels in Hawaii when it comes to rooms. However, it falls far short in service. While the self-parking lot enables to you to make a short trek past the check-in and to your elevator (unlike most hotels in Vegas like Bellagio where you have to make the long trek across the casino to get to the elevator), the valet and bell hop service is not up to the service level and excellence of Four Seasons. We also ordered room service. While the service was quick, the level of friendliness is not up to par with the Four Seasons. It may be because its Las Vegas, but the hotels in Vegas will nickel and dime you for everything, while the Four Seasons in Hawaii will make the extras part of your stay with no nickeling and diming. While this is more the culture of Las Vegas, it does reflect the service aspect. The other drawback is the location of the hotel. The hotel is located at the end of the main strip. As a result, it is a far walk to other major strip hotels and can be an issue. With that said, Encore is definitely at the top of the list when it comes to hotels in Las Vegas. I would definitely recommend staying at Encore when in Las Vegas. However, to earn the highest rating in my book means meeting or exceeding in not just rooms and cleaniness but also in service. When comparing the service level to an "Excellent" hotel like the Four Season Hotels in Hawaii, I simply cannot give Encore that kind of rating.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but I would stay somewhere else...its Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: I had booked the hotel through the casino as I had to attend a conference at the Wynn. The rate was pretty high. 249 for Sat and Sun and 149 for the weekdays. On top of this they charge a $20 resort fee!!! This is how they charge us more money in Vegas. Dont know what is so resort like in a casino. Got in around 4 PM and checked in. Fortunately this was not too long. We got to our room on 36th floor. The room was a King bed room with a sitting area and a swiveling TV. The internet speed was faast. The bathroom was also good size. There was no way to get hot water for tea in the room; no coffee marker nothing. So we called and asked for a hot water kettle. Guess what!! Its 10 bucks to rent one!! Encore; why are you nickel and diming customers when you are charging them 250 bucks a night!! This is the single one reason why I would never stay with them again; the attitude of trying to get a bit more money on small things. The bed was really uncomfortable. I just could not get a good nights sleep. Its too soft, at least did not suit me. I had expected that Encore would mean high level of service. This was really not the case. There was almost no service of any kind. You are one among the many out there. We were supposed to stay for 5 days but decided to check out after the 2nd night. I normally stay at MGM Signature and I moved there. It is a world of a change. You are person not a number. Service and high quality service exists there. And it was half price on a weekday as compared to Encore. My recommendation is that unless you are going to spend the big bucks and stay at one of the high priced suites dont expect to see much service. If your budget is sub 200 per night just quietly book at the MGM Signature. Its cheaper and much better even though Encore has spent literally billions on the hotel. I just wished they would have spent a bit more on the human factor. That would have made the premium worth it. I would not suggest it unless you want to spend a lot of money at the high suites. On a +ve not; LE REVE is a must see. It is a fantastic show.

Reviews.Title: “Encoredible”
Reviews.Author: BigNeill
Reviews.Content: what a great experience it is to stay here, Everywhere you go, whatever time, there is always something happening at the Encore. It captures the vibe of vegas perfectly, yet manages to tone down the tack considerably. Great room layouts, good size, decent decor, comfy bed and views a plenty. But you don't go to Vegas for the rooms. Amenity wise its got everything you can throw at a hotel, done to the highest standard. You will never run out of things to do. Great standard of entertainment. The Casino floor is a vibrant, bustling hive of action, with restaurants and bars surrounding it which are diverse, plentiful and delicious. Escape and unwind from the Vegas atmosphere at one of the pool facilities or go down and enjoy the absolutely exquisite spa. The hotel also gives you access to the facilities at the Wynn if you fancy a change and close by are the Fashion show mall and the Palazzo/Venetian resorts. A couple of gripes would be that everything costs extra, but it is a Wynn resort so if you want the luxury you have to pay for it. Also the resort can seem a little impersonal a lot of the time, but when you take into account the scale of this beautiful behemoth, its easy to forgive. Certainly one not to forget!

Reviews.Title: “Must be Close to the Best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BobSt23
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge a bit on our last 3 nights in the USA by staying at Wynn Encore, chosen after reading many reviews and looking at many photos online. We were very impressed. The room was huge and ultra-comfortable with a great view through ceiling to floor windows. The hotel was actually easy to get in and out of – many of the Strip resorts are like a maze. Every staff member we came into contact with was very friendly and helpful. I’d describe the price we paid as mid-range – definitely more than the older cheaper places but less than some of the highly reputed resorts and I doubt they could better the overall standard of room at Encore. Only 2 small negatives – no room in the bar fridge for anything like a bottle of water and an excessive internet usage charge. These are only minor. Definitely recommended. The best hotel we’ve stayed at in Las Vegas in our 4 trips here. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: superalpi
Reviews.Content: This is a fancy hi-tech hotel in Vegas. It is located on The Strip on a walking distance from the major points of interest. The check-in was really fast. We had a huge room which was fully equipped. Very spacious bathroom. I was impressed that some facilities like window drapes and sheers were managed remotely by electronic sensors. I would definitely recommend this hotel for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Teandrus
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Encore. I was impressed with many things about this hotel. Very clean and nice. However, I was very surprised when we were heading to bed at 2am and the music from the nightclub XS can be heard EXTREMELY loud all the way up to our room (18th floor). Every night the music would be blasting until 5am seeming to get louder and louder as the night went on. I understand that Vegas is a late night city but I would like the option of sleeping when I am here for a convention and do not want to stay up that late. Had to ask the hotel for earplugs our last night and could still here the loud music over the earplugs. I will NEVER stay here again. I have never had an issue like this at any hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, unexpected of a five star hotel, worst in 10 years.”
Reviews.Author: ajawich
Reviews.Content: The resort staff are extremely rude, clrealy backed up by careless attitude from management. Not family friendly at all, I have stayed at the Trump international hotel in the past, by comparison it makes the Encore look like a single star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Tower Suites...the best of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAngeleno
Reviews.Content: I've stayed many times at the Encore Tower Suites in the Salon Suite. This is the only place I will stay in Vegas. The elegance, beauty and luxury of this property far surpass any of other high end resorts on the strip. Yes, it is located on the far end of the strip, but it has everything you need and my fiancé and I often find that we never even have to leave the resort. Whether you are looking for gourmet grub (Society), the best authentic Italian seafood (Stratta), Michelin rated, 5 star dining (Alex) or the best sushi and sake on the strip (Okada), it is all here on the Wynn-Encore property. And the shopping...oh yes....they have the best boutique, luxury designer goods in one location. Other properties have more stores, but none with such a discriminating selection of unique and hard to find items. The gaming and resort staff go out their way to make you feel welcome and make sure you have every need met and have the best time. Only once have I ever encountered a problem with the staff and management responded immediately to my satisfaction. They really do show their appreciation for customer loyalty. Drinks at the High Roller Bar are a must for beginning the night out! They have unique cocktails and a great selection of premium spirits. And after a long night out, nothing beats the beauty and pure bliss of an afternoon spent at the Encore spa.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Xmas Treat”
Reviews.Author: L-in-Denver
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick Christmas weekend trip to Las Vegas. Let me start by saying I did everything in my power to do as little as possible and rarely even left the Wynn/Encore premises. This gave me an opportunity to really enjoy the hotel and use most of the services. We were able to upgrade to the panoramic suite--WOW what an impressive room. Beautiful decor, comfy bed, great bath amennities, I could go on and on. From the check in to the room to the service everything was top notch. For example--we had reservations at Alex and a spa treatment booked before check in. During the check in process everything was confirmed and some helpful hints on timing were relayed. Thank you for not making me track down this information on my own. Every single interaction with hotel employees was pleasant-with big hellos and a feeling of really being welcome. A special thanks to the man working in the walkway between Wynn and Encore early on Xmas morning--your good cheer was inspiring! We were also lucky enough to enjoy various restaurants during our stay. We ate at the deli in the Wynn--good sandwiches and soups. Cocktails at Parasol Up and Down. Went to Red 8 for dim sum, headed to SW for deserts and coffees, sushi at Okada, and of course the Xmas dinner highlight was Alex. Every single meal was a perfect presentation of great food, wine, and service. My only complaint would be the coffee bars i the morning--just not a great latte to be found. All in all I would highly recommend staying at the Encore--we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Best on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: GJGPrescott
Reviews.Content: Beautiful standard king room with large, separate living area. Polite staff. Resort fee was steep at $20 but included long-distance, internet, and access to the gym, which is very nice. Although we don't gamble, we did notice that the Encore casino was much less crowded than that of the Wynn (the two hotels are attached). Encore is located right across the street from the Fashion Show Mall. Our only quibble was the lack of a coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “All around great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateCinci
Reviews.Content: Amazing pool, amazing casino, good restaurants, good service. All around, a great place to stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely 5 star resort...had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: SusieJue
Reviews.Content: I received a promotion in the mail for 3 night stay at Wynn Encore and since I love going to Vegas I was totally game. The total cost was about $450, which included the $20 per day resort fee. Two tickets to Le Reve was included (this is the BEST show I have ever seen, highly recommend!). The Wynn Encore is connected to the Wynn, but it is totally separate as far as check in. The valet is free and very efficient, as was the check-in. My non-strip view room was spectacular and if you don't opt for strip view, you will get a room on a higher floor. My room was on 51st floor and had great view of the north strip and mountains beyond. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and definitely five star all the way. The Resort King room was beautiful and really the WOW factor hits you as soon as you open the door to the your room. I love the comfy Wynn Dream king bed and Sharp 42" swivel flat panel tv between the sleeping area and the sitting area. I like the controls on the nightstand for the lights and the draperies! There is floor to ceiling glass windows and very dramatic views. Nice lounge seating and desk (and fax machine). Large closet and in room safe. Pay per view movies, but no DVD player available. The thing I didn't like was the mini bar had a touch sensor, so you could not remove items and use as refrigerator. Luckily, the ice bin was just down the hall. I also surprised that there was no coffee maker in the room. Wired and wireless internet in the room and local/domestic long distance phone calls are included in the resort fee. The marble bathroom has separate shower, tub and toilet and TV near the sink. The towels were very scratchy and I guess that's just minor. I liked the robe and if you call, they will bring you slippers. The toiletries were good size and smelled good, there's a bathroom scale and nice makeup mirror. The housekeeping could use some improvement, as I found hair near the tub, toothpaste in the sink and the glasses were dirty. The bell service was excellent and Paul brought ice when he delivered the luggage. Get a map of the property at check in, it's very helpful to navigate your way to restaurants, shops, etc. I also got $25 slot credit, but it was very difficult to figure out the Red Card and how the machines worked, etc. You can call ahead to valet to have your car waiting for you downstairs and they will also print out your boarding pass for you. The TV will also give you your daily account balance and there is express check out. The casual dining options are very good and I love The Drugstore Cafe. Good salads(Southwest Shrimp Salad) and soup (Southwest Tortilla Soup). Open 24/7 too. There is a very handy sundries store open 24/7 near the hotel elevators, books, magazines, snacks, drinks, etc. Obviously, there is room service should you want that. The Fitness Center usage is included in the resort fee and is adjacent to the spa. For $40, you can get a day pass to use the spa facilities. The lounge area at the spa reception is free and a beautiful place to hang out. There's also a nice store there. Shopping is just on the first floor and Wynn Esplanade some of the stores include Manolo Blahnik, Chanel, Dior, Hermes, Louis Vuitton, Graff. If you want to head across the street, you have the Fashion Show Mall with Macys, Neiman Marcus, Bloomingdales, Zara and others. Plus, there are good restaurants and ABC store is handy for drinks, snacks, etc. Lots of restaurants, nightclubs (Blush, Tryst and XS), bars and swimming pools, golf course on the property. The Lake of Dreams is also a highlight. I had a fantastic stay at Wynn Encore and will look for more hotel deals to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 5 star hotel , but housekeeping stolen cash from our room”
Reviews.Author: BugsbunnyRO
Reviews.Content: It was preatty sisspanointing for me ! When we arrived at this hotel I was absolutely surprised . Modern arhitecture , very clean , nice pool area , indees a 5 star hotel The room si big and very pleasant , big windows with nice view , extremlly comfrotable bed in whcih we have slept very well . I truly luxurious hotel ! Alex restaurant was awesome ! as well is the country club were we felt very well The Negative part came when we forgot to properly lock the safe room and after 6 hours we have discovered that 3000 USD were missing . The reaction of the hotel was poor , they send somebody from the security after 30 minutes , and the complaint went to RISK management which has not worked very well during our stay . I have send clothes to loundry and when they did not come back I have asked what happend . They told me that I need to prepay although there were a 250 usd deposit at the reception ....... ....So great arhitecture hotel , great food at alex restaurant and country club , I am not such a gambler but I have noticed that dealers in other casinos are funnier and have better attitudine ................but service was not 5 star hotel , maybe 4 star

Reviews.Title: “Steve Wynn is a genious!”
Reviews.Author: Murraymn
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Encore was spectatular! Steve Wynn is a genious! This was perhaps our 6th stay at Encore or Wynn and there were several surprises around property to keep us entertained. The new wine bar La Cave was cozy and chic and the food and wine inventive and savory. The new night club Surrender was intriguing. Our old favorites include the "off the hook" spa and fitness center, the luxurious casino and the amazing shopping including Hermes and Chanel. The luxury surroundings make the hotel comfortable and entertaining, but the extraordinary service is what makes the stay. I would not hesitate to say that the staff at the Encore is clairvoyant. They anticipate your expectations and exceed them at every turn at Encore.

Reviews.Title: “So Much Fun, and Elegant, too”
Reviews.Author: mvdoc
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel, beautiful room, friendly staff, excellent service, and delicious food. oh yes, the casino was very pleasant, and the wynn casino even better (they are attached by a walkway, and the walking exercise is good for you!) - great food at all venues. we had a problem with one of the free meals not being available during our stay (of three days), and the casino host graciously solved the problem for us - minor complaint: check in and check out take way to long - otherwise a perfect stay. can't wait to return. don't miss the sinatra show, it is out of sight - who would have thought!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: coolio
Reviews.Content: We had been wanting to stay here for a while and got a great rate. Got a high floor double queen room early checkin no problem. Tipping of course helps ;) Asked nicely and also got a late checkout. The remote control for the TV was MIA and housekeeping were up with a replacement on a silver platter within 10 minutes! I love Vegas but sometimes the car parks are miles from the rooms and we live to shop so valet is usually the only option. Encore is the exception to this rule with it very easy to find a parking space less than a 2 minute walk from the elevator to your room. We got a large box 20lb delivered ahead of the stay and the business centre sent an email confirming delivery and it was delivered into our room very quickly. This aspect was great as we had ignorantly just addressed it to Wynn business center and not the encore one, assuming it was one of the same. The room was amazing. However, we seemed to have a slightly faulty privacy button by the bed. Housekeeping was quite loud during the day also. They were very good though when we had to head back to the room as we forgot money in the safe. They had literally just seen us leave a couple of minutes previously but before getting back in the room checked the room key. Gambled a few hours each day in the casino. Cocktail service was great. All communal areas were gorgeous. Would've been good if the Wynn buffet opened earlier than 8. We needed it after early morning drinking and had to wait around. we also ate at Pizza Place and the deli in the Wynn Casino. Le Reve is great and I hate shows! My partner loved the gym and again, so easily accessible from the room. It really seems like a small hotel service wise and the down to the layout. The only downside to Encore is the location but the deuce and cabs help overcome that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience for Vegas Weekend”
Reviews.Author: knoxmarlow
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Wynn Encore in May 2010. We received an offer from the Encore with promotional rates and free tickets to La Reve. The facilities deserve five stars. Our room was spacious, quiet and comfortable with contemporary furnishings. Our bed was comfy. Our bathroom was large, clean and bright, with modern finishes. My fiance loved the shampoo, lotion and other products in the room. Like the room, the overall resort is contemporary, clean and strikes a balance Vegas excess and comfortable luxury. The casino air filtration system is remarkable. Non-smoking gamblers will appreciate that technology. We were slighly disappointed by the pool environment. Overall, the pools are nice, but we prefer a deeper pool that facilitates moderate swimming. The Encore pools are basically shallow wading pools. We both enjoyed the pool music, although the house beats do not make for the most "relaxing" pool experience. (Despite our pool experience, I'm still giving the Encore five stars because the room vastly exceeded my expecations.) Other notes: the staff were polite and helpful; the Wynn and Encore restaurants were top notch; the buffett was terrific; and the show (La Reve) was spectacular -- highly recommend if you're into Vegas shows. Parking was free in the large parking gararge adjacent to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “The Cherry on the Top of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: brodertr
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the Xmas holiday. From the smile of the valet as he opened our car door to the Concierge printing our boarding passes for our flight home, the Encore has perfected Service. Every employee we encountered - housekeeping, dealers, reception, valet, pit bosses, shop staff, everyone - was polite, helpful, and interested in doing whatever necessary to assit you and make your stay the best possible. Add to the fact it's design is elegant, spacous, colorful (esp if you like red) and immaculate, Steve Wynn has outdone himself. The rooms are large, well-appointed, comfortable with the most amazing views thru the floor-to-ceiling glass wall overlooking Vegas. In fact, we had initially booked a suite at the Venetian but seeing the pics of the Encore vista convinced us to change. Being able to operate all the lights in the suite from the bed was a nice touch. The shops are at the top end of style (and price) but we did find some reasonable items. The gambling crew was helpful and fun - the dealers were friendly and patient. My wife played Blackjack for the first time and her dealer, Nina (?), warned her against sucker-bets and when to hit and stay. My wife walked away happy and with more than double her original stake! The restaurants are beyond compare (see our review of Bartolottas and Society Cafe) and room service was perfect. Not much into the club scene, but from the size and the look of the people who were, it's THE place to be. The downside(s) - well, you do pay a higher price for these perks but we felt the extra efforts and great attitudes of the staff more than compensated for the higher cost compared to other resorts. We visited most the big resorts during our stay (Ceasars, MGM, Mirage, Venetian, etc) and found only the Bellagio's staff comparable. The other (possible) turn-off may be the location at the 'end' of the Strip. But, to us, that was more a perk than a strike. Overall, great stay, great service, great experience. It's not cheap but we felt we got what we paid for and was money well-spent.

Reviews.Title: “Fine attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: kekaimalu22
Reviews.Content: Stayed December 20-23 on a comp stay. Friendly valet and bell staff which contributed to a wonderful first/last impression of resort. Hotel interior bathed in red...imagine a red can of paint that exploded. Decor in common areas are visually stunning, including red chrysanthemum pieces and butterfly artwork which adorn the walls. Red theme extends throughout all areas including the casino, Encore Esplanade, ending at the Wynn Theatre. Check-in was fairly brisk, although there is no demarcation to denote where to form a line...everyone just kind of stood in a mob waiting a check-in desk to open. It was okay though, because there was just a few of us in line around 4:30pm. I can't imagine what it would be like during busier periods. Stay on 63rd floor in a Resort King Suite. Rooms are large compared to your typical hotel room. The Wynn beds are fantastic with luxe linens and very comfy pillows. Wall partition that holds a flat screen television swivels so that it can be viewed from the bedroom or the living room. Lighting is excellent throughout the room. Don't touch the mini-bar and snack tray unless you want to be charged. It has that sensor-thingee that will detect and charge you if you move them. Living room has a large couch, desk with fax and internet hookups (fee for usage of course). Automatic drapery with floor-to-ceiling windows. Lights, drapery, and privacy button can be adjusted from a panel on the bedside stand. Ample closet space with safe (not large enough to hold a laptop). Mirrored walls everywhere in room...floor-to-ceiling along one entire bedroom wall and one entire living room wall. Also mirrors in hallway. Kinda creepy being alone with all those mirrors and seeing my reflection everywhere I went in the room, but I got used to it after a while. Bathroom also large with a separate shower, tub, and toilet room. Stayed at Palazzo before and toilet room was too dark. Toilet room here had ample lighting (wall lamp above toilet). Double vanity sinks with lighted mirror. Small television in wall of bathroom. Shower had a bench which is convenient, and showerhead included a handheld nozzle. Adequate water pressure and water temperature. 2 logo robes hanging in corner of bathroom. Lemongrass citrus Desert Bambu amenities (generously sized). Also available are individually packaged Q-tips, shoe polish, buff cloth, shower cap, and I think I saw a nail file too. 4 sets of Wynn-branded available for use. Scale was helpful for keeping track of my suitcase so that I don't exceed the allowed airline weight restriction! Hair dryer also available. Only issue I encountered was that the safe in my room was locked upon check-in, requiring a call to Housekeeping who sent hotel security to my room to reset it. Otherwise, room stay was great. Beautiful, intimate casino, much smaller than Wynn's. Casino quiet over the 3 nites I stayed there (Mon-Thurs). I appreciated it though, because I do not care for a loud, party-like casino with drunk, obnoxious people everywhere. Casino atmosphere noticably more subdued and classy than others. Wynn casino was much more active. I did not have much luck in the casino here...better luck at Wynn. Unfortunately, I did not go to the Spa or dine at the restaurants at Encore. I ate at the Wynn Buffet due to the fact that for the price, I could sample wide variety of dishes. Overall, I enjoyed the accomodations at Encore. I enjoy a luxury vacation experience and certainly Encore did not disappoint. The resort is visually spectacular, paying close attention to detail. Staff that I encountered were courteous. Only downfall is that Encore is at the North end of the main Strip which is not that convenient if you like to casino hop. I had a good experience and don't mind staying here again. Thanks for a wonderful stay Encore!

Reviews.Title: “The Nickeling and the Diming”
Reviews.Author: DJTravelBoy
Reviews.Content: The Encore is simply a spectacular resort. My room was superb and the ambience of the entire casino/hotel area was excellent. BUT, the resort fee concept is a mess. I went to the gorgeous spa thinking that it was included in the resort fee ($20/day). Oh no. I could use the fitness area but could use any of the wet areas of the spa without paying an ADDITIONAL $40. yes, you read that right. To shower, it was going to cost $40. Unreal. Really soured my feeling about the entire place.

Reviews.Title: “Garth Brooks Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Mo6pack
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I spent 3 nights at the Encore with the Garth Brooks Unforgettable Weekend package. It was an AMAZING weekend. We had a Tower King Suite on the 60th floor that overlooked the Vegas Strip. Private VIP entrance to the hotel with Concierge Service. Everyone on the staff was very friendly & helpful. The package included credit at the spa, Switch Steakhouse, Sunday Jazz Brunch & for Garth merchandise. We also had 3rd row seats for the Saturday night show. Best show we have ever seen. If you are a Garth fan, you must call the Encore for this package!! Worth every penny we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at Encore”
Reviews.Author: Brannie
Reviews.Content: Encore did not disappoint us for the second stay. We stayed two weeks and were on the 62nd floor. People complain about the music from the clubs and we did hear a faint amount of music but one night it was really bad. We were told they had some special event that caused that but it was hard to believe that we heard it up that high. We never get much sleep in Vegas since we are always on the go so it didn't wreck our trip. We had a clean room and wonderful housekeeping staff. Had turn down service nightly also. The spa is wonderful and again Lisa V did not disappoint with the Good Luck Ritual! Society Cafe, Stratta and Switch were wonderful meals. Their room service is also wonderful. Nothing bad to say - great room, cheerful staff and a late check out - great stay! Can't wait to go back! Sinatra show at Wynns was a great show also. Max Brenners was great and tea at Mandarin Oriental was excellent and a great view! Saw Triumph at LV Hilton - don't waste your money - nothing like they said it was to be - cheap magic tricks and at our show they had to go get the key to let the guy out of the box! Bad show! Horrible seat comfort also!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Fantastic rooms, great service and totally over the top in all categories!”
Reviews.Author: chris_philly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Encore for a few nights on a business trip and was blown away by the hotel. The attention to detail was incredible as were the overly spacious rooms and excellent service. It's everything I could want in a luxury Vegas hotel and i will definitely be returning soon! Thanks for an awesome stay.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel experience ever, it made the trip great”
Reviews.Author: 2urhlth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch, from the service to the rooms to the food. I can't say one negative thing about this hotel, I would absolutely recommend it to everyone and will definitely stay there again. It made the las vegas experience wonderful. The weather was warmer than expected and right across the street was a mall to purchase new clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel and amenities.”
Reviews.Author: kilp6233
Reviews.Content: The Encore was wonderful. We stayed 4 nights and have not one complaint. We were early and got into our room right away. We were also upgraded with our American Express Platinum to a room on a high floor. Room was comfie & big. The hotel is exceptionally clean & very nice. The fitness center is extra unless you use the Spa services, but it was worth it. The Society restaurant had the best breakfast and hamburger for dinner. The shops were lovely, the pool was great. Can't say enough and would definitely stay here again. Great for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe Crawford
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love the Encore. Room was panoramic view on 57th floor with a breathtaking view of Vegas and the strip. Service and check-in was fantastic. Not overly crowded or smoky. Nicest room I have had in Vegas. Connected to the Wynn though a shopping corridor. Will be back. Very nice spa.

Reviews.Title: “"5" star Encore, not quite "5" star!”
Reviews.Author: TBATES8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Encore from Dec. 8 - 11. The place is wonderful. Positives: Rooms are big and roomy. Great bathroom and amazing view of the strip and Wynn golfcourse. Wazuzu restaurant..amazing asian cuisine and service. Switch restuarant great steaks but not exactly ALBERTA beef quality. The casino is nice and service was great, although I was unlucky. Go to Parisole Down in the Wynn and ask for Omar....amazing service and he got us into Blush without paying cover. Negatives: Room was not clean when we arrived. Papers on the floor and old food left in the mini bar from previous guest. This lack of attention to detail was disappointing especially since you are at Encore. Hair all over in the bathroom. A walk from everything, we didnt mind this but others might. We were on floor 36 and we could still hear the nightclubs base pounding at 4 am! Overall we would stay here again and hope that the cleaning issues would not occur again! Viva Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing treatment of repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: trvlin_man
Reviews.Content: I understand that the Vegas casino experience is all about gimmicks and tricks, and separating you from your cash. I understand that. But The Wynn is one of the classier resorts on the Strip, and I don't accept that kind of treatment by a hotel. Let me explain. I'm a repeat visitor. I received an invitation in November and took them up on it, getting a good rate ($169/night average). When I arrived, at about 4PM on a Saturday (and this is the slow season between Thanksgiving and New Years, whee all sorts of deals are available,and Vegas is hurting for vsiitors), I was told a room wasn't yet available. At 4PM? They asked me if I would like to receive a call or if I would like to wait in the lobby until a room was available. My response was that it is 4PM, and this is a huge hotel, during a slow season, and what I would like would be a room now (by the way, as I was standing there, I saw 4 other parties being given rooms). A manager came over, and after 10 minutes of complex typing into their system, they found me a room. It was a very nice room with a great view of The Strip (which is the type of room I always get there). It was obvious to me that they were trying to find a crummyroom to utme in, and made me feel like a second class citizen. Then they told me about the $20 daily "resort fee", which isn't mentioned on their site until you buy the room. The hotel is nice, and so are the rooms. But being treated like that, upon arrival, and being a repeat visitor, just completely put me off. There is not a shortage of hotels and resorts in Vegas, and I plan on taking my business (and my action) elsewhere in the future. is a room

Reviews.Title: “Funky old people smell, don't get a room by the elevator!”
Reviews.Author: ReliableReviews7
Reviews.Content: Greta hotel with wonderful staff, amenities, etc. Probably the best hotel in the world by a mile. However, you can't change people. I smartly, or so I thought, requested a room by the elevator. It literally smelled like an old age home, but was thoroguhly cleaned. Unfortunatley, I not have to be specific and request close to the elevator, but not too close. XS and Surrender, nothing else!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful ambiance and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: cindyIndiana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights at Encore at Wynn and were very pleased with our choice. It was an early birthday gift for me. The staff is well versed in making their guests feel welcome and will go out of their way in order to insure a good time with no glitches if possible - something that no one on vacation anticipates but unfortunately frequently happens. We upgraded to the tower suites and had a wonderful view from the 52nd floor of the Las Vegas strip and mountains. Bedding was superb and towels thick and plentiful. Loved the chaise in our small living area for reading the paper in the morning. Windows are floor to ceiling and provide plenty of light but remote draperies keep the room dark for sleeping in late if desired. We walked and also utilized cabs for getting around to other casinos, hotels and restaurants. We had no problems walking to Wynn, Palazzo, Venetian, TI, and Mirage. Both of Wynn's casinos are well lit, beautifully decorated and comfortable for gambling. The restaurants are rather on the expensive end but we ate more than once in the Society Cafe and also Terrace Pointe (Wynn). Terrace Pointe at Wynn was lovely with an outside view but closed at 3 pm. We would have eaten there again if the dining hours had been extended. For a special occasion I would recommend this hotel as meals and room service were definately on the high end for Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like an outsider”
Reviews.Author: johnsonnl
Reviews.Content: When I reserved the room I told the agent that I had two toddlers and asked if the hotel kid friendly. She not only told me they were kid friendly she told me I would have access to all pools in both hotels (wynn/Encore). We learned after we got there that Wynn’s pool was closed for the winter. Additionally only special tower people have access to the remaining pools at the wynn…I wasn’t really upset because I knew it was too cold to swim. But then getting a taxi we were left in the cold while a high roller and his group got into a Bentley and a Stretched Limo (Remember I said it was cold with a 2 and 3yr old in tow) and when I spoke to the bell boy/man he told me there were out of taxis and he sent a guy to the street to get us one. After 15 minutes…… a taxi arrived. And he lied. There were 4 taxis waiting in line at the next exit. Note this was our 3rd night and previously they always called a taxi up for us. Except for this last night… Lastly we were told on our last night that encore does not allow strollers in their hotel, unless we were guests, and he wanted us to wait to get our stroller registered….. (which we didn’t do!) Loved the room, hated the “bate and switch” show.

Reviews.Title: “Encore is the best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: balimontana
Reviews.Content: This year I've spent seven weeks in Encore and Encore Tower Suites on business and for leisure trips in Vegas. Some stays were up to two weeks duration. For comparison I've also stayed at the brand new Aria, Four Seaons and Bellagio and the Palazzo. Encore is superior to all of these hotels. 1.) Encore standard rooms are the best on the Strip. They are huge - about 700 square feet. Well decorated, quiet and very comfortably furnished stylish attractive rooms. 2.) Encore spa is the best on the Strip. Great masage therapists. Gorgeous spa. Amazing facility. I'm a spa junkie and this one is world class! 3.) Encore gym is large and well appointed by hotel standards. Has everything most of us will need unless you're a serious hammerhead bodybuilder. 4.) Room service is quick by Strip hotel standards. Food quality is excellent! 5.) Dining venues are all excellent and too many to mention! The Encore has excellent service overall. The decor and "feel" of the property are very special. When they do make a mistake they'll quickly admit it and rectify the problem. Don't expect Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons style service at the Encore because this type of service doesn't exist on the Strip. But it's as close to it as I've experienced on the Strip. The only single drawback - and this is a minor one - is the location. Bellagio is Center Strip and is much more conveniently located to all of the other properties on the Strip. Walking from the Encore to the center strip is a long walk. Overall this is definitely the best property on the Strip for those of us who appreciate luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: iriskasiriskas
Reviews.Content: Best of restaurants, atmosphere, service ,show and clubs in all vegas! If you can afford to stay here, do not think twice. You will be pampered here. You wont even want to go anywhere else. Actually , walking through other hotels, except for may be venetian and bellagio, was depressing. (married couple from nyc, early thirties).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: srtr
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 32 nd floor and not next to the elevator..yet you could hear it. If you turn up the fan on your thermostat it will deaden the noise. The room was beautiful. windows were floor to ceiling. Not sure why they would charge a resort fee ($20.00) when the pools are not opened. All in all, a good value for the price- $139.00 + resort fee. Check around for priciing as their are alot of choices in Las Vegas and the Wynn was competitive with other 5 star hotels. We ate @ Joes Stone Crab( not as good as Miami) Vic and Anthnonies( Golden Nugget)- very good , Archi's Thai Kitchen- Excellent. Visit Red Rock Canyon-worth the short drive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suite!”
Reviews.Author: GoldenVenissa
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel! Staff was very professional and friendly. Rooms was amazing, plush and very well maintained. Highly recommended hotel all-around, though it is on the far end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seattle53029
Reviews.Content: sparking clean, great services, good food, good lighting,beautiful place a little bit too far from center of the strip

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: steffw1
Reviews.Content: This has to be the cleanist, friendlist, comfortable hotel I have ever stayed at. From the minute you walk in the lobby you are amazed at the beauty and it smells so good too. The suite was beautiful and spacious with awesome view of strip. Every restaurant we ate at was to die for. The staff was always accomodating. My only complaint is that it is far down the strip, can't walk to any nice hotels. I'd still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but to far from the action”
Reviews.Author: Scullytraveller34
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great. Spacious and large and big enough with 2 kids in tow. However the encore is at the end of the strip and it takes a fair effort to get anywhere a good 10 min walk even to the palazzo next door. Having stayed at both of these properties in recent months they are both lacking in several areas. 1. No tea/coffee facilities in room. This is very annoying with the end result being you are 20 bucks out of pocket every morning for coffee.. you have no option but to purchase from them of course! 2. no breakfast..Considering you are paying the highest room rates on the strip both these services should be offered as complimentary. Its about time one of these big players stepped up to the plate and offered value as well as customer service. people are not stupid and they will fill more rooms. Would i stay at the wynn again! No but purely only on location. It is a wonderful property in every other aspect just to far down the end for my liking..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: TheRfamily
Reviews.Content: Thank you Encore Resort! My husband and our daughters 18 & 16 couldn't have had a more Wonderful time! On our arrival we were placed on the 60 floor with a view of the strip! Our room was spotless, room service was excellent! We had breakfas/brunch everyday at the Tableau. Service was excellent, and the meals were delicious. Large selection of Breakfast and Brunch/Lunch Menu's. We highly recommend Sinatra's, One of the Best Seafood Risotto's, other than Ciak in Monterosso, Italy, What a treat! Bartolotta Ristorante Di Mare, exceptional food & service! Society Café Encore, Great/Fun food, why leave the hotel for #1 Food and Service when it's right in your hands. The concierge service was EXCELLENT!!! We went to see Le Reve, Beautiful!!!! The other Restaurants we visited were Spago's, just ok, Cheese Cakes, alright for a quick bite, and Samba Brazilian Steakhouse, great assortment of bbq assorted steaks, salad bar, would have rather just ordered my own. Must visit Jean-Philippe Pâtisserie, Awesome Ice Cream, Crepes, & Desserts !!!! Visit Jean-Philippe Pâtisserie in the Aria and Bellagio. Our youngest daughter had tickets to see Justin Bieber, lucky for her she won the Meet and Greet with him, so she will never forget Las Vegas!!! The Pool and Spa were Awesome, as well as the pool side drinks. Shopping is Awesome!!! Vist the outlet stores first then the Malls, Great shopping in the Encore, and the Pool Shop, Fashion Mall, Miracle Mile, all great!!! Casino in the Encore was by far the nicest of all Las Vegas, we are not gamblers, but took home what we gambled. The only dislike of our trip, was the smoky cabs. I suggest the Encore looking into providing customers with some kind of shuttle service, this would have made our stay even more pleasing. Thank you Encore, we would definitely return and recommend your Beautiful Hotel and Service to all our family & friends your #1!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - need to fix service issues”
Reviews.Author: Ravs27
Reviews.Content: As the other reviewers have this is probably THE best hotel in Vegas - I will not argue that. However, the service is not 5 star and they have a lot to work on. First off we stayed for 4 nights while attending a conference at the dull Venetian and chose this hotel because it is new and looks great. At check in my requested room type was not available even though I booked my room 4 months in advance (not a great start), next each morning when I lef tmy room around 8:30 I took the do not disturb off only to return around 5:00 pm to a still dirty room - I was staying alone so it was not a big deal since there were lots of towels in the room but when you are paying lots of money it is nice to have your room serviced each day - the worst part of this was on my day of check out I tried to sleep in since we had a late night and the Housekeeper tried to barge into my room at 8:00 am asking if I was checking out yet - needless to say they didn't show for 3 days and then on the last night decide to wake me up. At check out I was offered $100 off my entire stay and it was like pulling teeth just to get that. While I would not hesitate to stay here again they really need to correct these service issues. As far as the casino - every dealer I met while playing Blackjack complained about Steve Wynn and the fact that he took 40% of their tips and that once City Center fully opens they will all be leaving to work there - I understand their frustration but it did not make for a lot of fun while I was playing to hear constant complaining about working conditions - I was hesitant to tip them since they would only be getting 60% of that tip anyways. We partied at Blush which was awesome and Surrender which was even better - highly recommend bottle service if going to either one.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we've ever stayed at in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Andy71405
Reviews.Content: The Encore is the best hotel we've stayed at in Vegas. On our last trip to Vegas we stayed at the Trump, which is a nice hotel, but we ended up spending most of our time at the Wynn. For this trip we decided to just book our room at the Wynn or Encore. We are really glad we stayed there. Everything about Encore is first class. From the time we arrived, until we checked out, every member of the staff is attentative and polite. They pay attention to every detail throughout the two properties. Everything you want is at the hotel. On our previous trips to Vegas, we spent a lot of time walking up and down the strip to get to things. While you can still do that if you stay at the Wynn, we only left once a day to get a massage, shop across the street at the mall, and go indoor skydiving. The rooms are very large and very plush. We had a great view overlooking both the Wynn golf course and the strip. They have a great fitness center. The restaurants are fantastic. We ate breakfast at the Terrace Cafe every morning. They have a great Maine Lobster egss benedict. For Vegas, the prices are very reasonable. For dinner, we ate at SW Steakhouse, Okada, and Alex. All three were very good. For us, eating at Alex was a bit of a splurge to celebrate our anniversary, but it was also one of the best meals we've ever had. While we stayed at Encore, we did most of gambling and eating at the Wynn. The two are connected, so it was only a 2 minute walk from our elevator. We liked staying at the Encore as the casino is not as busy, so you don't walk out and into the casino action each time you go to and from your room. The dealers were very good, and very friendly. On all of our future trips to Vegas, we will stay at either the Wynn or Encore. If you are comparing it to other hotels, I would stay here - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “I could stay here every time”
Reviews.Author: fish_and_chips6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights at the end of Nov 2010, at the Wynn Encore. The lobby is done in red - very surreal. Our panoramic king suite was on the sixty-first floor, as we had requested a higher floor. The room had beautiful floor - to - ceiling windows, and the views of the city and mountains were spectacular. The room had a decent minibar and docking station. The bathroom was huge, and they provided plenty of towels and lemongrass-flavoured toiletries. We did not have the chance to try room service - or any of the hotel's restaurants, as my husband does not own a jacket, and the reviews made it sound as if many/most of them would require such. The casino got to be pretty pricey in the evenings, but daytime gambling was pretty reasonable. I did have a chance to try the spa at the Wynn ( NOT the encore), and I would have to say that this is a must. It is a very intimate facility, with the staff being extremely professional but very kind, and obviously highly capable. The fitness facilities looked amazing, but there is a cost involved for use ( ?$14 daily per person) . No problems encountered - very smooth operation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: natsfats
Reviews.Content: The Encore at the Wynne is a lovely hotel and very tastefully decorated. This was recommended to us by a couple who stayed there when eloped and we weren't disappointed. We stayed in the tower suite and had a separate reception and concierge with complimentary vallet parking. It was nice to be separate from the rest of the hotel, and we did feel extra special. As it was our honeymoon, we recieved a complimentary bottle of Champagne and chocolate covered strawberries with a welcome letter, a very exciting touch. The rooms are awesome, and we had a lovely view of Vegas. The bathroom was huge, and the complimentary toiletries very good quality. We went to their nightclub XS and were blown away by the size and glamour, and we ate at the buffet restaurant which I can recommend. I'd recommend booking your room early is we recieved a heft discount on our rooms. The hotel is across the road from the Fashion Mall and is the end of the newer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Belief!!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnB09
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Vegas with my girlfriend where we stayed at the Encore in the Wynn Las Vegas complex. Half asleep in the taxi from the airport after travelling nearly 24 hours we are suddently awakened by the jaw dropping site of the lights and size of the Encore and Wynn Hotels, soaring into sky and dwarfing anything around it. If the outside was impressive, this was just the beginning. The staff could not be more friendly and courtious and do absolutely everything to make your stay as comfortable as possible. As you walk into the reception area you are greeted by the customary casino, we are not the gambling type but was great to see a real Vegas casino in all it's glory. So we check in and up to our room, only words to describe this as we opened the door was "wow". Spacious, spotless, luxurious are just some words that spring to mind, fantastic views also and the most comfortable bed i've ever slept in, even the bathroom was of the highest quality with a flat screen on the wall which was a nice touch. This hotel has everything, you would not need to leave it as you can shop here, eat here, relax by the pool, go to shows and night clubs, whatever you fancy, Encore has it. Again I can't speak highly enough of the staff, from the bell boy, to reception to the cleaning staff, all made us feel so welcome. There is so much more to this hotel that I may even be leaving some out so apologies for that. On the flip side if I had to pick a minor fault I would just mention the location, it's just outside what I would call the plush part of town near the Belaggio and Caesars Palace, so to visit that part of town you would need to get a cab which to be fair is only a few minutes away and would cost about $10 which is very reasonable. To finnish I would not let this put anyone off staying here, it's by far the best hotel i've ever stayed in and without doubt wewould go back, next time for longer though. - P.S Garth Brooks concert there was amazing too !!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vegas Experience - period!!”
Reviews.Author: SarasotaTrav
Reviews.Content: We recently took 40 valued clients to this hotel for our first experience. All i can say is way over rated and way over priced. This hotel does not measure up to the tropicanna much less a premium experience. my personal room was not available for 4 hours after arriving (arrived at 2pm) a condition of our contract was to have the room ready. That was the beginning of disaster. Decore is bizarre, hard to get drinks at the bar much less on the floor. we have held over 200 events in vegas over 15 years and this one is now on the "do not go back" list. would highly recommend one of vegas' other premium offerings. Palazzo was a much better experience with superior rooms at half the price. now you know.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rossimus78
Reviews.Content: Myself and my new wife stayed here as part of our Honeymoon. This hotel is only 2 years old and has to be seen to be believed! We were given a room on the top floor (63 if you're counting) and the view is absoulutely stunning. Our room looked out on to the top of the strip and the amazing mountains behind it. The room itself is perfect, and the bed is the most comfortable thing I've ever slept in! Pretty much everything is available to buy in the hotel, so may save up and get one shipped over! We spent 4 nights here, you could survive without ever leaving the hotel, there are numerous choices of restaurants and bars to choose from. The food ranged from very average Asian cuisine to the luxurious and famous Sinatra restaurant (very good food, but a limited menu and quite expensive. The staff are all very attentive and friendly and I cannot find fault with the hotel at all. Yes it's expensive, but if you're in Vegas you're probably loaded or there as a one off.

Reviews.Title: “6 out of 5!”
Reviews.Author: LTravel81
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas a number of times and now I have stayed at the Encore, I'm not sure I would stay anywhere else. It's a big hotel but they all are on the Strip, and it was perfect Vegas from start to finish. The suite was huge and even from the 33rd floor (halfway up) we had a great view. Everything had been thought of - electric curtains and sheers, a comfortable chaise longue. A huge comfortable bed that I never wanted to get out of - thankfully there was an excellent shower to wake me up! The spa is incredible - expensive but that's to be expected. I had one of the best massages I've ever had there and loved the heated loungers by the whirlpools. We saw Le Reve (make sure you tell them you're staying at the hotel - Wynn or Encore - for a good discount) which was fantastic. The Wynn buffet is one of the best out there. Generally friendly staff on the blackjack tables: varying degrees of success in the game! Also a mention for the valet staff. I have often found, particularly in big hotels, that you have to wait for your car even if you've called down beforehand. Not so here - on both occasions, I called down and we immediately headed downstairs. One time was in the middle of everyone's checkout. No wait at all for the car. I would definitely return. Preferably to live there.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Comfortable Stay At An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ortravelers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at the Encore. The only reason we stayed here was because we received a great offer in the mail from them. We certainly our glad we did. The suite we had the 22nd floor was large, clean and had a great view of the stripe. When we checked in they tried to get us to upgrade for $25 a night to a suite on the 60th floor but we passed as it basically the same room but on a higher floor. We found all the hotel and casino staff to be helpful and friendly. We ate breakfast the first 2 mornings at Society. While the food was very good both times the service wasn't. The first morning we had a great server who made us feel we were here only table when in fact she was running her feet off. So we decided to go back the second morning and the server we had was down right terrible. We saw tables served by other servers come and go but others he was serving along with us just seemed to take forever and he was getting orders wrong on top of it. So if you ever get David as your server ask for someone else!!!! Our package included tickets Le Reve which really wasn't something we would have paid to go so. While the performers are truly talented the show was rather confusing. If you go the performers are amazing but the story if there is one is very confusing. If you do stay here remember it's at the north end of the strip and it's hike to just about everywhere or a taxi ride. We did use the Deuce Bus to go to the south end of the strip which is quite reasonable at $3 each. Also, there is $20 resort fee which includes internet access. But what is interesting is when you go to use the internet it says that's a $13.99 charge. So I asked since we only used the internet could I pay that price and was told no as now everyone pays the resort charge which includes free local and long distance phone service. Another way to make money as most people use cell phones now. But we would stay here again especially at the price we had from there special offer/

Reviews.Title: “You can't really lose at the Encore at Wynn”
Reviews.Author: jtrn
Reviews.Content: Our resort suite was big, beautiful and had a great view looking towards The Mirage and Treasure Island. I loved everything from the decor and color schemes to the amenities!
