The resort and the adjacent Wynn complement each other in decor and design. I thought that the service was great, the staff met and exceeded my expectations. I look forward to a return stay at the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and classy”
Reviews.Author: EmandDee
Reviews.Content: Had been before to the Venetian (2004) - Encore reflects a more subtle, classier Vegas (as does City Center) influenced by Middle East resorts. The decor throughout is prettier and less brash than "old" Vegas, the casino comparatively small - doesn't dominate. A lovely place to stay - best breakfast location by the way is the Society Cafe Encore (the Wynn buffet is extremely greasy) and Encore has, in Parasol Down, the most delightful cocktail bar with a genuine charm and wit in its water feature. Stratta is a nice, smart but laid-back bar with great beers and martinis and a super Italian restaurant. We're not gamblers, just enjoy the Vegas experience and Encore is a great example of the new trends in town. It has a prettiness and charm that's not the Vegas norm but a nice change.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mooreny21
Reviews.Content: The Encore at the Wynn is beautiful. It is by far the best hotel in Vegas and probably one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed at. The staff is wonderful the accomodations are incredible. Even the food was excellent. I will stay that the food, accomodations, etc are more expensive than the vast majority of the other hotels on the strip but it was worth it. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Impactdancer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Wynn and this time chose The Encore. the beds are amazing, the Encore rooms are better than The Wynn rooms but the public areas are nicer at The Wynn than The Encore. Although both hotels are at the top of the strip, they are opposite a brilliant shopping mall and you don't really notice the walk along the strip. Visit Parasol Up at The Wynn, it's such a lovely bar. Amazing fitness centre and pools. This hotel is pure quality.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome do-over trip because Venetian Palazzo Sucked.”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before and had a flawless experience, so having a very poor birthday trip to try out the Prestige club level of Palazzo, we chose to do a quick make up trip back to the Encore. The rooms are far more sleek than the traditionally appointed competitor. The service levels are flawless. Check-in was a breeze and the gal at the front desk even gave us a couple different locations of rooms based on the view. We chose to look over the golf course and out across the valley. We don't spend a tremendous amount of time in a hotel room, especially in Vegas. They are as well appointed as any 5 star hotel you will find worldwide, complete with electric shades and draperies. The towels and linens are sumptuous. There were no problems whatsoever with our stay. What we think is best about Wynn and Encore is the attention to public spaces. The shopping arcades are so much more refined than say the mall next door at Venetian. Granted you can't take a carnivale style ride with a poorly singing gondolier, but then who would want to? The staff and guests are a cut above other locations on the strip, unless you're comparing to say Bellagio, but given the location and all the tourists that tromp through, you get more of a mix in Bellagio. The restaurants in Wynn/Encore are simply the best in Las Vegas. Everyone of them seems to be rated in one guide or another. The prix fixe meals are decadent and an incredible value given the ala carte price points. The decor, while over the top Las Vegas is much more refined and high end than the other casino properties on the strip. We're so impressed we're actually thinking of making a stop in Macau to see stay at their property there when we next fly over to Hong Kong. You won't be disappointed at the Encore. We've never stayed in a room at the Wynn, but I'm sure they are equally as elegant.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel, the staff are well worth all the praise given.”
Reviews.Author: LewisCox50
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny for the room, we stayed in the Encore Parlour suite. Do try the Country Club for great steaks and service also SW steak house was also very good. The Encore buffet is very good for breakfast but perhaps a little disappointing for lunch and dinner, the only minor point of our stay that did not match expectations. The staff deserve all the praise they receive they are very well trained and genuinely friendly. The pool area is well laid out and you can enjoy a long swim if you wish or just a cool dip, I thought the beverage prices where reasonable. The drinks served in the casino are very well made and served in the correct glasses with garnish, a martini in a martini glass and you can order what ever you desire my favorite being a lychee martini. I did find it a long walk to get to each facility but hey you eat and drink, its good to walk it off the next morning. Special praise for the cocktail waitresses always service with a smile and they remember what you favourite tipple is after ordering just once. All in All a great stay and we where made to feel very special, sure it is not cheap but at the end of the day this is a top notch hotel and you pay for what you get. Steve please keep up the good work and make sure you continue to look after your staff as I am sure that is the reason they look after us so well.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to put valuables in the safe!”
Reviews.Author: 2papillons
Reviews.Content: We returned Sunday from a 3 day stay at the Encore. We traveled with friends . Both couples ended up missing jewelry that we left out on the night stand.The jewelry was worth about $100 but still....The room was outstanding but still this left a bad feeling . I called the hotel to see if anyone had turned the jewelry in but the answer was no.

Reviews.Title: “The Encore is five star in all respects”
Reviews.Author: noncorteccia
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the employees were professional, helpful, and courteous. we had an issue with our key not working and a mini bar attendant stopped his work to help us. The suite was clean, comfortable, spacious with great amenities. The hotel layout is not confusing and it's located across the street from the shopping center. The people who keep the public areas clean do a fantastic job. Fitness center was new, clean, efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice but be ready to walk”
Reviews.Author: bryoung304
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore in mid-August. Check was really easy around 11am when we arrived. The line was very short. Casino is nice but pretty empty compared to other hotels. We have stayed at Tresaire Island, Mirage, Caesar's Palace, and the Wynn before. I am comparing it to these casinos. The food was very good at the restaraunts we ate at. The entire hotel was always very clean. The room was great! Comfy bed and even a little living room area w/swivel TV. The only problem I had was the walk out of the place. It took forever to get to the strip via the walk through Encore and then the Wynn. If you walked straight out to the strip from the Encore, it took a really long time to get anywhere on the strip walking. It was hot so we walked theough both hotels usually before exiting to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: maarcsays
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore on an offer for 3 comped nights, $300 freeplay, and food and beverage. I visit Las Vegas about 4-5 times a year, and by far the Encore/Wynn properties are the best on the strip. Rooms are very spacious, staff is top notch, and the casino is spotless clean. Only downsides to the hotel is the check-in wait, especially on Sundays. Furthermore, they need more Concierge staff, only having 3 staff members working at a time. Overall, I would stay here again, mainly because I always get free rooms here. If you were to ask me if I would pay the 300-500/night, I probably wouldn't, as there are other hotels that are as great, with a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed and will stay again”
Reviews.Author: achnyer01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore for the recent SEMA show and I was impressed with the hotel and staff. All the staff from the waitresses to the front desk staff and even the maintenance man in the hall way were all polite and eager to serve. Room was spacious clean and very quiet, it was like a vault. I could only find one place to have breakfast at the Encore and that was Society Cafe. Other mornings I walked to the Wynnn and ate at the buffet. I would probably stay at the Wynn next ime but would not hesitate to stay at the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: VegasGirl22
Reviews.Content: I loved the Encore from the minute I pulled up to the lobby. I go to Vegas once a year and like to try out all of the hotels and this is by far my favorite! The entire lobby and casino is absolutely beautiful and elegant. I loved the butterfly decor! Our room was huge and stunning. The beds were probably the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. I could have spent my entire vacation in the Encore and not left and been completely satisfied. The Society Cafe was delicious. They give you little soft pretzel sticks with your meal and they were soo good. The breakfast and lunch there is amazing. The pool was beautiful and the new Encore Beach Club was so much fun. We were offered a free cabana and got to hang out all day and drink free mimosas. Couldn't have had a better day. XS nightclub is easily my favorite club in Vegas, I was wowed as soon as I walked into the place. I have not one bad thing to say about this hotel. I even bough the cutest picture frame from the gift shop. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: stickie29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights for my parents 40th wedding anniversary celebration. I have to admit, I had high expectations after reading all the rave reviews and hearing over and over again how this was a five star resort. Perhaps my expectations were a little TOO high. The rooms were beautiful but overall I would say our experience here was only average, and we probably won't stay here again. Nex time I will opt for the Bellagio or Mandalay Bay. Here are some more details about our stay: Pros: 1) The rooms. Gorgeous and spacious. Everything is electronic, so you can be uber-lazy and shut your draps or put out the privacy notice without leaving the bed. The beds were very comfortable, and the pillows were heavenly. 2) The on-site staff. They were five-star friendly. Everyone bends over backwards to make sure you're happy and comfortable. Cons: 1) The towels in our room REEKED of smoke. Now, my parents didn't have this problem in their room, so I think maybe our maid was a smoker. But it was a problem every single day we were there, so it wasn't just one stray towel. ICCKKK. 2) The hallway of our floor (12th floor) also reeked of smoke half the time. Now, I understand this is Las Vegas, but we specifically asked to stay on a NON-SMOKING FLOOR! And there are signs everywhere, so I don't know why it smelled so terrible. 3) The other half of the time, the hallway reeked of pungent cleaner mixed with a ham sandwich. I'm not kidding. It was such a strong, gross smell, we wanted to throw up. 2) The resort is small and offers few amenities compared to the Wynn. You have to walk over to the Wynn for practically everything. My b/f wanted to get his shoes shined and had to walk to the Wynn. Ditto for me when I wanted to get a facial- their spa is very small and was booked up. 3) The pool. It is placed right between the Wynn and the Encore and gets sun for only two hours in the morning. What a stupid place to put the pool. It was shaded and cold all afternoon. Beware, the Encore is not all it's cracked up to be!!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Luxury”
Reviews.Author: CarmenD4
Reviews.Content: The hotel had the best room I've ever stayed in the world over. The view of the strip was incredible and the room itself was amazing with so much attention to detail. The bed was wonderful and the lounge area and bathroom were also perfect. The hotel is a little further up the strip but to be honest we found that a bonus as you didn't have all the 'hick' tourists wandering through your lobby with their big plastic cups of beer. It was a haven to escape to when you left the strip. That said it certainly wasn't dead. There are plenty of nightclubs to choose from and XS is allegedly the coolest spot on the strip right now. I do think that the queuing is ridiculous though and I don't think that guests should have to pay in. We're already paying enough! The overall decor in the communal areas is bright, and filled with light. The red everywhere is not overpowering but actually is a really vibrant, light colour. The pool is great and we had no problem getting loungers. All the hotel staff were helpful and courteous. We will definitely be back. 2 nights was NOT enough time to explore the hotel, let alone the whole of Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “The least sleaziest of the Las Vegas hotels ;-)”
Reviews.Author: njfamilytravel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Las Vegas, stayed at the Wynn Encore because I had a conference for a few days and decided to make it a whole week with the family. The hotel is beautiful and luxurious with terrific restaurants and amenities... but at its heart, the Wynn resort is a casino so it's prime focus is to attract a certain crowd, albeit with a fatter wallet and discriminating taste. We were there over Halloween, so there were lots of crazy outfits. You cannot avoid the smoke - it's everywhere on the casino floor and the surroundings. The lobbies, restaurants, pool and shopping areas are OK but the air is never totally smoke-free. The location is at the far north end of the strip, away from most of the action but that can be good or bad - you will have to decide. The rooms were extremely quiet and comfortable. Room service, housekeeping and valet were 5-star. We visited almost all the other "upscale" hotels on the strip and the Wynn property was by far the nicest and classiest. You will not find frat boys, adolescent bachelorette parties, fast food joints or pushy time share salesmen or anything that would make you forget you are being pampered in 5-star luxury. The downside is that everything at the Wynn is pricey (a round of golf at the resort is $500!) and they nickel and dime you on everything: no free Wi-Fi or complementary business services (a fax costs $8!). They even charge you to use the fitness center. I guess the high prices are meant to keep away the hoi polloi ;-)

Reviews.Title: “God Bless Steve Wynn!”
Reviews.Author: siede
Reviews.Content: God Bless Steve Wynn! I have been in very upscale luxury hotels from Aman Resorts to Mandarin Oriental Hotels, from Peninsula to Ritz and to Four Seasons everywhere around the world, but the experience in Encore's Tower Suites is sublime : pure luxury. We go to Vegas every year once or twice and used to stay at the Four Seasons. I am very confident saying that the Four Seasons is now very weak compared to Encore's Tower Suites. From the moment you step into the Tower Suites Lobby, everything amazes you; there is this beautiful scent, the French embroidered curtains, you feel the harmony and bliss. From the staff at the reception desk, the bellman, everyone in the hotel is programmed to make your stay more pleasant, with great smiles. We stayed in the hotel for 12 nights and I can't find anything to complain. (I feel obliged to say that we were NOT invited guests, we stayed at the hotel at our expense). In room dining, the hygiene in the rooms, the size of the rooms and bathrooms, housekeeping service, all perfect with no exceptions. Patio dining at Botero! Wow! The only thing is that for the first 7 nights, we stayed at the 30th floor in a Suite with a Strip view and in the night, there was some noise coming up from the Surrender. The only suggestion I would make is to ask for a higher floor room (for the remnant of our stay we had a room on the 63rd floor and no noise), or to book a room on the old city side where you also have a limited view of the golf course. If you seek for the 'creme de la creme' go for it. It's worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: AVRLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here....great service, beautiful room. Le Reve is a must see (the pool show next to SW is not), had great meals at SW and Capitol Grille across the street. Cabanas in July are a must. The casino is quiet (no bagging slot machines) which I personally like. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Forced downgrade on arrival - no thanks”
Reviews.Author: spherex
Reviews.Content: When we arrived our month-old reservation was not honored and we were forced into a smaller room with smaller beds at the wrong hotel. Our reservations had been for two queen-size beds at the Encore, but they forced us into double-sized beds at the Wynn in a smaller room. The only other negative was that the smell of smoke was strong on our non-smoking floor. They did refund us the difference for the smaller room and the hotel was nice otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull vegas ))”
Reviews.Author: alexzhdanov
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel. comfortable. spacious. modern. nice pool and friendly staff. delicious breakfasts. I had a 57 floor. wonderful view of the entire Vegas and the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, impeccable service, expensive room service”
Reviews.Author: JaneEMorgan
Reviews.Content: I see and stay in a lot of hotels in my line of work, and I have to say that the Wynn Encore Resort is spectacular in every way. For $169/night (Monday and Tuesday nights), I was given a gorgeous King suite that was the size of a small apartment. The place was immaculately clean and beautifully decorated in a glamorous yet understated style. There was a separate living room area separated from the bedroom area by a half wall with a flat screen TV. The living room area had floor to ceiling (high ceilings) panoramic windows facing a beautiful view and a very comfortable sofa with an integrated chaise and ottoman. The desk was very comfortable to work on and had two chairs for conferences. The lighting was excellent throughout the room and the bathroom even had dimmers. The sheets were the finest I had ever slept on (no joke). The bathroom had a shower and tub, with a beautiful double sink. I love the fact that a disposable shoe polish kit was provided in addition to the usual amenities. Essentially every detail in this place had been thought out and it made the room fantastically luxurious. Room service was expensive but very very prompt and outstanding. THe food was served on beautiful linens. I had the most delicious chocolate croissant in recent memory as part of my very expensive continental breakfast. The mini-bar is quite expensive but I have to say that the $8 bag of gourmet potato chips was pretty outstanding. The hotel itself is also gorgeous and immaculately clean. They must have cleaning elves that run out and clean when no one is looking because everything is always sparkling all the time. There are fresh, expensive flowers everywhere, and every employee I encountered was helpful and courteous. I did not have time to visit the gym, but I heard it is very nice. The hotel charged a $20 resort fee per night, but that included free internet, local and long distance calls, and use of the gym. Not a bad deal. The Wynn is definitely my new favorite hotel on the Strip. Can't wait to try the beach club next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not family friendly, looks new but nothing works”
Reviews.Author: sinniebon
Reviews.Content: We previously enjoyed stays at the Wynn as a childless couple. Now that we have a little one we decided to go back and try Encore, which we thought would be newer and better. In addition to their regular resort fee, we were charged for items that would have been complimentary and free at other hotels for families. Roll Away bed - extra $50 per night Crib - another extra $50 a night A/C - Didn't work Humidifier - free but was loud like a motor boat, housekeeping came brought in another one that wasn't loud but didn't work either. Bathtub faucet leaked water all over the bathroom floor when we tried to bathe the kid. After one night at Encore we decided it was newer but far fro mbetter. The poor AC and loud humidifier made our stay very uncomfortable and baby kept waking up too. Next day we checked into Four Seasons bright and early, walked into a room and saw a beautiful full size crib perpped with fresh bedding and bumpers. There were baby wipes, baby shampoo, diapers and the whole suite was baby proofed! What a difference. Service was impeccable, Four Seasons took it an extra mile and prepared everything we didn't think of. We all slept like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated, over-priced; Snobby days and pennyless nights...”
Reviews.Author: Jivelene
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st trip to Las Vegas and we chose Encore to be surrounded by luxury and because of its standard suite size. I was married here to be married in Vegas and thought that the room would be adequate for me & my bridal party to get dressed & prepared. This hotel was aesthetically pleasing. From the moment you walk in the door, you're left smiling with a signature scent and soothing jazz versions of familiar popular songs. Our check in was pleasant and fast. My party of 8 were all check in early, however I called several times to make sure all of our accounts were noted for early check in so we wouldn't encounter a problem. I LOVE the location of this hotel. I drove all over Las Vegas while I was out there and i felt this northern strip location was prime. Just far enough from the huge crowds, close to the mall & still on the strip. It's basically the last of the hotels that really feel like they're on the Strip. You could walk to Walgreens which was the next street over if you forgot your toothpaste and didn't want to pay $4 for a sample size in the "Sundries' . The table limits were all reasonable during the day but they skyrocketed at night and on the weekend. My girlfriends and I went to Surrender for my bachlorette party. A beautiful dance club which was also partially poolside. A sea of beautiful people swerved and grinded to the hip-hop/pop mashups! Not too crowed too since it was on a Thursday. But bring your wallet, each drink was around $15. But the atmosphere was exclusive and electric! The day of my wedding went smoother than I thought at the beginning. I suggest upgrading to the tower suites if you have more than 3 girls getting ready in 1 room. 700 sq ft just isn't enough. But, we managed. As we walked through the casino/lobby bar area,guest were congratulating me with bashful smiles. My mother, my bridesmaids and I were waiting for the limo in the lobby bar. I'm standing there in a full wedding gown, beautiful and nervous. We all went up to the bar to have a "calm my nerves" drink. The bartender ignored us (even though there were only 5 other people, all men at the bar). After waving for minutes trying to get his attention, he rudely told us to sit down and that he would send a server over. While waiting, I asked if I could smoke a cigarette. The answer was no (I guess this is the only bar in Vegas that you can't smoke in). "$hit!" I said barely above a whisper. "LANGUAGE!" exclaimed the bartender. I was not only snubbed by not getting served, I apparently was getting an etiquette lesson 15 minutes before my wedding. We waited over 10 minutes and no one came to attend to us. Thank god my maid of honor promptly cussed that bartender out. She gave a standing ovation worthy performance of the 5 worst cuss words you could call someone. How dare he treat a bride like that!!! When we returned that night from our wedding, our room had barely been touched even though we had the house keeping light on. There were empty bottles, dirty glasses and other garbage that had accumulated from the morning preparation of 4 bridesmaids and a bride making ourselves beautiful for my wedding. The only housekeeping that had been done was the making of the bed. So, we had to call housekeeping to our room at midnight to clean. It took them just under an hour to come and by then, I had cleaned up most of the mess myself. For the price of these rooms and the reviews that I've read, I really expected them to give me top notch customer service. For the most part, the service was just average and the run in with the' bride-ignoring bartender and midnight housekeeping were huge turnoffs. I consider myself to be a snobby consumer. When I pay big money for a product or service, I expect to receive only the best in return. I felt that Encore did not deliver the service level that should correlate with its price and ambiance. However, if you're willing to pay $400 a night for 'ambiance' and a really comfy bed (my favorite part of my stay), then this is the resort for you.

Reviews.Title: “Consistantly Excellent”
Reviews.Author: shrop
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this resort and each time it gets better. The standards are consistently high with cleanliness and service both top rated. On this trip we had stayed at the Vdara for two nights previusly and there is just no comparison, the Encore is in a different league. It's hard to find any faults, thee may be very small issues but generally it's a terrfic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on the Las Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2206
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas and we did our research to ensure we stayed at a nice hotel. On arrival, we were not disappointed! This hotel was wonderful, very nicely decorated (note im obsessed with butterflies and there everywhere). The check in process wasnt the best in the world, but once we walked through and into our room we were very impressed and looking forward to our first Vegas experience. The hotel restaurants and nightclubs are some of the best in Las Vegas, and the Le Reve Cirque de Soleil show is also in the hotel theatre (make sure you go and see this its amazing!) The hotel casino is great and modern but still kept very much in the vegas tradition. If you manage to win big in the casino, the hotel even has a Ferrari garage where you can go and treat yourself to nice new car, or pop into Chanel in the hotel and buy yourself a beautiful handbag! Opposite the hotel is the large Fashion Mall shopping centre, and everything is within walking distance, which is ideal! There is so much to do at this hotel and in vegas that you will be spoilt for choice The hotel staff are very friendly and couldnt be more helpful.... We loved Las Vegas and the Encore so much that we have booked to go again next month with some girlfriends to bring in the New Year.... I will report back and hopefully our stay will be the same as before if not better!! :) PS.. a note on las vegas in general...if you enjoy your sleep and cant live without it then dont go! Because i think we slept for around 20hours total in 6days!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel-try it”
Reviews.Author: ENGLISHBLONDE
Reviews.Content: We checked in a the Encore at 1pm and our room was ready. And wow....what a room. We were on the 60th floor and had the most amazing view up the Strip. Considering there are only 63 floors we were almost at the top. The check in was very smooth and it was a 32 second flight up the elevator to the 60th floor. King suite E6020 was incredible. If you can tear yourself away from the view the rest of the suite is pretty amazing too. The bathroom is huge with a deep tub and huge shower. The his and hers sinks were very stylish with a 19inch television in the wall next to them. Robes were also hanging ready for us. The kingsize bed was the most comfortable ever with very very soft linens. Feathers pillows too. Cool idea too with the flat screen tv be able to swivel round to the bedroom area or the lounge area. The drapes, sheers and lights were all controlled from a panel by the bed or a panel by the entrance door. The Encore hotel was just beautiful. Very classy restaurants, shops and lobby and an equally classy casino floor. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and yes it is a little further down the Strip than I would have liked but we had a rental car so could drive up to the hotels at the top end of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jellytotty
Reviews.Content: A brilliant hotel with huge rooms and such friendly staff. Concierege was helpful when we needed travel information. We will definitely come back and stay when we go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here every time”
Reviews.Author: jfkdeuce
Reviews.Content: The Encore does everything right. From check in to check out, the Encore experience is first class. Rooms were large and comfortable, restaurants were exceptional, and the staff were not only helpful, but highly professional in every respect. I go to Vegas on the average four times a year, and plan to stay at the Encore on every visit.

Reviews.Title: “King Suite with strip view - upscale”
Reviews.Author: Bcr8tve
Reviews.Content: My annual girl's trip for shows, spa, fun and catching up. Stayed here with a friend in August, 2010 for 4 nights in a King Suite room. Fantastic Hotel and the best part was a rate of $109/nt for mid-week rental! What a deal. The spa is world-class and we started our day with a visit to the fitness center. The spa lobby smells so good you just wanna stay there the entire day. I prefer this hotel over the Wynn due to the designated elevator to the pool. At the Wynn and many vegas properties, you parade thru an elegant public space in pool clothes with wet hair. the Encore is not so and it's separated- very nice. The clientele is excellent as are the restaurants, cafe's, shows, decor, rooms etc... I like the high ceilings in the casino and the option of walking through to the Wynn for more restaurant choices. It was a terrific value for such an oppulent setting. The Encore is my top pick for the strip. We checked out the new city center too when we visited - it's beautiful and worth checking out the shops. If i had to say a negative, the music at the "adult's only" pool was very loud and drinks are incredibly expensive. I ordered a margarita at the pool bar and thought it was a mistake when the bill was $18 for one 10oz frozen drink in a plastic cup.

Reviews.Title: “The Best...”
Reviews.Author: PierreChicago
Reviews.Content: It's not cheap, but it is so beautiful and classy. Had a little problem at check in with the room they wanted to give me, other than that I was very pleased. Encore is a little smaller than the Wynn, but it is very elegant. The employees were great, and the service was what you would expect. XS was very cool, opens up to the pool, good crowd, although too many men compared to women, like most clubs in Vegas. The Spa was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DDLLS
Reviews.Content: Encore and the Wynn are the best properties in Vegas. Having been a huge fan of the Venetian in the past. After staying at Encore, I can never stay any where else. The service at both the Wynn and Encore properties is the best in Vegas. Though they are farther from the other hotels, we didn't even want to leave as everything restaurants etc is just better here. My only preference is the Venetians air quality in there casino. Wynn's and Encores casino air isn't as fresh. I found myself spending more time in the Venetian casino in the past, because it isn't as smoky with the air circulation and the Vanilla in the air. Encore's rooms are great, a little narrower feeling than the other hotels in Vegas. Will defiantly try the tower suites next time. But great decor, comfortable, and nice and quite. Never heard outside noise. Great bathrooms. Pools were wonderful. More of a relaxed adult atmosphere all around.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular, Awesome, Beyond Words on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: Mapandus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently travelled to Las Vegas for 4 nights and stayed at the Encore at Wynn. This hotel is unbelievable. It truly is a 5-star hotel. We felt very special and pampered. The lobby is beautiful, staff are very courteous and helpful, and the room was wonderful. Our view included the golf course, the Vegas strip and the mountains. The room was tidied every day and left in pristine condition. We were located at the north end of the strip and did a lot of walking; but that is to be expected in Vegas. We would definitely stay at the Encore on a return visit and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Visit”
Reviews.Author: schintz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in every high end hotel in Vegas and I have to say, this is the nicest! Great customer service, rooms are like brand new and quiet. I spent most of my time between the Encore and the Wynn, and didn't even want to leave to venture out to any other casinos. You have to try the Mar-tea-ni at the Lobby Bar and Cafe'. It's gin infused with earl grey tea....so strong in a good way and very tasty. Everywhere I went I was greeted with a smile and even got a handwritten note from the casino host when I got back, telling me to contact her next time I plan on visiting, which I believe will be in December.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience at Encore Devolving to Civil Suit”
Reviews.Author: davidlsharpe
Reviews.Content: There is something seriously wrong with the management and customer service philosophy used at this hotel. Wynn was way, way better before. I have been treated better at Motel 6s. What I observed in my time there: 1). Woman getting hit by object full water bottle thrown from second story balcony at pool area. 2). Me getting hit by another full water bottle thrown from second story balcony at pool area. 3). Man complaining to poolside security about an assault/battery of some sort at pool area. (I don't know the details of this one, but I saw the guy complain) 4). Stolen wallet from the pool area - not recovered as far as I could tell. Security did retrieve a stolen iPhone from the bushes. 5). Woman performing "an act that you wouldn't want your children to see" on a man on the balcony of cabana #113 in full public view of the families and children passing by on Las Vegas Boulevard. 6). At the entrance of the pool area, a woman asked a man to show her his privates. He asked her to show her breasts first, which she did for a few seconds in full view of the public. He lowered his swim trunks at that point. 7). I got banned from the property for complaining about getting assaulted by people at a high roller party in the pool area fronting Las Vegas Boulevard. I called the las Vegas police because the hotel refused to do so to keep their record clean. These imbeciles didn't even apologize for anything. Things have gotten so bad that I am in the process of filing a civil suit. Telling them that we had recently sent hundreds of salespeople there, but couldn't consider doing that again if this is what we would expect to happen to our employees and their families didn't seem to make a dent. I recommend you avoid this place until they gut out the bad management and customer service practices and replace it with folks appropriate for a 5-star property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: bethbaker
Reviews.Content: Encore is beautiful. We stayed there the weekend of Oct 15, 2010 Check in was smooth, the room was beautiful, view was fantastic. Pools were very nice, although at 2pm they get too much shade. Pool service was so so. It took quite a while for waitresses to take orders and bring drinks. The drinks were expensive, but I didn't find them more than other resorts in Vegas that we have stayed at. We ate at Switch Steakhouse for dinner one night and it was great, but pricey. The service was ok. Breakfast is a mess there. There is one little lobby bar with coffee and muffins. Always a giant line. There is Society Cafe that offers breakfast, but the line was crazy there too. I am not a breakfast person, so it was irritating to not be able to get something else other than breakfast food. The concierge was fantastic, they were lots of help with restaurants, shopping ,etc. Everything is expensive, as most of Vegas is, but it is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “can do much better in vegas”
Reviews.Author: ringo5
Reviews.Content: recently stayed at encore and from check in to check out recieved terrible service. this property seems to have no concern for customer care. Employees displayed bad attitude throughout stay. there are much better options in Las vegas and we will not return to encore. We even expressed our displeasure in a email to hotel which garnered zero response!!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a Bachelorette Party”
Reviews.Author: aroundtheworldb
Reviews.Content: Okay, so my previous reviews on Vegas hotels were through the eyes of one there for work. I can now say I've been to Vegas for fun and share a different side of the hotel story. The breakdown: 12 girlfriends from all over the country meet for one short weekend to celebrate a bachelorette party. The Hotel: The Encore ( a Wynn hotel) Rooms: 3 (which equals four girls to a room!) Itinerary: Arrive Friday afternoon and leave Sunday morning. I love Wynn hotels for their visual aesthetic. Steve Wynn and the people he has working for him have an amazing attention to detail that creates an environment that captivates your senses from start to finish. Flying from Minneapolis, I was the first to arrive at the hotel. I found the Encore lobby well decorated, with a whimsical butterfly theme. The line to check in was only 2 people long, so my wait was short. Unfortunately I arrived before check in time (3 pm) and they were unable to get me in to my room, but they immediately offered to hold my luggage and give me a pass to the pool. There are two pools at the Encore including a "European Pool" which is decidedly where those who want to party and socialize spend their time in the sun. Both pools were beautiful and packed on a June weekend. The Euro pool was essentially an outdoor, daytime nightclub, complete with house and R&B music blasting from 8 am to close. We rented a cabana for Saturday afternoon in order to have a waiter for food and drink service and place to sit in the shade. Though the cabana was nice (complete with refrigerator stocked with beverages, fans, TV, phone and couch), it was probably not worth price (around $600 +). The fridge wasn't working, so our beverages weren't cold and the cabana manager copped an attitude when we complained about it. Terrible customer service given the caliber of the hotel and cost of the rental. Cabanas are certainly great for a group, but next time I'd opt for a poolside chair near an umbrella. With four girls to a room I was anticipating a tight squeeze when getting ready to go out for the night. Fortunately the contemporary room was spacious, as was the grand bathroom with huge mirrors. The rooms are not a ornate as the Venetian (and not a spacious), but certainly comfortable enough for a short weekend. The spa was gorgeous and highly recommended if you are interested in expensive pampering. The services are not so different from the normal city spa fare, but the ambiance is above and beyond, making it worth the price. As with any bachelorette party, clubs going is a night-time must. The Encore and Wynn (which are connected) house a number of clubs and we were able to sample all of them. XS is right off the lobby of the Encore and opens up to the daytime Euro pool. The best part of XS would have to be the periodic spurts of one dollar bills falling from the disco ball hanging from the ceiling. Beyond collecting a couple bucks to put towards a $15 drink, the music and crowd are fairly unremarkable. Tryst in the Wynn is an upscale version of XS and the dance floor opens to a colorfully lit waterfall. Tables are a bit more sophisticated and the crowd more upscale. I'd opt for Tryst over XS if I went again. Sunday morning we had brunch at Society Cafe right off the casino in the Encore. This is a casual restaurant and perfect for groups or couples. Again service was slow and unremarkable, but the food was tasty and the ambiance is stunning in hues of black, white, lime green, and hot pink. It was also voted one of the Best New Restaurants in 2009 by Esquire Magazine. Would I stay at the Encore again? Yes. However, if I wasn't splitting the room/cabana cost with friends I would have been quite disappointed in the customer service. Overall an upscale, unique hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “WORST VEGAS EXPERIENCE EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: shirlphd
Reviews.Content: From check in to checkout, this place was a nightmare. They insisted on taking $450 out of y debit account even though the 3 nights were all paid in advance. Then, they refused to allow access to the minibar or to the telephone and a trip to the spa was an extra $45 charge - NONE of this communicated prior to the booking. I paid more than $500 for a single on a Thursday night and was given a room overlooking the air conditioning system. I experienced the front desk staff as rude and demeaning. None of these policies are listed on their website. This hotel has a 5 star rating but I've been treated better at the Motel 6. Stay away, stay away, stay away!.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: lel1911
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights on our honeymoon. It was amazing. The rooms are the best I have ever stayed in, the staff were amazing. The pool was gorgeous. I have nothing negative to say about the hotel or the experience. Would recommend it in a heartbeat..

Reviews.Title: “Bravo for Encore!”
Reviews.Author: Edinburgh_Lady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Vegas a few times and having stayed at Wynn LV before, we decided to try Encore this time. The rooms in Encore are exceptionally spacious, comfortable and clean. We have a friend who was there a couple of weeks before us, and he warned us about the noise from the outdoor nightclub on the weekend. We broached this during check-in, and the receptionist was happy to give us a room to the rear of the hotel - the view wasn't as good, but at least we could sleep at night! Like some of the other Trip Advisor reviewers, our only real gripe would be about the location. If you're out along the Strip, it's a hell of a walk back and we reckon that from entering the first door at Wynn LV, it took us around 15 minutes to walk to our room in Encore. If you're going, make sure you sign up for a Red Card, if you intend gambling at all. We're not high rollers at all, but over the week, we accrued 2 free buffets (worth just shy of $80), a delicious meal at Society (worth $150) and a free night's accommodation, should we return (and we were only playing 1c slots!). The casino is airy and pleasant. We are non-smokers and twice took taxis to other parts of Vegas (Fremont Street and the Rio) only to jump straight back in a taxi back to Encore because the smoke in some of the older casinos really is unbearable. There is a distinctive scent pumped throughout Encore which masks the smoke, and the high standard of cleanliness means that the environment is generally pleasant at all times. If I could pick up Encore and stick it in the middle of the Strip, I'd be back tomorrow. It really is a lovely hotel, but Wynn edges it on location.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience overall, would come back!!”
Reviews.Author: tnv108
Reviews.Content: The decor was absolutely beautiful. Staff members were always cheerful even in the early morning. I traveled there with a large group of girls for teh weekend and the staff memebrs were very accommodating to us. The view was great. Too bad it was a super hot weekend though :( but you gotta love the indoor AC!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: UncleMonty
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the only negative - the location. It's the last decent hotel at the north of the strip and a fair way from the hustle and bustle of centre strip. However that's also a positive as it means that it doesn't get crammed with all and sundry wanting to play the tables, get boozy, loud or generally unsociable. This 'exclusivity' is one of the reasons I booked it. Everything else was great and I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. I'll grant you it's not the cheapest hotel around but you get what you pay for. I've stayed at six different Vegas hotels, (including Bellagio, Venetian and Venezia), and this is the best, by a distance. I'd also add that although I generally don't sleep well in hotels, this had the second most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. That certainly helps when you need to relax after a hard day by the pool. :-) PS - SW Steakhouse is to die for. Pricey, but a must visit.

Reviews.Title: “Megatropolis”
Reviews.Author: cdamman
Reviews.Content: Wynn and Encore share the theatres and shops, as well as a few of their lounge areas. Together, it is very huge and if you do not like walking, it is not the place to be. The rooms are large and some have great views, but not all. It is a bit of a distance to the standard mid-Las Vegas attractions and in the heat that is a huge setback. It is designed for one to stay and enjoy what the two resorts have to offer without consideration of the rest of the city.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PackGuru
Reviews.Content: The Encore is truly one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. We usually stay at the Wynn or the Palazzo, but the Encore wins!! The rooms are huge and the layout is terrific. the bathroom is very large and I love the separate tub and shower. They have not missed the mark on anything. I have a new favorite hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money!!”
Reviews.Author: WelshRach
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas after a lifelong dream for my partner. We decided to stay in the Encore after much deliberation. We chose a Panoramic Suite which was quite expensive but it was our first time and we wanted to have somewhere nice to stay and it was worth it! The room is very impressive, huge king size bed, a bathroom to die for, lovely lounge area with a 42” TV that swivels round. Controls at the side of the bed for the curtains, lights and privacy, very handy! The hotel is immaculate and that was one thing I noticed throughout our stay, the staff are constantly cleaning and tidying up and it shows. The hotel is 3 years old but it doesn’t look like it’s been open for more than 3 months. The effort the staff put in to keeping the hotel clean is certainly noticeable and worthwhile. I used the European pool while I was there. I would advise to get there before 11am as it starts to get busy after that but the hotel does operate a 30 minute policy whereby if you have not returned within 30 minutes then they will remove your towel. Not so much of a problem in the week but they really enforced this on the weekend. I didn’t see any people take offence at this. There are waitresses walking around offering you drinks and are very pleasant. It took us a few days to get used to the smoking inside as this is banned in the UK. They spray a perfume into the reception and casino area and after a few days you don’t notice it. With regards to nightclub noise, my partner noticed it on the weekend but it was very faint. I would advise asking for a room on a higher floor. It was a holiday of a lifetime and we will definitely be returning! We will probably stay more central next time as we did feel a bit out of the way but we knew that before we picked the Encore. One thing I have to comment on is how nice everyone was that we met. People couldn’t do enough for you, the servers were always coming over to check everything was ok without being intrusive and people were happy to chat. It was a refreshing difference coming from the UK where people are more reserved!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! Excellent location, outstanding service, view and food!”
Reviews.Author: Kitten84
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best hotel we have every stayed in! We upgraded at $20 a night to a better room on the 52nd floor. Oh my goodness, the room was bigger than my flat. the bathroom is huge with his and her sinks, the room has ceiling to floor windows which i spent a lot of time on the chaise lounge watching the helicopters fly to the canyon. The staff were beyond helpful with booking tours and events and organssing transport for us. The pool area goes on for forever and ever! Food was 5 star, we ate there most nights, highlights being the chinese with the crystal dragon. Attempted to gamble here too and the free drinks were flowing and drinkable (unlike other casinos,MGM!!) and we were only on the 25cents slot machine. Now trying to book a honeymoon hotel that matches this standard, Wynn Macau looks like a favourite. Excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: mibeseev
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wynn twice before so gave the Encore a try this time. Both hotels are in many respects comparable. I booked a tower king suite and really think the "tower" concept is worth the extra price. Little things like the separate reception area with btw excellent staff and the complimentary wifi (which you simply expect nowadays but do not get in LV usually; not a big price if charged but simply puts me off anyway)! are all there. My wife and I also found the free pressing service for our clothes nice. Rooms are big and clean just like at the Wynn. Had the outer window been clean and not 30% covered with sand dust we would have enjoyed the view to the strip as well. Prices at the restaurants are very high and while this is justified for the restaurants which are usually just excellent I would have appreciated a place for coffee and cake at a lower price range. My wife and I had a lunch snack at the Bellagio and compared to this the Encore can become better (more variety). I also can't help but feeling that some of the restaurant staff tried too hard to be a first class hotel rather than making people just feel comfortable. I would still recommend the Encore but think for the rates they charge you really have alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “remember to ask for an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: skhemka74
Reviews.Content: remember to ask for an upgrade when you check in, I would always recommend getting a lowest room at the wynn and going to wynn and asking to be given a upgraded room at encore for an extra price. totally worth it. and what a super hotel. Although the gaming areas are considerably empty. you must eat at the pool side restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Wow- This is the number one!”
Reviews.Author: CORMORANTBournemouth
Reviews.Content: We have just reyurned from the Encore at Wynn- What a place! The hotel room we had was the resort suite and it was gorgeous! We have stayed as a family in many hotels and do like a nice hotel but staying as a couple for the first time in ten years this was beautiful! The beds are simply divine and I thought I had the best bed in the world! Have a look on the Wynn website at the rooms and it is exactly what you see! Even the cabbies and staff at the other hotels admit at present it is the best on the strip! Go to it and enjoy it all!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel ! Very noisy night club !”
Reviews.Content: An Absolutely stunning hotel with service and cleanliness second to none. I stayed at the hotel with my sister and son (14yr) The show La Reve is a must, absolutely fabulous !Get the cheaper tickets (advertised as splash Zone) we didnt get splashed once ! The negatives were a) The Beach Club nightclub was horrendously noisy and didnt close until 4am ! We were on the 61st floor and paid extra for view of the 'strip' and were assured we wouldnt hear the music WRONG! ask for room on the other side of hotel and it should be quieter (or take earplugs!) b) only a few parasols round the pool, in the Nevada sun EVERY sunlounger should have one but there was only 1 to every 8 loungers (approx)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel With a Somewhat Stuffy Attitude”
Reviews.Author: lam84
Reviews.Content: I went here with a couple friends last August for my friend's bachelor party. Overall, the stay was good, with a few exceptions, as will be noted below. SERVICE: Generally speaking the service was alright, but not spectacular. We had one major issue at check-in, though. Since we were going for a bachelor party, we brought beer with us. However, we were told by hotel staff that we could not bring any "outside beverages" into the hotel - no exceptions. As such, we were forced to bring our drinks back to the car before we could check in (which we subsequently snuck back in). I have NEVER heard of such a policy, even at the more "upscale" resorts that I have stayed at, such as the Bellagio, or the Venetian, and I have never been told to take my "outside drinks" back by either of those hotels, even when I had them in plain view at check in! I thought this was ridiculous. After all, this is Vegas, and we weren't a bunch of hard partying kids! HOTEL GROUNDS: the hotel grounds are beautiful, but a little gaudy, which is fine because its Vegas. Surprisingly, it didn't smell like smoke, unlike most Vegas hotels. Overall the hotel grounds were very well maintained in my opinion, possibly because the Encore is a relatively newer hotel. ROOMS: our room was awesome. Like I mentioned before, I've stayed at some of the nicer hotels in Vegas, and this was the nicest room I've stayed at. Extremely comfortable beds and bedspreads...not "hotel-like" at all. The bathroom was spacious, and the toiletries were a nice touch. The room is kind of set up like the suites at the Venetian, with a living room area and a bedroom area, and I believe all the rooms are suites. We managed to fit 6 guys in the room without any problems. POOL: the pool left a lot to be desired. It was overcrowded and very small for such a large resort. We went to the pool once around 1 pm, and there were LITERALLY no open pool chairs the entire 3 hours we were there. Also, the pool bar area got suspiciously murky and murkier as the day went on. LOCATION: Its at the end of the strip, so its not the greatest location if you want to walk, but not anything a cheap taxi trip won't solve. PRICE: we got a great deal on the room by booking way in advance, through Vegas.com, otherwise it would have been too pricey. I suggest doing the same. If I remember correctly, we paid $150 a night, divided by 6 guys, so it ended up being a total bargain. CONCLUSION: I would only stay here again if I got a good deal. Although its a beautiful hotel, it seemed a little stuffy for us. However, if fancy is your thing, this is definitely the place....I have no qualms about the hotel when it comes to the grounds itself, it was just something about the atmosphere there that wasn't as welcoming as other nice hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect luxury”
Reviews.Author: aaasis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite for 6 nights. Gorgeous room, huge bathroom with deep tub, big shower and luxurious toiletries. Large bedroom with the most comfortable king bed. Living area with sofa, desk and large flat screen tv which swivels to face bed or sofa. Full wall windows overlooked las Vegas strip but very quiet, no street noise at all. Hotel was clean, staff friendly and courteous. Lots of restaurants, shops and of course the casino. When staying here you have access to all of the facilities at both the Wynn and Encore including all of the pools. I love this hotel and will defiantly stay here again. It is expensive but they do have offers at times, we booked on an earlybird offer 9 months in advance and it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “beauty and class beyond words...”
Reviews.Author: skeptictraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore to try something 'different'. The last time we were in Vegas, we stayed at Cesar's Palace and had an equally wonderful time. The difference we noticed between the 2 hotels is the incredible amount of class and beauty that runs through the Encore. It was SPOTLESS, right down to the vibrant colored rugs throughout the hotel. With the amount of people trekking through there on a daily basis- it was very obvious they took imense care in making sure everything was impeccable. We actually strolled through the hotel to grab a late, late night coffee and found the maintenance guys steam cleaning the rug!! The rooms are great. Beautiful panoramic views of the city and at sunset is so beautiful. The only thing that was a little 'inconvenient' if you may- was the location. It was the far from the rest of the hotels that were more central on the strip-but made for a nice stroll.... Service was great- staff standing around if any directions were needed. A room key was required to enter the elevators at night- which made you feel secure that punks from other hotels weren't partying it up in the rooms next to you! Great food. "The Buffet" had amazing breakfasts! EVERYTHING you could ask for...literally!! All and all it was wonderful. Would HIGHLY recommend it. It was far from cheap- but if your going to treat yourself...DEFINATLEY stay at the ENCORE!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, but not the noise”
Reviews.Author: me_in_chicago
Reviews.Content: We went to The Encore for a girls' trip in October and stayed at the Encore expecting some much needed R&R and fun. The hotel is nicely appointed without being over-the-top. One of my main concerns with going to Vegas is the smell of smoke, and that wasn't a problem at the Encore. The hotel is kept spotless, but I never seemed to see the cleaning personnel (maybe because I was sleeping most of the morning!). My experience at the Encore was a nice one, except for one BIG exception. My friend and I decided to go to bed "early" at 2am one night. I couldn't fall asleep for at least an hour because the noise from the club at the pool was SOOOOOO LOUD. Keep in mind that we were on the 60th floor, so we were not close to all of the action. We had a panoramic view room with two Queen beds facing the Wynn/strip. I had read prior to the trip that this may be an issue, but I had no idea it would be this loud. The hotel really needs to do something about it. Our room rate for the weekend averaged almost $500 a night, so this is just unacceptable. Almost forgot to add that after about 30 minutes of not being able to fall asleep that I put in some earplugs and I could still hear the "Boom boom boom boom" from 60 floors down. The spa at the Encore is amazing. I got an 80 minute massage, and while it wasn't the best massage ever, the facilities were great. I spent some additional time in the steam room and plunge pool areas. Very nice. Again, very expensive, but the facilities are probably one of the best on the strip. I liked that the spa waiting area is NOT co-ed like at other casinos (stayed at the Bellagio once and was shocked to wait around in a robe with strange men...weird). The restaurants are also very nice at the Encore/Wynn. We ate at Society (grilled artichoke was awesome), Wazuzu, Bartolotta, and Terrace Point Cafe. All of the food was outstanding, but service could be much better (with the exception of Bartolotta, where service was great). There were times at Wazuzu when we had to flag down our server. The neighboring table to us was having the same issue. We went one night to Surrender and another to XS. XS was a blast! Overall, the stay was nice. If I stayed there again I would make sure to not have a strip/nightclub/pool view.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and grand Hotel - shame about the Wi-fi and lack of complimentary coffee/tea/water.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDream1
Reviews.Content: Our room was hip, modern and quiet - the windows were spotless but there was dust (probably due to the clean finish). The bed was the most comfortable bed we had ever slept in - you could buy the bed and the sheets from Wynn shop in the esplanade. The shower was pretty good as well.The view we had from our room was amazing looking out to the mountains - the Encore is hidden behind the Wynn so not sure how good the view is Strip side. The Wynn breakfast buffet ($20+tax) was well worth the money and is worth doing if you want to fill yourself up and miss lunch even if you are not staying within Steve Wynn's complex. Our main disappointment with the Encore (we are assuming the Wynn is the same) is their need to charge for everything and not give you anything other than free ice! This was the only hotel out of 5 during our last holiday in the states where we didnt have coffee or tea making faciliaties in our room (unless you wanted to pay a large amount of $ to have one delivered...i think not) - Starbucks is cheaper at the Fashion Show Mall! Neither do you get complimentary bottles of water (we gather Donald Trump gives you them daily for free!) This was also the only hotel where we didnt get free WiFi - $13.99 per day is ridiculous particuarly when you consider you are staying in Las Vegas and some of our other hotels have been smaller and less extravagant! As a guest you are given a red card; on check-in this was not explained therefore we didnt use it and didnt use the casino in either the Encore or the Wynn. We definately felt like a number rather than a valued customer. If you can get a stay at the Wynn or Encore at a good price (e.g.on expedia or something similar) it was worth staying BUT (unless you have one big in the casino) definately buy your bottled water from the shop down the road! Its true what they say a luxurious hotel with comfortable beds and sheer extravagance throughout. The locals say that if you stay at the Wynn/Encore the belief is that you are charged for everything inside - they are right! We would stay again if the price was right and wi-fi/coffee/water issue was resolved.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: AlyP
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Wynn we tried the Encore this year. Beautiful room (Resort King). Very comfortable bed and quality in room facilities. Choice of several excellent restaurants and beautiful pool areas. Spa comes highly recommended as does the Salon. Cannot fault this hotel, will return again and again. High standards of service, cleanliness and maintenance throughout.

Reviews.Title: “EXQUISITE -- Top Notch All The Way!”
Reviews.Author: Lana4444
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore 3 nights, room was great (had upgraded to Strip View). Air conditioning was not working totally, so upgrade fee was removed upon check-out. Ate at the Wynn Memerial Day weekend Buffet-- it, too was over the top! $92 for 2, tax and tip included (higher cost due to holiday weekend), but it was amazing!! Would definitely stay again and go to buffet again!! Pools were crowded but we were able to find space eventually. Only downfall -- no coffee in rooms -- ahd to go doen to cafe' in a.m. to get it.

Reviews.Title: “The best Vegas experience to date”
Reviews.Author: alhoutex
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Thursday around 2:30 PM. We were able to immediately get to the counter and were quickly checked in. We were assigned the 11th floor and requested to be moved higher for a better view. Our request was granted without any problem and we were moved to the 36th floor. Our room was beautiful and overlooked the north end of the strip. We did not have a strip view but we were ok with this as I heard that side can be noisy from the night clubs. During our entire stay, which included Friday and Saturday night, we never heard any music or thumping of base. We were right next to the elevators but only heard light whirring every now and then. The entire staff was always courteous and accommodating. Any questions were met with correct answers and everyone seemed to know where everything was. The food was excellent and we ate at Pizza Place, Buffet, Botero, and the deli. We gambled a quite a bit and drinks were free while gambling which saved us probably $100 in drinks. We also received two comped buffets for our table time and that was worth $65. We saw the LaReve show and it was excellent, we had great seats. Join the Red Card club if you gamble and you get 10 dollars in slot play plus they give you points towards comps. The morning of checkout, the concierge printed our airline boarding passes quickly and checkout was a breeze. I was 100% satisfied with our stay and recommend the Encore over the Wynn as it was less crowded overall than the Wynn. Most of the dining options are at the Wynn so you do have to walk over there. This was my 3rd time to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suite!”
Reviews.Author: jsngb77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Encore our last visit to Vegas in June.We booked a suite and we were in awe when we walked in the door! Such a beautiful room with floor to celing windows.The room was very clean and we didn't even want to leave the room while we were there!! We were on the 38th floor facing the pools.Our view was great.We could see the strip,partially,and the mountains.We saw the sunset over the mountains which was beautiful.The noise from the nightclubs were barely noticable on saturday night.The cooridor that goes to the shops and nightclubs were absolutely horrible on friday and saturday with all the young crowds, way too many and they were loud and obnoxious.Seems the Wynn would not tolerate this.You probably won't see this unless you are leaving a show late.But overall enjoyed our stay.I'd go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is first class, hospitality beyond your imagination. you leave feeling like a million dollars.”
Reviews.Author: zhar
Reviews.Content: I would highly recomend checking into this fabuous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2525
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel one of the best in Vegas We stayed in a tower suite and it was perfect but do make sure you take a high level room to avoid noise from beach club Beautiful huge room and so clean Fantastic views and service Just great!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hatsoff155004
Reviews.Content: The Encore is the best place we have stayed in Vegas and will not stay anywhere else in the future. Truly a five star complex with great service. The rooms are very large and the views are spectacular. The casino is not as large as some but is very bright and comfortable with a great air circulation. All restaurants were great except for the Stratta which we felt was overpriced. The pools and exercise areas are super. The whole complex is extremely clean and well decorated. Can't wait to get back to the Encore

Reviews.Title: “All we can say is...WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: Foodpassion28
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Encore at the Wynn, on the 30th Floor facing the Strip, Pools, Mountain, golf course & Airport in the distance! What a VIEW, and the lights at night were unbelieveable!!! It is a bit far from the other hotels as it is way up of the main strip area, but it was nice being away from the crowds at the end of the day. The pool & bar service was exceptional! We ate at three restaurants next door at the Wynn for two lunches & a light dinner and made a reservation for the Steve Wynn Steak House for our last night. Great food everywhere we ate! Make a reservation early if you want to dine at the restaurants during the evening as they book fast, we got one of the last two reservations for our desired time slot, making the resrvation when we arrived for our last night! The room was sensational. Large, comfortable and extremely clean! We were given a hotel credit, $$ which was applied to some of our food bills that we charged up to our room, so that was a savings for a few meals. We did not come home with any winnings but we saw a great show "LOVE", one of the many Cirque shows, this one to the Beatles music at the Mirage. Even though some of the reviews were not promising, we thought it was excellent! We had lots of fun away from Las Vegas Blve on Freemont St (OLD downtown STRIP). Go at night for the light show over your heads and dance/sing to the great music! It is now closed off to traffic, covered over for blocks which they have a show overhead every hour on the hour till midnight, and you can see all the old Vegas NEON signs down there and some of the older hotels! GREAT TRIP and it was our first time to Vegas! Four nights would have been best, not sure if we will travel there again, as we saw, gambled and did what we wanted in our short stay. If you have loads of money you can go on lots of excursions away from the strip, or see many more shows in the evenings if you have the time!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to the adult pool”
Reviews.Author: zuluOklahoma
Reviews.Content: Don't let your wife or girlfriend sunbath topless at the adult pool. Several perverts were taking photos. When my wife complained nothing was none. They said they had to catch them with a camera. Cameras were everywhere. Nothing said or addressed. So we made the hike to the Wynn pool and it was no better. We will not stay there again. Ceasars has the best adult pools.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: skintbint
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our first visit to Vegas for three nights in Aug in a tower suite, wow what a room it was so luxurious we did'nt want to leave it. The swimming pools were great, we found the "european pool" on the second day, which was child free and had a party atmosphere which we preferred. We don't want to stay anywhere else next time we go back !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel very clean, hip new place...”
Reviews.Author: Jayro304
Reviews.Content: Great hotel very clean, hip new place, feels tropical in a way. My only problem is they are too big for their own good, meaning you are just a number to them, once they get you in they got you. We had 4 rooms for 2 nights on labor day weekend, and in one of the rooms the shower had clumps of girls hair plastered on the shower door, pretty nasty. We called down and they came to clean it right away but when we asked what they could do for us as in compensation, the offered 20 bucks!!! Lol super insulting. Just spend 3400 on rooms and they offer 20 off! They just don't care.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: lindanaples1
Reviews.Content: Steve Wynn is a master at hotel design and management. We spent 4 nights in a vista view room on the 55th floor, and couldn't have been more pleased. The room was beautiful, with every amenity we expect in a luxury hotel. The casino is small in comparison to many others, and has a much more high end feel than others that we visited. We ended up spending most of our time at the Encore, as we felt we had taken a step down at every other hotel we visited--Bellagio, Caesar's, Venetian. We were also very pleased that the casino did not have a smokey atmosphere even though I know there were smokers present. It is THE place to stay if you desire quality and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves being a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: luv2goLa
Reviews.Content: This is such a beautiful and comfortable hotel. We arrived on a Friday at noon and after waiting about 15 mins we checked in and room was ready. The king suites are so updated and modern. Beds/pillows/comforters were so comfortable. Living room had walled mirrors with excellent view. We were on the 50th floor, and heard no music from any of the clubs. As you lay in bed you press a button to open shades/drapes, turn off/on various lights, and a button for privacy/or room service...no longer any signs to hang on door. Flat screen tv swiveled around from bedroom to living room. Found hotel very convenient, and no long distances from room to casino. Pools, clubs, restaurants (pricey), are probably the best on the strip. Ate at Buffet in Wynn and food was very good...yummy desserts! We enjoyed the casino in both Encore and Wynn, and found we enjoyed playing there than any other casino we visited. Don't need to bring soap, shampoo, etc since bathroom is stocked well. Lots of room in bathroom, and it has double vanity sinks, large tub, large separate shower, and separate toilet area, and also a tv. Blow dryer works good. Resort fee is now mandatory $20, and use of the gym or internet within room, and free long distance phone calls. The Encore or Wynn has done it right!

Reviews.Title: “High End Classy Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mari1130
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at Encore, and the hotel is absolutely gorgeous. Very classy and elegant. The rooms were spacious, and so were the bathrooms. I love that it is a double sink with a separate shower and tub. The bed was comfortable as well. My only complaint would be that I wish there was a separate TV for the bedroom part and the living room part. Aside from that, it was gorgeous. Also, club entry was a little bit easier being a guest. Also, great pools!

Reviews.Title: “top class”
Reviews.Author: nanny839
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days at the encore. Had requested smoking room, none available when we checked in. Was told one would be available in 1 hour and they would telephone us. Exactly 1 hour later, got the call. Check in was very efficient. Room was fabulous. Casino was bright and airy. Pool area excellent. Buffet breakfast was best we have ever had. Would definately recomment this hotel. No complaints whatsoever. Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Ambience”
Reviews.Author: emet1
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to Vegas staying at this location. Everything, as always, was well kept and clean. I am a person who will NOT stay in anything less than extremely clean and for 2 years in a row Encore at Wynn has not disappointed me. We used our 'free' nights this year and except for the Red Card points that the lady checking us in said would cover our meals, etc and it didn't everything about the hotel was great as always! Just be sure if you get free Red Card points to check in with the Red card table in the gambling area for redemption - don't take the word of the person checking you in at the front desk and end up having to pay for the meals, etc yourself at check out and still have all these points (cash value) to gamble with and not know it until you're on your way to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Bling las vegas style, great rooms, fantastic clubbing”
Reviews.Author: Chets_9
Reviews.Content: the encore las vegas is truly a great vegas experience. the rooms were very stylish, spacious had everything you could ask for. the only downside (whcih is in all vegas hotels) no tea coffe maker in the rooms. the hotel hasa great poolside , beautiful spa area. we had a good meal at the chinese restaurant on the casino level. the clubs, tryst and x's are unbelievable. the music, crowd ambience are truly unmatched. the casino floor is good but i prefer the casino area of the venetian or bellagio. on the whole a great option in vegas, try and get a higher floor cause on the weekends you can hear the music from the clubs in your room

Reviews.Title: “A great last three nights”
Reviews.Author: Swifty777
Reviews.Content: We ended our holiday here, the room was lovely, very clean and plush, such a shame the vegas culture doesn't allow for tea making facilities tho! The staff were very friendly and helpful, food and drink are a licence to print money but we just ate out instead. There is a place called stripbar across the road on the corner, beer is very reasonable and they have a great happy hour, it's nothing to do with stripping either! You won't be disappointed staying here, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad!”
Reviews.Author: PinkPanter1
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas so I wasnt really sure what to expect on the standard of the hotels. Encore is a 5* and certainly is that. It is beautifully decorated to the highest standard and the rooms very specious and plush. We were on the 7th floor on the north side of the hotel so there was no noise from the beach club. I think the water in the room priced at $8 for a bottle of water though is taking the micky! The only problem we really had with the room was the strong smell of cooking that came in through the ventilation system most evenings. Casino in the Encore is not very big and most of our gambling was done at other hotels as we always seemed to more lucky. The pools are definatly not big enough for the amount of people staying in the hotel and the sun beds are crammed in on top of each other so difficult to relax. There are a choice of restuarants however no cheap option. I wouldnt recommend Stratta in Wynn as the only time we went in here they served me raw chicken. I did get an apology and they didnt charge for my meal however that was the least i would expect having thrown the whole meal up. Another complaint I have is the fact that our flight home was not until 9pm, so we asked the hotel if we could keep our hotel room for longer. This was not possible so we kindly asked if there was somewhere to have a shower. There reply was we could use the spa for $40 each and they had showers in there. We did not want to spend the day in the spa and therefore not prepared to pay $40 just for a shower. Overall our holiday in Vegas was a memorable one however i am not sure we would return to the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “The only choice in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MAbendhoff
Reviews.Content: We met friends in Vegas on Sept 26 - Oct 1 and stayed at Encore. We go to Vegas 2 - 3 times a year and finally decided to spend a few more $$$ and try Encore (129/night for a Tower Suite King with a full strip view on 56th floor). It was worth every cent and I wish I would have stayed there years ago. Simply put - both Wynn and Encore know service. We are not high rollers, but they made us feel like ones. Every request was fulfilled promptly, spa services were some of the best ever and the food at their restaurants (Sinatra and Stratta) was outstanding. We have stayed at Mirage, Venetian and Treasure Island in the past and none compare to Encore. We generally played the $1 slots and bar service was consistent and regular. The gaming area was a bit smaller in Encore and seemed a little more subdued.......both casinos do an excellent job at keeping the smoke out.......hard to tell there is smoking at all. The room was outstanding - full glass windows staring south down Las Vegas Blvd.....the bed was as comfortable as home and the bathroom was huge and well appointed. Only recommendation to the hotel was adding free wifi - but my aircard worked just fine. Tower Suites are the way to go......they have a separate entrance that avoids the main check in desk. Valet parking is complimentary and they had the car there waiting before we had time to get down the elevator. Received comp tickets to Le Reve......excellent show, but not sure I would pay over $100 to see it......I think O and Blue Man Group are better shows for less money. Finally, headed to the trendy nightclub - Blush in the Wynn on a Wednesday......a bit slow but still a lot of fun. Mixed crowd of twentysomethings to fortysomethings......no cover charges on that specific evening, but generally men pay to get in, while the ladies are free. Dancing and overall activity seemed to pick up after midnight.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate On The Vegas Strip!”
Reviews.Author: SILVATON
