Reviews.Content: I just can't say enough about this place! After staying at the best hotels in vegas for years, after the Wynn and the Encore opened I never go anywhere else! Everything about this place is perfection! I actually get to take some money home more often that not, and with their off season special of just $99.00 a night for their luxury suites it's just incredible! Planning on staying this christmas with family!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic hotel, best in vegas”
Reviews.Author: bskIrl
Reviews.Content: booked thro expedia, got flights and king suite for 4 nites for 300 euro. hotel is awesome. great resturants, great pool, fantastic rooms. great staff, would stay here everytime in vegas. only negative is 20 dollars a day resort fee. but its so good you get over that. casinos in encore & wynn are excellent. cant wait for next trip

Reviews.Title: “Greats rooms/hotel ok service"”
Reviews.Author: shanercas
Reviews.Content: Everything was great at the Encore except if you are planning on using your cell phone be prepared to not have service. We had T-Mobile and Version and non had service throughout our stay within gues quarters. When I called down to the front they said that it is the cell phone providers problem and not theirs. I also talked to a supervisor who also said the same thing. They offered to downgrade levels but nothing else. I understand that there are places that don't provide service but for someone who need to use their phone for business, this was a huge inconvience and nothing was offered for the inconvience. However other than the cell phone issue the entire experience was very pleasing and I would travel again if I could have access to use my personal cell phone. Note Joyce at the front desk was extremely nice and personable and I was very pleased with the serivece provided by her.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic at Encore at Wynn Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Aloha123456789
Reviews.Content: First time at Encore. Would definitely stay again. The resort suites were beautiful, the casino was small and relatively quiet but that’s OK. You can always walk over to the Wynn if you want bigger with more vibe. The XS nightclub is awesome, if you buy your cover through the concierge you can by-pass the line up which is absolutely insane. When checking in, ask if you can stay above the 29th floor because you can apparently hear the nightclub which goes until 4AM. Or get a room that faces north (towards the Stratosphere), not a strip view but nice and quiet. All in all, very happy with the Encore. Looking forward to going back. Maybe I’ll try and get a tower suite if I can find a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Decadence and Luxury 24/7”
Reviews.Author: GSDiva
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas many time but the experience at Encore was the best. For us, every time in Vegas is something different. Encore was decadence and luxury 24/7. We were originally booked at Wynn but had to rebook, and both hotels were sold out for the dates we wanted. However, they were ultimately able to rebook us at Encore so they get props for cusotmer service. We got a beautiful suite on a high floor with a full view of the strip and at my request, Neiman Marcus. The windows go floor to ceiling and it was the best view of the strip I have had. Plus, the blinds are automatic and totally block out the sun. Nice big TV although we did not really watch much. For my husband's B.Day they brought us a big plate of chocolate. Nice touch, great snack. Speaking of snacks, the minibar had the best. The casino was not crowded either. My favorite part of Encore was the spa. So Zen. The walkway is adorned with illuminated Buddhas. I am bummed I could not take a picture. The good luck ritual treatment is a must. That spa is a great place to spend the day sipping decaf tea. We enjoyed the pool of course, not crowded or noisy. The shopping is exceptional, we had to buy a new suitcase with all the treasures. You can have a shopping adventure without leaving Wynn/Encore. They are exceptionally helpful at Rock & Republic, same day alterations. Dining is another topic, I could write about that all day. Exceptional Sushi at Wazuzu, and they do take out so you can bring it to the pool! We had an exceptional meal at Switch too. The location of Encore is fine even though it is far down the strip. We were able to walk to Venetian for dinner pretty quickly, it is easy to walk inside most of the time. It is right across the street from the Fashion Show Mall too. We truly felt there was not much reason to leave Encore. Overall, it was more low key than Venetian and had a European feel to it. We were able to relax a lot this time, not so much nightlife. Vegas for us is something different every time, and this time I felt like we were in a European resort. I totally see why it won the traveler's choice for romance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: lbmastiff
Reviews.Content: Besides the obvious beauty of this opulent hotel, the staff was extemely friendly and helpful. We recieved quick answers for every question we had, and felt like the amenities where so plentiful that we never had to leave the hotel grounds.

Reviews.Title: “I cant say enough good things about Encore at Wynn!!! WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: SoutherncaliTrojan
Reviews.Content: What a Luxurious Hotel, It was an awesome stay and now that I have been here it's going to be really difficult to go back to Las Vegas and stay at any other Hotel, because the Encore at Wynn spoiled me so much! First of all I got a great offer through the Mail that I couldn't pass up. It was basically half price for 3 nights with a free show, and a free $100 credit for slot machine play. If you get this special offer don't think it's a scam like I did at first, sometimes offers that sound too good to be true are actually real!! Don't pass the offer up if you get it. They charged a $20 resort fee each night, but they did provide free wi-fi in the rooms, free local and long distance calling, as well as free valet service, and free gym access. Having said that now that I have been to the Encore I would probably pay more to stay here again because of the treatment and high quality facilities they offer. Through my deal we got upgraded to a suite instead of just the standard room. We had an amazing view of the strip, and the suite was so awesome and luxurious. It was very clean and spotless, had a 42 inch plasma tv, huge bathroom with a jacuzzi like bath tub and a huge shower, and a King size bed. Although we didn't spend too much time in the room, why would you spend time in your hotel room in vegas right??, it was still really nice to crash there and hang out with our friends to throw back some cocktails before hitting the clubs... Once you are at the Encore at Wynn you honestly don't need to leave the hotel to visit any other places in Vegas, they have everything you need right here. They have 4 of the best nightclubs: Tryst, XS, Surrender, and Blush, which supposedly are 4 of the best in Las Vegas. The pools are awesome also, we didn't go to the Encore Beach Club party on sunday it was kind of a slow week in vegas, but we had just as much fun at the European bathing pool. Just a heads up for everyone the European Bathing pool is clothing optional, meaning a lot of women lie out topless, so it's enjoyable for the guys if your lady lets you go near that pool haha :P and enjoyable for the ladies if your into that kind of thing :D Also they have a huge mall area with a ton of shops. Kind of higher end stores, but still fun shopping for your lady friend. Now onto the important stuff. THE BUFFET!! It was awesome. It was a little pricey to be honest, but I didn't go to Las Vegas to save money seriously. The Dinner buffet was great, good prime rib and anything else you could ever imagine, Sushi, Pasta, Pizza, Crepes, Cocktail Shrimp, King Crab, unlimited Champagne etc etc etc. The Brunch Buffet on Sunday was my favorite and once again they had everything, from baby back ribs to prime rib to french toast and pancakes. It was delicious. 5 Stars all the way across the board, I want to go back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “great but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: lulubelle0
Reviews.Content: We were so exciting to be spending a weekend at the Encore. Unfortunately right a check in we felt disappointed. The front desk staff were not very friendly or helpful. We had booked two adjoining rooms and were told that due to our late check in, we could not be accommodated. The next day is was a bit of a hassle to finally get moved into 2 adjoining rooms and we had to carry our own luggage down 2 floors. Not what I would of expected from this hotel. Aside from the front desk staff, all other staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautiful, as is the pool area. We went to XS nightclub and had a fabulous time. The casino floor staff could not of been more friendly and welcoming, however be warned that we found it to be very smoky. The buffet restaurant is very average, so I wouldn’t recommend it. Try the other restaurants for breakfast, much better. Overall, we did however have a great time and we’d probably stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Graham1981
Reviews.Content: We are fairly well travelled and have enjoyed some nice places in our time, but this place beats them all hands down! From the moment we checked in (with no wait at all) we were blown away by the quality and beauty of this hotel. Stunning throughout, especially the pools and restaurants. I had taken my partner to Las vegas planning to propose, and was looking for a perfect experience... it exceeded all my hopes. The hotel and staff were so impressive that I decided to upgrade our room to see how 'the other half' live! Nick, one of the casino hosts, upon hearing my plans, put in a word at the tower suites, and we were able to upgrade to a tower suite for a very modest fee. Utterly superb room, on the 59th floor with strip view! On the first night the host left a bottle of champagne, chocolate strawberries, and a congratulations card in the room for us- to the delight of my fiance. In a town of such scale and excess, it's these little things that set the Encore apart from all the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great view from Tower suites - 57th floor”
Reviews.Author: Sergio092
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice and chic hotel. Just one thing I would say is that they charge you for everything extra, which make you feel less exclusive. I would prefer to pay my room a little bit more but have access to all the pools and night clubs. We had a tower suite on 57th floor....view to South strip was great!!! The room is also really nice (although there is no jacuzzi).

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVE The Encore!”
Reviews.Author: hbear85
Reviews.Content: My sister & I decided to do a little getaway for her birthday. It was my 9th trip to Vegas and first time staying at the Encore. We absolutley loved it. I almost always stay at The Signature at the MGM Grand. While I love the Siggy as we have nicknamed it, the Encore was a nice change. The hotel is just so beautiful. I loved the decor, the colors, the butterflies on everything. We stayed in a basic room with a king bed. I am a member of the Wynn's Players Club so I get offers through the mail. We booked with a stay 1 night get the 2nd one free type promo. The rate was excellent, 129.00 for one night and the other free. The pool was great. Drinks at the pool are not cheap! 17.00 for a margarita. BYOB in plastic cups to the pool :) I like that there are 2 pools, one for families and people looking for a quiet time, and then a over 21 pool for those looking for something a bit more exciting. My favorite thing about this hotel was the room. It was huge, first of all. The foyer and closet and giant bathroom were all great. The king bed was one of the comfiest beds I have ever slept in. The sitting area was nice because the tv swivels around to face either the sitting room or the bedroom. The automatic light dimmers and switches beside the bed are heaven. Waking up after being out a little too late the night before & being able to close your blind without moving from your bed, wonderful! We weren't too happy with the first room we got, there wasn't much of a view. The moved us promptly and gave us a $50 in house credit that we used to have a bottle of champagne before dinner one night. I think the Encore suites all kinds of people. If you are looking for a luxury hotel in a great location on the Vegas strip... this is your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “$13.99 per day for wifi!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: helenob81
Reviews.Content: The Encore was our first stop on our honeymoon. I cannot fault the staff, very helpful. The room was lovely size but our view was not of the strip. There was no fuss about us on our honeymoon so decided to let it be known again and we got a bowl of chocolate dipped strawberries, i expected more but at least it was something. We had meal in the bolero (think thats the name), where we got suckered into the chef tasting menu, I would not recommended and the air conditioning must have been on overdrive cause it was freezing. I did ask them to do something about the coldness and i got offered a shawl!!!! For the price we payed for the meal, they should have stuck an open fire or stove in front of me. We did not enjoy it but there are different restaurant. The biggest issue I have is that in this fantastic big hotel that is not afraid to charge for everything and anything, I had to pay $13.99 PER DAY for wifi. I was disgusted at this as every other hotel we stayed on honeymoon offered wifi as complimentary to the room. the day that we decided to spend at the pool (which very clean and really enjoyed the atmosphere) after paying for wifi for the day to my disgust I then figured out that i could accuse it from the pool area!!!! really was not impressed with having to pay for wifi

Reviews.Title: “Everything that counts - and more!”
Reviews.Author: bodenton
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a couple of different hotels in Vegas - The Encore has definitely spoilt us for anything else! We stayed for a Thursday/Friday night and loved it. We paid a $25 supplement to get a room on the 56th floor with the most incredible view of the strip and surrounding area. The room was beautiful and extremely well thought out. Spotlessly clean and with all the little luxuries and touches that you would expect - and more - ipod docking station next to the bed, business desk with fax/printer, controls panel on bedside cabinet for drapes, lights etc. Wonderful Staff are extremely courteous and helpful and check-in/out was a breeze. Only negative - the general pool area gets a bit crowded with the loungers very close together, but the weather was lovely and the drinks were cold! we'll be back. Oh - and the evening buffet - the best we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay. Hotel is...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. Hotel is beautiful and service was always good. Only negative was younger crowd staying and coming for entertainment at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's chic and comfortable but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: TheScarlett
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews we opted for the Encore at Wynn as our hotel for our very first trip to Las Vegas. I was slightly disappointed with this venue so I suppose that I was expecting more. This hotel has an understated elegance - modern and yet sumptuous - in the lobby featuring a red butterfly decor. They could have used more help at the check-in during peak hours but once we were actually helped the process went quite smoothly. I also found that the concierge desk was not always manned - more on that later. We had opted for two 'Panoramic King' suites and found that we really didn't have a view of the Strip - we could see some of the old hotels (Circus Circus and Riviera) but none of the newer sights. The rooms were a lovely size and quite comfortable for our needs. We loved being able to open and close the curtains or turn off the lights with a touch of a button by the bed. And it was fun to have a flat-screen TV in the bathroom. My only real other complaint about the room (aside from the view) would be that I just don't care for beige towels - I prefer white at home and when traveling. My main complaint was how much trouble we had printing our boarding passes for our return trip. You see we like to print them 24 hours prior to the flight and so we got up at 6 AM to go to the business center - which wasn't open. We were told that we could use the concierge but there was no one manning that desk. The front desk tried to help us but they couldn't find our reservations with the confirmation number. We were told we might have better luck at the Wynn's business center and after curling around the property we finally found that their business center wasn't open either. When we finally were able to get into the Encore's business center (after 8 AM) we were able to finally print our passes but by that time I had lost 2 hours of much-needed sleep. The shopping is wonderful and I guess if you are a Garth Brooks fan you would be thrilled at his proximity as his show is in the hotel. Is this a nice place? Absolutely! Is it perfect? No.

Reviews.Title: “Continue to be Amazed...”
Reviews.Author: travelfans29
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect, from check in to check out I could not have asked for a better place to stay. We got our room at $119/night during the week and paid an extra $20 to upgrade to a panoramic view of the mountains. We checked into a stunning 700sqft hotel room equipped with every amenity we could hope for. The pool at Encore was stunning as well. My complaint about the pool was the Encore Beach. They wanted to charge us $40 for entry fee as hotel guests, then pay an additional $100 for chairs/cabana. I heard it was a club scene in there complete with girls wearing bikinis and stiletto heels....however, you could find this at the regular pool as well. There are two pools - one European (topless) and one family style pool - both play loud club music depending on the crowd, so it isn't too relaxing, but a fun place to hang out. I ventured to the workout room and spa and both continued to amaze me. I literally woke up everyday to something new and exciting. The building of the spa was supposedly $200 million dollars and not a detail was missed. It is pricey, but well worth it if you want to unwind. So, I must conclude with my overall impression: continue to be amazed. It is a great getaway for couples and my favorite part was the fact that all of the gambling machines were on low volume - so you didn't hear that loud "ching ching ching" all the time while walking through.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Disappointed with the Encore”
Reviews.Author: LandJ1017
Reviews.Content: We went to the Encore to celebrate my brother's birthday. We are long time customers at the Mirage. We decided to stay at the Encore as a treat for a special birthday. From the time we arrived, we knew we made a mistake. We waited on line to check in for almost an hour -- and there were only 5 people ahead of us! Once we made it to check in, the clerk offered us a room on a high floor with panoramic views for $20 per night. There were 6 of us, with 3 rooms and we all decided to live a little and go for it. We were staying for 4 nights. As this part of the Wynn is all suites with floor to ceiling windows on one side, we assumed we would have a corner room with views all around. Shame on us for assuming. This "panoramic view," which is defined as a view in all directions, was the normal view one way. And we weren't even facing the strip. We were facing a half built hotel that lost their funding, the roof of the parking lot and the Riviera hotel. OK if you look straight out in the distance you saw the mountains. All three rooms in our party were given the same view. I went down to the front desk and told the manager how disappointed we were and how we felt we were suckered into paying for these rooms. I asked for a refund. He said there was nothing he could do other than move our rooms. He said they couldn't refund our money because they could easily sell those rooms. The hotel was not very crowded and we only saw one other person on our floor the whole time we were there. Also, our room was dusty as if no one had stayed in it or cleaned it in a long time. Why wouldn't they have given us strip views if they were available anyway? The manager was not very pleasant or helpful. We did not change rooms as some folks had already begun unpacking. We decided to make the best of it and go to the casino. The casino was empty and had a weird vibe. We decided to go to one of the bars and have a drink. At every other hotel, you get free drinks as long as you are gambling in the video poker machines at the bar. Well, not at the Encore! Another negative. The pool is right off the lobby check-in area and very small. Never went there. We spent all of our time at the Wynn gambling. Much more crowded, much better vibe. Positives: The hotel itself (Wynn/Encore) was very clean as were the rest rooms. The Wynn pool was beautiful and we rented a cabana. Awesome experience. The Wynn buffet was great for breakfast. Great variety/great value. Society Cafe in the Encore was really good. On the expensive side, but good quality food and service - lunch and dinner. My advice: Stay at the Mirage. They upgrade you for free and treat returning customers well. The pool is very nice. They have great restaurants. And you drink for free at the bars! Will definately not return to the Encore!

Reviews.Title: “A big WOW”
Reviews.Author: 9jafunseekers
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with 2 teenage boys and an 8 year old. My 8 year old's description was 'fantabulos' to date his favourite hotel was Le Touessrok in Mauritus and the hotels in Dubai But the Encore was very nice. I have been to a lot of hotels all over the world,this ranks as one of the best in terms of service ,decor,amenities. The decor though not my style was a jumble of eclectic grandiose style. The opulence has only been overtaken by the hotels in Dubai and the UAE . I paid under 150Usd per suite so opted for 2 with interconnecting doors rather than a 2 bed room suite. The concierge service was superb( European standard) quick and Efficent. The restaurants were fine- the only disappointment was the service at the Italian restaurant. The rooms were clean and regularly cleaned-the staff were helpful and pleasant The gym was a fanatics dream. Wonderful experience -location did not matter......wait ,location to where? Encore was perfect. I will return ,this time with my girlfriends ,ready to do the grownup version of Vegas Only downside is the lack of free Internet service(also very European!) but as I had prior knowledge ,we came without the laptops.

Reviews.Title: “Steve Wynn is a genius”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: You got to give it Steve Wynn. As a Hotelier, he sure knows how to do it right. He knows what people want even as the styles and needs and his target markets change. We have been to Vegas more times than we can count and have stayed at pretty much all the upper end places on the strip. (See my years of reviews). We've watched Wynn re-invent Vegas as we have stayed at all his hotels when they were new: Mirage, Treasure Island, etc. but the Bellagio has always been our favorite and we always wind up back there. Wynn/Encore is a beautiful resort that has an attention to detail and is impeccably maintained. Even if there are style options that are not our preference, the entire property is managed with elegance and class. Flowers and polished marble abound. Staff is professional and attentive. We stayed on a promotion that upgraded us to a Encore suite and included tickets to La Reve. If we return, I think it would be to stay at the Wynn instead. The Encore seemed to have a younger crowd (20-30's), smaller casino, less interesting restaurant options and a less interesting pool for our taste. The hotels are connected and easily accessible but we found ourselves walking to the Wynn more often than not. Our suite was immaculate and nicely appointed. The bed and linens were extremely comfortable. I slept better than I had in quite awhile. Every detail was elegant. No nightly turn-down service was disappointing. We requested a south facing strip view and unfortunately, could hear the pounding of the nightclub 37 floors below but that apparently did not affect our sleep. Other than that, no noise could be heard from ohter rooms...not even doors slamming from the hallway which is so often the case. The pools at Encore were a bit nutty, especially on the weekend but you could tell people were enjoying themselves. Music was too loud to concentrate on reading a book and shade was hard to come by. The "European" pool gets a lot of the club scene activity on the weekend. We chose to spend most of the time at the Wynn pool which had more nooks and crannies for not feeling part of the mob scene. There was a European pool there too but we did not hang out there. Food options at both property pools could use to be expanded. Staff was friendly and helpful and made sure the decks were neat and in order. Gaming tables near the bars is a nice and fun touch. Our favorite restaurants were at other properties which were easier to access from the Wynn as opposed to the Encore. La Reve was fun for free but not as outstanding as some of the other Cirque shows in town. That's the result of being wowed so many times that we've become jaded. Taxi's were easy to get from the Encore (which can be an issue with some of the larger properties). All in all, a beautiful property and we will definitely return to at least one of the Wynn properties again.

Reviews.Title: “by far the nicest hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Shmees
Reviews.Content: PROS: Hotel: I walked into every single hotel on the strip, and this one is by far the nicest. However, it is at the very end, so it’s a $15 cab ride to the other end of the strip, or a long and hot walk to get to the other hotels. Regarding the other posts, yes I did see security bags posted near the guest elevators and I did see them search bags once, but at all other times you could have brought in food or drinks from elsewhere. Self-parking was no problem. Helpful security and staff, both indoors and out. Room: Large and very new and nice. We were on the 17th floor facing the strip and overlooking the pools, but there was no noise. Nice view of part of strip, and nice sunsets over the mountains. We got a really good deal on Priceline - booked before they started charging resort fees. CONS: Hotel: At check-in there were lines but not too bad, with ladies offering bottles of water while we waited. It did get annoying having to walk through the same long corridor all the time to get anywhere. Pool area looked crowded. Business centre isn’t open yet, you have to use the one in the Wynn. Prices are outrageous on all food inside the hotel. Room: Very insistent housekeeping, rattling the door even when it said “private” (do not disturb).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Jalenkos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore from Friday, August 26 to Thursday, September 2nd and had a great time. Check-in It is quite busy if you go there at 3pm, but if you don't want to wait in line leave your bags with the bellman and go for a walk around the resort/strip. We checked in at about 5pm and there was no line. Renee was pleasant and offered us an upgraded room for an extra $20 a night. Would say it was worth it just because we would otherwise have been on the 9th floor compared to the 55th. She also sent up some nice chocolates since we mentioned we were on the 2nd part of our honeymoon (first part was Jamaica). The Room Very spacious and nice amenities. The bed is very comfortable and the blinds shut out all light completely which is just what we needed after being up pretty late a few nights! Beautiful view of the strip from our room, was quite nice at night with all the lights! Elevators were very quick, never waited more than a few seconds for one. The Spa Do yourself a favour and if you are in Vegas go to the spa here! It is an excellent way to relax! I went twice, once the 2nd day and once on the last day. Was a great start to the trip to have a massage, ease away the tension from flying and sitting around in airports! Also, the spa area is one of the best on the strip, with a sauna, wet sauna, hot tubs, cool plunge, cold plunge, heated stone lounge chairs, deluge shower, programmable shower with lights, music and several showerheads!). Was nice to use this on our last day as we had to check-out by noon but could go back to the spa until closing at 8pm so was able to refresh and relax before our trip home. That would be worth the money all by itself if you don't want to go for a massage (I think a day pass for the spa is about $25 or $30, but free with any treatment) Casino It was nice (despite the fact that I lost at most things I played). Not smokey like many of the older casinos. The drink service was excellent and very prompt! A fair bit of choice or table games and slots at various minimums. My only complaint is having to go to Wynn to bet on sports. They do have a 'Sports Book' kiosk at the Red Card desk but it was often closed so I would have to walk to Wynn. I will say too related to Pai Gow Poker that the dealers and pit bosses need a bit more training with respect to the 'House Way' to play the hands. Also with respect to their rules around banking. Had to go to 2 different supervisors to get the right answer. Mind you they did apologize for not doing it right in the first place but they just seemed a little unprofessional and flabbergasted that I would ask such questions and say that they were wrong when they gave me their first answer. The Restaurants We ate at several of the restaurants that were on the Wynn/Encore property while we were there: Society Cafe Nice laid back cafe style restaurant! They had a prix fix menu which was quite reasonable ($39 for appetizer, main and dessert). The food was good, but the jidoori chicken I found a little salty. Botero Food was excellent, as was the service. A little pricey, but comparable to most of the high end steakhouses on the strip. My only complaint here was related to the dress code. I don't have a problem with it (needing pants for men, no sandals, and a shirt with a collar). They went out of their way to tell us about the dress code over the phone when we made reservations but then when we got there most of the tables around us didn't follow the dress code at all. The table next to us had 4 men wearing shorts, flip flops and t-shirts. If you don't want to enforce your dress code then don't have one and especially don't preach how necessary it is when making reservations! Don't deminish yourselves by doing so! This just put a bit of a sour note on the evening. Switch My favourite restaurant at Encore! Again the prices are on the higher side but comparable to other steakhouses on the strip. We actually ended up sharing a Cesar salad, steak and sides so it wasn't as bad and they were happy to do so! There was plenty of food doing so this way (as we find American portions of everything far too large for us). The walls and ceilings of this restaurant change every 30 minutes or so. It was quite fun to watch and see how the decor changed! The food here was excelllent! One of the best Cesar salads I have ever eaten! The steak and the side dishes were excellent as well! Wish we had room for the desserts but again with the size of the portions even split between two people we couldn't finish it all! Buffet at Wynn There is lots to choose from here. We only ate here since we were given some vouchers. The food here was ok, not excellent. Seems they focus more on diversity and quantity than ensuring each of the dishes up there were quality. we just found that a lot of the dishes looked good but just lacked flavour or were way to salty. That said, they did have crab legs and prime rib up there. (I'm not a seafood eater but there were plenty of people with plates loaded high with the crab legs). The Prime rib was quite good though. Zoozoocrackers Deli We had lunch here on our last day. Lunch for two people was $48 so I would say it was a little pricey for 2 sandwiches 2 sides and a lemonade. We were sitting next to Mr. Wynn though so that was interesting to say the least. The Shows We didn't see the La Reve or Garth Brooks show, we opted instead for Beatles Love at Mirage. Do yourself a favour and if you enjoy their music in the slightest, go and see this show! It is absolutely amazing! I'm not a huge fan of the Beatles (enjoy many of their hits though!) or Cirque du Soleil, but this was excellent. Just watch out for deals on tickets as they are otherwise quite expensive. We got ours for 40% off through a promotion at Mirage, people beside us paid $150 while we paid $80 each mind you. The Pool The pool was very nice, not hard to find a chair at all. Nice that they have a poolside casino as well in case you want to try your luck while lounging by the pool! They have a family pool and a European (topless) pool. No doubt the European pool was where the party was during the early afternoons on the weekend. However both pools were very tame during the week. We could see the new Encore Beachclub from our room. Very busy place on the weekend, especially Sunday. Apparently $40 to get in and with that you don't get a loungechair. If you want one of those you have a minimum spend during the day of $1,000. Cabana's there look cool, but with a minimum spend of $15,000 they were far out of our price range! The Clubs Were not big on going to clubs (loud music, $20 drinks and annoying douchebags aren't really our thing). We walked by XS on the weekend and the line was about 500 metres long. Very busy. Sounded like the wait was hours to get in. Guess that is the place to be on the weekend though. Not quite as long of a line for Surrender, but still prohibitively long for my likings. Overall for the price we paid for the hotel ($99 per night) this hotel is an excellent deal! I only wish hotels that I have spent twice as much on closer to home had the same amenities as the Encore! There were plenty of things that I would say cost a lot of money there, but they are all optional. Just like any hotel or visit to Vegas you have control over how much you spend. There are plenty of cheaper hotels, retaurants and forms of entertainment within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Dukes24-7
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel at The Encore, new hotel so all room in top spec. Our suite was of a decent size, with separate living area, and nice big bathroom. Very Clean and luxurious, Great view of Vegas.. Pool area ok, however more caters to older people as no decent music and quite posh, some of the restaurants you had to wear collar and jacket, and you didn't feel right walking through casino in shorts without being stared at, stay at The Palms better for age group 20-35, great pool parties and more of a party place, however take nothing away from the Encore, great relaxing romantic hotel, take the mrs :-)

Reviews.Title: “An honest review”
Reviews.Author: userManchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore for 7 nights from 25 August 2010. We were quite worried after reading some negative reviews on here, and werent sure what to expect. Overall the hotel is stunning, very impressive! We visited all the other hotels on the strip and ours was by far the most upscale! The rooms were very neat and tidy, and we were on the 18th floor overlooking the pool. (i wont lie on a weekend when we got back to our rooms at 12.30am the music from the nightclubs was booming (it was like there was a disco in the next room!) but it didnt bother us as we were so exhausted we were asleep within seconds of our heads touching the amazing pillows (the beds are so comfy!) The pool area was fabulous, although the pool attendants are very strict (no cameras allowed in the european pool which is fair enough) and if your away from your sun lounger for more than 10-15 mins they will take your towels away! We ate in SW restaurant in the Wynn and were very impressed! lovely meal! we had a bit of an incident where we were queuing to collect tickets for Le Reve the show that we were going to see that evening. I left my camera on the desk as we walked away, realised 30 seconds later that i had left it, went back and it had gone! the lady said try lost and found and see if anyones handed it in. was so upset as it had all our holiday pictures on, wasnt bothered about the camera itself just the pictures. To cut a long story short we had to get the hotel manager involved as security werent doing anything. He was fantastic and really helpful, and checked the CCTV which showed that the people in the queue behind us had taken the camera for themselves! shame as most people we came across in Las vegas were so friendly and lovely. so it was unfortunate that we got the thiefs behind us! Just to say the Le Reve showing was AMAZING - we treated ourselves to the VIP seats and it was well worth it. amazing show! We didnt go to the Encore Beach Club as we found the prices were far too expensive ($50 to get in, £150 if you wanted a chair to sit on, if you wanted a sun lounger you would be toured around the 'real estate' to see what was available and prices $200 plus!) so we thought we would give it a miss! Another thing to watch out for... if you get room service and pay the very high prices always get a receipt if you pay cash! On the first night we ordered a breakfast on room service at 3am as we were jet lagged, and the lady that brought us the food was so friendly and lovely, we paid cash and didnt get a receipt (53 dollars for a sausage sandwich and a fried breakfast!!) when we checked our room bill it said we hadnt paid for the room service! we spoke to a manager who said it was down that we hadnt paid for it (we had paid cash!) so we had to fill out a form which stated that we had a descrepancy with our bill and it was sorted. however the day before we were due to leave it appeared again on the our room bill so we had to speak to a manager again and have it taken off! You will find everything in the hotel is very expensive, but you cant moan because its the best hotel there and you get what you pay for! The location of the hotel is not the best, we had to get taxi's to get into the middle of the strip, as after the first couple of days of walking down there our feet were hurting quite a lot! I know some people had said about a $20 per day service charge but we didnt receive this. All in all we loved the hotel and would defintely return, hopefully without so much bad luck next time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Sounds..... Bad Noise !”
Reviews.Author: edinpaul
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 day stay at the Encore. For a five star resort hotel we waited an unreasonable time to check-in and the line-up system was a bit disorganised. We were allocated a 37th floor room overlooking the pool areas and the Wynn hotel. The rooms are huge with a separate living area and a beautiful bathroom with a TV. After a long flight from the UK we had an early night only to be woken around midnight by a thumping dull beat. Beware if you have a room overlooking the pool area these form one of four clubs in the resort that are open at the weekend until 4.00am and the bass from the clubs just seem to bounce off the buildings. Next day we requested a move and were allocated a room on the 59th floor but this wasn't much better. If you are a light sleeper ask for a room on the other side of the hotel. As an absolute positive however the hotel and complex is beautiful and staff were most courteous and helpful. If you go to the the European pool at the weekend there is a DJ playing a mix of house,garage and R&B to a twenty plus crowd. Music is great and there's a real party vibe however if this isn't your scene the pool area at the Encore is fantastic and a lot quieter. All in this is one of the best hotels on the strip and would definitely consider staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Indulgent... Oppulent and different class!!”
Reviews.Author: Bully45
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy a hotel that's uber cool with stylish decor, then this is definitely the place to be... we enjoyed 5 fabulous nights in a Panoramic suite overlooking the Wynn and the Strip from the 61st floor - Vegas doesnt get much better than this! Lots of comments seem to focus on the cost aspect and whilst it is not cheap any traveller who appreciates attention to detail, good surroundings and choice of qulaity places to eat and drink will happily pay the price for something a bit special and both the Encore and Wynn deliver on that front. The SW steakhouse is right up there with any of the best restaurants in town - check out the peach martinis they are awesome and deliver a kick! The other negative comments that seem to fire people up is the issue of seating around the pool - lets put a myth to bed, you dont have to pay for the pool beds and apart from those that are labelled up as reserved for cabannas (nice but ridiculously pricey), its a first come, first served basis ....good to see the hotel enforce a clearly stated policy that prevents inconsiderate people popping towels on a bed early in the morning and disappearing all day. On the topic of the pool, be under no illusion it is a tad on the poncey side, take all of the preening aside of the "beautiful people" (Paris Hilton/Ronaldo wannabees) sit back and laugh at how self absorbed and amusing it all is. Although many comments have noted the loation as a down side, we didn't find this to be the case. Anywhere you want to go on the strip is a walk, bus or cab ride. It is very handily located right across from the Fashion Show Mall, which caters to the normal pocket. Having stayed at the Belagio two years ago, we found the Encore to be lighter, brighter and more oppulent with bigger up to date rooms. The trendy chill out music piped throughout the hotel and pool areas, creates a casual laid back vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jin8282
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at Encore with my wife and little son. Check-in took a little longer than expected due to lines in front of us. However, the receptionist's well trained customer service made us feel great after we talked to her. We were assigned to a resort king suite room with panoramic view of the strip. My wife and son were extremely excited when we entered into the room. The big screen TV was swiveling so that we could watch TV from both bed and the family room. We had good time at the pool. Unfortunately, it closes after 8:00 PM. There are some pools that children cannot enter. To my regret, I didn't have time to check out what's going on at the adult only pools. The Le Reve show was fascinating. I highly recommend this show. Upon check out, I was surprised to see the mini-bar charges because I did not consume anything. I told the clerk that the charges were not ours, then she removed those items from the bill immediately Later I found out that there are sensors under the mini-bar items that send signals to the billing computer when an item is removed. Perhaps my wife or son might have touched some items that the computer mistakenly assumed that we used them. So, if you are not going to buy it, don't even touch the mini-bar items. Overall, it was a pricey vacation at Encore, but we had the greatest vacation ever at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lil_star04
Reviews.Content: This hotel is massive! Had to wait a while to check in due to queues but it didn't matter as I was in awe of the place! Managed to get an upgrade by asking nicely without the $20 trick to a smoking optional room on the 69th floor. The smell in the room however, was overpowering and almost unbearable! So I made a quick call to the front desk and they sent someone up to refresh the room and said I could switch rooms the next day. Moving rooms was quick and painless. I also signed up to the red card and they gave me free $10 slot play on my birthday! All in all a great trip, although I did find it was a little far (Walking) to the centre of the strip

Reviews.Title: “Classy upscale, The Rolls Royce of hotels”
Reviews.Author: kingo904
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and modern. The beds feel like what I imagine the clouds in heaven feel like...lol. Bathrooms are huge with an lcd t.v. If you are looking to stay like a vegas baller stay here. Hotel is a lil far off the strip but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value”
Reviews.Author: SactoScuba
Reviews.Content: First the good. The rooms are lovely and well appointed. I had hoped but there is no water or morning coffee included. Lovely glass shower, OK tub but no bath salts or bubbles, dual vanity, small tv, separate room for the toilet. Comfortable bed, large tv screen, no internet included. Actually now they had added a $25 day resort fee - bummer. All goods and services on the property are 25-75% above average vegas upscale hotel rates! If you plan to stay here bring a wad of cash because your going to need it. Breakfast for two $75. Lunch about the same. Dinner $125 to $200+. Coffee $4. Poolside Mojoito $14. Domestic beer $7. Etc.... Also the pool totally sucks! Well it looks great on the website photo but thats about it. The hotel tries to "sell" all the furniture seating in the pool including chairs and lily pads. On top of that, they also "sell" all the lounge chairs in the first and sometimes second row. If you dont want to pay for a seat - either be there by 8 am or forget it. And you'll be in the back anyways. It really sucked. And on Monday - even though they hadn't sold any of the chairs or lily pads - they still wouldn't give them up to guests and if you sit there - they will come and kick you off. Wow - way to make your guests feel like second class citizens! One day, a group of us went down there around 10:30 and could only find 2 chairs available in one area, and 2 chairs in another area. We put our stuff down on both and walked around looking for more. One of the pool girls Natasha - took our stuff off and gave it to another guest. We immediately saw it and called her on it. She said she would find us another spot. After 10 minutes of no luck we demanded to speak with the pool manager. She gets some guy who argues with us that we must have left our stuff there for 30 minutes therefore, the pool monitors have the right to move our stuff and give our chairs to someone else. #1 we hadn't left the spot unattended 30 minutes. But we had to basically prove ourselves - thanks to nearby guest 'witnesses' for him to back off and admit they were wrong. Then it took them another 20 minutes to bring out a few chairs as our consulation. Wow knock yourselves out jerk wads. Often the servers, bartenders, and pool staff had attitudes and poor service. The best service we had was the front desk staff. Encore get a big FAT zero for this stay and me and my 20 friends will go elsewhere on our annual Vegas pilgramage! P.S. The "fine" Italian restaurant Bartolotta scored a big ZERO too - see my review under that restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent, excellent!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shell710
Reviews.Content: This hotel is GORGEOUS!!!! Also not as big as the Wynn...it's a little smaller, easier to find things and people if you get separated...haha. The staff is so great, the pools are beautiful...Encore Beach Club is amazing!!! The rooms are very comfortable and the restaurants are fabulous! I've stayed in many hotels in Vegas and this is by far my favorite!!! Love this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “steve wynn knows what he's doing”
Reviews.Author: kookygal
Reviews.Content: my husband and i took a belated co-birthday weekend. we were offered a deal through wynn/encore we couldn't pass up. $133 a night for a suite. done. this hotel is true vegas class. the decor of the suite was sleek and the bed was perfection. the shades were automatic so you could open and close from the bed. bathroom was roomy with double sinks and nice soaking tub. comfy sitty area and huge floor to ceiling windows to enjoy the view. there is lots of self parking with only a short walk into the casino. just a couple of things you should know. although we didnt have to pay the resort fee because we booked way in advance. you should know there is a $20 a night resort fee which includes wifi, the fitness room and long distnace calling. you will hear the noise from the clubs if you have a south strip view unless you stay on floors 61-63. we were lucky enough to stay on 61 andit was silent over a very busy weekend. also, the casino and the esplinade are dripping with drunken club kids on the weekend. really cheapens the place in my opinion. kinda felt like plams or hard rock. one last thing. the towels in the room literally felt like sandpaper. we asked for a whole bunch more thinking we maybe got a bad batch but every towl was rough. all in all, the encore was wonderful and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: WilmslowGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a dreadful experience at this hotel and would not recommend it to anyone. Other reviewers have listed the faults in detail so I won't repeat them, but I wholly endorse all the criticism of the diabolical customer service and the extortionate fees for services that are normally included in the price of a decent hotel. We switched to the Signature at MGM Grand and it was a hundred times better.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel, average value for money, ok location...”
Reviews.Author: Iain73
Reviews.Content: Firstly I have to say The Encore is a very nice hotel indeed. The rooms are classy and the casino is striking, probably one of my favorite casinos now. The whole place has a luxurious feel to it. I found most staff to be friendly and helpful throughout my stay. There is a 'but' though; and that is you can get better value in Vegas (and I have, just check my other reviews). The 'resort suites' are big rooms but they are not suites. They are large double rooms with a partition, albeit very classy (and expensive) ones. If you stay at The Encore you get the choice of the pools there or at The Wynn, both are nice pools and it was great to have the choice. The location isn't ideal being towards the north end of the main action. It's good if you want to spend time at The Sahara, Stratosphere, Treasure Island and Wynn, but it's a fair walk to center strip. Yes, I know if you don't like walking you're in trouble in Vegas but the location really isn't the best. Having said that we took taxis most of the time anyway. I guess it depends what you're after. I did enjoy my holiday at Encore and I would recommend it if you can get a good deal but trust me there is better value to be had out there. Botero is great for steaks (on the walk through to Wynn) not cheap but well worth splashing out for. Iain, London

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: RMGillM
Reviews.Content: Arrived here as the first stop on our honeymoon. The place is immaculate. Check in was quick and easy, and the room was fabulous. We were on the 61st floor, with a stunning view of the strip. We went for the cheapest room they had to offer, which was about $170 per night, and worth every penny. The room was really low key, nothing opulent, but very classy indeed. 40" TV, nice long couch and desk, with a very well stocked mini bar (expensive).The bathroom was huge and immaculately clean. The casino is by some way the classiest I saw in Vegas, but you don't need to gamble to enjoy this hotel. I would heartily recommend it to anyone. Do the buffet in the adjoining Wynn for breakfast, lunch or dinner- it's a short walk through the hotel and for the price it is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “The service is rude and mangement does not care.”
Reviews.Author: MElle45
Reviews.Content: If you are a business woman or man, well-traveled and have client service standards or any standards of being respected at all, do not go to Encore or the Wynn hotels. These are not the place for you. My husband and I, business owners and professional were asked to give up our table in front of the piano at Encore lounge for four 20 somethings that looked like Brittany Spears little sister and “gang” (not her just looked like her, you get the point). My husband and I were shocked that the hostess had the nerve to ask us and be so rude to us. We are twice hers and the coveters of our table age. The other four tops in the lounge were not good enough for the four young 20 s/gs. So ask us to move for them, I still cannot believe it. Another clincher...we reported it to management and they could care less. I even spoke to the top management (a woman) and she had n/g to say. It is obviously their training from the top down that puts that kind of rudeness into their hotel and makes it acceptable. Imagine Elaine and Steve Wynn being asked to give up their table to four any one of any age, doubt that lounge would be in business after that. Their double standards on how they should be treated and how their hotel treats other business men/women (anyone for that matter) are enough for me to never return to any of their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Brillaint Suites and Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous20107
Reviews.Content: Although this is probably one of the more pricier hotels - its more than worth it. This was our first time in Las Vegas and after a weeklong roadtrip we decided to treat ourselves and book in here rather than going for the many cheaper options that could be found in other strip hotels. We were in a king suite and boy did it deliver, the suite itself was very big and was very clean. The king bed was very comfortable and there was a large telly which could be turned to service the bedroom or sitting room area which was a nice touch. Floor to ceiling windows ensuring we have nice views onto the strip (towards circus circus and stratosphere only - think premiums would need to be paid to view the other side of the strip). The bedroom area had a control panel which could be used to turn on all the lights and close the drapes/sheers electronically etc. The bathroom could have been a hotel room in itself it was very big with seperate shower and bath unit, there was also a tv in the bathroom as well. Overall great hotel with a huge amount of amenities - make sure to try the lunch/dinner buffet although pricier than most of the strip its more than worth the extra money for the quality of food available. Only main downside is that it is towards the end of the strip so we found we were doing a lot of walking to see the sights on the strip which was not ideal in c110degrees heat but its location means it is quiet and less hectic.

Reviews.Title: “Wow very nice first class hotel/resort”
Reviews.Author: Killinski
Reviews.Content: Great big room. Very quiet. The Encore is everything they say it is. 5 stars!! Watch out for the mini bar. No in room safe, but that was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: funsunandsand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore because we had gotten tickets for a show there and were offered a discount on the rooms. The room we had was amazing with a great view of the strip. Loved the gorgeous bathroom with a huge shower and tub. The food was really good and the shows were fun. We got to enjoy the pool too. We did the members only one and appreciated how quiet and relaxing it was.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: PDXcrew
Reviews.Content: The Encore is easily the premier place to stay and play in Vegas. It's pure luxury from top to bottom. The pool is great, the casino is stellar (and not smoky at all) and the rooms are pure decadence. I've stayed at several places in Vegas and the Encore is second to none in bringing together class, style and hipness.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo! Encore! Encore!”
Reviews.Author: HiMaintain
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day trip to Las Vegas staying at the Encore and am still cheering and wanting more. I read reviews for months on this hotel and was a little worried I might have issues with check in/out (NOPE), noise level in rooms from night clubs (NOPE, NONE), snooty staff (NOPE) and excessive charges (YES). We arrived at noon on a very busy Saturday figuring our room would not be ready until 3pm and we could just store our luggage and hang at the pool until my spa treatment. Our very nice and cordial front desk clerk, Jill found a room that was immediately available and on a high floor facing the strip away from any noise. We headed up to our room about 15 minutes so did our bags. The room, AMAZING and we just booked the regular Resort King through Expedia mind you, not directly with Encore. Large spacious luxurious bathroom as well as sleeping and living area. Beautiful view on the corner overlooking the pool and the strip. The corner allowed us to look at both the mountains with airplanes taking off and landing and also the strip. Went on to the European pool mid afternoon. Lots of people but was able to grab 2 lounge chairs close to the pool. Only a few (2-3) ladies partaking in the european bathing so I decided to go for it. No gawkers, no comments just relaxation. Met some really great people who were about our age (late 30's early 40's). Music is pumping and loud, which may bother some, but not us. Drinks at the bar will run you about $14 without tip. Only had snacks once, hubby had italian sub ($15) which was really good, friends next to us order $10 guac and chips, a little disappointed with the very small container of guac that comes with lots of chips so I would say no to that. I then headed on to the salon for a hair and make up appointment. I took a quick shower at the spa, which is gorgeous by the way, wish I had a massage. Afterwards onto the salon where Ray styled my hair and did a great job. I did have to ask him to flat iron my hair which he was not going to do but then did with no problem. Then on to Jessica who did my airbrush make up. She was fantastic. I felt like a movie star. I also had a chipped nail that was quickly repaired at no charge. I left the salon right on time with no waiting or delays at all. when I returned to my room I was met with a delicious tray of gourmet chocolates sent up for my birthday by the front desk which I nibbled on for the next 3 days. Later that night when we left for a concert I will say that the hotel was PACKED, due to the nightclubs that are there. We had a limo pick us up at 12:15 am and he could not get into the hotel because of the back up onto the street. The hotel check in attendants were regulating traffic in and out and that did take about 15-20 mins worth of waiting. The taxi line looked like it was about 30 minutes even with taxis available. Anyway, its a Saturday night in Vegas. We made it back to our room about 3am and there was no noise coming from the clubs (still going) or any rowdy behavior we witnessed. The bed and linens are amazing. I don't know if I have ever experienced such a good night's rest before. The remote by the bed is a nice touch, just press all and all the lights go out. The room darkening shades made me think it was still nighttime at 10am. Needless to say, Mr. Wynn put a great amount of thought into ensuring his guests sleeping comfort. Sunday we had the buffet which was outstanding, every type of food you can imagine is prepared for you and is very good. Its a little pricier on Sunday but well worth it if you can put away a lot of food. We spent our afternoons at the European pool which was more livelier on Saturday than Sunday or Monday,but still a good fun crowd. By 4pm everyone is usually more relaxed and ladies are throwing caution and their tops to the wind. Not baudy, just fun. We toured both the Wynn and the Encore on Monday and came to the agreement that no stone was left unturned to making this resort a complete oasis. There are beautiful lavish live blooming plants everywhere as well as mosaic tiled and marble floors and exquisite chandeliers and ornate ceilings. The casinos were bustiling and not overly smoky. The Wynn casino is much larger and a bit more lively. I befriended a craps table dealer who took time to explain to me the ins and outs of the game and insisted I order a free cocktail while I observed even if I wasn't gambling. I never encountered one employee during my stay who wasn't polite, helpful and friendly. Check out was a breeze. Was waiting in line at check out and whenever a check in staff member was available they would assist the person checking out to reduce wait time. We stored our bags at the bell stand while we had lunch after which the bellman quickly brought out our luggage and had a cab for us to take us to the airport. All with a smile and sense of thoughtfulness. I hated to leave. The downside, the food and sundries are pricey. We had breakfast in the Society Cafe which was very good, but pricey ($60), we also had lunch in the deli at the Wynn which was also very pricey ($58 for 2 sandwiches and 2 cokes). Two bottles of suntan lotion set us back $56, yes $56 dollars for sunscreen level 6 and 15. A pack of cigarettes will cost you $11. Do yourself a favor buy items such as these at the Walgreens located at the Palazzo next door or buy extra at home before you leave. The resort fee is a little ridiculous, $20 plus tax each day, for what I really do not know. Their night club XS is just that EXCESSIVE prices. $30 cover for men $20 cover for ladies and you MUST have table/bottleservice in order to sit down. Drinks average $14-$16 and by the time midnight rolls around the bar is about 15 people deep. Wish we could have gone to Blush but it was closed. A little disappointed that the nightclubs are only open certain nights and that was not well defined on the website. Overall, we had a phenominal time and would highly recommend to friends and plan to return. Maybe next time to the Wynn just to compare. Both hotels are amazing. We visited the M Resort, Venetian, Palazzo and Paris and they were no comparison to the Wynn/Encore. I stayed at the Venetian 10 years ago and was disappointed to see that it appears to be running down. There is a huge mall inside with typical "mall rats" running around and even a food court. Not upscale at all. The bottomline about the Encore/Wynn is this, yes, its expensive, but it is truly a 5 star resort. Expect to pay more, but for that price you do get luxurious surroundings and accomodations, peace and serenity, amazing customer service and extreme attention to detail at the finest resort Las Vegas has to offer. If that is what you are looking for and you want to spend the money, then you have found your place.

Reviews.Title: “Steve Wynn is truly "the master of the house".....”
Reviews.Author: suckr
Reviews.Content: ...as in thenardier from les miserables....i can just picture the wynn buisness meetings mantra: dont think of it as a "guest room , think of it as a small revenue generating engine: 1) since when have you been in a motel room where condoms were for sale? (ok they called it an intimacy kit) is this a truckstop? i could go on and on...500 dollars for shade at the pool...40 dollars for beef and broccoli(oh but it was the BEST beef and broccoli according to the suckerrs on here)200 dollars if you check out 1 minute past checkout....(what do the fishes and their fishwives say about this? "oh but its the best late checkout....) keep saying the words " 5 star resort" over and over and soon it will magically come true...whoever rated this place 5 stars was definitely either paid generously or drugged....yes the common areas are decorated nicely if garishly...yes its las vegas.. stop complaining...get in line...hand over your money.....make sure you smile at the robotic, unsmiling, inhospitable staff otherwise they might just charge you for frowning.....oh and if THEY make a mistake and charge something to your room "mistakenly" ( i think a trial balloon to see if you are paying attention), even if its for 5.95, you must sign a 2 page affidavit, swearing to the fact that you didnt charge it..when asked for a copy of what i signed ( mainly for further entertainment) i was told they do not give out copies of internal documents. But repeat the mantra: 5 star hotel over and over....who was it that said " the bigger the lie , the more people will believe it"? I think he works at the front desk...........

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at a Great Hotel - The Encore”
Reviews.Author: DrSteveLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Returned today from a 3 night stay at the Encore. I was apprehensive with reading a couple not so favorable reviews prior to our stay. I was happy to prove the bad reviews wrong with a wonderful experience on all levels at the Encore. We drove in to town and got to the hotel around 12:30 in the afternoon. We parked in the self park and were at the front desk with in a few minutes walk. When we walked by the pool, we wanted in as soon as possible. The front desk had us checked in and up to our room in no time. An early check in was no problem (the room was available). We were down at the beautiful pool having a couple of drinks in no time and well on our way to a great stay. The pools and service at them were top notch. There is always someone cleaning off lounge chairs as guests were leaving, so if you got there during a busy time, all you had to do was be patient and you would have yourself a spot. There were all types of fun guests at the pool if you wanted to socialize or you could hang out by yourselves. The room was awesome! Clean, spacious and very comfortable. The best I have stayed in Vegas, and perhaps ever. Service was Top Notch as well. From the front desk to the cleaning crew, we were always given a smile and a willingness to go the extra mile if it could be done. We went to a several restaurants on the Wynn Property - each one fantastic with regards to design, food quality, and service. You could complain that each one was on the more expensive side, but not so much so, and you always get what you pay for. We have been off property for meals before and there are no cheap quality meals in Vegas. Stay on site and enjoy what they have to offer. We loved the Asian/Chinese for dinner, breakfast outside overlooking the pool at the Wynn Hotel Pool, and the burgers for lunch at Botero. The gym is fantastic - there could be no possible complaints. By far the best hotel gym I have been to. You can't complain about a resort fee when you get this gym, the pool and all the other features on the property. We enjoyed Le Reve as well. All in all, we will definitely be back. You are getting what you pay for, all you need to bring is a desire to enjoy yourselves. Next time we are bring friends with us.

Reviews.Title: “Visually stunning hotel but it helps if you're young and beautiful too”
Reviews.Author: DawnOrmerod
Reviews.Content: Great if your 20-30 years iold. A really fantasic looking hotel with great rooms. We stayed in a Tower Suite which was lovely but had a bit of a rubbish view...a load of car parks.. Circus Circus..probably the ugliest cheapest hotel on the strip and half view of the golf course. If you like loud HIP HOP around the pools and live DJ's at weekends then this is the hotel for you but not for us. Apart from the very expensive SPA cheapest treatment is 165 dollars there is nowhere to really relax except your room. The weeknds are manic with bigs lines waiting to get into the nightclubs like XS BLUSH and Surrender. Plenty of fine dining restaurants but a bit pricey with meal for 2 including bottle of wine is nothing short of 300 dollars. We ate at the Country Club, Botera and Society cafe with the cafe great food at half the price of the others but not exclusive as the others. A round of golf is 300 dollars with a riders fee of 50 dollars if you want someone to go around with plus a caddy is compulsory agin this additional cost as have to tip them too. All in all wouldn't stay there again as have satyed a Mandalay Bay and that suited us better.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit, dont think I will make it a third due to the ever growing nightclubs”
Reviews.Author: monacobar
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Encore. We loved this hotel 12 months prior that we couldnt wait to come back. In Encore had changed so much in the 12 months since our last stay. Still great rooms, resturants and pool area but they resort looked like it was now catering to young nighclubers. We stayed in the tower suites, which our room was extact to that from our previous stay in the panoramic view room but with separate check in area, lifts and concerige, and we had free WiFi which was good. Great view from room on the 60th floor. The difference this time is that the new Beachclub and Surrender nightclubs have opened and for the four nights of our stay we were able to sleep due to the extremely loud noise from these clubs, I can only imagine what it was like on the lower floors. So make sure you ask for the rooms that dont face the strip. Which is a shame because these are the best view rooms. We also noticed at night the resort was filled with young nightclubers coming and going. Dont get me wrong, it is Vegas and we like to enjoy ourselves but we found the Encore to be a bit over the top and the pool on the weekend was extremely busy. Saying this the restuarants are great and the spa is amazing. Best spa I have ever been to. The buffet at the Encore was nice for the price and the conceirge in the tower suites was very helpful. Our next stay at Vegas will be at the Wynn or we will try somewhere else away from the pretenious nightclubers that seem to be overtaking the Encore and the lack of sleep, which is a shame because it is definately the nicest resort on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury meets sexy!”
Reviews.Author: Xiooooo
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went to Encore after staying at Planet Hollywood, and it is a completely different world. We met up with a group of friends who were supposed to having a wedding (but it got called off). Encore takes that loud party vibe out and replaces it with over the top luxury and everything is done with a sexy romantic twist, from colour schemes to decor.Encore would be perfect for couples and couple groups. I would not reccomend Encore for a younger, wild crowd (low 20's); i would say it caters to a mature crowd who still knows how to have a good time. The shopping is uber high end, ferrari, rolex, etc....we didn't buy anything but it was fun to window shop. The food is unbelievable, we tried almost all the restaurants, some were pricey but well worth it and some were very reasonable and still very good quality. The rooms are large, very spacious, the washrooms are stunning, from the tub to the vanities, really classy and impressive. the power window shades combined with the "too-comfy" beds will have you sleeping in until 4pm daily. The window shades are the best i've ever seen, with them down you would never know there was a sun outside. All the rooms have good soundproofing, we had a stereo going and you couldn't even hear it outside or next door. The pools (2, one euro) and the Beach pool (like a club) are big and eye catching. They are very well laid out and don't get too crowded. The Beach club does get crowded usually has a long line up just to get in, well worth it in my opinion. There are 2 night clubs in Encore; Amazing! Both, have amazing decor, and have that over-the-top vegas style to it. A must! The lobby and concierge staff are very helpful and patient, You really felt special as a guest, some even made the effort to remember my habits, and it really made a difference. GREAT STAFF! Overall, Encore is breathtaking, from its design and decor to its dining and staff. NO complaints at all, however the location is a good way up north on the strip, which does make for a long walk if you are planning to walk the down the strip. Well done Mr. Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic end to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: luce21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore after 10 days travelling through California at the end of our honeymoon and the hotel did not disappoint. We got a deal on this hotel through our travle agent and got 3 nights for the price of 4. Firstly the customer service was great, everyone we came across was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were fantastic, we had a room with a panoramic view, which was very good and very spacious. The casino was very good, after going in all the other hotels we always came back to the Encore Casino mainly due to the benefits we got from the red card scheme they operate. We were given 4 complimentary buffets whilst we were there from the points we earnt. The buffet restaurnat was fantastic, i never seen such a choice of food! It is a bit of a walk to the other end of the strip, however there is bus service to use. We would strongly recommend the helicopter ride over the grand canyon, its the best way to see it. We would definetely return to the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: amybabe1
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd Hotel on our Jour arond California and Nevada. It was without a doubt the best hotel on the strip having visited all of the hotels on our 3 day stay. The room was goreous and floor to ceiling windows were fab! But what a shame that our request of a strip view wasnt accomadated( I would ring the hotel directly a couple of days before if you want this) Bathroom was one of the biggest I have seen. Everything oozed quality! Although the dress code can be very casual in Vegas - at the Encore I felt out of place just wearing shorts and t-shirt so rooted out my best outfits for day and night! The only thing I would change or like to see in the hotel is free hot drink making facilities in the rooms and make sure you sign up for one of there red cards in the casino because it is free and you can get $10 each gambiling credit and if you tell them it is a special occassion you can get more!! Which is always good. The only time we drank at the hotel was when we used our free gambiling credits as the waitresses bring you free drinks as they were VERY expensive! Free parking at the hotel and in Vegas! We did extensive research on hotels in Vegas and it really paid off. Stay here and you will feel like a queen!!! The best on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay”
Reviews.Author: PProduction
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore invited by an invitation as a 1st time guest. If not for the promotion that offered discounted room rates, a complimentary tickets to see their water production, LeReve and so a little free gambling we would not have chosen to stay on there at all. Rated a a 5 star property we know there would be 5 star prices. Beautiful hotel lobby, great guest relations from the staff.... the pool, since it's summer I supposed seemed crowded but they allow guests to mosey over to their sister property/Wynn, where there are more pools and space. Satisfying. Yes, you do pay for most everything else and the rates are higher with a resort fee ($20 per day) of some extras that some may not use; fitness spa, internet and unlimited long distance phone calls but THEY'RE A 5 STAR HIGHLY RATED RESORT! I'm sure the marketing goes out to average to middle class for the higher class group doesn't care if they get a discount. They can afford it! Being on vacation we alotted for "vacation" expenditures and there were no hidden costs that were sprung on us. We noticed a much younger crowd over the weekend and assume that because they have that new Beach niteclub by the pool and XS which we passed miles long along the hall so the thumping of the music wasn't liked but was accepted. We'll just ask for the quiter side of the property or maybe staying on the Wynn. Loved the suites there... unique w/ a wall dividing the areas with a modern TV mounted in it and very luxurious. Very clean and comfortable. We felt like 5 star accomodation guests. Highly recommended and looking forward to coming again before the end of the year. Lot's of family there but plan on stayng at their resorts instead of w/ family.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Great Service”
Reviews.Author: oakforest2
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Encore for a business trip (convention). I stayed at the Wynn last year, and was lucky to get a great rate for the Encore this year. These 2 hotels are amazing! What I love about them, is that unlike traditional casinos, you don't feel like you are in a cave. The rooms are so spacious, and have a separate living room (Encore). Bathrooms are all marble with separate tub/shower and a TV. Check in/out was easy, and the SPA was incredible. I encourage you to try it. As soon as you exit the elevator on the spa/pool level, you start to relax. i ordered room service one night, and they gave me the ETA (which was accurate) and my food was brought up in a food warmer. Where you notice the difference is in the details of everything they do. They aren't in your face, but when you need something, anyone will help. The ONLY feedback I would give is that the Taxi line needs some improvements. We had to wait both mornings for 15 minutes, and the taxi line is not shaded - so you are sweating by the time you get in a cab. The cab driver we had, told us that by FAR the Encore and Wynn get the best feedback according to his customers, and I would agree. I didn't gamble while I was there, but heard great things about the XS nightclub. I would definitely recommend and hope to stay there again in February. Plan a romantic weekend there - you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Sumptious!”
Reviews.Author: chocolateloverLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a truly sumptious hotel. We had a room on the 62nd floor which was huge with a fantastic view over the whole of Las Vegas. We upgraded to this room on arrival for a total of $75 for a 3 night stay, so it's definitely worth asking. The hotel is linked to the Wynn hotel and both hotels are so huge it's easy to get lost. There are loads of restaurants to choose from - different prices so there should be something to suit most budgets. We had a particularly good chinese meal near the casino area in the Encore. The hotel is situated at the end of the strip so in August it can be hot work walking anywhere outside, and walking through hotels along the strip is not always so straightforward as they can be a bit maze-like. A piece of advice - don't pre book theatre tickets - you can buy them greatly reduced at Tix4Tonight shops - the closest of which is opposite the hotel on the ground level of the Fashion Show Mall. You do then have to go to the venue to collect your tickets (the earlier you do this the better) but the saving makes it worthwhile. The premium outlet stores complex, about 10 minutes by car, is well worth visiting!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back....”
Reviews.Author: TripGeezer
Reviews.Content: Sadly, I cannot recommend the Encore. It's advertised as a 5-star hotel but mostly it's the prices that are 5-star. Be aware that the whole purpose of the hotel is to separate you from your money. And mind you, that's before any gambling. The room was spacious and clean, I'll give it that.
