However, it was also very sterile. For what you get the rooms are way overpriced. You get a place to sleep, everything else is extra. Make sure you know about the $20/day/room resort fee which "entitles" you to wi-fi access, use of gym, and a few other useless things I don't remember. You expected a coffee-maker or a free movie channel like what you got at your last Super-8 stay? You're in the wrong place. A small coffee down in the bar will set you back $6. That's probably the cheapest item by far you'll find in any of their bars/restaurants. If that's the definition nowadays of "high-end" hotel I must be hopelessly out of touch. Their web site is actually a good representation of what to expect. A lot of fluff but no substance. The pool looks nice on the pictures, doesn't it? Well, it's quite small. Shady spots are hard to find, you'll be baking in the LV heat. When the temperatures finally drop and the pool area is in the shade they close it down. No use of the pool after 7pm. You're supposed to be in the casino or one of their restaurants. The strategy of the newer hotels/casinos to make it hard finding an exit was elevated to an art form at the Encore. It'll loop you around so even when you do find an exit you're facing the Encore or Wynn again. Shows are ridiculously expensive. We went to see Le Reve. Luckily we were invited so I shouldn't complain about a gift horse. However, at a face value of $113 or so the tickets make Disneyland (which is already horrendously overpriced) look like a bargain. I will admit though that the show itself was nicely done. Good acrobatic and artistic entertainment. Would be willing to spend $40-50 for it. Try the half-price counter near the MGM if you want to go. The machines at the Encore/Wynn casino also seemed to be very tight. We saw our gambling allowance dwindle quite fast so we went next door to the Pallazzo where we were able to nurse it much longer. By extension my impressions of the Encore apply to Las Vegas as a whole. Granted, the city always existed to relieve you of your money but by and large that was limited to gambling. I came to LV a number of times in the 80s and 90s but hadn't been back for 15 years. The hotels wanted to get you into their casinos and made most everything else a relative bargain. That's no longer the case. For instance, food used to be inexpensive. Alas, no more. A buffet (with huge waiting lines) will set you back $20-25 typically. The LV police has also gotten into the game of fleecing the tourists. Whenever we drove down the strip or to the east of it it we saw an unfortunate motorists pulled over at almost every other corner. Never noticed a NV license plate, mostly CA. So, watch out when you're driving! Las Vegas was never a place for families and things haven't changed. I head read reports that they offer more for kids now but I can't corroborate those claims. Your best bet might be the center at Circus Circus. Some casinos have little corny shows later in the day in front of their buildings (Bellagio, Treasure island, etc.) but nothing to keep the little ones entertained really. In conclusion, I wouldn't go back to the Encore. Get as much information as you can about any hotel you have in mind before you go to LV. Save your money for gambling - which is why you're going, right? Are there any other reasons to go to Vegas? None that I can think of (unless you're into gaudy displays of neon lights for which LV still doesn't have any competition). Even for the purpose of gambling I don't have to drive that far anymore. Here in CA the next casino is never more than 2 hours away. I can certainly wait another 15 years before I visit Vegas again - if indeed ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShellyBNyc
Reviews.Content: Amazing service: everyone from cleaning staff, to the dealers, to the waiters were exceptionally friendly and professional. Great room. Great food. The spa is now one of my favorites in the world. Try the cinnamon buns at cafe society!

Reviews.Title: “Most tastefully decorated and cleanest hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: loriv247
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay at the Encore. We traveled with our 3 kids aged 16 mos - 11 years. While this hotel is not really meant for children, we decided to take them anyway. We were nervous that the hotel would force us into two rooms, but that never happened. We were treated very kindly and politely all throughout our stay. Part in parcel to the fact that our kids are very well behaved. The room was absolutely fabulous. It was probably the highest quality room we've ever stayed in. The furnishings were all well constructed and all the doors very heavy duty (if it needs 4 hinges, then you know its solid). The room had the modern touches (automated curtains and lighting, dual vanities, Flat screen TV's in bathroom and bedroom). The TV rotates around to the living area so you can watch TV there if you prefer. Despite what others have said, we did not hear any nightclub noise, but that was probably because we requested a room on a high floor on the opposite side of the club. Would definitely recommend and we will return. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - everytning is extra!”
Reviews.Author: festivas
Reviews.Content: hotel is very clean and comfortable - however - I expected at least a coffee maker in the room - not!!! Everything is extra - don't even think about opening the snack bar or alcohol bar for over 60 secs or you wil be charged.... there is also a $20 charege daily for internet etc...to be honest - you are better off at Bally's or Flamingo - save some money and be closer to the middle of the strip - to get to the casino in Encore from the street as a visitor - you have to walk a 1/2 mile - yes a 1/2 mile - my pedometor stated this - I will not go back to this hotel - better rates elsewhere when you are really not in the room that much...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by Encore”
Reviews.Author: aqp
Reviews.Content: I had really been looking forward to staying here. I'm a Vegas regular (6-9 visits per year), had previously stayed at the Wynn, and wanted to check out Encore. Check in took a reasonable length of time, but I was given a room that, when I got to the door, I found maintenance working on the bathtub, and he did not know when he would be finished. I was assigned another room, but the keys did not work. After waiting 20 minutes for keys, the bellman arrived with my luggage and let me in the room. The bellman was very gracious and really made an effort to make things right. I called the front desk regarding the waste of an hour of my time, and got a minimal apology. When I asked, I was given a food credit to make up for the lost time. There is a resort fee of $22/night (ugh!) which gives you wifi and health club access. It is not included in your estimated total for check-out. Rooms are spacious and well appointed. Nice big bathroom with separate shower, tub and w.c. Towels and linens are very nice, and they give you a spa bathrobe. Bed was comfortable and there was a seating area with a sectional couch in the room. A bit over-engineered with the light and drape controls. If your room is in the E Tower and an even number, be warned - the noise coming from nightclub Surrender was loud enough to be a problem on the 28th floor. The Euro pool was great - good DJ, nice layout, no kids allowed. Cabana guys were very friendly - helped me find an open chair and set me up with towels. Pool had enough people for a fun time without being a human koi pond. Poolside food service wasn't great - we usually had to go to the bar for drinks since our server didn't come by very often. The biggest complaint I have with Encore is although you are paying one of the highest room rates in Vegas, there is no advantage to being a hotel guest here. Shows, nightclubs, restaurants - you are treated just like anyone who walks in off the street. At our last visit to the Wynn in 2008, we got a room upgrade to a suite, line/cover passes to Tryst, and our friends got special seats to Le Reve. At Encore, even though my friend dropped $10K plus on her wedding at the Wynn, the best they could offer her for the group to go to a club after the reception was $30/person cover for Surrender or $100/person at XS. They also charge Encore guests full cover at Encore Beach Club. I spoke with a manager who was more than willing to come down to the concierge and talk to me, but he explained that in this recession, they had to keep all their staff employed and were trying to maximize their revenue. While I appreciate his frankness, I will choose another place to stay next trip where there are advantages to being a guest of the property (and I'm sure it will be at a lower room rate!).

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Encore was poor at best, found the room I stayed in dirty and employees rude.”
Reviews.Author: rmiller44
Reviews.Content: I visited the Encore from the 8th thru the 11th of August. When I first arrived the check in area was not organized. Parties coming in after me were being waited on before me, not what I consider being customer conscientious. When I got to my room someone knocked on it probably 4 minutes after arriving, young lady asked if all was correct and I said I had just walked in but noticed there were no robes. That was not taken care of until the next day. I walked down to the bar nearest to the registration where I found the two bartenders serving Sunday night to be very unresponsive, for only having 12 people in the bar. I was greeted after a 2 minute delay with what do you want? Very impressive. I gave up and called it a night. I the middle of the night I got up for a drink of water and while walking into the bathroom I stepped on a something. So I turned on the light and sit down on the edge of the bed to see what was going on. It was a piece of glass, apparently from a previous stay? I removed the glass and while sitting there I notice that there was food particles on the floor around the bar area. Again it was not cleaned up from a prior stay. Throughout my stay I ended up stepping on another piece of glass, sit down on the coach and was greeted with bobby –pins. I just have to question how well you clean your rooms. I had trouble logging into the wireless, so I called down to the lobby. The young lady answered the phone explained what I needed to do and when I questioned why it was telling me I would be charged roughly $14, she said – no sir that is included in your room don’t worry about it there is no additional cost. That was not what I found out later when checking out! I went to the work out area where again I was told there was a $15 charge per day and decided forget it. When I checked out of Wednesday I went down to the front desk to turn in my door key. A gentleman that had no personality what-so-ever asked if I wanted to put my additional charges on my credit card. I said no sir the stay has already been pre-paid for I should not have any additional charges. He then gave me a bill for $67.20. Telling me that was the cost for the wireless and gym charges during my stay as I tried to explain to him and he said they are “RESORT FEE CHARGES”. Again, I tried to explain and he said you used the wireless you get charged for it and you used the gym, stopped, looked at his screen, and said no I guess you didn’t but you will still be charged for it. What kind of racket are you pulling off? The cost for a three night stay with tax was $502 and then you charge an additional $67 for “RESORT FEE CHARGES”. The gentleman then dropped his head would not talk to me and let me discuss my stay , nor did he ask me at any time how was my stay. Since then I have tried to call the Encore Wynn manager to discuss my stay and cannot get him to return my calls. I would have to say that from the staff I was subjected to, to the cleanliness of the room I stayed in I would have been better off staying at the Red Roof Inn and paying $39 a night. At least you are getting what you pay for. Be careful of their hidden fees. And unless you like ambiance the Encore is not worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull room!”
Reviews.Author: Belgian_traveller_8
Reviews.Content: Encore is definitely worth a stay! The room is just so beautiful and comfortable! We just stayed for one night, which was really a pity. The bathroom is very spacious and even has a small TV. in fact, the whole hotel looks very nice. We had dinner at the buffet of the Wynn which was very good price-value (we also had dinner at the Mirage the other night (which is cheaper and equally good according to me). When we checked in we were offered an upgrade for 20$ (official). however this just was a room on a higher floor (59th). But we were glad with this, because at night ,the night club was very loud and we could hardly hear it on such a high floor (luckily). negative about this hotel: - location may be bit less favourable than other hotels, depending on what you are looking for... - the night clubs. When we were there the beach club was open and it was LOUD. Glad we stayed at the other site of the hotel - when we checked in I asked whether any clubs were open. The lady at the reception didn't even know...

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Believe I Has a Relaxing Time in Vegas - Thanks Encore!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTourista
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip at the last minute when another trip fell through. I ended up in Vegas for five days with my 6 year old son. I had heard rumours that the hotel was not child friendly. I would agree that the restaurants are not child friendly however the hotel itself is. Since I was not doing any gambling or clubbing, we spent most of the time at the Encore and Wynn pools and exploring the hotel (except the Casino). It was also great because it was close to Circus Circus, the food court at the Fashion Mall and Treasure Island/Mirage attractions but sooo much more civilized. And the beds - what can I say - I slept like a baby for four nights in a row - which has never happened to me in Vegas before!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, weird staff”
Reviews.Author: hendfakhroo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore for 5 nights. We found a promotional code that allowed us to get internet, national phonecalls, and fitness club access for free. It was amazing. The rooms are beautiful and spacious. Since the Encore is relatively new, you get that "new room" feel. The casino itself is kind of dead. The restaurants are good. We ate at the chinese one, Wazuzu - excellent! There is a Denny's around the corner so we had breakfast there to save some $. Also, Fashion Walk (mall) is directly across the street. The spa is incredible, and the Salon is definitely worth a visit. The pool was mediocre. We ordered room service a couple of times, and although it took some time to get to our room, we were happy with the service and the servings. On the fourth day we decided to extend our stay by one night. Unfortunately the promotional code wasn't valid anymore, so we were charged 4 times the amount of money (the entire cost of the first 4 nights basically) just to extend. We sucked it up and paid, but when we requested a late check-out the hotel wouldn't budge. They charged us an extra $200. There was no such thing as an extra hour or two for free. The staff acted like robots and didn't talk to us in a normal fashion. I travel extensively during the year and have stayed in a lot of hotels. No hotel has ever been as rigid about check-out like the Encore. We would definitely stay there again, but would never extend.

Reviews.Title: “the problem is not the hotel, the problem is Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: ALEKLABU
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be quite good, wonderful one could say, if it wasn't for one little detail... it's in Vegas... roomssmell like cigarettes, elevators take forever to arrive, many weird looking people everywhere... I got the feeling that everywhere I went someone was trying to get money from me! But what was I expecting, it s Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “It Doesn't Get Any Better”
Reviews.Author: sh7934
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my 40th B-Day in Vegas with my wife and another couple and we couldn't have choosen a better place to stay as the Encore is absolutely opulent!!!! Check in was fast and easy and the customer service was second to none. The entire property was spotless and our room was well appointed with a very nice view of the strip. Although the dining options are a bit on the expensive side, it was well worth the cost. What else do you expect at a 5 star property. We dined at the SW Steakhouse on my birthday and it was the best meal that I have evert tasted and the service was excellent. We appreciate good customer service and everyone went above and beyond the call of duty to make our stay enjoyable. Because the Encore is attached to the Wynn, you literally do not have to leave the property because you have access to everything under one roof . However, if you want to venture out to the strip, be prepared to pay for plenty of taxis or do alot of walking because the Encore is located on the North end of the strip. However, that was not a deal breaker for us and we will absolutely be going back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Bigmoney236
Reviews.Content: Recently Returned from a three night stay at the Encore and simply had a wonderful time. I have been to Vegas on average 2 times a year for the last ten years or so and Encore was the best hotel I have stayed in. The place if fairly new which lends itself to being very clean and well kept. The air was always clean even when walking through the casino (never smelled of smoke!). Staff was courteous and helpful. I requested turn down service on our first night and it worked flawlessly throughout the entire stay. The room itself was absolutely amazing! Had floor to ceiling windows with nice view of the mountains. Bathroom was huge and very well appointed. I enjoy very much staying at both the Bellagio and The Hotel at Mandalay Bay and this one blew them both out of the water! Most beautiful hotel I have stayed in by far. Ate most of our meals here or within the Wynn (connceted via shopping esplanade). My wife and I even enjoyed the spa, spent almost an entire day there! I can't say enough good things about this hotel. From shopping, dining, gaming, and accomodations the Encore is simply on top of the Vegas food chain!

Reviews.Title: “Secluded Vegas Baby...”
Reviews.Author: 2011Bruins
Reviews.Content: From the arrival to the Encore Tower Suites drop-off, it really was a great stay. My wife was 7 months pregnant and despite some (at times) serious back pain issues, we still managed to have a great time. When checking in, we were standing beside one of the actresses from The Practice... that has to be a good thing, right? You are positioned away from lights in Vegas, so be aware of that... but we enjoyed that and looked forward to that before even arriving. This might not be a great place to stay for 1st-timers more interested in the LV sites and hoopla. Also, we stayed Sun-Wed when the clubs weren't raging... so the scene was more lax and subdued, but we prefer that anyways. The casino was pleasantly smoke-free despite smoking allowed. The only thing we wouldn't suggest is the Le Reve show... not that great in our opinion, but oh well. We loved the more-than-large-enough Tower Suite (really, really recommend the T suites) with a fantatsic bathroom, comfy bed, and great all-around space for lounging. We really enjoyed the increased feel of privacy and attention given to the Tower Suite residents... its really worth the extra expense. The Encore pools are a great place for retreating too. Listen, the place can be pricey, but its LV and you're staying at a 5-star resort, so just be prepared or deal with that. We had great meals at the on-site cafes and restaurants too. Its all there for you in minutes walking distance. The AC was excellent, the in-room breakfast was very good, and the room upkeep was fantastic. We're looking forward to going back, hopefully sooner than later. Felt like a VIP.

Reviews.Title: “good but with serious concerns”
Reviews.Author: ppts
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed by housekeeping service...1st day, room did not get cleaned until 5pm as they were short staffed (in a 5 star hotel) despite calling multiple times thru-out the day. Second day, room did not get cleaned until 3 pm, again, after repeated phone calls. We had spilled coffee on the counter table, the stain was still there after the room was "cleaned". Also, watch out for hidden charges, if you move any of the snacks on display on top of the vanity (not locked in the cabinet) for more than 60 secs, you will be charged. A pain since you can't use the vanity table. Compared to a year ago, this place has definitely gone downhill. Restaurants remain top-notch. Location is biggest plus.

Reviews.Title: “Most elegant hotel in world”
Reviews.Author: minklem
Reviews.Content: This hotel has maximum luxury in the world.the chefs in it are all very amazing. XS nightclub is the apex level when it comes to nightlife. Encore is best in vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “NO is the theme here. Started the morning with call to security.”
Reviews.Author: TOMANDJILL
Reviews.Content: I had forgotten what it feels like to be shuffled around like a cow to line after line. Everything is so impersonal. While some may like the anonymity, I prefer customer service. We arrived with no greeting. No water. In the desert. In August. We waited in a line. A line usher ushered us to the next line. Each check-in took about 15 minutes so the wait was about 25 minutes. They didn't care and made no apologizes. We were packed in with dozens of loud smokers with all the luggage. Our check-in took 15 minutes. She asked for requests and I told her we came for a quick getaway without our children and wanted a quiet room on the top floor. She issued our keys. Both of us had to give ID. I asked her if our room was on the top floor and she said no. Would have been nice for her to say something. The room was OK. Although the Encore advertizes all suites - it's not really. It's a bedroom with a sitting area that doesn't close off. So, it's not like we could have brought the kids and had any privacy or had friends in for a drink without having them in your bedroom. We tried for a nap but a raging party started next door. We hadn't unpacked to we changed rooms down the hall with little inconvenience but, again, no apologies. Afterall, the front desk said (after a long hold time) it's not their fault. Well, it kinda is if they drop the room rate so low for the summer that they are getting 4 guys per room there to party hard. Next, we realize that we had no information about our slot credit and show tickets that were part of our package. This was never brought up at check-in. I called and, yes, after a long hold time, was told how to get the $25 slot credit which was really only $15 with conditions because anybody can get $10. A bit of a scam. Then, we learned we couldn't use the gym. We went to the front desk but were ushered away by the line usherer who explained people had been waiting in line. I knew this to be true because we did too. So we waited. And waited. We had to pay a $20 per day plus tax resort fee to use the gym and could no longer use the spa (which is what I would do while my husband works out longer)(this was a new policy). Again, no apologies. Everything else was so-so. Nice gym. No in room coffee so my husband had to make the trek and wait in line every am to get a cup of coffee in a paper cup for us. The Wynn Buffet line was so long, we paid extra for a front of the line pass. As a hotel guest, you get nothing extra other than use of the pool. If you have your ID. Everything is so impersonal and regulated. There is only one way in and out of the pool area. Crowd control is the name of the game - not guest convenience. We stayed up to 2 am on our last night and dearly looked forward to sleeping in the next am. We were awakened out of a dead sleep by a screaming fight next door. It was so bad we had to call security. We called the front desk and asked for a late check-out ...OK. Not even late. I asked for an extra hour. Any guess what the answer was? I guess I need to stay at boutique hotels since I expect hospitality. There was no offer to use a hospitality suite or store our luggage since we had such a late flight. No apologies, just "corporate policy". I asked to complain to the GM by leaving a voice mail but was told "they are all in a meeting so use a comment card" - I insisted that the voice mail was viable option despite the meeting and left a message. I doubt they care. It's about the masses.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTravellots1
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Vegas a few times. I like to try a new hotel each time I go. The purpose of my trip was business and vacation. The Encore far exceeded my expectations. The lobby is gorgeous. The hotel is new and it looks new. There are no signs of wear and tear. Check in was fast and the service was exemplary. Unfortunately, there is no coffee maker in the room and coffee will cost you a few dollars in the cafe on the main floor. The gym also costs extra to use unless you purchase a spa treatment. The location of the hotel is farther down one end of the strip. The room was amazing, even nicer than my room had been at the Bellagio. (very modern - huge bathroom with plasma tv in the bathroom, double sinks, separate tub and shower, large tv in bedroom, blinds that open with push of a button, privacy sign for the door with push of a button, etc.). Housekeeping does a great job on the hotel. I am a clean freak and I didn't see any area of my room or hotel that had a spot of dust even. Compared to the other hotels that I have stayed at on the strip (Bellagio, New York New York, Luxor), the Encore is the nicest however it was also far more expensive than the other hotels that I stayed at. The pool at the Encore was really nice. Pool side service was great too. Overall, it is a very nice, modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reneekim
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3-night stay at the Encore. We loved the hotel lobby/casino decor, and although the service was about a B+ (unless you stay at a Four Seasons or equivalent, it's hard to get consistent A-plus service), the amenities, food, and room were probably the best we have ever had in Vegas. To get a hotel like Encore in Manhattan, you'd probably pay $1000 a night. We paid $110 a night plus we got 2 free tickets to Le Reve. We also do not understand the Red Card player club system they have, but we got 2 meals comp'ed at the Society Cafe (very good food, and they brought out hot pretzels!!!! For lunch, it was about $110, so it's not like a standard cafe) and about 6 buffets comp'ed. We kinda got sick of the buffet, but the food is very good. And how can you really complain about free food? And we should say that the king crab legs (they offer it for dinner only) were sliced lengthwise. It was so easy to eat. Whoever invented that machine or tool...kudos to you! Hubby said the pizza at the pizza place at the Wynn was the best he had had in a long time! And I had an Asian Chicken Salad at the deli by the theater at the Wynn, and even though it was pre-made, it was very delicious. The food was excellent. And the retail options there are great. Of course, it's all high-end stuff, but my husband and I got some really good deals on clothing. They sell Juicy Couture sweats ($100-plus sweats) at the sundries store. That's my kind of shop. We would definitely stay again, and we preferred the Encore to the Wynn because it was laid out very well, and it was much smaller than the Wynn. So, you didn't have to walk too much to get to here or there. Then again, after eating all that food, walking is good for you. Great job, Steve Wynn...and wife! I guess she does the retail portion of his hotels.

Reviews.Title: “THE ENCORE DELIVERS”
Reviews.Author: U646
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three nights at The Encore. We had a special $99.00 a night rate for a King Suite and $75.00 resort credit. We self parked in the garage right behind the property. This self park garage was the easiest I've used on The Strip and very close to the front desk and room elevators. Check In was a breeze and the room on the 35th floor facing the pool was great. We could not hear any outside noise. The room was as expected and the bed very comfortable. It took a while for hot water to get to our room (3-4 minutes). The Lobby Bar has breakfast items and coffee located right next to the elevators. We used this each morning. There are two pools, one for 21 and over. This was greatly appreciated and was a quiet oasis. Food service is rather limited at the pool, but plenty of drinks are available. The fitness facility cost $15.00 a visit and the locker room/steam/sauna facility cost $40.00 a vist. So to workout and have a steam it cost $55.00. The facility is beautiful.... questionable if it is worth the cost. Internet was available.....$13.99 a day. It's crazy that Starbucks can have free wireless..but The Encore wants $13.99 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: heavyduty75
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Encore and it was amazing.I really couldn't complain about a thing.I would recommend and stay here anytime.Our last 4 trips to Vegas have been wonderful .We have stayed at a lot of different Hotels on the strip....but non compare to the Wynn/Encore.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: gattisdoc
Reviews.Content: this and the wynn are the finest hotels in las vegas.the rooms spectacular.food superb.staff all look like they genuinely like to work there.we have been to vegas 20 times at least.the wynn and encore are the best

Reviews.Title: “Not so good Encore experience”
Reviews.Author: RoddyC
Reviews.Content: My expectation of Encore by Wynn was that it is an exceptional hotel associated with another exceptional hotel. Well it tuened out to be more like a wolf in sheeps clothing. Check in was quick and fine and we got a room on the 38th floor and could have paid an extra $25 per night to get a higher hotel room. The room was plush and the bathroom was as big as the rest of the room. First thing I noticed as I checked the room out was that it had a lot of wasted space. It had a large what I thought was a dresser, but turned out to be just a display. It had no drawers and you couldn't open it. It also had a couple of more places you would think they would allow you to store things that were no more than cosmetics. I still thought the room was fine until I tried to turn on the big screen tv and it didn't work. That was my first call to the service desk. While waiting for them to arrive I noticed they had a collection of snacks and gifts sitting on the dresser thing. Well these were balanced on a device that if you removed any item you had 60 seconds to replace it otherwise you will be charged for it. This probably wouldn't be a big deal unless you wanted to read the contents of whatever it was. Speed reading anyone!!! Also noticed that there was no refrigerator. This prompted our second call to the service desk. Turns out you could rent on for $25 dollars a day. Hummm, that works out to $175 for a week. Fortunate for us the hotel is within walking distance of a Walgreen where we went a got a disposable ice chest and other goodies to tide us over for our 3 night stay. They came up and got the tv working and we were ready to dive into the casino and other offering of the hotel. The gaming is your usual slots and table games that all hotels offer. The place had several restaurants with the most intreging being the Sinatra. Decent prices for a high end Italian restaurant. The other restaurants were just over priced. The Encore is attached to the Wynn so you can go there as well but the two places are the same in decor and amenities. After a long drive to get to Vegas we called it an early night (about 12 midnight). The next day everything changed. I checked by checking account like I do everyday and found that $850 dollars had been charged to my account. I wanted to know what this was and it turns out that the hotel had charged me for the nights I was staying and they had an incidentals charge of $150 per night that was deducted from my account. Now I don't know about you but I have never stayed in a hotel that charged for the room upfront and most incidentals were either I take you card number or about a $100 refundable deposit. I asked why the incidental charge was so much and the responde was "we don't know it you will destroy the room or not". Excuse me, but what type of guests do you have it you think they will destroy the room. That sheds a bad light on the hotel. We inquired about an alternative to the incidental charge that they had taken out of my account and they had none. Personally I think tying up the amount of money they were tying up was taking away from us enjoying what the hotel had to offer. Not everyone uses credit , so of us pay as we go. This whole incident led us to not want to spend any more money in this hotel, so the remainder of the trip we eat and gambled elsewhere. But that wasn't the end of out problems. We returned to our room after one excusion and our toilet didn't work and another the electricity in the room didn't work. Needless to say we wern't happy campers at this hotel. The kicker came the morning of checkout. Part of the package deal we got from the hotel was a $75 dollar credit with the hotel. We hadn't used any of it so we decided to hit the pool early and then have breakfast by using this. The pool area is wonderful at this hotel. They have a regular pool and they have an adults only pool for those who want to go european style. Cabanas go for $300 to $400 dollars a day through the week and $400 to $500 a day for the weekend. The cabana is yours for the entire day, so you could leave and comeback later in the day. Well we charge a couple of bloody maria's while at the pool and then went to breakfast. Well when we tried to charge the breakfast on the room we were informed that we had checked out of the room already. It also turned out that the drinks we thought we had charged did not count either. So we ended up spending close to $70 dollars that we could have spent somewhere else. It was a very frustrating situation. How did we get checked out without our knowledge? The explaination from the hotel was that the hotel must have automatically checked us out. What? How does a hotel automatically check you out? We hadn't even went back to the room to get out stuff. What the heck!!! Well when we really did go down to get the explaination it wasn't pretty. Our complaints were so much that they had to pull us out of line and the hotel manager talked to us on the side. Turns out that they also have a policy of letting hotel personnel use each others name tags. The person who checked us into the hotel that didn't tell us about the incidentals or the upfront room charge had been using someone elses name tag. So the hotel couldn't identify who had checked us in. There was also different solutions to the incidental charge that could have been used. On top of all this when we were ready to leave the hotel we had our luggage sent to the valet parking and they lost our luggage. We had to wait in valet for almost 45 minutes before we could go. Also turns out that we were not the only ones who had a problem or two. Overall the experience was a total failure on the hotels part. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. As a matter of fact I would recommend that anyone looking for a great experience to go to the Pallazo and Veneitian hotel for a lot better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property in so many ways, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: GetWellKatelynn
Reviews.Content: Pros: This is a beautiful property and the rooms really are as beautiful as in the pictures. There's great music on the TV, which made the room have a very relaxing ambience while I worked. I took the advice of many people on this site and at check-in requested a room on the opposite side of the nightclub. The front desk clerk immediately nodded; apparently he has heard this before; and he gave me a room on the 50th floor. The downside of the "opposite side from the nightclub" is that your room view isn't worth writing home about. That's okay with me, because unlike many Vegas visitors, I was going to use the room to sleep at night. My colleagues, on the other hand, got very low floor rooms on the nightclub side, but I gathered from the stories I heard the following day that they didn't plan on sleeping anyway. I was also given a $75 room credit, as were my colleagues; and we pooled our credits and enjoyed a nearly-free fabulous steak dinner at Switch. The cons: It's crowded. Checking out was nearly a disaster. I was running late for the airport at 5:00 a.m., and when I went to the Registration Desk to check out, there was one clerk and four people waiting on line. No time for that, I bypassed the checkout procedure and got my receipt emailed to me the following day. They have a silly system of charging you for an overpriced snack or drink if you pick something up for more than 60 seconds, but they will refund the charge if you call them promptly. The worst thing of all about my room was the bed. I'd heard great things about the bed and was really looking forward to sleeping in it...but, someone really heavy had slept on one side of the bed, making it seem like I was sleeping on a hill. That was not comfortable at all. I am normally a very good sleeper in hotels, but this was one experience where I can say I did not sleep well at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Beeben
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore for 4 nights last week and it was the perfect end to a great holiday in the US and Canada. Las Vegas is a town full of BIG hotels and Encore is no exception. As it is the twin hotel to the Wynn inside it feels like one huge hotel. This hotel is very classy and cool piped chill-out music throughout and beautiful butterfly-inspired deccor. Oour room on the 54th floor was gorgeous although the mimi-bar was a bit cheeky. Loads of goodies but if you lifted them for longer than a minute they were yours. Plenty of warnings and everything in Vegas has a price after all so not a big deal. Any staff we encoutered were very helpful and took time to explain gambling etiquette to us novices. The pool was fantastic-lots of beautiful people but room for everyone. A fantastic stay and would love to come back

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: Littlelobo
Reviews.Content: I recently got married in Vegas in July and we booked out hotel stay at the Encore. It was the FANTASTIC! Our room was on the 63rd Floor overlooking the Vegas Strip, WOW!! The room was large, comfortable, relaxing, it was home away from home! Will definitely plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Encore is Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: tranquil_kate
Reviews.Content: Travelled from London, 10 nights at Encore, 1st time in Vegas - The hotel is fantastic, the best one in my opinion. Four pools to choose from as well as the beach club pool at wkends is you're into clubbing in the day! I can not recommend the Le Reve show at the Encore enough, it is literally the most mind blowing best thing i have ever seen, would def see it again and even worth going back to vegas just to experience it again. Stayed on the 35th floor, and no noise very quiet at night! Staff are fantastic, can not do enough for you - everyone is very polite and the placs is spotless 24-7. Would def love to go again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Rooms, typical lackluster Vegas service”
Reviews.Author: billnbob
Reviews.Content: I was VERY excited to be staying at the Wynn, even more so when upgraded to the Encore suites. The rooms really are beautiful. We snagged a great deal for the room. More than the room I was looking forward to "the hotel" in Vegas that really was upping the service factor. Dissapointed to say the least. Almost everyone we had dealings with were ONLY interested in doing their very specific jobs. Yes they were pleasant enough. That said, any inquiry to them met with a refferal to someone else. No ownership. There are a lot of rules here evidently for employees, they all seemed to be so afraid to break a rule they were helpless to make a decision. Great rooms, yes, but if you are looking for a hotel where you are treated as an individual person, this is NOT it. I am sure if you checked in as a "high roller' your treatment may be different. I figure our group (7 adults - 3 rooms) dropped about 8 grand in 4 days, not big spenders, but not cheapskates either. I would stay here again if the price was right, but a home run it is not. Next time I will try Aria or one of the smaller hotels.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: Verinn
Reviews.Content: For our yearly trip, my mom, sister and I visited Las Vegas and San Francisco. We absolutely LOVED the hotel. The service was great, it was fun, new and oh-so-vegas!!! The room was very spacious, and the spa was to die for. The food at their different restaurants was very yummy. Room service was a little disappointing though -not a lot of variety and nothing special I think my only complaint would be that housekeeping needs to do a better job. Upon checking in, the previous guest had left 2 dirty socks in a drawer, the carpet was poorly vacuumed and the bathroom floor was dirty. If I go back to vegas I will most certainly be staying at the Encore

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel in LV”
Reviews.Author: creighc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Encore for 6 nights to celebrate my retirement. This is probably our 30th trip to LV and our 3rd stay at Encore. We are big Steve Wynn fans - our past favorites being Bellagio and Wynn. We know the plusses and minuses of most of the hotels and for what we want, Encore is the best choice. Until something else better is built, it will be our first choice. Their attention to detail is unsurpassed. First of all, Encore is a smaller, quieter casino. Some think the location is a bit far from center strip, but if i choose to walk, it's close enough to other casinos, restaurants, etc. Besides, once you get there, you really don't need to go elsewhere - unless this is one of your first trips to LV. I'll list the things I like and things that are not that great. Love: The atmosphere - Classy, quiet, first rate decor. The Pools - beautiful, lots of lounge chairs, food and drink at pool, georgeous waitresses. The rooms - large, classy, cool big flatscreen that spins for viewing from bed or sitting area. We had small party for 6 and there was plenty of room for everyone on coaches and chairs. Bathroom is large with seperate shower/soaking tub. Lighting options are great and the beds are wonderful. Staff - We have always found the Wynn/Encore staff to be well-trained and friendly. I think some quests interpret their professionalism as "snooty" or "standoffish". We have always had good luck with the staff by being friendly and kind - and not demanding something we did not pay for. The maids were great, once they learned we liked extra towels and lotion, there was always an extra supply available. Bags were delivered right away, valet staff was super accomodating, check-in (20 min wait) was friendly and efficient. my favorites are the gaming staff - professional, efficient, friendly and knowlegable. It's clear that they all know they are working in the best property and they need to be the best at what they do. The spa - have been to 10-12 of them on the strip and this is clearly the most beautiful. The one area that i would love to see changed a bit is the food choices. The food itself, and the service is suberb. We have eaten at several of their resataurants and I rate them all equally high. However, sometimes you want a less expensive choice without leaving the property. That's my only quibble. There is a great sandwich/deli called Zoo Crackers right next to the Sports Book at Wynn, but it's a 5 min indoor walk. I have booked an end-of summer return to enjoy all the Encore and LV delights. Hats off to Steve Wynn and staff for their great success!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: explorer50uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days from 14th July, the rooms are fabulous, the beds are out of this world!! could have stayed in the room our entire stay!! especially since the temps were around an unbearable 117 degrees F. Pools are so nice and the Wynn pools are available too. Check-in was excellent, only thing is, they want a credit card and will take an authorisation for $300 per room per day, we were not too happy with this, I know that this is the norm for most USA hotels but since the mini-bar was ridiculously overpriced ( can of coke was $6) and we were not going to be using room service, we eventually managed to get the price down to $200 for 2 rooms for the whole stay!! so if you are not happy to have your CC authorised for that amount, then speak to reception. The staff are very pleasant and service is great. The dinner buffet at Wynn is amazing!!! $42 but worth every penny!! Check out was smooth and parking is free. This applies to most hotels in Vegas and since the cars are very reasonable its worth having one, especially in these high temeratures.!! Any questions please ask me. You will not be diappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good in some areas, disappointing in others”
Reviews.Author: Janey1UnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: Visited the Encore as a group of 4 adults for 5 nights encompassing Memorial weekend at the end of May. The hotel was busy over this holiday weekend and when we arrived - tired and late at night, the rooms were not together and one party was given an upgraded room and the other wasn't. The staff and then the manager was unable to resolve this problem and I felt customer service was very poor here. Rooms: The rooms themselves are large and bright with floor to ceiling windows and lovely views down the strip towards the airport. Other rooms do face in the opposite direction with a less attractive view. Bathrooms were large with separate shower and bath, amenities, and tv near his and hers sinks. We had 2 Queen beds with I am sure a hundred pillows!!! Slept very well. We were on the 62 floor, our friends further along the corridor said they could here the music from the Encore Beach Club that opened that weekend - even on the 62 floor!! We couldn't here it. Couldn't fault the rooms. The hotel is very plush in the public areas, with a large casino and walk way connecting through to the Wynn with a number of restaurants/shops and a night club enroute. There is a nice bar area near the reception. I liked the fact that there are windows in areas of the casino as opposed to other hotels where there are none. The let down was the pool areas. The Encore has 2 pool areas - one for all and one for adults. Both of the pools were quite small and the sun loungers were in tight rows with no parrasols to get shade from the sun. I felt like I was sunbathing in a 3 star on the Costas!! It was really busy, so even getting a sun lounger was a problem. One morning they were not ready to open the adult pool at the allocated time, due to a party there the night before. It nearly caused a riot!! There are some loungers partly submerged in the pools with shade but you paid about £500 a day for the privledge of using these. There are also cabannas for hire but these were going for over £10,000!! a day. If only!! There was a bar with a few tables to eat at and some gaming tables in the pool grounds. Cocktails here cost about $60 for a pitcher for 4. The pools in the Wynn were very similar, although slightly bigger. I don't really know much about gambling so can't really comment on the tables, only to say that the minimum bet was usually £25. Did try the slots for fun. You are offered a drink if you are gambling on the tables, I was never offered one on the slots, but you do have to tip the waitress well. We went to Fremont Street to gamble, minimum $3 bets and free drinks with a dollar tip to the waitress. We really enjoyed it there!! We hired a car from the airport (avis, prebooked online) very cheap compared to Europe. I think we paid about £130 for 5 days for a Ford Mustang Convertible. It's free valet parking at the hotel with a tip to the guy of course. You can drive down the strip and park free at other hotels. Vegas is loud, brash and never seems to sleep. We visited many of the other hotels on the strip and really they are all very similar. You can't check out the pools though as this area is restricted to hotel guests only. The fountains are good to watch at the Bellagio in the evenings. Our friends went on a helicopter trip to the canyon with a touch down in the canyon and fly back over the strip. They really enjoyed this. They went with Maverick Tours that fly from McCarron airport (Las Vegas). Some tours fly from Boulder so no flight over the strip on your return. We ate at the Wynn buffet restaurant one night which was good value, plenty of choice and well cooked. We added on the champagne option which was only aabout $8, for unlimited champagne while eating. Good value with most drinks costing about $15. We usually bought breakfast - fruit, croissants and coffee from the bar areain the encore and took to the pool. One good thing - plenty of free water stations around the pools. We also ate at the Hard Rock (tradition for us!) and a Tony Romas. Overall I enjoyed Vegas, I am glad I have visited as it's a must see place, but won't be rushing back. If I did return I probably would stay at the Encore again, even with its faults or possibly the Bellagio as it's more centrally located on the strip. The Encore is at the top end. Take plenty of cash - it's not cheap! It didn't help with it being an American holiday so the whole place was packed and prices over inflated due to this. By the Tuesday it had become less crowded and prices had dropped again for food. I appreciate Vegas isn't a beach hol and they want you to gamble, but I think abit more thought could have gone into the design of the pools and pool areas, after all most people can't afford to gamble for 24hrs a day. By the way the weather was great - 95 - 97C each day.

Reviews.Title: “Don't check in on Sunday!!!”
Reviews.Author: balltaba
Reviews.Content: We arrived at check-in time (3:00 PM) on Sunday and were told our room was not ready. I asked when it would be ready and was told 15 min. to one houir they would call us. When I reminded them that check-in was 3:00 PM they replied that's when they start checking-in. I asked if I could start checking out at 12:00 and maybe take an hour or so.They said no check-out time was 12:00 noon. We were not able to get into our room until 4:30. We were traveling with our daughter who could not check in until 5:00 PM. If you have to wait be prepared to sit at a gambling table/machine, the bar or outside in the 115 degree heat. There is no seating in the lobby. Five stars--NO WAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: 27tomboy
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation through Tripadvisor rather than direct with the hotel. It turned out that 1800Hotels.com was a fraud, charging our card, but not paying the hotel for our room. None of that is the Wynn's fault. However, how the hotel handled the situation was terrible. The Wynn showed that we had a room reserved, and asked us to wait until it was cleaned. One hour later they told us that the room was ready, but our reservation had been canceled. After several phone calls, we realized that we had been duped, and that we would need to pursue 1800Hotels on our own. But since we still needed a hotel room, and they had one clean and waiting for us, we expected that they would rent us the room directly for a similar price as our reservation. WRONG. The desk staff asked for twice the rate we had originally booked for and refused to have a manger discuss the issue with us. We left and had a perfectly wonderful weekend at Caesar's. Although we have stayed several times at the Wynn and enjoyed it, we will not be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Expensive - Check your bill carefully”
Reviews.Author: GoCoogs79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore for the July 4th weekend. The hotel was beautiful, room was excellent. We ate at the hotel restaurants, very good food, and very expensive. Be sure to check your bill, I had booked a package from a direct mail promotiion that included two tickets for Le Reve. Having to rush for the airport, i didn't review my bill until 2 weeks after I got home. Encore had Charged me $258 for the show tickets. I called the head cashier's office, and the charge was reversed. I had a friend travel there on the same promotion in Jun, after telling them what happened to me, they told me the same thing happend to them, plus they were charged for a bottle of wine that they had never had. Sounds like a bit of a scam.

Reviews.Title: “A quality resort experience in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelnow
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Encore on July 4 at around noon. Cab fare from the airport was just under $20.00. The front desk was very busy and one of my only quibbles with the property is that I found the check in area a little chaotic. A person who appeared to be supervisory jumped in to ease the line-up and we were checked into our (strip view on request) room very quickly. We booked a very well priced prepaid package through Expedia.ca. I was prepared to upgrade views and rooms, but after we saw our Resort King Room on the 36th floor we were very satisfied. In contrast to the vibrant red décor on the floor the room was serene and spacious with a contemporary cream and black colour scheme. We’re fans of more modern design and can live without faux chateau or theme touched hotel rooms masquerading as “fancy”. A spacious front foyer, with thoughtful halogen lighting led to comfortable bedroom and living spaces. Gorgeous bathroom with double sinks, soaker tub, generous shower and small flat screen TV. If you really can’t miss a call, you’ll find a phone by the, ahem, throne. Add the floor to ceiling strip view and we felt Vegas chic. Housekeeping was great and toiletries quality. TV’s flat Screened and the bedside consol that controlled drapes, lighting, the Do Not Disturb light and an Ipod Dock were fun. Two very nice pool areas. We ate at Café Society, Botero, the Wynn Buffet, NY Pizza and caught some cappuccinos at the Bamboo Lounge. Food and beverage offerings were high quality in every respect. Service was test-book good. A variety of outlets and price points available in the Wynncore. An easy walk across the street to the Fashion Show Mall will get you many more options. We’re not big gamers. We found the Encore was an excellent value as quick getaway resort vacation. Honestly after a while, we didn’t want to leave, except to attend shows. We'll be be back to golf when the temperatures come down a bit! The best of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A Casino with nice beds”
Reviews.Author: rubberman9
Reviews.Content: First let me say my primary reason for going to Vegas is to gamble.I have been going for 32 years and stayed in the best and worst Vegas has to offer.I do not complain often.This is advertised as a 5 star resort and in many ways it is.The room,decor and cleanliness of the place are perfect.My girlfriends spa experience was top shelf. It falls way short of the personal experience you should recieve in a couple of areas.The first is the 90 minute 3 phone call wait I had getting my bags brought to valet upon departure.The second is the lack of proper coffee shop.The coffee service is fine,but if you would like a fruit cup or some such quick breakfast item the wait was as long as a half hour.This is not 5 star service.The basic 2 egg and bacon breakfast in the 24 hour general restaurant consisted of hard potatoes and what seemed like old bacon.Underwhelming for $17.Go to Denny's lol. To those of you who are gamblers,I am a diamond member of Harrahs and a Borgata Black card holder.This means I play and risk a fair amount of money on these trips and am rewarded by other properties for this.I normally recieve a full complimentary stay at those properties.At Encore they picked up my coffee.I know how much play it takes to recieve comps at higher end properties and trust me I exceeded any gambling I would need at Caesars Palace or the Water Club which are coparable resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation was bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: RossHM
Reviews.Content: I reserved my room and paid for it weeks in advance. However, when I arrived, my room had already been given away. I was told that if I wanted a non-smoking king room like I had requested, I would have to pay an extra $50 a day to get a room on a higher floor. With taxes and fees, that added up to an extra $168 to my 3 day trip. I was told that my request for a non-smoking king was technically not a reservation but merely a "preference". That's right - a "preference" which can be simply dismissed. They even referred me to the fine print of my reservation confirmation. That's right! The Encore will not actually reserve the room you requested - even if you pre-pay for it weeks in advance. And I got no apology for this. In fact, they actually seemed to be a little annoyed that I would even question their "reservation" policy. And since we showed up on a weekday and the hotel appeared to be far from full, I suspect this might have been their plan all along. My recommendation - if you want a five star room in a nice hotel, there are several other five star hotels in on the strip - many for significantly less money and a better variety of restaurants and shops. I woudn't trust the Wynn or the Encore with a reservation again.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Resort On The Strip”
Reviews.Author: vermagnuson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have enjoyed every one of our stays at The Encore and The Wynn. This place has never left us disappointed. The cost may be a little higher but well worth it. We have gone to other places to stay or dine but end up wishing we had stayed at Encore. If you understand the value of quality you won't mind paying the little extra to enjoy this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: tcardona
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Monday -Thursday stay. We have stayed at most of the hotels on the south strip, and I must say that our Encore stay was the best! What to say- the rooms are gorgeous and huge with lovely ammenities; the restaurants are beautiful, food great; great, friendly service! What I loved the most was the relaxing vibe there. The music by the pool was a bit loud, but acid jazz/bossanova style and easy to listen to, but upbeat. The crowd by the pool was a bit more refined that other places we have stayed-nobody obnoxious. The adult/european pool was most appreciated -as don't really want to hear kids screaming or kicking me in the pool. Although I have read that the food and beverage prices at Encore are outrageous, the cost of a drink is about the same at Paris, Bellagio, Venentian, etc. For a low cost dinner/lunch option, check out Pizza Place at the Wynn. You can have a New York style pizza while sitting outside overlooking the waterfalls and Lake of Dreams. The only downside was having to hear/feel the music from the Surrender Night Club on Wednesday night. We were on the 39th floor could still very well hear and feel the music pretty strongly. Not sure why Encore would want to inconvience the hotel guests for the young party crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: Scratchpaper
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel and incredible experience in Las Vegas. We kind of stumbled into this hotel and didn't want to leave. We found all of the staff extremely helpful. The food inside of the hotel is excellent and the garden in the back was an awesome spot to take some photos and just soak up the beautiful weather in Las Vegas. I would absolutely recommend this place to all my friends. They are setting the bar high in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “wynn and encore both brilliant”
Reviews.Author: robertadams
Reviews.Content: stayed here in august 09 as part of our las vegas then san diego to san fran road trip anyone who has given this place 5/5 has pretty much covered everything that needs to be said so i will not add anymore. have also stayed in encore in march 09. both hotels absolutely brilliant

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: CrystalV
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel as well as the casino was wonderful

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best. If not sophisticated stay away.”
Reviews.Author: RichardSharp
Reviews.Content: Everything at Wynn if first class. Drinks are $15 so be ready. 75% of the people staying at Encore act and dress very nice. Thats great for Vegas. If you need a Starbucks or everyday burger, go across the street to the mall. You can take the bridge from the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “what a soothing oasis in a searing concrete jungle”
Reviews.Author: agent98
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend and i stayed there to celebrate being together for 19 years, and i couldnt have asked for a more calming and quiet experience. this being my 32 trip to vegas, i have stayed at many hotels, from bellagio, to the orleans, to the aliante station, and back to caesars palace. we booked our trip out of bellingham on allegiantair vacations and with the friends fly free promotion, we got two round trip tickets and four nights at encore for what i beleive what we would have paid for two nights if we booked through encore's website. we paid the extra 25 per night that they seemed to ask everyone at check-in, but we got upgraded to a panoramic view room on the 60th floor. This was the most awesome room ever, almost 800 square feet, floor to ceiling windows, dual vanities, robes, electronics galore from mutiple clocks, and draperies to i think 27 lights to set your mood with dimmers, all turned on or off with a single switch, this is some high end wiring in these suites. Sure the food was a bit expensive, but just walking the esplanade between wynn and encore with the hippest tunes playing, and enjoying the most georgeous pools ever made paying a little extra seem worth it, heck, we usually stay at the Hyatt, in either waikiki or kaanapali and the food at wynn seems like a deal. we can't wait to go back. p.s. we snuck out to the orleans for some good eats at TGIF, half price appys in the lounge and buckets of beer for 10 bucks. Well that paid for that nights upgrade, enjoy everyone!

Reviews.Title: “incredible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Agilito
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference (business), the hotel is incredible, brand new and very luxury. A bit noise at nights as it has night pool parties but you're in las vegas, it's the way it is!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, fun, attractive hotel - at a price!”
Reviews.Author: mel.w
Reviews.Content: Hmmmm - the Encore. We have been regular visitors to Las Vegas over the years, seeing hotels of varying standards, come and go. Have stayed in the majority of the strip hotels, but this was a first stay at Wynn / Encore. The hotels are adjoined, with subtle differences in identity. Both are undoubtedly beautiful to look at. Encore has a definate red colour theme - carpets, chandaliers, walls in places.Floral arrangements - both real and artificial - abound. We stayed in a resort room, having asked for a high floor - we were given that - at an extra premium. The room - and view- were fantastic. I experienced none of the problems that others have had with housekeeping etc.... everything was done efficiently. I would however agree with one of the previous reviews - despite the room being extremely large and comfortable - it could do with an extra piece of furniture ( it is almost bare really) for storage - a extra chest of drawrers would not go amiss. Realistically, there is just a wardrobe, and a small set of double drawers. More needed. Beds were extremely comfortable. I did not have any issues with noise, or the thin walls as mentioned by other reviews. It would be fair to say that my main observation would be the way the Encore has marketed itself. Every store at the hotel is "high end" individual retail, with pricing to match. Even mundane items are exhorbitantly expensive. I saw a pair of plain rubber flip-flops- nothing fancy whatsoever - on sale for $15. That is just silly. Everything at the hotel seems to be priced at a higher level than elsewhere, incuding food, sundries etc. So be prepared to pay! A minor point - there is an abundance of nightclubs here - this results in lots of people waiting to get in the clubs, with queues, in the casino area, and in the walkway between the Wynn/ Encore. Never caused an issue with me, but others may object . Overall, Encore is a fun, beautiful - but expensive place. I am sure that is exactly what it sets out to be.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo, Encore”
Reviews.Author: HBunna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Encore over the 4th of July weekend. It was a great experience. The hotel is beautiful. Check-in was a bit chaotic, but they had someone managing the lines and directing us where to go. We asked for a room on the quiet side of the hotel and were accommodated without any problems at all. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. We loved the low key atmosphere and the smaller setting of Encore and will definitely stay there again. The Spa is fabulous, too!

Reviews.Title: “Encore and Tower worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: GeneandJulie
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Encore. We used to stay at the Venetian, but we wont stay there anymore, the staff and property at Encore won us over. The Tower Suites are worth the extra money if you hate lines. A Private driveway delivered us right to the check-in counter, and we had no wait checking in. We were immediately greeted with cold towels for our face, and a bottle of chilled water. The bellman stayed with us and delivered the luggage and showed us right up to the room. Power drapes and lights were all controlled from the bed, and the bed so comfortable we never wanted to get up. The drapes also blacked out the room so we could sleep. We had a top floor room, with a view of the strip and the golf course. I loved seeing both sceneries because of the immense contrast with the casinos and serene lush fairways with waterfalls. We loved the hotel and the restaurants. We only left the property once for breakfast at Bouchon. Paradise Cafe was a great restaurant for lunch, the tasting menu at Bartolotta was amazing, and the Omakase menu at Okada was amazing too. Kelley Reuben is the Guest Services Manager, and once she met us, she never forgot our name. The only not so great thing was room service breakfast. It was the only time we were reminded we were in a hotel. The rest of the time it felt like a home.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CathyMPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a fabulous stay at Encore. We stayed in a Tower Suite (got upgraded for a very reasonable price). Tower Suites are not larger than other rooms but there is a higher staff to guest ratio and from what I was told more amenities in the room. The room was ultra spacious, beautiful and very clean (I am a clean freak.). The bed was super comfortable. Perhaps best of all was the staff who made us feel like VIPs (and we certainly are not!). Every Encore employee greeted us and asked how we were doing. They went out of their way to make sure that we were satisfied with every aspect of our stay. The final touch was giving us cold bottled water as we were checking out. I highly recommend Encore and hope to be back soon. I know some reviewers have complained about the noise from the nightclub. We did hear some noise from the nightclub and the nightclub is open until 4:00 AM. We were on the 27th floor facing the Strip. But it did not keep us awake and would not deter us from returning.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING AMAZING and really just AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Ktravels718
Reviews.Content: Great hotel !!!!!!!! Spacious rooms, beautiful bathrooms WONDERFUL views and comfy beds. Great service overall. Its such a luxurious place to stay. Pools are so nice and food and drinks are great, EXPENSIVE, yes but its worth it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Probably nice service if you're a fat fish. Not so much if you're a smelt.”
Reviews.Author: serenabythelake
Reviews.Content: I am a smelt. I lose hundreds, not thousands, at the casino. I stop after half a bottle of wine. I don't look like a VIP. This, at the Encore, seems to make me invisible. No one is outright rude, mind you--but you do get the slightly patronizing brush-off, pat answer, eyes-gliding-over-you-to-the-next-person-in-line bit. For example, for the last two days, the neighboring room has had two babies who have been shrieking in tandem at all hours of the day and night. I waited a long time to complain, figuring that those parents were having their hands full, without the neighbors making a fuss. But when hours went by and I found myself tossing and turning with no chance of falling asleep, I called the front desk, politely asking if there's anything they could do to help. I was told that "they will look into it", and got the quick hangup. Of course, nothing was done (even though I was willing to move to a different room, despite the inconvenience). So here I am, listening to two fierce babies crying even as I write these words, and figuring that I have to brace for another sleepless night. In another case I went to the bell desk to ask for advice about booking a Grand Canyon trip. The attendant handed me a couple of brochures, did not wait for any questions, and moved on to the next guests in line. I ended up doing my own research and booking the trip online. Now, I'm not looking for anyone to kowtow to me, (though many hotels do go out of their way to offer excellent service, no matter who you are. Such was the case when I stayed the Vegas Four Seasons last year --and it was nice to be treated well). But at the very least, I want a service devoid of condescension. So, adieu Encore--tomorrow morning this smelt is moving to the Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Encore!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore for 4 nights in June. We originally had a King Suite booked but we arrived at the hotel late due to an airline delay and misconnection so they gave our room away and had us in a room with 2 double beds instead. This wasn’t our first choice but we weren’t going to let this ruin our stay. The room we had was still beautiful on the 61st floor with a view of the Wynn and the pools down below. We stayed Monday thru Friday so noise wasn’t a factor except for the Thursday night when their nightclub Surrender was open. On the 61st floor we could hear and feel the music, I can’t imagine how loud it wouldn’t been closer to the ground? The Encore hotel is decorated very nice with red accents everywhere. The casino floor didn’t seem as busy as other hotels on the strip. There are not too many quick dining options but we had a great meal at Wazuzu one night and it was delicious. The walk to the Wynn is about 5 minutes where you can grab a quick breakfast and coffee as well as the buffet. We went to the pool one morning and had lunch at the bar, the wait staff was very friendly and kept asking us if we needed anything. The European pool was very relaxing, we were there on a Wednesday afternoon and didn’t have trouble finding lounge chairs. It was a nice touch that they had ice water available around the pool grounds. Overall we thought the Encore was a beautiful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Encore never ceases to impress”
Reviews.Author: sdclams
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my second stay at Encore in the past year. Loved it yet again. First off, if you are looking to save money, don't go to an expensive luxury resort like Wynn or Encore. People on this site complain in reviews because of the cost, Encore has never said that they are inexpensive. if you don't want to spend big money, go to TI or Mirage or another nice place that gives good deals. encore is not that place. I stayed for four nights, three of them comped. between the fourth night, a few meals, and two trips to the spa for my wife, the bill was still nearly $1500. It's not an inexpensive stay, but well worth the money if you can afford it. Now to what Encore is.... Luxury at it's finest. The restaurants are first rate, especially love Wazuzu, but they are all good. pricey, but worth the money. My wife has been to most of the top spa's in town, and finds Encore's to be the best by far. The casino has professional, and personable dealers. say hello to Genet, she is the best of the group. I am not a big pool person, but the two Encore pools are beautiful. I visit Vegas often, and have stayed at Luxor, Hard Rock, Mirage, TI, Bellagio and Wynn before trying Encore. Wynn and Bellagio are great resorts, but they both have something that Encore does not have, gigantic crowds everywhere you turn. Encore has an incredibly wide open floor plan, and because of it's location and price it has remained fairly quiet, even during busy times for Vegas. this is not great for Encore, but it is fantastic for those staying there. you can always find a seat at a table in the casino, waiting times for the restaurants are reasonable, if not non existent. I just can't say enough about it, Encore is the finest. again, don't concern yourself with the negative comments from people who are looking for free buffets and cheap rooms, that is not what Encore is all about. if you want to spend a few days at a top rated hotel with outstanding staff and amenities, then I highly recommend Encore.

Reviews.Title: “The Encore is like their grass...FAKE!”
Reviews.Author: maddog3333777
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Vegas several times and enjoyed all of our previous trips. This was the first time we had ever stayed in such an expensive place like the Encore but thought the price would be worth it. We were very disapointed when after checking in, we started discovering all of the hidden fee's for things like Wifi and using their Gym. I went down to speak to the front desk and asked that they wave the fee for just one of our computers. (By the way the charge was $13.99 per day per computer to use wifi). No luck, I even spoke to the manager but she wouldn't budge. From their it only got worse, they have a sign stating no outside food or alcohol aloud in the rooms. They want you to buy their insanly overpriced food from them. Trust me, STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: michele-andy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wynn Encore, got a really good deal with lastminute.com. Hotel was fantastic but very expensive, all designer shops, the decor was out of this world, resturants were very good but expensive, room was very nice with floor to ceiling window so you can see the strip at night . very clean and comfortable. There was a fridge in the room but it was a mini bar and if you took anything out and just looked at it for more than 60 seconds they it was charged to your room, No tea or coffee in the room. Yes would stay here again but you need to make sure you have plenty of money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Will Be Back Again”
Reviews.Author: techmaximum
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights at the end of March, that's it, I only stay in suites from now on. Comfortable bed, large bathroom, nice ajoining living room. Decor was nice, but not my taste. Very clean, but couldn't help but notice a few small details the cleaning staff missed. Next time I stay there I will consider complaining if it's not resolved. Don't get me wrong, the place was clean, but I did find a few hairs on the bathroom floor and a cup mark on table. Heard some people saying the walls were thin, not the case as far as I could tell. Every night was quiet while we were there. No riff raff either, lots of security. We brought our own coffee maker because I don't like rushing out of my room in the morning (I'm also too cheap to order room service). I highly recommend you do the same if you need your coffee in the morning like I do. Most Vegas hotels don't provide coffee makers, so we took the situation into our own hands. The hotel is really nice and perhaps one of the best Vegas will ever have. We enjoyed everything about the Encore including how it connects to the Wynn hotel. If you want to stay somewhere decent and can afford it, I highly recommend the Encore for its service, rooms, restaurants, and gaming. I will be back Mr. Wynn!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and service is 5 star but do your research ahead of time”
Reviews.Author: Beezercal01
Reviews.Content: Our stay was Sunday through Thurs (4 nights), my husband and I in one room and my son in a second room. We had a great promotion for the room including $25 free slot play and 2 tickets to La Reve. My son’s room was also at a reduced rate although higher than ours. His room included a $50 food credit. The staff were all very gracious and accommodating. La Reve was dark during our stay so we were given a $50 food credit in lieu of the tickets. In addition we were provided with a second upgrade to a panorama view room - strip view. The bellman, Jim, was so helpful. Our rooms weren’t ready when we checked in at 4 p.m. One was ready by 6:30 p.m so we asked for all the bags to be brought to one room about 7 p.m. It was hard to complain when we were given 2 upgrades and placed on the 56th floor. Jim walked us through the controls for the drapes, etc and got us ice. After, he called down to see if the 2nd room was ready and went downstairs to get our room keys for us. When I placed my insulin on ice in the bucket, he called housekeeping for a fridge for my meds, no charge. The rooms are lovely, comfortable and have every amenity. During our stay, the rooms were kept very clean and well stocked. Unlike other reviewers we never heard the nightclub on the 56th floor. Because it was a midweek stay, the hotel was not busy and we benefited with lower limits at the tables -$10 single deck blackjack and $10 pai gow poker. We did O.K. at the tables and I even hit a royal flush in pai gow poker. Since we rented a car, we checked out several other casinos on the strip. No one is busy and the table limits are lower than expected. We went to Okada, Tableau twice and the Wynn buffet (each reviewed). We had room service once (sandwiches) and although the food was fine, the service was great. A table with our food was placed in front of the floor to ceiling windows. Great view to accompany a BLT with fries. Expect to pay 5 star prices but do your research beforehand and make some decisions. Internet charges at $15 a day are ridiculous so I left my laptop at home. The snacks and drinks in the room are also way overpriced - plan ahead. Also, cell service was spotty or nonexistent. I believe in tipping service personal well when they provide good service. The staff was appreciative and gracious to us from the valet staff to the concierge to the front desk. I have to say that the decor of the hotel isn’t especially appealing to me, but it is opulent, clean and well kept.
