Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: LDV15
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Encore for 4 nights, including 2 weekend nights. Since we were there on a special occasion, we were upgraded to the top floor (63rd) with a south view that faced the strip. Here are a list of pros and cons re: Encore; Pros: 1) Fabulous room decor and clean room. The view was over-dominating by the Wynn building south of Encore but overall, a breathtaking view of the strip at night. 2) It is less rowdy than the other hotels, namely the ones more South of the strip so it is a very peaceful couples hotel and more mature (mentally, not age-wise) hotel. 3) If you're into high-end shopping, there is Chanel, LV, Rolex and the necessary big brands for your shopping pleasure. There is also the Fashion Mall across the street with a variety of stores. 4) You get access to 4 different pools - 2 in Encore and 2 in Wynn. 5) The rotating flat screen TV was a nice touch as we were able to comfortably watch tv on our bed and on the couch. 6) Front desk, concierge, bell desk, door man were very friendly and helpful. When we tipped them, they were very appreciative of the tip and made it known that they were very appreciative by sincerely thanking us. Cons: 1) Very disappointed with housekeeping as they were subpar. We have stayed at many high class hotels and the housekeeping at Encore was by far the worst one we have encountered. Don't get me wrong, the regular stuff were cleaned but as a 5-star hotel, it's the little personal attention to details that makes the difference. Our ironing board was not put away, 2 days in a row. They forgot to give us a floor towel for the shower and when our maps dropped to the floor, they failed to kindly just pick it up and put it on the tv stand and instead, just left it on the floor. On the last day, housekeeping left their dirty towel on our desk and that was the last straw. Toiletries were not refilled properly. Also, no turn down services were offered and we didn't know if we were supposed to request for it because other 5-star hotels automatically performed such services while we were out. 2) The location itself is very North of the strip so there will be a lot of walking involved if you wish to reach the South end of the strip. 3) Be prepared for costly meals and drinks at the hotel. The price is expected for a high-end hotel. If you can't afford the food, just walk down the strip and eat somewhere else as the room per night here is not that bad if you get a good deal. Overall, we enjoyed our experience at the Encore. It was our first Vegas experience and we loved coming home to our comfortable and clean room at the end of the night to get a good night's rest!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: wsmithclearwater
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Encore was perfect. It's a perfect combination of exciting and relaxing Vegas. For excitement, you're nearby everything the strip has to offer. Le Reve was the best Cirque du Soleil show we've seen. You have easy access the to great clubs at Wynn and Encore. For relaxing, the spa is absolutely unbelievable. Gorgeous. The restaurants are simply some of the best in the world. Daniel Boulud's famous burger is too good to pass up. SW is a little generic, but still top notch steaks and an atmosphere on the crazy lake with shows. Botero was ok. Society Cafe has a fantastic selection for breakfast and lunch. Yes, the restaurants are all extremely pricey, but it is one of the most spectacular hotels you can stay at. Suite was large and perfectly equipped with great views of the dessert. Amongst the top tier hotels in Vegas, this is the only one I would choose.

Reviews.Title: “High class and high price.”
Reviews.Author: TeamW
Reviews.Content: This is yet another behemoth on the Las Vegas Strip. Unlike a lot of strip properties, this place exudes class, has stunning views, luxurious rooms, and delivers on what it promises to be- uberluxury. This all comes with a price that is simply prohibitive. Maybe I'm just jealous because I am not another LA spoiled tot on a weekend in LV on daddy's platinum AMEX, but prices in this hotel are downright stupid. $8 for a cup of coffee is unacceptable. If I had decided to clean out the minibar the tab would have been not quite half a mortgage payment. Maybe things are priced this high to keep out the gangster-thug-life-wanna’-be's I dealt with everywhere else on the North Strip. Why is wifi not free? I felt insulted that if I am paying $300 a night the hotel has a policy that prohibits me from bringing in my own food and beverage. Yea, that's right technically the hotel prohibits you from bringingn in a bottle of wine, leftovers from your over priced dinner with Emeril, or a soda from the 7-11. If I want to go buy a 6 pack and bring it back to my room, at $300 a night, I think I've paid for the privilege. The room is beautiful. The electronic light control and drapes are a neat touch. The rooms are spacious. The bathroom provides a luxury only surpassed in the nicest of homes. My room was quiet. The TV and furniture are excellent. No complaints about the lodging. I don't mind paying for something nice. However, when it gets to the point where I feel taken advantage of, nickel and dimed, and treated like a walking revenue source as opposed to a guest, I can't help but be offended. It's worth staying here once. For half the price, one can get a room at a lot of 4 star properties. I just don't know if twice the cash is worth the extra star- more than once.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: number1hedge
Reviews.Content: the encore is a beautiful hotel! check in was easy, and very friendly. our room was beautiful, and spotless. we ate a society cafe, it was great, and sinatra, also very good! we had the sunday brunch, it is the best buffet in vegas! we saw the garth brooks show, it was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Loving the Encore”
Reviews.Author: aanita66
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great clubs, awesome pool! We would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: watanurse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Encore on a business trip this past week. Granted, business trips are not fun, but the atmosphere at the Encore was very cold. My rate was changed at check-in. Check-in took a very long time. I was told several times there were no non-smoking rooms available, then one magically opened up. This hotel charges (a LOT) for everything. If you pick anything up from the in-room refrigerator or off the snack bar, you have 60 seconds to replace it or else you will be charged. A large sign in the lobby warns you not to bring outside food or drinks to your room, and that bags/purses/briefcases are subject to search. This is ridiculous and unacceptable. The casino features $10 minimum tables. Anyone who rates this hotel highly should consider what was paid for the luxury atmosphere. Certainly you should expect nothing less, and probably a good deal more in terms of friendliness. the Marriott at least gives you a free bottle of water when checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Blew us away!”
Reviews.Author: AlatCarrick
Reviews.Content: What a spot! This hotel had it all, golf, food, shopping, gambling and shows. We were situated opposite the Fashion Show Mall on the strip. Make sure to ask for a Strip View room. The room was amazing, very luxurious and even had a TV in the bathroom. My wife loved the Tv while lying in the bath. We also went to the La Reve show in the Theatre. Would recommend highly. We went for the VIP tickets which included Champagne and truffles. One thing I noticed about Vegas was the better the hotel - the better looking the wairesses. Needless to say, ours were like Supermodels! Have travelled all over the world and this would be as good as any I've stayed in. Can't fault it all. The hotel is so big it took us 15 mins to walk from our room to the far side of the Hotel. Get it booked!!!

Reviews.Title: “The amenities were great, but the rooms were loud”
Reviews.Author: mpgan
Reviews.Content: We found the rooms and general ambiance of the hotel to be everyting and more that we could have hoped for...during the day. The suites were spacious, luxurious and came with incredible floor to celing windows providing fantastic views of the city and mountains. The gym was one of the best equipped, in any of the hotels I've stayed at, and we never had a bad meal, although they could use a better coffee bar (Starbucks, Peets, etc.) somewhere inside of Encore. That being said, as soon as the music in their nightclub, XS, got started around 10pm, the bass was thumping throughout our room until 4am. And this was 18 floors up. We complained and the perception I got is that this is a fairly regular complaint. The staff moved us the following day to the other end of the building, and while the nightclub noise was dampened, we could still hear the bass. More distrssing, our 2nd room was above the site of the new Beach Club. While changing for dinner one evening, they crew was testing the sound, and despite now being on the 22nd floor, not only could we hear the music, it was loud enough to follow the lyrics. Personally, we are very leery at staying at this hotel again, and have provided some feedback to friends who knew we had stayed at Encore. My biggest complaint is not that the hotel has a nightclub on premises, if the line had been less than 2 hours, we might have gone in ourselves,rather that the hotel seems to be willing to prioritize noise in the rooms and resulting hotel guests discomfort over their desire to run a "Trendy" nightclub. Sad that a hotel/casino with this much potential, does not appear to be doing anything to permanently resolve the problem. I'll be back to the casino, but would not stay in the hotel itself unless a permanent solution has been reached ensuring quiet suites/rooms for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Tiger99a
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Hotels all over the western hemisphere and Las Vegas, including The Venetian, Planet Hollywood, Luxor, Treasure Island, Paris, and the Encore blows them all away in every detail. The room was expertly laid out including a TV that swivelled from being a bedroom TV to a living room TV through an opening in the wall between the bedroom, and living room. Service was immaculate, staff was friendly, and the pool was the best pool i've ever been in. I felt like a celebrity while at the Encore. This hotel had a way of being Elegant and Hip at the same time. One Caveat that my fiance did not like was that we had a southern facing room with a view of the pool, that turned into a night club she said that Thump thump thump from the nightclub at the pool kept her awake on Saturday night. So if you have a problem with that make sure you get a room on the other side or higher up.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent stay in the Tower Suites”
Reviews.Author: sushinutnc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from stay June 21 -25 for 20th anniversary. I paid for an upgrade to a panoramic room and upon discovered the agent apparently further upgraded us to a Tower Suite. From what I understand, the Tower Suites are the same room type, but have the following extras: separate valet entrance, check-in desk, concierge, elevators, and pool. We had two bottles of water and newspapers delivered each day and nightly turn-down service. We also noted a special "for invited guests only" reception area (only noted guests in there once) and also a private casino for invited guests accessible from the private elevators. Other than these, I'm not sure there are any other differences from the regular rooms. The separate check-in is apparently a big plus-- we arrived late on a Monday evening and were able to walk straight up to the regular check-in (no wait), who informed us of our upgraded room and to go check in at the Tower desk. The rest of our stay, we noted the regular check-in is kind of a mess.... on weekdays it usually had about 50-75 people trying to check in/out from around 11am to about 1 pm. The Tower desk never had more than 2 people waiting and was usually empty. Mind you, these were weekdays. So, our experience: We had a little problem during check-in with the reservation, but it was quickly resolved by the EXCELLENT front desk attendant-- Jessica. While she was working this out on the phone, my wife had mentioned we were on our 20th anniversary (more on that later). Also, we noted from other recent reviews here about the noise from the newly opened Surrender nightclub (glad I checked here again before leaving). I asked about a north-facing room, up high. I noted they had only a couple rooms on the strip-facing side up high. They had at least 10-15 on the north side. It was totally quiet. Didn't even notice any noises from neighbors (up/down/sides). She set us up on the 52nd floor. I will note that north-facing rooms look out onto the last of the old strip and downtown (Circus Circus, Stratosphere, Riviera, the stalled (but pretty) Fontainebleau right in the middle of the view, and the stalled (but nasty and ugly) Echelon site to the left. After getting to our room, we noted the place was immaculately clean. I see occasional reviews on here re: cleanliness issues. Our room was perfect. After settling in for a bit, we decided to order room service. Now, I'm used to room service being generally expensive in any hotel, so I was prepared to see the prices. Turns out, many of the items were about the same room service prices you'd see in 3-4 star hotels (note: a $5 room charge PLUS an 18% gratuity is automatically added). I decided to splurge on a $35 steak, just because we were celebrating. We were told it would be about 30 minutes. After 10 minutes, a knock was on the door... turned out not to be the dinner, but one of the staff members presenting a welcoming gift of 4-6 huge chocolate-covered strawberries in an edible chocolate bowl... with a wonderful hand-written note from Jessica at the front desk congratulating us on our anniversary and welcoming us to "TSE" (Tower Suites Encore). An EXCELLENT touch, Jessica. (Steve Wynn-- we noted on the news most every night how staffing cuts and shortened workdays were just being resolved while we were there... give Jessica a bonus and a personal, hand-written note that her service went above our expectations). ;) So, another 5 minutes later, maid service came for nightly turn-down service. We declined, since we were eager to eat and settle in. After a total of about 40 minutes, the room service arrived. I wish I noted the attendant's name (sorry!), but he had also delivered the strawberries. He did a fantastic job. BTW, the steak was perfect. I seriously don't think I've had another steak that good. I was actually happy to have spent $100 on room service that night. So...the rest of our stay-- We welcomed the nightly turn-down service, once we received it on our second night while we had been out. The room lighting was dimmed, the TV was set to a nice "mood" channel (desert scenes, classical music), a couple mints, and two sets of slippers arranged on wither side of the bed on top of a white napkin-like floor mat... and of course, covers turned down. Another nice touch. Weekdays appear to be a perfect time to visit. A friend of mine noted the "LA Trash" (his words, not mine LOL) come up on Thurs or Fri nights. The resort was not crowded at all during this week. Casino was bare until about 9pm. Be prepared for the higher end table minimums... $15/$25 blackjack was the normal minimums. Pool attendants were hit-or-miss.... for about an hour they circulated fairly regularly, then vanished for an hour. We had to request one.... took 30 minutes for her return with just a soda (she also delivered lunch to another guest). BTW, as others have noted, that's a $5 soda. As noted frequently here, the food prices are a bit out of control. We actually decided to skip the restaurants, just to see what other hotels had to offer (price-wise). Also, just to note. Others have commented on A/C and problems with the remote controls for lighting/shades/curtains. Ours worked perfectly. Absolutely not a single problem. Overall pros: - Fantastic staff, especially in the Tower Suites - Beautiful property. Totally upscale. - Nice to have a separate pool for the Tower Suites... plenty of lounges and room around the two much smaller pools in this area (they are actually over at the Wynn). - Extra touches were much appreciated - For the price (with Internet specials etc), the value of the room is great, especially with our upgrade. We've dropped $250/night at some crappy dives. This room was well worth the ~$133/night I paid. - The bathroom was huge; fixtures/design were nice - Weekdays and north-facing room = nice respite from the constant over-stimulation of walking the Strip, although the view isn't pretty... that's for sure. Cons: - Food prices are rough. Again, I understand the quality is supposed to be 5-star, so I understand what Steve Wynn was going for. If the economy were better, maybe the place would be full and people would pay the prices. From what I could tell, the restaurants were pretty barren most evenings (I didn't see all of them, though). - Pretty much everything is expensive. - Internet service is $13 per 24-hr period (if I recall correctly). A bit of gouging, considering what it actually costs them to provide it. I bet they'd recoup their costs for that service if they reached a lower price point. I decided not to use it at all. If it were $5-7, I probably would have used it every day. - I wish there were a couple lower stakes table games. I have a hard time justifying even $15 per hand of blackjack. I decided to play video blackjack and was entertained for at least 2 hours over two of our nights. Only lost $6 on $60 total at-stake. Taking the free drinks into account, that's about 10 drinks for about $16 (incl. tips). ;) -- this is only a slight con... and could be a pro for the right guests: the new club Surrender appears to be a new hot spot for the wannabe party crowd. On weekdays, lines aren't forming until after 11pm. We were stuck on Eastern time through most of our trip, so we didn't even bother checking it out, but it looks like it could be a bit of a nuisance if you are old and crotchety and can't stand a bunch of young people having fun. ;) If you are that kind of guest, skip the Strip-facing view and take a north-facing room... and head to bed before 11. Final Recommendations for guests: - Stay for the luxury/room value, but go elsewhere if you want cheaper food (still hard to find elsewhere). - If you fly in, I highly recommend renting a car. Parking at all hotels/casinos is free on the Strip... you can see other hotels and eat at any of them without much difficulty. Most have food courts... their prices looked a little closer to "normal" for the most part. Also, if you want to avoid traffic on the Strip, there are feeder roads to the east and west that run parallel to the Strip. EASY to get to the south end of the Strip on one of them. - As noted frequently here, take full advantage of the Walgreen's just a block north. - Golfing-- I understand from a friend that the greens fees were $500. If you just can't wait to play for $500/round, then this is your place!!!! In the 4 mornings I checked the course from our window, I noted no more than a total of maybe 4 groups on the course the entire time. - unrelated to the Encore specifically, but if you go to Hoover Dam, get out there before 9AM. We were glad we did. The security checkpoint allows only one car at a time. We were in a line of 6 cars when we arrived there around 9am. We left back for Vegas around 11:30 and the single line of cars waiting for the checkpoint stretched almost 3 miles. - also unrelated to Encore-- if you want to see a beautiful, natural desert landscape, go out to Red Rock National Conservation Area. Go in the morning... it was surprisingly cooler there than back in Vegas (about 5° and a nice breeze). It's an easy drive. Final Recommendations for Wynn: - Shower: do something about the gap between the shower stall door and the vertical wall of the seat area. If the shower head is pointing to that lower hinge on the door, water hits the vertical marble and streams along its surface, right out through the gap in the door. The first night, we had a bit of a puddle running towards the sink. The rest of our stay, we had to point the shower down more towards the drain and away from the stall door. It worked out, but the initial flooding was a bit of a surprise/scare. - Toilet room: already noted here several times--- no active fan. There is what appears to be a passive vent, but I tested and there was no negative air pressure. If these vents were designed to actually vent this area, you need to do something about upping that flow. (further comments/descriptions withheld). ;) - Get rid of the $13 (?) per day Internet. I realize these charges are common across all ranges of hotels, but in a tourist destination, the convenience of free or much cheaper Internet access would have been nice. Next time, I won't bother bringing a laptop. Overall-- I would recommend Encore Tower Suites for couples wanting to be pampered. Absolutely a great stay. If you are one of those picky people who expects to be treated like a queen/king and are put off by the smallest things (things I frequently see in reviews on TripAdvisor), I'd like to challenge you to find fault at the Tower Suites, but then again, I'd rather you take your attitude somewhere else, so you don't ruin this place for when I return. :D Also, I rated Value as a 4-- Compared to other top-tier Vegas hotels, you can find lower room rates and better food prices. Compared to other, **similar quality** hotels (found elsewhere), I believe the rooms and accommodations appear to be EXCEPTIONAL value (price)..... the food prices are probably "right" for 5-star restaurants... just not great value. Hope that makes sense.

Reviews.Title: “over priced and a bit over rated.”
Reviews.Author: dolphinboy1
Reviews.Content: We are here now, until Saturday. check in was fine, and we were offered the 63rd (top floor) up grade for $20 per night. I had read previous reviews on here so i was well aware of that offer. Im actually quite disapointed, there are things missing , which should not be for a 5 star hotel. The "bar" is just a mini fridge with way overpriced drinks in, there is no C/D player and the "suites" are really studio rooms. We went down to check the breakfast out and the prices are way, way over the top, especially for vegas. I dont mind paying a bit over the top, but these prices are little short of outrageous. There is a Dennys a couple of mins up the road , so we have been using that. maybe, ive been spoilt by previous places i have stayed in. The room was not serviced on our return at 5pm. I think the casino is nice and the drinks ect are presented well. Also, i dont think much of the signs by the lifts to the "suites" stating you are not allowed to take your own drinks and food to your room!!! Beware, also, there is a resort fee attached to the Wynn properties now too.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: VegasPaul
Reviews.Content: 14th June and off to Encore at Wynn.We booked through Wynn website at a very good rate of $119 a night with $50 resort credit.Get to checkin and line was about 1 minute.Room was not ready untill 3pm.Left bags with Bell Desk.Went to look around Encore hotel.Encore is smaller than Wynn but still a beautiful hotel.Now 3pm and off to pickup keys.Room was on 14th floor .3 hotels and all on 14th floor.How spooky.On entering room we both said how elegant it was.The Bell Hop came with the bags and asked if everthing was ok with room.The drapes would not open with the remote control.He phoned to Maintenance to report this and left.5 mins later a guy came to fix drapes.Fix was simply a cog in motor at the top of drapes.He noted how warm room was and checked filter in aircon vent.It was covered with dust so he went off to replace this with a new one.Within minutes the room chilled down .Excellent service from this guy.Everthing about Encore and Wynn shouts quality.The girls who serve you drinks on the Slot Machines to cleaners who say good day to you.You will note how much food prices has gone up all over Las Vegas.It is not cheap anymore.Went to Wynn Buffet to use our room credit.As we were staying at Encore we showed our room key to book the buffet and we were allowed to use VIP line.30 mins wait down to 1 minute.Food was excellent.Overall experiance at Encore was brilliant.Just a word of warning about Encore.The new Beach Club has opened and along with XS Club so expect noise to be heard in rooms lower down.We could hear XS Club beats playing. Wynn and Encore now charge a resort fee.Would stay here again if price was right.

Reviews.Title: “One Really Gross Moment, Otherwise Good”
Reviews.Author: HuntingtonBeach
Reviews.Content: The good: Nicely appointed rooms, true HD on the TV, big bathroom, convenient parking The bad: Slow service, a daily charge for internet, weak air conditioning The ugly: Housekeeping missed a pair of dirty underwear in the ice bucket We met some friends in Vegas for the weekend. They stayed in the Wynn, we stayed in the Encore. Encore rooms are a little newer/bigger. The two hotels are connected via a five minute walk through a shopping area. The room was well planned. It had nice touches like power operated drapes, a good sized plasma TV with real HD in the main area plus another TV in the bathroom, a tub big enough for two adults, and a "Privacy" light you could activate from the bed. We were getting ready to settle in for the first night when I grabbed the ice bucket to bring some ice back to the room. That's when I noticed a pair of soiled underwear in the bucket from the prior guest. I called the front desk, and I was told they would send someone "right up." Forty five minutes later (it's almost midnight by now) someone shows up with an ice bucket. It's bad enough housekeeping missed the underwear but getting the ice bucket should have been a 10 minute wait, even if it meant grabbing one out of an empty guest room. Not what I would expect from a hotel that touts itself as one of the best in Vegas. Not much else went wrong, but the underwear in the ice bucket was a doozie. I'll come back on a discount, but no way at full rate. Tips: -There is a Walgreen's just north of the hotel. Exit via the valet area and head north one light. It's a good place to buy water, sunscreen, booze, etc. -The Encore parking structure is on the north side of the Wynn/Encore property. -The Saturday brunch is good but overpriced at $32/person. -The sportsbook at the Wynn is really weak, with poor ventilation and only a couple of small HD displays (there are a bunch of large displays, but they are SD). A much better option is Lagasse's Stadium at the Palazzo right next to the Wynn. Aria's sportsbook is also nice but much further away.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property that is unlike any other property and delivers on 5 star resort promise”
Reviews.Author: CarinGalletta
Reviews.Content: The Encore hotel at the Wynn was an eye opening experience for a hotel casino in Las Vegas. It is intimate (compared to other properties) completely upscale and feels like a real resort that I would want to spend more time. When we return, we will stay at the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Encore new favorite Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: D.B.1976
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas several times over the last decade. Although there are a few hotels I would like to try at some point, I may not make progress on that list if the price is right for the Encore/Wynn. We got a terrific deal by booking several months in advance and upon arrival got an upgrade to a panoramic room for only $20 per night. Best view I have ever had at a Vegas hotel - and may ever have in Vegas. 56th floor facing the south side. Pros - the property is visually incredible all over. Pool was great. Room was solid - better than the Venetian stay of a few years ago. Remote control shades and lights, the swivel TV and the nice bathroom. I liked the location. Even though it's on the north edge of the main strip, Palazzo, Venetian, Mirage and Caesars were an easy walk. We had outstanding dinners at Delmonico and Carnevino at Venetian/Palazzo. We also liked Grand Lux as a reasonable option for breakfast/lunch at Palazzo. Cons - we got a great rate and upgrade price but everything else was expensive, but that was expected. It felt a lot like our stay at Atlantis Paradise Island - $14 pool cocktails, $5 cokes, etc. There was also some weird smell in the hallway between the elevators and the room but that was it. Also be aware that the Encore Beach Club/Surrender is really loud and goes well after midnight. It didn't bother us but we could still hear it on the 56th floor. Overall, great room with an even better view. Got a lucky break from the recent heat wave in Vegas and left a few hundred up - makes for a good trip and a good review, but it was deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Encore is ok”
Reviews.Author: VancouverRickc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great- room is marvelous, noise from the "beach club" at 11 o'clock at night is a bit much

Reviews.Title: “The perfect creation; with one huge, glaring flaw...”
Reviews.Author: madlylovemegs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our stay at The Encore celebrating our one year anniversary. We arrived on a Wednesday and checked out on Saturday. We loved our room. We loved the vibe and crowd. We even came to love the garish, red decor after a couple of days. This hotel is superb, truly, with one (as we see it) fatal flaw. Most of the reviews cover the pros of this place (which I wholeheartedly agree with), so I just want to share the bad. Fast forward to our Friday night. We got back up to our room around 2am to discover someone had set up a DJ booth in the room next door. Wait, no that's not coming from any of the rooms, that's coming from the pool area. Oh, the club XS has taken over the pool and is blaring the most annoying and repetitive bass-pounding music in the world (like all other clubs on the strip do) OUTSIDE!!! My wife and I could not believe how loud it was from 27 floors up. Well, we are pretty heavy sleepers (we live within two blocks of a train) so we just tried to go to sleep. After more than a handful of false starts, we conceded to the fact that sleep wasn't happening. Called down to the front desk and was told the club will be open until 4am, and they could send up some ear plugs. We got our earplugs quickly, but they were not much help against the super low frequency of the protruding bass thumping. Even asked for an extended check-out time since we had to wait until 4am to get any form of solid sleep, but was denied. I'd sum it up like this: The Encore is like dating the perfect person, falling in love, then discovering they're a closet meth addict. Luxury and decadence can and do coexist in a beautiful way up and down The Strip; they were just never properly introduced at The Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Encore OUTSTANDING hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mchristie2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore for 13 nights from the start of June 2010. it was our 4th visit to Vegas so we knew what to expect and had stayed at the Wynn twice before. Check in was simple as we arrived at 8pm to be met with no queue and we were in the room on the 59th floor within minutes. Like the previous review i did notice during our stay that reception could get very busy around 3pm, with some queues. Room was amazing - view of strip 59 floors up and 2nd best hotel only to Upper Houses in HK. All the touches were there - controlled curtains and sheers, large sized bathroom with TV, large bath, great shower. Bed was amazing - large soft and sheets to die for, Everything was charged for expensively in the room....Internet was $14 but you can get free access in Pizza place in the Wynn shops. drinks etc are dear but you can ask for a fridge and then buy drinks, snacks etc for shops a mere 100 yards down the road. The Encore pool got quite crowded on days and the sunbeds were very close to each other. Played good music some days although on sat/sun it is like a rave with music way too - there was however free iced water. Out of all the hotels we visited this time walking about, the Encore (and the Wynn) were the grandest and least cheesy. We will definitely stay again, and it was quite nice that is was out of the way at one end of the strip and away from a lot of the mental goings on up the Strip. The restaurants in encore/Wynn are some of the best in the country - the food was amazing and we didn't have a bad meal all holiday. Fantastic shops for us and there is also a great mall opposite the hotel (Fashion Show Mall). If you get the chance to stay in Vegas and want some luxury then you need to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but too far to walk to get to center of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: rileyden
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice but not as nice as the Wynn. Encore is located at the far end of the Strip. Very quiet hotel, rooms were spacious, with formal red/black color theme. I usually enjoy walking but this hotel is just too far from everything. If I wanted to get out on the Strip, I had to either go through the Wynn Hotel, or go out throught the hotel's main entrance and walk approx 10 minutes just to go to Fashion Mall shopping center across the street. It was far too much walking even after getting to the bus stop because the nearest stop was at the Wynn Hotel. Although the Wynn is Encore's sister hotel, there was still a lot of walking to get between the two hotels before arriving at my room. In the future, I would stay closer to the center of the Strip. There is a lot of construction going on right now. Hotel did not really impress me.

Reviews.Title: “Only for the party animals so never again - too noisy”
Reviews.Author: ssenit
Reviews.Content: Just back after one week at the Encore and I have stayed at the Wynn hotel twice before. This time I had a 61st floor panoramic view suite which is 2 off the top. Firstly the suite is really nothing more than the Wynn Hotel and in some ways the furnishings are not as good. This trip was in 4 different hotels and I booked all suites for my 3 week trip but the facilities at the Encore were the poorest. The room was nice and the view was good but it lacks many of the facilities provided almost everywhere now. No free internet ($14 per day), no coffee maker, no fridge, and no waterprovided in the room even on arrival. I felt costs were being shaved all the time here even to the lack of secutity in the hotel caompared to my last 2 stays at the Wynn. It should be said this hotel is geared very much for the 20 and 30 year olds and the noise from the beach club and the night clubs on the site seems never ending. Even on floor 61 you get the thump thump from the poolside XS night club thill 4am for at least 4 night a week. Other people on lower floors must have been really disturbed and when the club comes out at 4am the noise moves to the floor corridors. I know Vegas at weekend is a bit of a zoo with drunks and noise but the Encore is particularly bad. When I complained I was ofered a rear room with a view of the derelict shops behind. From Friday to Monday the pool is jam packed and they have a DJ on who seems to think loudest is best. There is no escaping it and even with earphones on I could not hear my Ipod over the loud clubbing music blaring out of every bush in the area. From Tuesday to Thursday is is ok with only the non stop softer volume samba music. Drinking in and around the pool at weekends leads to everyone shouting to be heard above the music so the noise becomes even worse. It is a beautiful place but it is being wasted for those of us who are older and clearly we are not the market for the Encore. Staff even told us that when the XS comes out there is trouble with fights and over consumption of alcohol. Four years ago my wife saved th e ives of 2 girls who had slipped into the pool at the Wynn after taking too much alcohol in the afternoon heat. We were told that the hotel frowns upon overdrinking but the Encore takes this to new heights I am afraid. In summary, enjoy it from Tuesday to Thursday but don't go there Friday to Monday.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!”
Reviews.Author: OrganizedTourist
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family during Chinese New Year's. I thought it would be crazy packed but it wasn't too bad. The rooms were amazing! Bigger than the Wynn rooms since they are considered to be suites and much more spacious. I felt like I was in heaven the moment I stepped through the door. I never wanted to leave the room and we were in Vegas! We also had room service which the food was great and the service was impeccable. The decor is very similar to the Wynn so you'll see tons of amazing and beautiful waterfalls and flowers everywhere. The clubs and bars are also the best in town. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay there. It's my favorite hotel in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experience at Encore”
Reviews.Author: Phillytravler1
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Encore and it did not disappoint. I was in Vegas for business and this year I made sure to set aside a little more time to enjoy the property. I utilized the pools at both the Encore and the Wynn. Depending on what you're looking for, the Encore's pool is more lively and the Wynn, a little more laid back. If shade is a must, then the Wynn pool will be to your liking. This year I also indulged and treated myself to room service every morning. The room service is exceptional and reasonably quick considering the massive property that they are serving. Of course, this is Vegas and you'll have rowdy folks no matter where you stay, but for the most party, the rowdy crowd was kept to a low roar. The rooms at the Encore are spectacular and clean. I travel quite a bit and often I go back to properties a year later and they are showing significant wear and tear. I was concerned that this year's Encore stay wasn't going to be as lat year's. Not the case. There was some wear and tear on the carpeting in the public areas, but the rooms were fantastic. The Encore also has incredibly comfortable beds and the rooms are topnotch. I look forward to retuning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: swishLondon
Reviews.Content: Hi all We stayed at the Encore at the beginning of June 2010. Just to let you know, it was our first trip to Vegas, so nothing to compare it to. Check in - We arrived at 6:30 pm, and there was no queue for check in, which was brilliant. However, I did notice during our stay that reception could get very busy around 3pm, with some queues. Room - fantastic. I'm a bit of an OCD clean freak and didnt find anything wrong with it. Lovely view, button controlled curtains, nice sized bathroom with TV, large bath, shower. Comfy bed. They do charge you for everything though, no free internet or anything.. we didnt dare take anything out from the mini bar! Staff - we found all the staff we encountered very helpful and friendly, going out of their way to help. All the cleaning staff were lovely and all smiled and said hello if they passed you in the corridor. Pool area - agree with what some others have said, the Encore pool got quite crowded, and the sunbeds were very close to each other. Played good music though and there was free ice water. We preferred to sunbath at the Wynn pool, which is an air conditioned walk away through their esplanade. This pool was layed out better, and more chilled. Prices round the pools for snacks and drinks: $9 for a smoothie $14 cocktail $13 ceaser Salad $11 sandwich $10 tortilla chips and dips $4 kettle chips Out of all the hotels we visited, the Encore was the grandest and least tacky. We would definitely stay again, and it was quite nice that is was out of the way at one end of the strip. Although, as it was so hot, we had to get taxi's everwhere, which worked out quite expensive due to the amount of traffic lights! Good mall opposite the hotel (Fashion Show Mall)

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: treatmenice
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. I really shopped around and got a great deal for 5 nights here... the hotel and facilities blew me away. The room was amazing, the pools had great atmosphere, playing Craps by the over 21 pool was just so much fun... The weekend was so much fun... everyone was in the party mood, with music playing constantly through the hotel speakers... not too loud, and perfect for the atmosphere... Ibiza meets Vegas, then in the week... the music was more chilled out/easy listening... absolutely loved it here... can't wait to go back!! I only had one bad thing happen, and that was with the valet parking attendants who made my life hell, the first time I used it. I lost my ticket, but showed them my id, passport, driving liscence etc... room key... but they were having none of it! They were rather rude...(this was day 1!!!) But I didn't let it spoil my holiday! I never used valet park again... so that's a load of money I saved on on tips!!! And they lost out ... ha! Ah well... As I said before.... hotel was amazing... can't wait to go back! xxx

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: BarbieMD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the room was great, and everything was very clean. That being said, I would expect that from a 5 star hotel in Vegas. The service was terrible!!!! When we checked in, the man at the front desk was very rude. I wrote that off as one bad employee. The following morning, after I payed $15 for 24 hours of internet access, the internet was down for 1 hour. I called the front desk to get a refund, and the front desk manager answered the phone. She said there was a power line down, and there was nothing she could do about it and it would be back up in 5 minutes. Not only did she refuse to refund my $15, she hung up me. When my fiance called back in 15 minutes after the internet was still down, she said, "that little girl just called 5 minutes ago, and I told her there was nothing I could do." She again refused to refund the money, and said all she could do was extend our internet for 24 more hours. I ended up having to go to a friend's hotel room to use their internet to send my one e-mail for work. In Vegas you expect a beautiful hotel with exceptional service. I was extremely disappointed by Encore! Also, the pool is very small, and we had to wait 30 minutes before 2 chair opened up. Do yourself a favor, and do not stay at Encore!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For This Time In Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: michaelAlbertaCanada
Reviews.Content: As my title says i enjoyed this hotel.It all depends on what you want out of your vegas Trip. Was With My Wife and we wanted a great hotel close to my convention...We Got both ...is it cheap to eat...Hell no but we had done our research and knew the prices and what to expect.I dont understand with the internet how someone can complain about the price of a hotels food and beverage prices. Check in was fast and the valet was great and we used it lots...Had breakfast at the hotel and it was great twice we looked at the pool and then i had to try tableau...It was great and we both enjoyed it. We went to vegas loved this hotel and will return or we may try another property......

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kikiroo
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business conference so I tagged along for a little vacation. Having stayed at the convention hotel previously and not liking it, we decided to choose another hotel on the north end of the strip. We wavered between Trump, the Ventian and the Wynn properties. I'm really glad that we chose Encore. First of all, it's at the northern-most part of the main strip. Secondly, although the Wynn and Encore are still big hotels, they are by no means the behemoths that some of the other casino/hotel compounds have become. No big malls, and the in-house theaters are somewhat secluded. Both of these mean that it's quite a bit tamer than some of the more expansive properties. We like that, but if you're looking for super high energy, it might not be the place for you. The rooms are huge by hotel standards. The bathroom is three times the size of mine at home and had a separate toilet room, double sinks, shower and big soaking tub. The toiletries were the very nice, and the housekeepers were very generous in replenishing them. The room had a separate "living room" with a couch and desk. The "bedroom" was spacious and the bed was comfortable. Everything was extremely clean and still had a "new" feel. We were on the 35th floor facing north, and didn't experience any noise issues that others have complained about, even over the weekend. They claim to be a 5-star resort, but this is a little questionable only because there is little to zero as far as personalized service is concerned. All of the staff we interacted with were very nice and helpful, but at other 5-star hotels I've stayed at I'd always be greeted personally, and most times by name, I'd get turn down service, as well as a call in the room to make sure everything was okay. The lack of this didn't bother me in the least, since I prefer to be more of an anonymous guest (and I guess it would be awfully hard to do this with more than 2000 rooms) but when you're claiming 5-star I think this would be the expectation. I'm also not complaining too much because we got an awesome deal by buying a bundled air/hotel deal with one of the big online travel agencies. Everyone who is saying that you get nickeled and dimed is correct. Internet is $15/day, the gym is $30/day. The smallest coffee in the lobby (and it is pretty small) is $3.50. But you won't find anything different in any other quality Vegas hotel, so consider that the standard in town. I would definitely stay at the Encore again. It's our first choice for all future Vegas trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Mtownmac
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and I must say I was initially very disappointed. I got the room for a good rate but I was shocked by the incidental charges that they charge. Most hotels charge a nominal fee for incidentals but here they wanted to authorize $150 per night on my credit card and only after I complained did they accept $300 instead of the $750 they wanted. To top all of I requested a refrigerator and they wanted $25 per night for a small dorm fridge the probably only costs $75 or less at any Walmart. The hotel was aesthetically pleasing but that is were it ends. Everything is just extremely overpriced. I stayed at the Venetian two years ago and it was hands down better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, friendly staff, expensive restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: garyarch
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 night stay. Check-in on Sunday did take about 30 mins. Room on 57th floor was excellent. It was clean and very spacious.Staff everywhere was very friendly and helpful. There is a great coffee/breakfast bar outside the elevators on the ground floor with reasonable prices if you don't won't to pay $25 for a pot of room service coffee. No problem with taking food up to your room. Restaurants at Encore and Wynn have a special "Taste of Wynn" that provides a set price for a 3 course meal. Excellent food, service and menu items. Regular menu items run around $50 per entree. Fashion Mall across street has several good restaurants as well. Pool areas are very clean and plenty of room and chairs available. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “if you want a good night sleep, go some where else”
Reviews.Author: programdd
Reviews.Content: Just return from a 4 days stay from encore. My room was on the 56th floor with a great view of strip. The room is somewhat dirty at first. The tub look as if was used with muddy bottom. The TV remote was sticky with food residues. Since I don’t use the tub and TV remote was easily cleaned with a wet paper wipe, the above condition did not bother me. I am giving this hotel a one star because you would not be able to have a good night sleep at this hotel. The music from the newly opened night club surrender was so loud that even at 56th floor I was not able to sleep at all. The worst thing is the music stars at around 11 pm and last past 4 am. When complain to the hotel staff at 3 am, only solution they offered is some ear plug. Stay away if you want to sleep at all. Stay if you want to stay up all night and some free music.

Reviews.Title: “Fair - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Tschaller
Reviews.Content: The Wynn Encore and Wynn LV hotels are beautiful properties - a fantasy land really - at the end of the strip before the midtown area between the lv strip and downtown and there's not much around exept for the Riviera a two block walk in 105 degree heat and a Walgreen's almost adjacent. My best tip for the first-timer after staying there for two days and nights is to max out your amenities if you get any and ask a million questions at check-in because it will help you navigate the large properties. The crowd was very "las vegas" and not as high-roller as I expected when reading the reviews beforehand. Most people seemed to gamble periodically - but not much high roller activity that I could see. Throngs of people though the weekend after Memorial Day. Checkout bill was exactly as expected - no hidden surprises. Suggest checking out the mini bar when you first walk in the room - mine was missing a bottle of liquor (and they cost approx $9 each for the mini bottles) - there are signs that state your bags can be inspected before entering the hotel and no outside food or drink - but they do not enforce it - again too many people to realistically enforce this rule. So expect to pay $4 for a coke and $3 for a cup of coffee each and every time you want something to drink - that's a budget of $25 a day or so just to keep hydrated. No water fountains anywhere - suggest stocking up at the walgreen's immediately upon arrival. Lots of crazy people running trhough the walkways and restaurants - but it's Vegas. I suspect staying at the Palazzo across the street is very similar in quality for probably 20% less cost..Beuatiful mountain view if you request that side. It all depends on what you are looking to do in Vegas. Friendly staff overall. No complaints other than the crowds and location is very far from the major strip hotels area even the monorail is a mile+ away from the Wynn for some odd reason..

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: synergypro
Reviews.Content: Ive been to 10 hotels in vegas and never been treated like this. The staff constantly screwed up and was unapologetic for it. The AC in the rooms cannot cool the room to anything below 74 degrees ( according to the maintenence guy, this was a design flaw) The place is WAY too expensive for the quality of service . Very beautiful but i'll never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Memorial Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: zsazsa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Memorial Day Weekend. We arrived at 930pm Friday to a short line at check-in, we dropped our bags in the room and headed to the very busy Parasol Down bar at the Wynn, four drinks $75. + tip welcome to the Wynn. My husband and I had room 2420 with a great view of the pools and beach club. I didn't notice any noise from the nightclubs at night as others have reported , admittedly we were up very late ourselves. Everything was packed the casino, the pool, the bars and restaurants. We didn't go to the beach club but we did see the lines. Saturday morning we went to the Euro Pool from at the Encore and by 11 am there were no open lounge chairs. I agree with others, the Wynn's pools are much prettier. Kudos to room service as we pre-ordered a Vegan Birthday Cake and it was waiting in our room as arranged with no phone calls or anything required. Ate breakfast Sunday morning at Society Cafe, they have a bloody mary cart they push around and make they make your drinks in front of you right at your table. Wonderful. Novelty for sure, and it kept our mind off of the fact the service was really slow otherwise due to the crowds. Coffee was notably excellent. Decor in this cafe was great, loved the hot pink couches. Ate Sushi at Okada's on Sunday, I love it! The Okada roll is still as awesome as ever. Once again I love the atmosphere in here and the food was delicious and fresh , fresh ,fresh. Encore room was large , warm tiled floor in bathroom, nice seating area, wonderfully comfortable. I think next time given the choice I'd pick the Wynn to stay at vs the Encore. I like the pools better over their and found I spent more time on that side of the casino than the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Encore was great but the Goons at The Beach Club need to be fired!”
Reviews.Author: bambu5
Reviews.Content: The Encore at Wynn Las Vegas is a beautiful hotel. The service is a little slow, but they are so busy, the staff is non-stop and does a good job at handling all of the guests. We DO NOT recommend going to The Beach Club. After waiting 30 mins in line, one of the workers asked if we were guests of the hotel and when we said yes, moved us up into another short line. When the Big Goon Boss saw what he did, the poor guy got a total tongue lashing for showing hotel guests preference. When we tried to explain that we had purchased pre tickets to get in the club, we were turned away and told they were not valid!!! They told us to take them to another club in the hotel! They were extremely rude, and you could tell that they enjoyed throwing their weight around...that became obvious when they began to laugh as we walked away. KMA, Beach Club...you suck.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail superb”
Reviews.Author: chrsteele
Reviews.Content: The Wynn and Wynn Encore spare no expense. Attention to detail is excellent in all things from the music playing in the common areas, to the rich appointments, to food quality. Most of the places to eat are closer to the Wynn than the Encore and so it gets to be somewhat of a nuisance walking from the Encore area to the Wynn to eat, especially if it's a multiple day stay. Food prices are higher than the strip although quality is excellent. If you can get a discounted stay, it's worth a splurg.

Reviews.Title: “Average...”
Reviews.Author: jimbolee12
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Encore for our honeymoon on the 4th May 2010 and it was quite a way down the strip so it took us some hefty walks up and down the main strip to take everything in. I would have prefered to be more in the e e e middle i think. The Encore at first glance looks amazing and we loved the fact that it was very light inside compared to some of the other hotels but everyone is just so robotic in there. Everything seems scripted by all who work there. Ok so some of the bar staff were ok but thee were no great personal touches from the staff. We were on the 35th floor and my wife could hear all the music from XS till 3am in the morning. This needds to be taken indoors as they do in Europe as it's becoming a re-occuring theme in these reviews. We found that our towels were taken off the sun beds all the time by the pool staff and there were no regular cleaning checks on the pool...people would leave rubbish by their beds and it would end up blowing in to the pool, sinking and not getting dealt with. The cabanas and pool beds are $300 each and hardly ever used so they are just sat there empty for most of the days. I sat on a chair in the pool and got told that i had to move because it was part of the pool beds. I said i would move when someone got there but they still said no, it wasn't giveing out the right message. Low and behold it sat there empty all day. I personally prefered the Bellagio and would rather stay there for the money we paid. I would imagine the new costly Beachpool will create further noise and further noisy customers to the Encore. If Steve Wynn is wanting a hotel full of noisy stuck up yobs then he's going about it the right way. I personally wouldn't go back to this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but.....”
Reviews.Author: traveloverNj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights . I chose the hotel because it was pretty new and we had already stayed at many of the other "top" hotels in Vegas, wanted to try a different property. The location is good, but maybe a little bit too far down at the end of the strip. The rooms are gorgeous, decorated in light colors, extremely comfortable beds, and floor to ceiling windows with awesome views. The check in was a little out of control with people not knowing where the line ended or began. That seems to be normal for most of the Vegas hotels during peak times. The pool of course was VERY crowded, a real job finding an available lounge, and on the small side for the size of the hotel, lacked atmosphere and excitement, preferred the Wynn's pool ALOT more, which we used for our stay. Book early, you will get better rates if you want to stay here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “don't buy into all the hype, way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: heel
Reviews.Content: I had very high expectations but was diisappointed. We got suckered in by a competitive room rate but then you get nicheled and dimed but ten and twentied to death. If you want 4 cups of coffee in your room then it will cost you $ 16 plus 5 for room service plus 18% for gratituity. We did not find the service over the top. We found the place mostly understaffed. They have all the nice cushions surrounding the pool but it will cost you $300 to sit on them. They are all around the pool and sit empty.. I suppose if you don't care how you spend your money this hotel would be fine. I just had to let people know.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-but didn't exceed expectations”
Reviews.Author: birdie02
Reviews.Content: The Encore is by all means a 5 star hotel and our stay was great, but it didn't exceed my expectations as I thought it might. In their defense, it was Memorial Day weekend, so the 30 minute check-in, while inconvenient, wasn't suprising. The room was beautiful and the view was even more breathtaking. The pool was great, although the first day we had to wait a few hours before getting any lawn chairs. One of the staff was gracious enough to keep a look out and we eventually were situated and happy. So again, while it was a wonderful get away, it didn't blow us away. We were just happy to be on a mini vacation and Encore and Vegas provided us with what we needed to relax and unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing at best...”
Reviews.Author: gmc0531
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned today from a 5 night stay at Encore for our anniversary. Let me begin by saying that this was our 4th stay at Wynn properties but the first (and last) at Encore. Before our trip I read many reviews on Tripadvisor warning about the noise from the club XS. Upon check-in I made sure we had a Strip view room which was far away from the Club. What we didn't know is that our room was directly above the new Beach Club which is also a night club called Surrender in the evening. This weekend was the grand opening for these clubs and for Encore, it was a disaster. On the 35th floor, the music kept us awake until 5:00 AM. The crowd the clubs attracted was so rowdy that we actually had a stranger bang on our door screaming for us to open up at 4:30 AM. WHERE IS SECURITY??? The afternoon at the European pool was also extremely rowdy. There were at least two drunken groups of partiers that were removed from the pool area. Even the cocktail waitresses were getting abused. Maybe this was just all due to the holiday weekend but I really believe this property is heading in the wrong direction. I am not sure what Steve Wynn is thinking. We used to think Wynn was the best hotel on the planet. We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Worst 5* service experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Hunter_uk91
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many 5* hotels and the service experience received over Memorial day weekend was incredibly bad. Here we go (in chronological order): 1) Suites are supposed to be ready by 3pm for check-in. Our 2 tower suites weren't made available until 6pm on the day of arrival. 2) We went to the newly opened Encore beach club on the Saturday. When we checked our bill on check-out, there was a spurious $510 additional gratuity that had been added. When we queried the charge, it was reversed immediately without investigation. This suggests that it's a common event. That is shocking. 3) We reserved a table at the Encore beach club for the Sunday, This was agreed to be a $3,000 minimum spend the day before. On the Sunday, we stood in queue for an hour, despite having a table reservation. The hosts of the club were telling the table reservation line that groups would only be moved forwards if they tipped. Basically soliciting a gratuity. When I complained to the hotel, they said that the beach club was run by a separate company and there was little that they could do about it. Escalation proved ineffective. To make matters worse, the host at the beach club then said that the table was a $5,000 minimum spend. Essentially there were just trying to squeeze people as much as possible despite prior agreements. 4) We stayed in the tower suites on the 9th floor. The newly opened outdoor nightclub, Surrender was so loud that you could hear the music very clearly in the suite. They hadn't considered additional soundproofing. 5) Room service food took over an hour every time that we ordered. One time, we complained and were told that the food would be complimentary. When we checked the bill on check-out we had been charged. All in all, it was a disastrous weekend for the Encore. Their beach club is a racket where the Encore deny all responsibility by saying it's run by a separate company. Escalation within the Encore hotel management chain doesn't get you anywhere which means that the beach club continues to get away with it. The hotel management didn't come back to us with an explanation for any of the above points and I had to continually chase them for answers. Finally, the only thing that the management did for us was to reverse the $510 gratuity which shouldn't have been on the bill in the first place! Out of all the vegas hotels I have stayed in, I have never received as bad service as I received at Encore. I would recommend anyone to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond on almost every level”
Reviews.Author: Eddie_Zane
Reviews.Content: After the long, cross time zone flight, we arrived mid afternoon to a typically sundrenched Las Vegas and were grateful when we fell into the air-conditioned taxi quickly taking us to the Encore at the Wynn. The check-in desk resembled a train station ticket desk as bulging; luggaged queues were 8 deep as the many desk clerks furiously tapped into their consoles. On reaching the front we were given a very friendly welcome and gave our name. As the clerk entered our details she told us there were no King suites currently available as it was now just past 3pm and this was now the busiest check-in time but we could take a double Queen Suite or wait until a king became available up to which the hotel would call to notify. Having pre-booked a King suite we were a little annoyed one was not available and opted to wait. We were told we would need to come back to the room card collection desk once a room was ready. We decided to join the back of this queue and take a chance on a room becoming available as we were eager to shower, change and relax by the pool. On speaking with the new clerk and re-explaining we were on our honeymoon, he was able to offer us a free upgrade to a panoramic suite with strip view straight away which we immediately accepted! The room was amazing from the chez-lounge by the floor to ceiling windows, the bedside controlled electric sheer and blackout curtains to the double shower, deep sloped bath and super comfy king sized bed. The views were mesmerising with a prime position taken on the chez-lounge, my only gripe would be it faced away from the strip - but even then. Service was as Impeccable as you would expect from a hotel of this class with staff seemingly not able to do enough for you either when asked or if you passed them in the corridors. The European pool area is he place to head for if you plan to sunbath as the loungers are more evenly spread than the main pool where it's crowded. The pool bar and gambling tables are also situated there if you want to escape to the shade but still enjoy being outside. Drinks and poolside snacks equally are as expensive as you'd expect in Vegas with 2 mojitos costing around $30 (or 2 beers and a shrimp cocktail the same). With its Location further down the strip, there is a danger of feeling a little out of the thick of things but the Encore more than makes up for its decision to not be a themed hotel and once inside it really is a tough decision to ever leave and visit anywhere else. The television runs several Wynn infomercial channels, showing Steve Wynn talking you through the hotel, its facilities as well as its vision as a destination. With handfuls of restaurants, cafes, designer stores, bars and premier clubs there's plenty to keep those not wanting to lose it all on the gambling floor busy - after all every casino/hotel wants to keep you spending your cash with them for as long as possible. We ate at the Zoozacrackers - their take on a New York deli (not as good by far but a fair attempt). The pizza slice - another challenge on NY pizza (a pretty good alternative with really good pasta sauce). As well as their fine dining, multi award winning restaurant, Alex. The service here is impeccable, from the greeting at the door to being shown to our table down the grand staircase to the waiting staff. The sommelier found us a great bottle of red to match our meagre budget without making us feel uncomfortable at having one! The food? Amazing, 5 courses ending with our Achilles heel of a cheese board and even our own congratulatory chocolate cake to mark our honeymoon. Both my wife (stil not used to calling her that!) and I had always said if we ever returned to Las Vegas, we would want to stay at the Wynn but as we researched further we found the Encore to be more to our taste and design. Once there, we were more than satisfied with our choice as while the Wynn is a lovely hotel with a better pool and cabanas (just choose your spot with care as larger sections do fall into shadow early afternoon), the Encore benefits from a seemingly different agenda with less gambling tables, higher ceilings and more windows allowing for natural light (a Vegas no-no to have any indication on time). All in all a great place to stay, on the strip but far enough away for a little more peace and a great representation of the new breed of Las Vegas hotel/casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: nuviBlumenau
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Wynn in 2008, and I really prefer it. I think Encore doesn't have personality, it is just an extension of Wynn. But much worse. The casino and the pool area are so small.There are no options to casual dinning. The hotel is under construction. The location is not the best. The services are so expensive. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place I'll Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Stajo12
Reviews.Content: No reason to go anywhere else. Encore is worth every penny. The casino is intimate and sun-lit, the rooms are comfortable and well-appointed, the linens are perfectly soft and smooth, the staff are professional and friendly. Had the most gorgeous view ...

Reviews.Title: “Simply fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: trayolfc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first week of May, 8 ladies celebrating a 60th birthday. We loved it and had 3 rooms. 1double 2 triples. Rooms- We booked Resort Suite and asked for them to be together but as we arrived late on the Saturday night and it was full we got allocated 2 connecting on the 14th facing downtown and 1 on the 11th which overlooked the pool. One triple had a foldaway and the other triple (11th) had 2 queen beds. (Apparently this is usually an upgrade as most rooms are king as standard). The 11th (mine) was one huge big room; the 14th rooms had the separate sitting area. This was best in my opinion. I wanted to watch the Liverpool v Chelsea game at 5.30am on the Sunday. I enquired on check in and reception made a phone call and advised that Sportsbook in the Wynn was open 24/7. I walked across and checked, 4 guys in total assured me it would be on. We all unpacked and went to bed as we had been awake for 36hours!!!! But no chance of sleep as the noise from XS nightclub was unbelievable. At 5 I went down to the Wynn Sportsbook and it was CLOSED!!! Knackered and not happy I was informed that it’s never been open 24/7!!!! Anyway after 5 various staff members later (who were all very helpful) they got it on a screen for me in the Poker Room. (Shouldn’t have bothered, we got beat 2-0) My room mates at least grabbed some sleep as the music had stopped after 4ish. On Saturday they have the pool open which is why it’s so noisy but it was fine for the next 6 nights with no noise. Pool- Lovely, free iced water and towels available, terrible really loud club music on the Sunday (thought I was in Ibiza) fine other days. We’re not doddering old fogeys by the way, as the club in the Mirage would testify, but the Encore is very geared to the really young at the weekend. Society-went twice, great food and they made the birthday girl feel really special especially the cake with her name drizzled in chocolate sauce. Tip- A travel kettle is a must, I was Mrs Popular for bringing this. Deposit- yes they DO require a CC on arrival but I gave mine, we never charged anything to the room so nothing was charged. It is just a hold for anyone bothered about this. Turn left out of the hotel and 5 mins away is a cash machine is in the liquor store and only $2 charge. Handy for your wine and spirits for the room, just get the ice from down the hall. No problem with that from staff etc. Also few cheap diners like Peppermill which was great for a really good value breakfast. Wallgreens for coke, snacks etc Great trip, great hotel. Feel free to ask any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Really luxury and good service”
Reviews.Author: Foggtraveller
Reviews.Content: Great modern hotel with friendly staff , who were happy to help. We have just returned from a ten night stay at the Encore, Las Vegas. It was our first visit to this hotel and we has high expectations (as it was fairly expensive in comparison to our normal budget. ) Like most of the hotels on the Strip you need to look beyond the gaming: It had top class rooms, the most comfortable nights sleep I have ever had, beautiful pools with comfy sunbeds and swish restaurants ( but they are not cheap) . Luckily, we had a penthouse room on the 63rd floor with views of the Strip ..fantastic. Although it costs extra I would also recommended a day pass for the gym and spa just for the experience. You may not realise that you can aslo use the Wynn's pool facilities and they are great too.

Reviews.Title: “Making this an annual getaway... Marvelous!”
Reviews.Author: RodSantaRosa_CA
Reviews.Content: Three night getaway for our anniversary - turned into an experience we plan on making an annual event! Out panorama suite on the 58th floor (not really that many floors though!) was wonderful - with the floor to ceiling windows, mechanical sheers and shades, mood lighting from a bedside switch allowing for constant ambience adjustments - bright to romantic... perfect. Luscious bed, high ceilings, mirrors (!) and impeccable interior furnishings and accessories creating a wonderful home base to return to. Thankfully, in spite of being used to a California smoke-free existence, we found the casino/public areas were virtually smokeless in terms of smell. The restaurants were superior in every regard - from Wazuzu's twists on asian cuisine (we went twice!) to Botero's succulent steak to Daniel Boulud's impeccable French bistro offerings. Kudos to the concierge who secured a waterfront table for two outdoors at Boulud affording a front row experience of the water/light show. And then the spa experience... off the chart. From an incredible well-equipped Fitness Facility to the indulgent spa - faultless locker room, sauna, steam, rainforest showers, and hydrotherapy pools of four different temperatures. Add to that heated stone chaises to lounge on and a library/club environment in which to unwind. I went twice a day! Both my wife and I booked spa treatments - again, an "otherworldly" experience - especially when being escorted into the main hall adjacent to the treatment rooms. In the four days, we left the hotel only once - to shop at the Fashion Show mall across the street. Le Rève was an outstanding experience as well. We are not travel writers, but simply a couple seeking a 26th anniversary getaway. Our experience of the Wynn Encore was truly outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely beautiful hotel, more than we ever hoped it would be”
Reviews.Author: Millie66
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation at the Encore last year and having read the reviews we were excited to be staying there. The hotel did not disappoint from the moment we arrived the reception staff were excellent, the rooms were amazing - the most comfortable beds without question, along with a fabulous bathroom what more could you want. The hotel is linked to Wynn via a walkway which houses amazing shops, there are also plenty of restaurants to choose from including an array of deli's and 'cheaper' eats to wonderful restaurants with world class food. What particularly inmpressed was that the restaurants were not over priced hence we ate in either Wynn or Encore during most of our stay. The pool area at both hotels is again pretty special with plenty of sun lounges, the European pool area is a fun addition which appeals to varying age groups - particularly fun during the weekend. I would definintely recommend both Wynn and Encore, we have never stayed in the same hotel during our many visits to Las Vegas but these hotels have really swayed us to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with little promotions”
Reviews.Author: tuck113
Reviews.Content: we spent 3days in vegas at the encore hotel our room was wonderful and the food was great but,after spending @4000 for 3days we have not recieved any promotions.guess are next stay wont be at the encore!!

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed with the Encore!!”
Reviews.Author: 1967denisetennis
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at the nicest hotels, Four Seasons, Pennisula..etc. In the past we stayed at the Bellagio and it was great.,but I was concerned that it was in need of a renovation. When I booked the Encore I was concerned about the location. Well I'm thrilled I booked the Encore, yes it is at the end of the strip, but the bus is not too far and there is always a taxi in the front. We were so glad to come back to the Encore after being out, it is crazy further down the strip and the Encore was an Oasis compared to the other hotels. You can't smell the smoke in the casino, the rooms are awesome. I would recommend upgrading to a strip view it's worth it. We carried in some food and water and nobody stopped us. The pools are beautiful and we always got a chair, but you have to get down there by 10 to get a good one. Can't wait to go back!!! The buffet at the Wynn is also amazing! Couldn't find a bad thing to say.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, wonderful stay with only one negative”
Reviews.Author: horadam1
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property in Las Vegas(probably the nicest hotel in town!) The only reason why I didn't give it "5 stars" is because there was a pool incident which irritated me. The pool is supposed to open at 8am. On Saturday morning the pool didn't open until 8:45am because there was partying the prior evening and the pool people were cleaning up the mess. The problem is that several people were waiting for the security people to allow us to enter the pool area. As soon as we were allowed to enter the area everyone was in such a rush to get a chaise that an older gentleman slipped and hurt himself because the ropes were not removed properly. This kind of thing reminded me of something that would happen at a 2 or 3 star property. Onto the positives: the ambience is gorgeous, the bed is heavenly, the food is delicious, and the casinos do NOT smell like smoke. The service was also excellent. The wait staff were courteous, the dealers were friendly, and maid service was very efficient(no turndown service which I thought was strange for this caliber of hotel), and the room service was timely. After visiting the other properties, I know that I will return to the Encore or Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: AngelMel
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I traveled to Viva Las Vegas because that's what one is supposed to do when celebrating a 30th birthday! I had previously stayed at the Wynn with my husband, and loved the hotel, so decided to return for my friend's celebration that I planned. Four of us shared one of the suites at Encore, and we absolutely loved it. The rate was descent, and we stayed there more for location and amenities in the hotel, i.e. pool and club access. Our suite had a nice sized sitting area with a lot of mirrors, which is perfect for a group of girls getting ready, and two very comfortable double beds. The room was quiet, very clean, and decorated well, and had a gorgeous view of the city. The bathroom was a nice size, and the shower was fantastic. If you are traveling on a budget, I probably would not suggest the Encore. However, if you want a great location with multiple amenities, and comfort, I would certainly suggest Encore. Yes, you will probably encounter some snooty attitudes, and paying $15 for a bloody mary at the pool is not easy to swallow, but if you want a certain atmosphere, then the Encore is the place for you. Get to the pool early, seats are taken quickly, and make friends with one of the pool attendants. It was a great girls' weekend, and in fact, we will be returning this September to celebrate my 35th post-baby birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms... but Expensive and No Outside Food/Beverages in your Suite”
Reviews.Author: yobigjoe
Reviews.Content: Been to both Encore and Wynn before and enjoyed the stay. On this recent visit to Vegas I was traveling alone and I noticed something that bothered me. As I was carrying up my dinner and drink to enjoy in my suite, I noticed a sign that read something like - "No outside food or alcohol permitted in your suite". Huh? Too late. There is no way they can enforce that one so why even bother with the signage. Steve, I'd be OK with that if you can price your food and drinks accordingly. I'm sorry, but I'm not paying $30 for a "Wynn breakfast" (that doesn't even include the "service charge" or tip). I did pay $5.50 for a latte at the lobby bar and that is the most they got out of me for food and drinks. The room is amazing, the place is beautiful and the spa facilities and gym are top notch. They just need to work on offering their guests reasonable pricing for food and beverage and then I would return.
