On a side note, I had booked a Strip View but due to construction of the new Encore Beach Club I decided to opt for a pool view instead. The woman behind the front desk said not a problem "but there is an additional $25 charge for a pool view". Rather than argue I just paid it... just another sign of the times in Vegas I guess. BTW, I don't consider myself to be cheap, usually stay in 4 and 5 star hotels and don't mind paying for quality. But... when I feel as if I'm getting ripped off... that bothers me. Will I return to Encore/Wynn? Probably-- because the rooms and beds are the best in Vegas. I just won't be dining there.

Reviews.Title: “How Good Can it get”
Reviews.Author: Rich076
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the nicest hotel in Las Vegas it has all the great entaties that you would expect fram a Steve Wynn Hotel. Each hotel is better than the previous he started with the Mirage still a nice hotel, then the bellagio a very nice hotel, then the Wynn very nice now Encore this is far his best does he stop here lets hope not this is by far his best in every way only this missing is a great sports book on the hotel next door the wynn has a good one

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but pretentious and too far away from the action”
Reviews.Author: judik
Reviews.Content: i know 8i am in the minority with my less than glowing review buit it was my experience.it all started at check in which was lenghty and annoying.Long line to check in,room not ready.OK,i understand.Checked bags went to have lunch.Returned to get key-another line..The clerk wouldn't give me the key because i was not primary on the res.(I have the same last name and my credit card was used to secure room charges but i guess that doesn't count)so i had to change palces with my husband at the valet desk.Waited long for my bags.My husband faced another line to get the keys but some kind soul let him cut i.He was exasperated so the check in clerk rewarded us by giving him a lousy room on the 5th floor overlooking a roof.If i had picked up the key i would have requested something better,they probably knew that! The room was nicet,the bed extraordinarily comfortable.Didn't care for the furnishings - too modern.Soulless actually which is how i would describe Encore Steve Wynn may call it "refined" i call it boring, lifeless and overpriced All that would have been OK since really how much time do you spend at your base? But that was the problem for me.it is sooo far away from everything I am fit so I am used to exercise.But not walking miles in sandals that are not used to pounding the pavement.Everything we did required a 30 minute walk at least.I like having stuff nearby I got a great deal,not complaining about the price.But next time it is mid strip for me or the Venetian which i stayed on a prior trip and absolutely loved

Reviews.Title: “Quite Possibly the Best Hotel We've Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: PlainGirl
Reviews.Content: I wish I could remember our bellman's name because he set the tone for our exceptional stay at the Encore. He was so solicitious and informative. This man had obviously been trained to perfection and made us fall in love with the Encore like he seemed to be. The automation in the room, the amazing view of the Strip from the 57th Floor, the LCD in the bathroom, and the wonderful experiences at the pool, casino and restaurants all made us Encore loyalists.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely exquisite, over the top incredible birthday weekend at Encore”
Reviews.Author: pinkbrina2010
Reviews.Content: I just got back from an incredible weekend at the Encore. Anyone that has complaints about this hotel has no idea what they are talking about. Everything and anything you could possibly want in a 5 star hotel. The decor is exquisite, the staff is helpful, attentive, and friendly! We arrived at 10: 30 AM on a Thursday, the hotel stored our bags for us and we headed to the fashion show mall a mere 7 min walk. The hotel called us within the hour to let us know our room was ready. We had requested a higher floor away from the nightclub a couple of weeks beforehand, we were in room 3909, 39th floor facing the golf course, and a nice view of the hilton and some other hotels. The room had floor to ceiling windows, a great living area and the most comfortable bed in the world! The central control for the shades and lights is also a very convenient feature when you want to take a "disco nap". The European pool is an amazing experience, great music, there are always chairs available and the pool is just the right temperature. It isn't over the top partying, just a great way to spend the day under the sun with a couple cocktails and great music. The drinks are made well, the food tastes delicious and the poolside restaurant, Botero makes fabulous Ahi Tartar. The lobby bar at the Encore makes delicious Berry Berry Infusions and the bartenders were very accommodating, going out of their way to secure a HUGE delicious piece of chocolate for my birthday during the time I was born- 3:30 AM! The casino is not smoky, and the rest of the resort has a great smell too it, no stale smoke here! Also, there is a great breakfast at the Society cafe which also has free internet access. There is an additional free internet "kiosk" by the swim shop that lets you check your email and print out boarding passes etc. The maid service was great, our beds were always made, towels replaced, nothing disturbed or missing. The safe also fits a 13 in macbook comp btw. Lastly, the nightclubs are incredible, you will never want to celebrate anywhere else! Make sure to get on that guestlist because the line into XS spanned all the way into the Wynn from the Encore!!!! Overall a fabulous stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding-miss it already”
Reviews.Author: normandog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore May 9 thru the 14th. Was not sure how comfortable these two midwesterners would feel, but from start to finish we felt welcomed and well served. Ate breakfast at the Society Cafe in the Encore, and the Tableux in the Wynn. Very pricey, but well liked and would eat there again. Casino in both hotels are nice, CW is always available and pleasant. The concierge at the Encore was alwys pleasant and willing to anser any questions and help us out. Our room was on the 58th floor, facing the strip. Elevator service was always quick coming and going. The pools are lovely and loungers were readily available and comfortable. The only downside, and it is more of a personal issue, is their valet service. You walk out of the hotel, and have to walk down an aisleway, take an escalator down to retrieve your car. No fun if it is windy or rainning, which it did for two days. So, yes we would stay again. Can't wait to get another offer in the mail!

Reviews.Title: “Encore is simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: chango335
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to celebrate our 1st anniversary together so we decide to stay at the Encore hotel. It was our first time in Vegas, so we weren't sure what to expect........needless to say we will be coming back every year!! Everything about Encore was top notch. As soon as we arrived at the hotel, we received a complimentary upgrade to the Tower Suite section and stayed in their typical suite. The decor was fantastic...very luxurious and gaudy, which is something you expect in Vegas. The room was very modern, with luxurious accents. I loved the remote control that operates the curtains and lights. The bed was fantastic...it was so good, we almost slept through our checkout time! The service is fantastic...it was the first time I've ever been asked by room service if it was ok for them to come into the room (we've been to many 5 star hotels around the world and I have yet to see this). We celebrated our anniversary at SW Steakhouse- The Best Steakhouse we've ever been to. We had the patio seating that overlooked the Lake of Dreams and it was pretty much the most romantic meal we've had. We then decided to watch Le Reve, which was truly a stunning show....a MUST see! We also went to the pool area and were quite impressed as well...although we think it closes too early. My wife and I visited almost all the hotels around the strip and were not as impressed by them. We both agree that Encore/Wynn is the top hotel in Vegas...we will be staying there for years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be any better!”
Reviews.Author: IndyMex
Reviews.Content: Couldn't resist the oppulence and grandeur of the Encore and glad we didn't! Absolutely incredible property and service - great value too! Thought that location on the Strip would be a negative but excellent shopping and entertainment nearby. No negatives - have stayed at Bellagio and Paris - we think the Encore is superior! T

Reviews.Title: “Encore, encore!”
Reviews.Author: Cosmocal
Reviews.Content: My first time back to Las Vegas in over ten years. And, staying at the Encore really hit the high notes for a nice, short vacation. As everyone has commented, the casino decor will have you wearing sunglasses inside, but hey this is Vegas--where the more gaudy you are, the more you fit in! Everyone kept telling me how nice the place was, but when I got here, I wasn't so impressed--lots of color, especially red, lots of bling, deep deep bars with rows of impressive liquor, plush carpeting, butterfly motifs--just kind of what I expected from Vegas. It took me until the last day to really appreciate the Encore, because by then I've visited several other casinos and each time I came back, I felt a relative sense of serenity and relief. We registered at the Wynn, asked for as high a floor as possible and they put us on the 29th floor, without an upgrade. It turns out they have, I believe, three sets of elevators: one for fls 1-30, one for flrs 31-64; and another set in the other corner of the casino for the tower suites. The even number rooms face South, which will give you a view of the strip--the higher even numbers will have your strip view partially blocked by the Wynn hotel, and you will be closer to the XS nightclub, which can be quite loud when they open the pool area up to 4am. If you're the partying type, ask for low even numbers; if you're a light sleeper and staying over the weekend, ask for odd numbers so you're on the other side of XS. The suites(they're all suites) are the antithesis of Vegas--simple elegant lines, easy beige/black colors, comfortable functional, modern classic furniture, thoughtful amenities like automatic curtain/sheers, separate hand showerheads, bathroom tvs, and a swivel flatscreen for bed and living room viewing. Service was prompt and professional: being addressed by name by hotel operators; we were missing a remote, and within minutes a short tuxed fellow presented us with a remote on a platter. It really was comforting returning to this hotel after a day of walking and sightseeing. The casino is muted, almost hushed tones compared to all the other casinos, and especially in light of its flamboyant decor. I don't like a lot of bells and whistles the rare times I gamble, so this was very pleasant and comfortable. Everyone was very professional and helpful, and seemed to enjoy where they work. Some cons: staying at the hotel doesn't comp you into XS, although they do let you cut in line if you pay full price. Nor does it help you cut in the buffet line. There is a fridge ONLY for their beverages, and food from outside is strongly discouraged, so what do you do with leftovers? You have to drive through the entire LV blvd to get to the hotel, so figure out some shortcuts. The pool closes early, but I guess all Vegas pools do so you'll go back inside and spend money. $15 a day for wireless. As we neared the end of our four day vacation without the lil guy, we were a little sad to leave, but our stay here does make me want to return back to Las Vegas for another vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, service backs up the excellent facility”
Reviews.Author: dave9956
Reviews.Content: Coming from three nights at the Aria, we were very happy to arrive at the Encore. From the minute we arrived, we felt welcome at the Encore. Staff was friendly, from check-in, to housekeeping, to the dealers. Food at the Wynn was excellent. Room was comfortable and clean. No comparison to the suites at the Aria. Encore is the winner for us in Vegas. Excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Encore!!!! We arrived around...”
Reviews.Author: hagen007
Reviews.Content: Love the Encore!!!! We arrived around midnight Friday night. We had booked through travelocity and they wanted to put us on the 10th floor. We upgraded to the 63rd north floor. As was stated on the other reviews, the rooms are fab! The room was smoking optional and eventhough the smell wasn't terrible, I could smell it. I called and the front desk said they could move us to a lower floor but we wanted the view. Housekeeping came right away and sprayed the room and it was very acceptable. The next night they upgraded us to the 59th floor facing the Wynn. The air was still and we could here the nightclub but not bothersome. The third night it was windy and no noise from the club. Everything is top notch. It is fun to dress every evening for fun in the casino. Even though we are not high rollers, I certainly enjoyed the five star treatment we received from all the staff. Ate at Stratta the fries are excellent! The Wynn buffet was exceptional, as well. It is only a short walk over to Denny's where there is a great staff of hard working people. Fast and tasty food and free wi-fi!!! You can even pick up a newspaper on the way. We loved everything about the Encore and can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Steve Wynn has excelled yet again!”
Reviews.Author: Louchalmers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore for 7 nights in Mid april 2010. Having stayed at the Wynn, we expected high standards from the Encore and were not disappointed. We were in a resort suite (Standard room) which was lovely. Very similar to the rooms in the Wynn but slightly bigger and a different colour scheme. The Wynn resort beds are the best you will ever sleep in. So comfortable, you can even buy one form the hotel! We did find Vegas generally alot more expensive that when we were there in 2007, partly due to the exchange rate. The restaurants in both the Wynn and Encore are to a very high standard, expect to pay a premium though with a glass of wine costing $14+ and approx $24 + for a main. The encore seems to be slightly more chilled than the Wynn, especially around the pool. However, if you are staying in the Encore you can still use the Pool at the Wynn, which is crazy at the weekend (think high class Ibiza!) They even have a DJ by the pool! We saw Le Reve which is outstanding, well worth doing the VIP package. And can also highly recommend David Copperfield at the MGM (if he is still there). We would also recommend Maverick Tours if you want to see the Grand Canyon. We have used these twice now and although they are pricey they only take small groups and are worth paying the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Encore/Wynn review”
Reviews.Author: SasaMommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Vegas at least once a year. We stayed at the Encore last Sep. and at the Wynn in Mar. Overall everything was up to or exceeded our expectations. We had stayed in almost all 5* hotels in Vegas over the years and we highly recommend the Encore for a number of things. In the lobby/casino area, it's not as smokey as Wynn or other hotels. So it's excellent for non-smokers or ppl with allergies. Everywhere is exceptionally clean. Our suite was spacious. Love the bathroom. We went to the Society Cafe multiple times during our stay at the Encore, and again when we stayed at the Wynn. The food is amazing, and service is excellent. And the price is reasonable too for what you get. For breakfast, we went across the street to the Fashion Show Mall. There is a Starbucks, near the Half Price Tix office. There are two ABC stores inside the mall for you to buy water and other grocery items. The pool area at Encore is also one of the best. For those who have never been to Vegas, you may find these hotels a bit far from the centre of the strip if you intend to walk around to explore. In that case, I would recommend the Bellagio. It was also under Steve Wynn, and it was the best hotel on the strip a few years back. You'll like it. Overall, great experience at the Encore/Wynn. They spare no expense in buiding these two hotels and the qualify really shows through.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beachbum1Toronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I go every year to Vegas to celebrate our anniversary. We went in August of 2009 and the fact that I booked again this year reminded me to write a review. Check in was smooth and quick, we were early but our room was ready so we didn't have to wait. The rooms are spacious, clean and very luxurious. The beds are the most comfortable that I have ever slept on. The view of the strip was incredible. During the day we stayed at the european pool. Poolside service was excellent. The drinks were incredible. Quality and quantity was great. The service at SW Steakhouse was great. I had the best steak ever. We also had the good fortune of getting a booth at the Encore Night club on a Saturday night and partied till 4am. We just booked today for August and can't wait!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “$400 for a place to sit at the pool?? Are you serious???”
Reviews.Author: JacknJill2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful! The rooms are very nice!! The pool is ridiculous!! I have never stayed at a hotel and had to pay $400 to sit on a lounge chair! One would think that a chair at the pool was an ammenity that was offered. We got outside by the pool at 9:00 am and there was not one "free" chair available. The staff was not accomidating when iI complained. They said the only options were to rent a cabana or a lilly pad. We decided to rent a lillypad for $400 on Friday. On Saturday, the price of the lilly pad went up to $500. We refused to do that again so we spent our whole day sitting on the concrete around the pool!!! Not my idea of 4-5 star hotel. Will definately be staying at the Bellagio from now on. They are much more accomidating and when you walk out to the pool they have staff glad to set up chairs for you for no charge!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean, customer service, first class hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Oldbikers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I received an offer of $99/night plus $150 free play a couple of months ago and made our reservation immediately even having stayed at other Vegas hotels twice a year for years and receiving comp rooms at some of them. We liked everything about Encore and if Encore/Wynn send us simular offers in the future, we will stay there every time in the future. "Thanks Encore for the excellent customer service and giving us one of our best vacations ever."

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Encore”
Reviews.Author: saoneal
Reviews.Content: Everything was stellar. I personally prefer more themed hotels (i.e. the Venetian, Paris, etc) but my family prefers the more luxury, ritzy feel with less theme and more class. The hotel was excellent, staff was accommodating, and everything was great! One thing: Beyonce was coming to the Wynn a week after when I was staying. So she was EVERYWHERE! and there were tv screens playing clips of her songs 24/7. It didn't really make me want to go to the concert. It kind of made me want to never hear her again, actually..

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever for the price!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessConsultant86
Reviews.Content: Instant charge for room rate $200 per night (discounted for tradeshow rate) plus $150.00 incidental charge per day so extra $600.00 for stay. Room service was called twice to pick up food from dinner, it sat in my room until I put it outside where it sat until I left the next morning. The entire hall smelled like old food. They did not wipe down the counters in the bathrooms when cleaning and did not do a great job there. Hallways smelled like wet dog when you got off the elevator. Food in all restaurants mediocre except for Society which was good. Gambling tables are all more expensive than other hotels. Check out was horrible. Tried to call service and just kept getting disconnected. Guest book says you can use their healthclub if you purchase a spa treatment, not true, you must spend $75.00 worth on spa treatments to get the healthclub kicked in. Hotel managers are rude and pompass, don't care about guests at all. There are so many other great choices in Vegas than the Encore. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: abotel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort property on the strip but isolated from the bedlam. Spacious,well appointed rooms,great facilities & choice of restaurants which are moderate to expensive. Shops are nice but quite pricey. Staff is outstanding. You can't go wrong with this choice!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: joelcohena
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great, even if you take the cheapest ones. It really makes you feel at Las Vegas! pleasure is unlimited. Great golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Encore - Is a Must!”
Reviews.Author: 30S0methingTraveller
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Vegas so wanted to do it in style and did we. The Encore is beautiful and the rooms are better than even in the Wynn very spacious and modern. We walked around many a hotel and didn't find anything to compare (although we didn’t see the rooms), if I go back it will be to the Encore. The hotel didn't allow strollers like many of the other hotels so it wasn't as congested as others and made for a relaxed atmosphere, which made the experience that much better. Don't get me wrong this hotel is expensive as is Vegas in general but you get what you pay for, the staff get to know you very quickly and are friendly and accommodating most of the gambling staff knew us on a first name bases which was brilliant. The clubs within the Wynn and Encore are some of the best in Vegas in Tryst and XS, but they don't interfere with the rest of the hotel which is great. We were stuck there during the Volcano crisis so couldn't get back to the UK but the hotel was very helpful and did what they could for us. Only down point was probably no free internet in the rooms which seems to be standard in most hotels you visit apart from that no complaints and would definitely go back again. Tip: If you gamble whilst at the Encore make sure you hand your room card in so they can record your playing time it can bring benefits later in the week with free shows etc etc (see the casino hosts)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: mmsull2
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying I am not a big fan of Las Vegas. I am far from one of those people who gets excited by the glittering lights and chiming of slot machines. However, the Encore definitely helps me enjoy the experience. Overall I really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms were well appointed and large by Las Vegas standards. The views with the floor to ceiling windows were great. Although everything in the hotel is expensive, even by Las Vegas standards, in my opinion it is worth it. The hotel is right on the Strip, but it feels far away from it all. The pool area is great (as are the poolside pina coladas!). This hotel is probably the only place I'd stay on the Strip. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: mehinco
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Encore are very luxurious., Great big bathroom with whirlpool tub and separate shower. The bed is very comfortable. There are controls by the bed to open and close the drapes and request privacy or room service. We ate dinner and the Sinatra restaurant and it was great. Also, Le Reve is a great show, we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: footballfanOntario
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, as well as my 3 brother in laws and their wives stayed at Encore at Wynn. The entrance was okay but not as impressive as we were led to believe it would be. The rooms were nice, but not cleaned very well. The pools were nice, however we had rented cabanas for 4 days and the encore cabana service was terrible. We waited an hour for our server to come back with our drinks, so we started ordering from the regular wait staff which only upset our hostess and she pretty much stopped asking us if we wanted anything else. Our rooms were not cleaned in the morning but late afternoon. Overall, it was just okay of a stay. For the same amount of money consider staying at Wynn(awesome pools and service) or Palazzo were we stayed last year. We all agreed that we would never stay at Encore again.

Reviews.Title: “Encore spoiled me for other hotels”
Reviews.Author: gotmilk8
Reviews.Content: I love hotels, and since I've stayed in a lot of them, it's been a long time since I was surprised by one. I pre-registered in the morning, which took a surprisingly long time with all of the information they ask for, i.e. address, email address, etc., but then I left my phone number and they called me around 1:30pm to let me know I could check in. When I came back, the line was pretty long, but I think I only stood in line for maybe 10 minutes. I was upgraded to a panoramic suite, strip view on the 56th floor in the tower suites. The room was gorgeous and I can't think of a detail that was overlooked, from the doorbell, to the controls for the lighting. They brought my bag up quickly, and showed me the features in the room, and two days later the guy who brought my bag said hello to me and referred to me by name. That was pretty impressive, and a nice touch. I booked through Amex PTS, and received breakfast both days and lunch one day through the package, and it ended up being a good deal. The pools were nice, and you have access to the 2 pools at the Encore and the pool at the Wynn. The dishes at the restaurants I ate at were fresh and delicious (albeit very expensive), and the service everywhere was impeccable. I thoroughly enjoyed my trip and I'm itching to get back there ASAP. The only bad thing I would say about the hotel was that the gym was $30/day or a three day pass for $75. That's way too high especially when much cheaper hotels offer that service for free.

Reviews.Title: “A bit Overrated”
Reviews.Author: nikkix2010
Reviews.Content: My bf and I just got back from our trip from Vegas, and we stayed at the Encore. We made reservations through Expexdia, so i called the hotel to make sure we were getting the rooms we wanted, At first they had us on level 38 which we wanted to be higher so the rep told us it would be an extra $25 a night to upgrade.. WOW thats all. NOPE we get there and they tell us that they want a $300 deposit for everynight "just in case" we use any of the services in the room. HAHAH $300 that would mean we are letting them hold $900 for what??? Well we finally talked to the manager and he said ok $150 for the 3night.. ok much like it!! We get to the rooms, and the view is nice, but it is typical hotel room. Tub was too small for both me and my bf to fit in at the same time. BEDS were great though. VERY COMFY. The first mornings breakfast, we pay $73.00!!! I ordered the french toast with a side of eggs, and my bf ordered the eggs bacon sauage and toast meal... Was not cooked all the way, was cold, and a glass of orange juice $6.. yikes. The place is nice but it def has flaws to where it is not "in our book" something to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway Spot”
Reviews.Author: Sassypants01
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of other couples & we rate the Wynn as one of our top choices for where to stay in Vegas. It's far enough past the insane masses to be perfect. The room was beautiful & well appointed. The sheets...oh those sheets! 3 of us used the Spa & thought it was incredible. The crowd wasn't frat boys which is KEY to having a good time. Simply put, it was just a classy place with great service. Casino was a big hit with the guys & shopping was incredible for us ladies. It was our first Wynn stay & we will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Refined Glitz”
Reviews.Author: lmgreen
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at this mega hotel. Everything ran smoothly from check in to check out. The staff, waiters, maids all did their work properly and efficiently. The choice of food and restaurants was infinite. After a large breakfast , there was no need to eat until sunset. We had a strip view room on the 60th floor ( really only 50 floors up due to the superstition of no floors in the 40's) with the lights of Vegas at our feet - quite magnificent. The rooms are all mini suites with all the modern conveniences. The casino is relatively quiet which had no importance for me. Overall - a 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent & Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: acdublin1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Encore in Las Vegas for three nights and it was exceptionally good. We had our doubts because of some of the reviews here on Tripadvisor. It seems a lot of the hassle in these huge Vegas hotels come if you need someone to serve you when you have an issue (lost keys, problems with rooms etc). Fortunately we had no problems like this. The rooms were outstanding - huge tub, 2-person shower, great flatscreen tv, big living area, great beds - the Encore is newer than the Wynn so if you want you modern luxury this is the one to go for. We ate breakfast at the Wynn buffet and it was worth every penny of the $19.95. If you're going to stay here work hard at finding a deal - we got a huge reduction on standard rates that made it incredibly reasonable. One caveat: it is on the Strip but it is not central Strip at all. To walk to the Bellagio, for example, takes close to half an hour from your room. We didn't mind but be prepared to walk a bit if you want to be out of the hotel. Also, these are BIG hotels, you'll be disappointed if you expect anything by way of personal service. Also, having to pay 14.95 a day for Internet is a scandal in 2010! Otherwise, definitely visit the Encore. It's fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “The Encore was an excellent vacation!”
Reviews.Author: kathywisconsin88
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Encore and it did not disappoint! I had read the reviews on this site and kept that in mind. I did not have any trouble with check in. The service was outstanding. The layout of the Encore makes it easy to find your way around. We did not take the $20 room upgrade and our room was beautiful. It was spacious and the bathroom was great....double sinks, large shower and bathtub, nice toiletries and robes. We did do a lot of walking because the Encore is further down. We went to the Fashion Show Mall quite a bit for happy hours and restaurants. Maggiano's italian rest. is a must! The portions are HUGE so share or order from the appetizer menu! We went downtown to Freemont street to the Golden Nugget. Fun gambling and ate at a really nice steakhouse called Vic & Anthony's...surprisingly elegant and the food was amazing! Overall, I enjoyed our stay at the Encore and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely first-class in every way”
Reviews.Author: Trekman
Reviews.Content: In the past twenty years or so I have stayed at 10 different hotel/casinos in Las Vegas, including high-end properties such as the Bellagio, Caesars Palace, and the Venetian. I have to say that my recent three day stay at the Encore surpassed all of those previous experiences in every way. When you stay at the Encore you also can experience the Wynn hotel which is just next door. The two properties are connected by an enclosed and very plush shopping esplanade which is a pleasure to stroll through. I booked a 12th floor resort king suite at a special slot club rate of only $99 a night and what a great deal for absolutely the best hotel room I have ever stayed in in Las Vegas. The room was huge, divided into a sleeping area and a lounging area, with a giant 46" LCD which could be rotated to be viewed from the bed or the sitting area. Everything in the room was well-designed and high quality, from the furnishings to the comfy bed with premium mattress and bedding. Check in was very efficient and all hotel/casino staff were friendly and really seemed to like working there. I even has some good luck playing the slots at both Encore and Wynn. Only downside was a less than satisfactory dinner at their Sinatra restaurant. The appetizer and lamb chops were only average and way over salted for my taste. Much better dinners at the Stratta Italian Bistro and a really excellent room service experience. Overall, a very good experience at the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy”
Reviews.Author: Davidsad
Reviews.Content: I was in LV on business and took my wife along. The Encore is a high class hotel in every respect. The public areas are subdued (except for the constant, annoying music piped in everywhere - why?). Staff are excellent. The casino, although not smoke free, has a clean atmosphere and not the smell that one detects at other places. Even at night it did not seem crowded. Our room, a king suite, was spacious, quiet, and comfortable, with high end appointments. The location was fine for us: We walked 15 minutes to the Mirage for a show and to the Palazzo for dinner one night.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a nice place...will go again.”
Reviews.Author: mdolson67
Reviews.Content: This was going to be my wife's first time to Vegas and I wanted to make sure she liked the hotel. I was surprised at the great deal I could get just by being in the Wynn players club. The foyer and registration area are very classy and look out over the pool. Our room was amazing. It was so large and had a bunch of toys. A double sink in the bathroom with a flatscreen TV in the wall, motorized blinds and sheers, and a remote to turn off all of the lights in the room from your bed. There is a little sitting area as well. Everything is high end in this hotel. The pool area is nice. It keeps the classy atmosphere. They even have a European pool area and gaming tables at the pool. They do charge for internet and use of the fitness center. That would be the only disappointment we felt during the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: SweetKISSfromNY
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! The lobby decor is flower themed. Rooms are black and gold and are all jr. suites - separate area for bed and living room; flat screen TV. More sophisticated that Wynn rooms. Perfect place for a romantic getaway. Room service is pricey! One Caesars salad and two hot teas more that $40. Go down to Wynn buffet instead. Otherwise, perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but pricy”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinJen
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Encore to celebrate our 10 year anniversary. Overall we loved it! The positives: 1. GREAT room- decor, comfort, cleanliness, beautiful bathroom with soaking tub and shower, 2. Wonderful spa and for $30 you can use the fitness facilities AND the spa with whirlpool and cool tubs, waterfall showers, sauna, steam room. WELL worth the $! 3. Friendly and helpful staff. At check-in we had a great experience and even got a free fridge to use in the room. 4. Nice pool area. 5. Decor throughout the Encore was beautiful. The negative: 1. Prices!! Margaritas are $12- now come on- that is way too much even by Vegas standards! Coffee $4, snacks were also very high. No real carryout area for lower cost food. 2. Drink service was bad. We hoped to get a drink while playing the slots and video poker and had very little luck. If we got a waitress it took her a LONG time to get back. We also couldn't get a waitress at the pool area and my husband had to go quite a ways to get our $12 margaritas. 3. Location- pretty far at the north end of the strip. I'd probably stay at the Pallazo or Venetian when we come again. We had a more positive experience there just gambling and eating and there is more going on for us. But it is a really nice place despite the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: arlmon18
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Encore, and loved every minute of it. It's a relatively "young" hotel and is beautifully decorated. The suites are exactly what you see on the photos - no surprises. The hotel itself is very clean, and the decor is superb. Just the flowers alone are magnificent. The pool area is very quiet - no blasting music, which is perfect. We ate at the buffet (Wynn), which is attached, and it was unbelievable. A bit pricey, but worth every penny. If it was up to me, I would have eaten there everyday! It's a great place for a vacation, located across the street from the Fashion Mall, and the staff couldn't be more helpful and accomodating!! Would go back in a flash !!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and room - a bit pricey for everything else”
Reviews.Author: techteacher10
Reviews.Content: My 25 year old daughter and I stayed at the Encore for 3 nights in early April.Our room was lovely and the bed extremely comfortable, bathroom was laid out very well for two ladies.We had a view of the Stratosphere end of the strip with not so pretty construction site directly across the street on the 59th floor (a $50/night upgrade - not sure if it was worth the extra money - but there was absolutely no noise from the night club at all.)We loved the buffet and ate there 3 times - for early dinner(at 3:00, we paid lunch price), brunch, and breakfast. We got the $7 unlimited champagne, which was wonderful and we thought the buffet was delicious and well worth the money. We never paid more than the lunch price.However, all other resteraunts are extremely high priced and we ate elsewhere one meal a day.We saw three shows and my daughter' favorite was LaReve, at the Encore. I absolutely loved Jersey Boys and we also thought the the Phantom of the Opera was marvelous too. Both the Jersey Boys and Phantom were next door at the Palazzo and the Venetian.We decided to stay at a more central strip hotel next year so that we could see the other end of the strip also - the hotel is located at the END of the strip, so you do a lot of walking or taxi rides to get to Ceasars Palace, Bellagio, Paris, not to mention the other hotel casinos even further down.We also feel that we could get a better value for the dollar for food elsewhere. We want to do a show each evening and a little gambling, so we like good food but really don't want to have to pay more than about $50 a couple for a meal, not including drinks - not possible at the Encore - the Buffet is the one exception. We saw one PreFix dinner menu that was reasonably priced but not served when we wanted to eat. We received very good service from everyone at the hotel.Only consideration for us was that the location was a bit out of the way and the resteraunts were too pricey - except for the buffet nothing was really reasonably priced.We were exhausted one evening, not in the mood for pizza, and couldn't find one place to eat that was not outrageously priced! We settled for an appetizer and 2 glasses of wine and the bill was $60.On the plus side, the hotel is absolutely beautiful, waterfalls, butterflies, and flowers everywhere and very low key and relaxing.You can find lots of good reasonable places to eat and drink next door at the Palazzo or Venetian or across the street at the Fashion Show Mall, but everything is about a 15 to 20 minute walk. We thought that the pool was just ok, compared with the Palazzo, Venetian, or Ceasars Palace. All in all, it was a fantastic trip and I'm glad we stayed at Encore, just not sure I'd come back. I think I'd go back to the Palazzo or try the Bellagio instead next year.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: hpisles
Reviews.Content: We did a girls only trip to the Wynn Encore. We went here because I received a letter from the Encore offering rooms for $189 per night, the 3rd night was comped and a $50 dinner credit. Upon arrival, it a nice surprised that it was just a short walk from the interior parking lot to the registration desk. The decor is high-end Asian - lots of red but still nicely done. Our room was huge! with 2 queen size beds, mini-bar, 42 inch flat screen tv, opulant bathroom, desk, fax and other high end amenities, etc. The bed was to die for and wonderful to sleep in. Best yet were the floor to ceiling windows with panoramic views and we could control all the drapes and lights while lying in bed, Our spa brochure was missing the pricing menu so when I requested one - a wait person arrived within minutes and presented it on a small tray - impressive. The room was fully wired for business travelers. I need to make a copy and the fax/copier machine was out of ink, when I called housekeeping they asked a "good time" to install the ink cartridge and it was done in a timely manner and they even left a note saying it was done. All the staff (in the resturants, hotel, etc.) was very helpful and friendly. The Encore did have some pricey resturants but we found a very reasonably price deli to get breakfast and the pizza place in the Wynn that served yummy salads (which was an easy walk from the Encore - through an interior espanda). It took us a day or so to figuare out that we could hop on the Deuce bus out front of the Encore ($7 for 24 hour pass with unlimited on/off previlages) and we could go to the outlets and Fremont Street, etc with no problem and it was a great way to see the entire strip without walking! There was a HUGE shopping mall across the street from the Encore which you couldn't tell how big it was from the street level because it was quite deep and took up a number of blocks. The Encore is within walking distance of the Mirage, Vence, Plazzao, Treasure Island which was wonderful since we could sit on our beds and watch the volcano at the Mirage erupt! This place really did meet our expectations and more!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch (aside from Service)”
Reviews.Author: Dalecorp
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel only to wait close to 30 minutes for check-in with what has to be one of the most disorganized and disfunctional check-in procedures and line-ups of any hotel that I have ever stayed at. When finally getting my room, I was pleasantly surprised with its opulance and attention to detail, as was present throughout the hotel. My Wynn certainly doesn't miss a single construction related detail utilizing only the finest materials in every aesthetic aspect. The room was perfectly clean and large although the Palazzo's room design is superior. Aside from check-in, all other aspects of the hotel's service were excellent and the staff were both courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: k2inaz
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from Vegas after staying at the Encore @ the Wynn. The rooms are really nice. Mini-suite with large flat screen TV between bedroom & sitting area. Bathrooms are very large, double sinks, tub, shower stall & separate closet for toilet. Controls at the bedside for lights & drapes were a very nice accommodation. Had drinks & food at the bars & restaurants-- service & quality was always above average. We never left the properties - walked over to the Wynn for gambling, shopping & eating a couple of times. Saw "Le Reve" one evening & it was terrific. Highly recommend the show & hotel. Met spouse's cousin & hubby there & they enjoyed their stay as well. This hotel is not within an easy walk of the other casinos on the strip, but that is the only negative I could find.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: chai77
Reviews.Content: one of the best thing about this hotel is that the public transport bus, the DEUCE and the Gold Ace bus stops are just in front of the hotel. the Deuce goes up and down the strip and the express Gold ACE which takes up directly to the shopping outlets (both north and south). if you are not into shopping at outlets, Fashion Mall is directly across the road. also because it is nearly at the most northern aspect of the strip with regards to new casino/hotel complex it feels less crowded. one thing that strikes you is how the inside decor are mainly red in colour and there are no hotel room floors starting with the number 4. hence the lift goes from floor 39 and next level is called 50. this is obviouly to attract chinese clients (you may recall WYNN got a presence at MACAU). red is a lucky chinese colour , and the number 4 when pronounced in chinese and with a slight change in tone pronounciation means DEATH / or to DIE. check in / out lobby is truly not impressive as well, subdued and hap hazard. the rooms are huge and i agree the restroom/bathroom in the room is the largest i have been. we were put in the 53rd floor looking south along the strip - magical. rm number 5312. pools were heated to about 28 celcius, not as impressive as the wynn encore. the european pool for topless swimming was more interesting. since this hotel is part of th WYNN complex the buffett restaurant is in the WYNN hotel section hence abit of a hike, but get use to it, everything in LV is abit of a hike

Reviews.Title: “Encore”
Reviews.Author: enabler
Reviews.Content: Three personal bests I found at Encore: Best bathroom ever, by far. Best bed. Best TV. Actually, make that four bests - best view from the room, too. Refreshingly, the self-parking garage is not a mile away from the hotel, as opposed to most on the Strip. Having a count of available stalls for each level as you drive in is also a nice touch. I was not there on nights that XS was open, so it was quiet, which I appreciated. Easy walk to Palazzo and Fashion Show Mall. Being so high end, there's pretty much no "cheap" food or drink on site but at least what's available is outstanding, and not just overpriced mediocre fare. Also somewhat surprisingly, casino money lasted waaaay longer at Wynn/Encore than pretty much any of Harrah's joints. Go figure. Go Encore.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: LondonDanMark
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Had only been open just over a month when I stayed and everyone in Vegas is talking about it. I stayed in an Encore Resort Suite (twin), rooms are large with 2 queen size beds (very comfortable) and a seating area. Bathrooms are large as well with a shower, bath and a TV! Hotel is at the end of the strip so you may have to get a few cabs. There are many bars and restaurants in the hotel, a couple of swimming pools and a spa.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: jbellour
Reviews.Content: Excellent property and great location. All restaurants had excellent cuisine and service. We found the service here to be warm and welcoming. If you greet someone with a smile, you get warmth in return. The concierge went out of his way to solve a problem my travel agent could not. I look forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Super Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyguyAustin
Reviews.Content: A true 4 star hotel with an emphasis on nice rooms. The Encore is the all suite sister to the adjacent Wynn. I am not really sure why they gave it a different name as they share almost everything. The rooms are very large with a divider, which holds the TV, separating the sitting area from the bed. The bathroom has two sinks, marble shower, full tub, a full complement of towels and robes, separate TV in the wall, a good selection of amenities, and solid core doors everywhere. The room has numerous electronic controls, including the drapes over the floor to ceiling windows, a 32 inch flat LCD TV, and a nice work desk. Service is good as well. I was originally assigned a room that was not cleaned, and the manager quickly apologized (these things just happen, in my experience) and “upgraded” me to the same type room on a higher floor. I accidentally pushed the button for privacy, so the room was not cleaned when I returned, and they cleaned it within an hour of the request. The program includes an evening turn-down service….bedroom slippers, chocolate, and a cute note. The pool at the Encore is certainly not as nice as Wynn’s previous property (Bellagio), but Encore guests have access to the Wynn pool, which is almost as nice. Both pools have an European section (topless) that is becoming de regiur, at the bigger strip hotels. It looks as though the Encore is adding another pool area. The terrace café at the Wynn has dining on the pool deck, but there are bars with some food service at both pools. Lots of free parking, and, unlike a lot of the other strip hotels, close and convenient to the room elevators. Parking is in the back of the hotel past the main Encore entrance. Encore is no different than other strip hotels, and charges $14 for 24 hours of Internet. There is no resort fee (avoid these hotels) but has the high Las Vegas tax rate. Starbucks is across the street where you can get AT&T or T-Mobile internet if you have access to those accounts. While I still prefer the aura of the Bellagio, here the rooms are bigger and nicer, at a comparable rate. It is a easy walk to all of the street theatrics (TI, Mirage, Bellagio, and the Forum), so in a good location. You will like this all suite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, they make everyone...”
Reviews.Author: Moose5
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service, they make everyone feel like royalty. Every detail in the rooms has been thought through. From the elegant, spacious room, to the ample storage space and dressing area, to the one touch controls for light and draperies. Check in was a breeze and room on a higher floor with an even better view was offered without being asked for. Room service was prompt, food was excellent and the service was stupendous! The buffet was one of the best I have ever experienced. The spa is beautiful and huge. The pool is lovely, although a bit on the small side. Lounge chairs are comfortable and pool wait staff is friendly and promt. The Encore and sister property Wynn are both beautiful and you will find exellent service. On the pricier side, but well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but.......”
Reviews.Author: KZKAT
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via an email promotion, which required a pre-pay. I was okay with that. When we arrived to check in, they asked for the original credit card used and I told them I don't have it. Hubby used his to book the room, and I was using mine for the extras. I was told that since I didn't have the original one used, they would have to issue a credit back to it and charge the one I brought with me. I got pretty angry since that bill had long been paid. I argued but they wouldn't budge. Now I have to wait for the credit to appear on the original cc, go through a billing cycle, and wait for a refund issued by my credit card company to be sent to me. The manager kept insisting I was told that at the time of booking, but I was not! Then I asked for a "quiet" room away from the nightclubs and was told there was nothing available in the King resort room. I had to settle for 2 queens, which was okay since it was a nice quiet room. It was also over the pool construction (on the 37th floor) but I did not hear any noise and I am a very light sleeper! The room was beautiful and extremely clean. Beds are very comfortable!!! Overall, the resort is gorgeous, but the staff is not very friendly. One thing I did not like is that we were told to charge everything to the room, and they would see what could be comped at the end of our stay. However, when we went to the Red Card booth, they told us that they could arrange for some free buffets. We had to argue with them somewhat to get the ones already charged comped from our bill. So check with them first before you charge a buffet to your room! The buffets were okay, nothing great, but plentiful and decent. No rooms comped since we were there on a deal. I don't think I would stay there again, more so because it's too far down the strip. I like a central location better. I think the idea is to keep you at the Encore or Wynn for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: FarmGirl1103
Reviews.Content: I was a little wary of some of the reviews, but this hotel was absolutely superb in every way. We arrived at the hotel at 11a.m. and were given a room immediately, they offered the $20 upgrade, which we took and our room on the 62nd floor was stunning. We had no issues with noise from the XS club because it was closed on the days that we stayed at the hotel. Everytime we asked an employee where something was located they took the time to walk us to the restaurant, pool or spa personally. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: bfinneg
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about Encore; we loved every minute. Beautiful lobby, room and casino. Didn't eat at the restaurants, though we were tempted, but there's too much selection in Las Vegas; maybe next time. And I wouldn't even consider another hotel next time!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Encore”
Reviews.Author: sassyangel
Reviews.Content: This is def a 5 star hotel in every way. Service, room quality, attention to detail, friendlyness of staff. We travelled to the Encore for our honeymoon and where not disapointed. i will start at the beggining in the hope you may get some helpful tips. The distance from airport is minimal. However if we returned we would choose to get a taxi on arrival as it would take maybe 10-15min and the shuttle took us to at least 4 different hotels before ours so took about 50-60min. The check in also can take about 30min so be prepared. However this was not really an issue and all the staff are very friendly. The decore throughout this hotel is stunning, stunning , stunning. This continues through to the Wynn...you can walk through a prominade of (very expensive) shops and into the Wynn. If you want to go to the mall across the road i suggest walking through to the wynn and out by their street entrance to casino by the water fall , saves a big walk. Ladies that are like me new to gambling go and find the "Sex in the City " slots in the Wynn they are great and tend to pay out better than any others. We saw the La reve show here and it was fantastic. we paid for VIP as our honeymoon and so glad we did. Choc strawberrys and bottle of champagne inc (should be for price) and very large comfy seats. However if not our honeymoon wld still have gone and normal seats would have been just fine, nice small theatre so can see so much detail. Food: Society in Encore is so nice. casual wear at any point, great food, great atmosphere and great coktails! Beautiful boutique style. Best breakfast...found this too late .....Its called Buffet and is in the Wynn. WOW beautiful flower and fruit orniments hang from ceiling. Cant name what they havent got!! so much to choose and very very good food. Tasted american dishes i had never had. Also pasteries and cakes...pancakes, salmon...etc etc. And a reasonable price for around there. One thing i did not like...no kettle in the room. so one tea with two cups was $16.60. Bit pricey! I do love my tea though. Golfers....a must this course is amazing again. My husband loved the course and found the caddie very friendly and gave lots of tips to help. Advised to tip caddie. We went on the upgraded package to hoover dam. In a big pink 4x4 LOVED IT. for me the best part of the trip was being able to go down ont the lake. It is a restricted area no other trips go there so just you. And it was beautiful. If i was to advise anyone it would be spend the money as i personally found the rest of the trip a bit bland so would have been disapointed if that was all i had done. Resturants..... Wazuzu really nice. SW steakhouse very nice too gets busy so make sure you book. Also one of the pricey rest. But to be honest as they have some of the best chef in the world there can you really get a bad meal???? One negative for me as a non smoker was obviously the smoke. Gets really bad in the evening. I really did not like this but nothing can be done. And it in no way affected my stay, but if i could i would chane it...im ssure many , inc my husband who smokes , would disagree. In all i would absolutly recomend this hotel. Best hotel in Vegas even above the Bellageo ! If you have any Q's please ask. Hope this helped.

Reviews.Title: “We'll meet in Las Vegas for an Encore”
Reviews.Author: fifataxi
Reviews.Content: Four friends from east coast to west coast met in Vegas to catch up and spend some quality time together. Travel Agent booked the Wynn Encore. Arrived from airport (night time) after short drive and immediately started the "Wynn" experience. Chill Lounge music playing outside which immediately reminded me of the Buddha Bar Lounge. Checked in to Wynn Encore and was told we were upgraded to the Tower Suites. Steamed face cloth and bottle of water was presented during registration and we were off. 12th flr, 2 queen beds, lounging area with full amenties bath experience. Bed linens of cotton, bamboo and room was spacious for four. View was nice and sun sets on the room. Staff ranging from registration desk, concierge, security, bell desk, doormen, room service, housekeeping and casino area were extremely helpfull, pleasant and professional. 5 stars. Had breakfast in Wynn by pool side and it was delicious. 2 cafes were available for a quick croissant and coffee when full breakfast was not desired. Note to the Wynn: Extra security hightens on Thursdays thru Sunday and passes are required to be shown when you stay in the Tower Suites. A bit annoying but not reflective on the staff, more the idea that Monday thru Wednesday you can roam freely and uninterupted yet when there could be the odd Garth Brooks sighting or whomever the Wynn consideres Royles Royce worthy it becomes a hassel to all that are enjoying their stay. Either always have the security regulations or find a way to not impede on the clients who are their to enjoy the stay and not people watch. Also, after a long day of sight seeing in Las Vegas, water therapy should be available either in a different venue than the spa or have the spa water therapies open longer than eight in the evening. Just a suggestion as several properties that are 5 star rated around the world want their guests to have access to a lovely whirlpool until 10:00 p.m. All in all, extemely impressed and would have to say that although esthetically pleasing to the eye, the staff at the Wynn Encore takes this property to "luxury status". Many regards.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: lovthesites
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Encore the first full week of April. We had a wonderful time. We booked on the special rate of 3 nights for $299. We could not say no to that price. We took a taxi from the airport to the encore which cost about $16. No help with our bags, one hop wandered our way but quickly left. Maybe our 2 bags was too many. We arrived at the hotel around 9 am. They only had a checkout line (no check in line) which was ok for us as we were very early. There were 3 workers checking people out and only one ahead of us in line which also was ok. Then a New Yorker cut in front of us (you can just spot a New Yorker a mile away). We told them we were here to check in and they took our info but said no rooms were available and said they would call us between noon and 3pm. I had to ask for an up grade, $25 for strip view per night, 20 for mountain view. They called us at 1:00pm with our room. We were given a room on the 56th floor. Gorgeous room, excellent bed, wonderful view of the strip, very quiet, service and staff were excellent, pool was very nice. We spent most of our time at the European Pool (adults only), which was very quiet and classy. Topless sunbathing is OK here, but in 3 days I think we only saw one female doing this. Our only complaint about the pool is that they should have had drinking water in a few more locations around the pool. They only had one, at each pool, and it was quite a hike to get to (maybe done purposefully to get you to order drinks?). They had a nice, private way to get to the pool by going through the spa area. That way you didn't have to walk through the lobby. While walking through the spa we overheard the spa employee tell someone that the workout room is free if you have a spa treatment, otherwise it's $30.00 a day. We weren't thinking about working out, but that certainly would have made us choose not to. Wireless internet is available in the room, but costs $14.00 per day. I thought in such a classy place they should have that for free. Complimentary in room safe. We ate at SW Steakhouse and sat outside by the water feature, we both ordered the ribeye steak with blue cheese topping. Must have insulted the chef because he smoothered my prime cut with blue cheese. That is all I could taste. Just a little touch of blue cheese would have been much better. Steaks were $57 each, we split creamed spinach $10, blue cheese topping $5, featured red wine from France $14 per glass (very good). We at the buffet beakfast $18 each. Very good, two stations empty but there were plenty of choices. We had the asian salad $12 and turkey sandwich $11 twice by the pool for lunch. Very large portions. My wife and I shared it and it is very filling. We went to the La Reve show at the Wynn, free with our package, and loved it. Show was in the center with seating all around. I do not think there is a bad seat in the house. We we seated in row F and I am glad I was not any closer. The consierge printed our boarding pass for us upon departure (complimentary). We can not afford to pay rack rate here but will go again on a special offer.

Reviews.Title: “Airy, spacious, beautiful, and great prices. Favorite place in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: KristinCarlson
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas for work several times each year, and this is unquestionably my favorite place to stay. Not just in Vegas but in any city, this is a lovely, remarkable hotel with a considerate, professional staff and fresh, airy ambiance. The design, decor, floorplan, lobbies, casino, pools, and rooms are all beautifully designed, hip, and thoughtfully detailed. The plethora of natural light in the casino area and the building as a whole are a welcome difference for a Vegas establishment. A room on a high floor with two plush king beds, a sitting area, large bath, and amazing view of the strip at the time of my last stay was less than $150 per night. Even with four of us, there was plenty of space. From the casino, there are plenty of tall windows beginning at floor level which look out to the French gardens and/or pool areas. In the shopping hallways, there are arched stained-glass skylights overhead. Valet or self-parking are easy and free. With a trendy red design scheme throughout the hotel, small restaurants and bars are tastefully tucked in beneath crimson draperies throughout the gaming floor. No need to walk a half mile to eat as in some of the other large resorts. This isn't your frumpy, stuffy Vegas nor your run-down barfy dorm room Vegas. Staff were courteous on all counts, and the food and specialty drinks at all the restaurants we tried were great. I enjoyed the adults-only pool and poolside drinks service (although admittedly steeply priced). That said, everything else was quite reasonable, especially for Vegas, not to mention at this level of quality. Incidentally, the slot machines were good to us as well and certainly balanced out the pool drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Steve Wynn got it perfectly with Encore”
Reviews.Author: Maggers
Reviews.Content: On two of three Vegas trips in the last 18 months I've stayed at Encore, which I'm convinced is the best hotel on the strip. Encore was developed by Steve Wynn, who envisioned the Mirage, Bellagio, and Encore's big sister, the Wynn, which is connected to Encore by a shopping esplanade. Encore is, according to one of the front desk staff, "the culmination of everything Steve Wynn learned from his previous hotels." It's smaller and newer but a little taller than the Wynn, but has all the luxuries. The standard room is about 700 square feet and includes a sitting area. Bathrooms are amazing, even by Vegas standards. It's all in the details at Encore, from the attentive service to the authentic antiques decorating the individual casino salons; from the bath products to the fabulous bed. It's worth booking the panoramic view room (a $25 per night upgrade), which puts you on one of the top floors. Ask for a south-facing room for the best view of the strip. Be sure to visit Encore's spa as it's also the best I've ever seen. Gain all-day access to the fitness area and water therapy rooms for $30, which are free if you have a treatment or salon service. Encore's first-rate concierge desk can help you with directions and recommendations––especially helpful when traveling alone. Security is subtle but tight, and both Wynn and Encore's top-notch restaurant servers will protect you from an awkward solo dining experience. The feel of Encore is that of a boutique hotel. It's easy to navigate since the casino area is broken up into individual salons, so you won't end up wandering through seemingly endless casino floors. Another plus: Although you see people smoking, you never smell smoke. I'll never stay anywhere else––until Steve Wynn builds another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The most beatiful hotel in Las Vegas-the design, service, and amenities are stunning.”
Reviews.Author: LeBois
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews prior to booking our four night stay at Encore. This was one of the best hotel stays we have had. Bar none. Here are the highlights: 1) The design, layout, and attention to detail is one of the best we have experienced. 2) Natural light is everywhere often with views of the beautiful pool grounds. 3) Our cabana at the European Pool (adults only) was a real treat. We had #20 which is on the upper level closest to the stairs. The pool bar and casino, spa tub, and wonderful pool are right at the base of the stairs. This was our first cabana and will not be our last. 4) The variety and quality of food is astounding. Combined with offereings at Wynn next door, the choices are endless. Be sure to check out the "Taste of Wynn" menus at each of the fine dining venues - they are a great value for money. 5) We were in the basic resort king and it was anything but basic. What a great room. bed (one of the best ever), linens, furnishings, tub, bath products, and the list goes on. The TVs in the room carry many music stations including a "Soundscapes" option which was perfect for soaking the tub. I lost track of reality. 6) The casino is so bright and easily laid out on a grid you could find your way in an instant. We are slot players and played the whole time we were there. If you're picky about your slot, you'll find a broader selection down the esplanade at Wynn. 7) The service was 95% spot on. So polite, welcoming and friendly. Professional too. From the bell staff - to the casino hosts - to the restaurants - to the concierge. 8) La Reve was beautiful, inspiring and worth the price. You get a bit of a discount if you are a guest at the hotel. Simply put - we can't wait to go back and are already planning our next visit. We particularly enjoyed the lower-traffic nights of Thursday and Sunday and will probably stay more off-days so we have even more of it to ourselves. From what I read in the negative reviews, I think many of those people forget that while this is a 5-star property (and it most certainly is), it is still a mega resort. Although it is so-well designed and staffed, it is still a big place and you cannot expect the intimacy of a 250 room Mandarin Oriental. But you would never have all that Encore has to offer if it were a 250 room hotel. Encore will not disappoint. Be sure to take some slacks and a blazer - you'll feel more a part of the scene. Enjoy your stay and happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: jagoodbar
Reviews.Content: By far, this is the nicest room we have ever stayed in. When we arrived at the Encore on Friday Afternoon, we went to the check-in desk and it went quite smooth and the young lady was very polite. She offered an upgrade to a higher floor with better views, which we declined. We then took the elevator to our room on the 19th floor. Upon entering the room, the bathroom was just inside the door on the right. It was very large with a shower and separate tub. There was a large counter with two sinks and a lighted magnifying mirror for my wife. There was a separate room for the toilet. There was also a small television mounted in the wall of the bathroom. Then we entered the sleeping area and there was a large king size bed with very luxurious sheets and a down comforter and down pillows. There was a large flat screen television that swiveled ti either the bedroom or the living room. the living room had a couch with a large ottoman and a recliner on one end. There was a table with two chairs and three large floor the ceiling windows which looked out over the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning rooms, stunning casino, not the friendliest place”
Reviews.Author: ScubaMoose
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel (and I wasn't in the best frame of mind following a lost luggage debacle - thanks American Airlines). Check-in was a little chaotic and the reception staff a wee bit off-hand. Not rude. Just a bit frosty. The rooms are lovely, quite modern, large enough, with a separate sitting room area with a huge sofa near the floor to ceiling windows. Stunningly comfy beds with remote control curtains, sheers, lights, privacy button, Ipod station. Large LCD TV at the foot of the bed with some good channels. Bathroom is huge too, with an LCD TV. Bath is nice and deep but a little on the short side - no big surprise for most hotels. We had a high-ish floor (39) and noise was never an issue. We was offered an upgrade (at a cost) to a higher floor but didn't see the need. There is a gym, but it costs $30 a day which I thought was a bit of a con. The Encore casino was our favourite - we are not big gamblers, so it was nice to avoid the crowds and the smoke (it is a smoking casino as are all the others, but it never seemed intrusive - good aircon I guess). Tables had minimum bets of $15, but we had hours of fun with $5 and the blackjack machines (big spenders!). There's a bit of a red theme going on, which i quite liked - gave it a luxurious feel. I can understand other comments about it not being very exciting - It was pretty quiet, due to its location at the end of the strip I suppose, but that suited me. I liked walking around the other casino's then escaping back to the Encore for a drink and a flutter. The waitresses are friendly and courteous. Other casinos seemed a bit grubby by comparison. We didn't really use the restaurants or shops (all top-end & expensive) in the hotel as its just over the road to the Fashion Show Mall which is way cheaper. The food court came in useful and the coffee shop at the back of the mall on the lower level near the catwalk is more the half the price of the hotel coffee shop. Once you can find the exits (maybe it's just me, but they are never signed and you can walk for miles and not find the exit you want) It's an easy walk to the fashion show mall, The Pallazzo (used First Restaurant - very nice and not too expensive), The Venetian, and Treasure Island with the Gallions and the Siren show (which you have to see just to appreciate how bad it is!) I would use this hotel again and none of the others we saw looked nearly as nice. It is a long way from the hustle and bustle of the middle of the strip though.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fulleruppernai
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Encore. The ultimate highlight is the rooms, we were on the 29th floor in a south strip room and the view was fantastic. The rooms are huge and contain a living room area and an immense bathroom with a television. From bed, you can control the sheers, drapes, room lighting, and privacy sign outside your room with the push of a button, which was a great touch. Through using our American Express Platinum card, we were able to receive our first night free, a room upgrade, two $30 breakfast vouchers for each day we were there, and 2 $45 lunch vouchers. This made our stay of course that much better. The cons are that the hotel itself really isn't that exciting. Compared to the Bellagio, there really isn't much to see inside the resort other than the casino and a few restaurants. We found ourselves consistently walking back to the Wynn when we wanted something to do. Another con is its location, at the far end of the strip, making it a significant walk to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and one of the best”
Reviews.Author: ChangChi
Reviews.Content: Last week stayed at Encore, Bellagio and MGM Grand. Both Encore and Bellagio I booked from Platinum Travel Service from American Express and got Fine Hotel & Resort amenities, which include room upgrade, free breakfast, spa credit(Bellagio), free lunch(Encore) and late check out. I can say now that Encore was the best of three. When we checked in, we got complementary upgrade from resort king to tower king, wow, what a suite! Very clean, much space, twice housekeeping a day, fantastic soup. I got 58th floor south strp view. The hotel has less smoke and less crowd comparing to Bellagio and MGM Grand, and lots of other hotels we had been to. Everything in Encore was fantastic. We also had free lunch in Red 8 (Chinese restaurante) at Wynn, also very nice food. Two complementary breakfast at Wynn buffet and the food was better than Bellagio's buffet. Certainly I'll stay at Encore over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: masak10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore July 2009, have already booked to stay their again July 2010. Have even got my sister in the UK to meet up with us there for her holiday. I had tears in my eyes when we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Flawless”
Reviews.Author: lisa_fi
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Encore for 7 nights , It really was flawless prob the best hotel i have ever stayed in , It was totally spotless so so clean, Our Room was on 30 th floor overlooking the mountians , golf course, pools etc , the room was amazing and the bed was really comfortable, our bed sheets were changed every second day and I never requested it . The housekeeping staff were brilliant. Honestly i could not flaw any of the staff everybody was so friendly to us. It seemed like every staff member was so genuinely grateful for the business during theses times of recession. The hotel is totally amazing you could spend the day walking around admiring the decor . The hotel is expensive but i found everything in Vegas costly , Only Fault in the hotel is the pool area is a bit small for the amount of people staying in the hotel but one of the Pool Attendants did tell me that the hotel is building a new swimming pool area and it will be open this May. We walked around other hotel s in the strip and found them to be very crowded and shabby , i never felt the Encore was crowded at all even when the hotel is full. I would highly recommend the Restaurant called The Maggianos in the Fashion Show Mall across from the Wynn and Encore Hotels . It was really lovely the food was amazing except the portions are hugh so make sure u only order the half portions honestly its even hard to finish the half portions. The Encore was really wonderful , We also got tickets for Garth Brooks , and i can honestly he was fantastic , I would nt call myself a hugh Garth Fan but i was totally blown away it was just the best and such good value. Im from Ireland and was thinking the tickets would have been the same price in ireland but the concert would have been in a stadium with 80000 people . Honestly pay the extra small charge its so worth

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel, poor service..”
Reviews.Author: branmoof
Reviews.Content: Got a package deal to Las Vegas for 3 nights at the Encore, with a credit note to spend on basically on food/drinks at the hotel. Even though they spent the money to make the hotel look like a 5 star, the service was a bit lacking. Arrived at check-in, we were helped relatively quickly. They didn't seem too busy at that time. The service did feel a little impersonal and fake. Ended up agreeing to an upgrade to a higher floor (62) with a panoramic view. We got such a great deal, thought why not, plus we didn't want to be disturbed by any noise as mentioned by previous reviewers. However, they failed to tell us it was the "mountain" vs. "strip" view. So felt a bit conned. But whatever, it was fine. The room itself is alright. Big enough, there were only the 2 of us. The decor looked nice, especially since the hotel is relatively new; the bed itself was quite comfortable, There is no fridge to use as it was stocked with their own items; there was a small slip of paper warning you that you had a time limit to pick up items before it was charged to your card. Internet was extra so didn't bother. Housekeeping did not do a very good job maintaining the room, items were still dusty. Another thing was that we had left some items in a plastic bag that we used as a laundry bag, and they ended up throwing it away! Never have we had that happen at any place we've stayed at. Not impressed. The decor of the hotel was a bit too flashy for my liking - used too much red in everything, esp for the chandeliers in some areas. Played at the casino; the minimum for some tables were pricier than at some casinos. The cigarette smoke made us feel nauseous after a while, but that's in all the casinos. The pool at Encore was closed for renovations, we wandered by the pool at Wynn, but it ended up being too chilly for a dip. Didn't try many of the restaurants there, but as we had hotel credit as part of our package, we went to Tableau for breakfast per recommendation by a friend. The food was tasty, albeit pricey. The setting was lovely, we got a seat by the window, and with the sun warming our faces, I could have sat there for hours. We also went to the Lobby Bar one night for late night drinks. The cocktail my fiance had was tasty, and my white wine refreshing. The seats were comfy, and perfect for people watching. Location wise, it was more towards one end of the strip, which we didn't mind. We ended up getting a 3 day bus pass ($15) which starts counting time the first time you use it. The "Deuce" bus ran 24hours and we took it into downtown and figured out which bus took us to the outlet mall so we didn't need to take taxis. Although you had to wait at times, it saved us some money. All in all, Encore is a huge modern hotel, with mediocore service. We got a great deal on this "5-star" hotel with flight, but next time will probably try another hotel in Vegas since there are so many to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Nikclay
Reviews.Content: I soooooo loved this hotel. Beautifully decorated, (in Red!!) amazing views, fantastic service, immaculately kept grounds, AND the restaurants (Society) have GREAT food! The beds were comfy, with lots of pillows and great sheets. Nice soaking tub! I utilized that beautiful thing every night of our 3 night stay! LOL My favorite part was the ventilation system, though (LOL)! Because I am not a smoker, there is only so much cigarette smoke I can take.
