Walk into most Casino Hotels on the Strip and you are immediately assaulted by the smell. Not so at the Encore, OR the Wynn for that matter. THANK YOU, Steve Wynn! :) There is a lot to do without even leaving the hotel, which I also enjoyed. Shops, restaurants, nightclubs, casino, AND great shows, all in one place. The Wynn and the Encore are connected by an upscale shopping mall, by the way. I cannot say enough about our amazing stay here. It is at the end near the Stratosphere. Fine location, unless your show is at the MGM Grand (as our Bon Jovi Concert was). One thing I didnt like: paying 4-6 dollars (depending on the size) for a bottle of water in the convenience store. Crazy! Walk across the street toward the Palazzo, and there is a WalGreens right on the strip in front of the Palazzo. Also, dont bother with the RED 2 story sightseeing bus, unless you want to sit for a few hours. It will set you back about $40 per person; its difficult to find the pick up spots at the various hotels because they are not marked on the map; AND they come only every half hour. Plus, the regular buses stop just about everywhere down the strip, with about 10 -15 minute intervals.

Reviews.Title: “Steve Wynn hits it out of the park”
Reviews.Author: cr8it
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel. We stayed for five days and wanted to stay longer. We enjoyed a suite in the towers section of the hotel and the room was over the top beautiful. It was cleaner than any hotel I have ever stayed in. The amenities were great in every way. If you get a chance go to the spa - it is breathtakingly beautiful and the menu of services is great. I had the Sandlewood Men's special, and felt like I had a new body when it was finished. The staff was wonderful - I read a couple of reviews where people say they were treated rudely, and it must have been another staff. Our only disappointment was the Sinatra Restaurant. The food selection was so/so (but what we got was tasty). However, so much more could have been done with this concept. The only real connection I could see was a grammy, emmy and oscar in the showcase at the entrance. The casino was fantastic. I made a mistake one time and did not put odds behind a craps roll. The pit boss noticed this (I had been playing the same way with the same odds all night). He talked to the dealer and came over and said to me, we are going to pay you on that bet (the pay off was about $90). I thanked him, and he just said "You are playing at the Encore." This blew me away. All in all - a delightful experieince. Have stayed at The Bellagio, Venetian, Hilton, MGM Grand and a variety of the older hotels over the years. This one is head and shoulders above all the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globe-trot-er
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, and I spent 4 nights at The Wynn Encore and I can't say enough good things about this hotel. 5 Star all the way - immaculately kept property, first rate amenities, great location, and impeccable service. I've stayed at many fine hotels during my travels (George V Paris, Park Hotel Tokyo, Palazzo Sasso Ravello, etc.) and this property ranks among the best. Upon arrival I was automatically upgraded to a 63rd floor (top) suite with a panoramic view of the strip and surrounding mountains. All rooms are spacious (about 750 square feet) - floor to ceiling windows, large sitting/living area, king sized bed, long/wide foyer, and huge bathroom. Beautiful pool, posh casino, and first rate restaurants. My only complaint is that guests are not entitled to use the fitness facility unless you've already purchased a salon/spa package - otherwise, the daily usage cost is $30 - fairly steep - in fact, I don't recall paying extra for use of a gym in any (5 star) hotel that I can remember. Nevertheless, this is a first rate property and I highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great on the Eyes - Rude on the Ears”
Reviews.Author: scamper78
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Expedia. Everything was on time and no problems. When we arrived at the front desk we had been up since 3am (Atlantic City time). While checking in the clerk told we could upgrade for a panaromic view we both declined. Then she went on to tell us that our rooms on the 13th and 15th floor would be noisy because of the nightclub. We said that was ok and got an eye roll out of her. We joked with each other during the whole check in process and couldn't get a smile out of her at all. Felt like she just wanted to get us out and there. A credit card was asked for incase we billed anything to the room. We signed paperwork and left. On the second day someone from the casino stood by the elevators and asked to see my room key but not the two teenage children because they said, "They didn't have one" and he let them go and another couple dressed better then us. Nice way to treat paying guest. They should treat everyone the same! On the last day we checked our bill and found out she charged us for the $20. extra a night for a panaromic view that we never agreed on. Oh but we gave our credit cards and signed. Our view a construction site, McDonalds and Ross. They wouldn't do anything for us and the manager wouldn't talk to us. First time ever in Vegas last time we will stay at Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: tripsterish
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel: Pool: big enough that if you wanted lots of action (noise) you could have it without disturbing those who wanted quiet. Rooms: Our room was huge and had a great view. Everything was spotless and we loved the automatic shades Casino: we didn't gamble much, but walking through we appreciated that it didn't stink of smoke. The service was also incredible. Friends had ordered champagne sent to our room, and when I tried to tip the room service waiter, he wouldn't accept it because service was included. Never seen a hotel employee turn down a tip! The only thing I'd say is that the buffet is a little overrated.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Eldudarino
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sahara last year with a buddy and we had the buffet at the Wynn. Right then I knew this was a special place. My wife booked the Encore even though she was not sure with some worrisome reviews. Well needless to say she was very happy with our stay. The first thing you see when you walk in the front door is not gambling but a garden with a great pool. This is the centerpiece of a great resort. The whole place is very cozy and the staff from the front desk to the restaruants was friendly and professional. The self park garage us easy in and easy out. The checkin and out was painless. The room was better than expected. We had a panaromic suite that we loved. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in and the automatic drapes are a nice touch, they really darken the room. The bathroom was huge with his and her sinks a large tub and roomy shower. Only negatives are no coffee maker and no mini fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms but pretentious crowd”
Reviews.Author: jequizz
Reviews.Content: So when we first walked in, we felt underdressed. We had come off the plane in our "just married" t-shirts and jeans and everyone around us were in sport jackets and dresses. We checked in about 10:30am after about a 10 minute wait in line. They are VERY slow at the front desk, FYI, so be prepared. We got our room keys about an hour later which was pretty awesome since check in wasn't until 3pm. We get up to our room, which is GORGEOUS. The rooms are truly amazing. I have never stayed in such a nice room. Be careful with the minibar. We figured we could put things on top of the items in the fridge but no, they'll charge you for that. So be sure to ask for a personal refrigerator. Also, one thing you need to do is put the latch on your door. If you have the "do not disturb" light on, housekeeping will ignore it. Our first morning they rang the doorbell and walked in. Then the second time it happened we had the latch on so they couldn't get in. Don't understand the point of that light if they ignore it?? It is a very expensive casino to eat in and gamble in. Nothing lower than $10 tables, even mid-week, early morning. The food is very expensive. I saw a guy order a $12 turkey wrap and then heard them say it was pre-wrapped (in other words, they didn't even make it). $12?? Come on! The staff wasn't friendly. We sat down at the Eastside Lounge for video poker and to watch tv. We ordered water and the bartender gave us a rude look then asked for our IDs. Sorry we didn't want to pay $10 for a well drink. Movies were $12.99 for on demand (stupid price), spa prices were outrageous. And the casino just had a very pretentious feeling. Gorgeous rooms. But overpriced casino and not a very fun crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: JasonRM72
Reviews.Content: We booked through Orbitz and I had no problem at either check-in or check-out. Both went quickly and smoothly. The room was a great size for the 2 of us, beautiful and clean, as was the very spacious bathroom. We were on the 15th floor, which is non-smoking, so we did not have any issues with smoke smell, or noise from the rest of the casino/nightclubs. My only 2 complaints are: 1. that there was no coffeemaker in the room. We were forced to either spend $4 each for a coffee or make the trek over to Starbucks at the Fashion Mall. 2. though the bed was comfortable, the pillows were not our style. They were way too squishy, your head sinks right through it to the mattress. That made it difficult to stay comfortable at times. They may have other pillow options, but I never got around to asking. We would gladly stay again

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is getting greedy”
Reviews.Author: Mexicangreekgirl
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at either the Wynn or Encore for exactly two years, since the first time I came to Vegas. I've been at either hotel AT LEAST 12 times, and I usually get more than one room because we bring our teenager with friends, or we treat my sister in law and her husband, etc. Once we even rented 4 rooms for my husband's birthday. NOT ONCE have I gotten recognition from this hotel group, I only come back because I love both hotels. I have tried to see if I can get ANYTHING, like an upgrade or free night's stay, to no avail. They don't even say "welcome back" when I check in, yet again. With all of the great rewards that Vegas hotels offer these days, I definitely DON'T feel like a valued customer, which is why this is probably my LAST stay at either hotel. They even charged me for a panoramic view room, which I didn't get. Nobody likes to be charged for absolutely EVERYTHING and get NOTHING back. Wynn just got too greedy for me, so I'll take my business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “It's a five star property, just not a five star operation.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelPolo
Reviews.Content: The Encore is a beautiful hotel... the rooms are very nice and the common areas are just gorgeous. Sadly, the people that work there are inefficient and lazy. Our first impression wasn't a good one. We arrived at the hotel at 3pm and decided to check in. After 15 minutes in the queue, we were told that the computers had crashed, and there was nothing they could do. After a long day with at the airport/ airplane, this wasn't great news. 30 mins later, things started moving. We got our room on the 34th floor, and was placed DIRECTLY in front of the machine room which made a loud noise every 10 seconds. We called down once to tell them about the problem, and they told us they would send up security. 15 mins later... still nothing. We called down once again, a little angrier this time. Still nothing. The third time we called, we were practically screaming and requesting a room change. We were moved up to the 51 floor and the problem was addressed. What was really disappointing however, was that even though we changed rooms, we could STILL hear the pounding noise from the XS nightclub. It's UNBELIEVABLE that in a 5 star hotel, 51 stories above the nightclub, that we could still hear the noise. Terrible. The hairdryers were dirty, the trashcans were not cleaned out, and the tables were sticky. The room didn't seem clean at ALL. The pool was okay. Pool boys don't set up the chair for you like they do at the four seasons. In conclusion, the Encore had bad service, dirty rooms, TERRIBLE sleep quality (from the nightclub and random machine rooms..), and inefficient people.

Reviews.Title: “Encore”
Reviews.Author: FadiaC
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I have ever stayed. King size bed, huge TV, awesome view. Wonderful food, great pool, nice waiters. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “The best....”
Reviews.Author: PVDFan1974
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, fanciful, amazing resort. From the casino and room decor, to the gardens, spa, and atrium, this place exudes class and elegance. Early (12pm) check-in was a cinch. Hotel staff was professional and friendly. In-room dining and buffet were great. Among the places I've stayed in Vegas (Signature, Wynn, Aria, and now Encore), Wynn/Encore is easily the best.

Reviews.Title: “Encore...encore...EnCoRe!!”
Reviews.Author: CandyLoveKiss
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel from March 6th to 10th of this year. This was our second time going to Vegas together, last time we stayed at Treasure Island, and while TI was very nice, I was set on staying at a 5 star hotel this time around. Well, I have nothing but good things to say about Encore. I had read many reviews...actually after I had already booked thru Expedia (Got a GREAT deal). And it seemed like there were alot of mixed opinions. I was a little worried about what was to come. When we arrived, we were greated by a nice young lady, no wait to check in. My boyfriend advised her that we were there celebrating his birthday and she said she'd have something special sent to the room. We got upstairs, and the room was exactly like the pictures....with an amazing view of the strip and the mountains. The room we had was on the 28th floor. After barely unpacking we left and walked to the Wynn side to the buffet. This was at about 6pm. When we returned to the room, there was a plate of chocolates as well as a card from the girl at the front desk wishing my boyfriend a happy birthday and good stay. The hotel itself was really pretty. The room had everything I expected...including comfy robes. The swivel tv in the room was convenient and the ipod alarm clock was cool. I must add that housekeeping was really nice. A couple times we ran into housekeeping as we were leaving our room and each time they were very friendly. I also had left a few dollars out after the first night, which i intended to be for the housekeeper...since i had requested more bar soap..and she didn't even take it! I guess it's cause she didn't want to touch it if it weren't meant for her. The next day i wrote on the actual note "FOR YOU..housekeeping" and she took it. I really liked that I didn't have a worry as far as belongings and money left out in the room. Honesty goes a long way when it comes to me returning. All in all I absolutely loved Encore. I did have a few gripes, but that wasnt about the service. The walls are very thin in the room. Therefore if you have noisy neighbors, you can hear them. (Unfortunately we were next to a bunch of drunk guys), and you can also hear the person in the bathroom. I also wish Encore/Wynn had a closer monorail stop or shuttle (they got rid of that from what i hear). The breakfast buffet at Wynn was really tasty, and service good. The dinner on the other hand, not so much. And the service was terrible. Wouldnt pay 40 per person again for that, but we went 3 times for breakfast and it was fantastic. If Encore is in my price range again, I'd definitely stay there again...and again! (P.S., in our room, we didn't really hear the nightclub)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: MM1928
Reviews.Content: It was amazing,never saw something like that even a Ferrari garage near the casino. If you go to Vegas don't miss that Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but lacks attention to detail and 5* treatment”
Reviews.Author: Shoesy80
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas numerous times, and stayed at many hotels on the strip. We have stayed at the Venetian and The Palazzo which in my opinion are MUCH better, as are The Paris and New York New York for the price they charge. I expect all 5* hotels to offer turn down as standard, but this is not the case - you have to request it - which we knew from this website so did it when we checked in.....however it was only done on one night and this was only after I complained again!!!! At the Palazzo and and The Venetian its standard - it's not at The Paris and New York New York, but then these hotels don't claim to be 5*!!!! When I mentioned this on check out, they said it was a shame we hadn't charged things to our room, as they would have credited us $50 - easy to say though wonder if they would have if we'd had an outstanding balance?! The rooms are lovely - the mini bar food snacks did have a thin layer of dust on them, but guessing the cleaners don't want charges to happen when they clean. Aside from that the beds are comfortable, bathrooms large with a TV and a nice seating area by the window. On our first night we did awake to hear the club - mainly the base from the music (after discussing this on check out if you are looking out over the pool area you will hear it even if you are high), but as the hotel was full all they could offer were ear plugs, and said we could move the next day - we did and were then by an elevator but we never heard this - t I thought if they had been big on customer service we would have been upgraded - but that isn't what this hotel prides itself on I suppose.....we in fact had a worse view after our view but at least slept soundly. We saw "Le Reve" which was very good but not as good as "O" although the theatre is better (fyi this show is never sold at discount booths on the strip), we also saw Peep Show as I love "Girls from the Playboy Mansion" but it was pretty poor to be honest and Holly is beyond wooden, we also saw Chris Angel - who is no David Copperfield - I thought his show was in fact airing on really bad compared to David Copperfield. However we did get 241 on this so couldn't really complain. Location wise you are at the end of the nicest part of the strip, but we had a car so this wasn't a problem, and to get to The Wynn you don't have to walk outside. It's also opposite Fashion Show Mall which is a good thing. Restaurant wise think they could consider vegetarians more - although The Wynn Buffet does cater for vegetarians very well. The casino seemed always rather quiet, and it was too cold to use the pool when we were there but it did look nice. The butterfly theme is lovely but I felt it could have been carried through to the rooms. Also I am big on finishing touches and the mixture of chrome and gold in the bedrooms felt a little off to me - have one or the other - both doesn't work. I wouldn't stay here again - it's a nice hotel but not special enough to stay at again - The Venetian still has my heart!

Reviews.Title: “The ONE to choose”
Reviews.Author: A2409H
Reviews.Content: Last December my boyfriend and I went to Vegas for the first time. After doing our research, we decided to stay at Encore at the Wynn. Let me just add that we are very picky and choosy with hotels. Always takes us forever to decide on one. This time we definitely made the right decision!!! While in Vegas we went to almost all the hotels in Vegas to check them out for our future trip there and we can honestly say that we stayed at the best. Will definitely go back and stay at the Encore at the Wynn. As a matter a fact it will be the only hotel we stay in Vegas!!! We were told that one of restaurant at the hotel has the best buffet in town, unfortunately we didn't get to try cos its always full and packed. If you want to go there, make sure you plan ahead and get there way before/after the lunch or dinner rush hours. All in all - 2 thumbs up and additional 2 toes up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: picasso6319
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Encore at the Wynn at the recommendation of our travel consultant. We had two bags of new purchases go missing from our room. When this was reported to the hotel, they stated that they have a policy which does not cover hotel guests property in their room during or after their stay. We have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world and this has to be the worst customer service we have ever experianced.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Nice and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Marchvisitor2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore for five nights, The room was great, the service including housekeeping was notihng but the best. Our room was on the 25th floor right near the elevator and we never so much as heard the elevators. The Encore is at the edge of the strip and actually that was a positive. As always in when staying at a Las Vegas Hotel you pay more than you should for food - take out coffee etc. but that is no different than any other hotel in Las Vegas. The buffett at the ajoining Wynn was over $30 but one of the better ones I have been to. It was great to stay there, I have stayed at the Venetian previously and the Encore room was my favourite. I have to be honest and say I hate the red decor in the main areas of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great room.”
Reviews.Author: glasgowgirl67
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 5 night stay at Encore and enjoyed it very much. The room was gorgeous and very spacious and the view from the 63rd floor was awesome. We were travelling with our 9 year old boy and there was plenty of space for the three of us in our room with 2 queen beds. I have to say that on this stay we ended up going to all the restaurants in the Wynn hotel rather than the Encore. They are attached by a row of beautiful shoppes. The SW steakhouse was incredible(make sure you try for a table right on the water for the water and light show at night) and the Pizza Place was really great too overlooking a lovely waterfall. I think next time it is going to be a tough decision as to which one to pick Wynn or Encore. I like the Encore rooms better but the restaurants and location of the Wynn are more to my liking. Even though they are attached the Wynn is just that much closer to the other good hotels and the Fashion show mall. By the way the burgers across the street at Strip Burger at the front right corner of the Fashion Show mall are great and my son said the fries and the cookie and cream milkshakes were the best. Steve Wynn does everything in great taste. My husband did a round of golf there and said it was very nice but Shadow Creek is nicer for the 500 dollar green fees. P.S. all the staff I encountered were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “7 star”
Reviews.Author: bear8400
Reviews.Content: Simply Beautiful! Professional staff, friendly, never felt out of place (we're not high rollers). Suffocated but not pretentious. Steve Wynn is by far the finest resort owner in Las Vegas. Encore At Wynn is a CLASS ACT.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay any place else while in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CRBPoker
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Vegas from 3/15 - 3/18. Got in early Monday morning and expected room not to be ready. Bags were checked in right away and said they would call as soon as room was ready. Within 2 hours they called and had room ready. I told them it was my wife's and my 2 year anniversary and they moved us up to a higher floor. Didn't know it but they also upgraded our standard room to a jr. suite!!! Everyone and I do mean EVERYONE that worked at Encore was extremely friendly and helpful. First my wife is extremely allergic to feathers and while we checked in I asked that all feather be removed from the room and they said no problem. When we got to the room all evidence with feathers were removed. It was wonderful. Also while picking up our room key at the front desk they called the bell desk to have our bags taken up to our room. Within 10 min they were they and the bell man was very polite and answered all our questions. We noticed there wasn't any bubble bath and he called housekeeping and 5 min later we had bubble bath that was delivered in a nice little bag. The room was immaculate. Only one little issue was there were 2 black hairs on the shower wall that was taken care of within seconds. The hotel is beautiful and warm feeling. We ate at Switch steakhouse and the food was incredible! Every 20 min the room "switches" by walls moving and/or the ceiling opening. Enough good things cannot be said about this hotel. My wife and I will always stay there when we are there on our own from now on, until the next Wynn adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Racist Staff and no sleep”
Reviews.Author: nicebizguy
Reviews.Content: I intentionally waited over a week to write this review to make sure I was speaking from a rational place... so here you go... "You are in America, that is not how we pronounce it here" Front Desk Clerk at check in "It is what it is, we cannot shut down the night club" Front Office Supervisor "And why do you expect me to change your room?" Front Desk Clerk after night of hell All the quotes are accurate with the first one being directed to my Mexican-American travelling companion who happens to be a Vice President of IT and, not that it matters - GREW UP AND WAS BORN IN THE U.S. - and witnessed by two attorneys who were traveling with us.... and in reference, of all things, to the pronunciation of his own name. As this took place at check in and we had 5 days to spend, we thought it better to not make a big deal and move on... although this bitter and completely ignorant comment never left our minds.... Add to that the nightclub that kept us awake until 3am.. and we were on the 17th floor...followed by the move at 3am to a LOWER FLOOR..lol...(what?). Apparently, they must make a lot more money from the nightclub patrons than their guests that gamble and dine and drink at their restaurants because I see now this is a consistant problem with the management staff apparently uninterested in fixing it by simple keeping the music to a dull roar.....and the consistantly astoundingly bad attitude from the front desk we will never stay here again. We have stayed at both the Bellagio and the Venetian in the past and will be happy to stay there again... but never again at anything owned by Steve Wynn...

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Crasie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, worth the extra money if you are not sure, trust me book it!!! Everything is great from the rooms to the food!!! Any questions, feel free to email me! Club XS is a must if you want to go to a club!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: LBlowers48
Reviews.Content: The Encore was a fabulous place to stay! First class all the way - from the rooms to the employees. Didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievablely amazing; I'm planning a trip back ASAP!”
Reviews.Author: Hunter725
Reviews.Content: I just got back from one of the best trips of my life to the Encore; hopefully a few ideas will help you: Registration - not longer than what you would expect, maybe 15 minutes on a busy Sunday afternoon, very helpful and sunny staff! Room - did the standard upgrade to a panoramic for $25/night. Totally worth it! Was on the 58th floor with a view that honestly took my breath away every time I walked into the room. Mountains, strip, mountains. Panoramic doesn't do it justice. Beds were to die for, the room itself was enormous, and the bathroom was like a palace. Cleanliness - I was on the lookout after reading the other reviews: the spots on the marble floor are definitely detergent of some kind that won't come off easily. The designer who picked the speckled marble should be faulted, not the cleaning staff. Everything else was perfect. And as someone else mentioned, if you call down and ask them to change the linens they will oblige without hesitation - otherwise they make up your room in every way that you would expect from a luxury hotel (including hanging up a piece of lingerie I absentmindly left out and my partner's pants, contrary to another review I read). Restaurants - Was wowed by them all. Ate at Daniel Boulud @ Wynn overlooking the Lake of Dreams and had what I can only describe as a lovely, adventurous, and satiating meal. The Society Cafe and Wazuzu @ Encore were both great options (and you can enjoy the "Switch" from the Switch Restaurant in the Casino and in Society Cafe)! The bartender informed us it was the most expensive restaurant ever built...?! The breakfast buffet was great, but that was the ONLY time I was ever even slightly disappointed in the service (no OJ/coffee refills, someone was trying to get a stain out between us and another table VERY awkwardly, waiters were more interested in talking amongst themselves). The Terrace Point Cafe was A+! Mimosas were only $7 and they had a bacon/avocado omelette to die for. The Cafe in Wynn was very overpriced, but if you're looking to spoil yourself, spend a few days in complete relaxation, and feel like you are in paradise - then it's all worth it! Bars - didn't get to XS/Tryst, but spent my birthday at (the slightly more intimate) Blush, just off the casino. With outdoor heaters and "reserved" signs that they invite you to ignore, we were able to spend an amazing evening sipping outstanding Mojitos, Redbull Vodkas, and Manhattans until late having the time of our lives . Even though we were in more of a lounge-y mood and I didn't have on fake eyelashes or 7 inch heels, I felt comfortable and welcomed by both patrons and staff. The bathrooms @ Blush were the best - small/dark mirrored tiles abound! However, my absolute favorite bar (unexpectedly!) was Parasol Up @ Wynn. In the center of it all, the circular bar is classy and relaxed but also evokes a real sense of Vegas, waitresses in SHORT cocktail dresses, everyone smoking a cigarette or cigar, and a sort of intimate friendliness that I loved instantly. The Pear-A-Sol was the best drink I have ever had. Also, a brief mention to the Eastside Lounge @ Encore, it overlooks the pool and it perfect for an afternoon "El Toro" to pick you up (red bull/tequila/etc). Drinks around the resort are $6 for domestic beers, $7 for imports, at least $8-10 for a cheap glass of wine, and typically $12 or 14 for a cocktail. But let me say this, after two $12 Pear-A-Sols, I was feeling fine! Enough said. Pool/Spa - Pools were lovely, had a blast in the hottub outside and had a nice chat with the bartenders @ the over 21 pool bar. Biggest regret was not getting to experience the Spa, that main golden waiting room all over the website really is that grand. Casino - I mainly stayed to the slots (as I'm still garnering courage to play some of the more intense games), but I thought the Encore casino was outstanding. It was open and light in contrast to basically every other one I saw (and had seen before). Put it this way, you could tell that time of day it was and it wasn't crowded. The Wynn casino had a bit more life while still retaining a good amount of that open feel. Decor - The thing I think I liked the best about Encore was it's style. I loved the red and the butterflies, and the way it was so over-the-top was playful and I felt like it was almost slightly making fun of itself in a graceful way. I couldn't stop being awestruck; every little detail was considered. I didn't see that in ANY of the other hotels we checked out. Staff - Basically every time we had an encounter with a staff member, it was pleasant. I think it could get slightly better, but you could tell that you were dealing with real people and not robots - it was a diverse staff, which I liked as well. Shows - Le Reve was outstanding, but was a bit corny at times. I appreciated the live music, but the songs were really all like "should I follow my dream? do I love him?" Blah. But the performers themselves were all incredible and I liked that it was very upbeat and pleasing to the eye. We sat in the 3rd Row and were barely misted at one point, and the front row was "splashed" once or twice. I could rave about the Encore all day. I honestly want to go back soon, and even though it was my first time to Vegas I can't say enough about it. Since we're in our 20's I was expecting to feel a bit removed from the "action" of the mid-strip, but then I realized that all the action I wanted was within our resort. It was upscale and perfect. PS - My boyfriend secretly bought me a Wynn robe for my birthday, and I almost died... it is so comfortable, plus it is a perfect memento from the trip of a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “"Beautiful hotel"”
Reviews.Author: chattykathy2
Reviews.Content: After staying at the other end of the strip the last couple of years, I really wanted to stay at this end this time around. Although we had a wonderful experience at the "Encore" it is quite a walk to get anywhere so you need to be in god shape or be prepared to cab it a lot. The service we had was excellent from check in to departure. The only sore spot was waiting for service in the bar one night. After sitting for about 20 minutes and being ignored by the waitresses we finally got up and left. There was four of us so it wasn't like we were invisible but maybe we didn't look moneyed enough to be served. Other than that one bad experience the rest of the staff were great. The check in was very quick and we were upgraded without charge to a panoramic view on the 51st floor as there were no rooms left that we had reserved. Our suite was amazing and was kept spotless by our housekeeper "Dora" who introduced herself to us the next morning. I can't really comment on the restaurants as we ate off resort for most of our meals. We did go to the buffet at the "Wynn" and loved it. The pool area was kept very clean and staff were also friendly there.I had the best sleeps on the very comfortable beds with the most amazing pillows. You can buy them for $99.00 in the home store which was very tempting. We also found our suite very quiet. We saw people on both sides of us but didn't hear any noise when we were in our room at all. I only wish that this hotel was a little bit closer to the action further down the strip but can't find any other faults with this beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravelandwine
Reviews.Content: I was just in Vegas for a friends wedding and stayed at Encore in the Tower Suites. I was 100% impressed with the Tower Suites and agree that its the best of both worlds. It has a seperate checkin which is very chill with concierge, belldesk, front desk, vip lounge and elevators so you dont have to go through a big hotel to get to your room. From this area there are also doors that open up into the regular Encore so that you have quick access to all the facilities at Encore and Wynn. I had a note on my reservation that I'd be checking in early but assumed my room wouldnt be ready since i was checking in at 10am and normal checkin was at 3pm. To my happy surprise the room was ready. We were on the 29th floor. The room was perfect, great seating area, desk, fabulous views, beautiful bathroom with tub and shower and double vanity with seating! Right after check in i called for a spa appointment which they were able to slot me in immediately for. The spa was stunning, one of the most beautiful I've ever seen. My treatment was great and the facilities of the spa are great. I also had a manicure at the salon which was great. Whenever I am in Vegas again, I will only stay at Encore Tower Suites!

Reviews.Title: “You'd better like red”
Reviews.Author: Beaker40
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for a conference, and get out there maybe a couple times a year. I usually stay at the Bellagio or Mandalay, so this was my first time at Encore. While it was exquisitely beautiful with no expense spared, it was also red beyond belief (and I happen to hate that color). Also, the restaurants are exceptionally overpriced and I didn't have one meal I would call memorable (except for the sticker shock). If you want a quick sandwich, good luck, unless you want to trek down to the Wynn. I ordered a simple pizza and a beer at the bar of one restaurant and $33 later was served what would have been $12-15 anywhere else on the planet. It's like Disney - really good to look at, but it's style over substance and you never really get past the fact that you're being hosed. The room was great though, and the quality of the hookers trying to sneak by security posted at the elevators was better than I've ever seen. I'm always amazed by the hookers in Vegas - both by their stunning beauty but also how they stand out like sore thumbs. Hot chicks by themselves in 6" stiletto heels and the ever present cell phone to their ear is a dead giveaway. But I digress...nice hotel, but next time I'm hoping my conference is at Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Encore, Almost There; But Not Quite”
Reviews.Author: Lola1177
Reviews.Content: Before our trip to Vegas and staying at the Encore, my brother and I read most of the reviews posted. Therefore, we knew what to expect in the way of check in, room upgrades, ect. We stayed 4 nights, March 6-10. Upon arrival, our bags were promptly taken by a young gentlemen that announced to us he could not take our bags up to our room but they would be stored and to call the Bell Captain when we were checked in. Check in was about a 10 minute wait but the desk attendant was very pleasant. We had a king suite and requested an upgrade to a Queen which was not available. We also requested a high floor which was a $20 per night extra charge, which we took. Since they did not have a Queen available, (we checked in on a sat.) whe offered a roll-a-way bed and no extra costs (which is usually $20 per night, so the high floor extra charge was basically a wash). Additionally, we had read where noise from the night club and the construction out front was disturbing. We heard neither from the 62nd floor. I would suggest that you ask for an even numbered room as they face south with a view of the strip. We had a northern view with limited stip views but did have a nice view of the mountains. We stayed in a room next to the elevator but never heard a thing nor did we hear any neighbors thru the walls as reported by previous reviews. The room was well appointed with the upgrades you would expect in a 5 star property. The bathroom was large with a small TV, robes for your stay and standard ammenities. We had stayed at the Wynn previously and therefore knew how the snacks and mini bar worked. Don't take the items off their resting spot for more than a few seconds or they are charged to your room. We did notice signs at the elevator saying "no outside food or beverages allowed to be brought in". We brought a few things and were never questioned. The bellman promptly brought our luggage, filled our ice bucket and made sure our roll-a-way request was honored. Of course, as in everywhere in Vegas, everybody gets tipped. The decor is red and black everywhere, no number in the 40's anywhere as 4's are an unlucky number in the Asian culture we were told. There is ample storage for cloths, a safe for your valuables, a 42" TV that is mounted on a swivel, and WiFi abailable for $13.99 per day (we did not use this as we had a Verizon card). Drapes and sheers are remotely controlled by a pannel beside the bed as are the room lights. Maid service was good but they did forget to empty our garbage one day which I will ding them for. We did leave a tip at the end of our stay for the maids. Encore property is smaller than the Wynn and the gaming was tighter I thought. Cocktail services were good as was what food we comsumed on the property. VERY pricey and small servings. No in room coffee pot, coffee is $4 a cup downstairs BUT you get one free refill. They mark your cup upon the refill to prevent you from getting another. It is quite a walk from Encore to other strip properties but with use of the bus system, tram and shuttles, it is not bad if you are not in a hurry. Although we had passes to EX, (the night club) we did not go as there was a long line every night; however, if you are a hotel guest, there is a shorter line; $30 for guys and $20 for ladies but free tickets can be had if you ask. We bought a few small things in the gift shop which were also "pricey". In summary, I would give Encore a 4.5 having stayed in most of the properties on the strip, it is not the best value for the money; I think Paris is; however, it is a "beautiful people" place and I would stay there again. We go to Vegas at least twice a year and consider ourselves savory travelers. Be sure to take advantage of the free shuttle services to the off strip casinos and outlet malls. You can catch them right across the street from the Wynn at the Fashion Mall. Cabs are not the best way to get around unless you are in a hurry. The Deuce goes up and down the strip and can be ridden all day for $7; quite a deal, if you are not in a rush,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience- Encore is amazing”
Reviews.Author: jennyboyson
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Encore at Wynn from March 3-8. Upon arriving at the drop off at Encore, we were immediately pleasantly welcomed by the bell man and he promptly took our bags to take care of until we could check in. When it was time to check in and we entered the hotel, I was speechless, it is absolutely gorgeous, I have never seen any hotel/casino that is so architecually and decoratively stunning. There were quite a few guests in line ahead of us but we had to wait no more than five minutes, the registration lady was friendly and efficient. We were so excited to see our room as we had looked at a lot of pictures of the resort suites and hoped it was exactly as shown, and it was. The suite had an enourmous foyer/hallyway, upon entering. The bed was amazingly comfortable, the nighstand had an automatic control panel which you could control the shades/drapes/lighting and even the privacy status on your room (none of those plastic door hangy things needed!) The bathroom was gorgeous, with a huge vanity, and I especially liked the parlour chair and mirror for the ladies to do their make-up, that was a nice touch. The room was clean, tastefully decorated and all around perfect. The casino in the Encore is just as beautiful as the rest of the resort. We had no problems with the cocktail waitresses service, and sometimes we were only playing penny slots. The minimum bets for table games were a little high for us, but that is to be expected at a world class resort, so we went to other casinos that had lower min. bets. Not an issue at all. My boyfriend surprised me with a massage at the Encore Spa. The day before that I was reading the spa services menu at was saying there is no way I would ever pay $150 for a 50 minute massage! The spa was ornate, I thought I was shocked to see the beauty of the resort itself but once I entered the spa it knocked my socks off! The nice thing about having a spa service is that you can use the spa facilities for that entire day, free of charge. There is the gym, eucalyptus sauna, 3 different temperature whirpools, hot massage like chairs and beautiful showers. I felt slightly out of place at the spa because it seemed like a place only for the rich an famous, but they were not the ones who made me feel that way at all, they were very warm and welcoming. From the instant we arrived, to the moment we hopped in the cab to the airport home, the entire experience was wonderful, words cannot express how pleased I am with everything and everyone at the Encore. All of the resort staff were cheery and kind, the resort was beautiful and comfortable, and it was an amazing experience, what more could you ask for? I cannot wait to come back to Las Vegas and stay at Encore again. I will be back, no doubt about that. If anyone has questions, please feel free to message me!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best in vegas”
Reviews.Author: edwina50
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time at this hotel. Room was immaculate and very comfortable, classed as a suite but more like a large room partitioned. Plenty of space though. General surroundings very classy. Staff were professional yet friendly and helpfull. Only down side is that from our room the night club was very loud, we were on 6th floor, wouldn't suit a light sleeper! We visit vegas every year and have stayed in quite a few hotels this is definitely one of the best. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous customer service; clean, modern decor; exquisite amenities; excited to return soon.”
Reviews.Author: somelikeithotEL
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival the concierge was more than friendly. A series of questions guaranteed that we would be well attended to during our stay. The f loor level was easily navigatable despite including several restaurants, bars, shopping and a full casino. The entrance elevators to the Encore tower was personally attended to by subtle security guards in order to prevent unncessary intrusion in the tower. The room itself was very well kept. Spotless even. Will lit and pleasantly laid out to be comfortable for even a night in, had we chosen not to enjoy the vast entertainment that even just the Wynnn alone has to offer. There are two theatre, a nightclub, garden and all the other previously mentioned entertainment venues. The room was fully of all the technological amenities of home and more. Remote controlled lighting and curtains and to the comfort and luxury. Overall, this has been one of my favorite stays in Las Vegas, I anticipate staying here again the next time I return.

Reviews.Title: “Encore suites are impressive”
Reviews.Author: RJRWi
Reviews.Content: The suites at the Encore are very nice. Large foyer and bathroom. Nice LCD flat panel TVs and a TV in the bathroom. Be prepared to walk, especially if you are going anywhere south on the strip. If I can get another good rate, I'd certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpecialK0900
Reviews.Content: This was probably the best hotel I have ever stayed at. We got an amazing deal through Expedia that included our flight and hotel stay. The room was clean and offered so many things that other hotels don't. The bathroom was big with his/her sinks, a nice shower and massive bath tub. There was also a TV and bath robes in the bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable and soft. Needless to say, it was very easy to fall asleep on! Right beside the bed there were controls that turned off the lights and closed the curtains. The view was okay but didn't overlook the strip. The service was excellent. We were able to check in around noon and were given a $75 resort credit that we used at the buffet for two breakfasts. The food was amazing and definitely worth eating. The casino isn't very big and didn't have too many fun slots to play. The Encore pool was open but it was too cold to swim. We were told we could use the Wynn pool but it was closed for some reason. The only bad thing I could say was the location on the strip for this hotel. It's a long walk to get to the middle/south end of the strip where more things seem to be happening. Overall, I couldn't complain about the hotel or the service. It was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: CRDSC
Reviews.Content: The Encore is in a class by itself. I was totally blown away by the level of personalized service provided by a hotel with over 2000 rooms. Attention is paid to every detail at this property. From the moment we arrived at the Private Tower Suites Entrance until we checked out the service never stopped. Their was no line or waiting to check in and it was if everyone in the hotel knew our names and knew we were coming. We were personally escorted to our suite and our baggage was there as soon we got there. If you have ever stayed at other large properties in Vegas you know it sometimes takes forever just to get your luggage. We stayed in a Salon Suite on the 59th floor overlooking the entire strip. The suite was over 2000 square feet and with attention to every detail. The hotel and our suite was immacutely clean with every amenity you could imagine. I have stayed at the Bellagio and the Venetian and neither property can hold a candle to the service provided at the Encore. As a frequent guest of Ritz Carlton properties, I rarely stay at properties other than a Ritz. I must say the Encore set a new standard of service by which I will judge all future hotels. It is obvious the staff genuinely cares and that upper management at the hotel is outstanding. Make sure to eat at any of their great restaurants. Everything I ate while at the Encore was out of this world. If you are planning a trip to Las Vegas you will be doing yourself an injustice if you choose to stay anywhere but the Encore LasVegas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: pjc115
Reviews.Content: The Encore was the perfect hotel for our stay as we were only going to be there 2 days. Arriving at 11:30 at night no problem with the check in, receiving a room on the 30th floor overlooking the strip, pool and golf course. We had no problems with any noise. Everything at the Encore was first class form the Wynn buffet to the Spa(massage) to the shows ( Le Reve and Garth). What I liked most about the Encore was it wasn't as crowded as the Wynn within a 2 minute walk you are back in a nice relaxed atmosphere. Everybody there was very helpful and friendly. I can't understand how people could nitpick with this hotel it is a first class operation and I would definately stay there again in fact I don't think I would stay anywhere else other than maybe the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best on the Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: goDNA
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Encore for 4 nights back in August. I am a frequent Vegas visitor and have stayed at other high end properties on the strip including the Bellagio, The Hotel at Mandalay Bay, Caesar's Palace, The Signature at MGM Grand, Wynn, Venetian, and the Palazzo. I'd have to say that in terms of ambiance, amenities and customer service, this is certainly the best hotel I've stayed in Vegas so far. LOCATION: This is probably the only slight drawback to this property and may not be ideal for first time Vegas visitors . It is on the northern end of the strip and is connected to the Wynn via a climate controlled walkway lined with upscale shops. The Wynn/Encore complex offers plenty of shopping, dining and entertainment options (although pricey!). The walk to the Wynn is brief and once there, the more central areas of the strip can be accessed rather quickly. CHECK-IN: Lines were long but moved fairly quickly. Front desk staff was friendly and cheerful. I booked a standard resort room with Expedia and asked for a room with a view. She offered a room on the 59th floor for a nightly upgrade fee of $50. I gamely took the offer and wasn't disappointed at all (see pictures). By the way, the hotel puts a nightly hold of $150 per night on your credit card for incidentals (eg. room service, movies, etc). You'll get this amount released less the actual amount you've charged to your room account after check out. I'm just mentioning this since I've read posts on the Las Vegas forum here on TA wondering about this little detail. All the hotels I've stayed in all over the world have a similar policy but the Vegas high end properties tend to charge much higher ($150/night is typical). ROOMS: For an extra $50 night, I ended up in a panoramic room with spectacular wide views of the strip as well as the Encore/Wynn pool complex and the Wynn golf course. The pictures really don't do justice to just how dramatic the strip views are! The decor is one of understated elegance- luxurious and sophisticated but at the same time warm, relaxing and comfortable. There's a 42" flat screen HDTV (with HD programming) that swivels 360 degrees so you can watch TV from your bed or from the living room/work desk area. The king bed is extremely comfortable (probably the most comfortable bed in Vegas) with 300 thread count sheets and a down comforter encased in a duvet cover. There's a bedside device that allows you to control the lights, curtains, as well as the privacy setting, all from the comfort of your bed. The bathroom is spacious with a large bath tub that is separate from the shower. There's also a 9" flat screen TV in the bathroom. There are nice little touches in the room that really make your stay special such as having your name displayed on the touch screen phone and on the main menu of the TV. There's a snack/minibar station with really yummy treats. As expected in a resort of this caliber, the items there are very expensive. At about 700 square feet, this room is slightly smaller than the standard room at the Pallazo or at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay, but substantially larger and far superior than the standard room at the Bellagio. Overall, I actually prefer the decor and ambiance of this room than the rooms of the resorts I've previously stayed in on the Vegas strip. DINING: For this trip, I dined at Wazuzu and Society Cafe. The food and service at both places were excellent, although a bit pricey. I also had breakfast at the buffet at the Wynn and the selection and quality of the food there is still the best on the strip in my opinion. I also ordered room service on a couple of occasions and the food were prepared impeccably and arrived on the time promised. The room service menu is quite extensive, ranging from quick eats such as sandwiches and burgers to fine dining selections such as steaks . On my previous stay at the Wynn, I had dined at Wing Lei and SW Steakhouse and the food at both establishments was outstanding. SERVICE: The service here is simply impeccable. Every single member of the staff encountered, from the front desk staff to the bellmen to the room service delivery waiters to the hotel maids, was genuinely helpful and willing to make your stay pleasant. ISSUES: In my experience from previous stays at upscale resorts everywhere, there are always issues that surface regardless of how spectacular a property is or no matter how hard working or pleasant the staff are. This is particularly true in Vegas mega resorts and the Encore is no exception. A few things I've encountered: 1) the noise from club XS is loud and can be heard even on the higher floors. I was on the 59th floor and even at that height, I could still hear the noise from the club, albeit the noise level is substantially muted and didn't really bother me enough to prevent me from sleeping. Luckily, this happened on my last night there and the club is only open Thursday-Saturday nights. I can only imagine how bothersome it must have been for those staying in the lower floors. 2) thin walls between rooms. I could hear the TV from my next door neighbor (although muted and not really particularly bothersome) and could hear doors slamming and people's conversations on the hallway. I had the same complaint during my stay at the Wynn. Pretty surprising considering the amount of money spent to build this complex. 3)turn down service not offered automatically. This is really no big deal and more nit picking. You would have to request it to get it. At other resorts such as the Palazzo/Venetian and the Bellagio, this is something you'd get without asking. IN CONCLUSION: I tend not to stay at the same property twice since I like trying out different resorts, particularly on my Vegas trips. But after this recent stay at the Encore, I must say that this is the only resort that I would actually consider for a future stay. I just really loved this place. It is elegant without being pretentious. Everything about this place exudes luxury, from the stunning lobby with the beautiful mosaic marble floors and flowers and trees that bring nature in, to the little unique art details in the casino and hallways to the extremely comfortable rooms. With the opening of City Center, there will be plenty more resorts to consider, but Encore will always be a close competitor.

Reviews.Title: “Encore, would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsS_09
Reviews.Content: We (myself and hubby, both mid 20's) stayed at the Encore in August 2009 for 5 nights. the rooms: the room was one of the most well apointed accomodations we have ever stayed in, from the rotating tv, to the breathtaking view, as well as the little touches such as personalizing the tv and telephone with our names. We never heard the "noise" of the nightclub as other reviewers have posted. We ordered room service which was delicious! Spa: We booked a couples massage which was quite relaxing. The spa itself is beautiful so bring your camera! Casino: During our stay we visited various casino's on the strip, and Encore being relatively new we found was very bright (there were windows) and didn't have the lingering smell of cigarettes that the others had. It was never tooo too crowded and there were always waitresses seen around taking orders. Pools: We are definitely pool people, and the Encore did not disappoint here. The pools were beautiful and we enjoyed all of them. We tried lots of smoothies on the drink menu and they were all delicious! During the weekend however, it was impossible to find loungers and keep in mind we are relatively early risers, so we decided to hit the casino instead. A little bit of a let down but we got over it. Food: since we were visiting for 5 days we decided to eat mostly at restaurants at Wynn/Encore so we could just charge to our room. Its been a while, but our dinner at Botero, and the sushi restaurant facing the waterfall were definitely the most memorable for me! The breakfasts everywhere were yummy, they did eggs benedict really well. Clubs: We checked out both Tryst and XS, and they were both impressive!! I believe we contacted the hotel/concierge desk while we were there and they were able to provide us complimentary passes, we still had to wait in line but this was definitely a nice touch for Encore to accomodate their hotel guests. Both clubs had a really goodlooking crowd and we enjoyed the experience. Shows: We saw Le Reve. It was a surprise from hubby and he got the VIP seats with champagne and chocolate strawberries. What a delight! I highly recommend this as the seats had a great view and another small screen to see alternative views of the show (behind the scenes, and the performers under water). This show was outstanding and nothing like anything we've seen before. Overall comments: The Encore offers the complete Vegas experience with a modern upscale twist; every aspect of this place is incredible!! The hotel is situation near the end of the Vegas strip, so if you want to be right in the middle of the action this place is probably not for you. If you have a high level of standards in terms of quality of food, entertainment, and accomodations, book this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Encore Gets It Right”
Reviews.Author: K&L092906
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Encore in the last 3 months. They get it right - awesome service, beautiful casino and resort, luxurious rooms and the most comfortable beds in the world! No detail is missed!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Held at Encore/Wynn-Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bocephs
Reviews.Content: I recently had my wedding at the Wynn in Las Vegas. We stayed at their partner hotel, Encore, but the wedding was at Wynn. I cannot speak highly enough of everyone I worked with in the Wedding Salon, but especially Rebecca Salvo. If you are having a wedding in Las Vegas I would definitely contact Rebecca Salvo at Wynn. She was proactive, amazing, and made the entire day a breeze. A great resource to have on such a stressful day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Service but Skip the Casino”
Reviews.Author: murphyclc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. Hotel is lavish and well and done. Room was huge with comfy beds and spacious bathroom. The service was excellent in every aspect of the hotel. A few important nuances I took from the experience: 1. Don't expect Comps. We played at the Wynn and Encore for three days and got zero comps. That's okay as our room was already a deal and we got a few other perks but this is a high-end resort and they don't have to give you anything. 2. Don't waste your time in the Encore casino. We took the two minute walk to the Wynn everyday and loved it. The Wynn Sports Book is generous with drinks as long as your betting $2 horse races or more. You get one drink ticket for every bet. Dealers were very friendly at the Wynn and we won more than we lost. Overall, the Encore is a great place to park it but venture to the Wynn for your entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kimba2122
Reviews.Content: I'm glad to see people are finally starting to write positive reviews and give this hotel the credit it deserves. We arrived on a Tuesday afternoon before check in so they asked for a cell phone number to call as on when our room was ready. While we were checking in I overheard a gentleman who couldn't believe that his room wasn't ready and what did they expect him to do while he waited. This bothered me to see as confirmations clearly indicate hotel check in times and this is just a part of the system. It's these types of people that makes huge deals out of nothing and come on here and put down the hotels when it was just the hotel following procedure. We waited maybe 20 minutes for our room and loved our upgrade to a panoramic view on the 54th floor. The room and hotel are very elegant and there is a lot of detail. This time of year there was a lot of emphasis on Chinese New Year in all the hotels and this fit in very well with Encore's red theme. I highly suggest watching the hotel channel on your room's TV to find out more little secrets about what to see within the hotel, or reading the hotels magazine which is also in your room. Things such as the crystal dragon in Wazuzu which is meant to bring good luck, to the Lake of Dreams at Parasol. What I liked most about this hotel was the fact that it was away from the hustle and bustle of the centre part of the strip. As there isn't much directly beside the Encore at the moment, no one uses these hotels as a walk-thru creating major pedestrian traffic. The crowd is a little older and the casinos aren't overly packed or smoky at all. The hotel seems to pick up in the evening as XS is quite the hot spot and getting through that hallway can be challenging at times when the club is open. Be sure to make use of your red card and ask if you have enough points for things like the Buffet. Having a redcard also allows you to bypass lines or have shorter lines for the restaurants or clubs within the two hotels. There are a couple of negative things I read in other review that I can now comment on myself now that I've been there and maybe help confirm to others that are yet to stay here. 1) Noise from the nightclub being heard in rooms - TRUE We had a view facing the strip and were on the 54th floor and could hear music and booming from XS down below. It wasn't excessive and we could certainly sleep through it. I will agree with those people that commented that you can hear it; I can't imagine what it would be like to be on a very low floor. Perhaps those that have said they can't have north facing rooms? On the bright side, the club isn't open every night but when it is its open until about 5 am. 2) Doors slamming - TRUE I suppose it's for security and fire purposes but the room doors do slam upon entering and exiting. We tried to force the door to close slowly but it's almost forces itself against you to try and slam anyways. 3) Dust - TRUE Our housekeeping came in a did a great job but it's definitely obviously that not many people take advantage of those treats you have to pay for on top of the cabinet with the mini bar. A thick layer of dust had settled upon these items which I'm guessing will continue to build. However, I'd rather that layer of dust then housekeeping cleaning it off and accidentally triggering a charge to my room that I would later have to dispute. Regardless, I loved this hotel and would return in an instance. Many positive things to say and I highly recommend it here. Please feel free to contact me with specific questions.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular room and amenities”
Reviews.Author: johnsons658
Reviews.Content: Beautiful suite with great view and fantastic amenities. Staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Options”
Reviews.Author: jmccar41
Reviews.Content: This was my wife's first trip to Vegas and the Encore was a great choice. The hotel was relatively quiet with an upscale feel. We never felt crowded (like at the Venetian) or dirty (like TI). The check-in process was a pain, but was the only complaint. Housekeeping was prompt and pleasant, the room was spacious. Easy access to great shopping and restaurants. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: foogy67
Reviews.Content: Booked a room in The Tower Suite. From the time we parked the car eveything was perfect.Quality of room, staff, food.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not the finest Vegas has to offer”
Reviews.Author: djqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in February. We normally stay at the Bellagio, but we decided to give the Encore a try because we were going to the Garth Brooks concert. We were not terribly impressed with check-in. I mentioned out loud that I had asked for a higher floor when we originally booked. The desk clerk then said that she was giving us an upgrade. We were very grateful for this, and assumed that it would be a higher floor too. Not so. We were put on the 8th floor, which is almost street level (there are more than 60 floors in this place). I couldn't figure out what the upgrade was, as the room looked exactly the same as the pictures I'd seen when I booked. However, we didn't want to question it. We tried to sleep later that night and were awakened in the night by a "boom boom boom". Seems we were also placed near their XS Nightclub, which runs until the wee hours of the morning. It sounded like someone was playing the drums in my head, that's how loud it was. It was ridiculous. They offered to switch rooms for us, but we had five suitcases that we had already half unpacked. Not very convenient. We decided to live with the noise for two nights. We noticed there was no turndown on the first night, so we asked the concierge about this on the second night. He said you had to actually ask for turndown service (we never did anywhere else we stayed). We asked for turndown service on the second night, and came back to our room around 10:30 p.m. No turndown service. They forgot. Next time, we'll be back at the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here. You won't regret it.”
Reviews.Author: lyang
Reviews.Content: We were spoiled rotten. The room we stayed at was a king panoramic with a gorgeous view of the strip. Nice furnishings and very comfortable bed. Standard room size has to be one of the biggest in Vegas. Service was impeccable from the front desk to the end of stay. They have a lovely spa, in which I indulged in the stone massage. I highly recommend that service.. You could probably spend easily a couple of hours there just in the steam, sauna, and pools. We also visited some of their onsite restaurants and bars both in the Encore and Wynn. Alex was a treat and the 'wine guy' knew exactly what to pull out when I described what I wanted. (I'm telling you that wine list was so long.. I was getting dizzy reading it. ) The two other memorable meals I had on my trip.. (not related to Encore) was brunch at Bouchon and dinner at Joel Roubachon.. Both SPECTACULAR. I could go on and on about the food I had in Vegas, but I probably should put it on Chowhound. XS was so much fun... just go. They say it's impossible to get in, but it's not... and I went on Saturday night. Just wait in line around 10ish.. and the line goes fast. They don't pick and choose people; it's all very fair. Your entrance fee is discounted if you are a hotel guest. Hotel concierge can also get you passes to get into a shorter line seperate from general admission. I think you pay for the passes. After walking much of the strip and seeing the casinos, I am glad I chose Encore. The casino was less smokey, very elegant with natural lighting and 10 times as luxurious as the others. You can already tell the difference by the lobby and esplanade connecting to the Wynn that a decorator went nuts on these Wynn properties spicing up the corridors and spaces. The price point wasn't bad for the rooms, but I admit the food and drinks are very expensive on-site. As a last minute kooky thought.. both my husband and I liked watching the Wynn channel.. It's a taping of Steve Wynn himself describing all the restaurants, bars, and shops at his hotel... Basically- everything is wonderful, and grand.. it's his vision and he did it all for you. His voice is stuck in my head.. so weird. But he's right.. the place is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Extravagence galore!”
Reviews.Author: stephmcvail
Reviews.Content: My mom and I were invited to join my brother who is a VIP at the Encore. We stayed in a Salon Suite with an adjoining room. We were on a lower room so not a great view but the room was outstanding. I have attached pictures of the suite. The bathroom was beautiful and huge in both sides. We ordered room service for breakfast everyday and loved every bite. For dinners we ate at Okada, Botero, and Alex. Okada had lots to choose from since my mom doesn't eat sushi at all. I enjoyed the sashimi platter. Botero was good food but small portions. My meal came with a side of potato au gratin and I think it measured one inch all the way around! Alex was splendid but I see why you pay so much. There were small meals served in between each meal. I know there's a name for that but it escapes me right now. They also served us each a glass of champagne as we sat down. I just loved the individual purse stool! I took a purse with me just so I could take advantage of this! Unfortunately I can't comment on prices since we never paid for any meals or drinks! With my brothers play status we were able to use a pool cabana for the day. My brother stayed in the room and worked while mom and I got to know the cabana host really well! The drinks were fabulous and very strong. There was also a fruit platter and non-alc drinks in the fridge and a small flat screen t.v. We were on the second floor above the pool so the people watching was great. The drinks were so strong that after lunch at the Asian restaurant next to the casino, where more drinks were had, mom and I asked at Botero if we could cut thru the patio to get to the pool quicker than walking all the way around. My mom had no patience for asking permission and walked straight into the glass wall and completely knocked herself onto the floor!! I will say that I enjoyed the Encore atmosphere and the beautiful tile work but I got tired of the bright red that was EVERYWHERE! One more thing I wanted to mention was the concierge in the Encore Towers area was extremely helpful. My mom hadn't been to Vegas in 30 years and she had lots of questions for the concierge but she was very patient and spent lots of time with us! With my brothers play

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Boneal
Reviews.Content: Loved it. I would tell anyone to stay here! The hotel is beautiful

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable bed I have ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: luci5
Reviews.Content: Check in was a zoo with no proper lines. Waited 10 mins, asked for a quiet room on a high floor away from the noise of XS nightclub I’d read about. She said that would be north facing, but it wasn’t ready yet, could be 1-3 hours and took my mobile number to call when it was ready. Got a pool pass and went there for an hour. It was mobbed, the beds were very close together and it seemed cramped. Eventually found 3 beds that looked abandoned. No phone call, but checked back around 2 and our room was ready, 6347, on the 63rd floor which is the top floor and at the very end so as far away from the noise as it could be. Gorgeous room, bed area separated from living area with a marble divider and 48” flat screen TV that swivels between the two areas. The king bed was so comfy it was like sleeping on a cloud and I struggled to wake, electrically operated curtains and sheers, doorbell, privacy button rather than a card on the door. Floor to ceiling windows with a view of Circus Circus, Riviera and the north strip. Saw as far as the Plaza which is downtown. Mini bar, but we didn’t touch it as items moved for more than 60 secs are charged to the room. 3 seater black sofa and one of the seats was extended like a chaise long. There was a desk, fax machine and internet access at $13.99/24 hours. The fully mirrored walls made the suite seem twice the size and the room was spotless. There was a large bathroom with a very deep bath, separate shower, twin sinks and the toilet in a separate room with a phone. There were two bathrobes and digital weighing scales. Nice lemongrass and citrus toiletries – shampoo, conditioner, moisturiser, shoe polish, but there were only bars of soap instead of shower or bath gel. Large wardrobe with 3 drawers and the iron and ironing board and safe. There were also 4 drawers in the bedroom. We also had dinner at Switch at the Encore where the walls and ceiling change every 30 mins. We chose the Prix Fixe menu at $59 each and both had the same, Corn Chowder, Petit Filet Mignon with whipped potatoes and milk chocolate crunch bar. With 2 coffees and a bottle of wine the bill was $183 plus tip and was worth every penny. The service was excellent and friendly with 4 or 5 people serving us. They had noted that it was my birthday and with dessert brought out a lemon sorbet with “Happy Birthday luci” pipe in chocolate on the serving tray. Cocktail service was good in the casino and we had a couple of paralyzers which were very good. I would cetainly stay here again if I got another offer.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Encore”
Reviews.Author: hkplayer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed from February 10-13 (3 nights) at the encore. I think I will approach describing my experience from two lenses as this will help me share more information with everyone. Also, since I have been following ALL the reviews of the Encore on tripadvisor for the last 3 months it would only be fair to express my feelings as well... Big Picture View: - The hotel/lobby/casino is quite elegant, in my opinion. Compared to the older hotels on the strip, including recently turned old ones such as the venetian and palazzo, etc, the encore is head-and-shoulders above all of them in terms of condition and in terms of presentation. In both wynn and encore, the colour red is quite prevalent. So if that particular shade doesn't suit your eyes, the use of it might get to you. - The room we got was 716; seventh floor and was a two queen bed regular type room. The wynn's regular two-bed rooms have double beds, encore has queen beds. Though we were expecting a one king-bed room, they said that since the hotel was at capacity (due to conferences, etc) and that we arrived late (9pm) they could only offer an upgrade to a panoramic room with a king bed for an additional $20. We declined and enjoyed our separate queen beds on this trip (lol). Front desk attendant was nice nonetheless and she apologized for the inconvenience. The option to ask front desk the next afternoon for a king-bed room was suggested but we didn't bother since we weren't in the room that much anyway. - The room in general, was massive. Not sure where else in the current vegas hotel offering will a REGULAR room give you a room near the size of 700+ sq ft. We went to our friends' regular room at the bellagio on the 9th floor and their room, though nice, was what looked to be half the size of ours at the encore. - We didn't gamble that much so I cannot comment on the liquor service or dealers' attitudes. Detailed Picture View: - The bathroom in general is gorgeous, both wife and I easily agreed on this. Sure, there were what seemed to be dirty spots on very small areas of the floor. Being the person that I am, I went to such spots and picked at them with my fingernail. What the spots seemed like to me was that the tiles had weak areas where cleaning detergent actually penetrated through the surface and thus the detergent-type stains were indeed permanent. Nonetheless, the tiles are quite impressive in the bathroom and foyer areas so we never thought much of it after the initial inspection. There were dust bunnies in some corners. - The corner-type L-shaped couch in the room is a nice touch and is fairly comfy to sit in. The floor to ceiling windows is always nice. The button-activated drapes and sheers, privacy button, and individual room doorbell were nice as well. - The TV was big and very nice. I believe the brand was sharp, which is ok enough in my opinion. Yes, there is a small flat screen embedded on one of the side walls of the bathroom. Neat, but not required. - The extra big pillows on the beds, mostly to be used to lean against while watching tv or reading, are a nice touch for those utilizing those. - Housecleaning staff was, in my opinion, a little lazy. They tidied up the bathroom and made the beds, but did not refill the ice bucket or put the cup tray back in the dresser (perhaps they are not allowed to though). Nonetheless, since they did't go through our bags or steal anything of ours, I still like tipping them each day of our stay. - Though we didn't hear any construction noise at all, you can hear voices through a vent or pipe or something like that Some Conluding Thoughts: - I stayed at the mirage in January of 2009 and had a fairly positive review on their property on tripadvisor. Comparing that hotel to the encore, the latter is more intimate in terms of general vibe (not sure about service from hotel staff) and more elegant looking aesthetically. - I prefer to stay on this north end of the strip (mirage northward) due to it's more quiet atmosphere and since it's a little more on the higher end (and newer) side of the strip. - Cost wise, well, you could expect to pay more in general for encore. Hotel and flight packages that we received from where we are put us only $20 a night more for encore over mirage at least from one year to the next which gave us a total cost of about $120 a night at encore ($100 per night at mirage). Now I know what you are thinking, but it was that low for the most part, and I'm sure people have gotten better package deals than us for this resort or any one's equivalent. I wouldn't have been able to afford to stay the encore if it wasn't for such good package deals available to us, but now since we have experienced the luxury of encore (and wynn), we aren't sure if we will be able to go to other properties. All budget dependant I guess. - Ate at the wynn buffet in both january 2009 and this february 2010 trip. The alaskan king crab legs were better tasting (much less saltier) back in january 2009.
