The other items were still good tasting, however. - Being from the tourism and travel industry, I can appreciate how the wynn and encore have marketed themselves. But, as stated by other patrons on this site, they really have to work on giving more value-adds even on little things such as internet (which is so cheap to set up in hotels nowadays), water bottles, even mints and chocolates would likely give a nice luxurious touch - even to low revenue clients like myself (non-gambler and so forth).

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: LisaC13
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious and well appointed. Service was excellent. I had forgotten some toiletries and I rang the front desk to ask for some. They were brought up right away and were of the nicest quality! XS nightclub in the hotel is THE place to go. Gorgeous venue and beautiful people. The only complaint I had with this hotel was the pool area. Was so packed everyday, it was difficult to get a lounger. Also, the pool water got a bit manky with all the people in the water. There was a suspicious foamy film floating in some of the corners... Ewww. But, the pool area itself was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to come back to”
Reviews.Author: Binibini_M
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. Pretty much everything you can think of is available IF you have the money. I was lucky and found a very good package deal so that we were able to stay in this hotel for 4 nights and 5 days. In the beginning my husband and I felt a little out of our league staying in this expensive place. Its a really good thing that the hotel is close to the strip and there were other places to eat. There were very fancy shops available downstairs right in the hotel. A Rolex store that promises to have every rolex available in the world, Chanel, Louis Vuitton... All nice to look at but I felt too intimidated to go inside. Our room was a little bit smaller than I expected (although still beautiful) from looking at the pictures (we stayed in a Junior King Suite) but it still had everything I expected it to have and it was well decorated. It was a nice place to come back to after a busy day walking through the hustle and bustle of the city. The bathroom was awesome. Everything was made of marble. We had a his and hers sink so I was able to place all of my stuff and do my hair in the morning without having to wait for anyone. After walking through a lot of hotels in the city I have to say that Encore and Wynn were the best ones I've seen. Even nicer than the Belagio (which I was expecting to be really nice). The casinos are a bit quieter (I'm assuming because its expensive) but I didn't mind this as I wasn't there to gamble. So if you luck out and actually find a deal to stay in this place, I'd recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “6th stay at Encore - each one a '10'”
Reviews.Author: FlamingoJoe
Reviews.Content: Not sure why it took me so long to review this amazing property. I have stayed there 6 times in 12 months, many of the visits were specifically to bring relatives to see this extraordinary place. (Review is of Encore rooms, but Wynn & Encore properties.) In 6 visits, I am still discovering some of the amazing details in the decor and design. Some refined and classic, many outlandish and bold - all of the decor seems to, in some magical way, blend well. There are hundreds of stories behind some of the pieces - comment on one of them to a staff member, and you'll likely hear one of the tales. Many are featured in the resort's in-house magazine or e-mail newsletter. (For example, legs on the chairs in the Encore Tower Suites lobby are modeled after Steve Wynn's dog. Seriously.) Amazing pools - 5 of them (2 topless). At peak times it may be hard to find lounges or chairs - just slip an attendent $5 or $10 and let them work their magic. I have been to about half of the restaurants. I will try to write separate reviews. Breakfasts are exceptional at Terrace Point Cafe or the Buffet. For a higher-end experience, try Tableau - its worth the trip just for their house-made ketchup (a doctored-up Heinz 57). Options are fewer and more casual for lunch than dinner - TPC or buffet again, or Red 8 for Chinese, Wazuzu for Japanese. The Country Club just started serving a $28 3-course lunch but I did not indulge. Either way, you must go at least to see the golf course and waterfall. (Other simpler options are available, but I don't go to Vegas to eat deli sandwiches.) There was a great place called Sugar & Ice, but they changed the name to Pizza Place (a strange disconnect in name, logo and appearance from all of the other glitzy eateries here.) The gelato and sorbets are excellent there and the outdoor patio affords views of 3 of Wynn's many waterfalls. Dinners are top-notch all around: SW (traditional steakhouse), Bartolotta di Mare (Italian / seafood flown in fresh daily or every other day from the Mediterranean - excellent and very expensive), Botero (a steakhouse with flair), Switch (steak / seafood / continental - the walls and ceiling actually completely transform every 20 minutes - a real spectacle), Sinatra (classic/nouveau Italian), Okada (Japanese sushi / teppanyaki / robatayaki & excellent atmosphere - ask for a table near the window or outside if weather permits to enjoy the lush greenery and waterfall). Rooms leave little to be desired - bathrooms are big enough for a small cocktail party, living area (with sectional and desk) and bedrooms are separated by a partial wall, with a large flat-screen TV that swivels so it can be viewed from either room. Views from the higher floors are second-to-none. Ask for a high floor in a low-numbered stack facing south, and you'll see about half the strip, beautiful mountain views and have the Wynn logo from the adjacent tower - a picture-perfect-postcard to behold. Separate drapes and sheers are operated remotely from your bedside night-table, as are all of the room's lights. Beds are comfortable. Mini bar and snacks are appropriately and forgivably overpriced. Request turn-down service and they'll refresh your ice nightly and leave Wynn logo slippers by your bedside. Tower Suites offer a more private entrance, front desk, concierge and bell desk, the main perk of the Suites. The rooms are pretty much the same unless you opt for a larger soom (like a Salon Suite.) There are consistently numerous hiccups in the housekeeping and bell service but I hate to dim the glow of this review by listing specific experiences - none interfered with enjoyment of the stays. Everyone is very friendly - I have had great conversations with dealers, pit bosses, members of the management team and even marketing staff (some Vegas legends are now on-staff) - all seem to be genuinely interested in their guests. (As has become one of Wynn's trademarks, most female servers and front desk staff are way above average in appearance.) The night are clubs are exceptional - Tryst and X/S are among the best in Vegas. On three occasions, I skipped long lines simply by asking staff if I had to wait in line and explaining that I am guest of the hotel. At X/S, it might help to mention that you are trying to get to the blackjack or craps tables that are situated poolside in the club's outdoor promenade. The shopping options are all high-end and offer very enjoyable experiences. You can look up the list of brand name offerings on your own, but for me, the highlights are the unusual home decor found in the resort's 2 home stores - I've not yet left empty-handed. If you're accustomed to a run-of-the-mill casino on the strip, the minimums might be too rich for your blood. Most peak evenings, you will most likely not find a table game under $25. La Reve, a Cirque du Soleil-esque effort is OK, but not in my top 10. I saw Beyonce there in July in a small intimate theatre, which was one of the best concerts of my lifetime (among literally thousands). She had specifically re-tooled her show for the small room which is a formula likely to be followed by other big names in the future. Catch any headliner you can there (ie Garth Brooks). I have gone for 3 or 4 day stays here and never left the property - there are dozens of bars and lounges in nooks and crannies, each in a unique environment. There is no getting bored here and there is little not to like. I used to go to Vegas for the restaurants, nightlife and gambling. Now I go to Vegas to stay at Encore - everything else is secondary.

Reviews.Title: “Encore is the only option”
Reviews.Author: Haliay
Reviews.Content: By far our best stay in Vegas to date. We previously stayed at the Wynn, but once you go to Encore..you never look back! Amenities were top notch. Dble Queen Bed suite was fantastic, plenty of room. The European Pool was such bliss. You have to rent a Lili-Pad for the best experience. Bottle service comes with water/gatorade/fruit and great service by the pool attendants. Great scene!

Reviews.Title: “Unfulfilled Expectations”
Reviews.Author: BigT71
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay, the first at the Wynn on our honeymoon and 6 months later at The Encore. We really enjoyed the Wynn except we felt the housekeeping was poor, when we checked out we told the staff this and they apologized profusely and said they would pass it on to housekeeping to rectify the situation. We were excited to return as both properties are very nice and luxurious and the front of house staff are very good. They are warm and welcoming and give great service. I also found the restaurants in both properties to be excellent. If you listen to Steve Wynn talk about the properties he will tell you how proud they are with their Mobil awards however I have to say that for such a beautiful 5 star resort they let themselves down and based on the very poor levels of housekeeping I would have to say I think one can do better. Why am I so hard on them when clearly the resort is beautiful and to be honest they fall at this hurdle? Well I think when you are paying $300 plus a night and being sold luxury 5 star service you should expect it. Every night they did turn down, well actually not every night but most nights. They closed the electric curtains which always left a small gap and never bothered to ensure the curtains were closed properly, this would mean the bright sunlight came streaming into the room the next morning so we had to ensure the curtains were closed. The Mini Bar snacks above the fridge were covered in a thick layer of dust and never cleaned. One day I had bought some sugar free candy downstairs, it was something like $8 for the jelly beans, the housekeeping decided that I didn't need them and promptly removed them 2 days later but left papers that were clearly to be thrown away in the room. On the final day I opened the mini bar to find the person before us had left their nasal spray in the fridge in a dirty bag, clearly they don't check these things properly. Others have pointed out when you stay in a luxury hotel you expect the little touches like your toiletries to be laid out neatly, curtains to be closed properly and pajamas to be folded and put on the bed. Another interesting incident was that housekeeping came in one day, cleaned the room and then turned on the do not disturb sign which was bizarre in itself. We obviously did not receive a turn-down that night but also one of the robes was missing as well. all very odd indeed. Each of these issues in isolation is trivial but it is really the fact that there were so many things and to make it worse when we checked out we told reception and got the exactly same response as the time before, i realized this was their way of saying, honestly we don't give a damn! To make matters worse an hour after leaving we realized my wife had left something in the bathroom. It was a mouth guard in a box and it was left in plain sight. The bottom line is they said they couldn't find it and made no real effort to do so either. I escalated it to management but again the attitude was pretty poor and uninterested. In summary the front of house is actually great and is hard to fault, also the dealers and casino was great BUT having experienced the lackluster back of house I have to say it is my choice to take my money elsewhere. I for one will not return to the Wynn or the Encore when I return to Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “The Encore! Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: matts911
Reviews.Content: There is only one problem with the Encore! After a three day stay at the Encore in Feb 2010, where does one go from here? Where or what place will you find the next rung up the ladder? I pay attention to the little things, the staff saying good morning, the facilities, which I define by the following, no marks on the walls from visitors, the elavators keep in a prestine condition, ashes which fell on the carpeting being removed as soon as possible, betting table staff in good spirts, even at 7:00 a.m. in the morning. The little things which make your stay worthwhile. I took a walk to a few other casinos nearby, they just do not feel the same! I can not wait to go back. Matt from Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “When all else fails...read the directions.”
Reviews.Author: smjack8088
Reviews.Content: I had read mixed reviews about Encore. I read some where people were thrilled and more than pleased with their stay, and then I read others in which people were disgusted with their stay. I have a word of advice for past, present, and future travelers: "When all else fails, read the directions." I arrived at the Encore late in the evening after flying in from Atlanta. The hotel staff were more than pleasant and helpful. They checked me in immediately (and yes, there was a line of folks.) "Alfred" took the time to welcome me to the hotel, gave me some brief information, and bade me a good night (after I had told him I wanted nothing more that night than to go to sleep.) I stayed on the 10th floor in a King Resort Suite (we had booked through another website and got a great deal of $120/night.) I had already noticed some little touches such as my name printed on my room key. When I arrived at my room, I noticed it had a doorbell outside the room also with a privacy feature (so random persons couldn't ring it at night even though evening hall/loud traffic was NEVER an issue!) The room was spotless and welcoming. It was dusted, the [many] mirrors didn't have a single fingerprint on them, the bed was nicely made...no issues whatsoever. I got up the next morning, went to the convention, and when I came back, my room was just as fresh as it was when I arrived: clean...clean towels...nicely made bed...just...spotless. To address some "issues" others had: 1. "The linens weren't even changed!" Answer: If you read the card next to the bed, it clearly states, "linens will not be changed unless requested by the housekeeper and upon check out." 2. "We were charged for items from the mini-fridge! Apparently when you lift an item up for more than 60 seconds, it charges you." Answer: If you read the card located ON the tray of goods above the mini-fridge, it clearly states, "feel free to pick up items to browse or count calories, but removing an item more than 60 seconds will automatically charge it to your room." 3. "Internet is not free...local calls are not free." Answer: I don't know any hotel in Vegas in which internet or local calls are free...that are quality hotels. Vegas hotels don't want people staying in their rooms...they want them out and about spending money. I didn't have an issue with either one of these. (Are we sensing a trend here?) I ordered "In-room dining" three times when I was there, and it was always a nice experience. In-room dining was polite and quick, the persons who brought the food - just as nice and polite. I even chatted with some of them regarding Las Vegas, why I was there, where I had come from, where THEY had come from, etc. I am sure they would have been just as happy (or at least professional) to be ignored as I am sure they are with other guests, but as I worked my way up from serving jobs into the corporate world, I wanted to treat them with as much respect as I hope to receive. I highly recommend the French Onion Gratin soup (French Onion soup with trademark melted cheese) and the Beef Short Rib. The beef short rib is so amazingly cooked that you can pull it apart with a fork. It has just the right amount of flavor as well. As I didn't come to Vegas to gamble and party, I thought Encore was a GREAT hotel. It was VERY quiet. I never once heard loud noises, loud voices, or "the sound of the night club" as other reviewers have stated. I had ONE issue with Encore...my remote control died. However, a quick call to the front desk, and...voila! An "engineer" was up at my room fixing it. Some small touches you might enjoy: 1 .Your name on your card, television, and telephone. 2. In-room dining ringing your doorbell, and then introducing themselves, pausing, and asking permission to enter your room instead of just walking in. 3. If you enter your room with the housekeeper or mini-fridge "checker" in, they will ask for your room key before they let you go any further. This is to check and make sure you belong in that room and aren't just some random person walking into it. I highly recommend Encore if you're looking for a relaxing spot in Vegas. From the very clean casino and ventilation system to the impeccable service and friendliness of the staff, you just CAN'T go wrong. I will definitely stay at Encore again. Future visitors are welcome to contact me for questions answered about the hotel (if Tripadvisor allows.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent from Check-in to Check-out”
Reviews.Author: Susie818
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Encore At Wynn for three nights in late January. From the beautiful room to each meal eaten at the property I could not ask for better quality or service. Everything exceeded my expectations. Casino staff, housekeeping and all other employees were extremely helpful, knowledgeable and went out of their way to be accommodating and pleasant. A beautiful hotel is nothing without good service and the Encore excelled in all aspects of guest services. After having stayed at other very nice hotels in Las Vegas, from now on it is only Encore for me. I am officially spoiled!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, After staying at Aria and Wynn, Encore takes the cake!”
Reviews.Author: bran99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here this last weekend. We just loved the rooms. It took everything that we loved about the Wynn and just made it a touch better. I just dont see how you cant enjoy staying here. If your looking to be burried in the busy part of the strip stay at Bellagio, but if your looking to relax, eat well, drink well and enjoy time with your spouce this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: McReaPoint
Reviews.Content: Best room service in any hotel ever ! Everyone bent over backwards to make everything right !! Very rare these days !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KKP720
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Vegas at least once a year. We have stayed at a lot of nice hotels, the best was the Bellagio. Until we stayed at the Encore. We had a basic room, and we were blown away by the size and comfort of the room. We ordered room service our first night there and it was really expensive however the service made the expense well worth it. The hotel does sit at the farther end of the strip, but it was not a bother for us. The hotel staff were very courteous and helpful. We truly enjoyed this hotel. The beds were extremely comfortable, they were so comfortable we considered purchasing one. The hotel is a little priicey, but you get what you pay for. My only complaint would be the closet space was very small. Not enough room for all of my shoes. Overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Jessamies
Reviews.Content: Great service and food. Doesn't smell of smoke, casino is quiet and intimate, a real gem. The rooms, we were on 51st floor are stunning with sumptuous bathrooms and large sitting room. Only downside have to pay for internet access on a daily basis per computer not per room.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: acremon
Reviews.Content: Really terrible service - especially in the casino!!! For such a great reputation - really not a great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to our expectations at all, and too expensive for nothing .. too overrated !!!”
Reviews.Author: LinazCairo
Reviews.Content: Although Wynn/Encore come as very prestigious hotels, and that you are going to have the experience of a lifetime, this was nowhere near our actual experience there. To begin with, the room (suite in fact) was total disappointment. VERY average, and nothing impressive about it at all, with the exception of the bill. On our first night, we came back to the room to find that the housekeeping ONLY changed the towels and did the beds, BUT left the bins and ashtrays un-emptied, the shampoo not replenished, the carpet and sofas not cleaned, the glasses not cleaned, the misc stuff (documents, clothes etc), as is, the remote control was mixed with the toothpaste, and other stuff of the sort. When we tried calling the management to file an official complaint, and asked for someone to inspect the room, the answer was; "there is nothing that we can do about it, call housekeeping to come clean it, and they can clean it tomorrow", and the funniest was ..."we will send you a fruit basket !!!!" Not at all the level of service or responsiveness or apology that we would have expected from such a hotel. We tried the open buffet in the Wynn, something that was supposed to blow our mind away .... turned out to be nothing impressive either. So why do we go to such a hotel, pay a hell of a lot of money, for absolutely nothing. If it is for the restaurants, and they have some very nice ones to be honest, can go there anytime, without having to endure the outrageous bills for nothing ...

Reviews.Title: “Lacks customer service”
Reviews.Author: funsandiego
Reviews.Content: Nice, spacious and comfortable rooms. The service is not the best, but the hotel itself is very nice. Bathrooms are very spacious and have built in tvs in the dressing areas. Good amenities. Room service was good - food excellent. Lots of security - must show room key when exiting elevator. Upscale shops.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: scottschw
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 days, the hotel is beautiful and clean, the rooms big and spacious the spa was fantastic. Overall we just loved everything about the encore,

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: traveller-2664
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Encore over the long weekend in January with 3 other girlfriends. We chose the Encore because we wanted a luxurious, pampering stay, and that is exactly what we got. The rooms were fantastic and pristine!! Gorgeous bath ammenties that were replenished daily, and the most comfortable bed and linnens (which they sell too). We made use of the spa, which is grand and worth spending a few hours in. Was well worth the $30 to use the facilities for the day. Also went to XS nightclub. We found out on the second night that if you put your name on a guest list at Encore's concierge, that you don't have to pay cover or wait in line for the club. The club is GORGEOUS by the way-- definitely had a good time there. Also went to Tryst next door at the Wynn. Only negatives are that this hotel is on the farthest end of the strip... we rented a car, but I imagine if we hadn't, we'd be cabbing it everywhere. This really wasn't an issue, but it might be for others. Also, it's on the pricier end of hotels for Las Vegas-- which around $300/night is still reasonable consiering the amazing ammenities and comfort you get, but still, if you're here to see shows and stay out, you probably don't care about the room. We cared, but you might not, so there are always other hotels to consider. If I come back to Vegas, and I've rented a car, I will definitely stay at the Encore/Wynn property again. Otherwise, based on location, I'll probably stay at the Bellagio (where I normally prefer, but is far less luxurious in comparion).

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, Second rate this time around”
Reviews.Author: 1funtravler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year a month after they first opened and LOVED it! This time it was a little less spectacular mostly due to service. We arrived a day early due to weather and were very rudely informed they were 'sold out'. Odd since it was DEAD! no one was even at check-in, restaurants or casino area. We asked how this is possible as was informed by the staff that 'everyone went to bed early tonight'. HA! It's 8pm in Vegas! Then we were informed that there was a standard room available this Tuesday night for $400 plus tax and resort fee. But it's sold out? Hmmmm. Also odd since the next night we reserved for $99. Tuesdays must be more in demand than Wednesday. We then left and called the Encore to see what they would say over the phone. The 'sold out' was actually just 'sold out of promo rates'. But we were once again rudely dealt with and decided to stay elsewhere. This would be true for the following 4 nights we were booked here but the reservation was by then prepaid and could not be changed. Arriving the next day our friends checked right in around 2pm but we were told (next in line) that a room wasn't ready yet. Really? Then after overhearing other guests next to us in line get a standard king room we looked at the staff member puzzled and she exclaimed, "A room just opened up!" Off we went to our room. Expecting the same dazzling cleanliness that greeted us last year we were disappointed upon arrial. Dust covered the lights, counters and other areas of the room. A few hairs were found in the soaking tub, and stains on several towels were also found even though they appeared to have been washed. The windows that were sparkling clean last year seem to have not been touched since then either. Not the amazing entrance we hoped for. Overall the rest of the hotel was kept in nice and clean condition, the casino staff was much better than the hospitality at reception, although there was a lack of doormen this time around, as well as cocktail waitress's during the day. Enjoyed the lobby bar for breakfast, the lattes were as good as I remembered as well as the croisants! Botera steak was the best meal we had last year however upon returning this time it took 3 times before they sent out a steak that was even close to how it was ordered. The 3rd steak was certainly not the filet mignon cut that was ordered and was quite tough and stringy. The others at the table also had cooking issues where the medium chateaubriand was closer to rare, and a medium well steak was much more like medium rare. NOT what you pay for there! In the end they took off the steak that was sent back 3 times. Needless to say we won't return. Society Cafe was much better and the service was excellent as well. Upon checkout they had overcharged us by $700! As well as charging for internet service PER DAY! where as last year it was per stay! Check your bill and save your room charge receipts and it will be much easier when you must dispute their overcharges! It seems as if the hotel and staff was happy to have visitors last year, but this time around they don't really care whether you stay there or return. Quite disapopinting. After a delay at the airport we had another unexpected night but did not return here. Want luxury and service in Vegas? Try Vdara! much more what we expected from the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Pristine Upscale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mel4trip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Encore for a few nights on a business trip. I was very impressed with the spacious room . The room had a very contemporary appeal with a large flatscreen TV(that rotates so that you can watch it anywhere within the room), extra comfortable bedding with down blankets/pillows, and access to room lighting and drapery from buttons at bedside. The bathroom was very clean and modern with a TV and two separate sinks. There was even a phone inside the toilet room. There was a business area complete with phone and fax machine. The window in the room was room-sized offering a scenic view of the mountains. The hotel had a comfortable upscale look without being too arrogant or gaudy. I highly recommend the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: la310la
Reviews.Content: Their rooms are one of the most modern and def the cleanest on the strip. I liked the flatscreen tv and the huge bathrooms. Also, the "living room" area was actually comfortable and it felt business-like. I didn't like the wi-fi you had to pay for (boo!). The other great thing is that you have light switches on your door to notify the staff if you are in and not to bother you or out and need your room cleaned. The cleaning people did not bother us once during our stay which was WONDERFUL. I tipped extra just for that. =)

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: designbluesky
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at Encore as a gift to my parents and my aunt. When I was booking the room through Expedia, I specifically asked for two queen size beds instead of one king size bed. They put me on hold for several minutes and I got the confirmation in the email for the two queen size beds in the room. Then I called to confirm it again just in case. However upon my parents arrival, the front desk gave them a room with ONE bed then had told them that this was a special request made by a third party (Expedia) and that they do not guarantee such request and that they did not have a room with two beds available at the time. SO I called Expedia, and now they are telling me the same thing and that I should re-read all the fine prints on my confirmation email. Then when I asked to speak to a manager, they put me on hold for a while then told me that they contacted the hotel and they gave my parents a different room with two beds. By then, I didn't feel good about how this was handled. Why all this unnecessary time and phone conversations?? So I called Encore front desk and she was so RUDE and was not willing to listen. When I was trying to explain that I had the confirmation emails through Expedia, she told me that they don't honor third party requests . Then why do they even have services through Expedia?? It wasn't like I paid less than any other customers. I did not understand where the rudeness was coming from. I paid high prices for their cheap services. Like I said, this was supposed to be a nice gift to my parents but the hotel service made my parents feel like I got them a room through some kind of a cheap discounts when I paid over $450. I really wish booked the room somewhere else and used a different service.

Reviews.Title: “amazing place”
Reviews.Author: MinaKOC
Reviews.Content: I had great time with my friends we enjoy a lot I want to go again.It was my great ungorgetable time at Encore...I recommend Encore hotel everyone..I am sure you will enjoy..

Reviews.Title: “Totally Pleased with the Encore...Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NonaZoe
Reviews.Content: From initial self-parking to express check-out, everything was perfect. The self-parking was very convenient and very easy access. Registration was uneventful and timely. Yes, we were offered the $20 room upgrade, but we declined. We were in 2319 facing the north strip, and it was lovely. We were very close to the elevators, so that was convenient. I requested additional hangers from housekeeping...they arrived five minutes later. They were very accommodating for all of my special requests. The concierge was very helpful with all of my requests. The front desk will print your airline boarding pass for you (and check in your luggage...have your credit card ready). Nice service. The Enclore pool is currently closed...probably until March. But the Wynn pool is open and it's lovely. Warm, soothing, loved it!!!! (But, it's a hike from the Encore to the Wynn...approx. 600 steps...flat surface) Complaints? I hated their ice cubes from the floor machines. Melted in your drink in five minutes. I try to save on linen laundering, and they request that you do so. BUT, housekeeping kept taking away the towels. I requested that they not do that. They still did it. Finally, I put the "little green request paper tent" over my towels. Success! The bar by registration (overlooking the pool) is a great place to people watch, especially when the night clubs are open. I've never seen so many five-inch heels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Xlnt Customer Service, but nickle and dime you for everything”
Reviews.Author: crystalcatSandiego
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the many of the hotels on the strip and The Encore at Wynn was right up there for beauty, comfort and customer service. We took advantage of upgrading our suite to a panoramic strip view suite for $25 and it was well worth it. View was fantastic and the room was tastefully decorated and very comfortable. Couch and furniture was cushy and welcoming, enabling you to relax and enjoy the panoramic view, unlike the rock hard ones at the Venetian suites. Bed was great and bathroom was nicely appointed with extras like robes and lighted sit down makeup area. The maid service and all staff were 5 star. . . in fact, they offered the best service I've experienced yet at any of the 5 star hotels on the strip. But be ready to be charged $$$ for every extra--that some other hotels would include, i.e internet, fitness gym, etc. We enjoyed gambling at the Wynn versus the Encore--it just seemed less stiff and more inviting than the Encore's Casino. One criticism is that the prices at all the restaurants were exceedingly high and the food was sometimes disappointing. To our delight, we discovered, Maggianos, a fantastic Italian restaurant across from The Encore (highly recommended on Trip Advisor so we knew it would be good!)--reasonable prices compared to Encore and delicious food and service--about a 3 minute walk away. Recommend calling for reservations at least 2 hours ahead. Only other negative was The Encore has these ridiculous signs posted near the elevators stating that guests cannot bring their own outside food or drink to their room--everything must be purchased at The Encore. I found this insulting and it left a negative impression of a greedy company. But all in all, we enjoyed our stay and would return. Important Note: be aware that if you do not have a car, you will be taking taxis to get around as this hotel is located on the quieter end of the strip and is a 25-30 minute walk to the monorail system.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: kcsaab
Reviews.Content: I have had the luxury of staying at some top line hotels in Las Vegas and around the world. I was excited to stay at the Wynn complex, what a let down! The lobby is just plain boring as is most of the hotel. Service not up to par at the resteraunts we tried. The only real positive is the room, great big nice room. I would not recommend or stay there again. Charges billed to our room from the Spa, we never even saw the spa! Horrible check out process.

Reviews.Title: “Wynn's not so identical twin”
Reviews.Author: Emma1975
Reviews.Content: We received great rates of $109/night + $100 credit so we thought we would give Encore a go. We had previously stayed at Wynn a couple of times and loved it. Upon arrival at Encore valet, it dawned on us just how far away the property is from Wynn ... it felt like we were pulling into the Riviera! But we carried on and made our way through to check-in. The decor in this hotel is so tasteful! Red is the main colour theme through this hotel, as well as butterflies. Our 10 month old daughter was mesmerised by the decorations, the butterflies, the lights, the sounds, the people - everything. Check-in was very easy and the staff were extremely friendly. The elevators were not far from check-in (for once!) which made it easy to find our rooms without having to walk through the entire casino. Arriving into our room I found it to be quite dark and dreary. Where Wynn use a lot of taupes, whites, creams etc, Encore went for the darker colours - a big, heavy black door, black sheer curtains, it was all a bit much. I didn't get that homey feel like I did when I walked into Wynn ... it took away the "comfort" factor. The room layout and size is similar to that of Wynn, however the room is broken into 2 sections, divided by a spining plasma TV which was useful. The only issue with this divider was that it used a fair bit of space which made the rooms feel a litle smaller than that of Wynn. The bathrooms were pretty much identical to Wynn, however I was very disappointed when I found there were no slippers! :( I love my Wynn slippers! Nonetheless, all the necessities were there, plenty of towels, great water pressure, even a set of scales! We didn't get a chance to dine at any of Encore's restauants, however found it lacked a 24 hour cafe style place. They do have a coffee place that runs until around 1pm and then turns into a bar (no under 21s after this time). This bar served breakfast, but nothing substantial and nothing healthy. Saying this, it was a convenient place for us to regroup in the mornings and discuss the day's plans over coffee. The staff were very helpful and extremely efficient. If anyone is trying to decide between Encore and Wynn, I would definitely suggest Wynn over Encore. The rooms are better, the gaming is better, the location is better. TIP: A must when staying at Wynn or Encore is the Wynn Buffet! We ate there for dinner on a couple of occasions and it is sensational!

Reviews.Title: “As Good As Expected”
Reviews.Author: Wiley12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Encore towards the end of 2009 after staying at Wynn a couple of years earlier. I enjoyed everything about the hotel/resort from the colors to the décor to the service. I really have no complaints other than the shower. I think that there was a water pressure issue in the room and I am not quite sure what the separate head was for, that puzzled me. The size of the rooms is quite large and we had a great view of both the strip and the golf course, best of both worlds. I was a big fan of the automatic drapes/lighting system. It is great to go to sleep with the drapes open to take in the strip scene and then just lean over and hit a button to turn the room pitch black when necessary. Also, very impressed with the bell/valet service. It was some of the quickest service ever in having the car retrieved by the valet and the bags that the bellman had previously picked up from the room meeting us at the car. The have a good system there. Did not get any room service this trip so I have no opinion on that. However, I did scan the in room dining menu and it looked quite expansive. I might have to try that the next time I am there.

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite Hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Ocean_gal74
Reviews.Content: In the past we've stayed at the Four Seasons and loved it but wanted to try something new on the north strip. We arrived on a Thursday at 3:30PM and there was no wait for check in. We booked a standard resort suite but were given the option to upgrade to a panoramic suite for $25/night. So glad we did, we were on the 63rd floor (top floor) looking straight down the strip. The view is amazing day and night. The room was spacious and I loved having the extra seating area to enjoy the view over some pre-dinner cocktails. Housekeeping was great, never had any issues. It was too cold to enjoy the pool area so I can't comment on that. The spa was amazing. We didn't book any treatments but did pay the day fee to workout and use the facilities, spent a full 4 hours there. Yes, the restaurants are all expensive but there are some reasonable options. Society Cafe at Encore has a great happy hour M-Sat, 4-7. And Zoozacrackers in the Wynn is a nice option for a casual lunch. We also ate at Alex one night which was great but probably not worth the money. Other than that it's a quick walk to the Palazzo and Venetian, which has some more affordable dining options. In the future we'll likely stay at Encore over the Four Seasons for the following: Pros: Spectacular view and room, quick access to the nicer casinos and hotels (Wynn, Palazzo, Venetian), not as crowded as other hotels/casinos Cons: $30 fee to workout, expensive restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Fun time had by all...”
Reviews.Author: nyu05
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Encore for our first trip to Vegas. The hotel and casino were beautiful, it has amazing decor and style. We went to XS, it is an amazing club albeit very busy. Check out the buffet and the Wynn, its pricey but very worth it.

Reviews.Title: “There are many five star hotels on the stip my advise would be to skip this one!”
Reviews.Author: eyereent
Reviews.Content: A word of caution to travelers who book their vacation through Expedia. This hotel does not choose to honor all Expedia bookings. My friend and I recently booked two queen beds through Expedia, when we arrived at the hotel the booking was questioned even with the hotels confirmation number. We were told we would have to pay an extra $50 dollars a night, which we questioned. Then they said they would be able to put us up for two nights with the beds and we would have to move over to the Wynn for our last two nights. When we went to move they again asked for our reservation and confirmation after waiting for a very long time they photo copied our reservation and said that they would let us stay for the last couple days without charge ( I believe that the Wynn was full and they had no choice). Then we also discovered that beverages had been half drunk and left in our fridge from previous guests. They questioned this but did remove the charge. The whole experience of this beautiful hotel had been ruined for us. We found the experience to be stressful and we wasted much of our time trying to iron things out. There are many five star hotels on the strip my advise would be to skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favorite hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tiger62z
Reviews.Content: When I booked 4-night Vegas package for Xmas 2009, the newly opened Aria and Vdara offered a better deal than Encore. However, I was not impressed by their room pictures posted on the web site. Since we were absolutely blown away by the magnificence of this property during our 2008 Xmas stay, we decided to stay with Encore again. And we were not disappointed. This time our room was on the 38th floor (one floor higher than the one we stayed last time), has both strip and golf course views, which was absolutely gorgeous. One year after its grand opening, the property is still in its perfect shape. I’m well traveled and have stayed at many hotels. I must say Encore room is one of the most beautiful, elegant and spacious. Although Encore’s location is not very central on the Strip, it is right next to Wynn, a short walk to Palazzo, Venetian, TI and Mirage. By the way, I saw some of the reviews here complained about loud noise from XS. From our room, we could see XS's outdoor pool but heard nothing during its opening hours. Probably because our room was on the high floor? Speaking of XS, it is bigger and better than Tryst but smaller and less fun than TAO. But it was definitely worth paying a visit. Like Tryst, its dance floor opens up to fresh air makes the club so much breathable. It offers $10 discount for the hotel guest (no compliment pass).

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: k_1Toronto
Reviews.Content: second time at encore las vegas, honestly its wonderful. you get a suite, its really spacious best hotel ever..... already opening my third trip at vegas.. worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven = Encore!!”
Reviews.Author: Almazanguy
Reviews.Content: Beautiful casino, delicious drinks, prompt service, and clean! VERY nice and worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Nice..but tacky”
Reviews.Author: Cohiba77
Reviews.Content: Why does a five star hotel need to charge you for everything? I mean really 1.50 for a local phone call, 30 dollars to use the gym, 14 to have Internet, and the list goes on and on. Its tacky and poor taste. A hotel of this caliber should not come across as cheap and that's exactly how it comes across. They nickle and dime you for everything. Sure, their cliental can affort it but its still poor taste. My husband and I were there for 3 nights and 4 days. In that time housekeeping never paid us a visit EXCEPT at 8:00am the day we were checking out. Our room wasn't exactly the cleanest either. There were crumbs under the bed and the bathroom floor looked like it hadn't been mopped around the toilet. Gross. There were also some funky things in the shower. Sure, the Encore is pretty to look at but unpleasant things lurk beneath the surface. In my opinion its tacky. customers do not come first...its Wynn's bottom line You will not find class here. My husband and I will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Customer Service not Quite Match Up”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_Ting
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this five star hotel from Dec. 21st to 25th, 2009. Both of our air fare and hotel were booked through Expedia.ca and we've been grant $75 hotel credit as part of the deal. Little background about us: we are young couple at our late 20s early 30s. We take vacation at least twice per year, we love gourmet food and we enjoy good shows. The upside: The hotel is really gorgeous and clean, which you can see from the pictures we post. The room is the most sound proof among all other hotel rooms we stayed, so we had good night sleep every night. The spa is world class and a must do as part of the hotel experience ($30 extra charge). The pool is beautiful but December is too cold to plunge in. The downside: From the title you know we have something to say here... While we arrived the hotel, we were about 2 hours early for checking in, however the lady who took care our check in told us our room is not currently available however we could upgrade to the next category by adding $20 more each night, we asked her if we could use our $75 hotel credit towards such upgrade and pay only the difference at the time of check out, and she gave us clear "YES" with her rolling eyes. At the last day when we check out our room before noon, they handed us a $90 bill that include all the charge of room upgrades and related tax. At our confused face, we've been told "because we didn't use our hotel credit toward food and beverage, so the credit have gone void at the time of our check out". OUTRAGEOUS is the only word that could describe our feeling for that moment, luckily after talked to manager this unhappiness got solved immediately. But we felt that we should never had such feeling during our vacation. During our stay at this hotel (only the Encore side), most of the employees (except the manager and at the spa) we've encountered gave us an impression of snobbish and phoniness which is absolutely unmatched the class of this beautiful hotel. One thing we must mention, we have made request of one extra set of toiletry at the morning of fourth day to the concierge, when we returned to our hotel room at the end of the day, we found plenty of extra toiletries on the counter top in our bathroom (more than the quantity we request), but right away, we also found out all of our luggage have been went through (one zipper bag in my luggage got unzipped, and the number on our 3-number combination lock for another luggage aren't the same set of numbers as we left the room in the morning). Fortunately, we didn't loose anything since we didn't leave any valuable items in the room, but we did feel shocking that incident like this would happen in such high scale hotel. All in all it's a love hate experience, we won't return to this hotel unless they fix their customer service problem. We will make our decision on future traveler's review at tripadvisor.com before our next Vegas hotel booking..

Reviews.Title: “Think for a moment: Sore Throat, Lung Cancer, Loud Noise, Smoke everywhere, Angry about losing money....Vacation?”
Reviews.Author: Crewman7
Reviews.Content: They say '1 hour in a casino = 6 months of passive smoke'. Nothing could be more true about Encore. Forget the glamor for a moment and Encore has glamor. Is it worth it risking your health (if you are a non-smoker), your time, your hard-earned money, and your sanity to stay and gamble at the most 'glamorous' casino on the strip? No matter what anyone says, it wasn't worth it. Avoid Encore - it's just like every other casino on the strip and a zebra will never change it's stripes.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: bbillcat
Reviews.Content: this was my 2nd time at the encore and I wouldnt stay anywhere else and I have stayed at almost every hotel in Vegas The service is FIVE star The staff is friendly and professional The restaurants at theEncore and the Wynn are the best The pool is lovely I cant wait to return Steve Wynn runs a classy operation

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddict082
Reviews.Content: Went to the Encore for my 40th birthday and our first time to Las Vegas. Check in was not great as we arrived around 9:30pm and they tried to have us upgrade for additional $200 to the Tower Suites. I was a little annoyed when I paid for something and then it wasn't available. Funny thing - they seemed to find me a room after a while on the 53 floor. Not sure if I was upgraded but the view of the Strip was amazing. They even had a complimentary cake sent to my room on my actually birthday - nice touch. I don't gamble so not really interested in that aspect of Vegas but we did win $800.00. Saw Le Reve very enjoyable and David Spade - funny. Ate at Daniel Brassiere (can't remember the exact name) and Bartolotta. They were ok but for $300 a dinner I thought it would be better. Shopping was AMAZING!!! All that said I loved this Hotel. I think it's definitely worth staying at. I'm not one to rush back to Las Vegas however - good to see it but not a lot to do during the day if you don't gamble and have checked out all the other hotels. The weather was too cold to sit by the pool which was too bad because I would have LOVED that! My husband golfed and really enjoyed that too.

Reviews.Title: “Encore exceeded all our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: FLNOLE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Encore in late December 2009 for two nights. We got a wonderful rate that beat any of the "discount" on-line hotel retailers simply by calling the hotel. I have to admit I was apprehensive about staying at the hotel due to the poor TA reviews, specifically the poor service. We were treated very well, upgraded to a suite on the 58th floor upon check-in without request. We did not experience any snobbery or mistreatment at all...Also, check in and check out was a breeze (quick and efficient..It seems they have addressed this issue). The ENTIRE hotel is a masterpiece, honestly around every corner was something else that had that "wow factor". The shopping is to die for! Ladies, some of the most exquisite jewelry you will find is housed at The Wynn shops (as well as Encore). We saw Le Reve one evening and my husband and I were both in awe...We have both been to several Cirque shows and this show blew everything out of the water. It was magical! We ate dinner at Stratta one evening, the food was very reasonably priced and was excellent. You cannot go wrong with any of the dining options within this hotel---from the top down they are all tasty. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, I looked for flaws and simply just did not find any.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lululinne
Reviews.Content: this hotel its wonderful, the service at the hotel and restaurants are excellent, they have their personal trained to make you feel more than great. Rooms are big and beautiful with all the amenities you can expect. I love this hotel the decoration its amazing try the spa its expensive but worth it

Reviews.Title: “already sucked lime in my drink!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SharonE19
Reviews.Content: Went for 9 nights the room was excellent although upon checkin asked for a high floor after reading reviews and was given the 10th floor. After producing $20 tip miraculously we were given a room on the 59th floor. This was after originally being advised that there wasn't any high floors available! Hardly any waitress service on the casino floor, when we did manage to ask for drinks my husband had a gin & tonic with a lime in it that had obviously been sucked on by a previous customer. This is not what you expect at a 5* hotel! Therefore didn't gamble in the encore after that, we chose to gamble in the wynn so we could still use our RED CARD. WHAT A JOKE THE RED CARD IS!!!!! After gambling $4000.00 on the slots we managed to accumalate 2000 points. We were then offered just $40.00 cash for this amount. We had inroom dining 3 times (very nice but expensive) and were offered just $90.00 comp'd against this. So if you gamble on the red card you need to get 1000 points to get just $20.00 back & beleive me this takes some accumalating! When we stayed at the bellagio we had ALL room service comp'd on less points. Have stayed in Vegas 14 times, this hotel is the nicest but the red card is the worst comps in vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, especially if you go during the week.”
Reviews.Author: Amosuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore for 2 nights in September last year. We stayed in one of the Tower Suites and judging by the long queues (this was a tuesday!) we made a great call. The seperate check-in was superb and we were in our room in no time. We had a great view down the strip from our floor to ceiling windows and teh bed was supremely comfortable. There is a great selection of restaurants and shops and the hotel definately feels "5 star", certainly when compared to some of the other resorts we visited on the Strip. The only criticism i had was the pool area.... it was packed to bursting. We couldn't even get a lounger....... on a Tuesday. Luckily we had come mid-week and got a great deal. had we paid $1,000 and not been able to get room by the pool i would have been furious. The concierge staff were great and advised us to take the "Maverick helicpoters Grand Canyon tour". Regardless of where you stay in Vegas do this, it was truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Excellent Stay.. Encore is my new base in LV”
Reviews.Author: ILTheDuke
Reviews.Content: Overall, Encore blew away every other hotel I have stayed in Vegas. I found the room very plush and comfortable. The Spa at Encore I can only desribe as one of the top 5 I've experienced in the world. Everything from the lounge and hydrotherapy area to the treatments themselves were amazing. The room had all the comforts of home and a great view. While I am not a fan of the casino in Encore, a short stroll to the Wynn side solves that problem. My only complaint with the room is it was stuffy on the bedroom side during the nights, but by cranking the air all the way down I was able to get comfortable. The only major serivce glitch was with room service. When I would place my order every morning, I was told to expect my order in 30 minutes. It was taking between 45 minutes to almost an hour and a half for delivery. In the end, the staff were apologetic and responsive to my complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Do they ever clean this place? Hidden nasty suprises all day!”
Reviews.Author: Cjguy101
Reviews.Content: Ok. I booked this room for a romantic 2 night getaway for my wife and I back in July. I had a choice to stay at the Wynn or Encore for the same price but I ended up picking the Encore because I heard the rooms were bigger. We walk up to our room. Fabric on the walls, electric drapes etc. Beautiful room! I go to sit down on the ottoman and there is a nasty black stain on the center of this thing. BIG BLACK stain. I didn't want to gross my wife out and ruin the experience so I tried to tap it away hoping it was dirt from a shoe or something. Let's just say it didn't work. Almost immediately my wife comes out and is holding the handle for the sink in the restroom. Apparently it had broken off long before we arrived. It appeared that cleaning crew just placed the broken handle right back in the slot as to appear it was ok. This place seemed as if it had just had a party like the one from the movie "the Hangover". It felt gross. So 10 minutes later, we are unpacking. I open the drawers and find a big glob of dried soda right smack in the center of the top drawer. It had that gooey, syrup thickness to it. It appeared as if someone had dropped a soda in there. At this point I tell the wife that we should go downstairs and get some food. While downstairs, I sneak away to ask them to please clean up my room as it was clearly a filthy mess. The guy apologized and says he would have them clean the room up, and also leave us a gift basket for the inconvenience when we return. I took my wife out for a little dinner and came back 4 hours later. They cleaned up the ottoman and the soda in my dresser but as I suspected no basket. Whatever.....I didn't even call. I was just happy I was there and they had cleaned up the room. Or so I thought.... A couple of minutes later I am in the potty room and start to notice all kinds of bodily fluids stuck to the floor. It was so disgusting. It looked like they had not mopped up in weeks. Boogers and pee were two for sure! I got on the desk to start dialing the front desk, I lean back in the chair and notice there are tissue papers wedged in between the lamp shade on the desk and the actual wall. Management did nothing they said they would clean up the room but they never did anything. I can't believe this place got a 5 diamond rating. What a joke! Save your money and stay at a motel 6 they have cleaner rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Getaway - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Di2442
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to the Wynn Encore in November with another couple, and I have to say, it was a fabulous experience all around. We had previously stayed at the Wynn, and my husband has stayed at a number of other hotels in Vegas (including the MGM, the Hotel, and others). This hotel was by far the best. The rooms were nice and roomy, the bed was fluffy and devine, and the amenities were out of this world. The spa is absolutely fantastic - you feel as though you've been transported to the most high end spa in Thailand - and the fitness centre is large and modern. Staff are all excellent, and the customer service is second to none. I had ordered some items to be delivered to the hotel before I arrived, and these were all delivered to me within the first 20 minutes of my stay. The gardens are beautiful, and the light show is unbelievable! We also went to the show, Le Reve, which is fantastic! We ate well, saw great shows, relaxed in the sun, and enjoyed some first rate shopping. All in all a terrific experience, and HIGHLY recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerriejo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the encore for 9 nights at the end of December. Check in was a breeze, but that may have been due more to the flight delay of 8 hours which meant we arrived at 10pm. Rocio was lovely and we got the type of room we wanted with no problem. The room itself was gorgeous, exactly like the pictures I'd seen. Mirrors running alongside the bed was a bit kinky but wasn't exactly a problem with the room. The layout was great, and the bathroom was gorgeous ( I wish could transport the bed and bathroom to my own house). We were on the 61st floor with a north-facing view of the strip and the view of the mountains was just lovely. Others have mentioned this and I'm sure theres a good reason for it but tea/coffee facilities in the room are sorely missed. Housekeeping has a note informing you that they do not routinely change bed linens during a stay, but as we were there for 9 nights we thought a couple of changes would be in order (i would change then that often at home) and it was no problem at all, a quick call to housekeeping would ensure it done. We ate at a few places within the resort: 1) Take away breakfast from the Lobby cafe in our room. Nice, had a bacon egg and cheese croissant with coffee. 2) Dinner at Wazuzu - fabulous chinese food and the service was very friendly (our only gripe here is that when we walked past and booked a table - the people inside were all 'dressed up', so we went and got changed, were seated 30 mins later only to sat next to a fellow in board shorts and sandals so we felt a bit silly and over dressed - totally nothing to with the restaurant but just one of those things which affected our meal) 3) dinner at Daniel Boulud - we had our 'Xmas dinner' here and loved it all. The wine was easy to drink, and the food was beautiful. The show with the waterfall was great and just enhanced the whole experience. 4) Breakfast at the Drugstore cafe - again just coffee and a breakfast bagel - all good. 5) Lunch at the Pizza Place - sat outside under the heaters, food was nice but the pizza did not match New York standards (despite Mr Wynn constantly telling us this on the tv). We used the Concierge a few times but only one of them was even slightly helpful (Kenny) - the others either couldn't give us any info unless it was regarding places within the Wynn, and on two occasions we were given completely wrong information (one was Wynn information). The casino's within were very classy and the dealers were really friendly. We were not high rollers by any measure but we still felt very welcome. The location of the hotel meant a fair walk for all the more central attractions on the strip, although the hotel is very handy for the Fashion show mall. By the end of 9 nights though, just walking from the Encore to the exit of the Wynn was a trek and a half!!. (one small note - if you wish to loan a dvd player during your stay, the charges are a little steep ($55 install and $75 per day) and we were made to feel like our request was a majorly huge deal. We only requested it because one of us was sick and and couldn't really face going out and we honestly didn't think a dvd player was that big a deal - oh well) I've gone on a bit but overall we had a great stay at the Encore and whilst I feel the hotel is aimed at older, richer guests than we, I could not find much fault with anything.

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Kev330
Reviews.Content: The place is great, I think the other reviews said a lot about the place. The only thing I would mention is that if you want double queen beds is almost impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: MaharajTrekker
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and willing to make our stay comfortable. Room was highly comfortable and of high standards. Location of hotel is good but amenities are a bit pricy. Luckily there is a mall across the road where you can buy food, a cool drink or coffee a lot less cost.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Encore”
Reviews.Author: BerberBear
Reviews.Content: One year in business and still the best hotel on the strip. Chic, hip, and modern, but with a warm soul (unlike anything at City Center). Most past reviews are very accurate in the descriptions of the hotel and rooms. Check in is showing signs of improvement over the past year. Rooms are still very clean and new, showing very little wear and tear. Yes, there is currently some strip side construction going on, but this is of very little consequence to the resort itself. If what little noise they're making bothers you...what are you doing in Las Vegas? Restaurants at Wynn/Encore can be just okay. None bad, just some better than others. That said, they all have relatively high price points, so you go in expecting great and just get okay. A few tips: -Wynn coffee shop has great espresso based coffee drinks -self park at both Wynn and Encore is amazingly smooth -Wynn Buffet breakfast before 9:30, no line -quiet place for breakfast...Tableau -best hotel mattress

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Sammy916
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Encore Casino before xmas was super friendly and then check in was very quick and easy, and the room was beautiful. I stayed on 56 th floors, great views!!! The bed was super comfortable, housekeeping was very nice and super friendly Also, I love the food and room service was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Best Christmas present ever”
Reviews.Author: DiceDiva
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three-night stay at the Encore over Christmas, thanks to an amazing promotion we received in the mail. We enjoyed the comfort, decor and location of this hotel. The atmosphere is classy and lacks the excessive theme park atmosphere that exists at many other strip hotels. It is a luxury property with lots of high-end eateries and retail shops. However, there are at least three options for casual, inexpensive (well, relatively) food. The Encore is north of the Wynn resort, and they are connected via a long esplanade of retail shops. Each hotel tower has its own restaurants, casino and pool. The Encore's casino is about half the size of the Wynn's and it also has fewer restaurants. But the two hotels basically feel like one property, so it doesn't really matter. Pros: Gorgeous, spacious suites with neat high tech features -- like being able to close the window curtains, turn off the lights and set the "privacy" sign from your nightstand. Comfortable beds, nice soaking tubs, double sinks and bathrobes. You can use the special "Wynn" channel on your TV to check out, review your hotel tab or view the waiting list in the poker room. Easy access to the room elevators from the registration desk and self carpark. Beautiful pool area. The hotel is connected to Wynn, so you have easy access to all of that hotel's facilities, restaurants and shops. Good entertainment options: Le Reve production show, numerous bars and three nightclubs. Cons: $14/day for wireless Internet access in your room. Most of the restaurants fall into the "very expensive" category. It's at the northern end of the strip, an easy walk to the Venetian, Palazzo, Treasure Island, Mirage and Fashion Show Mall; but if you want to explore all of the strip it could be a long haul or necessitate a cab ride, depending on your energy and fitness level. This is not the place to stay if you have a tight budget, but it is worth a splurge, especially if you can get a special promotional rate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jennrose17
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this hotel. Extremely clean, friendly staff, and great food. A spa like I've never experienced before.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Ecore at Wynn”
Reviews.Author: ASLTravel
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great: large, flat screen,hugh bathroom with all modern applications. Ask for a room with view on Las Vegas Boulevard! The casino was one of the better we did in Vegas. Great service and lots of free drinks :-).

Reviews.Title: “Upscale and worth it”
Reviews.Author: sir_snorksalot
Reviews.Content: I visited Vegas with my wife and other young members of our family (21-31 years old) for a birthday weekend, and we stayed at Encore. We had a great time and loved the hotel. The room was amazing, the bathroom especially so. The service was courteous and responsive. The casino was beautiful and not overly crowded (likely due to the location off the strip, smaller size, and maybe higher expense). I'm not a big gambler, so stuck with the lower minimum black jack tables--the dealers were friendly and fun nonetheless. The cocktail waitresses were friendly and definitely the most attentive of all the casinos we visited. Saturday night the place transformed, I think because of the club (XS), and was crowded with slick club-goers. Not my scene, but hey, whatever, it's Vegas. We had a great time, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “With Wynn, Second Only To Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Jtorsney
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Encore twice. Once in a Tower Suite and once in a standard room. Check-in was quick and uneventful on both visits. The guests rooms are large, well appointed, and include amenities like guest robes, remote control shaers, drapes, and lights, and private bar. The Tower Suites are even better as they add a couch and chaise lounge to the mix. Encore has its own casino, saving guests from constantly going back and forth to Wynn. Service is generally good, although the hotel's 2,700 rooms make personalized service difficult. My only negative comment is that Encore's restaurants are a cut below those at Wynn. Otherwise, just a great resort that deserves its 5 star ratings

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, snippy attitude”
Reviews.Author: Dudewhoplayscraps
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and thought Encore was first rate and cosier than its sister hotel Wynn, even though they are connected. Room was beautiful, and the tables at the casino were great. Very stingy on the comps, even though I gambled a significant amount there, and when I tried to book again for January, they seemed entirely indifferent about giving me a rate any better than a 'stranger' would get. In fact, the check in staff were terrible all around - my biggest complaint about an otherwise lovely hotel. (BTW - staying at the Monte Carlo for my January stay - they seem to care).

Reviews.Title: “WOW, AMAZING, EVERYONE SHOULD EXPERIENCE THIS”
Reviews.Author: AABEYTA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at this top notch Las Vegas Resort. We dined at the Buffet on Saturday morning as well as Wazuzu on Sunday night. Both restaurants were top notch. The food at the buffet was fresh, delicious, and had so much variety. Wazuzu is Asian fusion at its finest. The flavor combinations were executed with a delicate, yet complex attention to detail. My wife experienced a massage at the spa and said it was the most amazing spa experience she had ever had. Let me mention she has been to several spas throughout the country that were all of a fine reputation and she said none of them compared to her experience here. The thing that separates this hotel from others is its' customer service. My wife and I are working class all the way (middle school teacher and a registered nurse) and this place at every turn made us feel like they were there just to serve us. They were uncanny at anticipating our every want or need. They are classy and not pushy. They never big timed us. That in itself will assure our return over and over again. Don't waste time on other hotels people. You have got to experience this place. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - Nice rooms & a great view from the room”
Reviews.Author: RickLa
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many many times over the past 7-8 years. I always look for good deals for my stay. I found a good deal at Encore during my stay in March 2009 and booked for a 2 night mid week stay. Paid about $120 per night which was unbelievable to begin with. I thought I will get one of their regular rooms. But it was not. For my $120 a night, I got a 700 sq ft suite room on the 60th floor with a full wall floor-to-ceiling windows and a awesome strip view. You can see pretty much half of Vegas from this high above the desert floor. Everything in the room was perfect. Huge bathrooms, spa tub, towels, bathrobe and the floors. The bed was very very comfortable (the most comfortable I have ever experienced). The only problem I had was during check in. It was a long wait to get to the front desk guys. The person was helpful. But unfortunately the hotel was packed and the room was not available immediately for my check-in even after I arrived late around 4 PM. They said they will call me when its ready. I got a call 2 hours later. Finally checked in around 6 PM. But the hotel made up for this mess up by giving me one of the nicest rooms on the 60th floor with a great view. It was absolutely worth the few hours wait. The hotel really knows how to keep its guests happy. Thank you guys. I will definitely visit the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A 6 star hotel - if you stay at the tower suite”
Reviews.Author: HCABraz
Reviews.Content: As soon as I got at the Encore at Wynn, I felt bad about my choise because I really didn´t feel as a important guest (and we all should be). Only when they noticed that I booked a room at a high floor level in the tower suites location, they started to treat me nicely. BUT, and this is a huge BUT, after that, everything was just perfect. The room was amazing (61st floor and a great view), really big and very confortable. I would rate the hotel with a "A". Not an "A+" because I really felt the staff do care very much about how much money you have and how you are dressing. It bothered me. Except for that, it´s a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wynn Blows Them Away!”
Reviews.Author: VTCMart
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip and first stay at Encore. The rooms were incredible! Loved waking up facing floor to ceiling windows, opening the drapes with a touch of the button. Had a good view of the mountains and South strip on the 21st floor. Everyone from the bellhop to the pit boss we spoke with was extra friendly and treated you like a king, even when I was just in jeans and sneakers. My girlfriend had a button break off her jacket and the concierge had it fixed and placed in our room before we even got back and for no charge...true 5 star service. The lobby/gaming areas feel very fresh and classy, really appreciate it when you visit some of the other "budget" casinos. Location: Is on the north end, with Circus and Riviera being slightly farther north. Only negative for area is lots of construction going on across the street (new casino) and on the strip facing entrance of the Encore, but I did not hear any construction noise while in my room or the hotel. Location does feel on the outskirts of the action (and traffic) packed, glitzy part of the strip with Caesar/Bellagio/Bally intersection being a much more packed, bustling area, about a 10-15 minute walk away. I would definitely stay again and in fact it is going to be hard to choose somewhere else after such a great stay. With the deal we got bundled with our flights it was a bargain too at over half off the rack rates.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: smitty195
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Encore for 4 nights to attend the Nascar Champion's Week festivities (hosted by Wynn). I reserved an Encore Tower Suite room, and at check-in, upgraded to a Salon Suite. The check-in area for the Tower Suites is amazing! The staff are very friendly, and it is so easy to get up to your room. The elevators are located within the private check-in area, so you do not have to walk through the casino to get to your room. The staff are very attentive and friendly, and surprisingly, they remembered my name. At the check-in counter, you are given a hot towel and a bottle of water---a nice touch. You also receive a list of amenities for being a guest of the Tower Suites such as 2 complimentary daily newspapers, free daily internet (usually $13.99), free $25 in daily local/long-distance calling, free admission to the spa (normally $35), and a few other perks. My suite was absolutely amazing. Spotlessly clean, and very modern and sleek furnishings. The bed was sooooo comfortable! There are 3 LCD HDTV's in the room (both Sharp Aquos Special Edition models), and one LCD HDTV built into the wall in the bathroom. They provide nightly turndown service as well. I read the previous comments about poor housekeeping, and I have to say that I did not experience this at all. Everything in my room was flawless and spotless. Maybe it helps that I always leave a note on the bed saying "Thank you" with a $20 bill. It pays to tip housekeeping! The valet staff are also very friendly and knowledgeable about Vegas---go ahead and ask them any questions you have, and I'll be they will have the answer. They will also get you a complimentary bottle of water if you would like one. I have stayed at almost every major resort hotel on the Strip, and by far, the Encore is my new favorite (with Venetian/Palazzo coming in second place). One not of caution: They have ripped up the front entrance to Encore, and they are building a new entrance and nightclub. The construction trucks are running 24 hours a day/7 days a week. I was on the 60th floor in room 6006, and I could barely hear the noise. However, if I were on a lower floor, I'm sure the noise would be incredibly disturbing at night with the backup beepers and construction noise. All of the Salon Suites face the Strip (above the construction area), so you are not able to get one on "the other side" of the hotel---they do not exist in that location. However, all of the Parlor Suites face downtown (away from the front) so you are away from the noise. There are NO Parlour Suites that face the Strip. In order to understand how the "Tower Suites" section is setup at Encore, picture this in your head----if you are standing on The Strip and you are looking at the front of Encore, look to the top where you see the big "ENCORE" sign at the top of the building. Where the last letter (the "E") in Encore is located, draw a straight line going all the way down to ground level. You have now divided the hotel into the Tower Suites section and the regular hotel section. I hope that makes sense. Have fun in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: micheleroseno
Reviews.Content: I have No complains at all. everything was perfect... very friendly and helpfull staff. My room was huge and had a great view... Went to see Le Reve (great show) . And if you´re there on sundays, don´t miss out the poll party at the European pool ... The club Xs is totally worth the visti as well. If I come back to Vegas, I´ll sure stay there again... !000 times better than Bellagio!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - one of the best hotels in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: RichardLister
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas once or twice a year and this time opted for the Encore. Overall very pleased with the room, the service and the price! Checkin on a Saturday early evening was easy and smooth (no wait at all) with a friendly welcome and an upgrade to a high floor panoramic room. The room was very nice, decorated to a very high standard with a great bathroom and a very comfortable bed. Room service was good quality and very quick (less than 30 minutes) - which is extremely good for Vegas. Didn't bother taking any photos as the room looked identical to the pictures on the website. Litterally my only complaint would be the slightly low shower pressure (but nothing like as bad as the Palazzo last year!). Overall extremely pleased and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accommodation - just a long way to go to explore”
Reviews.Author: MyOpinionOnThings
Reviews.Content: I had read mixed reviews about Encore before deciding to stay there, I had wanted somewhere that was beyond words - modern, with spectacular views, central location (ie not too much walking) & was prepared to spend just that little bit more to get it.
