Reviews.Content: my sister and i recently returned from a trip to the encore. we have previously stayed at the wynn and have stayed at the bellagio too. our room was lovely however housekeeping made our beds the first day and the sheets were hanging out below the comforter. we had to call a technician to the room to fix our safe. we were asking him questions about the mini=bar and he said "if i'm going to pay that price for a drink, I want to see some boobies. yes you read that correctly. The casino was nice and roomy however the chandliers are so bright red that they appear gaudy. these are all over the casino. while eating breakfast at the wynn we were talking to a gentlemen who said it looks like valentines and christmas day all the time. while going to the restroom, along the hallway i found this girl lying on the floor with throw up by her side. security was there with a wheelchair but people qwere passing by her. i felt humiliated for her. the next day you could still see traces of the throw up on the floor. when we stayed at the wynn we had no complaints. and when we've stayed at the bellagio it has always been very upscale. Mr. wynn is talking about buying the bellagio back. Please don't because you may be expanding too fast to keep up with what you already own.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Encore!!!”
Reviews.Author: DPenkala
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Wynn's new Encore Hotel & Casino from Sunday April 26th thru 29th and really enjoyed my stay at this new resort. The rooms are spacious and seperated as if you are in a 2 room suite. The bathrooms are spacious with a tv in the wall and a nice little night light feature so you're not banging into things during the middle of the night. They should have went the extra mile though and installed whirlpool tubs in the bathrooms (as Ceasers Palace has in their new towers) instead of just plain tubs...just my opinion though. I found the bed to be very comfortable, the electronic blinds/curtains feature to be a very big plus and the seperate tv area/work station very relaxing. The pool area is nice, but I can see it getting a little crammed during the prime summer months when everyone is laying out by the pools. I look forward to my next trip out to Vegas where I will have to see about another stay at this new resort. P.S. I didnt do all that well in the casino, but my brother hit for 1,000.00 on a dime video poker game, so that made it even a better stay!!! P.S.S. Just found out that the main headliner at this resort, Danny Gans just passed away...R.I.P. Mr. Gans

Reviews.Title: “Great for Vegas but $$”
Reviews.Author: MintChip17
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at the Encore and if you're heading to Vegas for gambling, fine dining and high end accommodations, then this is the place. However, if you are looking for any sort of relaxation by the pool (and i know many vegas visitors aren't) then think twice. I just wanted a couple of hours mid-afternoon to enjoy the nice weather, relax by the pool and read a magazine but with the loud, pounding club music and no shade to speak of, you're better off staying at the Four Seasons or getting a massage in the spa and calling it a day (btw, the spa was nice and in my book gets an 8). I was also shocked that at 2pm there was hardly a spare lounge chair to speak of. Equally surprising was the difficulty gettting reservations in the restaurants. This is a hotel which doesn;t seem to show any signs of a recession, which is not at all what we expected. In any case, we enjoyed our dinner at SW which is their signature steak house -- so much so that we ate their both nights -- but as with most Wynn/Encore restaurants they are high end...a drink in the bar beforehand -$40 with tip for 2 martinis! You will pay LA/NYC prices but you will get great service and food. Another thing to note is when we asked the concierge for reservations at SW we were told they were "fully committed" but when we said we really wanted to eat there, she mysteriously found a table for us both nights at prime time. Lesson is you just need to be nice and persistent with concierge, maybe checking back later. Everything about the Encore pricewise just seems to be a bit higher than other vegas high end hotels so if you dine and shop there just expect a bill at checkout that's probably higher than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: denvergirl2009
Reviews.Content: This property/resort is amazing. If you're looking for a nice place in the middle of the strip I would recommend this hotel. If you would like to go dancing for a night but don't know where to go - ask the Concierge. They directed us to a club on property called XS and provided us with free admission tickets. This is a nice club with access to an outdoor area that surrounds the pool and leads you out to a poolside bar. The atmosphere is great. We went on a Monday night and it was busy but fun! Drinks are a tad expensive but the experience is worth it, plus you don't have to cab back to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Finest Hotel on The Strip but be ready to pay.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisIsOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: THE ROOM: Visited the Encore 4 days in late April 2009. Was upgraded to a Panoramic View Suite on the 61st floor. Great room. 8 ft tall windows, electronic sheers / curtains and lighting. Big screen HD TV. Good size closet. Separate shower and tub. Dual sink vanity. 2nd TV in bathroom. Robes, scale, hair dryer and ample custom toiletries. Mini Bar. Internet was approximately $12 a day but incredibly fast. As I remember it was about 9 meg up AND down. FOOD: Dined at Wazuzu in the Encore. Very Asian. Very good but expensive. Also ate at Strata in the Wynn (neighboring sister hotel). NOT GOOD. This was my second attempt at Strata. This trip was late night dining. In November it was for dinner before the La Reve show. That experience was not good and both our waitress and the assistant manager thought it appropriate to debate with a guest. I'm sure this behavior is not taught or tolerated by Steve Wynn. Management should clean house at Strata and start over at this particular restaurant. Did The Buffet (Wynn) for lunch. It was all very good but given the price I felt the offerings were a bit on the meager side. Could be a reflection of the economy as The Buffet was not at all busy this trip. Tried the Sunday Brunch at The Buffet on my November 2008 trip and it was excellent. Also have had several very good meals at the Terrace Point Cafe (Wynn). It's the required hotel "coffee shop" but a very upscale one. We perused the other restaurants at both The Encore and Wynn. Most of the restaurants at both hotels are business casual attire or better in the evening. Room service was prompt and service there was good. CASINO: The casino at The Encore is a bit smaller than at The Wynn but very nice. Cocktail service in the gaming area was excellent. POOL: Didn't partake personally this trip but it looked excellent. ENTERTAINMENT: Took in the La Reve show last November. Hard to describe but it's a sort of Cirque Du Soleil type water show. It was excellent and I definitely recommend it. SPA: Had a massage in the spa. Fantastic. Excellent facility. Juice bar was a nice surprise. Expensive. BUSINESS CENTER: Went to the business center at The Encore to print a boarding pass. Told the staff what I wanted to do and they directed me to a computer they appeared to have set aside for this. No charge. Very nice touch. As an aside I was very glad I took care of this ahead of time as the airport ticketing area was a mess on my departure and even the self service kiosks were mobbed. MISC: I'm not sure why but it seemed like taxi cabs were a little hard to come by at The Encore during my stay. Everyone seemed to agree that this was the case but no one was sure why. CONCLUSION: Loved The Encore and overall it was a real treat. Will definitely stay there or at The Wynn again. Be ready to pay though because NOTHING at either of these hotels is inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great effort from Wynn.”
Reviews.Author: SlavaTravel
Reviews.Content: The descriptions you see from other reviews are all very correct - great decor, clean and new, friendly staff. Good comps are: Bellagio, Venezia Tower. Pros: -use of pools and restaurants at Wynn & Encore -Stayed on 58th Floor, facing away from the pool - zero noise even though I had the first room from the elevators. -Friendly staff and nice attention for such a huge property with thousands of guests -Classy and not as noisy as a lot of other properties - went to Mirage to see a show and realized how lucky I am to stay at Encore -Check-in was quick, but I did see lines at times - I think it is a function of a large group arriving. The attention at the front desk is very good and they spend the time with you which really slows down the process for others. If you pressed me to find faults, here is what I would say: -Biggest complaint: sucky food at the pool and no pool side restaurant (tuna salad sandwich???). However, this is easily cured by going to Wynn, which has a wonderful pool side restaurant that serves awesome breakfast and lunch. -service around the pool was slow on one of the days and another guest complained. It was fixed the next day. -XS & Tryst are great, but Monday night @ XS they weren't very selective - maybe locals night. Could have been better. -Not a lot of shade by the pool and no umbrellas

Reviews.Title: “"spring break"”
Reviews.Author: arlenejustice
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted to celebrate his 50th birthday in vegas for just the two of us...so i booked Encore since it is one of the newest hotel in vegas and i was curious...We stayed in Encore from 8april-12th. The hotel is just beautifully decorated and impressive. Checked in was excellent since we arrived almost 8pm which means not a long line and the guy that checked us in was very customer oriented even asked me what room do i prefer, strip view or mountain view. Going to the elevator has a security guard asking to show your key card, nice touch i thought. Our room was at the 18th floor and facing the pool and Xs club with very nice mountain view. It was very clean, no slipper but just a bathrobe but didn't really matter because the marble floor, i think, felt comfortable with our bare feet. The bathroom is big and more than enough for my husband and i using it at the same time. I read some complained about a cabinet space but our room has plenty of it both from the closet and from below the plasma tv. The bed is just so comfortable but had no aches or pain getting up in morning even from staying at the wee hours. Restaurant: we tried the wazuzu, i think thats the name, the food was okay nothing to brag about but expensive, busy and the waiter seemed to like to hurry you up in your decision and ordering. We also ate the at wynn, sw steakhouse, best porter steak and vegetable we had but again Expensive. Poo: Encore pool is nice but nothing extraordinary, and yes you have to reserve and pay for the cabana and the soft chair close to the pool area. don't know how much and didn't really care for it, the lounge chair served our purpose and the sun wasn't that hot for us. The water by the pool is complimentary and has a coctail waitress that comes around to take your order for drink or munchies. I ordered an asian chicken salad, mai tai and double shot of rum and coke for my husband and i, cost us close to $50! EXPENSIVE!!!!!!!!! Club: Xs club--very crowded and $20 to get in. Theres a coupon from the wynn buffet that you can pick up where the girls are free for only certain days but you have to get in before midnight. Unfortunately, the line was so long that you have to be in line before 10pm or ealier to get inside by midnight. Again, drinks inside the club are expensive. It was so crowded that everyone bumping and hitting each other that i saw couple episode of almost erupting into a fight, so we got out..The music seemed to go on forever and ever to our room till about 445am. Xs is openned friday -monday. Aside from the music from the Club, my husband and i heard few conversation next door and nothing in the hallway. I always put our don't disturb light on. The casino is small but not bad for me and my husband, we are not a gambler, just passing time. The hotel has free valet parking but i heard complained of being slow so my husband parked our rental car himself. we always found parking easily in first and second floor close to the entrance. The hotel is accessible to the Forum shop,wynn shops and palazzo hotel but a lot of walking. Overall, it was a nice hotel but it is gear toward adult pupulation, businesses and high profile customers. Another thing the hotel should have at least a welcoming basket of fruit or nuts complimentary for couple celebrating anniversary, bithdays or at least with 50th or above birthday or some other special occasion to ensure customer to keep coming back. I told the hotel reservation its for my husband 50th birthday and she told me theres nothing complimentary that the hotel do. '

Reviews.Title: “Encore”
Reviews.Author: TheNetBuilder
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at the Encore in Las Vegas - checking in on Friday and departing on Monday. We stayed in the tower rooms, non-strip facing. The rooms are very nice and large. We had a king bed and it was very comfortable. The bathroom has double sinks, tub and shower. The bathroom is large and nicely appointed. The room was quiet if you wanted to sleep, and as long as you set the privacy indicator, you are not disturbed. Check-in: one word of advice, it can be a long wait to check-in if you arrive from Noon to 4ish. If you can wait, it will be a lot faster after 3-4pm. Location: The Encore is attached to the Wynn, which has the larger casino; the Encore casino is small but nice. Across Las Vegas Blvd is Fashion Show Mall. It has lots of shopping options and several restaurants. Realize you are staying towards the Downtown end of the strip and it is a bit of a hike to center and south strip. I like all of the Wynn created properties and the Encore was no exception. Service was good, the food in the cafes and restaurants was excellent - although not low cost if you are looking for that. The walk between the Encore and Wynn is reasonable. It is a nice property overall!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but I would return only if I got a good rate”
Reviews.Author: josiebishopbaptiste
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three night stay at the Encore. The rooms are spacious, clean, beautifully decorated and comfortable. The location on the strip isn’t bad, but just be prepared for LOTS and LOTS of walking. Comfortable shoes are a must. The staff was relatively friendly. A few complaints which didn’t surprise me based on some reviews: our room was not ready until about 4:30pm (we arrived at 3pm just in time for check-in). We had to ask at least 2-3 times before we could check in. There is really no place to sit and hang out – and who wants to drag their luggage all around? The walls are paper thin and even though we stayed on the 24th floor, the music each night (until 4am) from the club downstairs was LOUD with constant BASS. No need to go to the club, we could have had the club right in our room. I requested a one hour late checkout, and was told that wasn’t possible. After some negotiation, our request was finally granted – after all, we had to wait to check in, the least they could do was let us stay an hour longer! The hotel feels like a maze and it takes a good while to walk through the smokey casino and shops. One tip – the hotel “store” is pricey but there is a discount store in the Fashion Show Mall directly across the street. I suggest going there to stock up on water! I would stay at the Encore again, but only if we got a good rate, otherwise, I might check out another property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Addition to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel009
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a promotion. Great hotel. Service very friendly. Ate at Sinatra. Good meal but the Italian wine was way overpriced. Room was fantastic with greeat view. Heated tiles in bathroom made it difficult to adjust all room temperatures. We didn't leave the room the first day until noon, and despite the maid seeing us leave, and turning on the sign for room cleaning, was not cleaned when we returned at 3:00 pm.

Reviews.Title: “$250 for a pool umbrella?! Are they kidding?”
Reviews.Author: GeoSin
Reviews.Content: Total disappointment. It began with the woman checking us saying over and over “You are staying for 5 days?! Wow. That’s a long time!” Progressed to the room itself. Nicely appointed but unbelievably limited in drawers and closet space. A couple of tiny drawers for each guest? Half a closet? Oh look there’s a huge console in the bedroom! Whoops – just a nice oversized wrapping for the mini bar. The centerpiece of the room is a huge flat screen TV. Which is nice if you are there to watch TV but who goes to Vegas to watch TV? The walls are – as has been reported in other reviews – super thin. We were awakened around 1AM Saturday night by a group of young women in the room next door screaming and laughing. I called the front desk to complain. To illustrate how bad the noise actually was – I held the phone up in the air for the woman at the front desk to hear for herself. “That’s next door?!” she asked me. Yes ma’m, it sure is. They did respond with security at the door within a few minutes. But even security ringing the bell and the conversation he had with the guests next door was fully audible from our bed. But what made us check out 3 days early and move to the Bellagio is that when you go to the pool and ask for an umbrella the charge for it is $250! Which by the way was more than the price of our room. There had to be some mistake. Nope. Unless you are a “Tower Suite” guest with access to the VIP Tower Suite private pool – which provides umbrellas free of charge – expect a room charge of $250 for the umbrella. Desert sun? No shade? And $250 for an umbrella? Wow. We checked out and moved to the Bellagio where we were given an umbrella by the pool free of charge. But it does make me wonder if the Encore has no trouble skimping on basic amenities like umbrellas by the pool for guests who aren’t “high rollers” what other basic amenities – that we can’t see – are they skimping on as well? Ugh. I don’t even want to think about that one!

Reviews.Title: “The Numbers”
Reviews.Author: mcvegas
Reviews.Content: A 5 star hotel staffed with 1 star employees. With the low room rates you get 3 star neighbors. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BrownsFanToronto
Reviews.Content: Huge room at a great price. The hotel is brand new, so it is clean and beautiful. Classy (in a Vegas way) and not anywhere near as crowded as some of the other hotels. Pools (including the ones at the Wynn) are great. Service is friendly and the restaurants are good but VERY expensive. Having said that, I would recommend Botero for a splurge. Truly one of the best meals I have ever had. One the negative side... the XS nightclub blasts music poolside from 10-4 every night/early morning. Our room on the 18th floor was subjected to a steady thump-thump-thump. We tried to deal with it, but gave up after an hour. On the plus side - after calling the front desk, it took less than a half an hour before we were in a quiet room on the other side of the hotel. The service was that responsive. I don't mind spending extra money on food and sundries if I am treated like a valued customer. And at the Encore, that's precisely how I felt. Even the stickmen at the craps table were friendly. One other thing - the Wynn has the best, most comfortable sports book I have ever been in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ediggidy
Reviews.Content: Just spent three days at Encore and it was a terrific experience. Such a huge difference in the new hotels vs. the old hotels. The wear and tear is just not there. We stayed in the basic room and it was over 700 sq feet and very nice. Once of the best hotel beds, soft, but not too soft. The staff was very attentive and helpful. Both check out an check in were made easy by a helpful staff. The casino is on the small side but Wynn is a five minute walk. The path between Wynn and Encore is much more doeable than the maze between Palazzo and the Veneitian. The spa is amazing. For my next trip back, I will stay here again and that is not normal since I like to experience the different hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Encore!”
Reviews.Author: 1GraciousTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a complimentary 2 night stay at the Encore and I can truly say that this was one of our best hotel experiences ever! The resort was so upscale in every aspect, I really hated to leave! We had a pleasant check-in and received a room on the 33rd floor where we had a great view of the strip (could see the Mirage Volcano go off at night) and a view of the pools at the Encore and Wynn and as well as the golf course. We we impressed with the floor to ceiling windows, and a nice couch with lounge to enjoy the view. The bed linens were exquisite, and we appreciated the robes and slippers that were provided. The tv that swiveled to be viewed from the sitting area and bed was a wonderful idea, and the bathroom was elegant with the double sinks, great lighting, glass shower with a good shower head and hand held attachment. We were also impressed with the remote panel next to the bed that controlled the curtains, lighting and privacy button. The decoration throughout the hotel is eye popping and sometimes over the top, but I almost felt that I was in a palace. The pool area at the Wynn was better than the Encore, and we savored the experience with the beautiful gardens, elegant arches, relaxing music, complimentary water and great pool towels. By the way, the buffet at the Encore was the best that we have ever had in Vegas! Very fresh, gourmet and elegant food. I can't wait to go back and experience the pampering Encore again!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite - even better than the first time!”
Reviews.Author: godiva136
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Encore after a short two-night stay. This was our second time staying at the Encore (the first was over Valentine's Day) and this stay far surpassed the first go-round. We stayed in the Tower Suites in a Salon suite, high on the 55th floor, which afforded us a great view of the Strip (and the big sparkly Wynn sign right next door - ha). Bell service was prompt and helpful, which was my chief complaint last trip, and check-in was smooth and swift. As usual, the room was impeccable - squeaky clean, gorgeously appointed, and well stocked. We had one teeny complaint - there were some track lights that wouldn't turn off - but that was dealt with and fixed within 15 minutes of discovery, and really, it's all in how they treat you. So we had zero complaints as far as that goes. We tried Sinatra (we have previously dined at Switch, Botero, and of course the Society Cafe) and found it slightly lacking. Ambience and service are nice enough (if a wee bit slow), but the food wasn't too hot. I don't think we'll be eating there again, but by no means was it a bad restaurant - there are simply finer offerings on the Strip (and indeed, within the Wynn properties). The casino continues to be my favorite casino - small, intimate, and upscale. The usual drunk frat boys and half dressed cigarette-chugging women aren't really found here, and it's refreshing. If I wanted someone breathing Jack Daniels in my face while I was playing blackjack, I'd go somewhere else. Of course I visited the spa and had the most wonderful massage I have ever had - better than the last one I had there, and that is really saying something. I may very well change my allegiance from the Four Seasons at this rate. The spa is decadent, gorgeous, fabulously well appointed, big, detailed (a la signature Wynn), and utterly tranquil. Even I, who can't fall asleep in a public place for the life of me, took a decent snooze by the hot tub on these amazing heated rock-type chairs they have (sounds uncomfortable - but believe me, it was a slice of heaven). I truly cannot say enough good things about the spa. Service was impeccable all around, from room service to bellmen to security. Truly one of the best service experiences I have personally had. Being younger and a woman, it can often be difficult to obtain the same level of service and attention afforded to others, and I was very pleasantly surprised. Encore makes you feel special! :) We visited XS not this trip, but a couple of weeks ago with a passel of friends, so I'll light on that - GORGEOUS club, big, shiny, and fantastic. Great music, amazing ambiance, gorgeous people, fantastic bottle service, and a lot of details - if you go, be sure to check out the wings on the ceiling. Well worth attending. I can't wait to go back again. This is far and away my favorite hotel in Vegas and I recommend it to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “First time is a charm....”
Reviews.Author: kitkatdaisy
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying at Encore during our first trip to Vegas. This hotel is hip and relevant. No crazy ornate frou frou nonsense. We arrived on a Friday morning walked into the Tower Suites private check in, employed the "$50 trick" and found ourselves in a 1400 square foot north facing Parlor Suite. If you can swing it, definitely go for the Tower; it's so worth it. 2 bathrooms, a massage room, a living room, bedroom and enormous bathroom. The suite was brand new, beautifully appointed and perfectly clean. There is a wet bar with an empty mini fridge, and also a mini bar with all the accouterments. The website photos depict the rooms exactly. There was a 52" tv in the living room, a 42" in the bedroom and a 19" in the bathroom. My only complaint about the suite is that it seemed a bit too minimalist. There was only a sitting chair in the second half of the bedroom and it seemed lost in the space. Also there was a big gap of space before the bathroom on the left side of the bedroom. It looked sadly empty. We never heard a peep from the hallway or anyone else's room. If you want turndown service, simply call housekeeping and they will happily provide it for you. We found the service in this hotel exemplary. Each time we walked into the lobby we were greeted with a smile. Each time we requested something it was addressed promptly. Room service food was the best I have ever had in any 5 star hotel. It was fresh, clean food presented beautifully. Also we had two breakfasts at Society and the food was very good. In a word, the spa is extraordinary. You will step into a sea of tranquility where no details have been overlooked. Wonderful treatment rooms, 4 different pools, specialty showers, and every other amenity you can think of. Yes, it is expensive, but the extras are so worth it! The therapists and treatments were first rate. We sat at the outdoor pool for a little while and within minutes were approached by an outgoing friendly cocktail waitress for drinks which were huge, delicious and not lacking liquor! One evening we saw Le Reve which was absolutely unbelievable. Pure Vegas entertainment. We ate at SW Steakhouse and the food and service was very good. We also reserved VIP at Blush and were treated like Royalty. We found the location of the Wynn properties perfect. In our opinion it was nice to be a little bit removed from all the craziness yet it's only a 5 minute cab ride away from everything. We are very picky travelers and expect the best. Encore delivered that and then some. We cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, classy and THE place to be... at a price.”
Reviews.Author: Stuartyboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from the Encore after a seven night break. This hotel is truely a sight to be seen. It is by far the best hotel we have ever stayed in and I would argue the best on the Strip. You can see the million of dollars it took to construct in the detail; from the massive chandelier outside when you drive up to the luxuriousness of every suite in the hotel. But be warned this does come at a price while you are there. Check in/out: Check in and out was effortless. I was expecting lines and grumbling Americans complaining endlessly but not a peep. The lady who checked us in spent so much time answering our questions; very helpful,l friendly and welcoming. I really think it depends when you arrive. The hotel was very crowded Friday-Sunday. Midweek was not so bad. Rooms: The rooms are amazing. So luxurious. A marble hall opens up into a bedroom and then living space. The 42 inch TV is great which swivels so you can watch it in the living area and while in bed. The bathroom is also finished to a very high standard. We loved the double sinks, bath and separate shower with two shower heads. Th toilet is also off he bathroom in a different room. The bed is THE most comfortable bed we have ever slept in. In some ways it was a hindrance as it was such a hassle to get out of it! Food: There are many restaurants in the hotel but I would say there needs to be more casual dining options. Zoozacrackers is great for burgers and sandwiches but sometimes we craved food that wasn't of this sort at affordable prices. We ate at SW one night which was incredible but it did come at a price. The breakfast buffet is also incredible but again comes at a price; $18.95 each and if you are staying for an extended period it does add up. At times we were screaming 'We only want a bowl of cereal and some fruit for $15 all in' but the Encore is not this sort of place. If you want this you should be staying at Circus Circus where they have a McDonalds... enough said! Pool Area: The pool area lets the hotel down in my opinion. Although well designed it is far too small for the hotel. The Wynn one is much more appealing, better designed and less crowded but I think that is due to there being more space. I purchased some cream at the pool... $33 dollars... but that is the price of where you are staying. Did I mentioned the $8 dollar charge for bottled water in the room or the $9 charge to take elivery of flowers that a relative sent us. (Take some time now to reflect on the title of this review. Is it sinking in?!) Spa: In one word... awesome. Be prepared to let it all hang out though in the spa. Separate ones for men and women so if going with a partner you will be split. I had a massage and it was sublime. My wife had a facial. Total: $400. (Refer back to title once more!) Location: I really liked it. Not right in the hub but really close to the Venetian (which is amazing) for Blue Man Group, Phantom and Jersey Boys which we saw and across the road from the Fashion Mall which offers cheaper food options including Starbucks, KFC and other more affordable options if 'fast'. Gripes and advice: The pros far outweigh the cons at the Encore but here are a few negatives and bits of advice to help you... 1. Bring lots of money you will need it! Our check out bill was nearly $900 and we really didn't go nuts. Treatments and ONE meal in fine dining restaurant pushed it up. 2. Go to Hoover Dam or a variety of other trips with Pink Jeep Tours. You can book with the bell desk; not the concierge which I thought was strange. Very good sevice. 3. Bring very comfortable walking shoes. Due to the location, you will walk a lot. All the hotels are on a massive scale. To walk to the buffet in the wynn from the encore will take you 15 minutes and this is at a fast pace. We underestimated the scale of everything before we arrived. Pace yourself. 4. Noise. Although we didn't experience room to room noise, we were disturbed b the beat from the nightclub Fri-Mon. We were in a strip view room on 27th floor. If you don't want to be listening to the beat then request a room at other side of hotel. In my opinion, in a hotel of this class you should be hearing a pin drop. Disappointing even though the view was amazing. I would have been even more pissed off if I had kids with me. 5. Just embrace the madness. Las Vegas is crazy and like nowhere you have ever been to; it's loud, false, imposing, overwhelming and exciting. You shouldn't really love it but just go with the flow!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, great experience”
Reviews.Author: Teach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Monday through Friday. Arrived at 10:00 in the morning and our room wasn't ready. That was fine, we went to get lunch and while eating, my husband got a call on his cell that our room was ready. Thought that was fast. We asked for an upper level floor with a good view of the strip. We got the 16th floor which was great because any higher high and the view wouldn't have been as good. However, was disappointed that were on the opposite side of the good view of the strip. We faced Fremont street end which was more construction. However, it still wasn't a "bad" view. The window is the entire width and length of the room and was wonderful. Night view was fantastic. The resort is absolutely beautiful. However, beware that all of the restaurants and bars are very expensive. We ate at the Switch Restaurant one night and spent $160.00 for the two of us and we only ordered their special which consisted of soup, entree (chicken which was excellent) and a small dessert. That was $59.00 each and we each had a beer because we found a new one we can't get at home that we really liked (Flat Tire). That was it! With tip it all added up to $160.00. But what the heck, we were on vacation. Overall, great resort. There are two pools, one had quite a few kids which I don't have a problem with that, I love my grandchildren but they were quite noisy and splashed a lot. So we went over to the meditterean pool which requires you to be 21 because it was topliess. No one was until we got ready to leave and two gals planted themselves right next to the entrance. Was kind of strange to me. Only disappointment was check out. We waited in line for 45 minutes. Only 4 four people in front of us but lots of questions regarding their bills where managers needed to be called in. Switched line though and moved up faster. However, beware of the added charges for the mini bar in room. I was aware of the fact that we shouldn't touch any of the candies, etc. for sale. Bellman even told us not to touch anything because it was all weighted and we'd be charged if it was taken out of it's "home". Looked at bill and was charged $8.00. I asked how that would happen when we didn't touch anything. She asked if we took out the ice bucket! We said yes, and she said that's probably what did it. So make sure you look carefully at your bill! I was really glad we didn't choose to do the express checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms in an "ok" location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: missywiener
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautifully appointed. The view was fantastic. I stayed at the Palazzo in January and the suites are quite similar. Both hotels were pretty new agt the time and the introductory rates were fantastic. I prefer the decor in the Encore, but I did like the sunken living room in the Palazzo. I found the staff to be quite helpful and eager to have me return to the Encore for my next Vegas stay. That's saying a lot considering that I am only 24 and look even younger; I am used to people treating me not as nicely as they assume I am too young to know how to tip properly or something. My biggest problem with the hotel is that it is pretty far up the strip. The Encore does have amazing nightlife, however, so they make it worth your while to stay here. I just hope that I can find another good deal so that I can return.

Reviews.Title: “Best on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuyNewYork
Reviews.Content: Best place in Vegas. Great design, friendly staff, amazing food, cool nightlight options. Every time my wife and I stepped 'off-campus' to visit restaurants at other hotels, we were sorely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks, Mr Wynn!!”
Reviews.Author: j0rdysm0m
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about the Encore on here, I was paranoid for 3 weeks before we left that our experience was going to be horrible! I should not have worried at all. This hotel was gorgeous, the service was amazing, the room was beautiful. Here's a synopsis. Check-in: We arrived at 11am and our room was ready. We were upgraded to a higher floor just by asking, and to a North-facing room so we wouldn't hear the nightclub. We didn't have to wait in line to check in, although we got there on a Thursday. The next day, we saw a massive line/crowd at the check in though. This always happens in Vegas so those who complained about long check in lines maybe haven't ever been to Vegas before? Anyways, I did see 2 hotel employees (in suits) surveying the line to figure out a better way to do things...so maybe they'll get a bit more organized in the near future. We had NO problems, though. The room: wasn't really a suite, just a larger-than-average room with a dividing wall. Who cares, it was gorgeous. And we had no noise problems whatsoever. I am the lightest sleeper and I hate, repeat, hate hearing people in other rooms when I'm in hotels. Our room was totally quiet and so comfortable. I can't say enough about the bed...I wanted to pack it in my suitcase and take it home. I spent half the vacation in the bed because it was so amazing. The soaps and lotion they give you in the bathroom are scrumptious lemon. So nice. Didn't have room service so can't comment on that. The bathroom was bigger than our master bedroom at home. No complaints. Oh one - we didn't have a trash can in our bathroom but the maid brought one right away. The Spa: didn't have a treatment but we worked out one morning. Very nice fitness centre, it was $30 but that's the case with most of the hotels in Vegas. Nothing is cheap so if you want a cheap vacation, go to Iowa or something. Anyways, the fitness centre was a bit warm and after being up late a warm room and a run on the treadmill was a bit nauseating. Otherwise the staff was so nice, they have bottled water and lockers and whatever. The Society Cafe: we didn't experience the bad service that others wrote about. In fact, the service was amazing, the food came quickly, and it was so good. I had a turkey club sandwich, yummy. Hubby had tuna sliders, amazing. Casino: it depends what you want, really. If you want frat boys and 21 year old drunk girls falling all over eachother, go somewhere else. If you're single and you want to meet someone, it's probably not gonna happen at the Encore. The casino is really nice, not smoky, no riff raff, but my complaint about it is that there are very few tables where you can bet less than $25. And, we didn't hear a lot of slots ringing..meaning, people weren't winning (?) The pool: gorgeous. but the weather was crap so we didn't lie out a lot. Servers were quick and attentive, unlike some other hotels where you have to jump up and down to get their attention. Didn't go to XS nightclub but there were a TON of people in line when we passed by at 12am on Friday. Mostly people in the 21-30 range with a LOT of makeup on. But, that's Vegas for you. All in all, a great experience with no problems. Honorable mention to the staff, they were so nice, so helpful, we can't stress that enough.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Hotel, Fourth Rate Staff”
Reviews.Author: bdj1978
Reviews.Content: I chose the Encore based on a $159/night NCAA Basketball package offered on the Wynn website. When I did not receive a confirmation of my reservation by email after a few days, I called the Wynn 800 number and the very helpful operator confirmed my reservation and the rate, and promptly emailed a confirmation (only upon my return home did I notice that the room rate field was conspicuously blank). My friend Rob and I arrived late Friday afternoon and were informed at the front desk that not only were they out of rooms with two Queen beds (a bit of a problem - Rob and I are close, but not that close), but that our rate was actually $209/night. Of course, we protested and were informed that the system had no record of that rate (I am still at something of a loss as the Wynn website featured a prominent ad that bodly stated the $159/night rate). After half an hour of being passed around and the infuriating mumbled apologies for the confusion, I was offered the very unsatisfactory suggestion that "maybe that rate only applied to telephone reservations." Determined not to let this ruin our weekend, we begrudgingly checked in. We had just set down our bags in the room when Kevin from the Wynn reservations office called. I outlined my complaint, and offered to call my office in Los Angeles and have the confirmation I received forwarded to him. His response can best be summed with two words: arrogant and condescending. He also contradicted himself a number of times, leading me to believe I did not have his full attention. I got pretty fed up with his treatment, told him that I would not spend a dime at either Wynn property, and terminated the call. Needless to say, this was not the ideal start to our weekend. We recovered quickly though - it is Vegas after all. As we are acccustomed, we enjoyed a pint or three at Nine Fine Irishmen Pub and Grill at New York, New York, and an amazing meal at Bouchon at the Venetian. The poker room at Caesar's was a pleasant surprise this trip, as was their spacious sports book. Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill lived up to the hype, and Napoleon's at the Paris is a pretty happening night spot. By and large, we otherwise enjoyed our stay at the Encore...until Saturday night. When we returned to the hotel around 2 a.m., we discovered our room keys were not working. We walked back to the front desk and were provided new keys by the desk clerk, who thought the system was "virused." We walked back to the room to find that the new keys were equally as ineffective. After another trip to the front desk - no short trek, especially when you have the room at the end of the hall - we were offered more mumbled apologies, some reports of similar complaints from other guests, and new keys, which also did not work. Tired of walking and just plain tired, I elected not to return to the front desk and instead entered the housekeeping quarters, where I picked up the nearest phone. I was transferred around and then told that security was en route. After fifteen minutes of literally lying in the halls, I got back on the phone and was reassured that security was en route. When a security guard arrived ten minutes after that, we gave him a little cheer. He then checked our IDs and tried unsuccessfully to open the door with his key card. We were asked to wait another five minutes while a booster key was retrieved. Fifteen minutes later, the security guard returned with his supervisor, each of whom thought the other had brought the booster key. Had they not been so embarassed and apologetic, I would have sworn we were on a candid camera program. More waiting ensued, but we were finally admitted to our room - an hour and a half after the whole ordeal began. I was too tired to do anything but turn in for the night. My friend Rob, however, immediately got on the phone with the night manager. After going round and round with her, he was put on hold and then told that the hotel would honor the $159/rate - the rate that did not exist the night before. As he put it the next morning, "it was as though she and the rest of the clerks received a no apologies, no gimmes lecture from management a few hours earlier." That pretty much sums up our experience at the Encore. It's really too bad. The resort is really quite lovely, elegantly decorated, and conveniently located with spacious rooms and all the amenities you would expect at a first rate hotel. The fourth rate staff, however, makes one feel more like a burden than a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place...especially with the discounts that abound now!”
Reviews.Author: incompletebt
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Encore on USAir Vacations (about $100 less per person than Expedia or Orbitz). Figured for a great price, before prices went up again, would stay and enjoy the 5 star experience. Every single person who worked at the hotel was accomodating, friendly, and welcoming. We arrived at 9 in the morning, and since a room wasn't ready, they offered us pool passes for the day till our room was ready. A nice guesture, even though I would have had to change in the lobby bathroom. No other hotel has ever offered this to me, and I have stayed in Vegas at over 10 different hotels. The room was gorgeous, spacious, and luxurious. Everything is top-notch, from the wall paper, to the MOST COMFORTABLE BED, to the remote control for the curtains and lights. The pool, especially the Euro side, is beautiful and spacious (although it was not the summer 110 degree weather which draws the crowds). The location is at the far side of the strip, which is a bit far for me. I prefer to go to a casino with single and double deck blackjack tables, and they were not easy to find. I believe I saw one once, but it was closed later. I typically gamble at the Harrah's properties (great rewards card), so it was a bit of a walk. If you are content with "shoes" for blackjack, and plan on gambling there most of the time, then Encore is perfect for you. I will say that although this hotel is a bit out of the way, I would definitely stay here again...the room and service made up for it. (For those who don't know Vegas, look at the distribution of hotels on the strip and you will see that this is the last major hotel on the strip before you head towards Circus Circus and the Riviera...) Read a lot of reviews about the paper thin walls and the noise...didn't experience one bit of it.

Reviews.Title: “The PERFECT hotel for a Las Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: PaulJudeRN
Reviews.Content: We recently returned for a 6 day stay at the Encore Hotel in Las Vegas. We travel to Las Vegas frequently for both business and pleasure and over the course of the last few years have had opportunities to stay in most of the major hotels on the strip-especially the Bellagio and Cesaers. The Encore is far and above the best hotel in the Las Vegas. The rooms are large, well designed and perfectly appointed. Check in was easy with a knowledgable and courteous staff. There are a wide range of options for dining and we ate in most of the resturants in the hotel......and would recommend Botero at the Encore and Alex at the Wynn. The pools were terrific and for us, the location was exactly where we wanted to be on the strip. I can't imagine staying in any other hotels in future trips to Las Vegas. This hotel is an A+.

Reviews.Title: “better than the original”
Reviews.Author: chathamNY
Reviews.Content: Wynn has repeated the success of the WYNN and evolved. The hotel is bright, smoothly run, not LV tacky (although it is over the top..) and with current rates AMAZING. We have to visit LV four/Five times a year...and tried them all... NO MORE, we have a place that is now our favorite. Room service was perfect, the rooms quiet and well designed (there are even enough outlets for our electronics as well as theirs!), the check-in and out was, for a huge hotel, smooth. Some rambling comments: the hallways are long, but not endless, the spa is really nice, the sun coming into the hotel was great, restaurant offerings abundant, parking a breeze, the connection to the WYNN nicely done, the new sky bridges connecting LV's other resorts and shopping great... I don't like LV but if I have to go..this is as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable First Time in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LPC2910
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay in Vegas at the Encore. Absolutely one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. All rooms have a "suite" design. The layout is unique with floor to ceiling windows, luxurious bedding, power window sheers and drapes, integrated lighting, upscale furniture and lamps, and a serene marble bathroom with double sinks, tub and clear glass shower stall with seat. Arrived at 3:00 and check in was a breeze. Jennifer took care of accomodating all of our requests which we had emailed to the hotel a week before our arrival. We had a view of the strip and golf course, a king size bed, non smoking room on the 25th floor. Without exception, all of the staff were friendly and professional. Definitely an upscale environment where both the decor and personnel were top notch. Since this was our first trip to Vegas, we decided to rent a car at the last minute. It was one of the best decisions we could have made. All of the hotels along the Strip, offer free parking...including free valet parking. Note, the valet service at Encore is excellent. What luxury....pull up to the front door of any casino and the valets wisk your car away and you waste no time walking from self parking or from your hotel. We visited most of the casino hotels on the strip and wasted no time walking or waiting for buses or monorails to take us there. Gave a $2 tip each time we used valet service. Location of the Encore is perfect. Just far away enough (a couple of blocks) from the heaviest congestion. Driving in Vegas is simple and tame compared to cities like Philadelphia. Also saw Danny Gans Show at Encore. Worth every penny. Overheard someone say they had been to his show 4 times and each time it was different but still great. Will definitely stay at Encore again when I return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting experience!”
Reviews.Author: gambler233
Reviews.Content: My family and I are frequent visitors to Las Vegas and this was our worst hotel experience! First of all, registration was very disorganized and took forever. I did a phone booking for a suite with double queen beds (which was clearly stated in the confirmation email that I received from them). However, I was given a room with one bed and it seemed like it was a big favor that they gave me an uncomfortable rollaway bed instead of another queen bed. To make things worse, the room keys didn't work....security took forever to respond to open the room & I had to stand in line again at the registration desk to get the keys re-validated. The bathroom floor was filthy...there was some gooey material that was not cleaned. I would not stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nicolePGH
Reviews.Content: We try to visit LV for MLK weekend every year. I found a great deal to stay at the Encore, which is part of the Wynn, and had just opened in December. If you are considering the Wynn, Venetian, Palazzo, then definitely also look at the Encore since they are all next to each other. Check in was a breeze, even when arriving on Friday night. And no long line at the airport for a taxi! :-) Anyway, when we walked into the room we were both amazed. Absolutely beautiful. And brand spanking new. The bathrooms, the bed, the sitting area, the floor to ceiling windows... it was all extremely nice. My husband was taking pictures on his phone and uploading them to Facebook... that's how nice it was. We ordered room service and I have NEVER experienced better quality food or service. I travel for work a lot and get room service all the time. This is certainly the best experience I have had. We went to LV to just relax so we spent the whole weekend pretty much in "Wynn World". We did go to Sensi for dinner on Saturday night. Overall I was not impressed. I didn't really like anything I had, including the famed black cod. If you do decide to go give yourself extra time upon arrival because it's buried inside Bellagio way past the chocolate place... maybe for a reason.... We basically just vegged out and walked around, watched some NFL playoff games, signed up for the Red Club and got 2 free meals at the Wynn buffet. Shame on us... we totally skipped and didn't take advantage of them. We ordered room service again the night before we left and I had spaghetti and meatballs... it was literally among the best I've ever had. Delicious! Overall I would absolutely recommend you stay here if you're thinking about staying on this end of the strip. Really great option for such a low price (if you get a good deal...). It's worth paying way more than I did!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but had some issues”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_IlFoodiegal
Reviews.Content: So many of the reviews on here were spot on-I usually listen to them with a grain of salt and if most of them are favorable that is good enough for me. However, there were a lot of complaints on here and unfortunately they were right. First of all, we tried to check in when we arrived at noon but were told no rooms were ready. We came back at 340pm and were told the same thing. When I said " I thought check in was at 3pm" the girl behind the desk said "check in STARTS at 3pm." Nice. Anyhow my husband told them we had dinner reservations at 630 and needed time to rest and they gave us a handicapped-accessible room on the 52nd floor. It was a nice view of the strip. The walls were paper thin. From 12-2 that morning a child in the next room was crying and whining. The next day at 4 am a loud group arrived from partying and was loud and raucous for 20 minutes. I could here another conversation in the bathroom throught the vents as well. The rooms are very comfy though and especially the beds. No turn down service, disappointing for a hotel of this caliber. We got robes, but no slippers- unlike the Venetian. The lemongrass soap is very pleasant. The lines to check in/out are individual- instead of the one big line. So you better hope you pick the right one. Had a $50 resort credit which took a phone call and visit to the front desk to get straightened out. Our room was charged for the mini bar which we never used/touched. Ate at Society Cafe- service painfully slow to start but food was excellent, and this wasn't even one of the top restaurants here! Definitely go back here. A lot of restaurants have specials now at great prices ( maybe due to the economy). I had a mac and cheese appetizer, 8 oz filet, and warm donuts for dessert for $38. Excellent value. What sold us on this place was the clientele- no tank tops or yard-long margarita types here. Very classy and especially in the evenings. Don't get me wrong we gamble during the day everywhere but we like a sophisticated atmosphere where we stay. This place fits that bill. I said I wouldn't come back becasue of the acoustics in the rooms but my husband really liked it here ( he slept through all the noise). Oh, another thing- it was my 40th burthday and my husband mentioned that when we checked in. The gal sent up a pretty tray of chocolates that said "Happy Anniversary" on them. When we were leaving, two different older couples were in the elevator on the way down and said they got upgraded to suites on the top floors because it was their birthdays that weekend. I guess you need ot be a senior citizen to get any upgrades here.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Encore!”
Reviews.Author: wallyQ
Reviews.Content: - Amazing Suite - Very Comfortable Bed! - Modern Luxurious Design - Spacious Rooms - Nice Bathroom - Great Lobby - Good Service but a bit busy at times - Long Walk to the Wynn and the Strip. Around 15 mins. - Not the Best location, at the Far end of the strip. Very Wonderful Stay at the Encore. Highly Recommended. The Rooms are the Best in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: marcosv
Reviews.Content: We had our concerns due to some mixed reviews we'd read, but we ended up having an amazing experience. Hotel was beautiful. Room was good sized with all the amenities you would ever want. Staff was extremely friendly. The Buffet --- on the Wynn side --- is terrific. It has a great selection. A little more upscale than the avg buffet. They don't put out huge quantities so the food is always hot and fresh. The area around the hotel is quiet. More laid back than center strip, but the mall is close by. If you're looking for a place where you can easily get to all the attractions (hotels) on the strip, this may not be the right place. If you do want to get to other areas, the hotel esplanade is like a walk on rodeo drive and it's a nice and spacious alternative to walking on the strip. This is not the place for people that like massive casinos or high energy hotels. This is for those looking for an elegant and more reserved environment. However, the nightclubs seem to be very popular. Didn't get a chance to go, but there were long lines around 10pm on thursday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: mrmull
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple recently spent three nights in the new Wynn Hotel addition, Encore. There are a lot of good things to say about Encore but also some things that need fixing. First the good things. Like most hotels in Las Vegas, room prices were much lower than in the past. We got our room for $169/night and have been told that when the hotel opened in December 2008 the rooms were initially priced at $350/night. Encore is beautifully decorated, both in the casino and public areas and in the rooms. Without exception, the staff was extremely friendly, including the dealers. The lobby cafe and lounge was a wonderful place to relax and have a small bite to eat. The food in the restaurant Bolero was excellent as was the service. The rooms have all of the amenities as the regular Wynn Hotel, though to call them suites is a bit misleading. They are in reality regular sized rooms with a divider that holds the television and separates the bed from the rest of the room. The use of mirrors on the walls makes the room feel more spacious that it really is. I should point out that we stayed in a regular resort suite and not in the Encore tower, but we were told by staff that the rooms there are the same as in the regular hotel and that you pay extra for the private check-in and concierge service. However, we found our room perfectly adequate. The bathroom was in the Wynn tradition of large and well-appointed. My wife says that the Encore spa was the best she has ever been in, both in terms of its beauty and the quality of the staff. Now, the bad things. The rooms have no soundproofing. We had "ghost voices" of other guests coming through the walls and even the floor. Our friends had to relocate because of the noise from a neighboring room (the guests were cheering on a team participating in the NCAA basketball tournament). In our friends' new room, they were very bothered at night by the noise from the Encore nightclub XS. A word to the wise--when checking in, request a room on the other side of Encore from the pool, because XS is located by the pool and the nightclub is loud and active from 10 p.m. to 4 a.m. Friday through Monday. The sound travels up, so even staying on a high floor is not effective. It was disappointing that our friends were placed on the pool side of the hotel even after they requested the side away from the pool. We also found the music in the hotel restaurants extremely loud. That isn't a problem in the old Wynn. When we asked one server to turn down the music, she said it was pre-programmed for loudness and the staff had no control over the noise volume. Registration was disorganized as there was no staff member present in the lobby to direct guests to the various lines that formed. We have found that Bellagio handles this very well but not Encore. Our friends also had a bad experience at the restaurant Sinatra before we arrived, but as I did not witness the problem, I won't go into detail. In summary, Encore is nicely appointed and the staff works hard to please (except for our friends' room assignment), but our overall experience was not as good as in the older Wynn Hotel. When we return, we will probably stay in the Wynn Tower rooms and not in Encore, though we will frequent the Encore casino.

Reviews.Title: “Encore almost a home run”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelsc
Reviews.Content: Had 2 rooms for 4 nights during March 2009. Overall a great experience but next time we may go back to the Wynn or try another hotel -- Bellagio, Pallazo, Venetian. Check-in was one of the worst we've seen. A hotel employee was on the scene to try to maintain some order and keep the lines moving but he was successful in making my husband's stay in line longer. (He tried, though) To make it even worse, one of the rooms was not ready (not Encore's fault, we were early East Coast people) and we had to stand in another and much longer line. Rooms were very clean (new hotel) and very spacious. Very similar to Wynn except for the cut-through to make the room a suite and not "just" a room. At at Switch for dinner the first evening and at the Society Cafe for several breakfasts and lunches. Both had friendly and efficient staff and at one lunch at the Society Cafe, Steve Wynn walked in to eat just like he was one of the people! The hotel was beautiful and new and clean. The maids did a great job once they got there but we never in 4 nights had turn-down service. I could have phoned to request/complain but they always left us so many clean towels with the main service we could always get by. However, at a hotel that nice and once costing that much we should not have to ever just "get by". I would recommend Encore to anyone, however we will be in no rush to return. All the little things like no turn down service, strange check-in procedure, not being able to charge something at the gift shop because my husband's name was on the room card and not mine, being at the far end of the stip add up to staying even a tiny bit closer like the Wynn (which has more dining options) or on down further.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rosimmom
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend. The rooms were amazing. We got a really great deal on expedia. We were even upgraded. Each room has a sitting area, a bedroom area and a really really nice bathroom. this is a newer hotel so everything was really clean. the staff was really nice. We followed the recommendation of another traveller and rented a car. it was cheaper than cabs and we saved a ton of time. The parking and valet parking at the major hotels is free. So you don't have to wait on the huge lines for cabs. The Encore is attached to the Wynn and you can walk right over to the Venetian. Be advised the casino is on the smaller side so if you want a really loud and raucous time gambling head over to some of the bigger properies. The clubs were nice here. For food, I would head to the mall across the street, there are cheaper options. I ordered a cake and drinks thru room service for my husband's birthday and they were great. They brought it up as soon as we checked in. I had ordered it two days in advance. It was a work of art and worth the price. The concierge were really helpful and had all info at their fingertips. There are great deals right now so if you can go , you should and stay at the Encore

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skier87
Reviews.Content: I stayed with some friends at the Encore for a bachelor party. I had read some reviews and expected problems but we had none. I did see the "no outside food or drinks" sign by the elevators but it was not enforced by the security that is really only there to make sure only hotel guests go up the elevators. The pool at Encore is nice but small. It is worth it walking the 5 minutes to the Wynn and enjoying the much bigger pool area. Rooms are quite large for "regular" hotel rooms and the sitting area is great for having a drink and watching tv. XS is the nightclub in the Encore and Tryst in the Wynn - both are great although expensive. If you look hard enough in the Encore you should be able to find one or two $10 blackjack tables but none in the Wynn. I would definitely stay at Encore again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, nickel and dimey, but I guess standard for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lmr275rgr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Encore..a beautiful Room, gorgeous view of the strip and the mountains. The hotel is in a great location by a walgreens, and a liquor store for room supplies, in case you just want to get a bottle of wine and enjoy the view. The only knock I have was the fee for wireless internet and use of the fitness center. I say they just include those services in the price of the room...It is $30/day/person to use the fitness center (which is included as the spa fee). It just seemed a little crazy to be staying in a 5 star hotel without free internet and use of the fitness center. They should at least offer guests the choice of using the fitness center without all the spa amenities.The wireless internet is $14/day (24hrs). All in all, the room was great, the bed and sheets are phenomenal, just hate to feel nickel and dimed. Oh, also wish there was a starbucks on site. There is one across the street at the fashion show mall, but wish it was in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Encore is Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: pintessential
Reviews.Content: My group of friends and I had a luxurious stay at Encore in early March. Everything is kept immaculately clean and the service is excellent. We checked in late, and unfortunately the hotel was unable to grant us the two queen beds we requested (very few rooms with two beds in hotel). Fortunately, they were able to give us one the next day and gave us a twin rollaway bed in the meantime. The King room had a divider separating the bedroom from the living area, which was nice. I preferred the room with two queens though, since there was no divider (a big open space) and the air conditioning flowed freely thoughout the room (the King room got very stuffy due to the divider). Both rooms had identical bathrooms with a small tub, separate shower stall, terry cloth bathrobes, double sinks, small flat screen tv with remote, and a toilet in a separate subroom. The main rooms both had an over-priced mini bar (snack food, sodas, alcohol, and an intimacy kit), larger flat screen tv's, bed-side controlled blinds/lights/privacy sign, an ipod dock, a desk with a fax machine, and a fairly large "L" shaped couch (moderately comfortable for sleeping on). There are many mirrors that make the room appear larger and floor-to-ceiling windows with a pool or north strip view. The beds were a bit to soft for me, but I don't sleep much when I'm in Vegas anyways. We went to Blush ultra-lounge at the Wynn and thought the DJ/music were excellent. Beware of the drink prices in Vegas clubs though. They usually range from $10-$15 each. While the location isn't right in the middle of the action, I enjoyed Encore's proximity to the cheaper gambling hotels (Riviera, Circus Circus and Slots-A-Fun) and the nicer ones (Wynn, Palazzo, and Treasure Island). All of these were a ten minute walk or so. We were able to book the hotel for $125 a night plus tax on Expedia by combining it with our flight, which was a steal! Overall, it was an excellent stay and it was nice being pampered for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “No Food. No Service. Doctor needed.”
Reviews.Author: MrLuxury_8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at every nice Las Vegas hotel for business reasons, since the Mirage opened in 1989. And while Encore is the newest large property, it is among my least favorite. Virtually all the hotel public spaces (except some gambling) are located a good distance away in the Wynn. Therefore, if you want to want to eat after 10 pm, play poker or see a show, you will need to walk the long way under the street through a never-ending tunnel to get to the Wynn. Once you get in the Wynn, you still need to find the attraction you are interested in, further in to the casino. Not great if you have someone with even slight problems walking long distances. Our group went to see a show and returned about 10 pm. The Encore staff told us to go to this restaurant or that restaurant at the Encore, not knowing which were open—none where (on a Saturday night). No one wanted to walk all that way AGAIN so we went to lobby bar, receiving the worst service in Nevada: One hour wait to order, one hour wait for food, wait staff arguing with us on what we ordered. Why can’t they just say they are closed? While all the rooms in the Encore are “suites” please keep in mind, this room will be below expectations if you have ever stayed in real suites. The room is on the large side, with a flat panel television dividing the sleeping and sitting areas. A true suite has a separate sitting room with partial bathroom. That way you can have friends or associates visit or meet and not tromp through your sleeping area. Like the Wynn, Venetian, and Palazzo, Encore sprays scent in all the public areas. I am not allergic to anything and I am home for more than a week now and cannot speak. I started getting sick before I spent the first night and it only worsened. Alas, to get a cough drop, you need to leave the Encore/Wynn, so I just left town. DON’T STAY HERE UNLESS YOU REALLY WANT THE EXERCISE AND YOUR WHOLE GROUP IS UP FOR IT.

Reviews.Title: “The best rooms I've slept in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: focculare
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay at the Wynn for the week, and surprise, I got a free upgrade to a suite at the new Encore at the 61st floor (which is actually the 50th, as there is no 13 and 40's - something to do with Chinese badluck). So far great... we went to the Encore elevators, which is a good walk away from the Wynn reservation desk, and every detail you see in that walk is amazing, they really weren't cheap building it... So.. a few stores and such. The Room: Amazing, It's kind of like the Venetian or Palazzo rooms, there's a little living room, separated from the bedroom by a small wall and a 42" LCD, with ¡¡64!! channels. It only has one TV on the living/bedroom area, you just rotate it. The views are spectacular from the room (of course, this from the 61st floor). The bathroom has a TV which has somehow became a standard in this kind of resorts, separate toilet, bathtub and shower, two sinks... the lot... A small wardrobe IMO with a smaller safe for that matter. A desk with a fax machine, and a fancy color LCD phone. LAN and WIFI in every room - with a cost, of course. The craziest thing about this bedroom is that... most of the stuff you find in it is for sale, there's a little brochure in the desk with all the prices and stuff. The service was excellent, I used the concierge a couple of times and they were very friendly and fast with my requests. The casino is not so big, but very well designed and decorated... everything red (again something with the Chinese luck). The valet service was always very fast. The food. I had dinner at the buffet, and you'll like it... if you're one of those people who like gourmet dishes... very elaborate for a buffet IMO. But the food was great, everything tasted excellent, and you can have almost anything done at their live stations. The desserts are spectacular. Pros: Service, Great Rooms, Great Views, Great Casino, Good looking girls and guys. Cons: If you don't have a package of some sort... well the price then. And the toilet paper... awful.

Reviews.Title: “Tower Suites - Every hotel I stay at now is compared to Encore”
Reviews.Author: David1988
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying in the new sister hotel to Wynn called Encore. From now on, I compare all other hotel's to Encore. I stayed in the Tower Suites edition. They have door chimes and a private elevator lobby. The last hotel I stayed in I found myself saying, "why isnt there this or that like Encore in Las Vegas?". Next trip to Las Vegas, I won't have a problem deciding where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Mr_MrsEncore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore tower suite, the Encore made it very hard to leave Las Vegas. It was wonderful waking up to the amazing views through the floor to ceiling windows, it was very posh but some how felt very comfortable like you were home. The hotel is beautiful from beginning to end. A great location were you can easily access the Fashion Show Mall and neighboring hotel/casinos. The lines for checkin looked pretty busy but we got a room in less than 10 min. Also some of the best and swakiest restaurants on the strip. We are heading back to Vegas and staying at one of the Whynn apartments...the feeling thet you receive there is addictive.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, I don't think I can stay anywhere else in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: luckydog818
Reviews.Content: We recently read an article in the LA Times on the opening of the Wynn Encore Hotel. It also said they had some introductory rates. Having not been to Vegas in a while and feeling like a fun weekend away, we booked the Encore Hotel. Wow, what can I say, I have stayed at a few hotels in Vegas like Flamingo, Bally's, Luxor and Bellagio, but wow, this place is far and away the best. The lobby is very nice. The red color everywhere, which I normally would not think nice, is so beautiful. Check-in had a few minute wait. The staff were very nice and helpful. We got a room on the 37th floor (I think, it was up there) facing the strip. The rooms are to die for. Spacious entry, large bathroom, king bed area, spearate living area with floor to ceiling windows. There are so many nice things about this room. The decor was incredible and rich. I could be there for days. The bed was the best bed. I just sank into it, with a huge comforter and sumptuous pillows. With the curtains closed, you could sleep forever, and it seemed we did. But if you want to wake up, just hit the button next to the bed and open the curtains as much as you want. I know everyone writes about this, but it is just so darn great. I want it in my house, but then I'd never get up and go to work. The two Wynn casinos are great and easily connected. I like that it is not in the center of the strip. It just made it less busy, and had a highler level of class with the clientele. It made it fun to dress up. I really just can't ay enough about how great this place is. It is really the best place of the major hotels in Vegas. I don't think I could stay anywhere else now that I have been spoiled. On a separate note: Elton Jon was great and worth every cent. Ka by Cirque du Soleil was my 5th cirque show. All I know was what the heck was that? Spend your money on a good cirque, not this bizarre one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Expensive restaurants, Dissappointingly small pool area”
Reviews.Author: griffjd
Reviews.Content: As with other reviewers I have to agree that in terms of quality this hotel is at the top end of the scale for Vegas. The rooms are extremely comfortable but as with other reviewers the housekeeping can be a bit patchy. Be warned though that there can be quite alot of noise from the XS nightclub at weekends until 4am.If you're trying to cope with jet lag then this can be annoying. Make sure your room is at least on Floor 20 to avoid the worst of it. Another tip would be to have an even numbered room looking Southwards on the Strip (the lower the room number the closer you are to the Strip). Great views over the Golf course at the rear of the property and I would definitely recommend dining at the Country Club overlooking the 18th Green where in Summer you can dine outside. The service is first class and the food excellent. As a Vegas regular I've noticed the wine prices increasing significantly over the past couple of years. Prepare yourself for $70 minimum for a bottle at the Encore. The pool area will be far too small as the weather improves - I think Mr Wynn has missed something here. In addition to the regular pool (which is overlooked from the casino floor) there's also a "European" Pool for over 21's. You also need to consider the location if you are planning to see the rest of the Strip. The Encore is towards the North End of the Strip. The next hotels are Circus Circu and then the Sahara. Its extremely unlikely that as a guest at the Encore you'll have any desire to wander into either of these two properties. It must be a 30 min walk South to the Bellagio. For shopping the Encore is directly across from the Fashion Show Mall and I would try the Italian restaurant over there - great happy hour from 4 - 6.30pm! If you want a room at the Encore then grab one quickly at the current promotional rates. They can't last long at these prices!

Reviews.Title: “Great addition to the Wynn Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Leoliveira77
Reviews.Content: Encore is expensive. You can't go to this hotel if you are in a budget. Even if you get a great deal, remember there are NO cheap places to eat/drink and the Spa/Gym charges you $30/day. However, you get what you pay for. The rooms are very well appointed. Nice decor, stylish, and great lightning. The casino is something you have never seen before. Plenty of sunlight during the day and artwork all around the hotel. I booked a Parlor Suite at the Tower Suites side. This mean different check in so I didn't have any issues with long waiting. The pool area is small, but there were no crowds since the weather was not hot. However, I think this will be an issue once the weather gets hot. I can't see anyone being able to relax there if the hotel gets sold out on Summer. Maybe they did that intentionally since the pool is attached to the night club XS and by the end of this month they will have a DJ during the day. Botero is great. The food and the ambience are amazing. One minor issue: Housekeeping. They did a terrific job in cleaning and maintaining the cleanliness of the room. But they did not (re)place some of the amenities (toothbrush, razor, shower gel). As far as I understand, these little free goodies are part of any rooms at the Tower Suites. The towels were not replaced properly (one day I had only two bath towels and no bath mat by the tub neither by the shower). And lastly, when I checked in there was a cake that I think belonged to the previous guest in the fridge. These are minor issues, but they really need to pay more attention to the little details if they want to achieve what the Tower Suites at Wynn Las Vegas have achieved: 5-star service all over and consistency for almost 4 years. With this addition, I believe Wynn Resorts are the best in town. Stylish, modern, great decor, and the best service. All employees have a true and honest smile in their faces you need them. One last note: The Spa at Encore is something out of this world. Great service and features.

Reviews.Title: “WORST Experience ever....”
Reviews.Author: Malibu310
Reviews.Content: It took 45 minutes to check in. Only to be told none of the four rooms I had booked were ready. When we returned - the wait was 30 minutes - only to be told ONE of the FOUR rooms was ready. Several more hours went by...another lenghty wait in line and ONE more room was ready. The guest went to her room, opened the door and was quite surprised to find it occupied by a couple who were in the midst of a romantic encounter! When the remainder of the rooms were FINALLY ready - we were not given queen beds as requested. We were told there were no queen beds at this facility - yet when the reservation was booked we were given the choice. Our rooms were all on different floors. It was 5:00pm by the time we all got our rooms. This was BY FAR the WORST experience I've EVER had at any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “looking forward to an encore @ encore !!”
Reviews.Author: vegasbud
