Reviews.Content: We were offered a good rate for the Wynn & Encore through our red cards and decided to give Encore a try as we always liked playing at the Wynn but wanted to try the Encore whilst it is new. When we got to our room on the 34th floor we realised we had been given a non smoking room, after a quick call to the front desk we were placed on the 62nd floor ( only 63 floors ) with a panoramic strip view and were blown away by the view. The room itself was amazing, king size bed, great linens ( 1 million thread count or something ) 46inch plasma TV, Ipod dock etc the lounge area has a huge couch to relax on and enjoy that view. Huge bathroom with plenty of towels ( replenished daily ) and excellent shower and ammenities. We did actually manage to lock ourselves out of the bathroom but again, a quick call to maintainence resolved this although my wife had to go down to the casino for a wee in the in-between. !!! We found the whole place to be beautifully decorated with sumptuous wall coverings, carpets etc and fabulous ornaments especially the chanderliers. The casino was small but very light and airy with drinks service aplenty !! we also found the slots to be amongst the loosest we played and saw lots of people winning also ( nothing large though) The pool area is excellent but not the largest in Vegas although you can use The pools at the Wynn ( only a short walk) Good sunloungers with complimentary drinking water. We did have breakfast at the cafe a few times but it is expensive ( as you would expect from a hotel of this quality ), if you want to save some money, i would suggest going out of the main entrance and taking a right and go to the ' American cafe' they even made breakfast bagels for us which weren't even on the menu !! Although the Encore is expensive to dine at, i did note that most restaurants seemed to be offering special deals ( including switch ) I never ate at Encore but i did eat at Stack @ the Mirage for $29.99 for 3 courses and found it excellent value and ate there several times. If i was going to be pedantic, i could mention that there was no slippers, no turn down service, howerver, who cares & the plate of homemade chocolates i was given for my 40th birthday which i celebrated here were awesome and a nice surprise ( they got my birthday from my red card details i didn't have to tell them) Would i stay here again - HELL YEAH !!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: travelbh
Reviews.Content: The encore is the epitome of what a Las Vegas luxury hotel should be. Beautiful rooms, amenities, great staff and service. We stayed in a Suite (sounds expensive but check out the rates they have come down dramatically). Received a food credit, and enjoyed Okada(Hibachi), and the coffee shop at Encore). Danny Gans is a great entertainer and one of the best evenings in a long time. They even have new price fixed menus in many of the restaurants. The weather is great. It's worth a few days to come here and forget the bad economic news. It seems that everyone in Las Vegas appreciates the visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Beyond Belief Mr. Wynn Has Done It Again !”
Reviews.Author: Tiburon-Travel
Reviews.Content: Luxury, pure luxury, I do not know how else to describe Steve Wynn’s newest addition in upscale resorts. Newly opened at the end of 2008, this resort is a great escape for anyone that wants to be pampered 24/7. It is located next door to Wynn, and connected by a corridor containing only the best in upscale shopping, called Esplanade. If you love the color red and butterflies you will not go wrong here, the resort is decorated in both. We arrived at the Encore Friday morning, after being greeted at the front door by a very professional Bell Staff; we went to the front desk for check-in.We were there for one on my clients wedding that she booked at [-]. The front desk staff did a great job of getting us checked-in and to our room, within 15 minutes we were looking out at the view which encompassed the Wynn Country Club, the Strip and the Nevada mountains, we could not have asked for a better room location or view. The room at just over 700 sq ft. has everything that you could possibly want or need during your stay in Vegas. The bathroom consisting of all marble floors has a large shower, soaking tub, 2 vanities, a decent sized TV, and a separate toilet room. Large closet space in the hallway, with ample storage and a safe, large enough to store your laptop computer. There is a mini bar that contains any drink both alcoholic and regular that you could want and a wide variety of snacks, all of which are priced typical to that of a hotel of this class. There is an office desk complete with phone, chair, and fax machine located in the sitting room which also has an “L” shaped sofa that overlooks the floor to ceiling windows. The bedroom section consisted of a King sized bed, which was one of the most comfortable beds that I have ever slept on while vacationing, two night stands, a 42” HDTV ( that can swivel for viewing both in the sitting room or bedroom ) and a device that allows you to control all of the lighting in the room as well as the curtains that screen the floor to ceiling windows. The rooms made our 5 night stay there very comfortable. There are many choices when it comes to dining but I will comment on our favorite all around restaurant. It is called Society and is located just off of the Casino floor, and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. We had the pleasure to experience all three of them, and were very happy with all three. I would have to say that my favorite meal there was the Fillet Mignon Sliders that they serve at lunch served with hand cut fries and freshly made doughnuts. If you go, you have to get these!! My wife used the spa facilities and was very impressed with the staff as well as the treatments performed. We did get a chance to lay by the pool one day, but did not use it because the weather was still a bit cool, but we will be going back when the weather warms to take advantage of it. There are 2 pools, and a whirlpool at Encore and like the rest of the property, all well manicured and nothing out of place. Overall impressions of the resort were very positive; the only thing that I did not think was up to the rest of the resort standards would have been the Housekeeping Staff. They just did not seem to have it all together yet, and that was disappointing, knowing that they have now been opened for close to 3 months. I do however highly recommend this property to any of my clients looking to spend some time in Vegas and wanting to be pampered during your stay. Please check out the pictures of the resort at [-]. Thank You !! Shawn

Reviews.Title: “Get what you deserve”
Reviews.Author: Youyellit
Reviews.Content: Before leaving on our trip, we spent three days reading reviews and checking Las Vegas hotel websites. After picking the Encore, we got a good rate through the hotel reservation staff, and booked ourselves. It is a stunning property. That is the point of this review. It is too beautiful and classy for any of its visitors to be disappointed. When we checked into our suite on the 22nd floor, and the carpets were not vacuumed, I called housekeeping twice, and got nothing but empty promises. When we came back around 9 PM, I am sure the front desk was not happy with my call. Fifteen minutes later, the Director of Housekeeping knocked on our door to tour the room and to douse my fire (metaphorical of course) She was lovely and shocked that her staff was unresponsive. After bringing my husband and me slippers, she promised to correct the situation. Next day, the room was impeccably cleaned, our drapes were drawn, beds turned down, chocolates in place, and slippers bedside. It was so thereafter. Don't let understaffing ruin your expectations. There are good people at these properties who do care and are responsible. I would never stay anywhere else in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it, needs some improvement in housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: JohnW48
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore for business and pleasure. I love the Wynn and couldn't wait to try Encore. The hotel is beautiful and the people that work there are incredibly nice. Upon check in, I asked for a room in a quiet part of the hotel as I am a light sleeper. I probably should have just let fate dictate where I stayed. After going to bed at 3:30 am ( it is Vegas afterall) I was awakened by what sounded like a whole kindergarten class next door at 5:30 am! I'm guessing there were four little kids in there...and they were definately up for the day! That was it for my sleep that night. I accepted my fate and went to the casual dining restaurant for breakfast before going to my conference. Service was quick and food was fine breakfast fare. Upon returning to my room that afternoon, my room wasn't made up yet. I had left the little light indicating the room should be made up..but to no avail. I called housekeeping and asked them to come up as I went to use the gym. Came back an hour later, still no housekeeping. I'm not that fussy, but at this point, I needed my towels changed out. So I called again and informed them that no one had come all day and that I was going out for the evening, and asked them to come before I get back from dinner and gambling. When I finally got back from the night's festivities, the room was spotless and I had an abundance of towels. Not sure what their turndown service at night policies are, but I had it performed only once during my four night stay. I think that housekeeping is still a bit rusty, but I'm sure it will get better with time. Outside of that minor complaint, the only other thing, which has been discussed here is that sound travels between rooms far too easily for such a swanky place. As I said, I am a light sleeper, and it was a real problem for me. So much so, that I may switch back to the Wynn, which I find more quiet. Botero steakhouse was phenonmenal! The dealers were great! Loved the feel of the casino. Although, they stopped serving Kettle One vodka at the blackjack tables both at Encore and at the Wynn. What?? No premium vodka at such fine establishments? I'm hoping that little experiment comes to a screeching halt when I am there next time.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay is not enough!”
Reviews.Author: itsme718
Reviews.Content: I was at Las Vegas over the weekend with my sister and a teenager niece. My sister booked Encore through Southwest (vacation package). We were having trouble looking for the Encore parking lot (the signs was confusing). So we end up parking at the Wynn self park. We were stunned by the interior designs in Encore. Found our way to the front desk. The front desk told us Southwest booked a king size bed (we ordered double bed). But we were worried a king size bed is a little bit tight for 3 people. They offered us a rollaway bed and put us on a upper floor with great view. We end up on the 25th floor. While we were exploring the room the housekeeping bought in the rollaway bed. Five seconds after the housekeeper left the front desk called to follow up on the rollaway bed. Assuring was everything okay in the room. Very sastified with the fast service. The room is amazing. Loved everything in the room from the bathroom mirror to the wall designs. The room is very spacious and comfy. I'm definetly coming back to Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Steve Wynn does it again, A Excellent hotel with Class!!!”
Reviews.Author: trotter13
Reviews.Content: I love the Wynn but I wanted to try the Encore, it was great!!! Words to describe this lovely hotel : attention to detail, luxury, relaxing, new technology, best sleeping bed ever, classy and contemporary atmosphere, polite and professional employees and friendly. When to the Botero resturant is was very tasty, great side dishes and yummy steak.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty is only skin deep”
Reviews.Author: AVandelay
Reviews.Content: Here is my review about my stay at the Encore during CES (1/8-1/11). Good · Short walk from parking garage to check in. · Front desk staff was extremely helpful, courteous and contributed to a great start to my stay. · Every staff member that I came in contact with (face to face) was helpful, polite and trained in guest satisfaction. · My room on the 62nd floor had a spectacular view of the Strip. · Everything was new and clean. Bad · Housekeeping is very disorganized. I had to call Housekeeping twice to have my room cleaned. First, the room was not cleaned when I returned to my room at 4 PM on Saturday. The maid knocked on my door at 5 PM to clean the room and I told her to come back in an hour since my friend was taking a nap. I came back to my room around midnight and it was in the same condition that I left it. I called Housekeeping and they stated that someone would be there immediately (I took that to mean about 15-20 mins). I waited for 45 mins and then went downstairs to the Front Desk and had them contact Housekeeping again to clean the room. I came back around 3 AM and the room was finally made up. And yes, I made sure the Make Up Room button was pressed (Green light indicator was ON the whole entire day). I was asked 3 times if I had the Do Not Disturb button turned off. Every time I left the room, I checked to see that the green light was on. · Soundproofing in the rooms is nonexistent. There was a loud of bunch of guys in the next room and I could hear all 4 of them shouting at each other and the music they were playing. In my sister and her husband's room, they could hear the TV and the man talking loudly next door. I'm not sure how to solve this issue since the hotel is brand new but something to consider when renovation time comes. · There were no bath robes in my room. I had no desire to purchase the robes at the Wynn Home Store since I didn't have an example to try on. For a 3 night stay, I would expect someone would have put robes on the 2 saddest looking hangers in the bathroom. Also, my sister's room had bath robes but no slippers. I had slippers but no robes. · The in room express check out didn't work on the TV for both rooms I booked. I had to go downstairs again to check out of my room. I gave my room information to one of clerks helping guests in line. That was a big inconvenience and something that should have worked correctly the first time. For the most part, I tried to like the hotel but the lapses in the details, technical glitches, and my frustrating experience with housekeeping leave a lot to be desired. Especially for a resort looking to earn a 5 Star and 5 Diamond rating. At a lesser hotel, I would be willing to overlook these issues but when you are constantly advertising about the awards won and ratings bestowed, it all rings a bit hollow. I may or may not stay at the Encore in the future. Well, definitely not at the regular room rates and if these same issues still exist. There are just too many other alternatives in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Sophisticated and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Travelers08
Reviews.Content: We stayed only two nights and it was far too short a time to stay at this wonderful resort! We had a view of the strip as well as the golf course and pool. The bed was so comfortable that it was hard to leave it! Best I have ever slept in a hotel! Service was outstanding! It's far down the strip but who wants to leave once you are there! We had a great offer of $149 a night and thought we should try it. I can easily say that I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever!!!!!!!!! *** Noisy Neighbor****”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler800
Reviews.Content: This is a new "5 star looking" hotel. Unfortunately it only comes with " 0.5 star SERVICE". I stayed here for 2 nights. First night, **nightmare!** the LOUD TV SOUND woke me up at 5:32AM. The "think" wall is like paper. I could clearly HEAR what my neighbors talking about! 2nd day , I ordered room service in the morning. After finished, I called front desk to pick the remaining food and tray up. They said we will send someone to pick them up. But they never! I called 4 TIMES! They PROMISED 4 TIMES. Finally they came after 5th call. I will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Special”
Reviews.Author: cartermac
Reviews.Content: Check-in and check-out stink at this property. Everything is extra. In this level of hotel internet and health club should be included. Hotel, rooms, service, restaurants, decor, etc. .....fabulous. We had the best of everything....best view, best room-suite. We felt like super star guest. We called to book for a return visit and marketing guys were super rude. I can not say we will be going back. What's up with the attitude?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripindicular1
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three night stay at the Encore. I have stayed at the Wynn, Four Seasons, and Bellagio in LV. Encore is very similar to Wynn with some improvements. The rooms are larger. I found the decor a bit more masculine. All amenites are perfect including bathroom amenity fragrance, mini-bar and bed. The spa in this hotel is gorgeous and generally very upscale. They did not provide brushes though they had dryers which was odd. The gym is great but surprisingly full. The casino area of the hotel is busy but much less so than the Wynn which we preferred. As shoppers, restaurant and show clients as opposed to gamblers it made it easier to walk through though there was still plenty of good people-watching. Both hotels have a beautiful very upscale Esplanade ( Chanel, Hermes, Graff) Service was pretty good but there was room for improvement. The concierge staff gave me the wrong info on hours of restaurants at the Wynn for example. The phone system is difficult because they seem to sort of share it and you never can tell if you are speaking with a Wynn or Encore concierge. Also, I asked them to print out boarding passes and send them to the room. This was really a time sensitive request and it was not executed. They were able to get seats at two shows successfully ( Cirque de Soleil Love and Danny Gans, both wonderful and worth seeing.) Strangely there is no concierge service after 9:00pm which does not make sense in a town like LV. This was very inconvenient and I wondered if it would be different in the Tower section of the hotel. I went in and asked and was told it was the same. I was informed that this was due to economic cutbacks. The hotel is very opulent and there are many excellent restaurants. . You would never know they were experiencing cutbacks if you were not told so. The hotel is very opulent and there are many excellent restaurants. I thought the pool area was great at night when it becomes an extension of the XS nightclub ( extremely hopping place). In the day time I liked the pool at the Wynn better. There is a clothing optional area but everyone there was clothed.The hotel is very opulent and there are many excellent restaurants. Botero was great although they made us wait and hour + for a table. This wasn't something I would normally do but it was in the upscale shopping area so there were distractions. You are also across the street from a topnotch mall with Neimans, SFA, Nordstrom, etc. and next to the Palazzo with many designer boutiques and Barney's NY. I would recommed this as a shopping destination to anyone from anywhere who likes fashion and has a healthy wallet. Stores are beautiful and loaded with inventory, much moreso in my opinion than even LA where I am from. This and the Wynn are providing competition and alternatives for eachother. They are both really fun places to be. Service is stronger and more personalized at the Four Seasons, but the location is not as good for other diversions. ( FS is closer to the airport) I would decide between Encore and Wynn strictly based on price. They are so close in style and you can enjoy both staying in either.

Reviews.Title: “BE-A-utiful!!”
Reviews.Author: RSDTE
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe. I'd love to give it a 10 star. Awesome hotel. Great experience. B-E-A-utiful! As with all casinos smoke in the casino is an issue but less so here than the Wynn , and less so in the Wynn than other casinos. The restaurants are excellent, however, a restaurant of the caliber of SWITCH would best be enclosed off of the casino such as with SW - away from the smoke. Interestingly, SWITCH does have walls that descend in the evenings to enclose most of the restaurant and then the decor changes every 30 minutes or so mechanically. Every time we venture out to another restaurant in Vegas for a meal we largely regret it and find ourselves back at the Wynn/Encore the next night and lovin' it. The Staff is always very friendly. Mr. Wynn has outdone himself. Thanks for a GREAT experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: RandT3
Reviews.Content: It has been seventeen years since my last visit to Las Vegas, and to be honest with you, I wasn't looking forward to going back. Upon my arrival at Encore, that all changed, and I fell in love with the property and the city. It also helped that we paid next to nothing for our stay due to the unfortunate economic circumstances affecting the leisure industry. The hotel and casino are very clean and well presented. They do a nice job of attracting the top tier traveler and keep some of the weekend warriors out. In other words, you won't find any bachellorette parties or any bars serving fishbowls of watered down pink drinks. It is a high class venue from beginning to end. All of the food at each of the restaurants was wonderful. I had no issues whatsoever. Service in the bars and lounges was excellent. My suite was immaculate every day. My only source of frustration was the check in. It took forever! Thankfully, someone else from our group handled it, but we waited nearly an hour to go from the desk attendant to the concierge to drop off our bags. I guess I am a little confused as to why in this day and age, hotel check in is still a mind boggling adventure. I mean, I can check in for my flight from my PDA, why not be able to do that for a room? I loved the hotel, loved the casino and loved the trip. Don't waster time staying anywhere else on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “W-Y-N-N-E-R ???”
Reviews.Author: HttLan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a suite on the 36th floor 02/26/09 thru 03/01/09. Upon our arrival we received fast and efficient service, check-in process was painless. At check-in we were given a choice of what floor we would prefer. (After reading previous reviews we chose the highest possible offered). Upon our arrival our room was spacious and welcoming. (One minor cleaning issue in the bathroom was addressed the next day quite efficiently) . Our suite was a King Suite. The bed and accompanying linens were the best we have "EVER" slept on in any resort! Congrats to the management on this account! No skrimping here. Luxury mattress and crisp linens, plenty of cushy and firm pillows to balance it all out and to float away the days stressors, awhhhh! Slept so well each night. The mini bar concerns mentioned in previous reviews were not an issue (no charges) the ice machine on our floor was broken sending us to the 35th floor several times. Ordered breakfast via room service our 1st morning. Food was good our server was polite and courteous. Dined at Terrace Point Cafe, Red 8. Terrace point had mediocre food at best (husband said crab and lobster salad was fantastic, my French Onion Soup was okay and Kobe Beef Sliders 3each 1.5" burgers were nothing to rave about as I wondered what my $15.00 could have really purchased? Maybe a BIG SLOT WIN??? At Red 8 we dined on Thai Beef with Basil which was on special and a Rice Noodle Chicken Signature dish. BOTH WERE SPECTACULAR yet there were service/food issues. Our order was not submitted to the kitchen in a timely manner, we waited a very long time only then to receive an incorrect order. The waiter was politely apologetic and placed responsibility for these errors on the kitchen staff, 1 hour and 40 minutes later after discussing our concerns with a gracious manager one meal was graciously comped and we were were on our way... Purchase tickets to see "Danny Gans" at the Wynn Theatre his show was fun and very entertaining, very much worth the cost of tickets, when see him you will laugh from start to finish. The hotel is connected to the Wynn by a semi-long walkway which is somewhat annoying. The corridors contain higher end shops like "Rolex" Wynn Jewelers" and many clothing botiques that no one I know, have known or perhaps will ever know would shop there ? (I am over 40). The casino floor was adequate, spent most of our time at the Ventian Casino as they had better dining options available and gaming floors were better. Enocore resturants did not cater to average dining preferences and choices for casual and business casual very restrictive/very expensive. Security after hours was very reassuring at the guest elevators, housekeeping of common areas was flawless. Decor is tasteful and inviting. Overall the Encore provided a Good Vegas Vacation, yet not what we had hoped for as the reviews were better. Overall the Wynn Encore was a good experience. We will most likely not be returning to this resort as the dining options are very limited and it's location is not ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: donutman1964
Reviews.Content: Loved it, the room was very comfortable, the service was way beyond my expectations

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bar the thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: IrishRoverette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Encore during the Valentines weekend and were greatly impressed with it. After reading reviews regarding check in we were expecting a long wait and messy queues, but it was a breeze. Saying that, we did check in during a quiet spell. We requested a high room with a view, and were given a great room on the 50th floor with a view of the back of the Wynn and the strip. All the previous reviews on the rooms are on the nail......beautifully done. There are some complaints on the thinness of the walls and didnt find a problem with this till the 5th day...or I should say night! Whoever our neighbours were, they were at it for hours, screaming and arguing with each other with the odd bang against the wall thrown in. Not ones to complain we let it go, but it did get a bit too much when it resumed the following night and didnt let up till the morning. The crying was grating on us and the language was choice. So beware of having it out with your partner, you dont know who will be listening in!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooms, hated the casino and the location”
Reviews.Author: svelure
Reviews.Content: we found a great deal on expedia to stay at this 5 star hotel. We usually stay at imperial, so this was a step up haha. We got into our room and i was amazed at how big and gorgeous it was. I absolutely loved the bathroom, and floor to ceiling windows, with great view. The beds were cozy as well. but, the location of the hotel SUCKED. you had to walk forever just to get back onto the strip and to where all the other hotels/casinos were. This wouldn't be a problem if the casino at the encore was fun. Basically it was a bunch of yuppies and wannabe yuppies there so it wasnt much fun to hang out there. Drinks were outrageous and if you weren't dressed in a formal gown/tux you felt oddly out of place. So we were forced to make the long treacherous journey to casino royale (my people haha). Also, would it kill them to put a subway or mcd's in the freakin hotel! jesus h christ. i woke up at 2am STARVING one night and was forced to walk to walgreens to get something to eat (which sucked walking through the casino at 2am in sweat pants), it was better than paying 8 dollars for a bag of chips in the room. When i stayed at excalibur i could walk downstairs in my pj's and find a fast food restaurant, not at encore. First, youd have to put on an evening gown, then put a french twist in your hair, then you could head down and find an over priced cafe and get a 10 dollar grilled cheese (for real, i got a 10 dollar grilled cheese and tomato soup out of desperation) THEN when you get back to the room and find the tomato soup was too much to eat, YOU HAVE NO WHERE TO PUT YOUR LEFTOVERS because the only fridge in the room is one with a scale that charges you 12 dollars for a powerade. We literally went to walgreens and got a disposable cooler to put leftovers in lol. ok so basically, rooms were awesome, but if your a 20 something, like me, who is not rich, then this is not the hotel for you. You are better off getting a cheaper room at flamingo. OH, and one more thing, they CLOSED THE POOL AT 5PM...wtf is that about!?

Reviews.Title: “Great room but nickle and dimed”
Reviews.Author: elgallagher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed over Valentines weekend. Rooms were at fire sale prices so the value of the room for the dollar was great. We stayed in a Resort Suite; which was very nice. When I say you are nickle and dimed I mean specifically to use gym was $30 per person per day. A pot of coffee via room service was $22 including all the fees. They have a sign at the elevator which says "no outside food or drink" and at night they have a guard for the elevator. I know it's vegas and "everything for a price" but for me the sign and the guard seemd like a bit much. The strip is expanding to the north but currently the Encore is the farthest north and you have a healthy walk to all the other resorts. The way the economy is right now, there will be no new hotels north of this one for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Wow-Encore is even better than the Wynn!”
Reviews.Author: OCPB
Reviews.Content: As frequent and very satisfied customers of the Wynn, we were very excited to check out the Encore recently. As we were told on the phone, it is different from the Wynn but fabulous! We are sold - the rooms are spacious and beautiful - a little warmer ambience than the Wynn and the service was ten times better. At check in when we asked about a higher floor, we were put on the 61st floor - a fantastic view that was truly breathtaking. The room service/food was fabulous and everything at this hotel is top notch. We will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Encore is Flawless”
Reviews.Author: mariav11204
Reviews.Content: Returned from a 3 night stay at the Encore 2/15-2/18. We received a 3 night comp offer w/$200 free play. Check in was a little slow, apparently the family in front of us was having issues with their hotel reservations. We didn't ask for an upgrade, but were given a room on the 53rd floor overlooking the golf course and we could see the top of the Wynn hotel from our window. The rooms are stunning. The decor and wall coverings were beautiful. I couldn't find a flaw. Cleaning staff was amazing. I know Wynn laid off staff, but I couldn't find any decline in service other than the fact that I didn't receive turndown service. As a matter of fact, one evening I was going back to my room at 11pm. There was a maid dusting the picture frames hanging in the hallway! We had breakfast every morning at the Wynn bufftet. It was a 5-10 minute walk from the Encore to the Wynn, but we didn't mind the walk. I met Oscar De La Renta at the Encore! I was walking back to the hotel one evening at 10:30PM, and he was standing outside his store. People walking by recognized him, and he was waving and speaking to people who approached him.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Casino Hotel In the World - Top Class”
Reviews.Author: Vegastrader
Reviews.Content: I loved the Wynn but now I love the Encore even more. This place is so elegant. The employees are above and beyond friendly and helpful. It is always a treat to stay here. Thanks and CUDOS to all employees for a great time and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Wynn wins again”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaSingle
Reviews.Content: First stay at Steve Wynn's new tower in Las Vegas. Rather than being a separate hotel, it really just feels like an extension of Wynn Las Vegas. It's separated by a shopping corridor of some 20 very high end stores. The feel is very much that of Wynn, if not a bit more upscale feeling and a bit more red (which I liked). THE SUITE It had the feel of the Wynn rooms, but more updated in shades of black & white. The bathroom seemed identical to those at Wynn (which would be hard to improve upon). The bedding was the same (thankfully) and the real difference was the separate sitting area with full sofa/chaise and a 46' LCD that turned to front either the bedroom or sitting room. Really, I can't find anything wrong except that for comfort, it would be nice if they added a couple of pillows to the sofa area. The views from my suite were looking from the golf course behind Wynn to straight down the Strip (with better Strip views in my opinion than Wynn) to the mountains to the west. SERVICE/RESTAURANTS Didn't eat at any of the restaurants. When I encountered staff, I would say the service was good. Check-in remains a confusing mess - which you will also find if you check in at Wynn. They obviously don't like roped off qeues where the next person moves to the next open attendant. They prefer to guide you into the individual lines and it's just luck of the draw if you get a fast or slow one. First time in my many trips to Vegas that the room wasn't ready at 11am. And they say it's dead in Vegas right now???? Not at Encore. I had to wait til nearly 3pm to get the room keys and had to stand in line again for that. CASINO The Encore casino is nice in that during the day, you get tons of outdoor light from the pool area that is next to the casino and separated via large windowed walls. But I found the casino to have a smallish feel to it. I preferred to go to Wynn to gamble. More activity - more slot choices. Couldn't believe all the penny slots at both Wynn & Encore. I guess it's a function of the economy. LOCATION I love that Wynn/Encore is across from Fashion Show Mall - several restaurant choices and an ABC store for snacks/drinks to take back to the room. And being easily accessed via skywalk to Pallazo, you have all of the amenities/casino that they offer in easy walking distance. It was a nice 15 minute walk to Ceasars for shopping and show. While Encore is slightly north of Wynn, it's connected by the shopping corridor, so you really just feel that you're at one big resort. SUMMARY Steve Wynn has done it once again with Encore. It has become my top favorite for Las Vegas accommodations. Give them a try while rates are low, because I would expect that prices here will exceed Wynn once everyone realizes you are getting a full suite vs a large room at Wynn. I appreciate that Wynn offers more reasonable food prices in their resort (Sugar & Ice and the cafe near the theaters adjacent to the main Wynn casino) and doesn't force you to go outside of the hotel for reasonable meals. If they will only improve the check-in process, they will have a full 5 star review from me on all accounts.

Reviews.Title: “Left a lasting memory. what a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: miathebee
Reviews.Content: The Encore was very impressive right from the start. As soon as we arrived our bags were taken and brought to our room. Rooms were beautiful and very clean. House keeping was very polite and provided us with everything we needed. Rooms do not have a refrigerator for any of your own personal needs, but they are available upon request. The pool area was spectacular and the workers were very nice and helpful. The pool is said to be heated, but it was pretty cold. Still had a good swim though. The clubs were very fun and I would recommend them to anyone. I would definitely stay here again! Hoping to go back in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: BostonAngel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Encore for our anniversay and it was wonderful. The room was amazing. We requested a high floor room w/ a strip view and that is just what we got. 33rd floor w/ a magnificiant view of the strip and mountains in the distance. Besides the view the room was amazing. The floor to ceiling windows were spectacular to soak in the view while lounging on the chaise couch. Totally relaxing. We could even see the night show and waterfalls clearly from our room. As far as noise. We could slightly here people on a couple of occasions but nothing you wouldn't expect when in a hotel. We couldn't hear the club XS but for an ever so slight base thumping for a couple a minutes. Nothing that I would ever consider an issue. The bathroom was beautiful and huge. Beds super comfy, robes were a nice touch. Housekeeping was good although they forgot to take our empty used glasses but did replace them with new ones. This was the best hotel room we've ever stayed in. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Check in was a breeze no waiting, there was staff providing direction to keep the flow going. The rest of the hotel was great. It was so easy to find our way around, signs are so helpful not like at some of the older hotels, we could actually get our of the casino. Barely could smell the cirgarettes either. Only complaint is a long walk from the encore to places. Not unpleasant but long, make sure to have comfy dress shoes or bring lots of bandaids. People watching was fun. I'll review some of the specific bars/lounges and restaurants in those sections. Overall we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: i-gots-wanderlust
Reviews.Content: I don't know how Steve Wynn could've out-done Wynn Hotel & Casino, but he did. Encore is the best property in Vegas and I will never stay anywhere else. The hotel staff is top notch and very helpful. The slots were loose. The restaurants were tasty and surprisingly affordable (look at the menu! You'll be pleasantly surprised!!!). I stayed here for 3 nights (comped!) with 2 friends over Superbowl weekend. The casino is much smaller than the other resorts, but that's OK. It's not as crowded and the decor is beautiful. Take time to admire the $42,000 (per piece) red chandaliers. The rooms! Oh...the rooms. Due to a mix-up with the reservation (the only bad part that happened to us, but can't complain because it was 3 free nights) we spent the first night in a room with one king bed and called for a rollaway. The room is beautifully decorated, the bathroom is huge (just like at Wynn), and the view is breathtaking (ask for a room facing the Strip). The room with two double beds is slightly larger and the "living room" isn't sectioned off, but it is more than enough for 4 girls with lots of luggage. The spa is beautiful, although treatments are pricey. The day pass is an affordable $30 and well worth the price if you're seeking a few hours of quiet and relaxation. On the downside, the walls are thin (or maybe sounds reverberates off the marble floors in the entry way), but calls to security are quickly taken care of....either way...having to hear the people next door talk wasn't a deal breaker. The room could use another tv (the tv swivels in the delux rooms with one king bed) because the Palazzo suites all have two tvs, but again, that's not a dealbreaker. Overall, I wouldn't stay anywhere else on the strip. I wondered how Steve Wynn could out-do himself and he did.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Pretentious but Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cvrom
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the hotel for 3 nights, there was the usual confusion at check in as they dont have a line system, you just loiter until you see an empty desk then run to it before someone else does. I asked for a strip view on a high floor and thats exactly what I got, with no $20 trick needed. The room was very nice, black and white themed with the most comfortable beds ever. Previous reviewers have mentioned that the walls in the hotel are thin and you can hear every sound from the next room and the nightclub. I never had this problem, the room was quiet at all times aside from the air conditioning which squeaked every so often. Yes the minibar is expensive, $4 for a coke, i just went downstairs to the shop near the lifts and bought one for $2.50 instead. No real reason to use the minibar. The hotel has either wired or wireless internet for $13 every 24 hours, I needed internet access so had to use this but didn't think it was excessive. It is a bit far out at the end of the strip but now there are walkways to get through the hotel through the Wynn, across the walkway to the Palazzo, into the Venetian etc etc. All the restaurants are quite expensive, I have no desire to pay $110 for a steak or $36 for a fish appetiser, but thats just me. The shops are as expensive in the esplanade, high end designer brands with hoodies starting at $1900.....yes $1900 for a hoodie! My only issues were that due to 'cost cutting' measures as I was told by the concierge, you now don't get the free slippers, you have to request them, you don't get a turn down service unless you request it. They are even getting a bit tighter on the comps nowadays. Overall a lovely hotel both exterior and interior, but I think the Wynn still has the edge over the Encore. Unless you get a phenomenal rate for the Encore, stay at the Wynn, better location, cheaper food, better amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Boxy, Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Woomba
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very overpriced, from the hotel rooms to the restaurants to the bars. Casino itself is very boxy and maze-like. Staff uninterested and unfriendly. Rooms are slightly above standard remodeled Vegas. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: cindyloowhoo
Reviews.Content: We only spent an evening at the Encore, but it was so impressive, I just had to write a review. The hotel is breathtaking, and the service we received was beyond our expectations. We had 7:30 reservations for 4 at Botero. We arrived early and checked in with the hostess. We had decided to have a glass of wine in the lounge area to relax before dinner. At 7:45 my husband thought maybe they didn't realize we were ready to be seated. They were very curtious and said that hopefully a table would be ready soon. Five minutes later, 4 glasses of champaign arrived. A few minutes after that, 4 appetizers. We have waited much longer than that for resv at other restaurants and only gotten an apology, so we were impressed. At 8, we were let to our table in a beautiful dining room. Brown walls with white leather chairs and a mosaic floor. No detail was left unattended. I ordered the beet salad, gnocci, and brussel sprouts. Very strange combination, but these are all of my favortie foods. I think this was the best beet salad I had ever eaten. The gnocci was light and wonderful, but the red sauce was a little sweet. The brussels sprouts were lightly browned and just just right. The rest of our table oohed and ahhed over every bite. We were too full to order dessert, but when the ice cream lollipops arrived, complimentary for being seated late, we devoured them. They were a perfect ending to the meal. After dinner, we sat down at a blackjack table. The dealers were friendly, and the pit boss Jason went out of his way to make us comfortable. On our next trip, this will be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but lacking in service”
Reviews.Author: aml519
Reviews.Content: My husband received an offer for three free nights at Encore with a $150 dining credit. We were thrilled to be able to stay here, but honestly enjoyed the Wynn more. The check-in and check-out process were longer than I expected. When we checked in, there were several lines, and they were having problems with the card machine. The check-out process was slightly quicker. However, we left our bags at the bell desk because we had time to kill before our flight. We were told to give the slip to the valet. When we went to the taxi stand to leave, there was no one there from the bell desk, so they suggested we go back to the bell desk and pick up our bags. Not very customer-service oriented. When we arrived, we asked the concierge to put us on the guest list for XS, the new, gorgeous nightclub there. However, when we arrived, we were not on the guest list. The staff graciously admitted us anyway, but it was frustrating and embarrassing. The rooms were amazing, and we had a terrific view of Wynn and the strip. The bathroom was enormous with two sinks, a comfortable bathtub, a large shower and a TV. I loved that everything was digital - the drapes, the privacy sign, the lights. My main complaint with the room was the noise. At 8 a.m. our first morning there, the room next to us was blaring music. It was clear as day. We called the front desk to complain, and they said they would send security immediately. It was at least 20 minutes before the music stopped. The room had a large flat-screen TV that swiveled between the bedroom and living room. However, it was a 50-50 chance as to whether the remote would work and if the TV would actually turn off when you hit the power button. Overall, it was a beautiful hotel with many small luxuries that aimed to make your stay more pleasant. However, I would much prefer to stay at the Wynn next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wynn's”
Reviews.Author: DLO1975
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at Encore (3 nights comped). Mixed reviews that we read prior to our stay, along with our first impressions of Wynn, helped lower our expectations. After spending four nights in Wynn's latest creation, we now have a new favorite resort in Vegas! The check-in process could use some work, there are too many connecting rooms (as for a non-connecting one facing South), a casual coffee shop would be nice, and the water pressure could be a bit better; but that's where the criticism ends. The rooms were the nicest we've stayed in anywhere. From the always prompt elevators, to the wide modern hallways, to the spacious suites with views straight down the Strip; ENCORE didn't disappoint! The bed and L shaped couch were extremely comfortable; the swiveling High Def LCD tv was great; the bathroom was large with modern tiling, dual sinks, separate tub/shower/toilet, and a vanity area; and the maid service was excellent. The casino did not disappoint either. The chambered effect and natural light definitely put Encore in a class of its own. Each chambered table area feels like a private casino. The dealers and floor supervisors were all extremely friendly and helpful, and the cocktail service was excellent! We loved the bright red lights throughout the casino, floor to ceiling windows looking out on the pool/garden area, and atrium style ceiling in the entrance near Switch. Encore doesn't have a sportsbook or poker room, but the walk to Wynn through the Esplanade is not too bad. Finally, the pool area looks like it will be a huge draw once the weather warms up. We tried several restaurants and checked out XS...which I'll talk about more below. Restaurants: Cafe Society - Nicely decorated, but the menu is too limited and the prices are too high. Zoozacrackers and the Terrace Cafe at Wynn are better options in my opinion. When we arrived around 3PM they had a very limited menu consisting of only 4-5 choices...that may have been part of the problem. SWITCH - We went here our first night (Valentine's Day). Had our wives not been under the weather, it may have been the best meal of the trip. As many people know by now, the look of the restaurant changes three times each hour. Aside from excellent food, I have to admit the changing "theme" of the restaurant actually works and helps set SWITCH aside from its competition at Encore. The caesar salad was excellent and the bone-in NY Strip was one of the best I've had. My friend had the lamb, which he thought was good but not great. Our wives had the Risotto...and both thought it was very good despite not feeling well. BOTERO - We saved this place for our last night, as it was the dinner we were looking forward to the most. We had an 8:30 reservation, but were not seated until 9:15. After mentioning this to the manager on duty, he comped a bottle of champagne...which definitely took the edge off the wait. The restaurant itself is very modern and was packed! The entire floor is tiled and clearly cost quite a bit! Once the weather warms up, the outside patio overlooking the pool will definitely be a big draw. The caesar salad was excellent (one of the best I've had). Our friends raved about their meals (halibut and pepper crusted filet), my bone-in filet was very good (but not to the level of SW, Hanks, or Alize), and my wife's scallops were just ok (they come in a broth which is odd). The dessert cupcakes were also good...but who is really hungry after a salad and steak. XS - What can I say other than wow! Victor Drai has done it again. We stopped in at about 1:30AM on Monday and there was still a wait. Once we gained entry, it's easy to see the resemblance to Tryst! A wide open club with no hidden VIP areas (at least that we could tell). The dance floor was jam packed with a very expensive rotating chandelier above it. The dance floor opens up to a patio that backs up to the pool. There are also patios on each side of the main patio. Javon Walker was hosting a full house the night we stopped by, and his booth was right on the dance floor so that everyone could see he and his friends (Shane Mosley and a few other NFL players) having a great time. Tryst has a waterfall and XS by springtime will have the full pool area with cabanas and blackjack tables. I'd have a hard time recommending one over the other...so I'd probably tell people to drop by and check out both! Drink prices for those that care were pretty high... $8-10 for beer and $12-14 for mixed drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Stayed at in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: stkkattds
Reviews.Content: As the title summarizes, the Encore is one of the most upscale and nicest hotels I have stayed at in Vegas when in comparison to the Bellagio and the Venetian. The rooms were elegant and very comfortable. The bed is super comfy and the decor of the room is impressive. Everything is electronic with a bedside console to control lights, curtains, etc. Very nice touch. Turndown service was fantastic as well with good chocolates! Pool was open but since it was winter, it was not very crowded. Pool scene is definitley sleek and upscale. Not sure how much space there will be in the summer but both the Wynn and Encore pools are beautiful and probably meant for the adult crowds. Casino was nice since there was actually natural light, very rare for a casino floor. Did not have a chance to eat at the Encore restaurants but the Wynn restaurants were fantastic and tasty. We got a good deal through lasvegas.com but at peak seasons, everything about the Encore is pricey: rooms, snacks, food, etc. Only one complaint: One of the days, housekeeping did not come to clean our room. However, may have been my fault as we requested them to come back later when they visited a first time. Nonetheless, they did not return. Besides this one incident, we loved our experience at the Encore/Wynn and definitley look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A More Intimate Wynn”
Reviews.Author: crunchy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Encore the weekend of Feb. 7-9. Although this was our first stay at the new hotel, we have stayed at Wynn several times in the past few years. The Encore is a beauty in many ways. Parts are visually stunning. Realize, however, that there are about 25% less rooms at Encore than at Wynn, and some things just seem scaled down. The casino area is much smaller, and the pool area seemed to be about half as large. (Hard to get a real feel on a rainy winter weekend.) As at Wynn, the rooms are very well done. Same ultra-comfy mattress and linens, and, at least in the Resort rooms, much the same-sized bathroom with a similar layout. What's different is a slightly larger room, with a divider between the bedroom and living room areas. This divider has no door, and most of it is open, holding a flat screen TV that swivels quite nicely between the two areas. The chaise sectional in the living room area is comfortable, although not too fancy-more casual, I guess. There was some discussion between my spouse and I as to whether this was truly a suite. She said no, because of the lack of the ability to separate the two rooms completely. For instance, it was hard for one person to sleep in the bedroom area while the other watched TV in the living room area. The casino is smaller, as I said, and completely surrounded by bars and restaurants. Much has been made of the fact that there is a lot of natural lighting in the casino area, but I found it to feel much the same as the Wynn casino. In my opinion, you're just more aware of it because of the scale of Encore. Only had the chance to visit one of the new restaurants. We had lunch at the Society Cafe, and it was very good. Service was spot on and the food we enjoyed was prepared and presented wonderfully. Although we were just across the walkway from the casino, it never seemed to intrude. The Lobby Bar was also a great place to relax and have a liquid refreshment. The staff was all top notch in their performance of their duties; very professional and friendly. Never had to wait long for cocktail service in the casino, and the CWs were very engaging and efficient. Overall our stay at Encore was great. There were a few kinks in the system that still need to be worked out. Like others, we had problems with our keys failing to unlock the room. Luckily, one of the two always worked. The lines at the resort registration area seemed crowded and hectic all day Sunday to well into the evening. Again, we lucked out, as we came in early Saturday morning. They do offer Express and In-Room checkout, and we avoided any lines on checkout that way. Overall, I'd say we were very pleased with our stay at Encore. We would return, but may go back to Wynn instead. I think one tends to forget just how well they do things at both hotels, and, as I said, it might magnify any small problems that others here seem to find so troublesome.

Reviews.Title: “Prefer the sister resort Wynn Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HauntedMansion
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms in the Tower Suites as an online package back in December. When we arrived we were politely informed that our rooms were actually located in the Resort Tower, and asked if we would like directions to the Resort check-in. It was only after we provided evidence of our booking confirmation that we were accomodated in the Tower Suites. The lady at check-in desk was very apologetic, but nonetheless it was not a very nice way to start the stay. The rooms were very comfortable as they are next door at the Wynn, but I did not care for the color palette or furniture at Encore. It was very evident that a lot of the design influences came from the Macau property. Our room was VERY beige. The second room in our party was much nicer with black furniture and deep red accents, but oddly the rooms on the north side of the tower are actually smaller than the comparable rooms on the south side - we were told this by the valet when our luggage was delivered, and it was readily apparent when we went in to their room. Even numbered rooms are on the south side. The bathrooms were virtually identical to those at the Wynn, with slight changes (a nice marble shelf that runs through the shower all the way around in front of the sinks, and extremely odd placed sconces in the middle of the mirror. The bedside controls for the drapes and lights are a nice touch, as are the controls in the foyer. No fumbling with awkward "Do Not Disturb" placards either, as it is all electronic. The large cabinet which contains the minibar was poorly manufactured in our room. The light inside the cabinet was designed to come on whenever the cabinet door was opened, and go off when the door was closed. However, the contact switch was not properly installed so the light stayed on all the time even with the door closed. It was only noticeable at night. Eventually they might wonder why that bulb gets replaced so frequently. With Encore they made some improvements with noise in the room, but unfortunately they introduced new noise problems. First the pros - there is no longer the outside air vent located at the base of the windows which was the source of much of the noise at the Wynn. Also, they have installed baffles on the bottom of the doors so that when the doors close the baffle lowers and blocks sounds from outside the room. And now the cons, and these are big. The room are very much not sound proof. We could hear the silverware being used in the room next to ours, and at several points could easily hear muffled conversations and the TV through the walls. But the worst is in the bathroom - the vent above the toilet is a direct feed to other peoples world. You could not only hear other conversations through this vent - you could clearly understand every word being said, and it seemed as though someone was literally standing 5' away from you speaking. Completely unacceptable in a resort aiming for 5-stars. I would much rather have the outside air vent noise at the Wynn over hearing people in other rooms at Encore. All that being said, the public areas of the resort were amazing. The amount of natural light was stunning, as was the architecture and furnishings. The casino was very comfortable with nicer tables including a hardwood surface around the edge perfect for keeping your drink stable. Surprisingly, the casino was not smokey at all. After sitting in there for several hours, my clothes did not smell of smoke. At night you can clearly see out the windows to the pool area with almost no reflection.

Reviews.Title: “The Encore is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: butterflygrlUT
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views, stylish room and hotel decor. Pricy but worth it. The Encore is an experience you will not soon forget.

Reviews.Title: “Was not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kar882
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Valentine's getaway weekend in Las Vegas, and a fantastic stay at the Encore! To a person, the staff was nothing but warm, courteous, and professional. Our Parlor Suite (in the tower) was superbly appointed, comfortable, and had a spectacular view of the desert and surrounding mountains. Prior to booking at the Encore, I read thru all of the reviews posted here, so I wouldn't have been surprised had I experienced any of the issues that some other reviewers here noted. I am happy to report that -- other than the tendency for the bathroom to become a bit warmer than what might be considered ideal -- I have no complaints about my stay. (I think the bathroom might tend to the warm side because there are numerous lights in there, and no independent fan or additional climate control system.) The suite was peacefully quiet -- I never heard any external noise, either in the corridor or thru any vents. The room was very clean, and well stocked with amenities. Housekeeping was prompt when requested (I usually keep my privacy light on when in the room and call for housekeeping when I exit the room.) Every interaction I had with staff at the hotel was positive, from the bell person, to the front desk, to housekeeping, and on out into the gaming area. I don't frequent Las Vegas too often, but I have stayed in the Bellagio & The Four Seasons Hotel. I can't recall having any real complaints about either of those hotels, but I have to say that in my opinion, The Encore has raised the bar when it comes to a luxury property in Las Vegas. I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucy5555
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from spending the weekend of St.Valentine's Day with my boyfriend at the Encore, and we both agreed it was the most luxurious hotel of all of them in the Strip. It is not a thematic hotel, but still has its own style, very pretty, very elegant, very lively... the staff was beyond nice, so personal, caring of you like if you were their guest at home, making sure everything was perfect, and it was! the rooms are very big, with wonderfull views, I think they only have suites, and they are very roomy, with a spacious living room area, with a big and extremely comfy bed, and the bathroom was really big, and elegant with all the marble around, with two sinks, the tub, the shower, the separate toilet. we don't have any complain at all, the garden is really beautiful, the restaurants are equally sophisticated, and the prices are really good (with a lot of food!). We also enjoyed a night in the Blush, which is cover free if you have dinner in the restaurant. I just wish we can go again to stay in the Encore!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience at the Encore”
Reviews.Author: warwick290
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 7 nights at the Encore. Have to say I will not choose it again for our next Vegas trip. All was fine at first, no line at check-in and we arrived about 9pm. The problem started when they made an error with fantom hotel items charged to my credit card and the staff became quite hostile (just for the record, we did not touch anything in the minibar etc. or take them out for longer than 60 seconds, we are wise to that game). I won't recount the whole story but all I'll say is that the staff need to get their stories straight and accept that they made a mistake instead of accusing me of lying. I was put it a very upsetting situation and they did nothing to help. The room was ok, but a bit small, and yes, the walls were thin. We were woken up 3 nights at 4am by our screeching neighbours. Might as well have been in a motel. The items for sale in the room had a thick layer of dust on them - I wonder why? We walked through to the Palazzo and the Venetian where they had a lot more cheaper eating options. If it's your first trip to Vegas bear in mind that these hotels are ginormous and you will be just 1 or 2 of thousands and thousands of guests, also bring comfy shoes because you will be doing a lot of walking. Also, could the Wynn and Encore PLEASE put some comfortable chairs and couches around the reception area and hallways? I hung around in the lobby waiting 20 minutes for friends and there was nowhere to sit! The only chairs are at the slot machines and tables where it's very smokey. Just a couple of big couches to ease the pain of waiting around would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Encore”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTO03
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Vegas, and what a good choice we made. The Encore was beautiful - the details in the decor, mosaic butterflies in the halls, the opulent chandeliers, the gorgeous red bursts of colour. The rooms were very comfortable, and definitely had a sexy vibe! We gambled mostly at the Wynn - better choice of tables but nothing less than a $10 minimum. Saw one woman win $1,000 at the slots - but mostly quiet at other tables. Drink service was excellent, people were friendly. It was nice to see people dressed up, and you felt like you were somewhere special! We ate at the Wynn Buffet ( a little overpriced $35.00/person), but not unsatisfactory. Compared to other buffet rooms we saw, the Wynn seemed the prettiest and least "Mall-like". The cafe was steep - a large coffee and herbal tea ran $8.00!! We loved exploring the hotel and people watching. We recommend doing the express check out from your room - it saves time lining up (you can see your final total on Wynn TV). We asked for a late check out and they gave us till 1pm versus the usual 12pm. Since we had a late flight, the bell desk was happy to hold our luggage until we left for the airport. We saw Elton John and the red piano - great show!! Caesars Palace had a wonderful vibe going on in the evening, lots of sexy women dancing and dealing. The Belaggio fountains were beautiful. The free Big Elvis show at Bill's Gambling Hall and Saloon was fun - not to mention the .99 margaritas. The Imperial Palace casino was drab and unimpressive even if they had $5 tables. The lookalikes dealing and performing were fun. Binions had a wonderful vibe for gambling very comfortable and had nice friendly tables. Freemont Street was a little disappointing - the light show was not very good. The Golden Nugget looked great! Other smaller casinos on Freemont were sleazy but great for people watching. The Palms was very user friendly - a lot of promotions and ways to earn points and gifts - we saw one woman win $100,000 on the slots- lucky her!! The Palms had the best odds for video poker, and obviously the loosest slots. Cab drivers in Vegas were friendly and out to make a buck (ie. going the longer routes to keep the meter up). Overall there was a certain sadness and desperation - people we loosing jobs and money. The recession is probably hitting Vegas very hard. The Deuce bus was an experience - great to see parts of Vegas that we wouldn't normally. Overall a fantastic experience - we would definitely go back to the Encore. The Encore was classy, beautiful, a step above other hotels on the strip, very hospitable, and worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Luxury... With A Hip Vibe”
Reviews.Author: B.Hart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a stay at the Encore from February 7th to February 11th. This was our eleventh trip to Vegas and the Encore was the 8th hotel we've stayed in. In order from worst to best the other hotels we've stayed at have been Circus Circus, Bally's, New York New York, Planet Hollywood, Treasure Island, Mirage, and The Venetian. And as much as I love The Venetian, I would have to place Encore at the top of this list. From the moment we walked through the door, (which was held open by a very polite doorman), we were impressed. Everyone from the valets and bellmen, to the desk clerks and casino workers, to the security and wait staff, to the multitude of cleaners that we saw constantly cleaning all areas of the hotel, everyone we encountered were the most polite and helpful staff we have ever encountered in our many travels and hotel stays. When we arrived at 8:30 a.m. no rooms that met our preferences (non-smoking king room on a high floor) were ready, so the desk clerk took our mobile number and told us we'd receive a call as soon as a room was ready. We'd never experienced that service before. That allowed us to have breakfast without having to check back on our own. Check-in is 3:00 p.m. and was empty when we arrived although there were at least 3 clerks at the desk. We received a call about 3 hours later telling us we could pick up our key cards and proceed to our room. Our key cards, which had our names printed on them, also doubled as our casino players cards. You keep them after check-out for future visits to the casino even if you don't stay at the hotel. Registration is to the right of the valet area, and the resort elevators are a short walk from there. Encore has a very pleasant scent pumped through the air that really helps to combat the smoke smell of the casino, and from the elevators through all public areas of the resort, there is hip, upscale, but soothing music constantly pumped through the speakers. It is appropriate and not unbearable in any way. You must show your room key to security to access the elevators which are divided into banks of eight elevators each that serve 30 floors per bank. We were on the 35th floor, and we never had to wait more than a few seconds for an elevator going up or down. We were in room E3522 which was the first room to the left across the hall from the elevator bank. The way the hotel is designed there doesn't seem to be a long walk to the elevators from any room on the floor although the ice machines are located at the end of the hall. The room itself was absolutely gorgeous with an upscale contemporary feel. The photos you see really don't do it justice. The door opens to a marble foyer with a wall of mirrors on one side and the bathroom and a large lighted closet on the other. Next to the door is a panel that controls the lights which you can turn on by room (foyer including bathroom and closet, bedroom, or living room), or all at once. The lights, by the way, fade on and off slowly. The panel also has a button that you press to turn on the privacy or make up room lights outside your door. No more privacy cards hanging on the doorknob. There is also a doorbell outside your door that only works if the make up room light is on. The maid presses it to let you know she is about to enter. The bathroom is all marble with a tub and separate shower which has a bench and two shower heads. One head is mounted on the wall with different available settings and the other is a hand-held massaging wand. There is also a double vanity with a large mirror, a lighted vanity mirror area with upholstered seat, lighted shelves under each vanity for towels, a 19" LCD t.v. in the wall, two spa robes for use during your stay, a digital scale, and a privacy room, with telephone, for the toilet. The closet had plenty of hangers, an extra pillow and blanket, a three-drawer dresser, an iron and ironing board, and a personal no-charge safe. The room itself is nicely appointed in cream, black, and white, are 60 to 105 square feet larger than the Wynn and 50 square feet bigger than the Venetian, and is divided into two areas by a wall that holds a 46" HD flat screen t.v. that swivels between the sleeping and living areas. Whenever you turn the t.v. on it greets you with a personalized welcome message. Very cool. The sleeping area had two side tables, one held an I-home radio, and the other held a combo alarm clock and room remote that controlled the room lights, the outside privacy light, and the window sheers and drapes. There was also a large cabinet that held the mini bar on one side and an ice bucket, glasses, and a combo corkscrew and bottle opener on the other. There were also snacks on top, but don't touch them! Like the mini bar fridge everything sits on pressure switches that charge you if the item is removed for more than 60 seconds. There is lots of drawer space and a nice feature are the "no slam" drawers. You push the drawer to a certain point and the mechanism slowly pulls it in the rest of the way. The living area had more drawer space, a work table with two chairs, a sectional with integrated chaise lounge, a large leather ottoman, a telephone, and a printer/fax hidden in a drawer in the work table. The view we had was the best I'd ever seen. I'm unsure if we were in a regular resort suite or a panoramic suite, but we had a view that spanned from the Wynn golf course to the east, down the south end of the strip, to Trump tower and the mountains to the west. We never had those drapes closed. The climate control was also in the living area. Maid service was constant and we had fresh towels every morning. We had one minor cleaning concern when we arrived, but one call to housekeeping and the problem was handled professionally and quickly. Bed coverings are only replaced after each guest, but if you want your linens replaced every day of your stay you can request it. Unlike many hotels that make you go to the first floor and walk through public areas to get to the pool, you can take the elevator to the 3rd floor to access the private elevator to get to the pool area. The 3rd floor also holds the gym ($30 a day), and the spa. This floor looks, and smells, divine. Although it was chilly outside, the pool was open. There are two pool areas - one a family pool and one a "European" pool for adults only. There didn't appear to be a charge to access the adult pool unlike other adult pools in Vegas and cameras are not allowed. The adult pool is separated from the family pool by an archway of bushes, but both have pools heated to 80 degrees and complimentary bottled water and towels. The adult area also has a whirlpool heated to 101 degrees. Both have cabanas that are more than the glorified tents of other hotel pools. These are permanent free standing rooms with patios, and large flat screens on the wall. The pools were smaller than other pools I've seen, but it's not about swimming laps with these pools. It's about relaxing in a luxurious setting. The casino was nicely laid out and easy to navigate. As we gambled, cocktail waitresses came around often and bought drinks quickly. The drinks were not watered down jokes, either. They were good and strong. You can check-out through your t.v. and throughout your stay you can use it to periodically check to see if there are any charges to your room. And although we had no problem, during busy periods the front desk area seemed unorganized. There were plenty of desk clerks, but there was no dedicated system to take care of the next person in line. You just line up behind someone and hope for the best. That's the one negative they should address in the future. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants or visit any of the clubs. Encore has no buffet because they share the Wynn's. Also, the Encore and Wynn are connected by an upscale shopping corridor, but you can easily access the strip from either hotel. Guests at either hotel can enjoy the amenities of the other. Also Encore is in a great location connected to Wynn, and across the street from the Fashion Show mall. The Venetian, Palazzo, Mirage, and TI are close by. In conclusion, Encore is a big, bright, luxurious hotel, both relaxing yet pulsing with life, that perfectly walks the line between hip and elegance. Although open to families, Encore seems to be geared more toward upscale crowds maybe 30 and up. It's my new favorite, and I would emphatically recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Darkshine629
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 36 hr weekend trip to Vegas with the wife. This is a great hotel to stay in Vegas. Great for couples. Usually travel to Vegas 1-2 times a year and I was very impressed with Encore. Got a great deal online which indicated that we were staying at the Wynn. Front desk said that we would be at Encore. No big deal; they are connected. The room/mini-suite is awesome. The bedside remote control for the lights, drapes and privacy settings is something I wish every hotel would have. Floor to ceiling windows are nice. Love the rotating plasma tv, and found the selection of international channels very interesting. The bed was comfortable but certain people, like myself, have preferences for a firmer mattress and pillows. The bathroom is great. Separate shower and large tub, dual vanities, make-up area and stool for the wife, and privacy toilet are all extremely nice and clean. The towels are very large and comfortable, and the robes are excellent. The only complaint I have about the room is that the doors are heavy. I can imagine that some people would find it difficult to open the front door, bathroom door, or closet doors. We did not have any noise problems. The only restaurant we tried at Encore was Society (due to late arrival and it was the first place we found open at midnight). The food was fine. It's actually more interesting as a place to look into the casino and see the guys checking out the ladies. It's better than any tv show. We ate lunch the next day at Burger Bar at the Mandalay (a favorite of mine - burgers with jalapeno bacon and fried egg are the best), and dinner at Nobu at the Hard Rock. Nobu was pretty good, not great. Had the 100 Omakase dinner. I would say overrated but I would eat there again. Hard Rock is a strange property. So dark, the casino is so small, the poker room is pitch black, and it's so loud everywhere you go, and the front of the hotel is clustered with taxis, limos, cars, etc. Unless you are 21, have a minimum of 7 visible facial piercings and/or tattoos, or are a rockstar, I would not stay at the Hard Rock. Wife went to the Wynn spa (thought we were staying at Wynn). We stopped by the Encore spa to take a look and the outer waiting area was nicer at the Encore spa than Wynn. Wife thought the Bellagio spa overall was better. The Encore pools are very nice -noone was there except for one person in a hot tub. It was a bit cold in February. What is strange is that the main pool and the European pool (topless I assume as a sign says no cameras are allowed in Euro pool) are side by side without any type of barrier. I thought that other casinos section off their topless pools and charge a cover (Rio, Mandalay, Mirage, etc.), which I guess increases the perception that Encore is geared towards adults only. Maybe Encore only charges for cabana rentals, as there are many more private cabanas around the European pool than the regular pool. We walked by Tryst a couple times. It looked like a fun place to be if you're into the club scene. There seem to be a couple different types of lines to get in. Very confusing. I felt bad for the groups of 3-4 guys in line. No way they were getting in. The poker room at the Wynn is very nice. Fun place to play. Cocktail waitresses are easy on the eyes and service is fast.

Reviews.Title: “Got a few bugs to work out”
Reviews.Author: MVLULU
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Encore for four nights for a business trip. Check- in was efficient and quick, although when we got to our room, someone else was in it - the door was opened by a man in his jockey shorts!! Back to the front desk for a new room! I must say, the suites are large and beautifully appointed. The bathroom was very large with a glass walled shower, tub, double sinks and separate area for the toilet. A large TV was usable from the bedroom area and the living room area. Large floor to ceiling windows allowed for a beautiful view, especially at night. The bed was extremely comfortable. We had no problems with noise or temperature control like some reviewers. We did notice, and keep track of, some toothpaste marks that were on the marble shelf by the sink. They were there when we checked in and never washed off by the staff during out entire stay. They sort of resembled the marbling of the marble, but should have been noticed and taken care of. We also were put off by the signage by the mini bar that said if you moved anything from it or the snacks on top for more than sixty seconds, your account would be charged. I find this annoying. The hotel was very beautifully decorated but there were not enough reasonable choices for eating. Even breakfast was very expensive. How much should eggs and bacon cost? Overall, it was a comfortable, fun time and I would go again if the rate were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good - no more, no less”
Reviews.Author: pcha72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights during the first week of February. Check in on a Thursday evening took about 30 minutes. Our room was on the 22nd floor and faced the north side of the strip, thus we had a lovely view of the strip mall across the street. We each received a door key, but mine didn’t work. The room looked exactly as the pictures on the website; we thought the rooms were well appointed with a very comfortable bed. However, we never received turn down service or slippers at all, although I loved the lemongrass scented toiletries. We could also hear other people’s voices when in the bathroom, but thankfully didn't hear any noise from the nightclub. Encore is located on the north strip, so it does take quite a walk to get to the other hotels. All the hotel employees we encountered were pleasant and helpful.
