I would only stay here again if I was able to get a good rate, otherwise, there are many choices on the strip that could have offered the same (or better) experience.

Reviews.Title: “No bigger than a Hampton Inn,have a great view, no Tmobile service”
Reviews.Author: lisabetty
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms arriving Feb 5, checking out on the 8th. One 71 year old (my Dad) my son and his wife (just turned 30), and my husband and myself, late 40s/early 50s. So we have a good rangfe of ages, and we all had the same opinion....not really impressed. Rooms are small...and really not that great. Best part was the bathroom. There was a great coffee area at the bottom of the elevator...perfectly located and good coffee..that was my fav spot. My dad and I enjoyed that area in the morning. Great area for poeple watching!!! The slots played decent, better than the Wynn, in our opinion. My son played blackjack and enjoyed his play there. It is one of the hotels that still is lively and busy. The Riviera looks like it is going our of business, it was so empty...but in our experiance, the slots played better therer!!!! We went to see Jersey Boys at the Palazzo, it was a nice casino, lively as well and the show was the best we'd seen.....the 30 yr olds were not that impressed though ( due ot not knowing all of the music), my dad and my husband and I absolutley loved it. Food was expensive as well at the Encore..we have eated at the Wynn buffet before and even though we were all comped buffets, we chose not to eat there....it really is not that good for "reguar food" type poeple!!! We ate at the zoo craker(name?) place a couple of times and it was okay but for hamburger, wings and sanwiches for 5 , the bill was 125.00. What ever happened to eating cheap in Vegas???? We ate at teh cafe in teh Wynn as well, at the end of the hallway form the Encore to the Wynn and for two premade sanwiches ans one panini, three bags of chips adn three cokes it was 75.00.!!!! That is steppe to me, especailly when the sanwiches came in a prepackaged plastic wrap and were taken right for the refigerator!!! If we had known, we would not ahve eaten there, the display looks good, sanwiches were horrible!!! Overall rooms were truly, just OK, food $$, nice casino. I like Planet Hollywood for a younger couple, th Bellagio still has it over the Encore, and the Palazzo has the absolute best rooms....so for me, I will be staying elsewhere. One more note....all of us never slept worse anywhere, we all figured we got about 10 hours of sleep over three days, and it was not form lack of trying. Our room was really hot as well. We did visit the spa at the Mirage and would nto recommend it either. My daughter in law and I has facials and massages, both were not worth the $$, but it the only place we coupld get into with short notice...the Wynn/Encore did not have room the day we wanted to go....whcih was our fault for not preplanning.

Reviews.Title: “Encore, they have some work to do...”
Reviews.Author: wrenchheadcb
Reviews.Content: I was meeting my wife for a weekend retreat before deploying to the desert. She flew in from Orlando and I drove from LA. She beat me to the hotel so she checked in and waited for me in the lobby. I was so excited to see her and how much I was looking forward to the short weekend I would be seeing her before I go away for the next 5 months! We had a room facing the strip on the 35th floor. We went to the room and the maid was just finishing up? I thought that was strange. After they were done I put my key card in the slot and it didn't work. So I had my wife wait and I went down to the front desk to fix the problem. No biggie, but no apology. I got back upstairs and my wife said that another couple had said they were in that room! My wife told them they must have had the wrong room and sent them on their way. I tried the key and again, it did not work. I grabbed a maintenance man and they let us in. We were tired and just wanted to get a bite to eat. Once in, we started to get settled. We noticed our slippers were missing so we called the front desk and they brought up a set. There was another knock at the door and it was security asking us to leave there was yet another couple with them! Triple booked the room? No. They gave us the wrong room number. So we picked up and moved. 2 hours. No apology, still. I paid full price for this room just like every other customer in that hotel and just because I am not a high roller, this is how I am treated? Not a real caring staff, I think they need more training in customer service. You may want to give this new hotel some time to work out the issues before you book. The slot machines are not the best, there are not that many tables being worked and all the clubs were closed due to some movie production or something, they didn't even bother to tell us. The room was nice, but the hassle and inconvenience put more of a damper on the stay than the rain did.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Arial77
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed by my stay at the Encore. Nothing about it screams five star, from the lines at check-in and check-out, to the unhelpful staff and problems with the room. The biggest problem was an extremely noisy fridge that made a long, loud rumbling sound at 15-20 minute intervals. I called maintenance at 7pm before going out at night, requesting that it either be fixed or unplugged (it's impossible to get behind the heavy furniture and do it yourself). When I returned to the room after midnight I saw that it was still plugged-in and a mobile fridge had also been wheeled into the room. Wondering if they had fixed it I went to sleep only to be woken at regular intervals throughout the night by it. I complained in the morning about it but they (at first) denied I had made a call about it the night before and then seemed pretty unconcerned about the matter. They also have problems with the a/c on the 38th floor, it was still baking after setting the thermometer to 59 degrees, if it's like this on a cool, rainy February night then there is no hope for the summer. The bathroom was extremely hot too. Another warning, the rooms are loud, you can hear your neighbors chatting coming through the vents both by the couch area and in the bathroom. I could make out nearly every word of a regular conversation. When requesting an extra half hour to check out I was told it would be another $150 even though the room was not booked for that night, and after the complaint about getting no sleep. Eventually they agreed to a half hour but I would by no means consider this five star service. None of the employees were rude but certainly didn't go out of their way to help, smile or say hello. I would definitely recommend the Signature at the MGM over the Encore, the service and rooms are far superior and the staff seem to genuinely care about your experience. It's also in a better location, the Encore is on the north end of the strip and if you are in a north facing room you will have a depressing view over some parking lots and strip malls and not much else. Also the Signature has a wonderful little cafe and the dining options are far superior to those at the Encore and Wynn. There were hairs in one of the bathroom sinks when I arrived and the alarm clock was set to the wrong time with no instructions on how to change it--minor details, but not what you expect at five star levels and prices. Their website also claims they have turn-down service, this did not happen. The spa at the Encore is beautiful and well worth visiting. But I would recommend staying elsewhere. I definitely won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Encore is an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: mtnplay
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Wynn, I did not have high expectations for the Encore. I felt the Wynn's decorating was cheesy, and the lobby is a letdown. The Encore is stylish, cool, with alot of flair. The rooms are a bit smaller than they are at the Wynn, but much more comfortable. It feels more like a resort. I love the colors and the thematic styling. It feels very stylized without being overtly trendy. I was really taken by the attention to detail, and its a shame that Wynn and company just can't seem to get the Vegas hotel/resort/casino correct. This type of stylized hotel is really amazing, and its kind of shame that they wasted the chance to really break away from the typical Vegas casino formula. Steve, hire a guy (me), to give you some tips, as I have stayed at every casino/hotel in Vegas multiple times. My main complaint with Encore is the Casino being placed right upon entry. When will the Las Vegas hoteliers catch up with the tastes of the american public, this is not 1950 anymore. If you want to be classy and set yourself apart, make the Casino more of a seperate room with a grand entry, rather than the stupid notion that you want people to drop 5 bucks in a slot machine on the way to their room or a restaurant. If people want to gamble they will go to the casino. This theory of casual gambling belongs in a bygone era, or at some lesser hotel/casino. For Steve Wynn to allow this is a travesty, and I question his ability to design the perfect resort/hotel/casino. This isn't just my beef with Steve Wynn, but all of the casino hotels on the strip. Though the casino at the Encore is beautiful and very nicely appointed, it just reminds you that you are in Vegas, and not a 5 star resort. I gambled for several hours at the casino, and it seems odd the way its laid out. Regardless, I had fun, and I was very impressed with the hotel, and it is one of my new favorites. Better than the Wynn, but it still hasn't taken the notion of a top quality resort/casino/hotel to its full potential. That formula is still missing from the strip and I don't see any current build out that has gotten it yet. The Hotel at Mandalay, was a close shot to this theory, but it lacks the imagination that the Encore has. The Hotel lacks where the Encore succeeds, and that is people watching. The Encore is excellent for this sport, but again, they could have done it better. I ate at the Botero one evening and the meal was excellent. I felt the staff was a bit rushed, and felt that they were swooping in and trying to turn the table quickly. The place was filled with beautiful people, and I'm sure this will be one of the top hotels to be seen at. As a side note, and it goes as one of the top qualities of the Encore... the staff was amazing and very friendly and helpful. Only one note, since the pit bosses, dealers, etc. are recylcled from one casino to another, they really need to put them through customer service training. I'm always shocked at the patronizing and often rude behavior of dealers and pit bosses to the gambling consumer. They may do it day in and day out but the consumers are most often there for just a few days, and not always aware of the proper etiquette or rules around the table. Remember people are their to have fun, and should be treated as such. Enjoy the Encore, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Las Vegas Health Inspector should Investigate.”
Reviews.Author: h8stn4d
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at all of the best hotels in Vegas, and this was a disappointing, disgraceful experience. Steve Wynn should be embarrassed and the health inspector should be called. 1) In a four-night stay, housekeeping failed to come to our room on two occasions. We were out many hours during the day—during normal hours that we'd expect a maid to show up—and they never came. Even after we called and specifically asked that housekeeping come, they didn't bother to show! I have had better service at a Motel 6. 2) And when housekeeping did actually show up, they left an OPEN, USED BOTTLE OF WATER, "Compliments of Encore" on the table (next to a brand new bottle). The seal of the bottle had been opened and at least 1 inch of water had been consumed by a prior guest! This was NOT our bottle from the prior night; we finished those. The implications of this are unspeakable. I shudder to think about what other things Encore may be re-using to save money. 3) Many things were missing from our minibar when we got to the room. I was concerned that we would be charged. I called the front desk to ensure that we were not charged. They said that housekeepking would come up and re-fill the minibar. I said, fine, but that we would be leaving in an hour and asked if they could come back at that time. The front desk told me to call back in an hour. Not a huge deal, but why should I have to waste my time calling back? Also, to add insult to injury, for the rest of our stay, the minibar was never replenished (although I did specifically go to the front desk to tell them they could go up and to confirm that we were not being charged). 4) During our stay, we had countless problems with Internet access. Wifi never worked, and we spent at least 90 minutes trying to get it working. 5) They couldn't get our newspaper preferences right, even after we asked several times. Again, not a huge deal, but is it really that difficult?

Reviews.Title: “Winter getaway to the Encore - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Nieem
Reviews.Content: I wanted to suprise my wife for her birthday so I booked a room at the Encore. Overall we had a great time. Check-in was effortless and they were able to give us a room that faced the strip. Please be aware that they ask for authorization of $150/night on a credit card. It does not actually charge the card, but be prepared to present one at check-in. The rooms are A+. Nice floor-to-ceiling windows, hdtv, and spacious bathroom. There is a bar in the room that has sensors on each item there. If you pick up the item for more than 60 seconds, it will automatically charge it to your room. Also, all the restaurants are expensive, so unless you want to spend the cash, I would recommend eating at a mixture of other hotels. Also, there is a diner 2 blocks down the street that has GREAT food for reasonable prices. (and there's a liquor store on the way too) For those who don't want to spend $12-$15 for every drink. I would recommend going to SW Steakhouse for dinner(at the Wynn). The foood and service is excellent and there is a show on the water every 30 minutes in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “The Encore is Terrible...”
Reviews.Author: curious_travelling
Reviews.Content: My entire family (9 of us in 3 rooms) stayed at both the Wynn (with adjoining rooms) and Encore (1 suite) from 1/27 - 2/1/09. They'd emailed us specials, and we wanted to try out the new Encore hotel. We got reasonable rates...$129/night weekday, $159/night weekend. We had reservations requesting non-smoking adjoining rooms for the Wynn, and confirmed these requests via email and telephone several times. Upon checkin, our rooms weren't ready for over an hour. We were told that they wouldn't promise us adjoining rooms since it is "merely a preference and not a guarantee" (exact words) even though it's what we reserved. We did finally get them though. When the rooms were ready, we went back and got our keys and finally settled in. Endless banging from construction directly above both Wynn rooms forced us to complain (there was nonstop fast hammering from what we theorize was carpet installation). They explained that the construction was only supposed to occur that particular day from 7am - 3pm. By 5:00pm, it was still going strong. We finally insisted that they move us, and found out that the work was not complete and would continue at 7:00am the next morning. We moved by 5:35pm and it was still noisy with plenty of banging. Weak apologies, no upgrades, nothing to compensate us, not even a basket of fruit. Over in the Encore, (which is supposed to be the newer and higher class hotel) the room and hallway was pretty but the service was TERRIBLE! The housekeeping staff the first night was good - the housekeeper Milagro was pleasant and friendly and a fellow NY'er to boot!). Unfortunately for us, she must have had the next few days off because the next 3 nights were absolutely terrible. They tossed the pillows onto the couch instead of leaving them on the beds...what was the purpose?!?! They took all of our belongings, shoes, boots, clothing, etc. and tossed those onto the couch too. We're not slobs, we had things on hangers on doorknobs and others draped over the desk chair. Things weren't on piled on the floor preventing them from vaccuuming or anything (except for boots & shoes, which belong on the floor!) There was a layer of clothing, then shoes, then more clothing on top. All of our clothing was now dirtied by being mixed with the shoes. Totally unneccesary and rude. To add insult to injury, the remaining 3 days we had no turndown service. No slippers, no chocolates, no beds made. In fact, they even TOOK our slippers away from us. (We had 2 pairs given to us the first night, we brought 2 of our own in from the other rooms) After the second night, all but one pair were gone and were never replaced. The one pair that was left was thrown underneath the nightstand --- literally thrown under... It took 3 days to fix a loose toilet seat. The tub was not cleaned. There was a hooker in the Encore elevator who was solicited by 2 guests right in front of my husband and my sister's boyfriend...hello? security??? They charged us over $60 for 3 mini-bar items that we did not take. (their policy is if you move something for more than 60 seconds, it automatically charges your bill, but we didn't even touch or look at them!!!). In 40 degree weather, we have absolutely no use for a suncare kit, nor would we ever listen to or want a "Wynn Musical CD," or pay $8 for a snack. Thursday, Friday & Saturday night the music from the club downstairs was really loud. (we were on the 23rd floor and could hear it all) Luckily for us, we were out late ourselves those nights and returned exhausted after 4am and had no problems going straight to sleep...but if you were an early or light sleeper, too bad for you. Back at the Wynn, they jacked up the price of their buffet from $14.99 to $30.99 per person for brunch for the Chinese New Year...and it was not good, choices were limited, some stuff looked like it came out of a can - and honestly are eggs & breakfast meats, congee and stirfry really worth that kind of money? I don't think so. Plus they added 18% gratuity automatically. We did go back the second night for dinner (but only because we had a couple comps from an awesome pitboss named Brian) and their reputation was redeemed... I definitely recommend the dinner buffet, but save your money and skip the brunch. At checkout time, the lines were ridiculously long because they didn't have video checkout available, so every guest was standing on line to checkout by 12:00pm. When my husband argued the excess charges, they told us to take it up with the credit card company! Seriously?!?! Considering the economic recession, you'd think that they would treat and accomodate their guests better. (especially since 7 of us gambled and all lost quite a bit of money there). You would think that they would want to make us happy since half of us were repeat guests and gamblers. Granted we're not high rollers and we got a good room rate, but for the amount of money they'd normally charge and the reputation they're trying to maintain, their service was just poor and disgusting. I'll go back to the Venetian from now on, or even Treasure Island who once comped our stay since we gambled a lot there. We plan on writing a letter of complaint to the company. If anything comes out of it, I will re-post the outcome.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Exscribe
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Encore at the end of January. The attraction was that the hotel is new, and touted as a 5-star. Having stayed at the Wynn just after it opened, we thought we knew what to expect. And to a certain extent that was true. The suite, save for the decoration, was identical to the Wynn, which meant it was lavish and comfortable. We weren't crazy about the decor, but, hey, that's merely personal taste. If you get a view room of the strip, it's a joy to look out from the huge floor to ceiling window. But a warning. Get a room on the right side of the building (facing the strip) because otherwise part or all of your view will be obstructed by the Wynn. Now for the real problems. The biggest one is that Mr. Wynn cut some corners this time. For example, the air conditioning unit. At some point, everyone has stayed in a motel where the air conditioning turns on, blowing cold air into the room, then turns off when the temperature is reached, only to turn on again when it gets warm in the room again. I never imagined I would experience that at a supposed 5-star hotel. But instead of a constant flow at a chosen temperature, that's what you got at the Encore. There's worse. The unit is set into a wall by the windows. So the living area is cooled to the temperature set. But there is no vent in the bedroom, which stays much warmer much longer. To get a decent night's sleep, we had to set the temperature to 62 degrees, and I still had to sleep only under the sheets. Another big problem with the Encore. It is connected by a long walkway to the Wynn. Want to eat breakfast in a room that doesn't overlook the gambling area? You have to trek to the Wynn. Want to eat at the buffet? Start walking. Want to play poker? Sorry, that room is in the Wynn, too. If you're young and fit, you probably won't even notice the hike. But if you're a little older or get fatigued more easily, that walk starts to turn into a Death March. And finally, the Encore is at the extreme end of the quality strip hotels. If you want to try your luck at the Venetian or even the Mirage, that's no big deal. It isn't that far to walk. But if you want to go to the Bellagio or the MGM, you'll have either a long walk or an expensive cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: highwaylights
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Encore From Jan. 30th to Feb. 1st 2009. The hotel was amazing, but the rooms were the best! The rooms were spacious, the beds amazing, it was hard to get up everymorning. What I thought was also great was the service. Service is very important to us, and it was outstanding. I have stayed at 4 other hotels in vegas over the years, the Encore by far has the best service. There was only one problem, some of the plumbing chases in the hotel rooms were not properly sealed for sound, we ran into a few people that had similar issues, but the hotel was aware and was getting the problem fixed. It has been only open for a about 30 days, so I let them pass on this one. Next time I go to vegas this is the place we will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: reneraven
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Encore, after booking a penthouse suite at Bellagio, where we usually stay. Encore offered us a great deal. Our room was considerably smaller than the penthouse suite we usually get at Bellagio, plus, we had to get an additional room for our babysitter, which was a duplicate of our "suite". The suite was pretty small... you can see pics that other people posted...same room, basically... but, really, seriously, very comfy. I was a little concerned having our 7 year old with us, we usually get a separate room.. but, the "baby" suite was fine, besides, our son kicks one of us (my husband) out of bed at some point during the night so he can sleep in our bed, and my husband had no problem sleeping on the sofa, which he said was incredibly comfortable. But, the thing I loved about Encore (Wynn) was the boutique feel. Very nice and cozy. I can't wait to go back. Though, I have to admit, I preferred the larger suite we had last time we were there with the massage room. But, this being the first time we've had a regular sized suite, I still really enjoyed it. We did head over to Bellagio to take our son and babysitter (his kindergarten teacher's assistant!) to see "O" and were blown away by the crowds. One thing I DO NOT miss at Encore is the heavy crowds and the strollers. WHAT ARE THOSE PARENTS THINKING? dragging their babies/toddlers/young ones around the hotel at the wee hours? ugh! We've always been lucky with sitters in Vegas, but recently lost ours to a full time nanny position, hence the reason we brought along our own. Bellagio is sooooo much bigger and louder and everything else. Though, I'd be eager to go back to my Penthouse Suite, I'd be ever so happy to go back to Encore. Of course, you can't beat the restaurants at any of the upper scale hotels in the area. The food at Encore was incredible. We usually ordered room service in the AM and the Eggs Benedict had the PERFECT hollandaisse sauce. Being a foodie, and a cook, I truly appreciated it. And my skinny minny son, who LOVES and devours sushi LOVED the asian restaurant. I can't wait to go back... though, I'd prefer the craps tables to be a little hotter... and my husband would prefer the same with the blackjack tables. I think he's just too excited about heading to St John and staying at Kalorama! We got new videos of it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KellyTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 13th anniversary, and we both agreed it was one of the best vacations to Vegas we've ever had. The beds were very plush and comfortable, and our suite on the 28th floor had a fantastic view of the strip. Check-in was a breeze and the young women who checked us in was very polite and efficient. The drinks while gambling were very strong and plentiful, the decor was classy and festive. All the employees were pleasant and helpful. We especially enjoyed Michelle at the beach bar by the pool. The jacuzzi is open right now. The walk over to the Wynn is a snap through the breezeway and taxi drivers are always available to see the strip. Even when we forgot our shaver and hairspray, housekeeping came to the rescue in minutes. Thank you to Steve Wynn, for a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of bark with little bite...”
Reviews.Author: bubbaboytm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at some very decadent and luxurious hotels. In comparison, the Wynn Encore ended up being just an "OK" experience. YES, the hotel was new and beautiful (although the original Wynn is nicer) but the front desk had MUCH to be desired. It was a disorganized mess... none of our special requests were taken care of although we called way in advance (our party was scattered all over the hotel - no rooms together... they couldn't even do something as simple as a late check out for us!) The last straw was when we checked in at 11 p.m. (after a VERY long flight) and one group in our party was given the most disgustingly messy room that I have ever seen. Newness and luxury don't mean squat to me at midnight when I want to sleep and it looks like someone threw a bomb in my room. I went downstairs and complained. The aloof "front desk manager" said she would take care of it. Mind you, this is a $300+ a night room. After much insistence due to our inconvenience she offers me a $50 dining credit. $50???!! At the Wynn Encore??! So I can buy what, a cup of coffee and some toast? And mind you, she didn't even offer... I had to prod her. The situation is not about the money... if I was looking for "value", I wouldn't be at the Wynn Encore. It was about receiving superior service, which we did not. We flat out refused the dining credit... we told her she could keep it. We went out to dinner and when we got back (SEVERAL hours later) the bed had been made, but the bathroom was still disgusting with used soaps, etc. Well, the front desk was called and after going ballistic, the party was given a new room and a $200 dining credit. The credit was nice... but this SHOULD NOT be happening at a hotel of this caliber!!! We should not be roving through a hotel like gypsies at 1 a.m. because we have to repack and move because the front desk and housekeeping seem to be functioning on two different planets. On the plus side, the employees of the hotel were wonderful... very nice and helpful. The service and attitude of the servers in the restaurants were wonderful. But that front desk NEEDS to get it together... it's a fiasco! All in all, we had a nice time because we are able to roll with the punches, but I can say that a very special birthday celebration was ruined due to the lack of customer service and care that we received from the front desk. They acted like they just didn't care... and the way that we were treated by them brought the point home. Mr. Wynn should spend less money of fabulous draperies and golden tassles and invest more in customer service training for his front line staff. Don't know about the rest of my party (it was six people in separate rooms) but as far as I am concerned, I will NEVER return to the Wynn Encore again!!!! I can spend a few thousand dollars at a much better establishment such as The Venetian and TRULY experience what service at an upscale hotel should be like. Peace out...

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas Vacation Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan P
Reviews.Content: All I can say is Wow! My wife and I stayed at the Encore 1/22 - 1/25, and loved every minute of it. Check-in took about 10 minutes, we asked for and got a high floor strip view. The room is big and amazingly clean. The bedding, bathroom, everything was perfect. The casino is beautiful, and they actually had $10 craps tables going most of the time. I played for about 8-10 hours in total, and was up quite a bit of money until I wasn't any more. All-in-all I had one of the best gambling experiences I have ever had in Vegas. Everyone on the Encore staff is helpful, friendly, and seems to enjoy their job. The cocktail waitresses are very attentive and the drinks are s-t-r-o-n-g. My wife played a decent amount of slots, and qualified for the 2 free buffet tickets, hopefully we can use them next time we are there. What else? Oh, the restaurants are all beautiful and the few we had a meal at were fantastic. Try the Oscar Benedict at the Society Cafe, (crab cakes instead of English muffins). Don't forget to charge everything to your room over your stay. The comp program right now is very generous and you would be surprised what you can get if you ask for it... We liked everything so much, that we just booked another trip for early May so we can enjoy the pool. The price was great, and we just couldn't say no. To everyone that is complaining about location, look at a map of Vegas. It takes a long time to walk anywhere, if you don't like it, grab a cab. There is a line of them outside the front door. Steve, keep it up!! And, do you have an opening for a protégé?

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: JTM6
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Encore for our anniversary. We had such a wonderful time there and definately will come back again. Service is great every where we go. Staff is well trained and always provided service with a smile. Buffet was excellent, the crab legs and lamb were very good. Again, if Wynn is the best, then Encore is the best of the best. JTM Houston, TX

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Encore!”
Reviews.Author: djfishrock
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore Jan. 19 - 22, taking advantage of the three free nights comp offer from the resort (received via email). I have a Wynn Red players card, and probably accumulated a couple hundred points when I gambled at the Wynn in July 2008. I have never stayed at the Wynn itself, and the only comparable Las Vegas hotels in which I have stayed are The Venetian and Mandalay Bay. Simply put, staying at Encore was the best hotel experience I have ever had in my many trips to Las Vegas (it made The Venetian seem like a Holiday Inn in comparison). Everyone at Encore was extremely friendly and all provided top-notch customer service. From the valets, to the registration clerks, to the housekeepers, to the security staff, I was always greeted with a smile, and made to feel very much at home at Encore. The room itself was incredible, with plenty of space, a very comfortable bed, lots of closet space, and a huge bathroom. I loved the high-tech amenities such as the 42" LCD with HD, the iPod dock/alarm clock, and the bedside control panel (which operated the lights, the drapes, and the 'Do Not Disturb' doorsign for the room). I did not eat at any of the restaurants at Encore, but did have a couple of meals at the Wynn buffet during my stay. I will do a separate review of the buffet, but let's just say that it certainly is one of the best -- if not THE best -- buffet on the Strip. I played mostly slots at Encore, and had very good luck on one particular quarter machine. It being Inaguration Week, I played "Stars and Bars' and was rewarded with some nice-sized jackpots more than once. I also earned enough points for two more free Wynn buffets, which I plan to use on my return trip this summer. In addition, the cocktail service was impeccable, and the cocktail servers themselves were knockouts! Nothing better than being served a qualtiy adult beverage, by a beautiful woman, while actually winning some money in Vegas! :-) Granted, this stay was free, but I would have no problem paying for a room at Encore. Viva Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and luxurious hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: isen
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a beautiful hotel inside and outside. The check-in was speedy and staff were courteous. The room or should I say "suite" was fantastic!!! The bathroom was huge and extravagant - bathroom and shower to suit everyone! Double vanity, ottoman, light-up vanity mirror, and did I mention the 19" TV screen you can watch while brushing your teeth! The towels, slippers, and robes added the warm touch to the place! Oh, yes the bar soap was lemongrass scent - very exotic and lovely... The sectional sofa and ottoman made room for any guest you may have come visit and envy your suite!! It was such a pleasant and relaxing stay there. I think we got a pretty good deal for staying there this time of the year....I'm glad we got the chance! Must try if you're in for some R&R in a NICE hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Encore Wynn is a Winner!!!”
Reviews.Author: thekell
Reviews.Content: I organized a 6 man golf trip to Vegas. We paid $125 total per night for a room at the Wynn Encore. We found it on Travelocity. The hotel staff treated us like Royalty, upgrading us to a Panoramic View room overlooking the Strip from the 54th floor. Check in was a breeze, free valet park was prompt and courteous. Hotel was perfect in every way. Steve Wynn is a team builder and his staff is loyal to his vision. Customers are guests not objects to produce revenue.. The outdoor jacuzii closes at 5 this time a year so the hotel comped our spa visit. The spa is heavenly, cleaner than an operating room. We had a great casual dinner at the Cafe Society, we all won money, and we had a great time at the Wynn complex. To all the people who wrote a negative review about Encore, I say, "grow a spine, ask for what you want, and it will be delivered promptly with a smile" Don't be afraid to pass the savings along to the staff. So what if the economy is collapsing. You can live like a KIng at Encore because of it. The Kell P.S.Highly Recommend the In and Out Burger!

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: manktripguy
Reviews.Content: Spent three night at Encore. What a treat! Here's what I agree and disagree with from the previous posts: Agree: Check-in line was long but there was employees there to help move it along. Beautiful hotel, casino. Nicely decorated, meticulously cleaned, and very comfortable rooms (yes, the bed is the best). I do agree that the walls are VERY THIN. I could definitely here my neighbors at night. Food is expensive (but you should expect that in a five-star resort). The casino is small, but I like that it is a more intimate seting. Also, the casino does not have the overbearing sense of smoke everywhere as do other casinos in the area. Disagree: The employees here ARE extremely helpful and everyone is first-class. Bags were brought up to the room within 15 minutes of calling the Bell Desk. Previous posters must have stayed when the hotel was new. It is not a long walk to find affordable food options ... various cafes are available at the Wynn and it is a short walk over to the food courts at the Venetian or across the Strip @ Fashion Show Mall. I would definitely stay here again and I hope that you have a chance to stay here as well!

Reviews.Title: “Encore was Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sarahdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Encore for three nights (1-22-09 through 1-25-09). We were a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews on this site. After returning from our trip, we have decided there are (2) possible explanations for the mixed reviews we have seen: 1) We have low expectations. I don't believe this to be the case, but how else to explain some of the comments I've seen. We are fairly well traveled (esecially to Vegas with over 20 trips to this town) and we have never stayed at a more beautiful hotel in Vegas. I will give you that we are perhaps not as picky as some people, but I think we have pretty realistic expectations for a 5 star property and Encore met all of them. 2) YMMV. (your mileage may vary) We did not hear anything from our "neighbors". I'm not saying that it wouldn't happen. Only that our stay was very quiet and we did not hear anything from the hallway or the rooms next door. We also did not hear anything from the nightclub, but we were on the side that faces "downtown". By the way, that view is just fine. The service we received from the dealers to the waitresses to the front desk was great. We checked in within 5 minutes, tops. Yes, it was a little strange not having the zigzag 'rope line" to herd everybody to a specific place. But, shouldn't we welcome the fact that we are not being herded into a line? There is enough of that at the airpoort and the restaurants. A little common courtesty for your fellow man and the process works just fine. If someone was there before you, they are first. If someone arrives after you, you are first. Pretty simple concept. Overall, we had no complaints with the service we received. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Enough has been said about the rooms. Everything I read is accurate. They are absolutely beautiful and the beds are very comfortable. For my money, I didn't even mind paying $6 for a beer out of the fridge because you would have to pay that if you walked downstairs anyway. Granted, if you were gambling, then it would not cost you anything except the tip but there were times where we just didn't want to gamble. If I had one complaint, I would have to say that not comping drinks while you play video poker at the bar is it. The Encore & Wynn did lose quite a bit of our gambling business during the morning and afternoon for this reason. We simply went over to TI and had a couple bloody mary's and played there. We expect to walk an abnormal amount when we go to Vegas anyway so the location has no bearing on our decision. It is within (10) minutes of Venetian, TI, Mirage, and maybe (15) minutes to Ceasar's. In our minds, staying at Encore is very similiar to staying at Mandalay Bay and utilizing the free tram to get part way to Bellagio, Paris, Caesar's. etc. The only difference is no tram. However, the walking is about the same. Unfortunately, it was too cold for the pool but we did walk through the areas and they look like it would be a blast during warmer weather. Can't wait to go back and experience. Overall, this is now our favorite in Vegas. I just don't think you can beat the overall ambience, "newness factor" and the rooms themselves. Thanks for a great trip Encore.

Reviews.Title: “A mix of good and bad”
Reviews.Author: RBG81601
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here, arriving Thursday January 22nd. Check in was terribly long, no discernable lines so people bunch up and float around. As an invited guest I stood beside a sign saying Invited Guest Check In, but even here people jumped to the counter in front of us from other bunches. Once at the counter it took quite a while still, but the system is new and I am sure they are still working out the kinks. The room was beautiful, spacious, very clean. Just inside the entry is a panel on which you can turn on all the lights with one button, or just the lights in the bedroom or foyer - you can also turn on a Do Not Disturb which lights up a panel outside your room rather than hanging a sign on the door -- neat, but unreliable and our room was entered by housekeeping when we had engaged the privacy button which seems to have disengaged itself. The walls are painfully thin, especially in the bathroom and by the window, and we could clearly hear the conversation of two men in the room next door, including that one was "constipated" and "needed more fiber" and other things throughout the evening too x-rated to post here. This really, really hurt the "Five Star Hotel Experience" Wynn Resorts promise and ruined our sleep until I turned the HVAC on high fan which made loud enough white noise to hide the words of our neighbors. This fact, more than all others, soured our whole visit to this property. The TV is on a swivel between the living room and bedroom, and it is positioned well for viewing from the bed but not well at all to view from the sofa. No big deal, we only had the TV a little and were not in Vegas to watch TV in the room. The resort itself is a nice addition to Wynn and connected to it well, but Encore is brighter and a bit smaller with large windows in the casino looking out on the pool and gardens. Had quite a bit of luck at the machines, and the cocktail service was top notch. Le Reve is well worth seeing, but our dinner at Bartolotta was less then stellar. 3 bland prawns were $60, and a very tiny filet that was not even as good as Chili's was $50, and with a couple drinks and tip the total was $200. Emeril's at MGM is a much better fish place, and their steaks are awesome as well. On our last day our flight was not leaving until 8pm, so I contacted the front desk about checking out at 6pm. They offered this option to me for the "half day rate" of $150 -- however as an invited guest I was paying only $149 per night and mentioned this to the woman on the phone, but she said $150 would still considered my half day rate. In actuality 6 extra hours would be a quarter day which should have cost me an extra $37.25, but I would have gladly paid the true half day rate of $75, but I would not pay $150 to leave my items in the room for 6 hours. Luckily the bell desk minded our luggage during this time for the bargain price of two $5.00 tips. Overall we really enjoyed the hotel, but because of how thin the walls between the rooms are and how disruptive hearing your neighbors is to a relaxing vacation I will not likely stay here again - but I will visit the hotel itself without renting a room.

Reviews.Title: “A real "Wynner"”
Reviews.Author: tipsytravler
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Encore was truly fabulous. From the moment we drove up to the valet to the second we sadly checked out we loved Encore. All of the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was luxurious and spotlessly clean. The whole hotel smells wonderful!! There where a few minor glitches but they where rectified quickly. The attention to detail in creating this property is very unvegas like and much appreciated. If you want to truly get away from it all and enjoy some sophistication and charm stay here. I indulged in a pedicure at the Salon and that too was fantastic. My husband and I have stayed at many of the Las Vegas hotels but Encore is now our #1 pick. Do yourself a favor, leave the kids,your pink warm up suit, crocs and pull along coolers at home. Pack your heels, best dress, some sexy lingere and head to Encore for a wonderful time. Honorable mention: While the restaurants at Encore are top notch we also enjoyed a great meal across the street at Magianos at the Fashion Show Mall

Reviews.Title: “The Wynn/Encore Experience”
Reviews.Author: FlyboyOxford
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 10 day stay at Steve Wynn's new hotel called the Encore. This hotel opened its doors December 2008. I travel extensively throughout the world as part of my profession and have been fortunate enough to stay at some of the best hotels in the world but can categorically state that both the Encore and the Wynn Hotel (previously stayed there 6 times) are an experience not to be missed. There are a lot of great hotels on the Vegas Strip such as The Four Seasons and Bellagios, both of which I have previously stayed at and are equal to the Encore and the Wynn in stature and luxury. However the thing that separates the Wynn from these and all the other hotels I have stayed at is the staff and standard of customer service which quite frankly is unprecedented. They cannot do enough for you and really go out their way to make you feel genuinely welcome and appreciated. The whole Wynn experience is unique. All the staff I spoke to genuinely felt they were part of the Wynn family and certainly the way that we were treated during our stay was amazing. To cap the whole experience and during the first couple of days of my stay I was informed by a couple of members of staff that Steve Wynn regularly walks through the hotel and has a look around on a regular basis. I personally witnessed this and indeed met briefly with Mr Wynn and his business partner Scott. We had a brief discussion with reference to my stay and he was genuinely interested and caring about any comments I had. I do not know any other hotel of this stature where the owner can be so easily approached. This together with many other aspects of my stay made the Wynn experience a truly memorable occasion. The only complaint I have is that the days just whizzed past and then it was time to say goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “Enore good but not terriific depending on your preference”
Reviews.Author: vgasdude
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Encore due to an offer they sent me for two nights on January 19th-21st 2009. First of all everyone is right it is just like the Wynn it is a beautiful property. Second of all everyone is also right that the check in desk is a mess if it is crowded. There were people everywhere and there were some semi lines but nothing real organized. I did have someone ask me if I was there on an offer and when I said yes they sent me to invited guest check in which had a smaller unorganized line however I still waited about twenty minutes. Now it could have been due to time of day because several other times I went by the desk there was no line however the Wynn is pretty much the same way. The room itself it brand new and beautiful with a different color scheme then the Wynn and a wall in the middle with a HDTV that you can turn toward the living area or the bedroom area so as far as the room goes for comfort etc I was very happy. Also I encountered no customer service issues while I was there as some other people have. My room was always clean etc. Now for the preference part. The Encore is quite a distance from the Wynn not a long distance and it does have its own entrance but it is still a hike from one lobby to the other and up to your room. I had a friend at the Palazzo and when we split up every evening and I headed back to my room I had to walk over the bridge from the Palazzo to the Wynn, through the Wynn down the walkway of shops through the Encore to the elevators to my room. It was kind of a pain. TheHotel at Mandalay Bay was built right next door to Mandalay Bay so it is convenient to go to either property and it is not such a giant pain at the Encore that I wouldnt recommend the hotel however what I would say is this, if you have a choice between the two and have friends somewhere else on the strip stay at the Wynn and if you are on your own stay at the Encore. Just a suggestion because I would recommend either although due to the distance between them and the average check in line I gave this review a four instead of the five I have given the Wynn in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Happiness”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoMountainMom
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Vegas for her 30th Birthday. I wanted it to be a special trip to remember. I booked the Encore for that reason. After reading some of the reviews I was nervous. We rented a car, followed signs and easily found the hotel and valet. From the time we arrived we were greeted by a friendly, helpful staff. Valet offered to carry bags. A gentleman at the front desk directed us to the shortest line for check-in. I had called ahead and requested two queen beds. The young lady at the desk told us that there were very few of these rooms and none were available, but she would put us on a list for the next day. She offered to upgrade us to a Panoramic view room. She also offered a roll-away and escort to our room. The room and view were beautiful. No complaints. Quiet, clean and comfortable (beds and pillows, ahh!!). Loved the lighting and bedside controls. The rooms have doorbells, privacy lights, turn down service and a morning newspaper. The Hotel Lobby and Casino are done in red and white with Butterflys and dragonflies and are lovely, as are the gardens and pool area. Crystal dragon and Peacocks are stunning. We stopped at a wonderful lounge and were seated by the pool windows. The cocktail waitress was terrific. We sat for several hours, just enjoying drinks and the late afternoon. I liked the way the casino was set up with the natural light from the windows and small areas instead of large caverns as are most casinos in Las Vegas. It doesn't feel crowded. Our entire stay was great. Everyone we encountered that worked at the Encore were absolutely wonderful. A problem with the staff was a non issue. Everytime were took out our car, we were asked if we needed directions. On return we were greeted with a welcome back, by both valets and doorman. I don't understand peoples complaints about having trouble turning on to the Strip. There were clear signs for directions and a double turn at the light to go left??? Cabs didn't seem to be a problem. My only minor complaint was that there wasn't enough casual dining. Only a coffee shop. All others were in the Wynn a short walk away. It got crowded in the walkway to the elevators when large groups stopped there to discuss plans. It was a memorable weekend for us both. I have found that anywhere I travel, if I am respectful, friendly and have a positive attitude that I am treated the same.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: citygirl118
Reviews.Content: I am flabbergasted by the whiners on here. I feel like some people were staying at a different hotel, because my experience at the Encore was amazing. My mother and I went to celebrate my birthday after getting a great deal on a room here. I go to Vegas once or twice a year, and have stayed in all kinds of properties. The Encore was the best I’ve been in. We began by dropping our car off to a smiling, friendly valet who helped us retrieve our bags from the trunk (and asked if we needed help). Then another friendly face greeted us by opening the door and directing us to the check-in desk. A greeter showed us which line to wait in- a line that was only 2 deep at check-in time on a Saturday. We were quickly helped by the front desk agent. We had requested a room with 2 Queen’s, but there were none available. She put in our names to move if one came up the next day, had a rollaway sent to the room, and offered to upgrade us to a Panoramic Suite (the top 10 floors of the hotel- which I declined as I’m deathly afraid of heights). We got to our gorgeous room, and within 10 minutes the doorbell rang and the rollaway was set up efficiently, with a great view by the window (and an extra robe and slippers!). Oh, and I have to mention the elevators- they were so fast, we never had to wait more than a few seconds for one. Every person working at the Encore was so wonderful to us, even the cocktail waitress in the bar by the pool (great Prosecco with a lovely sunset view, by the way). We never opened a door, the valets always offered directions and were smiling, nobody was holding their hands out for tips. I couldn’t get over how happy the employees seemed. I also never saw big housekeeping carts in the hallway, which is a little thing I appreciate. Not to mention, the room was perfect. I took a long bath in the deep tub, and slept like a baby under the big down comforter. The turn down service is perfect after a long day, too- relaxing pictures and music on the TV, slippers by the bed, chocolates, low lights and curtains drawn. I just couldn’t have asked for more from the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fab!”
Reviews.Author: vegasbaby64
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Encore for three nights. Wow what a wonderful three nights, days, and, afternoons! Upon arrival at 6pm we were greeted by a wonderful, cheerful, clerk. She gave us our room and off we went. The room was magnificent. We have stayed at the Wynn three times, the Signature, Mandalay Bay, MGM, you name it...The Encore was just great. The casino was very low key and classy, the pool superb, the room was huge, comfortable, and very, very, quiet. Everyone was friendly and helpful. I think that some reviewers may not be used to such class....I did see a few couples arriving at the hotel with their Playmate cooler all loaded up...not exactly Wynn style. So if they walked up to the front desk and plopped their playmate cooler on the counter I could see the desk attendant maybe being taken aback. We had no problem with the location. We rented a car and took the back way down the strip...so no problems there. There are games for all at the casino. $10 black Jack to ???? and everything else one could want. We will stay at the encore again! Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: “Great addition to the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: Manico
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of the Wynn, preferring it over the Bellagio which I don't think has as good rooms, service or a pool area. So I was excited to be one of the first to visit Encore soon after its opening and was impressed with what I saw. The decor and look is the same as the Wynn which is expected since they are connected, but the Encore has a more intimate and less smokey casino floor which I liked. Yes, check-in does take a while, but I've yet to find any large Strip hotel where it takes less than 10 minutes (and most of them are moving towards this "no line, free-for-all" method of checking in at the desk). Check-in was efficient and polite. The room was larger than expected and of course, very nice with the automated lighting and drape features and the semi-separate living room area with the swivel LCD TV. The beds were comfortable and the linens clean as was the bathroom which had a nice separate soaking tub (although it didn't seem as large as some of the other hotels). As noted by some, the walls are very thin and I did hear both my neighbors partying next door as well as when others were showering etc. but again I think that's common in Vegas where they try to build big, fast and cheap. Didn't take advantage of many of the restaurants/bars in the hotel as it was a one night stay except that I dined at the Terrace Cafe next door at the Wynn where I had a good meal (with large portions) in a nice setting overlooking the pool area. Would definitely like to come back here when the weather is better for the pool as I do like the Adults only pool (not for what you think, but because there are NO screaming kids around). If you're wanting to casino hop, then this is at the far end of the strip for most people, but again walkable or you can use the Deuce strip. If you're looking for other dining options in the area, there are many at the mall across the street or just walk up north a few blocks to a Denny's or my personal favorite, the Peppermill where you can get a taste of the old school Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, rooms, decorating, etc.”
Reviews.Author: waynay6405
Reviews.Content: We had a late-night check-in that was very fast. I asked for a high-floor and was given a room on the 59th floor at the end of the hall (so it was very quiet). One minor glitch was the connecting room door didn't latch. A call to maintenance and it was corrected within 15-minutes. The rooms are nicely laid-out and decorated, with unbelievably comfortable beds. Twice a day maid service was given. Also received bottled water and two newspapers each day. Rooms are more spacious and nicer than the Wynn. We are "low-rollers", but they were nice enough to comp the room with no strings attached, apparently because we have stayed at the Wynn and have their "Red Card". Casino has Asian-influences and a more intimate feel. Good cocktail service in casino with an "awesome" spicy bloody mary. It's an easy walk (indoor) to the Wynn if you want a buffet or prefer their casino or restaurants. Bring lots of cash (or plastic) if you want to dine at either resort. There are no food courts, low priced restaurants, or buffets at Encore. Overall it was a real treat. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Fan”
Reviews.Author: old3
Reviews.Content: We are big fans of the Wynn and were anxious to stay at Encore. We stayed for three nights and our final opinion was that the Encore is the top Vegas property, but not for all of our trips. We will continue to stay at Wynn/Encore if our trip does NOT include roaming the strip or going with friends on their first Vegas trip ... we will opt for mid-strip Bellagio on those visits. We were slow to warm to Encore ... the service hiccups did not faze us because we did not expect perfect operations in the hotel's first month ... we eventually became accustomed to the RED throughout ... we learned to appreciate what Encore provided rather than focus on what it was missing. By the end of our stay we LOVED the chambered casino, finding it much less crowded, noisy, and smoky than any other casino. The walk to Wynn for the buffet and casual dining was effortless; that same walk at night was VERY entertaining with the crowd milling around Encore's club, "XS" "Sinatra" was our favorite restaurant - we will definitely return; superior food and service at a "reasonable" price. We enjoyed "Switch" and although the food was excellent, we have now seen the restaurant "transformation" and it's not really a draw for a repeat visit. The spa is over-the-top beautiful and we heard rave reviews of all treatments. The workout facilities looked great, but I'll spend that daily $40 in the casino. The pool areas are lovely but they look small. I will reserve judgment until we return when they are open. Bottom line -- first class property that fits a unique niche. We WILL return.

Reviews.Title: “Encore of my stay at Wynn”
Reviews.Author: Michelle2013
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about booking at Encore after reading the mixed reviews on this site. We booked anyway because we really enjoyed our stay last year at the Wynn. If you like the Wynn, you will like Encore. Yes, check-in is slow - but our check-in process was considerably faster than when we checked in at the Wynn (which has a truly awful front desk). We had no problems and were able to get our room right away. The room was very large, and clean. The bathroom was great. Everything is automated and very modern. The bed and sheets are extremely comfortable. We were on the 22nd floor and had no problems with noise. We had no problems with Encore service. We had problems with the safe in our room and within seconds of calling the front desk, we had security in our room who fixed it right away. The cleaning service was efficient and unobtrusive. And even the coffee bar in the lobby was efficient and we were able to get our morning coffee and croissant in the shortest amount of time. Yes, it is an extra 3-5minute walk anywhere. This was not a problem for my husband and I. We are both heathy enough to walk 5 minues. I dont know if I would stay here with an elderly parent, or young child. If we were going anywere, we found taxi service from the front of Encore to be quickly available - no lines, no wait. Location was not an issue for us. I certainly liked the proximity to the fashion mall! The drink service in the casino was excellent, as were the free drinks (I recommend the bloody marys). We are not big gamblers but managed to rack up enough points for 2 free buffet meals. We had those for sunday brunch at the wynn - EXCELLENT. Highly recommended. I cannot comment on the spa or fitness center, we actually chose to go to Qua at Ceasar's for our massages (also recommended). It was too cold for the pool, although the area is really pretty and will be great in the summer. As for our next visit, between Wynn and Encore - I may prefer Wynn, just because it is where most of the action is. But, the rooms at Encore help make up any difference. I think I would just stay where ever I had the better rate. It was overall a very similar experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Encore!”
Reviews.Author: heyshorty6
Reviews.Content: I received an Email from Encore for a complimentary stay and some gambling money, so decided to go back to Vegas. The Encore was beautiful! We asked for a high floor at the time of check in & got it. Our room was ready for us, a King nonsmoking. I did have to wait awhile in line at check-in, but no big deal. There were a lot of people to watch & talk to, and you could look around and check out the new hotel. Our room was ready at 1p.m. and we were able to check in watch the Charger game which was starting soon. We are from San Diego, and were really hoping the room was ready so we could relax and watch the game. The room was great with a beautiful view of Downtown Las Vegas. A huge window to look out of. The T.V. was the perfect size, and had beautiful high definition color. It swiveled around to the front sitting area, which had a nice couch & also an office desk with a fax machine and hookups for your laptop. The bathroom was beautiful with robes provided for your use while staying in the room, also slippers were provided. Bathroom amenities were really nice with shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, lotion, q-tips, cotton balls, etc. There is a night light you can turn on, which just provides soft lighting underneath the sinks. This was great for me to be able to see when I get up during the night to use the bathroom. While my husband watched the football game, I went downstairs to check out the casino & lounges. I found a nice bar-lounge that served some food. I got a great place to sit, right in front of the big-screen T.V. and ordered a small cheese sandwich & salad. I got excellent service and stayed there a long time, only drinking ice water (not Perrier). The waitresses were beautiful, as someone else mentioned on their review. The girls were young, and looked great in their short dresses...looking like models. So refreshing to see, compared to some other hotels who hire anyone. I remember going to the Hilton and seeing some really old women as cocktail waitresses (didn't look good at all). I had fun gambling in the casino too. I loved playing Steve Wynn's 1cent Megabucks game where you spin the wheel above. Also, I won three times on the Mr. Woo game which was nearby. I won the big top jackpot three times in the same night just by switching around to different machines. Also, the Wizard of Oz machine there is good, and is just 1cent. I got lots of good bonuses, and had fun talking to the lady next to me. Would love to receive another e-mail invite to return to Encore...I would definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “Bravo”
Reviews.Author: MsZie
Reviews.Content: Excellent. No complaints. New hotel of choice in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Will Never stray from Steve Wynn again!”
Reviews.Author: polobb
Reviews.Content: Steve Wynn's new Encore is the hands down the number 1 resort in Las Vegas. This fall I decided to go on a mother/daughter spa/shopping/show/casino trip and opted to try the Spa Palazzo as the Encore wasn't yet opened. Last year we had stayed at the Wynn, but wanted to give the new Palazzo and Canyon Ranch a try, so we booked reservations for January. It's true, I strayed from the excellence of Steve Wynn's resort expertise and I vow to NEVER STRAY AGAIN. We changed hotels after two nights. This man is a genious and the resort's service and well-trained staff are amazing. The Spa far supercedes all others. It is gorgeous. You are made to feel special everywhere in this large resort. I'll never leave Steve Wynn again!

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and plush, brilliantly designed”
Reviews.Author: Cooki
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Encore in early January, just a couple of weeks after it had opened. Although we had read some of the negative reviews that commented on poor service, we were curious to see whether the Encore would deliver and went ahead with our booking. I am glad that we did, as we not only did not experience any shortcomings in service, but were in fact consistently impressed by the efficiency and friendliness of all the staff. It is safe to say that if the Encore did have any teething troubles, these are well and truly left behind now. We booked a room a in the Tower Suites, and found the room to be gorgeous. As opposed to the smaller rooms in the Wynn, here all rooms are suites with a separate lounge area. As in the Wynn, one wall is glass from floor to ceiling, giving you brilliant views of the Strip at night. Additionally, one of the internal walls in both the lounge and bedroom areas is fully mirrored, increasing the feeling of light and space. The design is more grown-up than the Wynn, with more subtle muted colors. However, the feeling of luxury is absolute, and the finish everywhere is impeccable. The bathroom is spacious and has both a shower and tub. The room has a large lcd which cleverly swivels to face either the bedroom or lounge. The bed is supremely comfortable, and is a true bliss to sink into after a hard day of gambling or shopping. The in-room dining service is very efficient, and eating with a great view from your room is certainly a good option. However, we found the quality of the food to fall somewhat short of the brilliant dining options that Vegas now has to offer. Although certainly quite decent, the food was just ordinary (apart from the heavenly cheesecake!). In this respect, unless you are too tired to go to one of the restaurants downstairs, we wouldn't recommend ordering in. The Tower Suites have a separate check-in area, and we never had to wait (although the hotel was at full capacity when we were there). There is security at the entrance from the casino and I was always asked to show my room key before being allowed in. There is additional security in front of the lifts, which makes previous comments about stolen property from the room seem odd. Overall, the Encore is a fantastic epitome of the Vegas luxury. Although I still find the Wynn a supremely beautiful hotel, I prefer the Encore rooms as these are larger. Oh, and finally, to the remarks that this hotel is miles away from everything. Yes, it is at the end of the Strip, but it only really takes about 15 minutes to walk to Caesars palace (you can walk through the Wynn, and then the Palazzo and Venetian, so its quite a pleasant stroll). And finally, there is plenty happening at the Wynn and Encore, so I certainly never felt away from the Vegas vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Superlative Service at Encore Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: worldtrvlr1108
Reviews.Content: I live in Las Vegas and decided to check into Encore because of some really great room rates, and see if it lived up to the hype. Well, all I can say is YES! I used to think that Bellagio was still the best resort on the Las Vegas strip, well, Steve Wynn has really outdone himself this time. I booked a Panaramic view suite, the top ten floors of the tower, I forgot to ask for a strip view, but was impressed with the other side of the hotel. The building is curved so you have a great view wherever your room is. Every single employee I interacted with had a huge smile on their face, and were super energetic and helpful, from the greeter at the front door, to the Concierge, and even housekeepers. I spent three hours at the Spa and more money than my room, and loved every minute. My massage therapist 'Devon' was a very talented young man with a great spirit, I recommend him highly. The waterfall showers were a nice touch in the men's spa. My room was opulent, and the HD tv swivels so you can watch it from in bed or in the living area on the couch. I had dinner at 'Sinatra' and had the most succulent Maine lobster I've ever had. Try the 'Sinatra Smash' cocktail for a refreshing berry drink. Room service the next morning was perfect, the eggs over easy exact, the toast still hot when it arrived. I had the 'Earl Grey Mar tea ni' at the lobby bar and loved it. This hotel is full of the most attractive cocktail servers I've ever seen. Each one of them could be fashion models or soap stars. The glamourous days of Las Vegas are still alive at alive at Encore. Steve and Elaine Wynn have been able to recapture the elegance of Las Vegas, in the way that only they seem to know how to do. In 1998 when Bellagio opened it was the place to see and be seen. Bellagio, though still a great hotel, seems old and tired. If you want to feel good about yourself you need to book Encore. The elegance, the glamour, the opulence of Las Vegas is still alive at Encore! ps We went to XS and had 'bottle service'. XS is like Tryst but bigger, and sexier with a huge pool area that's lovely at night.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE Check-In Service!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AzNglrL182
Reviews.Content: Just spend the weekend at Encore and within 2 mins of arrival, the HORRIBLE service started. I got an email invite with a special rate directly from them as a Red Card Member. My reservation was booked at least 3 weeks in advance over their reservation line since that was the only way I can get the deal. The agent on the line asked me if I wanted 2 Queens and I replied with a "Yes." Problem 1: Check in time, reservations they have in system is for 1 King bed and for 1 person. Problem 2: they DID NOT have ANY rooms available. How is that possible when I made a reservation 3 weeks prior?!?! Problem 3: they were going to send me to Wynn for a King bed room Problem 4: I will be paying the SAME rate as for Encore. (Deal was Encore $159/night & Wynn $139/night) My bro refused to be sent to Wynn and asked to speak with the manager. Manager replied "we can have house keeping to check if there are any free rooms." The first guy guys just told me they DID NOT have any rooms based on their system. 3 mins later manager said "Ok, we found a room with a King bed that we can put you in IMMEDIATELY." How did they suddenly "found" a free room when their system said they were completely booked?!?! Problem 5: Check out. System check out on the TV does not work. Problem 6: Called front desk to check out. They were going to charge me close to $1,000 for 2 night stay? Ok turns out girl was reading the wrong room which happens to have the same last name. And she sounded extremely confuse with what she was doing. I'm will stay away from Encore until they clean up their act. Their rooms however are very nice and comfortable. With the exception of their customer service, I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Encore is refreshingly different”
Reviews.Author: mommaneedsatrip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Encore for one evening, the first week of January 2009. Right after Wynn opened a few years ago, I played for a while on their players card. I earned a few points, got on their mailing list but haven't received any deals worthwhile since then. In December Encore (Wynn's other hotel/casino) sent a deal with complimentary nights and free play so we decided to give it a try for a night. After parking, we went to check in (around 3 or 4 pm). Lines were long, and quite literally Not moving...at all. We stood in line, in the same exact spot, without moving for around 30 minutes. It was really unacceptable. After that amount of time one of the workers assisting the lines grabbed two or three of us in line and brought us to concierge for a MUCH quicker check in. The concierge escorted us to our elevators (nice touch). Every employee that we encountered was very helpful, just check in lines were S-L-O-W. We stayed on the 14th floor. The hotel had just opened a week or so before that, and the room still had the 'new room' smell. The room was clean and fairly spacious. It has a similar feel to the Venetian hotel, with the 'suite' being a bedroom with partition (no door) between bedroom and living room area. The bathroom was spacious, and the room had a very modern feel to it (with electronic drapery, light switches for the lights to all the room at the bedside). The bed was by far the most comfortable bed I've ever had in my 10 trips (and 9 different hotel rooms) in Las Vegas. It was a very soft pillow top bed, with wonderful linens. Overall, I would most definately stay here again...I just wouldn't try to check in at 'check in time'.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brianf06
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Encore from January 6-11 I was a bit nervous heading to the Encore on January 6th after reading a few negative reviews. However, my fears went away once I arrived and checked into the hotel. I had requested a non-smoking room, and upon checking in, the front desk specialist noticed that I had accidentally been put in a smoking room. She immediately corrected the problem and gave me a room on the 61st floor with the South ship view. This small gesture went along way. The rooms were simply fantastic. The only complaint was the fact that you could hear conversations in other rooms. I'd like to see them address this problem. I loved the fact that the casino and main floor floor was SO SMALL and manageable. This is hands down the best feature of the Encore. The casino's in virtually ever other hotel are just massive and way too big. and you're constantly getting lost. The Encore allows you to pass through the casino the restaurants or Esplanade in under 2 minutes time. It was great! I had rented a car too and parking was awesome. It was always easy to find parking spots right near the elevators. The walk was again 2 minutes from parking garage to elevators. Very convenient. Most importantly, it never felt overly crowded in the Encore. I don't know how anyone can like staying in the Bellagio, Venetian or Palazzo. These placed were mobbed on Wednesday and Thursday nights with wall to wall people bumping into each other!! Also, the fact the Encore attempts to have smoking ONLY in the casino area (or in your room) is a good idea. This limited the brutal smoke smell in other areas of the hotel. My wife loved the Spa, as well. I know a lot of people don;t like the fact that the Encore is towards the end of the strip, but I loved that fact. It keeps the walk through crowds to a minimum. You could still be at the Palazzo or across the street at the Fashion Show mall within 10 minutes. All in all, it was a great stay. I have stayed in many places in Vegas, and the Signature at MGM is the only other hotel that can compare. Good job Steve Wynn!

Reviews.Title: “Encore at Wynn: A New Hotel needing a few adjustments”
Reviews.Author: NavyDawg
Reviews.Content: Steve Wynn's newest property - Encore - is located adjacent to his existing property - Wynn - on the Strip, connected by a winding esplanade of high end shopping, dining and theatres. The hotel officially opened on December 22, 2008, and we checked in on Sunday, January 4, 2009, staying three days. Encore has its own entrance and street just past the Wynn with yet another separate entrance for Tower Suites. We booked two adjoining Resort rooms (one king, one queen double) at what can only be considered an astronomically fantastic opening rate of $179 per night per room, with a $50 dining credit per room. I seriously doubt that anyone will ever see rates like that at Encore again. Without going on and on and on about the decor, I can only say that if you ever get to stay in brand new hotel, definately do it. Everything is so...new! I mean, it is really beautiful in that Las Vegas over-the-top way. The theme is red, with butterflies adorning almost every surface you can imagine. The rooms are huge, and quiet: ours had views of the Wynn, and and the Wynn golf course. There is absolutely nothing "gimmicky" about this property. It is simply a beautiful, luxururious hotel intent on - of course - keeping you at the property to spend your money on gaming, shopping and dining. And considering the fact that it is connected to the original Wynn, and connected by bridge to the Las Vegas Fashion Show, it's hard - almost difficult - to find a reason to leave. As a matter of fact, the only reasons we ever left was to see a couple of shows, and a tour Hoover Dam. As with any new hotel, though, it had its share of problems, but surprisingly, it was all with the staff - not the facility. Check-in and check-out is a nightmare. There is a single desk with maybe 8 to 10 clerks working it, but no perceivable line. You are supposed to know -somehow- automatically, that there is an employee floating around the check-in, taking down your name, and assigning you to a clerk. Woe be unto you if you don't realize this, and simply step into an existing line. Because you will be summarily and peremptorily removed and told to wait at the rear of the check-in area until this mysterious employee decides you can move forward. Housekeeping was called an inumerable number of times for many things: lack of the room being cleaned, lack of turn down service (after being repeatedly requested) lack of amenities, towels, etc. Typical housekeeping problems, but, on the bright side, the housekeeping staffers themselves were absolute gems and always had a smile and a great attitude. We had in-room dining three mornings in a row and it was great. On time, hot, and not one single problem with the order. In general, the staff issue can be summed up this way: we never, ever had a problem with the gaming staff, dining staff, housekeeping staff, shops staff, etc. The problem seems to be with the front of house staff: the front desk, and the "concierge" desk. Perhaps they were just overwhelmed. I don't know but, Encore really needs to "fix" the check-in/check-out process. I went down to the front desk at 830am on our check-out day to get our bills printed out, and then proceeded to spend approximately 30 minutes at the desk, then another hour on my own trying to figure out who owed what, what belonged on what bill/folio, and then attempting to get the charges moved, or in a couple of cases, removed. Another issue seems to be that if you don't know exactly who to ask a certain question, you get a complete and utter blank stare, or foisted off on another department, or even worse - they say they will take care of it, then they never do. In summary: Las Vegas is not my cup of tea, but luxury hotels are. Steve Wynn has set a new standard, and time will tell what the room rates will settle out to be. It's another case of "is this the right hotel for me?"
