With so many options in Las Vegas - including a Four Seasons - it makes Las Vegas one of the few cities where your choice of lodging can really make or break your stay. We had a great time, but some of staff really made some negative impressions on us.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, even better than the Wynn”
Reviews.Author: GXS
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Encore December 28 for 5 nights and let me tell you Steve Wynn is a genius. Encore is revolutionary in many ways and is a winner. This is the place to stay at if you're going to Vegas. I've included some pictures so check them out as well. We arrived at Encore through the self park garage and went straight to the front desk which was only a very short walk. Upon entering Encore I immediately noticed that there was a lot of natural light inside because of the use of glass walls and ceilings throughout the hotel. Also the prominent colors used throughout the hotel seemed to be red and black, very chic. Also a lot of detail was spent on everything, nothing was spared. Once at the front desk I was immediately checked in by a very friendly and enthusiastic girl. I asked her if we could get a room with a nice view of the strip and she said she'd look into it. After all the formalities (which only took a couple of minutes) she gave me our room keys and promised us we would love the view from our room (more on this later) and if I didn't I could come back to her and ask for another room. Anyway, off we went to the room elevators, which was an even shorter walk than from the parking garage to the front desk (this is the first hotel in Vegas that doesn't have a long walk from the parking garage to the front desk or from the front desk to the room elevators). Our room on the 53rd floor had an amazing view indeed just as the girl from the front desk promised. We faced the south strip and had a nice view of the Wynn to our left, the mall to our right, and the Palazzo, Treasure Island, Mirage, Caesars Palace, and Bellagio in the center. Our room with 2 queen beds had the same layout as the 2 double bedrooms at the Wynn, with the exception of it being bigger because of the L-shaped couch. The decor inside however is more modern, the colors very chic, and overall more detailed (and luxurious). Lights can be controlled from a panel beside the entry door or the bed. The room also has a doorbell as well as an electronic privacy button. The drapes/sheer are also electronically controlled by the panel beside the bed. The 46" Sharp LCD in the room is also bigger than the one used in the Wynn and has actual HD channels. The bathroom has the same layout as the Wynn as well and is more modern and uses more expensive materials. The staff throughout the hotel seemed very nice, even the maids I encountered. They always said hi or asked me how everything was. Now onto the casino... The casino is smaller than the Wynn and as a result we were mostly playing in the Wynn since most of the machines were occupied in Encore. What I did notice was that the casino in Encore was a lot brighter in comparison with the casino at Wynn (which is already brighter than usual i.e. Bellagio) because of natural light and light from the ceiling. Most casinos have low lighting which makes the casinos feel old and tired even if the casino is new. I also took a peek at the Spa and let me tell you it was like I was in the lobby of heaven (not that I've ever been to heaven). Very nice, relaxing, and very detailed. We dined at Society Cafe Encore four times for breakfast and dinner and the food was excellent. Not only that, the food came out pretty quick (they strive to bring your food out in less than 20 minutes). We also had dinner at Botero, however our dinner didn't go as smooth as we had wanted. First we were seated at a table that was sandwiched between the kitchen entrance and the dining room entrance so we had a lot of traffic around us. We asked to be moved and were seated in the center of the restaurant. As a result of our move our appetizers came out after 40 minutes. This incident was blamed on our move which is what we were told at least. This was not acceptable. We didn't move to a new restaurant, we just moved a couple of tables from our original table. The rest of our dinner was flawless however and we had a great time. The food of course was excellent as well (the Chimichurri Filet was amazing). I would say that the food at Botero is better than at SW (which I think is overrated). We had dinner at Switch as well and our dinner was perfect. The lobster bisque I had as an appetizer however didn't taste any better than something from the supermarket. Our steaks however were pretty good (the Chimichurri Filet at Switch was also excellent). The attraction of Switch of course is that the "inside" of the restaurant changes every 20 minutes, the walls and ceiling figuratively change every 20 minutes, a pretty cool sight. I don't understand why people complain that everything in the hotel is expensive. HELLO!!! You're in a 5 star hotel... However, we did have the following problems during our stay: - Our room didn't come with any slippers so we had to call housekeeping for them (minor issue). - Our room safe was locked and we called to have it opened but no one ever came (minor issue). - Our room didn't have an iron and when we called housekeeping for an iron it took over 45 minutes before they brought the iron over (a major issue). - The ventilation in the casino isn't as good as in the Wynn. The casino had a strong smell of cigarettes/cigars unlike the Wynn. I would have thought that the ventilation would be as good as in the Wynn (a major issue). All in all I had an excellent stay at Encore and is now my choice of hotel in Vegas (before Encore it was the Wynn). I highly recommend you try out Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Wynn Encore Takes a Bow”
Reviews.Author: GrandOhioTraveler
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Wynn Las Vegas, although a splendid-looking place, I can honestly say that Steve Wynn's first hotel-casino offering after his famed Bellagio was somewhat of a disappointment. My initial reaction was, "Is that all there is?" But with Wynn Encore, Steve Wynn gets it right this time around. Wynn Encore is by far the most well-lighted hotel-casino on the Strip. Lucky ruby red colors abound everywhere from the carpet, to the walls, to those Willy-Wonka licorice chandeliers. The table game areas feel like private gaming salons, cornered by lavish drapes and ivory white columns. There's a gorgeous, picturesque-looking pool that surprisingly looks to be the center of the hotel's attention. (Steve Wynn might want to consider keeping it open to only male and female models--no kids and over-weight people allowed.) The hotel-casino, overall, is more South Beach with Asian flair than your traditional, themed Las Vegas hotel-casinos. The restaurants are open just enough such that people have a sneak peek at what they look like inside. We tried Wazuzu, Wynn Encore's Chinese-Japanese fusion restaurant. Try the chicken curry-- it has a nice balance of hot and sweet between the curry and coconut, or the caterpillar eel-avocado roll-- it does not disappoint. We topped off the dinner by sampling the mango-rich ice cream, which tasted like it was just made from fresh, ripe-very ripe, mango. The resort suite is a good size, maybe 700 square feet with floor to ceiling windows, a 42" flat-panel TV on top of a swivel so that it can be viewed from either the bed or the living area. The furniture is mostly white but there is a black L-shaped sofa. (I'd still probably recommend the much larger Palazzo suites for families with children, though.) The bed linens must be Egyptian cotton with a very high thread count--VERY comfortable. The bathroom has two duel sinks, a shower, and separate soaking bathtub. We ordered breakfast once; the service was prompt (only 30 minute wait) but the waffles, poached egg, and corned beef hash were nothing spectacular (18% gratuity and $5 dinner charge already included, so no extra tip warranted). In short, Wynn Encore offers intimacy and elegance. While admittedly, it doesn't have the "wow" factor, Wynn Encore, without a doubt, has the "cool" factor. Frank Sinatra, which one of the restaurants is proudly named after, would probably agree.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tcmorse6570
Reviews.Content: Had a room on the 60th floor (found out later it was really the 49th, no 13th and no rooms starting with 4, something about people being superstitious) and wow, what a view. Checked in at 1pm Jan 4th for two nights with hardly any wait even though there were three couples ahead in our line. Everyone was extremely pleasant. Room was very large. Mini bar, remote control drapes and lights, a safe. We liked the bright colors and floor to ceiling windows. Very high ceilings. Were offered and received our choice of two newspapers daily. Self parking is relatively close to room elevators, which I like. We called for an early room make-up both days and everything was perfect by noon. We like to nap in the afternoon. By the way, the bed was heaven. The only problems we had were the room was missing the remote for the television, which they brought up after the second request and at check-out, they had a difficult time finding where my reservation was supposed to include a $50 dining credit. He finally subtracted the amount after searching for a while. I'd stay there again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Encore has glitches!!!”
Reviews.Author: hailscott
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three nights in room 2014 at the new Encore Hotel. There are some very nice things we experienced. The spa was great, we enjoyed it very much, but unfortunately the steam room was not working, hopefully this will be fixed soon. The rooms are beautiful and I think the bathroom floors were heated, but this lead to the bathroom being too warm and with no vent and no ability to control the bathroom temp it became uncomfortable. Our biggest problem was the fact that the hotel had absolutely no sound insulation. You can hear every conversation from the rooms next to you, above you and below you, heaven forbid your neighbors are having a party. You might as well join them because you will not get any sleep. The staff is nice enough but we were not offered any apology or anything for our inconvenience of hearing these unwanted conversations. I think the sound travels through the vents and walls. At the price being charged at the Encore, I think I can do better elsewhere. Also if you are planning a stay at the encore, and love a morning coffee, good luck! There is no in room coffee and ordering room service is outrageously expensive. Be prepared to spend almost $30.00 for 2 cups of coffee...not including tip. Steve Wynn has some work to do to get this hotel up to a 5star, definitely not there yet.

Reviews.Title: “Average - by Las Vegas Standards”
Reviews.Author: OCarr
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 2 night stay at the Encore. The suites are spacious and beautiful. The bed was quite comfortable and the bathroom was large and well equipped. They added some very nice touches such as the remote near the bed where you can open and close the drapes and turn the lights on/off. There is a nice desk with a great phone and fax machine in every room ($8 per page to send a fax). I did not have any of the noise problems that I've read about however a couple in the elevator asked me if I heard any noises at night, so it must be evident in other rooms. I don't think it is from the nightclub because it is not located in that block of the hotel - I think these noises are from adjacent rooms. I say this because I did hear my neighbors phone ringing quite clearly one evening. The low room rates and "hip, contemporary" feel of this hotel also attracts the younger crowd who like to party into the night in their spacious suites. I'm in my early 40's and found this hotel to be too hip for me. I like classy and elegant. The Encore is more "in your face" than elegant. The Wynn is much more to my liking. I have to say that the uniforms chosen for the staff at Encore (and Wynn) have to be the ugliest I've ever seen. Tacky, tacky polyester in the weirdest colors. The male security staff wore purple jackets. Not the dark, elegant purple but Willy Wonka purple. The staff at the Wynn Buffet had thick pink polyester suits. The staff at any Denny's restaurant looks better. If I wasn't told this was a four star, Michelin rated hotel I wouldn't look so closely at such things, but OMG. The cocktail servers' outfits were no better. The prices for food and drinks is way up there too. I paid $4.50 for a small cup of regular coffee. It had obviously been sitting on the burner for quite a while too. When I mentioned it the server actually agreed that it had been sitting for a while. OKAAAY. So much for that five star service. I don't think this hotel will be winning many awards. By Vegas standards, its OK but the service and public rooms can be improved. I would stick with the Wynn, Bellagio or Palazzo when in town again.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, very luxurious but just hear me out first”
Reviews.Author: joeyismydog
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Encore from Dec 24 thru 26 and we booked a panorama suite that had wall-to-wall windows facing the Strip. Looking out the windows at night, we felt like high rollers like in the movie 21. The suite was really amazing. Steve Wynn did not skim on any materials. Everything was plush plush plush. The bathrobes, slippers, toiletries, iPod docking station, all very fancy. Even the closet doors were heavy and solid. And of course you can’t beat the discounts that they have been putting out. We also stayed at the Venetian (also an all-suite hotel) for two nights but the suite at Encore was way more plush. But just know one thing. Even if you can afford the room rates at Encore, you may not be able to afford anything else. Everything is super expensive. The room service menu prices are sky high. The gym is $40/day. The mini bar has pressure sensors so if you lift up anything for over 60 seconds, you will be charged. After seeing the prices, we were almost scared to go anywhere near the mini bar. All the restaurants are very expensive. We dined at Bartolotta and my small and not-so-good fish entrée was $55. Know that I live in New York City and my wife and I are used to New York prices and we eat out all the time. Still, the Encore prices are bother line ridiculous. If you just want to experience a brand new Wynn hotel and don’t mind going some place else for most of your activities, or you are simply loaded, then go for it. Otherwise, you are better off staying some place else.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.”
Reviews.Author: D&BCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Encore is first class even if the resort has a few bugs to be worked out. I say that, as it was more than a tad inconvenient to be locked out of our room at midnight when our electronic rooms keys suddenly stopped working. Twenty-five minutes after we were told that the security person was on the elevator to our room, a staff member arrived to let us in. At the time we hadn’t realized that The Encore had only been open for two weeks. Though there were definitely bugs to be worked out, all things consider, the property was functioning surprisingly well. If the service at the Wynn is relevant, the bugs will be worked out quickly. The Encore certainly is a spectacular property. We feel like we are pretty jaded about the interior design in modern buildings. In general, we find the glitz and shine of the Las Vegas mega hotels to be off putting. The Wynn and to an even greater extent the Encore manage to be visually appealing even reaching the point that the interior design reaches a level that we would call art. Particularly notable at the Encore was the massage room area in the spa. It truly feels as if you are entering another world when you step into the room to see a central path lined with beds of smooth and flat-whitewashed stones with large lanterns placed periodically. Off the path on both sides are the black drape clocked treatment rooms. At the end of the path is a massive Golden Buddha glowing in the spotlights. The area is breathtaking and worth the visit on its own. YMMV, but for us, this is the most striking hotel in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Met the hype.”
Reviews.Author: BobakLives
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Encore for an evening on December 27th, less than a week after it opened. A close family friend had arranged for my father and I to have a room through the more exclusive Encore Tower Suites (which feature a separate entrance and a much higher employee/guest ratio, similar to the Tower Suites at Wynn). Due to the buzz for the hotel, they actually ran out of Tower Suites and placed guests, including us, in adjacent rooms in the "Resort Tower". First, lets be clear: The Resort Tower and Tower Suites are in the same building, and actually connect to each other on ever floor but the lobby. These rooms are simply the closest six or seven rooms on each floor to the Las Vegas Strip. Guests of either side can freely access the other on each floor. The Tower Suites side has a few much, much larger rooms, but I had an opportunity to compare the "standard" suite on both sides and they are virtually identical, however the Tower Suites side uses a different color palette that favors golden hues. The carpet, artwork, and wallpaper of the Tower Suites side is slightly nicer, and the section features its own driveway as well as a guest lounge with complimentary food on the lobby-level. We were able to have access to all of the Tower Suites amenities despite the push to the Resort Side. I do not feel that anyone will feel a difference from the pure aspect of simply the rooms themselves. Now onto the room: I stayed in one of the standard guest suites, which come in at a minimum of 745 sq ft (69.2 sq. meters). The contemporary design was loaded with superlatives: the layout was very spacious (not difficult, considering the size), the amenities were all of high caliber (including a large LCD TV, an iHome bedside music player/alarm), and excellent views of The Strip, mountains and general area. The bathroom was equally spacious and featured a nice shower as well as quality toiletries. The general casino areas are attractive, with bold designs and even more natural light than the Wynn. There are influences from the Wynn Macau (designed between the original Wynn and Encore), and the Wazuzu features a large crystal dragon like the one found at the Macau location. Between my father and me, we've sampled some of the world's finest hotels in the US, Europe and Asia. We agreed that this hotel stands among them, specifically for the high level of service by all levels of staff --not merely those in the Tower Suites section. Las Vegas is a lot like an adult Disneyland in that the staff and atmosphere are aimed to be so pleasing that you don't really pay much mind to exactly how much you're spending (and it can certainly be spendy). This was the first time on roughly 20+ trips to Las Vegas that I actually spent all my time at one resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the look Hated the Casino”
Reviews.Author: KannTexas
Reviews.Content: Very Excited about Encore we love Vegas and travel there about every 3 months. I love to gamble but the casino area of Encore was such a dissapointment I won't be back. Very, Very small slot area, people were having to wait to play the machines. Not many varieties. Needless to say we played elsewear and won't be back. Very pretty, lots of people to help you but the casino was a HUGH disappointment

Reviews.Title: “Opening night jitters”
Reviews.Author: kliz15
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the encore the first night it was open to the public. We had booked a suite but we were contacted by the hotel front desk manager telling us we could not have that room because of a computer glitch that they were over booked. We were offered a regular resort room for a discounted price. Not really a great consolation considering thats not where i wanted to stay. The truth was they had vips staying in the suites and didnt care about the little people. Not a good way to start. Overall hotel is average for vegas standards. Small gaming and lobby. A few upscale restaurants, switch being the coolest. The Encore did nothing to set itself apart. Rooms were beautiful but not functional. Sofa faced away from a swivel tv that you can watch only in the bedroom or the sitting area. My suggestion stay at the palazzo where there standard rooms are much more functional. With vegas always raising the bar this hotel just may be right on par. Not what i was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities/Rooms Great, Service Huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: dbsjoe
Reviews.Content: Encore is a spectacular hotel in terms of the amenities, the rooms and the casino floor. My girlfriend and I stayed there for a night to kick off the New Year and we both thought the suites were impeccable. Most of the employees at Encore were genuinely excited about working for a Wynn casino and that showed. We ended up dining at Daniel Boulud's restaurant at the Wynn which we both really liked. We also went to XS afterwards and had a blast. There were, however, a number of negatives in the service department. We booked through American Express travel and were promised a $100 dining credit at "any of the hotel's fine dining options." I called to confirm that the offer was good at any restaurant in the Wynn/Encore and a person in the marketing department confirmed this was the case. The front desk person at check-in also confirmed this. However, at check-out, we did not receive the $100 credit and were told it was ONLY GOOD at the casino's CASUAL restaurants. Eventually, after some arguing, we got the credit applied; still, it was disappointing that the hotel did not have a streamlined process for applying the promotions they ran. Moreover, at check-out, we were billed $30 for a drink we never consumed at the mini bar. I told the front desk agent we did not consume the drink, and they did not believe us. They instead sent a person up to check this out, after which fifteen minutes later, they verified we did not in fact consume the beverage. (We had a ride waiting for us which made the situation worse) In my opinion, this was of pretty poor taste and coupled with the deceiving marketing ploy left my girlfriend and I a little unhappy. Overall, we had a fantastic time at the Encore. However, the check-out process and deceptive advertising left a bad taste in our mouth.
